Found Brother

by FakeAlice

Summary

For some inexplicable reason, Shen Qingqiu's body separates into Shen Yuan and Shen Jiu. Neither of them is happy with their new relationship.

Or sometimes fate is inscrutable and brings together two people who have lost their family.

Notes

Hi!!

Welcome to my new 100% self-indulgent fic. I LOVE found families and the concept of Shen brothers, so I came up with this story with a slow burn enemies to brothers (and enemies to lovers with a confused Liu Qingge). Luo Binghe is a kid at the beginning of the fic, so when he grows up maybe the tags of the ships will be updated or maybe not >:3

This will be a story with a slow evolution of the characters' relationship and themselves. I warn you that Shen Yuan at first is blinded by his opinions of the book and Shen Jiu is a lonely creature who absolutely mistrusts everyone.

 

English it's not my first language. Sorry for the possibles mistakes >_____<

Shen Yuan can’t trust the scum villain

Shen Yuan didn’t want to die or reincarnate in Shen Qingqiu. Of course, he also doesn’t want to be dismembered by the protagonist of the absurd novel in which he is trapped.

His situation is frustrating and if it weren't for the system, he would have already tried to run away. But he is stuck and it doesn’t matter if he is afraid or tired of parasitizing one life that doesn’t belong to him or wants to cry for the family and friends that he has lost forever. Shen Yuan has no choice but to move on and fight to survive.

And he is exhausted. In a very short time, he has had to confront the skinner, then rescued Liu Qingge from a qi deviation, and now, when he finally believes that he can rest, Xiu Ya points at his neck.

For an incomprehensible reason, the real Shen Qingqiu stands before him. Although now both share the same body, the gaze of the original is icier and threatening. He has cruel eyes and his pulse doesn’t waver at attacking someone identical to him.

“Who are you?” He demands. His voice, posture, and movements are arrogant. Shen Yuan discovers that the scum villain is obviously just as dangerous as the protagonist. Maybe worse. The person who threatens him is unjustly cruel, has abused children, and would have let Liu Qingge die.

Shen Yuan is paralyzed with terror.

“Who are you?” He insists. “How dare you appropriate my body, demon?”

Shen Yuan doesn’t understand what happened, why before they were one and now two, but he knows that he is still as human as Shen Qingqiu himself.

The sword grazes his neck, scratching him, and Shen Yuan finally reacts.

“I’m not a demon!” He yells, almost crying. “We are in the Lingxi Caves, demons cannot hide their presence here.”

There are many things in the world of PIDW that don't make any sense and perhaps their unfolding is one of those inexplicable plots, but Shen Yuan knows the rest of logical worldbuilding. Trembling, he raises his hands in peace and tries to look into Shen Qingqiu's cold eyes.

“I don't know what happened either...”

“I felt your soul,” he cuts him off with an angry hiss. “You tried to steal my body. Kill me. Take away everything that belongs to me.”

The scum villain hates him with an intensity worse than Luo Binghe's and Shen Yuan understands that he will probably die again. And this time, no one will miss him. Because he is a thief, a usurper, he shouldn't have been there or interfered in Shen Qingqiu's life.

Yet his will clings to life. He has already died once and it is painful and pitiful and frustrating. The system has granted him a second chance which has been a farce. It is unfair.

He wants to live. He desperately wants to live.

“I didn’t want to! They gave me no choice!”

The system beeps in his head, warning him of the consequences of revealing the truth. Shen Yuan grimaces. He wishes the system had disappeared when their bodies doubled and Shen Qingqiu snatched Xiu Ya from him to corner him against a wall. Or that the system had stayed in Shen Qingqiu's head.

Shen Qingqiu narrows his eyes.

“What do you mean?”

“I will die if I tell you.”

His answer makes Shen Qingqiu's expression darkened even more.

“Then there is no point in letting you live.”

“Wait!” He screams before the sword cuts his throat. Shen Yuan's heart beats so fast that his chest aches. He takes a deep breath as he carefully chooses his words. “Right now I can't tell you the truth. Something prevents me from doing that.”  He speaks slowly, watching the scum villain's reaction and the system's warnings. “But I can find other ways to explain myself.”

“Try,” he demands. “Give me a reason why I should let you live.” 

“I know the future.”

The system beeps again and Shen Yuan raises a hand to his head. Wait! He demands before the system begins to deduct points. I have a plan.

It seems that he has finally caught Shen Qingqiu's attention, as there is a gleam of curiosity in his eyes. Xiu Ya, however, continues to rub his neck.

“Probe that.”

“When you leave Lingxi Caves, you will discover that Cang Qiong Sect is undergoing a demonic invasion. It is led by Sha Hualing, a demonic saintess. She will challenge you to three duels. You will win the first, she will win the second, and Luo Binghe the third.”

“Luo Binghe?” He repeats with surprise. “My useless disciple?”

His words make Shen Yuan angry, but he hides his emotions. He needs to convince the scum villain to follow the plot.

“Yes. It could be said that it is his destiny.”

For some incomprehensible reason, Shen Qingqiu purses his lips in a wry smile.

“Of course, that stupid child has a glorious destiny.”

Shen Yuan doesn't care what Shen Qingqiu is thinking or why he hates Luo Binghe so much. He only has one chance to survive and he clings to it desperately.

“Let's make a deal,” he proposes to him. “Come out and stop the demonic invasion just like I told you. And you will see that I am telling the truth.” He inhales before making a crucial decision. “If Luo Binghe doesn't fight, I will die.”

“Why are you telling me such an obvious weakness?”

“Because if I said the truth and the three fights happen as I have told you, you will save the sect. And it also means that I know the future. And honestly, your future sucks and you need me to survive.”

Shen Qingqiu huffs.

“You lie. Do you think I'm stupid? You have said that you will die if Luo Binghe doesn’t fulfill his fate and now you are trying to convince me that you can change mine. It is contradictory.”

“It’s not! Some events have to happen or I will die. And others that I can change. For example, I have prevented Liu Qingge from dying in a qi deviation. You can ask him.”

Shen Yuan waits, terrified and trembling, for Shen Qingqiu's verdict. The villain watches over him with slightly higher interest than an insect. His decision lingers for minutes until he finally pulls the sword away and Shen Yuan breathes in relief. He is no longer so terrified when Shen Qingqiu grabs his arm and drags him through the caverns.

Outside, a chaos of screams, the smell of blood, and the clash of swords await them. Shen Qingqiu nods indifferently and a gleam of interest in his ruthless eyes.

“At least this part of what you said is true,” he comments before dragging him along.

Instead of joining the battle and helping his disciples, Shen Qingqiu chooses a secondary path to Qing Jing Peak. Shen Yuan doesn’t dare to reproach him about anything. He is terrified of the calm and impudence with which he ignores that threat. In silence, Shen Qingqiu leads him to his bamboo house. Once inside, he ties his wrists with immortal cables and pushes him into a secondary room.

“If you tried to deceive me, I will kill you,” he promises before locking him up.

Shen Jiu doesn’t trust anybody

Chapter Notes

The narration will call them Shen Yuan and Shen Jiu (since they are both Shen Qingqiu). In Shen Yuan's chapters he will still refer to the other as Shen Qingqiu, but later he will learn his name.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It seems that the usurper hasn’t lied to him, but Shen Jiu distrusts his words and prophecies.

At least the beginning turns out to be true. There is a demonic invasion and a demoness that presents herself as Sha Hualing challenges him to three duels. Not very surprising, the usurper might know if he is allied with demons. It is also no surprise that he wins the first duel (Shen Jiu is, after all, the legendary sword Xiu Ya and an immortal master), nor that the cowardly Sha Hualing defeats a disciple.

Of course, Shen Jiu finds some pleasure in seeing the unbearable Liu Qingge's sister defeated, who arrives just in time to see her beloved sister fall.

Shen Jiu brushes his lips with his fan. The third duel is the most difficult of the three. His enemy is the most dangerous demon, though Liu Qingge offers without hesitation. Shen Jiu frowns as he considers whether to follow the usurper's directions. He may be lying. He likely lied. Luo Binghe will lose and with him, the sect will also lose. But if Luo Binghe wins, that is a surreal event and completely impossible to predict. It will mean that the usurper was telling the truth and knows the future.

And manipulating the future is very tempting.

“Wait,” he hits Liu Qingge’s chest with his fan, stopping him. “Luo Binghe will fight.”

Everyone screams in amazement and surprise, his disciple opens his eyes in ridiculous joy, and Liu Qingge frowns.

“Who?” He turns around to discover Luo Binghe. “HIM? Are you crazy, Shen Qingqiu? You are going to kill that child.”

The boy in question steps forward despite Ning Yingying’s efforts to stop him with a tearful hug.

“I can do it! Shizun, I will show you what I am capable of!”

His confidence is so ridiculous that Shen Jiu rolls his eyes and Liu Qingge shakes his head.

“No. I’ll do it. As the lord of Bai Zhan Peak, I must defeat these demons.”

“You are late, shidi.” Shen Jiu approaches his martial brother and touches him twice with his fan. And then he leans in to whisper into his ear. “Don’t be stupid. You just survived a qi deviation. It would be very embarrassing if our War God lost miserably to these demons.”

When he pulls away, Shen Jiu discovers that Liu Qingge is blushing. Probably out of embarrassment.

“And you disciple can?” He growls, stubborn and proud.

No, he thinks while looking at that annoying kid with such talent.

“I trust him,” he lies, hiding his face behind his fan.

Liu Qingge crosses his arms but doesn't insist. That unexpected show of confidence makes him suspect that his martial brother still hasn't recovered from the qi deviation. Perhaps the usurper is not an enemy if he has truly saved one of our strongest warriors , he values. But Shen Jiu needs more evidence to understand the intentions of someone who has tried to impersonate him. And he had almost succeeded.

Luo Binghe runs like a happy puppy to a duel that is surely deadly, confirming that he is as talented as an idiot. Shen Jiu watches him curiously, not moving his fan away so that his expression doesn’t betray him. The entire sect holds its breath as an eager teenager faces off a gigantic demon, covered in poisonous spikes.

He would be amused by Liu Qingge's tension and seeing Luo Binghe be miserably defeated if it weren’t that Shen Jiu may lose because of that decision.

Shen Jiu hates the usurper even more because now he is encouraging the child he envies.

He is relieved when the miracle happens: Luo Binghe wins. The child succeeds when all seems lost. And despite the threat, he does it without a scratch. The other disciples break into applause and Shen Jiu closes his fan so tightly that the wood almost breaks. He should feel relieved and satisfied, Luo Binghe's fame belongs to him, but then he remembers the usurper's words. And he notices a bitter taste in his throat.

The child who had a mother who adored him, who has the talent to cultivate a shining path to immortality, also has an almost divine destiny. And he is left with a destroyed childhood, corrupted cultivation, and a screwed-up future according to the usurper.

It's frustrating.

Luo Binghe approaches him with bright eyes, eager for an acknowledgment that Shen Jiu refuses to give him. He turns his back and orders the other disciples to take the injured to Qian Cao Peak and fix the damage. In that instant of confusion, the defeated demon tries to attack Luo Binghe, but Liu Qingge kills him with a swift slash.

“Not bad. Your kid did well,” he acknowledges while sheaths Cheng Luan. 

He is a good target to take his anger out on.

“Surprised? You should trust me more.” Shen Qingqiu plays with his fan while giving him an arrogant look, accompanied by a smirk. “But you've always had to doubt me, even when I'm right. Like today. I hope you learn your lesson dear shidi.”

Liu Qingge blushes even more. He clenches his fists and turns his back on him, presumably to eradicate the straggling demons. Honestly, Shen Jiu doesn't care. He also ignores Luo Binghe. After making sure the situation is under control, he draws his sword and returns to Qing Jing Peak. His house is silent, nothing betrays he has a prisoner locked up and for a few seconds, he fears that he has escaped. However, inside he finds the usurper still tied up.

It's disturbing that your own face looks at you with concern and fear, without a hint of elegance. The usurper is a parodic copy that could not fool anyone.

Shen Jiu is terrified that he has managed to fool everybody.

“How did it end!?”

“Shouldn't you know already?” He hisses, closing the door.

“I was right,” he guesses and relief glows in his eyes. “Do you trust me already?”

“Never.”

Shen Jiu holds the sword in silent threat as he watches over that near-perfect copy of himself. 

“Your name,” he demands.

“Shen Yuan.”

“What can you tell me about your presence?”

“I don’t want to be here. I have certain... knowledge about the future and it seems like my role is to make sure that specific events happen.”

“That doesn't explain why you tried to steal my body.”

“The same... entity that brought me here wanted me to impersonate you. You have a key role for the future.”

“Despite my horrible fate?” He raises an eyebrow, sarcastic. “Your words are full of contradictions, Shen Yuan.”

Shen Yuan frowns and for a few seconds it seems like he is going to say something, but he remains silent. He doesn’t seem stupid and it is evident that he has more information than he wants to tell. It doesn’t matter. Shen Jiu is patient and cunning. In the end, he will find a way to extract that information from him.

“Next event?” He demands, impatient.

Shen Yuan takes a few seconds to reply.

“Tonight. A dream demon will attack Luo Binghe and Ning Yingying. It is an irrelevant event, they will defeat him without problems.”

Shen Jiu doesn't like to hear that the second event also affects Luo Binghe. He is suspicious, as he doesn’t believe in coincidences. However, Shen Yuan doesn't add more and it might not be wise to press him so soon.

With a sigh, Shen Jiu sheaths his sword. Perhaps he should worry about an intruder looking like him before the distant future. One thing is clear: no one else must discover Shen Yuan's existence.

“I'll let you live... for now,” he decides and Shen Yuan breathes in relief. “You will follow my rules. If you try to trick me or escape, I will kill you. Did you understand?”

Shen Yuan nods and Shen Jiu, after considering it, decides to untie him.

Chapter End Notes

They will talk a bit more about what has happened and what they will do from now on in the next chapter. However, their division has no explanation. 100% for the interest of the plot. This is PIDW!!

See you in next chapter :)

✰ Tumblr

They share the same house but not the dreams

Chapter Summary

Shen Jiu has an unexpected roommate.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Getting killed is less terrifying than being dismembered, but of course, Shen Yuan doesn't give the scum villain ideas. Instead, he stares quietly at how Shen Qingqiu puts talismans of silence on the walls. When he finishes, Shen Qingqiu crosses his arms and re-examines the room. It is a secondary room of the bamboo house. When Shen Yuan transmigrated, it was in disuse. Now it is his new prison.

The talismans will prevent them from being heard from outside, and Shen Qingqiu has also curtained the window. Shen Yuan recognizes that it is a better cell than the prison that awaits the scum villain in the future. He has a bed and a table, and a few forgotten books that Shen Qingqiu hasn't bothered to collect.

“You will stay here,” he orders. “You not only have my body, but also my cultivation level. You don't need to eat, congrats.”

A moment earlier, Shen Qingqiu had examined his spirit veins to determine his level. The verdict had been that they were both insultingly identical. The scum villain hadn't liked finding out.

Shen Yuan doesn't want to be locked in a tiny room for days or maybe months, but he doesn't protest. He intuits that Shen Qingqiu is in a horrible mood and is still better than the future written in the book. Shen Yuan clings to that idea to accept his situation with resignation.

Ironically, it is better to be a prisoner of the villain than of the protagonist. Thinking of PIDW, Shen Yuan feels fear scratching at his heart. He cannot tell the truth to Shen Qingqiu. The scum villain is a cruel and selfish person, a lot of people are going to die because of him! His disciples, his martial brothers... If Shen Qingqiu discovers it, he is capable of sacrificing him when Luo Binghe returns thirsty for revenge. After all, the two are identical.

Shen Yuan refuses to pay for someone else's crimes when he has been trying to save Luo Binghe all this time.

Shen Qingqiu finishes charming the room and stops in front of him. His gaze is sharp and Shen Yuan shrinks, uncomfortable.

“You’re a pathetic copy,” he says, clicking his tongue. “Did someone suspect you?”

Shen Yuan shallows.

“I tried to avoid the other Peak Lords,” he explains. “I haven't seen most of them. Liu Qingge, for example, I first met him at Lingxi Caves. Yue Qingyuan and Mu Qingfang were the only ones who were with me when I qi deviated. ” Shen Yuan lifts two fingers, wagging invisible quotations.

“Did they suspect something?” He insists, his gaze is even darker.

“I think not...” Shen Yuan is insecure, but he needs to regain the scum villain's trust to gain enough power to alter the plot. “I kept my distance and tried to act like you. During all this time I was only with the disciples and then three years in seclusion. I have supplanted you for a very short time! And I successfully defeated a demon!”

However, something he has said has caused Shen Qingqiu to clench his teeth hard. Shen Yuan is speechless and terrified. Although Shen Qingqiu is quiet, he is surrounded by a murderous rage.

“Tell me everything you did when you were in my body. Absolutely all the details,” he demands and Shen Yuan doesn't dare lie to him.

He tells him that he woke up in his bed accompanied by Yue Qingyuan, how Mu Qingfang explained that it had been a deviation of qi and that perhaps his memories were blurred, how he rescued Luo Binghe from bullies and the skinners’ mission. How he decided to go into seclusion to get used to his body and how he saved Liu Qingge's life. What he cannot explain is why they then separated into two.

His words make Shen Qingqiu growl and hiss in disgust or roll his eyes.

Shen Yuan thinks he has done a good job, and yet Shen Qingqiu seems increasingly furious.

“Did you allow a lesser demon to trap you?” Shen Qingqiu looks at him with a menacing rage. “You would have destroyed my reputation if I hadn't...”

Fortunately for Shen Yuan, Shen Qingqiu falls silent upon hearing someone call the bamboo house. The scum villain frowns before giving him a silent warning and leaving the room. Shen Yuan nods. He is not stupid enough to challenge him. Curious, he approaches the door and hears the calm voice of Yue Qingyuan confronting the poisonous Shen Qingqiu. Poor Yue Qingyuan, he regrets. It is not his fault that Shen Qingqiu is pissed off and turns his worry into excuses to insult him. Shen Yuan clenches his fists.

Despite everything, he still wants to change the end of the book. He wants to protect those children whom he has grown attached to and Yue Qingyuan, too kind for such a horrifying ending.

It has been a tiring day and exhaustion traps Shen Yuan without being able to resist. He crawls into bed and is already asleep when he collapses.

Shen Yuan walks through the mists.

It is confusing at first. He doesn't know where he is or what happened. He walks through an unfocused landscape. For a few seconds, Shen Yuan wonders if Shen Qingqiu has drugged him. Until the system explains that he is in the arc of the dream demon.

That makes no sense. Where is Ning Yingying? For Shen Yuan to replace Luo Binghe's childhood friend is as absurd as having become Shen Qingqiu's clone. He definitely hates PIDW's pointless plots.

A confused and scared Luo Binghe appears out of nowhere and runs to hug him.

“Shizun!” He cries. “Where are we?”

In a ruined wife plot, he sighs. In one of the plots that will change your life forever.

Shen Yuan looks at the boy with the suspicion that Shen Qingqiu threw him into danger without congratulating him afterward. And now he has a chance to fix it. Shen Yuan smiles as he pets Luo Binghe's head.

“This teacher couldn't tell Binghe before how proud he is of him,” he says. “You did it very well.”

His disciple bows his head, his cheeks flushed, and his eyes bright with happiness.

“Thanks, shizun.”

“I’m sorry,” he adds. “I hope Binghe didn't feel ignored. This master had to leave early to check the sect's security.”

“This disciple understands it!”

Binghe, he sighs, still smiling. You are an adorable white lotus.

Shen Yuan doesn’t like to act so that Shen Qingqiu will later take the credit and also insult and scold him as if he were useless. And at the same time, this opportunity tastes like victory. He grins. It's too early to give up.

 

 

That night Shen Jiu had no intention of sleeping.

He finds that sorting out the paperwork helps him to calm down. Because range bubbles in his chest until he is breathless. It’s painful. His emotions freeze his bones and heart, it clouds his mind. His hands shake when he picks up a manual. Shen Jiu takes a deep breath. But his discomfort doesn’t disappear.

Yue Qingyuan hasn't noticed. Yue Qingyuan, precisely Yue Qingyuan, didn‘t realize that he had been impersonated.

It hurts.

He can understand that Mu Qingfang and his other martial brothers didn’t suspect anything (he has always kept their distance from them) or that his disciples were fooled (they are little children), but Shen Jiu cannot accept that Yue Qingyan was misled.

His room is just as he remembered it, the usurper hasn’t sullied it. Shen Jiu sits in front of the table and considers possible strategies to extract the truth from him. Leaving him alive is dangerous, but Shen Yuan is not stupid and will surely keep secrets to ensure his safety.

Perhaps a poison could serve to interrogate him, however, Shen Jiu hasn’t forgotten the threat of death that surrounds Shen Yuan. He must first understand who he really is and how he got into his body. Then who forces him to meet certain events and why. Third, what about Luo Binghe. And, finally, his future.

Shen Jiu is thinking when the bamboo house door is opened without permission and the boy he hates goes into a panic attack.

“Shizun!” He yells with wet eyes.

“Luo Binghe,” he hisses, standing up. “What are you doing here?”

Realizing his mistake, Luo Binghe backs off. He is shaking when he bows.

“This disciple wanted to make sure that Shizun was fine.”

Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow as he crosses his arms.

“Do you doubt your master’s safety?” Although he interrogates him coldly, his thoughts fly away.

Shen Jiu deduces that Luo Binghe has just woken up from the dream induced by that demon Shen Yuan told him about. Another unexpected victory , he thinks bitterly. That brat is small and insignificant, and yet in a very short time, he has defeated two powerful demons. Shen Jiu wants to tear him apart and sink him into the same mud of misery that covers him. Shen Jiu wants to take advantage of his abilities for his benefit.

And he still doesn't know which of the two possibilities tempts him the most.

“Leave,” he growls. “And never again enter my house without permission or I will rip the skin off your back.”

“Yes, shizun,” he murmurs.

Finally alone, Shen Jiu sits down and sighs as he massages his temples. He is tired, angry, and frustrated.

That night he couldn't sleep.

Chapter End Notes

Thank you very much for the good reception you have given to the fic! >w<

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Liu Qingge is confused

Chapter Summary

Luo Binghe 🤝 Liu Qingge
Doesn't understand Shen Qingqiu attitude.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

After a sleepless night tainted with corrupted feelings, Shen Jiu is in a horrible mood. He sternly announces to his disciples that the next one who enters the bamboo house without warning will be punished. His gaze is fixed on Luo Binghe. He is too busy fixing three lost years and he doesn’t have time to punish him for his last night’s insolence, setting an example for the others.

However, Luo Binghe it’s not the first one who bothers him that morning, but Liu Qingge.

The War Gor comes unannounced. Shen Jiu grits his teeth as he recognizes that arrogant white-clothed figure walking up to his peak as if it belonged to him. His self-confidence is irritating and he forgets his disciples to intercept him.

“What are you doing here?” He hisses, tapping the fan.

Liu Qingge stops and stares at him like this is the first time. His silence is awkward. Shen Jiu glares at him, waiting for a delayed reply. Liu Qingge frowns when he extends an arm as if he is going to hit him. Shen Jiu is already prepared to defend himself when he sees that he is offering him a fan.

“What?” He sighs without hiding his irritation.

“For you,” Liu Qingge mutters. He has looked away and is as rigid as if they were going to fight. But instead of a sword, he brandishes a white and green fan, with red decorations.

Shen Jiu is not used to gifts and that’s why he doesn’t recognize one.

Restless, he leans over to examine that unfamiliar fan without understanding why he is offering it to him nor why Liu Qingge is getting more and more nervous. He seems about to break something, maybe the fan.

“It’s not mine,” he says, hiding behind his. “Did you find it? Perhaps some idiot has lost it...”

An idiot named Shen Yuan, he thinks.

“Now it's yours!” Shen Jiu still doesn't understand him and Liu Qingge huffs, tense and uncomfortable. “For saving me!”

Shen Jiu still hasn't accepted the fan, so Liu Qingge stretches out his arm until he has no choice but to pick it up. When he holds it in his hand, Liu Qingge turns and draws Cheng Luan. In an instant, he flies away and disappears over the horizon.

And Shen Jiu stands still, confused, and with his first gift in his hand. He looks at the fan, hoping to find a catch, not a fancy design. It is an expensive fan, typical of a brat like Liu Qingge. Shen Jiu growls as a poisonous thought slides through his mind like a snake. When I saved your life, you accused me of attacking you from behind but now you thank Shen Yuan with a present.

He returns to the bamboo house with stiff steps. After opening the door with a sharp bang, Shen Jiu heads to the second room. Shen Yuan has kept his word (for the moment) and he still hasn't come out. The usurper is trying to ruffle his hair and looks at him in surprise.

“Do you need something…?”

“For you.” Shen Jiu throws the fan at him and he catches it without blinking. “It seems like Liu Qingge is very grateful for saving his life. And that you told the truth again.”

“Of course! Why would I have lied to you?” Shen Yuan protests, his lips pursed in an offended grimace. Then he opens the fan. “It’s cute.”

“All yours. I don't want you to keep stealing my life and my belongings.”

Shen Yuan bows his head, almost guiltily. Too late, he thinks. Shen Jiun hums uneasy before leaving and slamming the door. He needs to evaluate the progress of his disciples during those three years. He needs to make sure the usurper hasn't destroyed his life and extract the truth from him. He needs to investigate if there have been any other strange occurrences. He needs to investigate the demonic invasion as well. He has so many things to do that anxiety drowns him out. And if that's not enough, a Qiong Ding Peak disciple appears to warn him that all Peak Lords have an urgent meeting at noon.

His head hurts like it's going to explode. Insomnia and stress have merged into a vague pain. Shen Jiu needs all of his willpower to maintain his aloof facade.

Before going to Qiong Ding Peak, he returns to Shen Yuan's room without actually entering. From the door, Shen Jiu gazes at the usurper.

“What do you know about the demonic invasion?” He asks. “Is suspicious that they attacked when all the Peak Lords were busy. And they also knew how to get around our defenses.”

Shen Jiu has not yet ruled out the possibility that Shen Yuan was in league with Sha Hualing. And he doesn't respond. Shen Yuan ponders his answer too carefully, which betrays him.

“You know something,” Shen Jiu understands with a hiss.

Shen Yuan doesn’t deny it. He lifts his head and looks directly into his eyes.

“Yes, but it’s that kind of information that I can't tell.” He pauses another pause before continuing talking. “I could try to find a risky way to tell you, but what do I get?”

Really? Shen Jiu looks at him in disbelief. Is that brat blackmailing him? After everything he's done? Prepotent! He squeezes his fan so hard his knuckles turn white.

“Remember why you are still alive.”

“And then what? Do you want me to stay here forever while I answer your questions? I'm not a bird!”

Shen Jiu narrows his eyes. He would keep arguing with him if it weren't because he's going to be late for the meeting. And he knows it. Perhaps he has sought out Shen Yuan because he needed an excuse to delay an inevitable moment.

He slams the door shut again and takes a deep breath.

It is time to face his eleven martial brothers, that group of hypocrites who didn’t recognize the difference between the two of them.

Shen Jiu flies on his sword. He is among the last to reach Qiong Ding Peak, shortly before Liu Qingge. He walks quickly to avoid coinciding with the War God because if he listens to him perhaps he will lose his patience and the words will slip out of him. Shen Jiu decides to ignore him despite his visible attempts to attract his attention. Liu Qingge ends up giving up and the two of them sit in their place.

Being so close to Yue Qingyuan is painful. Shen Jiu ignores him too, and his sad looks, his kind courtesy. Shen Jiu stands firm and composed like a statue, even though his disappointment is cracking his patched heart.

The meeting is as terrible as he imagined.

Everyone speaks at the same time and no one has clear ideas. Shen Jiu doesn’t participate despite hiding a suspicion called Shen Yuan and having been one who witnessed the invasion. He doesn't talk about his theories either. Shen Jiu remains silent and thinks about everything he will do when he returns to his peak. And if he should take care of Luo Binghe. He senses that there is something strange about this child, but perhaps it is his prejudices or that he desperately needs an excuse to justify his jealousy.

Unfortunately, the meeting ends with no results and Yue Qingyuan determines that they will meet again that afternoon. They've wasted hours yelling at each other and have yet to talk about beefing up security or investigating rumors.

Shen Jiu is furious when he leaves.

 

 

Shen Yuan has spent that morning thinking of strategies to negotiate with the scum villain.

He is not dumb and knows that he shouldn’t provoke him, but Shen Qingqiu has already destroyed the plot once. It would be naive to believe that with a couple of indications everything will end well. No, he needs to interfere more directly. 

Shen Yuan knows two things: first, he has Shen Qingqiu's interest. Second, he has demonstrated that he has told the truth. I have to convince him to let me take care of Luo Binghe, he thinks. But how? Unveiling his ideas so early is too risky. Perhaps he should start with tiny deals: information in exchange for small freedoms like access to bestiaries. The Immortal Alliance is still several years away. Shen Yuan clings to that fact to reinforce his hope and optimism.

The talismans prevent anyone outside the house from hearing him, but they don’t prevent him from hearing the noises outside. Shen Yuan sighs sadly. The disciples practice music and sometimes he hears a child cry. He misses those kids.

Shen Yuan stiffens when the door of the house opens. Shen Qingqiu has returned. He listens to his footsteps, tense and expectant with a mixture of fear and urges for Shen Qingqiu to open the door of his room. He hates that horrible character, but he is also the only person he can talk to.

Shen Jiu ignores him and Shen Yuan sighs again before picking up one of the few books in the room. He is so bored that he appreciates any reading.

An hour later, Shen Qingqiu enters his room.

Shen Yuan sits up. He has a proposal on his tongue, however, Shen Qingqiu overtakes him with his brusque gestures and sharp voice, with those gazes that demand silence and his arrogant words.

“I have a deal for you,” and he says it in a way that warns that Shen Yuan won't be able to refuse. “Do you want to go outside? Fine. I'll test you.“

Shen Yuan frowns but doesn't protest. It wasn’t in his plans for Shen Qingqiu to be open to bargains. This is excellent news and he clings to that possibility, hiding his feelings from him.

“What kind of test?”

“There is a Peaks Lords’ meeting this afternoon and I don't want to waste my time. You will go in my place. This is your chance to show me that you are a good substitute.” Shen Jiu approaches, ominously. “If you fail, you'll be locked in here until I consider it. If you do it right, I'll rethink letting you out. With my conditions, of course.”

As expected of the villain, Shen Qingqiu is a horrible manipulator. Shen Yuan clenches his fists, but nods. This is his best chance to change the future. And he still has information to negotiate with later. For the moment, Shen Yuan decides to focus on the task of being a good actor. They two have the same face. It’s quite logical that everyone will mistake him for Shen Qingqiu.

Shen Yuan decides that he will be a better Shen Qingqiu.

“Come, your hair is a mess,” the real Shen Qingqiu growls and Shen Yuan meekly follows his directions.

Shen Qingqiu refuses to give him Xiu Ya, so Shen Yuan will have to go on foot. Although he loves to fly with a sword, at that moment walking seems wonderful to him. Shen Yuan doesn't know when he will get another chance, so he walks slowly up Qing Jing Peak and greets all of his children. Then he heads to Rainbow Bridge.

Bai Zhan Peak is close to Qing Jing Peak and so he is not surprised when Liu Qingge lands in front of him, Cheng Luan in his hand.

“What are you doing? You are going to be late.”

Shen Yuan doesn’t want to be unfriendly to a person he hardly knows, but he must act out his role. However, due to his lack of experience, he cannot think of any answer worthy of Shen Qingqiu, so he hides behind the fan.

“Not your business.”

Liu Qingge's eyes widen.

“You're using my... you're using it,” he sputters before clearing his throat.

Yeah, it’s cute and I don’t have another one, he thinks. But he is now Shen Qingqiu and he shouldn't show any hint of sympathy.

“Of course, or did you want me not to use it?”

“I didn't think you would use it!”

“So why did shidi give it to me?”

Liu Qingge is visibly nervous and Shen Yuan is sorry for him. He can imagine that Shen Qingqiu hasn't exactly kindly accepted his gift. Liu Qingge’s reaction is normal, not his. Shen Yuan sighs before turning his back on him.

“It will be late, don't distract me.” Shen Yuan tries to drench his words with all the arrogance he can. It’s frustrating. He hasn't unlocked OOC mode to be cocky again!

He hears muffled noises behind his back, but he doesn't turn around. And all because Shen Qingqiu hasn’t wanted to leave me his sword, he grumbles. He is the one objectively dangerous, he should be unarmed not me!

Shen Yuan has become so distracted that he has not heard Liu Qingge jump onto his sword. However, instead of walking away, he flies up to his side.

“I'll take you,” he says in a strangled murmur.

Wait! What? What are you doing Liu Qingge? We are enemies! Shen Yuan has been paralyzed and Liu Qingge takes that opportunity to grab him and raise him to the sword. Not! This is definitely OOC!

“Leave me!” He protests. His panic grows as the sword rises several feet into the air. “I want to walk! I don't care about that meeting!”

Shen Yuan stumbled and almost tripped. Because moving on a sword is a very bad idea. A cry escapes him when he feels that he is going to fall, but Liu Qingge catches him in time in a hug that pushes him against his chest.

He quickly detaches himself as long as Cheng Luan's length allows.

“Don't be proud,” he mutters, a little flushed. “You helped me in the caves during the qi deviation and then you fought against those demons. Your cultivation has always been weak.” Shen Yuan looks at him without understanding what he means. “It is understandable that you are tired.”

“Ah…”

He never... has thought about it. The real causes behind Liu Qingge's death are never mentioned in the book. If Shen Yuan had been less lucky, he too would have mistakenly killed him. Or he would have been killed. Being written from Luo Binghe's POV, the demonic invasion is another scene where Shen Qingqiu mistreats him, however, Shen Qingqiu is saving the sect after having survived the murderous qi deviation of one of the more powerful cultivators. Perhaps Shen Qingqiu in the book also chose Luo Binghe because he needed his talent to protect the sect?

Maybe he hoped Liu Mingyan would win, but when she lost he was cornered. And he made the most logical decision since there were only disciples left. The other Peak Lords were either far or dead.

As a scum villain, the book says that Shen Qingqiu's cultivation is only as mediocre as his personality. Even so, Shen Qingqiu managed to overcome various setbacks without ever losing his proud appearance from Luo Binghe's eyes.

Shen Yuan begins to feel uncomfortable. He shakes his head to push those thoughts away. It’s irrelevant. They have changed the book, those scenes haven’t happened, and the real Shen Qingqiu is a horrible person. His assumptions are useless in this present.

Too late he discovers that Liu Qingge is carrying him in his sword without him being able to prevent it. Shen Qingqiu, don't kill me! He cries. He's being OOC, not me! 

“Fine,” he nods, hiding behind the fan. “Don't let anyone see us. Or I will kill you.”

Shen Qingqiu has threatened him so many times like this that Shen Yuan can perfectly imitate him.

Liu Qingge nods with a grunt.

Chapter End Notes

Writing this chapter I've realized that I totally forgot the scene of Binghe asking his shizun what he thinks about demons 😅 So that scene will appear in the next chapter.

★ Twitter
✰ Tumblr

Luo Binghe asks his shizun a question

Chapter Summary

Luo Binghe asks his shizun a very important question that maybe we'll change everything.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Luo Binghe intercepts him when Shen Jiu walks through Qing Jing Peak.

Besides bothering him, the boy has done nothing wrong so he can’t punish him. Luo Binghe respectfully bows and says if he can ask him something. Shen Jiu has no reason to refuse, so he clicks his tongue and crosses his arms while waiting for Luo Binghe to speak.

“Shizun,” he mutters, his voice as polite as uncertain. “Is it true that all demons are evil?”

Shen Jiu huffs and a wry smile spread across his face.

“Only someone like you would ask such a naive question! Don't be silly, Luo Binghe, humans can be worse than demons.”

And with a flick of his sleeve, Shen Jiu continues without paying any more attention to his disciple. If he had looked at him one last time, he would have discovered that Luo Binghe is smiling and peculiar happiness shines in his eyes.

To check if Shen Yuan imitated him correctly yesterday, Shen Jiu plans to meet some of his martial brothers today. If any of them comment that yesterday he acted strangely, Shen Yuan will have failed the test. If not... it is not a guarantee that he approved it, but he will value it.

First, Shen Jiu visits An Ding Peak. Shang Qinghua trembles like a hamster when he sees him. That shaky little man is a Peak Lord parody. Shen Jiu hates him. It is frustrating that someone so weak and useless has reached the same goal as him without all his effort. Shen Jiu sighs and tries to ignore those envious thoughts. Although he tries to control them, those last days are torturing.

“I wasn't expecting you. Do you need my help, Shen-shixiong?”

“I plan to remodel my house.” He says, staring at him very intently to watch his reaction. “I'm going to change some furniture. I also have a disused room that I want to convert into a second bedroom.”

Shang Qinghua frowns.

“Can I ask why?”

“No.”

Perhaps it is because of the terror he feels for him, but Shang Qinghua agrees to all his requests and doesn’t comment anything about his sudden personality changes.

His next stop is Qian Cao Peak. Shen Jiu approaches Mu Qingfang to inform him that he has recovered his memories and to question him about his qi deviation . His martial brother acts as the responsible healer that he is. He gives him a quick check-up and also asks him a few questions about his health. His verdict: he is back as before the incident.

That is obvious and logical because someone was impersonating him and now he is the same Shen Qingqiu as always.

Shen Jiu knows that he must visit Yue Qingyuan, but he ends up postponing the meeting. So, he stops at Xian Shu Peak to annoy Qi Qingqi and remind her that her wonderful disciple lost to a lesser demoness. The relationship between the two is dire and they take every opportunity to stab each other with insults. When he leaves Xian Shu Peak, Shen Jiu feels a little more relaxed.

His heart beats fast as he assumes that he must head for Qiong Ding Peak. Every step hurts, his thoughts spin out of control again. All the hatred that he hides in his chest spreads through his body like second veins that engulf him. Shen Jiu's lungs breathe anger, discouragement, frustration, and envy. Although he tries to control himself, in the end, he stops in front of Yue Qingyuan's door without daring to enter.

After sighing, Shen Jiu rides on his sword and returns to Qing Jing Peak. He should talk to Yue Qingyuan another day, one in which he has locked up all of those feelings or, at least, they have cooled down. He should order his ideas to avoid losing control when he looks into his eyes and knows that he has failed him again.

Shen Yuan is an interesting mystery that allows him to get distracted. After ordering his disciples to run fifty laps around Qing Jing Peak, he returns to Shen Yuan intending to rearrange the house.

Neither Shang Qinghua, Mu Qingfang, nor Qi Qingqi has mentioned anything, so for now, Shen Jiu is giving Shen Yuan a chance. And if he wants to keep his clone alive, he must adapt his bamboo house to a second person.

Shen Yuan perhaps recognizes that he is in a bad mood because he doesn’t ask any questions and follows all his directions. Shen Jiu mentally organizes how he will change the furniture and what he needs to order from An Ding Peak later.

Although it's heavy work, Shen Jiu manages to stay distracted enough to calm down as the hours go by. At the end of the day, he is too preoccupied with how to keep Shen Yuan hidden from the rest of the sect to still think about Yue Qingyuan.

A week later, the bamboo house is adapted for the two of them.

Living with Shen Yuan is as annoying as doing it with someone else. Shen Jiu appreciates tranquility, silence, and solitude. The usurper has also stolen that privilege. However, over time he discovers that Shen Yuan can quietly spend hours reading. So he ends up looking for several bestiaries for him after Shen Yuan promises not to bother him. And maybe it's because he has the same body and face, but Shen Jiu doesn't feel any threat. Or perhaps because time has finally erased the anguish of being surrounded by other men after the Qiu mansion.

Shen Yuan's second test comes when Yue Qingyuan calls Liu Qingge, Mu Qingfang, and him on a mission.

“Tonight I'm taking Ming Fan on a night hunt,” he explains while entering the bamboo house. Shen Yuan is in his room and looks out, without crossing the door, when he hears him. “Do you know if something will happen?”

Shen Yuan frowns.

“You guys do a lot of night hunts, I need more details. Who accompanies you?”

“Mu Qingfang, Liu Qingge, and their disciples.”

Shen Yuan nods while thinking.

“I’m not sure. At least, I guess nothing important will happen because then I’d remember it. I think it will be an irrelevant night hunt.” Shen Yuan bites his lip, a gesture Shen Jiu hates, and looks at him like he always does when he wants to say something but doesn't dare.

“So?” Shen Jiu demands impatiently, closing his fan in a sharp blow that startles him.

“Perhaps you should take Luo Binghe with you.”

Shen Jiu narrows his eyes. He knows there is something fishy about that boy, but Shen Yuan dodges all his questions.

“Why?”

“He defeated a demon elder. His level is better than Ming Fan...”

“Ming Fan is my head disciple,” he remembers. “Luo Binghe may be a good fighter, but we are at Qing Jing Peak, not at Bai Zhan Peak. That kid is a mess who needs to perfect all four arts.”

Like so many times, Shen Yuan lowers his head and doesn’t add more, in a gesture that Shen Jiu already recognizes: he is hiding something. Their discussions are brief and always end with Shen Yuan silencing his opinions, either out of fear or mistrust.

Shen Jiu doesn't care about his reasons. It’s proof that the usurper is not stupid, but is making it difficult to question him.

“Remember the rules,” he says before leaving.

Followed by Ming Fan, Shen Jiu meets his martial brothers at the sect's entrance. They will go on horseback and don’t need much preparation, it’s just a beast attacking a nearby forest. As Shen Jiu gives his disciple some final indications, he discovers that Liu Qingge is watching him. When he turns to growl at him, Liu Qingge abruptly turns his back and rides his horse. Strange, he thinks, suspiciously.

The ride is uneventful despite the rivalry between Qing Jing Peak and Bai Zhan Peak. Shen Jiu notices the tension between their disciples, but he has no patience to put up with their trifles, so he hisses until Ming Fan finds it wiser to ignore them and follow his teacher. To Shen Jiu's surprise, Liu Qingge also orders his disciples to shut up.

The rest of the trip is peaceful.

While Mu Qingfang and his kids stay in the rear, Liu Qingge guides his two disciples against the monster. It is an Ankylosing Snake with Eight Barbs. Shen Jiu and Ming Fan help the Bai Zhan Peak. It is a team mission, in which they combine skill with the sword and knowledge, however, they lack experience in fighting together. Although Liu Qingge is acting strangely assertive tonight, his disciples are brusque and reject any help. Ming Fan doesn’t act better either: he is proud and ignores Shen Jiu's prompts to prove that he is more capable than the brutes of Bai Zhan Peak.

It's no surprise that Yue Qingyuan sent Mu Qingfang as well. His disciples seem very happy about all the practice they will have later in healing wounds.

Shen Jiu has read about this creature and knows that its barbs can explode into poison when it’s cornered. That is why you have to kill it quickly and not the slow torture of three stupid teenagers armed with swords. Knowing this, Shen Jiu keeps an eye on Ankylosing Snake with Eight Barbs' attitude.

A bluish glow betrays the moment of its counterattack.

“Back off!” He yells, grabbing Ming Fan by the neck of the robe to push him away. “It’s going to expel poison!”

Is it worth being poisoned in exchange for kicking the War God? Yes.

Shen Jiu uses his talismans to push the rest of the children away from danger and knocks Liu Qingge out of the way with a satisfying kick. The poison hits him and Shen Jiu coughs as he covers his face with a sleeve. Since he's already poisoned, he doesn't mind charging forward. He lunges at the monster holding his breath and decapitates it with an accurate blow from Xiu Ya.

Then he backs off before inhaling too much poison. He is not an idiot.

“Shizun!” Ming Fan runs towards him half crying half screaming. “Are you okay? That’s been awesome!”

“Hum.” Shen Jiu cleans his sword before sheathing it. Mu Qingfang's children have surrounded them to examine all the wounds. There are a few scratches and claws, even Ming Fan has a bloody leg. “Go get examined. And then we'll talk. I expected another attitude from you, Ming Fang.”

His disciple bows his head, embarrassed, and shuffles over to one of the healing girls. Shen Jiu sighs and sudden dizziness assails him. He has taken a risk because he knows the venom of the Ankylosing Snake with Eight Barbs is not lethal, just annoying. Shen Jiu massages his temples in hope of easing his headache, although it will probably get worse throughout the night.

Jerky steps approach him and Shen Jiu rolls his eyes before extending his fan.

“Not now, Liu-shidi,” he groans before turning and facing Liu Qingge's disheveled face. Shen Jiu expected to see him offended and upset, probably to challenge him to a fight to regain his pride, however, Liu Qingge looks at him with wide eyes and astonishment.

“Did you… save me?”

“No, I hit you for pleasure.” Shen Qingqiu smiles behind the fan even though his vision begins to be blurry. “It was quite delightful.”

Liu Qingge makes a strangled sound and doesn't add anything else, so Shen Qingqiu takes the opportunity to walk away. It's strange. He has beaten Liu Qingge many, many times, but it is the first time that he is speechless or in the mood for more fights. Shen Jiu isn't going to complain either.

After two steps, he feels like he is losing his balance. Shen Jiu grits his teeth and rushes to his horse. On his mount, he feels more secure and can maintain his facade. Shen Jiu doesn't care that others think he's arrogant and cold, he's already played his part and he deserves a break. And maybe he does act impatient and is frustrated that it takes so long to heal the kids, but he's tired and the poison is spreading through his body. He needs to go home and sleep.

 

 

Without Shen Qingqiu, Shen Yuan feels like when his parents left one night and he had the house to himself. Of course, he doesn't dare to break any rules. And, although the temptation is immense, he stays inside reading one of the bestiaries that Shen Qingqiu has brought him. Shen Yuan acknowledges that PIDW's worldbuilding is amazing. And the bestiaries have a lot of information that doesn't appear in the book!

The night progresses and Shen Yuan recovers one of his worst habits: forgetting about sleep and reading for hours.

He is startled when the door is open.

Although he knows that he hasn’t done anything explicitly forbidden, Shen Yuan quickly closes the book and tries to blow out the candles without starting a fire. Shen Qingqiu loves complaining about everything he does and he senses that this disaster (the messy room, his hair down) will only annoy him.

Of course, an angry Shen Qingqiu walks into his room. However, there is something strange about him: his steps are wobbly, his gaze is unfocused…

“Sorry,” Shen Yuan babbles. “I've been distracted reading and… Are you alright?”

“It’s Luo Binghe, right?” He hisses. Shen Qingqiu points a hand at him so sharply that he staggers and needs to hold on to the wall. “You didn't know what was going to happen. Because you only know the future that concerns that brat, am I right?”

Shen Yuan swallows hard. He has seen Shen Qingqiu angry many times, but never so out of control. At that moment he can't think of any coherent lie. Because yes, PIDW is the story of Luo Binghe and all the adventures are told from his point of view.

Fortunately, whatever affected Shen Jiu also stops him from murdering him.

“Yes,” Shen Yuan decides to admit the truth because these days he has found that Shen Qingqiu reacts positively every time he confirms that he has not lied to him. Besides, it no longer makes sense to hide it.

“Why? What makes that child so special?”

“I can’t answer that.”

Shen Qingqiu growls. Fortunately for Shen Yuan, at that moment someone opens the door of the bamboo house without permission. Shen Qingqiu's eyes widened in panic. Luckily the talismans have prevented others from hearing their discussion.

"Liu-shidi, don't be so brusque. Shen-shixiong may be resting," says Mu Qingfang's calm voice.

Shen Qingqiu has paled. Quickly, he grabs Shen Yuan and shoves him out of the room as he closes himself inside. When Shen Yuan realizes it, he finds himself stunned in the middle of the bamboo house watching Mu Qingfang and Liu Qingge enter.

Fuck. FUCK. He needs a fan to hide his confused face. Although it is not the first time he impersonates Shen Qingqiu, it is not the same to have him so close, judging him. And Liu Qingge in front of him acting OOC again! What are you doing at our house, Liu-shidi?

As Shen Yuan hurries to pick up a fan, Liu Qingge blushes at the sight of his pristine martial brother with his hair down and his outer robe removed.

When Shen Yuan faces them, he notices their discomfort. Well, he's not going to apologize for his looks. A few moments earlier he was reading very comfortably and Shen Qingqiu has not given him time to clean himself up, so it is their fault, not his.

“Can I help my shidis?” He says in the coldest and most arrogant voice he can do despite his nervousness.

“Liu-shidi told me you have been in contact with the poison of Ankylosing Snake with Eight Barbs.”

Wait, is that the reason why Shen Qingqiu is acting strange? Damn you Airplane, this doesn’t appear in the book! Shen Yuan is very sure that after the Dream Demon Arc nothing exciting happens. However... It is evident that Shen Qingqiu wants to hide that he is poisoned. And from what he heard, Mu Qinfang has come at the insistence of Liu Qingge, who was killed in the book (and probably by now the other martial brothers would hate Shen Qingqiu for murdering Liu Qingge). So ... maybe it did happen but Luo Binghe never found out about this subplot?

Shen Yuan allows Mu Qingfang to examine him. Obviously, the doctor doesn’t discover anything strange, although he prescribes a week of rest just in case. He is the first to leave and the other two are left alone, both uncomfortable and without saying anything. Liu Qingge looks at the ground (he hasn’t dared to look at him for the last minutes) and his ears are a little red. Shen Yuan is fanning himself anxiously.

“Liu-shidi...” He doubts. Acting like Shen Qingqiu is horrible! “If you enter my house again without warning and manners, I will kill you.”

Liu Qingge raises his head to look into his eyes.

“Thanyouforsavingmylifeagain,” he splutters too fast for Shen Yuan to understand anything.

And he leaves. Without saying goodbye or closing the door. The War God disappears like a gale and Shen Yuan sighs in relief. Now he only has to deal with the most dangerous of all.

Shen Qingqiu is sitting on his bed, gasping for air. His eyes are closed and his lips are deathly pale. Seeing him so affected fills Shen Yuan with the courage to stop hiding his opinions from him.

“That was your brilliant plan?!” He scolds him. “You need a doctor! Now Mu Qingfang will believe that you are fine and will not give you any treatment. Or antidote. You are poisoned!”

“Ankylosing Snake with Eight Barbs’ poison it’s just a nuisance,” he mutters with a hoarse voice.

Your personality is also a nuisance!

“It's stupid. Aren't you supposed to be smarter than me? Don't endanger your health!”

Shen Jiu opens his eyes with difficulty.

“It's my health, not yours, does it matter?”

“Of course it matters! Your stupid pride will one day kill us both. Or the entire sect!”

“Don't be exaggerated...”

As a regular reader of PIDW, Shen Yuan knows the ending of this story too well and how destructive Shen Qingqiu's pride will be. If you didn't insist on hiding it, I would know this subplot. He sighs as he rubs his eyes.

“If I really was your enemy now I could kill you.” He warns him and for a few seconds, he sounds like the real Shen Qingqiu. “Do you understand now? You have to trust others.”

Shen Qingqiu throws his head back and laughs. It is the first time Shen Yuan has heard him laugh. It’s creepy. It is not a villainous laugh like the one in the movies, but a dry, sarcastic laugh. When he calms down, Shen Qingqiu looks at him.

“Do you want to hear a story?” Shen Qingqiu continues without waiting for his reply. “When we were disciples, I once went with Liu Qingge and Shang Qinghua to hunt ghosts. Liu Qingge was worse than now, stupidly arrogant. He was so carefree that a ghost tried to attack him from behind. I killed it.” He added bitterly. “And do you know what he did? He accused me of trying to stab him in the back. And Mu Qingfang? For three years he has believed I have suffered a qi deviation that has altered my memories and personality! He didn't realize that he was talking to a different person.” Shen Qingqiu looked delusional, but after rubbing his eyes he regained his usual calm. “So no, I can't trust anyone but myself.”

Shen Yuan has listened to his story with discomfort. Of course, that doesn't show up in PIDW either. Maybe he's lied to him, he's the villain after all, but Shen Yuan has a feeling he's being more sincere than ever.

“Well,” he says, approaching him to help him get up and carry him to bed. “Now you will have to trust me. You don’t have any other choice.”

Chapter End Notes

Liu Qingge has been saved twice already by 'Shen Qingqiu' and he always apologizes to the wrong Shen.

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu discovers that Shen Yuan is a good substitute teacher

Chapter Summary

The teacher (Shen Jiu) is sick, so the substitute teacher (Shen Yuan) arrives 🥰

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Shen Jiu wakes up dazed and with a slight fever. The poison has frozen his limbs. His joints ache when he tries to move as if they are rusted as if he has ice inside his bones. Shen Jiu sighs, exhausted and in pain, yet he still tries to get out of bed.

It is not the first time that he is in such a miserable state. As a wandering child, Shen Jiu knew hunger, cold, and extreme weakness. As a slave, Shen Jiu knew torture. As a disciple, Shen Jiu knew the limits of his own body.

In comparison, this is nothing.

Shen Yuan discovers him when he is trying to get dressed.

“What are you doing!?”

His scream pierces his head. Shen Jiu growls.

“Even if the talismans prevent others from hearing us, that doesn't mean you can scream.” He massages his temples. Even his voice sounds too high-pitched. It seems that the poison has also affected his perception of sound, ideal for being surrounded by lots of rowdy kids that morning.

“You aren’t thinking of going outside as if it is a normal day, are you?”

“Can you stop asking stupid questions for once?”

“You are sick!”

“Poisoned,” he corrects him.

“You are in a horrible state and you will surely end up yelling at him and punishing the children.” Shen Yuan looks terrified. Besides being exaggerating. “Today I will play as Shen Qingqiu.”

Shen Jiu snorts, almost amused by his audacity.

“So, are you going to try to impersonate me again by taking advantage of a moment of weakness?”

He drenches his words with resentment. However, Shen Yuan stares at him without being intimidated.

“Either you go to see Mu Qingfang so he can give you an antidote or you stay here resting while I take care of the children. Choose.”

Throughout his life, Shen Jiu has been beaten, locked up, ignored, wrongly accused... No one has cared about him, not really. Even his Qi-Ge's affection turned out to be fake. The prospect that someone else is trying to help him, even for selfish reasons, affects him more than poison.

“You can trust me,” Shen Yuan insists. “We are now in the same boat.”

“I will never trust you.”

“But you did.” Shen Yuan smiles victoriously. “Last night you trusted me to cover you in front of Mu Qingfang and Liu Qingge.”

In the next few minutes, their gazes meet in silence, arms crossed and the same stubbornness. They are like a mirror. Shen Jiu discovers that the two of them have chilling similarities. Despite his pride, Shen Jiu sighs as he sits on the bed.

“Fine,” he hisses. “Just for today. And erase that smile!”

He is already regretting it when, a while later, Shen Yuan leaves the bamboo house humming. Shen Jiu covers himself with the sheets and closes his eyes to force himself to sleep. At first, it's hard to rest while his thoughts revolve around Shen Yuan, his disciples, and everything that can go wrong. But he is too tired, his entire body aches as his qi fluctuates. Soon heavy darkness covers his head and he falls into a dreamless sleep.

When Shen Jiu wakes up, it is afternoon and someone has opened the door.

He stretches slowly, still dazed after so many hours of unconsciousness. Even when Shen Jiu hears Shen Yuan's cheerful voice, he still doesn't remember what happened.

Shen Yuan enters the bamboo house carrying a lot of scrolls, a smile lingering around the corners of his mouth. It‘s the first time Shen Jiu has seen him so happy and it makes him feel scared. Shen Jiu manages to sit upon the bed, still wrapped in the sheet, and rubs his eyes.

“What have you done?” He interrogates him when he is finally awake. Perhaps the poison has robbed him an entire day, but he doesn’t plan to give up so soon. Despite his dizziness, Shen Jiu leans forward as Shen Yuan sits across from him. “Music? Calligraphy?”

Shen Yuan shocks his head.

“I have taken them for a walk in the bamboo forest.” He explains. As soon as he hears him, Shen Jiu grimaces. “I thought you wouldn't want to be disturbed while trying to rest. So this morning we went for a walk. Then I asked them to write an essay on what has inspired them the most.”

“That’s… unorthodox.” Shen Jiu doesn't know yet if he dislikes that or not.

Shen Yuan keeps talking as he picks up the scrolls and puts them on the table.

“I have brought them to you. I guess you’d want to read them yourself.”

“You assumed well.”

Shen Jiu manages to get up, although he practically crawls down in front of the table. He hates his weakness. At least correcting his students' work will keep him entertained enough to stop feeling useless. After finishing his report, Shen Yuan goes to his room. However, he returns after picking up one of his bestiaries. Although they are sitting apart from each other, it is a different closeness than the previous days. The two ignore each other, concentrating on their readings.

Later, Shen Yuan asks for permission to leave.

“Why that?” Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow, suspicious. Shen Yuan was good that morning, too good even. He has been conscientious in the details and has chosen the option that Shen Jiu would like the most.

It is evident that he is planning something and he is trying to change his mind and then betray him.

However, Shen Yuan points a finger at him.

“You are weak and need to eat. And I’m hungry.”

Shen Jiu huffs, his gaze returning to his disciples' redactions.

“We've already talked about this: with your cultivation level, you don't need to eat as much. Anyway, go.”

Perhaps in recent days, they have shared more meals than Shen Jiu originally planned.

Shen Yuan smiles again, happy to have gotten away with it, before leaving the bamboo house. Of course, he flees fast, eager to escape those walls in which he has been locked for too long. Shen Jiu almost feels remorse. Almost.

Shen Yuan is slow to return. Shen Jiu thinks that he has lingered to savor his freedom, although he suspects that Shen Yuan is also plotting something. Shen Yuan carries a tray with a steaming pot and two bowls.

“No one has seen you, right?” Shen Jiu asks, pointing to the double utensils.

“Of course not!” Shen Yuan places the tray on the table while Shen Jiu collects the essays and puts them away. “We should keep more plates and chopsticks in the house...”

“You have some unusually good ideas today.” He changes his mind when he discovers that it is an unknown soup, with an abominable brown color and a powerful smell of licorice. “What’s that?”

“Licorice soup! I asked the disciples to try to make it, although I think it was their first time cooking something like that...” Shen Yuan's words lose confidence as he spreads the soup into the bowls. “I have read that licorice soup is good for treating an Ankylosing Snake with Eight Barbs poisoning.”

Shen Jiu's hands tremble when he picks up his bowl. Should he read Shen Yuan's bestiary first to make sure what he says is true? Perhaps he is trying to poison him by taking advantage of his weakness and has masked the poison with the smell and taste of licorice. But Shen Yuan is the first to taste the soup. Perhaps it is a specific poison? Or does he want to gain his trust to betray him later?

“Oh!” Shen Yuan's eyes sparkle. “It’s unexpectedly good!”

No, Shen Jiu doesn't believe it. Evidently, Shen Yuan wants to cajole him into trying that suspicious soup. Determined, he gets up and walks towards the bestiary. Shen Yuan has used a leaf to mark the page, so he immediately finds the section dedicated to the Ankylosing Snake with Eight Barbs. To his surprise, there is indeed an entry that talks about the properties of licorice soup.

When he turns around, he discovers that Shen Yuan is nervous. Too nervous. Shen Yuan looks away, but it is too late.

“You are hiding something from me,” Shen Jiu accuses him, his words as cold as threatening. “Don't take me for an idiot, Shen Yuan, it's humiliating.”

“Fine!” Shen Yuan sighs. And Shen Jiu waits with a tense heart and his gaze fixed on Xiu Ya just in case. “I asked Luo Binghe to make the soup.”

“What?”

“Taste it first! Luo Binghe is your best cook, he is the only one who can make delicious licorice soup. And you need to take it.” He pauses. When he speaks again, he does so by lowering his head and slurring his words. “And you might stop disliking him if you taste his food.”

Shen Jiu knew that he was hiding something, but he didn't expect that answer. Instead of feeling victorious, Shen Jiu sits in front of the table still uncomfortable and stiff.

The soup is good.

 

 

Shen Qingqiu is still affected by the poison the next day and Shen Yuan manages to convince him to continue resting. He still can't believe it. Shen Yuan hates with all his will pretending to be Shen Qingqiu, but he has won two days of freedom. Two days to walk under the blue sky and enjoy the bamboo forest. Two days to surround himself with his dear disciples. Two days to continue working to change the future.

Right now, Shen Yuan thinks he's capable of anything.

That morning he takes the children to Qian Cao Peak. After greeting Mu Qingfang and apologizing for his sudden meddling, he asks him for favors. Despite his insecurity, the healer accepts all of his proposals and leads them to one of his orchards. Satisfied, Shen Yuan looks at his disciples, especially Luo Binghe. This lesson is very important, protagonist!

“There is a huge variety of poisonous monsters throughout the world,” he explains. His thoughts hopelessly think of the amount of sex pollen hidden in flowers, snakes, and even rivers. “In the Qing Jing Peak library you have at your disposal the best herbalists and bestiaries of the sect, however, it is useless if you read them without knowing how to identify the plants. With Mu-shidi's permission, today we are going to study medicinal plants. First, I will divide you into groups. Together you will try to identify the name of these plants and their properties.”

He joins Luo Binghe with Ning Yingying (Shen Yuan wants to improve the protagonist's relationship with his most special wife) and Ming Fan (perhaps if they become friends, Ming Fan will not die horribly in the future). Shen Yuan fans himself as he watches his disciples. As he discovered yesterday, teens love creative activities and they immediately start laughing and arguing.

After a while, he meets with Mu Qingfang to talk. It is vitally important to improve his relationship with the sect healer. And maybe Shen Yuan forgets to act unfriendly. He can't help it, the disciples have put him in a very good mood!

Shen Yuan brings the teens back together so that they can answer together. He tries to get everyone to participate and also corrects them patiently so that no one feels bad about failing.

“Now let's play a game,” Shen Yuan hides a smile behind his fan. ”This master will propose hypothetical situations and you will have to answer which of these plants is the best for each case, understood?”

All the teens' nod, eager, and with bright eyes. Luo Binghe is one of the most enthusiastic. That is good because Shen Yuan plans to use his prodigious memory to mention PIDW chapters in which Luo Binghe was in trouble. Especially the arcs related to Endless Abyss.

After a morning of fun learning and many spoilers, Shen Yuan leaves Qiong Ding Peak followed by his disciples like ducklings. Before reaching the Rainbow Bridge, Liu Qingge lands holding a child under each arm. He looks at him and Shen Yuan realizes too late that he is smiling. He can't help it, it's been a wonderful morning.

“Greetings, Liu-shidi,” he says, hiding behind the fan. Shen Yuan is not going to give Liu Qingge any more reasons to continue acting OOC.

Liu Qingge's gaze is fixed on Shen Yuan’s fan.

“I think your disciples are dying.”

Liu Qingge is startled, suddenly remembering that he is holding two children covered in bruises, blood, and grime. Without looking back at Shen Yuan, he quickly walks towards the main house on Qiong Ding Peak. In the distance, someone yells: "Liu Qingge is back!"

Shen Yuan laughs quietly before leading his disciples back to Qing Jing Peak.

As they eat, Shen Yuan explains to Shen Qingqiu what they have done today. Since he's sick, Shen Qingqiu seems less terrifying. Although Shen Yuan knows that this pause will be brief. What a pity , he laments. Shen Yuan is getting used to those days.

Although Shen Qingqiu watches him less suspiciously than yesterday, he still acts like one of those stray cats from his past life. Only instead of scratching him, he can pierce him with a sword.

 

 

By the third day, Shen Jiu is well enough to return to his routine. Although Shen Yuan smiles, his disappointment is evident. For once, he doesn't blame him.

“I have arranged with Mu Qingfang that today we would take the disciples to Qian Cao Peak again.” Shen Yuan explains to him. Although Shen Jiu hates when someone else is trying to intervene in his routine, he agrees because perhaps his thoughts are acceptable. And Shen Jiu is still weak and without the patience to put up with noisy children, so it's not a bad idea to spread his responsibility with someone else. “They did it right yesterday, but most still have trouble putting the theory into practice.”

Shen Jiu nods. Unfortunately, he is aware that most of his disciples have more enthusiasm than skill.

Teens greet him like a bunch of chicks. Shen Jiu sighs before ordering them to walk after him quietly and in an orderly manner. It is inconceivable to him that all his disciples would forget their manners after two days of absence.

Mu Qingfang is waiting for him at the entrance to Qian Cao Peak. His martial brother smiles in a way that shocks Shen Jiu. It is the first time that the healer treats him with such familiarity. Shen Yuan, he thinks. Stop messing with my life.

Mu Qingfang guides them to one of his orchards, hands behind his back, speaking very proudly of his collection of medicinal plants. 

“Yesterday you worked with these,” he points to a small plot. “Your shizun and I think it would be good for you to take care of this garden a bit so that you become familiar with the herbs. We reached an agreement: if you work in the garden satisfactorily, you can make your sachet with medicinal plants.”

Although Shen Jiu has no idea, he nods with his face hidden behind the fan. The children are enthusiastic about the plan and they distribute the tasks quite effectively. Shen Jiu watches over them. Shen Yuan's ideas are strange, but they seem useful.

“Shen-shixiong,” Mu Qingfang says, holding out a hand for Shen Jiu to give his wrist so that he can examine it.

Later, when they return to Qing Jing Peak, Shen Jiu enters the bamboo house like a tornado. Shen Yuan is reading the disciples' essays and looks at him with a mixture of surprise and panic.

“You've tricked me!” Shen Qingqiu hisses. “You sent me to Qian Cao Peak for Mu Qingfang to check me even though I told you that I don't want others to know.”

Shen Yuan has the gall to blink in confusion.

“And that is bad? You need a doctor to confirm that you are cured and the poison will not leave you sequelae.” His voice fades to a whisper as Shen Jiu approaches him with furious steps.

Shen Yuan flinches when Shen Jiu closes his fan tightly.

“As a punishment...”

Chapter End Notes

What do you think Shen Yuan's punishment will be? 👀

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Yuan’s punishment

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Shen Yuan gazes at the disciples, who are waiting expectantly for his shizun's indications. Luo Binghe's eyes are the brightest, followed by Ning Yingying and Ming Fan's.

He didn’t expect Shen Qingqiu's punishment to be taking care of the disciples that afternoon. Shen Yuan is still confused and a part of him thinks it is a trap. That decision is almost a kind gesture. If it were someone else, Shen Yuan would believe that Shen Qingqiu is thanking him. But it's impossible. Shen Qingqiu is probably not well yet and he doesn't feel like babysitting a bunch of screaming teenagers.

Shen Yuan forgets about the scum villain. He's not going to pass up another opportunity like this one. After gathering all the disciples in the library, Shen Yuan pedagogically tells them how to defeat some very particular monsters. Specifically, some of the worst that Luo Binghe will have to face in the Abyss.

His plan is a success. For most teenagers, it is just an interesting lesson, but Shen Yuan knows how to hide many specific clues that Luo Binghe will find very useful. He smiles behind his fan, happy as ever that he manages to outwit the plot of the story.

However, the lesson ends abruptly when they hear a noise outside and something hits the floor, making even the walls rumble. WHAT THE FUCK , he thinks. System, what’s happening? But the System is the worst villain of all and remains silent.

Shen Yuan misses Xiu Ya when he goes to the exit and tells the disciples to stay safe in the library. Luo Binghe decides to ignore his orders by stepping forward.

"Shizun, I want to help you!" He volunteers and Shen Yuan sighs.

The white lotus protagonist is too adorable.

Although it would be interesting to have the protagonist's halo (like in the skinner's mission), Shen Yuan prefers not to risk it. The threat that stalks them outside doesn’t appear in the book and he doesn’t want to put any of his disciples in danger.

Shen Yuan leaves the library. Despite his calm facade, he is shaking. Perhaps he should seek out the real Shen Qingqiu to deal with the threat himself. He has more experience and a damn sword. With increasingly slow steps, Shen Yuan exits.

Outside there is a horrible monster, dark green and covered with spikes.

It’s dead.

Shen Yuan stares at the corpse with wide eyes and a little apprehensive as he recognizes the pasty blood. Even more unusual than a monster on Qing Jing Peak is the pristine silhouette of Liu Qingge, who turns around after delivering his package and rides on his sword.

What happens to him? Liu Qingge stop being so OOC! Shen Yuan is so shocked that he is not even scared at first. Then panic catches him like vines slipping under his skin, wrapping around his bones. Shen Yuan runs to the bamboo house and throws the door open. Shen Qingqiu is standing tense, his gaze piercing him as if he's to blame for all the disasters.

“What happened? I heard a strange noise.”

“Liu Qingge has brought you a monster. A dead monster.”

“He has done WHAT?” Shen Qingqiu opens his eyes, so dumbfounded that he forgets his rigid mannerisms.

Shen Yuan nods. As he begins to calm down, he realizes that Liu Qingge's attitude may not be as OOC as he had originally assumed.

“What if… it's a threat? You are rivals, right?” He muses. Liu Qingge giving them a fan it’s strange, not that he threw down a monster as some kind of silent warning. “Maybe you annoyed him on the last mission?”

Shen Qingqiu snorts.

“It was just a kick! And I saved him and his clumsy disciples!”

Wait! This is how you get poisoned? Shen Yuan blinks, a little confused. He doesn’t expect to discover that hidden side of the villain. Although ... If Shen Qingqiu didn't lie to him, there was another time when he saved Liu Qingge but he was misunderstood. Shen Yuan doesn't know how to feel about that.

“Maybe you shouldn't have kicked him,” he gently scolds him. After all, it was in his plans to rely on the strength of the War God if in the future they had to face a blackened Luo Binghe. “Although Liu Qingge is being a bit ungrateful, honestly.”

Something similar to a smile appears on Shen Qingqiu's face.

“That’s right! He has always been like this,” he hisses, but his attitude is more satisfied than angry. “Even as disciples. He has never had manners and he comes from an illustrious family. I don't know what they taught him, but education certainly did not.” Shen Qingqiu rolls his eyes. “He insisted on always chasing me to challenge me to a duel. He once even entered the library and almost smashed a very delicate book with that sword of his.” Realizing that he had been carried away by the weight of memories, Shen Qingqiu cleared his throat. “What kind of monster has he brought? And please give me a detailed explanation.”

“A Smelly Swamp Lord.”

Shen Qingqiu looks at him with surprise before starting to fan himself.

“Well, It seems that you don’t read all those bestiaries in vain.” Shen Qingqiu rests the tip of the fan on his lips. “In Liu Qingge’s language it surely means that he is the best hunter, but a Smelly Swamp Lord is a very rare and valued monster. Although it’s stinky, its meat can help strengthen the cultivation.”

Shen Yuan's smile escapes as he shakes his head.

“Poor Liu-shidi, he has given us a gift by mistake.”

“Hmmnn, I will tell the disciples to cook it.” Shen Qingqiu heads for the door, marking the end of Shen Yuan's brief punishment . “We will take the remaining parts to Qian Cao Peak, sure that Mu Qingfang finds its usefulness.”

“Oh! Smelly Swamp Lord's liver is used to decontaminate water and his tongue is very useful for some pills and...”
