Shen Yuan mutes when Shen Qingqiu gives him a curious look. With his face hidden behind the fan, it is impossible to tell if he is smiling or grunting.

“You are not as useless as you seemed.” He mutters to himself before leaving.

 

 

During the process of dismembering Smelly Swamp Lord's body and cleaning the garden, Shen Jiu may have made a mistake. The monster that Liu Qingge has brought is immense and although he is not a kind or altruistic person, he decides to share the corpse in a banquet for all of his disciples and Shen Yuan as well. Luo Binghe is his best cook and Shen Jiu decides to entrust him with the main part of cooking the food. And that’s perhaps a mistake. Luo Binghe looks at him with an illusion comparable to all the stars in the world locked in his eyes. It’s awkward. And unpleasant.

Shen Jiu still doesn't like that boy and doesn't know what to do with him. Shen Yuan is convincing him to stop punishing him and Luo Binghe hasn't made any mistakes lately either, yet he still wants to keep as many distances as possible. And make a decision, now that he knows that Luo Binghe's fate is glorious.

Should he defy destiny? Or steal Luo Binghe’s future fame like he did during the demonic invasion? Shen Jiu has always hated being in the shadow of others. He has built his path to the top with sweat, blood, and tears.

While he decides... he is going to enjoy an unusually delicious feast, which mixes the exotic meat of a monster that cleanses his meridians and strengthens them with a garnish that melts on his palate. There is silence in the bamboo house. Shen Yuan and Shen Jiu savor their food. When Shen Yuan begins to praise Luo Binghe's culinary prowess, spiced up with gibberish that Shen Jiu cannot understand, he nods.

His second mistake is to comment to Luo Binghe that his cooking was above decent. Shen Jiu doesn’t know how to give or receive compliments. That is why he didn’t expect Luo Binghe to smile as if he had been told that his abilities are excellent (and they are, but he is not going to acknowledge that yet).

Since that day, Luo Binghe has taken care of all his meals. His enthusiasm is so exaggerated as when he trains, and he prepares enough rations even for the two of them and more. He could invite half the lords of the peaks! Shen Jiu complains about him for wasting food, but Shen Yuan laughs behind his back.

Two days after the incident with the monster, Shen Jiu meets Liu Qingge. Instead of ignoring him as normal, the War God approaches with determined steps and a defiant look. There is no doubt, Shen Yuan is right: he's back to being his usual self. Shen Jiu sighs. He just wants peace, no complications with stubborn cultivators who only think about fighting. Although sometimes it is fun to miserably defeat him or leave him speechless.

“Did you like the monster?” He splutters.

This idiot, he doesn't even know his name! He sure doesn’t know his properties either. Shen Jiu fans himself while he hides a mischievous smile. Why lie to him when the truth is an even worse weapon?

“Yes, very much. Thanks, shidi.”

Liu Qingge flashes a relieved smile and Shen Jiu's eyes widen.

“I'm glad,” he says before turning his back on him and leaving, as lost in his world of battles and bloody claws as ever. Shen Jiu, despite his intentions, is the one who remains muted and perplexed.

“You don't even think of bringing any more!” He yells at him. “Or I'll make you clean my entire peak!”

Shen Jiu walks away growling through his teeth. At least this time he has Shen Yuan to complain about his strange behavior.

Chapter End Notes

Status of their misunderstandings:

SHEN JIU: I cannot trust Shen Yuan and Liu Qingge hates me. The normal.
SHEN YUAN: The scum villain is EVIL (even though he's making me rethink things) and Liu Qingge is our rival. I have it complicated to change the future.
LIU QINGGE: Shen Qingqiu is just a very picky (1) person who keeps saving me.
LUO BINGHE: Shizun likes my food so much that he eats for two people :D

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Yuan’s strange opinions

Chapter Summary

Shen Yuan discovers all the Peak Lords are bad with children.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Shen Jiu watches how Shen Yuan reads the disciples' redactions as comments and exclamations escape him. His opinion is irrelevant, but Shen Jiu hasn’t found any problem allowing him to read them. When he finishes with the last one, Shen Yuan is smiling.

“Ning Yingying has a lot of imagination! Her redaction is one of my favorites.”

Shen Jiu clicks his tongue in obvious disgust since he is disappointed with his favorite disciple.

“The text is decent, but her calligraphy can be improved.”

“Perhaps, but her writing is original and uses words very well. It contrasts with Ming Fan's: exquisite calligraphy, but his sentences are empty.”

Shen Jiu frowns, since he considers Ming Fan's redaction the best, as expected from his head disciple. He grabs his cup of tea.

“Sometimes I suspect that you forget that this is the peak of the four arts and strategy. I don't want mediocre disciples.”

“I’m not saying that!” Shen Yuan protests heatedly, waving his arms in exaggerated gestures. “Knowing how to write is as important as beautiful handwriting. I know what I'm talking about, in my other life I was a very renowned literary critic.”

“Oh.” Shen Jiu looks at him curiously. Shen Yuan doesn't usually talk about who he was before a strange force dragged him into his body. "What does that mean?"

“I read books, mainly fiction, and commented on my observations. I have a talent for recognizing bad stories and pointing out all their mistakes.” He clears his throat, a slight blush on his cheeks, and Shen Jiu knows that he won't say more. “That is why I consider what you write is as important as how you write it.”

He is right, but Shen Jiu won't recognize him out loud. So he continues to drink his bamboo tea while Shen Yuan flips through the redactions again. For a few seconds, neither says anything. Then the tranquility becomes that silence that precedes when Shen Yuan wants to speak but hesitates to choose his words.

Shen Jiu snorts and hits the table with the teacup.

“If you want to say something, just do it.”

“Well...” Shen Yuan drums his fingers on the papers, his gaze nervously searching Shen Jiu. “I don't know what you had planned, but what do you think if we propose personalized activities to the disciples?”

“Explain.”

“Those who have done good writing like Ning Yingying but need to improve their calligraphy can repeat the writing. Those who like Ming Fan have good calligraphy, but their writing is weak, they should write something new. And those who are like Luo Binghe..." He sighs, visibly disappointed. Because Luo Binghe's talent and enthusiasm are not reflected in the arts. "Let them try to improve his latest writing.”

Shen Jiu puts a hand on his chin as he evaluates his idea. He doesn't dislike it. And that's a new feeling that he doesn't know how to handle. Shen Jiu is terrified to start giving Shen Yuan shreds of his life, irretrievable little pieces.

“I will value it.” His answer is dry, somewhat scathing, but Shen Yuan smiles with unseemly happiness on his face. It's strange and uncomfortable, and Shen Jiu gulps as he wonders if he would be able to learn how to smile again or if he has lost that talent forever.

Then, the calm is broken with a scandal of childish screams. Shen Jiu sighs as he recognizes the clear signs of Bai Zhan Peak's vandals coming to annoy his disciples. He rubs his forehead, giddy with a sudden headache.

“Your turn,” he hisses.

Shen Yuan blinks as confused as surprised.

“What turn?”

“Your turn to stop the children from making noise.”

Shen Yuan mutters something like "Unbelievable" while getting up. His steps are accelerated and disappear quickly when he reaches the door and leaves. Calm soon returns and Shen Jiu closes his eyes in satisfaction before pouring himself more tea. In exchange for regaining tranquility, Shen Yuan returns bringing chaos with him in the form of complaints and curses.

“What’s wrong with Bai Zhan children? It's the third time we've been harassed this week!”

“It is a tradition of Bai Zhan Peak to disturb Qing Jing Peak,” he explains, downing half the teacup in one gulp. “It was worse when I was a disciple, believe me. Those fools wouldn't leave me alone, they even ambushed me several times. Liu Qingge once got angry because I broke the arm of one of his siblings, unaware that it was his shidi who tried to treacherously attack me on the Rainbow Bridge.”

Shen Yuan widens his eyes, offended and annoyed. Although it‘s not the first time that Shen Jiu has revealed a piece of his shameful past (and he still doesn’t understand why he does it), this time he perceives that Shen Yuan believes in him without reservation or second thoughts. He believes him. Someone believes him. It's a new sensation that makes him shudder.

He doesn't know if he likes it or not.

“That’s horrible! Is there no law here that prohibits bullying ?” Sometimes, he uses unfamiliar words that Shen Jiu doesn't recognize. “It's the same with Binghe a few years ago! Why are cultivators like this?” Shen Jiu squints as he realizes that Shen Yuan wasn’t a cultivator in the past, although he possesses a profound knowledge unrelated to an ordinary person. “Has no one tried to do anything to change it?”

Shen Jiu drinks again.

“The world is cruel. It breaks you. And you can only rebuild yourself from sharp pieces or die.”

“That’s inhuman!”

“No, it’s reality. Either you have the talent or you hang your head.”

Shen Yuan purses his lips in a line. When he gets angry his resemblance to Shen Jiu is almost perfect.

“Or you become powerful enough to change the world,” he declares with the naivety typical of those who have never suffered.

Shen Jiu sighs as he shakes his head.

“That will never happen. Power corrupts. You forget all your good wishes after climbing a mountain alone, shattering your bones, painting the road with blood. When you finally reach the top, you have lost all hope for a better world.”

A spark of sadness glows in Shen Yuan's eyes, but his optimism doesn’t disappear. Shen Jiu still barely knows him, but he already understands that he is a headstrong and stubborn person. And with a way of thinking very different from the rest of the people he meets.

“The world would always remain the same if that were true," he declares with confidence that leaves Shen Jiu speechless. "Why not start with small steps? Let's talk to Liu Qingge so that his disciples will stop bothering ours." A bright smile flashes on his face. “Perhaps we can end that stupid tradition.”

“I refuse.”

Shen Jiu finishes his teacup at Shen Yuan's disappointed look.

“Why!?”

“I don't want to waste my time with him.” Shen Jiu raises his head and a crooked smirk appears on his lips. "Do you want to try? I won't stop you. But it will be useless."

“Pffff, I'm going right now!”

“Really?“ Shen Jiu almost laughs. That's strange, he doesn't remember when was the last time he felt the heat of a laugh in his throat.

“Yeah. I don't care if we are theoretically rivals. Our fight must not affect the disciples.”

Shen Jiu considers this to be a futile effort, but he doesn’t stop him, even encourages him with the fan to go to the door. And Shen Yuan does.

“If you succeed, I will let you be Shen Qingqiu for a week.”

Shen Yuan stops.

“Are you serious?”

“I’m always serious. Good luck,” and he adds wickedly. “You are going to need it.”

 

 

Shen Yuan walks with furious steps towards Bai Zhan Peak. The conversation he has had with the scum villain has left a bitter aftertaste in his throat, a certain uneasiness in his chest. At first, that made him think of Luo Binghe's fate. Then in Shen Qingqiu’s. With a teacher with such a mindset, it's no surprise that Luo Binghe will be darkened. But he wants to try, even if it's a lost cause. Because changing that cruel little tradition will mean that he has the power to create a better place. A world in which Luo Binghe remains naive and happy, in which he doesn’t fear for his life and Shen Qingqiu…

His thoughts freeze.

Shen Yuan has begun to doubt his opinion on the scum villain.

He finds Liu Qingge teaching at Bai Zhan Peak. In other words, beating up all the children who end up landing on the ground after a swift flight. Shen Yuan sighs, rolling his eyes, before approaching him. His presence doesn’t go unnoticed. The green of his robe stands out against the sand and his footsteps echo, confident and determined, even though his heart is pounding. All the disciples stop fighting to watch him suspiciously. Liu Qingge turns and raises an eyebrow in recognition.

“Liu-shidi,” he greets him. “Can I exchange a few words with you?”

He nods, as eloquent as ever. His gaze is fixed on Shen Yuan, who raises his fan a little more to hide his face.

“I really appreciate you. You are a brave and loyal warrior, but I cannot understand why you allow your disciples to harass and treacherously attack mine.” Liu Qingge frowns, but that only encourages Shen Yuan to continue speaking. “It's hard to focus on Qing Jing Peak with so much fuss and I'm tired of sending mines with Mu Qingfang. Is this what you consider a fair fight?”

Shen Yuan has a powerful motivation (to be free for a week) and his determination doesn’t waver despite being in enemy territory. He has rehearsed in his head what he will say and, in case of Liu Qingge acts like a rival blinded by hatred, he will blackmail him with the fact that he saved his life.

To his surprise, Liu Qingge crosses his arms and faces his disciples. Although his expression has barely changed, Shen Yuan can recognize a hint of disappointment.

“It’s that true?” He demands, his voice clear and loud.

“Wait, you didn’t know anything?” Shen Yuan closes his fan without hiding his surprise.

The disciples exchange terrified glances and some begin to babble excuses that only darken Liu Qingge's expression. Shen Yuan doesn't need any more information to know how it's going to end, or why Liu Qingge turns to him.

“Sorry,” he says. “I wasn’t aware. Now I’ll take care of it.”

“Wait, Liu-shidi! Beating them to death will solve nothing!”

And he is against child abuse.

Liu Qingge looks at him curiously. Expectant. Although Shen Yuan had imagined many scenarios in his head on the way to Bai Zhan Peak, he never believed that the stubborn War God would actually be listening to him. Waiting for his opinion. Faint blush on his cheeks while he begins to fan himself. Why are all the Peak Lords a mess handling kids? Have they passed any exam to be teachers?

“Punishing them won't do any good if they don't understand why it's wrong. Or, at least, if his punishment is something honorific. Send them to copy a thousand times and they won't repeat it. I hope so,” he adds, a little desperate. “I just want to avoid any more fights. They are martial brothers, I don't understand why they detest each other so much.”

“I understand your point of view.” Liu Qingge nods. “I will think of a punishment with which they learn their lesson. Forever.” 

He sounds even more threatening than when he brought a monster to Qing Jing Peak. Shen Yuan walks away as the disciples' shriek and whimper and beg for forgiveness.

“Shizun, please!” They cry. “Hit us a thousand times, but don't make us copy a thousand times!”

 

 

Shen Jiu decides to give Bai Zhan Peak a month to confirm Shen Yuan's success. His feelings are contradictory, as his pride would hate that he wins, but a small part of him wishes for that victory against Bai Zhan Peak.

He is explaining to the disciples the next part of the writing activities after dividing them into three groups (who must improve their calligraphy, writing, or everything) when Liu Qingge lands. His presence at Qing Jing Peak has become anecdotal, and Shen Jiu sighs before shooting him a glacial look behind the fan.

“What is the pleasure, shidi?” He asks him in a scathing tone, without a hint of sympathy. Liu Qingge acts nonchalant.

“I have spoken with Zhangmen-shixiong. We are going on a night hunt.”

“What are you talking about?” He loses control over his perfect appearance in the face of the unexpected news.

“You, me, and our child...” A little flush appears in his ears. “Disciples.”

“Can you please explain what you mean?”

Liu Qingge has the nerve to look at him strangely as if it is Shen Jiu who is acting odd.

“You told me that our disciples fight. And that punishment wouldn’t be enough if they fight again. Let them train together.”

“Let me understand,” he massages his temples. “Do you want the two of us to go hunting with your little barbarians and…?” He stops to find that all of his disciples are staring at them with bright eyes and a hint of insecurity mixed with interest.

“A few days. The best way for them to stop fighting is if they learn how to work together.”

Shen Jiu clenches his teeth, refusing to acknowledge that Liu Qingge's idea is not horrible, just naive. People never change. But if Yue Qingyuan has accepted, he cannot refuse now. He also doesn’t dare to face him knowing that he has failed him again.

“We can test it, but it won't work.” He sighs. He could send Shen Yuan in his place, he doesn't feel like spending so much time with his former nemesis and a bunch of stupid kids, but it's too risky. “I hope we go to a very inhospitable place where I can bury your body and no one finds it.”

For some inexplicable reason, Liu Qingge smiles, and something inside Shen Qingqiu trembles.

Chapter End Notes

Liu Qingge has chosen the worst Shen Qingqiu for a fun trip with rambunctious children. Chaos is guaranteed! ヘ(^_^)ヘ

This time, the title refers to Shen Yuan having a different way of thinking (I was hesitating between "opinions", "ideas" or "thoughts") since he comes from another world and time. I'm not a chinese boy, sorry if I don't reflect Shen Yuan correctly!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter
✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu and Liu Qingge go on a excursion with a bunch of teenagers

Chapter Notes

This has been a crazy week and I haven't been able to write until today 😭 Hope you like it!

 

(It's actually because I've become obsessed with My Disciples Evil Sword Is An Angry Virgin And Is Demanding Papapa To Save The World and I have devoured 200k words in four days. Or less.)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The teenagers are yelling nonsense, Liu Qingge is staring at him, and Shen Jiu wants to kill someone. And they still haven't left the sect.

He doesn't think he will survive the excursion.

Shen Jiu wonders for the umpteenth time why he agreed to Liu Qingge's damn excursion. Right now, any plan, even discussing with Shen Yuan about learning methods would be more exciting. He sighs, reluctantly accepting his fate, and steps forward to demand silence from them. Shen Jiu doesn't expect the Bai Zhan Peak brats to listen to him (and they don't), but from his own, he expects a lot more decency and politeness.

Liu Qingge appears with his characteristic arrogant elegance. His firm footsteps make his disciples finally shut up. The admiration they have for a teacher who is usually absent is inexplicable. Liu Qingge walks among the horses to stand beside Shen Qingqiu. Like him, he greets him with a grunt before crossing his arms and observing the group they have both organized.

“Is everything ready?”

“Mn.” Shen Jiu plays with his fan as he checks one last time that all of his disciples are carrying their luggage and that there are enough mounts.

“We should go.”

Shen Jiu nods. Seeing that Liu Qingge plans to turn his back to head towards the horses, Shen Jiu stops him by leaning the tip of his fan against his chest.

“You come with me,” he orders with his most uncompromising voice, hiding his deep disgust at the prospect of locking himself in a carriage alone with him. His patience is ridiculously paltry, even worse than his usual humor, and he suspects that if Liu Qingge protests they will end up fighting. However, he frowns at him not with disdain, but uncertainty.

“With you? Why?” His question is ridiculous, but something inside Shen Jiu (something small and nameless) appreciates that he questions rather than acting impulsively. “I prefer to ride a horse. You should ride next to me.”

The truth is, Shen Jiu doesn't like to ride a horse.

“We must discuss what we will do,” he explains. Shen Jiu hides the poison of his voice for once. Liu Qingge deserves the gift of his cold courtesy as thanks for his patience. “We haven't talked about the trip. Neither what we will do nor what are our objectives. Let's talk inside the carriage.”

Liu Qingge surprises him again by silently nodding. Shen Jiu doesn't know how to feel when his wayward rival follows him without protest or complaint, but calmly accepting a logical argument. Shen Jiu senses something warm inside his chest again as he wonders what their relationship would have been if Liu Qingge had acted this reasonably from the first time they met.

They walk to the carriage while giving the last orders, under the watchful eye of their disciples. There are too many according to Shen Jiu. Neither of them had considered the other's disciples when they organized their respective groups. Shen Jiu only planned to bring his most troubled disciples like Luo Binghe or Ming Fan, but Shen Yuan had recommended that he should also take some of the more patient ones such as Ning Yingying to bring balance and common sense.

They will easily have to keep an eye on thirty excited teenagers among whom sparks of friction fly at the slightest touch. All it needs is a glance, a nudge, for both groups to threaten to cut the other's throats. And half still don’t have spiritual weapons.

“We should talk carefully about what we are going to do,” Shen Jiu begins when both of them are already seated in the carriage. Although there is enough space, he feels very cramped and claustrophobic. Shen Jiu doesn't remember the last time he was alone in such a small place with Liu Qingge. “I had thought that we could pair them up or organize mixed groups to jointly set up camp. Rather than throwing them into a fight, it may be more effective for them to work together cooking or doing the watch.”

Actually, this is another suggestion from Shen Yuan. Shen Jiu rests the tip of his fan on his lips. Shen Yuan's ideas are beginning to interest him. Although his mentality is very different from his, his way of thinking makes sense and turns out to be effective. Well, now they are both Shen Qingqiu, so there is nothing wrong with using his ideas as if they belong to him. Shen Jiu is very good at defending his thoughts.

His rhetoric is useless today since Liu Qingge agrees to almost all of his proposals and only makes a couple of remarks to which he is not entirely satisfied. To Shen Qingqiu's surprise, all of his comments are direct and overflow with simple but effective logic. Since the incident at the Lingxi Caves, Liu Qingge has become oddly pleasant. He is still just as sullen and unaware as ever, but he doesn't argue with him as much anymore. And he listens to what he says. Shen Jiu considers whether Shen Yuan instead of saving his life has replaced him with another stranger.

Suddenly, he feels uncertain if he is the real Liu Qingge or a stranger with the same face.

Just in case, Shen Jiu will keep an eye on him very closely. And then he will ask Shen Yuan.

Despite his pessimistic expectations, the journey is unexpectedly smooth. He and Liu Qingge talk a lot, first about his disciples, then about sect matters. The silence is brief and not uncomfortable as on other occasions. When Shen Jiu starts to get bored, he talks to him about beasts and Liu Qingge discusses some details with genuine interest. It is too nice and Shen Jiu knows that like all happy things that moment is doomed to break, so he decides to enjoy it. This is perhaps the first time that he has felt almost relaxed since his life was splitting with the arrival of Shen Yuan.

Their destination is a forest near the sect. The two organize the disciples to set up camp together. Neither of them tolerates the complaints and Liu Qingge indistinctly growls at all the teens who are protesting about the distribution of chores.

Shen Jiu's secret weapon is to leave Luo Binghe in charge of the food. Despite his rotten feelings for the boy, Shen Jiu fans himself as he watches the barbarians of Bai Zhan Peak react to that delicious smell that conquers the entire camp. As he had imagined, all the children soften their attitude a bit when they can finally taste their food. That plan belonged to him, the next step is Shen Yuan's idea: encourage his disciples to play the instruments to create a relaxed and pleasant atmosphere. Ning Yingying begins with a popular piece and some guys from Bai Zhan Peak accompany it with shy claps.

Shen Jiu hums with his lips brushing the fan. The hunt started unexpectedly... fine. The most curious thing is that he feels Shen Yuan's presence, even though he has stayed behind. However, his double accompany them in all those ideas that come true. Shen Jiu looks up at the sky as he wonders what Shen Yuan is doing now. Most of his thoughts are of insecurity, as he still suspects a possible betrayal, but he also has a little concern about leaving him locked up in the bamboo house for so long. At least he has left him enough bestiaries before he leaves. That will be enough, right?

Shen Jiu shakes his head. Since when is he so weak to feel compassion for someone who intended to impersonate him? Annoyed with himself, he picks up two plates and walks among the disciples, ignoring their chatter.

He finds Liu Qingge with his back against a pine tree and staring at distant peaks, surely assessing what kind of monsters he will encounter. Shen Qingqiu wouldn't be surprised if he left them to go hunting alone.

“For you,” he says as he hands him one of the dishes. Liu Qingge looks at him curiously. “You should eat something or they will eat you.”

“That's not gonna happen.” Still, Liu Qingge accepts the plate and sits on the ground.

Shen Jiu has no reason to sit next to him instead of leaving, but he does. Liu Qingge has chosen a place far from the noise of the teenagers, sheltered from the wind. The views are also beautiful: there is an orange sunset that softens Shen Jiu's heart a bit.

“Mn? That's... good,” Liu Qingge mutters. He tastes so slowly that Shen Jiu almost laughs. It's funny that this barbarian who only thinks about hunting and slaughtering monsters sometimes shows some excellent manners. “You weren't lying: your disciple's abilities are amazing.”

“I never lie,” Shen Jiu lies with a smirk.

They are so close that he can appreciate how Liu Qingge frowns as he values his words and decides whether or not to trust him. Shen Jiu turns away and looks at his food.

“You're acting weird lately, shidi,” he growls, unable to understand him.

Liu Qingge shrugs.

“You started.”

Because sometimes I'm someone else, it's normal! Although Shen Yuan tries, he will never be able to impersonate me perfectly. Which is your excuse?

Of course, Shen Jiu doesn't say anything and the two of them have dinner in silence.

As he had feared, that pleasant moment of peace is ripped apart by a chorus of high-pitched, unpleasant howls. The two of them stand up at the same time, their swords already drawn and illuminated in their hands. Shen Jiu snorts while he recognizes the silhouette of three Ancient Stone Bats in the sky. Although their flight is erratic, the scandal of the brats and the lights of the camp has attracted their attention.

“A good opponent,” Liu Qingge comments, bowing his head approvingly.

“Don't you ever dare! Those beasts are above the level of our disciples.”

Shen Jiu nearly hit him with the fan on the head, but Liu Qingge was acting reasonably for the first time in his life and nodded, still glaring at the Ancient Stone Bats.

“I'll take care of it, protect the kids.”

Shen Jiu purses his lips. The need to contradict him is an almost primitive instinct, as basic as breathing, but if Liu Qingge has been able to give up before, he will do even better. Shen Jiu hits him in agreement and his fingers rest for a few seconds on his shoulder.

“Its weak point is in the back, right where its wings are born.”

Liu Qingge nods with a grunt and after that tactical arrangement, Shen Jiu turns his back on him and runs to join the youngsters. The screeches of the monsters have not gone unnoticed and the disciples have gathered in the defensive positions of Bai Zhan Peak and Qing Jing Peak. They have separated again, but it's better this way: their fighting techniques are too different to combine without previous experience.

“Liu-shidi will take care of the monsters, you stay here with me.” Of course, Shen Qingqiu does not plan to miss this opportunity to resume his lessons. It's time for the Bai Zhan Peak brats to appreciate the role of Qing Jing Peak. “Can anyone tell me its name?”

“Ancient Stone Bats!” Luo Binghe answers, as excited as ever. His eyes shine like the embers of the bonfire in which minutes before he was cooking.

“Correct. Another one,” Shen Jiu is uncomfortable with Luo Binghe's enthusiasm. And since Shen Yuan has participated in some lessons, the brat's interest has grown suspiciously. “Can you describe the best way to kill them?”

Ming Fan doesn’t disappoint him, although Shen Jiu notes that his descriptions are bloody and gory as if he wants to impress the brats of Bai Zhan Peak with his knowledge... or explain in great detail its triple rows of teeth and the sharp claws with which they split the bones of their victims to absorb the marrow.

Shen Jiu doesn't reproach him for anything. It's funny how some of the barbarian kids have turned pale, though others seem even more excited.

A pale flash streaks across the sky as Liu Qingge begins to hunt them down.

“Any more details?” He asks, looking at all of his disciples and those of Bai Zhan Peak. This time around, not even Luo Binghe answers. And that seems to frustrate him, which makes Shen Jiu smile wickedly. "Nobody? There is a fundamental detail that nobody has mentioned yet." As he suspected, none have studied that much. Maybe when they come back he'll give them a monster test. And Shen Yuan may take care of it while he relaxes in the bamboo house. "Ancient Stone Bats always hunt in packs of even numbers."

“But shizun...” Luo Binghe mutters uncertain. “I only see three facing Liu-shishu.”

Shen Jiu tenses as he remembered that he also had only seen three in the sky. After muttering a curse under his breath, he raises his sword and watches around him. It is unusual for Ancient Stone Bats to travel in odd numbers. There are documented cases where they have gone so far as to kill the weakest member of the pack to equal numbers.

No howl is heard. The forest remains restless, the silence broken by the excited breaths of the disciples. Shen Jiu squints his eyes as he watches the shadows.

There is a howl and a gray monster emerges from the treetops, its bark is hard and its wings are ripping through the air. Some disciples shriek while others (essentially Luo Binghe and the ones from Bai Zhan Peak) come forward to protect their martial brothers. Shen Jiu curses all of them.

“Don't act recklessly!” He growls at them through his teeth as he gets between them and the Ancient Stone Bat. A turn of the wing manages to scratch his leg, but Shen Jiu aims his qi at the monster's eyes and destabilizes it. Its skin is too thick to break through and he can't risk leaving the children unprotected while he searches for his weak point, so he keeps it distracted with Xiu Ya. 

The disciples whistle and clap and cheer him on as Shen Jiu taunts the monster. Luo Binghe's spirits are the proudest, the loudest, and something inside Shen Jiu squirms. It doesn´t have any sense. He hates the child and is sure that the child hated him when he punished him. What has Shen Yuan done?

Perhaps Shen Yuan is a kind of cunning demon who softens the personality of those around him and that is why even Liu Qingge acts nice to him.

Shen Jiu is not distracted despite his cabal. When Liu Qingge appears and with one accurate strike neutralizes the Ancient Stone Bat, Shen Jiu doesn't even blink. He sheathes Xiu Ya elegantly. Seeing Liu Qingge disheveled and sweaty, his face flushed and his clothes stained with blood fills him with wicked satisfaction. Except for the leg cut, he has kept his pristine appearance.

“Everyone is fine?” He asks, sheathing Cheng Luan.

Shen Jiu nods. The commotion of the disciples it’s so loud that even if he answers, he couldn’t hear him. There are many shouts of enthusiasm, yet Liu Qingge ignores them. He frowned upon noticing Shen Jiu's bloody leg.

“You are hurt.”

“Hm? It’s nothing. I have some medicinal herbs in the carriage.”

“I'll bring them, shizun!” Luo Binghe exclaims before he even gives the order.

Well, maybe it's not a bad thing that the little beast has become so tame.

Shen Jiu stiffens when Liu Qingge approaches him. There is something strange in his gaze, a concern almost similar to Shen Yuan's when he discovered that he was poisoned. Shen Jiu opens the fan and outlines his best expression of disdain.

“As I said, It’s no… LIU QINGGE!!!!”

He yells when Liu Qingge picks him up into his arms, ignoring his blows and kicks.

“Stop moving,” he growls. “You're going to hurt yourself even more.”

Of course, Shen Jiu continues to try to break free. They are in front of their disciples! Why does he never think? It's just a bulky scratch! As he keeps trying to hit him, Liu Qingge holds him even tighter, pushing him against his chest and Shen Jiu's head just leans against his shoulder. And suddenly Shen Jiu is aware of how hot his skin is and that his breathing is still accelerated after the fight. When he opens his mouth to protest, Shen Jiu discovers that his throat is dry.

He should be angry, but what is roaring in his chest is just confusion.

Chapter End Notes

Did I tell you that I love PIDW worldbuilding because you can give all kind of ridiculous names? This time, the monster is inspired by a pterodactyl. It doesn't have any particular reason, it's just that I imagined a pterodactyl flying.

Another stupid fact: I thought about Liu Qingge carrying Shen Jiu in chapter 5, but I thought it was too hasty. So it was time to think of another scene hehehehehehehhe. Next time will it be with Shen Yuan? Or will Liu Qingge take the hits? What would you like the most? 👀 (I'm not going to lie to you, I want to write both scenes)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu is hurt (Don’t worry! It’s not the first time!)

Chapter Summary

Little Binging wants to grow up and join the love triangle. Not yet, Little Bingbing.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Luo Binghe is a loyal and well-trained disciple. His fearlessness even encourages him to stop the Bai Zhan Peak Lord when Liu Qingge lands on Qing Jing Peak intending to go to the bamboo house.

“Shizun doesn't want to be disturbed!” 

Luo Binghe is still small, although his muscles are already beginning to mark and in recent months he has gained several centimeters. Compared to Liu Qingge he is still a little sheep, even so, he is not afraid of him. Liu Qingge frowns, unaccustomed to such a lack of respect.

“Leave. I've come to see how your shizun's wounds are.”

“Shizun doesn’t wish to be disturbed by anyone, not even the other Peak Lords.” Luo Binghe smirks maliciously. “I can announce your presence, Liu-shishu, but you will have to wait here.”

Liu Qingge is visibly upset. He crosses his arms but makes no move to continue walking. Luo Binghe considers that this is righteous revenge after the liberties he took by carrying his shizun in his arms. Before turning around, he took one last look at his martial uncle. Luo Binghe dreams of growing up and being like Liu Qingge, powerful enough to protect shizun, strong enough to care for shizun. In his fantasies, Luo Binghe is even taller, more muscular, more skilled, and handsome.

Luo Binghe doesn't tell him that the disciples can't go to the bamboo house either.

Nor is it necessary: the two of them have spoken so loudly that the door opens and Shen Qingqiu himself comes out of the house. He looks as stylish as ever. His hair is perfectly adorned with green ribbons and a crown, his robes are the color of the bamboo and enhance his graceful and divine figure. While Liu Qingge acts like a legendary warrior, Shen Qingqiu looks like a true immortal, too ethereal to be bothered by the mortal world.

“You two again?” He sighs, raising his fan to hide his expression. Even so, Luo Binghe knows that he is smiling. “It was just a scratch and it's been two days. This master is fine.”

In fact, Shen Qingqiu is very fine, thinks Shen Yuan, who has just suffered the authentic Shen Qingqiu combing his hair until there was not a single hair out of place. He's just taking a vacation.

Shen Yuan considers the authentic Shen Qingqiu to be a bit dramatic.

Luo Binghe is still concerned about his shizun and he promises that he will cook him a delicious meal today.

Liu Qingge doesn’t understand why he has the urge to visit Shen Qingqiu every day.

 

 

Two nights before.

At the beginning of the trip, Shen Jiu wished to kill someone. Well, that feeling hasn't gone away and he already has a couple of names in mind. First, Liu Qingge, who has carried him to the carriage and insisted on taking care of his wound (Shen Jiu is not even the one who saved his life, why is he treating him like this?). Second, Luo Binghe, who seems about to cry in case his shizun dies (Really? It's just a scratch!) and insists on taking care of his wound as well.

“Leave! This is nothing! I can heal myself!”

They ignore his complaints.

“Shizun, we have these pills that Mu-shishu has prepared. You should take them all.”

“Shen Qingqiu, stop moving so I can examine your wound.”

“I also have the sachet we made with the plants from Mu-shishu's garden!”

“Tsk. It's shallow, but you've bled a lot. Don't move your leg.”

“Liu-shishu! What are you doing? Don't disgrace shizun!”

“What are you saying, brat? Leave.”

“But shizun...”

Shen Jiu is livid, using all his willpower to not behead them both. The two of them are talking non-stop and their discussion is giving him a headache. The fact that they treat him as if he is fragile is more humiliating than showing a leg to clean the wound. All his good thoughts were gone: Luo Binghe is a disobedient brat and Liu Qingge is still as stubborn as ever. Neither listens to him and Shen Jiu begins to stress. So much attention overwhelms him. It is too much and that makes him feel furious.

As if that weren't enough, upon returning to Cang Qiong Sect they have caused such a scandal that Yue Qingyuan appears very concerned to ask about his condition.

Shen Jiu returns to the bamboo house slamming the door, annoyed with everyone and not wanting to see anyone else. Never.

“You,” he hisses when Shen Yuan leaves his room. Shen Yua is smart enough to erase his smile and the possible question he was going to ask him. “You have won the bet. Take your week.”

Shen Yuan looks at him for a few seconds. His gaze is fixed on the bloodstained clothing, perhaps on his expression as well.

“Are you… okay? Do you want to talk?”

Shen Jiu wants silence. And rest. And a bath. And a week off in which no one overwhelms him with false concern about him. He wants to forget about the whole world, however... He hates Shen Yuan's hypocritical interest and no, he doesn't want to talk to anyone. 

He wants to complain. A little. Not admitting out loud the reasons why he has been overwhelmed so much when they carry him up or don’t give him space. They are shameful and terrible reasons; reasons so tangled in his heart that Shen Jiu doesn't quite understand them either. But without realizing it, he opens his mouth and starts to complain. He complains that Liu Qingge never listens to him while he takes off his crown. He complains that they are all exaggerated while he changes his clothes. He complains that Yue Qingyuan is the most hypocritical of all while he checks whether he can fix the pants or the monster has irretrievably ripped them.

“It's just a scratch,” Shen Yuan comments when Shen Jiu finally takes a deep breath and tries to relax. “I think it's nice that they care about you. And I imagine Liu Qingge is acting very cute.”

“It's not. It’s stressful and annoying. Is it so difficult for them to understand that I want to be alone? That I need it.”

Shen Yuan gives him one of those indecipherable glances, so common lately, and Shen Jiu trembles, aware of his slip. He has talked too much. There is an important nuance between wanting and needing . Fortunately, Shen Yuan doesn't insist. However, Shen Jiu still feels awkward. It's a different tension that now weighs him inside his chest: with the others, he felt frustrated because they ignored his request for solitude; with Shen Yuan, he is starting to feel unprotected. They talk too much and more and more naturally. And that is a mistake.

Shen Yuan can be an enemy.

“Deal with them this week,” he growls, shielding himself behind his mask of indifference. “I don't even want to hear their names.”

To his surprise, Shen Yuan smiles in amusement. It’s a sincere smile, without mockery or malice. Shen Jiu knows that Shen Yuan has understood him and that’s terrifying.

 

 

Thanks to that, Shen Yuan has gained a week to continue training Luo Binghe and earning his affection. He has plans, ideas that Shen Qingqiu would never approve of, but right now no one can stop him. After saying goodbye to Liu Qingge (Shen Yuan still doesn't know what to think about him, but it is fundamental to be kind to a possible ally), Shen Yuan meets with his disciples. 

Today, he is going to teach them to role-play.

“Yesterday you were studying the bestiaries, today we will put into practice what you have learned.” Shen Yuan closes the fan in a convincing blow. “For that, you are going to participate in an activity very different from the usual ones...”

Shen Yuan explains that they are going to invent a character . After an entire night of brainstorming, he has finally decided how to organize this RPG game. Their characters will initially have low cultivation levels and will be unarmed. Depending on how they answer the questions he will ask, their characters will gain experience and new skills. To avoid suspicion, they all start from the same numbers, although Shen Yuan gives each teen a unique ability to make it more fun. Luo Binghe's is to be a half-demon.

There is a gleam of concern in Luo Binghe's eyes when he whispers it to him, but Shen Yuan feigns ignorance.

Shen Yuan is quite proud to have developed a PIDW-based RPG in just one night. Tiredness makes him close his eyes, but the emotion in his veins prevents him from falling asleep. Furthermore, the fun of the disciples is as contagious as their smiles and he soon forgets that he is also playing a role.

After distributing the roles and clarifying the doubts (no one has ever played a role or participated in a play before) Shen Yuan divides them into groups to distribute missions. The first ones are simple since his objective is for them to understand the mechanics and apply what they have learned practically.

It's chaotic, but funny chaos. Shen Yuan watches as each group discusses the best strategies to solve all problems. Some of the teens worry about losing their life points and are very cautious, while others take too much risk knowing that it is just a game. Luo Binghe is one of the latter, so Shen Yuan punishes them with poisoning or sudden encounters with monsters so that they learn to value their decisions. In the future, fear shouldn't paralyze them... but he doesn't want them to die either!

After several hours, Shen Yuan clears his throat.

“It is the moment of the final mission. You are going to face several very dangerous monsters. If you defeat them, you will gain items and experience that will help you for tomorrow's session, but you can also end up injured.” All the teenagers look at him with impatient expectation, not knowing that these are real monsters that will try to assassinate them during the Alliance Conference. “In addition, those who are defeated will have to write an essay about the abilities and weak points of these monsters. And whoever defeats more monsters...” Shen Yuan hums absent-mindedly as he thinks. “They will get rid of chores for a week.”

The redactions are for Shen Qingqiu. Although he is on vacation, a week of inactivity is too long and Shen Yuan has to give him material so that he is entertained or he will continue to scold him for his mannerisms. 

The first day of role-playing ends with Luo Binghe winning. That isn’t a surprise, neither that he wins the next one or the next… Shen Yuan feels a little bad for the rest, but Luo Binghe's innate talent guides him through all the situations that he proposes. Perhaps because they are scenes that he has read in the book of his life, although Shen Yuan suspects that it is Luo Binghe's motivation that drives him to shine. His smile is the biggest and his eyes are the brightest whenever Shen Yuan congratulates him.

Understandably, the protagonist doesn’t want to do more tasks.

What is not normal is that he insists on preparing food for them every day.

Shen Yuan is also not complaining, of course.

During that week of role-playing, all the disciples upgrade their characters under Shen Yuan's watch. PIDW events are quite versatile and he dissects them on little adventures. It is fun and educational. Shen Yuan returns to the bamboo house very happily every day, where Shen Qingqiu watches him silently and suspiciously. Luckily, he doesn't ask him anything and Shen Yuan avoids having to lie to him.

Although it also makes him happy to be free and interact with other human beings. If he was the protagonist of one of the novels that he liked to read, he would complain that his life was so boring, but he is beginning to appreciate Luo Binghe's delicious meals, Liu Qingge's constant presence at his peak scaring away his disciples, thinking of a different adventure for each day, and convincing the mulish scum villain to visit Qian Cao Peak.

Shen Yuan enjoys the sweet smell of bamboo. He wants to live and all the small changes that he is making secure that future in which no one dies.

However, following the PIDW plot has its consequences. One morning, Shen Yuan mistakenly catches some disciples in a sex pollen situation. It wasn’t his intention, but after finishing the arcs of the worst monsters, PIDW becomes a porn novel. 

Shen Yuan freezes. As a reader, he thinks that PIDW has a ridiculous amount of porn. But he now lives in PIDW and that ridiculous amount of porn means he shouldn't act so careless. Unable to avoid it, Shen Yuan looks at all of his disciples. They look at him too, worried that his shizun has gone speechless and immobile. Shen Yuan sees some children who have grown to be young and will soon have their night hunts. Do they know that the real danger in this world isn’t demons but some flowers, monster secretions, enchanted caves, hexes...? What if they are alone on a mission and no one can help them in a fuck or die situation? What if they are accompanied by someone who would be horrible to dual cultivate with? How is dual cultivation different from normal sex?

He is starting to get overwhelmed. Too many possibilities. Too many things that can go wrong. The protagonist halo protects Luo Binghe and he always enjoyed all those erotic encounters as his harem grew, but what about the rest of them? Shen Yuan blushes at the thought that sweet Luo Binghe will soon go from a little sheep to a stallion. His shame turns to horror as he recalls the embarrassing awkward scenes of Luo Binghe's first sexual encounters.

“Shizun?”

Shen Yuan returns to reality. After an apologetic smile, he backs away.

“Excuse me, this master was reminded that he has to do one thing. Finish writing today's adventures in a redaction. I'll pick them up tonight.”

He runs towards the bamboo house still haunted by those questions. It is incoherent that in a world with so much sexual charge, most of the characters are celibate monks or act with such chastity. In PIDW almost everyone was a virgin until they met Luo Binghe! That is implausible! It breaks the suspension of disbelief!

He opens the door with a sharp knock. Shen Qingqiu is sitting at the table reading the latest essays while he enjoys tea and some pastries that Luo Binghe has prepared this morning. Seeing his hasty expression, Shen Qingqiu frowns.

“Something has happened? What has Liu Qingge done this time?”

Shen Yuan should calm down and collect his thoughts, but that revelation has left him stunned and scared.

“Disciples need sex education classes.”

Shen Qingqiu chokes on his tea, as elegant as ever, and Shen Yuan comprises that perhaps he should have proposed the dilemma to him with other words. It is already too late to regret it, so Shen Yuan closes the door and walks to the table with discrete steps.

“Please, explain yourself.” Shen Qingqiu's voice is cold and sharp like a knife. It is a voice that always pierces Shen Yuan's ribs and makes his heart tremble with uneasiness.

Shen Yuan sits across from him. He no longer knows if his nervousness is due to the villain's inquisitive gaze or an echo of the stress he has felt a few minutes earlier.

“Well...” Words that once seemed so sensible and coherent tremble in his throat. He swallows hard as he tries to collect his thoughts. “The disciples are no longer children.”

“I know.”

“This is not a world suitable for all audiences.”

Shen Qingqiu frowns.

“And what does that mean?”

Shen Yuan has read over a thousand pages of hideous and exaggerated porn, with almost every combination, from the most traditional positions to orgies. Talking about it shouldn't be embarrassing, and yet a faint blush covers his cheeks.

“You know… papapa…”

Shen Qingqiu, even more irritated, massages his temples.

“No, I definitely don't understand you.” He looks at him with a mixture of concern and distrust, although his tone of voice is indifferent. “You have spent too much time outside surrounded by inept people. You should rest and send those brats to do laps....“

“No! This is very important!” Shen Yuan is stressed enough to forget his fear of the scum villain and dares to raise his voice. “Listen to me well: in this world, there is an inordinately ridiculous number of plants and others that can cause a situation of... ahem... papapa...”

“Stop making up words! What does papapa mean?”

Shen Yuan suddenly remembers that Shen Qingqiu is a famous pervert. Perhaps proposing these classes to him is very dangerous for female disciples, what if he tries to take advantage of the situation? Should Shen Yuan take the risk? Shen Qingqiu is a threat that may not compensate for the disciples' current ignorance. However, he has already talked too much and Shen Qingqiu watches over him with an intensity that can't accept excuses.

“It’s...” Shen Yuan clenches his fists and decides to be brave for the future he's building. If Shen Qingqiu is a threat, he will defeat him. “Sex.”

Shen Qingqiu makes a disgusted face.

“Yeah, I guess those brats will soon start thinking about... that .” He grimaces again.

If Shen Yuan weren't so tense, he would find it amusing how Shen Qingqiu also avoids saying that word. While Shen Yuan is embarrassed, Shen Qingqiu acts like it’s too vulgar for someone as classy as him.

“What I mean is that there are many dangers that can end in... papapa. If they are alone, what should they do?”

“Release themselves,” Shen Qingqiu growls, still displeased.

“It’s not always possible! There are very uncomfortable plants that involve two people or that are solved in a certain way.” Generally, according to Luo Binghe's wishes, but Shen Yuan doesn't say it. “There are an overwhelmingly exaggerated amount of dangers that can create a mandatory papapa moment outside and the bestiaries hardly mention it. By that rule of three, all cultivators should travel in groups or pairs. What if they have to do papapa with someone unknown or even a demon takes advantage of the situation? That would be... rape, right? Even if they are saving your life.”

Shen Yuan swallows. PIDW proposes everything in a very funny and sometimes erotic way, but the perspective of ending up suffering from sex pollen twists his guts and leaves a bitter taste in his mouth. In front of him, Shen Qingqiu is looking at him with a less aggressive curiosity that encourages him to keep talking.

“Disciples need sex education classes. All if is possible, not just the ones from Qing Jing Peak.” Shen Yuan spreads his fingers to target his arguments. “The classes should include the most common causes and how to prevent them. And a manual on how to intervene so that it is neither uncomfortable nor painful, also how to resist if you are alone. Probably also a theoretical explanation about dual cultivation and...” 

Shen Yuan is speechless as he thinks of more problems. Are there contraceptive methods in this world? What about STDs? He definitely wants to kill the author for creating such an absurd and incoherent place.

The sharp blow of a fan against the table tears him out of his reveries. Shen Yuan looks at Shen Qingqiu.

“I was sure you wanted to talk to me about more nonsense, but... it’s not a bad idea.” That's an unusual compliment by him. “Sadly, the other Peak Lords will ignore it or even be offended. Forget about them. But you can present those classes at Qing Jing Peak.”

Shen Yuan didn’t imagine that Shen Qingqiu would agree so easily after scolding him for so many days because his classes are too creative. Again, he feels that fearful chill in case he is creating a situation favorable to a pervert. But the interest that shines in Shen Qingqiu's eyes is not lustful, but appreciative.

“You said the same about Bai Zhan Peak and Liu Qingge,” he remembers him.

Shen Qingqiu purses his lips in a fine line.

“Listen to me this time: it won't work. It was Liu Qingge himself who spread rumors about me.” Shen Qingqiu shakes the hand holding the fan. His disdain hides a frustration of several years. “You have also suffered from my reputation as lecherous, right? It's thanks to your cute Liu-shidi.”

Shen Yuan ignores the sarcasm in his voice. After the last events, he has started to question the fairness of PIDW. There are some objective facts, but others depend on Luo Binghe's POV. Mistreating children and coldly murdering sectmates is wrong, but... Why was Shen Qingqiu considered a pervert for going to brothels when Luo Binghe had a harem of six hundred wives? Luo Binghe is famous in and out of the novel for his massive cock, legendary stamina, and appreciation for female beauty. Maybe it's because Shen Yuan never liked that he had so many lovers and forgot about them, but now it is very easy for him to wonder why one is a pervert and the other is not.

Shen Yuan raises his head shyly. He has several ideas in mind with intertwined goals. Shen Qingqiu's latest complaint seems to hide more than is obvious.

“Maybe we could take advantage of that fame? It won’t seem strange to them if it is Shen Qingqiu who proposes it. That will create debate and won’t go unnoticed. And you could reproach them that you are the only one with enough courage to raise a serious problem that the entire cultivation world is ignoring.”

“Are you trying to manipulate me to get your way?” Shen Qingqiu lets out a surprised laugh.

“No!” Shen Yuan snorts, offended. “I'm serious! I really think this is a huge and horrible problem, but nobody does anything out of shame or appearances. Can you imagine Liu Qingge or Yue Qingyuan talking about papapa? I’m not.”

The image must be quite funny, as Shen Qingqiu laughs even harder.

“I would die to see it,” he acknowledges with a smile. His grin is brief and it immediately disappears behind a grimace. “Please stop saying papapa when you talk about sex. It's ridiculous.”

“Sorry.” Shen Yuan tries, but Shen Qingqiu imposes too much to talk lightly about sex with him. “And you have experience with dual cultivation, so you can give those classes...”

“Where did you get that nonsense? Maybe I have a reputation for being a pervert, but I have no experience with dual cultivation.”

Shen Yuan blinks. His entire thread of thoughts and arguments has been broken with an unexpected counterattack.

“But the brothels...”

A slight blush stains Shen Qingqiu’s cheeks, who opens his fan and hides behind too late: Shen Yuan has been able to appreciate his expression of insecurity and shame.

“Dual cultivation involves a cultivation partner. Another cultivator.”

Although it’s a coherent explanation, Shen Yuan squints his eyes as he wonders what exactly Shen Qingqiu does in brothels. The answer no longer seems so simple. He finds incoherent that a man so fussy, who is overwhelmed by physical contact and hates attention, turns to prostitutes. Maybe Shen Yuan is wrong, but now he doesn’t intend to forget that suspicion.

“My mistake.”

Shen Qingqiu snorts, there is almost a smile on his lips.

“You don't seem to have experience either, am I right? What a nefarious teacher you would be.” He mocks him, without evil or his characteristic cruelty. “Will you look for information in another bestiary?”

“I can teach them to recognize the most common plants and monsters.” Shen Yuan clears his throat, somewhat embarrassed. “But you're right. We need another teacher.”

The two look at each other. Shen Yuan wonders how he ended up talking to the villain of a bad porn novel about how to teach the protagonist about papapa. Now that the stress is gone, Shen Yuan can't help it and laughs. He tries to cover his face with his hand, but it’s useless: it’s an absurd situation that sums to several days full of smiles.

Raising his head, he discovers that Shen Qingqiu is still hiding behind his fan. His eyes are narrowed in an almost friendly way, betraying that he too seems amused by the conversation.

“What about Mu Qingfang?” Shen Yuan proposes after calming down. “After all, dual cultivation is a medical procedure.”

“Hmm...” Shen Qingqiu closes the fan in time with his hums. “It's not a bad idea. He might listen to us if we talk to him in private. And the other Peak Lords maybe will listen to him. He's also the best at teaching classes without a lot of hormonal teens getting too excited.”

Shen Yuan blinks very quickly, stunned to realize that the two of them have started speaking in the plural without realizing it.

“So...” Shy, he begins to fiddle with his fan. “Do you like my proposal?”

Shen Qingqiu snorts while rolling his eyes.

“If I didn't like it, I would have sent you to your room to copy the rules of Qing Jing Peak one hundred times.”

Even Shen Qingqiu's threats are starting to change. Less deadly, more... typical. Shen Yuan doesn't know how to feel about it, so he shuts up and nods.

Shen Qingqiu stands up to put away the essays he was reading and takes ink, brush, and paper.

“Of course, we are going to propose a complete educational program. I’m not going to lose my face for a poorly executed idea,” he warns him with his characteristic coldness. “We need to write all the content that we will present to the other Peak Lords and what arguments we will give them. I know them well, so I can take care of that part.”

“I can investigate bestiaries!“

”Of course,” Shen Qingqiu shakes his head with a mocking smile as he begins to write. “There is a lot of theoretical content, we should divide it between the two. This is more efficient and we will finish earlier.”

Shen Yuan has risen to stand behind Shen Qingqiu to look over his shoulder at what he is writing. There are three columns on the paper. The first says Shen Yuan and it is what he will have to do. The third is Shen Qingqiu and it is what they will present to the rest of the sect.

The second says Shen Jiu .

“Shen Jiu?” He mutters, confused.

Shen Qingqiu nods as he writes down what he will do under the second column.

“That was my name before I became Shen Qingqiu.”

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: What if this was a Would you dual cultivate with me? AU?

Shen Yuan and Shen Jiu: We want to teach the disciples dual cultivation.
Liu Qingge: Are you sure? Dual cultivation involves extremely dangerous techniques, not even all of Bai Zhan Peak's disciples could practice them.
The rest of Peak Lords: Should we tell him?

 
CURIOSITY # 1
There are several small scenes that I have very clear from the beginning of the fic but that I haven't yet been able to write because it wouldn't make sense due to the current state of their relationship. Presenting Shen Jiu's name was one of those scenes. Shen Jiu FINALLY trusts Shen Yuan enough to tell him. Furthermore, it is the first step in accepting that the two of them can play the role of "Shen Qingqiu" :D

I hope you liked this stupid debate about papapa! Their relationship is already improving and they are even starting to joke.

CURIOSITY # 2
I still don't know if I will include sex scenes in the fic. Just in case, the characters will know how it works. Do you think I should increase the rating of the fic? There will be no sex at the moment, but they will talk about it as they did in this chapter.

CURIOSITY # 3
Liu Qingge still hasn't realized that he has a crush. And it will take time for him to understand his feelings, so be patient!

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Liu Qingge thinks Shen Qingqiu is shameless

Chapter Summary

Little Bingbing's favorite hobby is being shizun's bingpup.

Chapter Notes

Shen Yuan and Shen Jiu share the same neuron and they still haven't realized it.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Shen Jiu can't hide his impatience. Although he has told himself that he has no special interest in those classes, his name will be affected and that makes him uncomfortable. Even though he and Shen Yuan have been talking for days, researching and documenting, Shen Jiu is still concerned if it’s insufficient.

The silence of the bamboo house is suffocating, allowing his worst thoughts to escape his control with nothing to distract him.

When the door finally opens, Shen Jiu gets up, forgetting the meticulous mastery of his gestures. Luckily, he recovers quickly and when Shen Yuan enters, Shen Jiu has already regained his control even though he is still anxious.

Shen Yuan, on the other hand, is terrible at hiding his emotions. He smiles and his eyes shine, that means everything went well, right?

“Tell me,” Shen Jiu demands as he urges him to sit at that table that already has space for two. It is more comfortable since now they spend a lot of time arguing at that table or eating together. “What did Mu Qingfang tell you?”

“He loved the idea!”

Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow. Over time he has learned that Shen Yuan is not stupid and his ideas are curious, but unfortunately, he is too naive and tends to soften reality.

“I want a detailed summary of exactly what he told you and what you have talked about.”

Shen Yuan sighs, his lips twisted into a pout. Shen Jiu also knows that his motivation is fickle: he prepares projects with all his enthusiasm, but only if they excite him. He is quite lazy and that irritates him.

“Well, I had to wait a bit because Mu Qingfang was busy with his disciples. Although when he has seen me, he has come to talk to me right away. He asked me about your wound, by the way.”

Shen Jiu nods. Not even a scar remains from that incident. As he repeated until he was bored: it was nothing. Still, Mu Qingfang's interest leaves him an uneasy feeling. Why does the renowned sect healer worry about a minor injury?

“Then, I told him about our plan. The truth is that... It was very easy to convince him. I didn't even have to tell him the speech you forced me to memorize.” He adds the last with mischievousness, reminding him of the brief discussion they had had: Shen Yuan defended improvisation while Shen Jiu didn’t intend to allow him to leave the house until he knew everything they had talked about by heart.

Of course, Shen Jiu had won the argument.

“Did you know that Mu Qingfang already teaches basic notions of dual cultivation to his disciples?” 

Shen Yuan was whispering and Shen Jiu leaned down to hear the gossip.

“No.” He acknowledges with genuine surprise. “But it makes sense. It is another medical resource, after all.”

“And some good arguments for when we propose it to the rest of Peak Lords!” Shen Yuan grins. There is a malicious glint in his eyes and for once Shen Jiu responds to his smile. “First, Mu Qingfang recognizes that dual cultivation has healing purposes. Second, Qian Cao Peak's disciples have already received classes similar to the ones we want to propose. Third, we are now two and no one will be able to accuse the good Mu Qingfang of being a pervert.” Shen Yuan pauses. “Two and a half, I guess.”

Two and a half, he thinks, nodding.

Shen Jiu immediately tries to ignore that thought.

“Has he told you anything else?”

“Mu Qingfang has no problem taking over technical classes. He has also offered to help us with the glossary of the most common plants that cause sex pollen and how to recognize them or prepare an alternative antidote to papapa...”

“Shen Yuan!” He scolds him, sick of hearing that ridiculous word.

“Hem! He is quite friendly, did you know? I thought it would be much more embarrassing to talk to him, but Mu Qingfang has very clear ideas. We can count on him, not only to defend the proposal before the rest but also to organize the content of the classes.”

“Guess you are right,” he mutters. Although Shen Jiu doesn't get along with any of his martial brothers, perhaps Mu Qingfang is the one he has a better relationship with. It is a superficial but temperate relationship, without the veiled tensions that it has with the rest. 

Maybe that‘s the reason why he doesn’t feel his usual jealousy or fear of being replaced by Shen Yuan, who is much more cordial, friendly and cheerful than him.

“Now that we have Mu Qingfang's support and knowledge, it is time to move on to the next phase of the plan,” he decides.

 

 

Even though Shen Qingqiu had been avoiding Peak Lords' meetings all this time, he had decided to present the proposal during the next one. Shen Yuan understands his reasoning and he is partly relieved that the real Shen Qingqiu took care of the most complicated part, but waiting locked in the bamboo house while the nerves eat inside him isn't pleasant.

Bored and stressed, Shen Yuan is unable to stay still. He has already walked a thousand times inside his room like a trapped animal and is now walking through the entirety of the bamboo house. He has mixed feelings about that place. First, it was a possible new home after he died. Then, a prison. Now... he doesn't know. It's still stressful spending so much time indoors, but in his past life he didn't leave his home much either and at least he has managed to turn his room into a refuge.

Shen Yuan stops at realizing that the second room has turned into his room . Not a cell, not a place without emotional value. It is a refuge that he has begun to decorate according to his tastes and where he always hides despite having the house to himself. The rest belongs to Shen Qingqiu, but that room is his.

Shen Yuan doesn't know how to feel about it.

His gaze stops on the table, where is the paper with the three columns. Shen Qingqiu is the name of the horrible character that Shen Yuan hates, while Shen Jiu seems the name of a third person. He no longer knows who he is living with. Shen Qingqiu is the terrible monster who committed so many atrocities in PIDW, but after raising doubts and questions, Shen Yuan begins to suspect that Shen Jiu is the real person.

Shen Yuan also doesn't know how to feel about it.

He startles when the door finally opens. Shen Qingqiu (or Shen Jiu?) walks in with his usual grace. His expression doesn't reflect anything, although Shen Yuan already knows him well enough to guess when he's upset. And today he doesn't seem pissed.

But he doesn't seem happy either, and his silence only makes him even tenser.

“How has it been!?” He exclaims.

“Wait.” Shen Qingqiu ignores him to close the door. “The disciples can hear you.”

Closing the door also activates the silence spells that protect their secret.

Shen Yuan chases Shen Qingqiu like a chick towards the table. He was more sincere! While he waits for answers, Shen Yuan takes notice of Shen Qingqiu's actions. He doesn't seem angry, rather excited. The sparkle in his eyes is definitely malicious and he almost smiles. Shen Yuan sighs, although inside he is still nervous.

“It went well, you can relax,” Shen Qingqiu growls as he sits down in front of the table. Although they have never talked about it, the two always sit in the same position. Their position. “Do you want the details?”

“Of course!” Shen Yuan protests.

That subject has kept him restless and stressed for too many days, in which he has had some horrific nightmares inspired by the book, has almost written an entire bestiary with just the monsters involved in the sex pollen and has had to endure Shen Everything Has To Be Perfect Qingqiu’s hysteria. He no longer has the patience for the scum villain to torture him like that.

Shen Qingqiu is a true antagonist because he lets out a laugh. It is a light laugh that he tries to hide behind the fan, sincere, the typical laugh that doesn't fit in someone like him.

“The meeting was as boring and pointless as ever, so I interrupted before the others fell asleep to propose our new educational plan.”

“Let me guess: it stopped being boring.”

“Yes.” Shen Qingqiu's eyes sparkle with malice. “They all had pretty strong opinions. Your cute Liu Qingge, for example. Or Qi Qingqi. I wish you could have seen their faces when Mu Qingfang stepped in to support us.”

This time Shen Yuan didn't imagine it: Shen Qingqiu is smiling behind the fan. It's a crooked smirk, ideal for a cruel villain detailing his evil plan. Only this time, the villain is defending sex ed.

It is all so absurd that he is unable to hold a laugh.

“I guess they freaked out,” laughs.

Shen Qingqiu fans himself without hiding his pride, not so much because of the idea they espouse, but because of the opportunity to leave the rest of his enemies speechless. Shen Yuan stops laughing as he remembers that they will need the support of the rest of Peak Lords to prevent a future in the Water Prison.

Shen Qingqiu's enmity with the rest of the Cang Qiong Sect is no longer so funny.

“Absolutely,” Shen Qingqiu smirks. “They have made the mistake of trying to argue with Mu Qingfang. You should never do it. Mu Qingfang is the only person who can calmly listen while they yell at him and then refute all of their arguments coherently and without losing his calm. He has destroyed them.”

Shen Yuan acknowledges that that would have been fun to watch, although he struggles to smile again. In the end, he decides to postpone that problem for later and focus on sex education classes.

“And the others?”

“They don’t have an opinion as intense as theirs. It has been as we expected: Yue Qingyuan considers it a magnificent idea, Shang Qinghua is too coward to refuse...”

Shen Yuan frowns as he speaks. Perhaps he is already being too suspicious, but PIDW always made it clear that Shen Qingqiu was taking advantage of the sect leader's favoritism to do evil things. However, Shen Qingqiu has mentioned Yue Qingyuan with bitter sarcasm. Shen Yuan shakes his head and tries to forget it.

“So, we are the majority, right?”

“Yes, our proposal has been approved, however...” Shen Qingqiu snorts while grimacing. “Each Peak Lord will decide whether to impart them or not. Bai Zhan Peak and Xian Shu Peak have already refused and I suspect that perhaps other peaks will look for cowardly excuses to sneak out.”

For Shen Yuan, that’s a bittersweet victory. At least Luo Binghe will receive the classes, he is the one who needs them the most, but in Xian Shu Peak there is one of his main wives. Besides, Shen Yuan is concerned about everyone's general safety.

“Maybe if I spoke to Liu Qingge like the last...”

His words are interrupted by Luo Binghe's familiar yells.

“Liu-shishu! Shizun hates being bothered! Wait here and I'll announce you to him! Liu-shishu, shizun will be angry if you enter his house without warning!”

What a coincidence , Shen Yuan thinks, amused, as Shen Qingqiu pales. The two look at each other.

“How do we do it? Rock, paper, or scissors?”

“What?” Shen Qingqiu frowns in confusion.

“Nothing, a game.”

“We don't have time for silly games,” he says as he gets up to hide in Shen Yuan's room. “Deal with him, I've had enough of his nonsense for today.”

Shen Yuan collects the incriminating evidence while waiting for Liu Qingge's imminent arrival. He silently thanks Luo Binghe for taking the role of their watchdog so seriously. Later I will tell Shen Qingqiu that he deserves a reward , he muses. Luo Binghe's screams betray Liu Qingge's presence and that’s why Shen Yuan is not startled when the War God opens the door with a kick.

“Shen Qingqiu!!” He yells, followed by the loyal shadow of Luo Binghe, who looks at his shizun with regret.

“Hi, shidi.” Shen Yuan forces himself to draw his coldest grin. That’s a bad moment, they have already argued and on top of that Liu Qingge has ignored his disciple to enter rudely. He deserves all the antipathy of the original Shen Qingqiu, even though Shen Yuan finds it amusing. “Thanks, Luo Binghe. You have done a good job, too bad your shishu is too impulsive. Now, leave us.”

Shen Yuan seems to hear a muffled noise, perhaps Shen Qingqiu is applauding his performance, perhaps Shen Qingqiu is upset that he congratulated Luo Binghe on a failed assignment. Both options are possible. Luo Binghe bows before leaving. At the door, the young man gives Liu Qingge a dark and sour look.

“Well, shidi?” Shen Yuan raises the fan. That makes it easier to speak without fear that his expression will betray him. “You don’t listen to my disciple, haven’t you listened to me in the meeting either and that is why you are now so interested in talking to me?”

A deep red covers Liu Qingge's cheeks.

“Shen Qingqiu, your shameless,” he splutters. “I thought you had changed, but now you intend for your disciples to visit brothels too!”

“I'm pretty sure I didn't say that.”

Although Shen Yuan hasn’t been in the meeting, he knows with an inexplicable certainty that Shen Qingqiu would never ruin their proposal with such foolishness. Unable to help it, he squints and watches Liu Qingge, remembering when Shen Qingqiu confessed that he was the reason for all his rumors. Rumors that Shen Yuan no longer knows if they are entirely true.

“Shidi, I understand that you have complaints. And I am willing to discuss our different points of view, but I won’t tolerate you making up any more lies.”

Liu Qingge crosses his arms, growling through his teeth.

“Why do you want children to learn dual cultivation? Sex harms cultivation.”

“First, dual cultivation it’s not papapa...” A noise is heard in the next room. “Hem, it’s not common sex. Haven't you heard Mu Qingfang's explanation either? It is a valid technique that can enhance cultivation if it’s practiced with a cultivation partner and can also be used medically in some specific cases.”

“They are too young to look for a cultivation partner!”

“I know, but answering your first question: there are many dangers out there that can lead to a papa... fuck or die situation.”

“That is an exaggeration. I have survived these situations with only willpower.”

Really, Liu-shidi??? Shen Yuan blinks, between surprised and on the verge of laughing. He would never have imagined that Liu Qingge would be so... stubbornly pure.

“Okay, but you have a special talent, shidi. People with weaker cultivation can end up in a dangerous situation. Our goal is not to teach papa ... sex, but also to explain the most common dangers to prevent them.” Fuck! I hope Liu Qingge thinks the "our" is for Mu Qingfang. Shen Yuan clears his throat before grinning at him and thus diverting attention from his slip. “Maybe you object because Bai Zhan Peak doesn't like to study?”

“Shen Qingqiu!!”

Fortunately, Liu Qingge screams, because Shen Yuan could clearly hear a giggle from his room.

“If not, I don't understand why you oppose us teaching them how to avoid poisonous plants and monster secretions.”

An even more intense blush covers Liu Qingge's face down to his ears. He clenches his fists as he looks away, fleeing from Shen Yuan's gaze.

“Teaching that is fine,” he growls under his breath. “Not the other.”

“Why n...” Shen Yuan tenses upon hearing a dry noise in his room. In a hurry, he coughs to attract Liu Qingge’s attention, who has frowned. “Hem, why no…?” Another noise. One can be chance, two is intentional. Shen Yuan stands up. “Excuse me, shidi. I think I have left a window open...”

He runs up to his room, with all the calm he can maintain in such a stressful situation and opens the door minimum so that Liu Qingge doesn‘t see anything. Nor anyone.

“What are you doing?” He hisses with a whisper.

Shen Qingqiiu pushes him away from the door and grabs his fan.

“I want to talk with him.”

After the exchange, Shen Yuan leans against the door to listen to the conversation between the two immortals. First, he hears footsteps. Then, the rustle of the fabric when someone sits down. Shen Yuan gulps and silently prays that Liu Qingge doesn't discover the little differences between their hairstyles and robes.

“Liu Qingge, I'll be frank with you: why are you against disciples learning about safe practices and respect? I am not interested in promoting dual cultivation, but it is a possibility that can occur and they should know how to act.” Shen Yuan seems to hear Liu Qingge try to reply, but Shen Qingqiu interrupts him. “You have always lived in your own world. Yes, you are filthy talented and have cultivated to perfection at a young age. Congratulations!! But not everyone is like you.”

“You would have my level if you hadn't damaged your cultivation by going to those brothels...”

“But we aren’t talking about me! What's your problem with us teaching these subjects at Qing Jing Peak? I'm not going to force you to make your hopeless brutes study a glossary of poisonous plants, but you can't force me to not do it with mine either.” Shen Qingqiu is raising his tone of voice and Shen Yuan recognizes the moment when his anger is born. “You haven’t listened to me at the meeting, you have come here with the wrong conclusions, and you keep talking nonsense. Your problem is that you despise me. That's the truth. You've been despising me since we were disciples. Liu Qingge, never forget that right now we are the same, despite our cultivation differences.”

“I...”

Shen Yuan is sorry for Liu Qingge, knowing how terrible Shen Qingqiu's anger is, although his curiosity continues to grow as he wonders what kind of history those two have had in the past.

“Let me add one last thing: I only intend to give them the necessary knowledge. If they end up in a humiliating situation for not studying, it will be their fault for their stupidity.” Shen Yuan sighs.
