That lack of empathy is typical of the scum villain. “However, thanks to spending so much time in brothels I know the horrible things that can happen. Things that you have never considered. That is really what I am interested in explaining in these classes.”

Shen Yuan hears that Shen Qingqiu rises again, leaving Liu Qingge speechless. Nor explain his erratic behavior. They're going to find us out because of you , he laments. However, Shen Yuan steps away from the door for Shen Qingqiu to re-enter the room and exchange again.

“Shen Qingqiu?” Liu Qingge mutters, visibly confused. He too has gotten up and looked about to head to the exit.

“I forgot to tell you one thing,” he improvises, trying very hard to imitate the same cold furious tone as Shen Qingqiu. “Mn… Respect my door!”

“What?”

Shen Yuan is not thinking. Shen Yuan has to justify Shen Qingqiu's dramatic departure after blurting out his speech.

“Don't come back so suddenly and listen to my disciples. Please.” Behind his back, Shen Yuan hears an annoyed snort. “And go talk to Mu-shidi if you still have doubts! You listen to him, right?“

Shen Yuan is trying to imitate Shen Qingqiu's presumptuous arrogance, but it's difficult when Liu Qingge looks at him with that beaten-up puppy face. After all, he is only slightly offended, while Shen Qingqiu seems to carry an old and very specific rage. 

Instead of leaving, Liu Qingge remained still, his gaze lowered and his fists clenched. He's... tense. And maybe confused. Shen Yuan waits as he fans himself to unsuccessfully hide his nervousness from him.

“I've never seen it that way,” he mutters. Shen Yuan is learning that Liu Qingge never runs away when something bothers him, but he also doesn't speak with his usual confidence. "Sorry."

Shen Yuan seems to hear that Shen Qingqiu has gasped behind the door, so he clears his throat to mask the noise. Although he doesn’t need those apologies, the hidden person, Shen Yuan appreciates that very peculiar courage of acknowledging a mistake out loud.

“See, shidi? We can solve many misunderstandings by talking,” he teases him and Liu Qingge looks away, blushing. “I appreciate your apology...”

Now they hear a sharp, cutting thump, impossible to ignore, surely from a bestiary hitting the ground. Liu Qingge raises his head with a frown as Shen Yuan smiles nervously.

“It’s everything fine?”

“The wind, don’t worry. As I was saying, I really appreciate that we talk and solve our misunderstandings, like the incident with our disciples or today...”

Another intense hit, maybe two or three manuals this time. Shen Yuan smiles, even more, feigning indifference. This is a golden opportunity to increase the affection of one of the Peak Lords for Shen Qingqiu! Also, he is one of the most powerful cultivators! Shen Yuan is ready to face the wrath of the scum villain later.

“Hem,” he clears his throat. “I appreciate you apologizing, shidi. And I hope we continue to talk as we have done now.” Shen Yuan doesn't even blink when the wind keeps throwing things to the ground as a warning.

Liu Qingge seems more and more confused.

“Maybe you should look...?”

“Everything is fine, shidi!”

“Sure? If you have a hole in the wall, I can help you.” Liu Qingge lowers his gaze, again whispering. “As an apology...”

“No need, shidi!” Shen Yuan knows that he is acting very OC, but he is not in a situation that allows him to think calmly. “If you want to apologize, stop spreading rumors about me.”

“Stop going to brothels.”

Why does this subject bother him so much? He cries internally.

“Liu-shidi.” Shen Yuan tries to imitate the seriousness of the original Shen Qingqiu. “Have you ever considered that there is another reason why I visit brothels? Look!” He gestures to encompass the entire room. “I am picky. I hate clutter and I never leave my house with disheveled clothes or wrinkles.” Perhaps Shen Yuan is exaggerating so that the wind listens to him and stops playing the fool. And give him a break, Shen Qingqiu's standards are impossible. “I don't like my disciples getting too close to me and neither do the Peak Lords gatherings. Yes, shidi, you made me feel uncomfortable during the other night hunt because you didn't give me space to breathe. Do you really think I'm going to find that kind of company in a brothel?”

Although Liu Qingge opens his mouth, he doesn't say anything. He takes a deep breath before leaving. Only when the door closes, Shen Yuan can finally calm down. Then another door opens and he tenses again.

“Sorry!” He exclaims. “Why did you leave without any explanation? I just wanted to cover us up and I've talked too much! But you have to make peace with Liu Qingge! It is very important for the future! And I really think that nothing happens if one day the clothes aren’t perfect!”

Shen Yuan mutes upon discovering that he is mindlessly babbling while Shen Qingqiu doesn't even seem to be listening to him. Or angry. Although he has frowned, his expression is strange.

“Is that what you think about me?”

“Mn?”

“About the brothels.”

“Dunno? I don't know what you're doing there and I don't know if I want to know,” he blushes, thinking about… “Only that I have the impression that you are not only looking for papapa?”

Shen Qingqiu continues to stare at him with that strange fixation as if trying to catch Shen Yuan's thoughts. He was so sure that he would have been angry that his silence is even more uncomfortable. Because that expression is not from Shen Qingqiu, but that Shen Jiu that he barely knows.

“Copy the rules of etiquette and courtesy from Qing Jing Peak. Fifty times.”

“What?” He babbles.

“And stop messing with my private life.”

Shen Qingqiu walks past his side intending to ignore him, but that is a very small place and they have nowhere to run.

Chapter End Notes

CURIOSITY # 1
Author: Within *looks at her hand* 288,432 chapters Shen Jiu will discover that Mu Qingfang wasn't worried about an irrelevant injury, but about him.

CURIOSITY # 2
I consider that Liushen's evolution is easier than Liujiu's. In canon, Liu Qingge quickly forgets the past discrepancies after Shen Qingqiu saves his life and he begins to act differently. Furthermore, Shen Yuan was unaware of all the tensions of the past. However, Shen Jiu is much more spiteful and for Liujiu to advance parallel to Liushen they need to deal with all the past grievances.

Is this stupid porn subplot an excuse for the characters to talk? Of course! There are several people who have already pointed it out, but even though Shen Yuan has good intentions... I think is't very awkward for someone else to get involved in your life???? They have to learn to respect their respective limits.

CURIOSITY # 3
Now it's canon that Shen Jiu is the cat who throws things on the ground when he is upset.

 

Next week I start working, so the chapters will be shorter. See you soon!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Luo Binghe finds quite interesting the papapa lessons

Chapter Notes

Shen Yuan is happy because the sex ed classes are succeeding. Little Bingbing is happy because he is learning interesting things, although Liu-shishu's closeness to his shizun no longer makes him so happy. The author is happy because she has finally been able to write about the Liu siblings.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Luo Binghe is very excited about the new classes that shizun has organized. They are special for different reasons: they will learn many things, they will visit other peaks, and they will also have other teachers. Luo Binghe loves when shizun takes them to the other peaks, like when they learned about medicinal plants at Qian Cao Peak, although shizun is the best teacher of all. But perhaps Luo Binghe is also excited by a very particular curiosity... and quite widespread among his martial brothers, who laugh softly at the thought of dual cultivation.

Shen Qingqiu had explained to them that these classes will last several days and that they would cover various sections, explained by different Peak Lords. Their first lesson is at Qing Jing Peak and they share it with the disciples of Bai Zhan Peak. Luo Binghe didn’t expect to see Bai Zhan Peak's disciples after Liu Qingge stormed furiously into the bamboo house without manners. However, his disciples have come and sat on the grass with the ones from Qing Jing Peak. Although the two are starting to get along better after the previous night hunt, they don't mix. Both have sat divided into two very clearly groups.

Luo Binghe sits between Ning Yingying and Ming Fan, who is squinting at the disciples from Bai Zhan Peak. Luo Binghe understands his suspicion: until recently, those savages always made fun of his shizun.

All the disciples whisper with hardly any exceptions. There is a lot of curiosity and interest, also a few jokes that make Ning Yingying and Luo Binghe blush, while Ming Fan snorts at the bad taste of some. The expectation is such that there is no silence when Shen Qingqiu arrives.

Luo Binghe examines Shizun's clothes and hairstyle, the elegance of his steps, and all those little gestures that reveal whether there will be smiles or reproaches that morning. Shen Qingqiu scrutinizes the disciples, his expression still hidden behind the fan. As there are so many, the class will be in the open air, near to the bamboo forest. Shen Qingqiu carries several books and Liu Qingge, who was with his arms crossed watching his disciples, comes over to help him. There is nothing intimate or special about that gesture, but Luo Binghe gets very nervous when he sees it. And he doesn't understand why.

“Silence,” Shen Qingqiu asks and automatically everyone, even the brutes from Bai Zhan Peak, shut up. There is an expectant silence and all eyes are on that elegant figure dressed in green. “We will begin these lessons by studying the most common causes of poisoning. Tomorrow you will visit Mu Qingfang who will talk to you about plants and their pollen. Today I will explain to you what kind of monsters and demons can corner you in a papapa situation.”

Papapa? Luo Binghe thinks. He is not the only one. Even Liu Qingge has frowned and looks strangely at Shen Qingqiu, who has become paralyzed. Not even his fan can hide the blush that stains his cheeks.

 

 

A few days later.

Shen Yuan would never have imagined that his proposed sex ed classes would turn into some kind of multi-day event that is hitting multiple peaks. It's fun. That reminds him of college exchange programs. Happy, Shen Yuan hums as he consults a manual. He is also learning many things: in PIDW almost all situations were solved with papapa, but Mu Qingfang has taught him different antidotes for less aggressive poisons. In front of him, Shen Qingqiu is writing.

The bamboo house is surrounded by a pleasant silence. Also, it's a sunny day and Shen Yuan begins to stretch like a cat, although every time he neglects his posture, Shen Qingqiu gives him a warning hiss.

At times, they can also hear the laughter of the disciples and the echo of their voices.

“How many papapa plants have you memorized?”

“24!”

“I never imagined that so many plants could cause papapa.”

Shen Qingqiu puts the brush down hard on the table and gives Shen Yuan an angry look and he trembles in terror.

“I'll kill you.”

“You already punished me by copying the poison manual two hundred times!” Manual that they then gave to the different disciples so they could use it as a reference. At least Shen Yuan's suffering wasn’t in vain. “Besides, It was you who said it, not me!”

Shen Qingqiu blushes as he remembers HIS slip. Shen Yuan regrets not being able to be present to see how the proud and arrogant scum villain said out loud papapa in front of a bunch of teenagers and the even prouder Liu Qingge. He smiles at the thought and Shen Qingqiu lets out another growl as he tries to focus on his writing. His attitude is simple: ignore what has happened as if it is going to disappear from everyone's memory.

But Shen Yuan never plans to forget it. This is one of his best memories in this world.

 

 

“I’m leaving,” Shen Jiu alerts Shen Yuan as he heads towards the door.

He wouldn’t have to say anything to him, to that usurper, to that double who could be a spy, a demon, or a threat, but Shen Jiu feels that he shouldn’t leave without saying goodbye. It's stupid, he'll be back a few hours later, but…

Something changed. Shen Jiu doesn't know exactly what it is, only that his life is no longer the same. And not only because there is another person in his house, nor that they live together, but there’s a change within him. Shen Jiu was aware since the day Liu Qingge came with his stupid prejudices to argue with him. Shen Yuan did something strange, something that no one else had done before, not even Yue Qingyuan and his empty words: he defended him.

Shen Yuan is perhaps the first person who has tried to understand his decisions instead of assuming things like everyone else.

On the way to An Ding Peak, Shen Jiu thinks of the Warm Red Pavillion. It has been a long time since he last visited those women. Maybe he should come over one afternoon, perhaps only to talk to them and make sure they are fine. Sometimes he still forgets that Shen Yuan has already stolen three years of his life.

The dual cultivation classes had been more successful than he had imagined. In his pessimism, Shen Jiu had accepted that they would only perform them at Qing Jing Peak and Qian Cao Peak, perhaps also Qiong Ding Peak, but after their discussion, Liu Qingge had agreed on the condition of being present. Although Shen Jiu suspects that it is because he would talk about monsters. However, the rest of the peaks are cheering up. To Shen Jiu's surprise, the cowardly Shang Qinghua had been the next to join.

Shen Jiu has always visited An Ding Peak to complain or demand that Liu Qingge's damage be repaired. It is the first time that he is there to teach. Shang Qinghua greets him as nervous as ever. Shen Jiu has never understood why he is the most criticized of all the Peak Lords when Shang Qinghua is more cowardly than a rat.

“Shen-shixiong!” He greets him with a trembling, piping voice. Shang Qinghua is as scared as ever and Shen Jiu sighs without understanding his decision. “Over here.”

They walk the main An Ding Peak trail together. Shen Jiu fans lazily, trying to ignore the nervousness which Shang Qinghua rubs his hands. Ever since he met him, Shang Qinghua has always been a pathetic parody of a distinguished cultivator. How he became Peak Lord is a mystery. However, he is more nervous than usual. Dual cultivation has the power to affect everyone and make them irrational. Some get angry, others pale and some even get scared.

Shang Qinghua clears his throat as they are about to enter the building.

“My disciples are very excited to learn from Shen-shixiong the... What did you call it? Papapa?”

Shen Qingqiu stops to give him a glacier look. Shang Qinghua pales a little but holds his gaze with determination.

“Don't ever say that word in my presence again,” he hisses.

“I won’t do it! Sorry!” Still, he seems neither regretful or intend to let him pass. “May I ask Shen-shixiong about his sudden interest in dual cultivation?”

“No.”

“Have you perhaps read a book that has changed your opinion? Proud Immortal Demon Way?”

Shen Jiu frowns, not softening his annoyed gaze, though inside he's starting to run out of air. It’s happening. Someone suspects them. And from Shang Qinghua's words, he suspects that perhaps a demon is usurping the real Shen Qingqiu. If it weren't for the fact that he has to assuage his suspicions, Shen Jiu would laugh at the irony. But it is not ironic or funny, but pitifully sad.

Not his sect or the Peak Lords (they also hadn't had a good relationship before), not his disciples (perhaps too young), not even Yue Qingyuan (his Qi-ge) or Liu Qingge (after so many discussions they shouldn't have a special enmity relationship?). The only person who has noticed Shen Yuan's shadow is the insubstantial coward Shang Qinghua.

That hurts. Shen Jiu takes a deep breath as he tries to maintain control. That is no longer a class, but a trap. And he has to act as normally as possible before Shang Qinghua decides to accuse him of being a spy for demons. After all, they still haven't discovered who leaked the information allowing the demonic invasion.

With his fame and records, with his many enemies, no one will believe Shen Qingqiu if he is betrayed by a rat like Shang Qinghua. Then he will have to reveal the truth about Shen Yuan and he is not prepared to face a future in which everyone he knows chooses that most pleasant and optimistic version of himself.

Although Shen Jiu begins to feel like he is drowning in his fears, his expression remains nonchalant.

 

 

Shen Jiu isn't the only one who has been thinking about the brothel discussion: Liu Qingge too. That’s the reason why he has gone down to the city with his sister and they are both walking towards Warm Red Pavillion.

“Let’s be clear: do you want me to question prostitutes about what Shen-shibo does or does not do with them?“ There is a mischievous glint in Liu Mingyan's eyes that makes Liu Qingge blush.

“I just want to know the truth,” Liu Qingge splutters. “He is acting weird. Sometimes he looks like two completely different people.”

“And finding out about his adventures with the prostitutes will surely clear up your doubts, hm.”

Liu Mingyan's words make him feel uncomfortable. When she speaks, he understands a little how illogical his decision is. However, for some reason, he can't stop thinking about that conversation. Why does Shen Qingqiu visit the Warm Red Pavilion? Is there another reason apart from the obvious one? Why does that worry him so much?

“You don't have to do it if you don't want to,” he mutters, still uneasy.

Liu Mingyan lets out an amused laugh.

“Don't worry, dage! I'll help you, but I'd like to know more about your... new interest in Shen-shibo. Although it is not very new either.”

Liu Qingge has asked Liu Mingyan for help in a desperate act, as several years ago he was expelled for life from the Warm Red Pavilion after provoking several fights with Shen Qingqiu. If it weren't for that prohibition, he would have gone to ask himself. Liu Mingyan is supposedly a more subtle option, but he's starting to rethink it.

“No interest, just concern.” He crosses his arms, ignoring his sister's insightful gaze. “He is acting weird. Rarer than usual.”

“Maybe you should leave him alone? You're always complaining about him. I don't think your relationship will improve if you continue like this.”

“That's the point: it's getting better. He...” Liu Qingge gulps, embarrassed at the thought of his qi deviation. And how Shen Qingqiu saved his life. “I am indebted to him. A debt of a lifetime.”

“You don't seem to hate being in debt to your worst enemy,” Liu Mingyan points out maliciously.

“Because since then he has changed! He talks to me and tries to reach agreements. Maybe I was wrong?”

Liu Qingge has always trusted his instincts. That is why he is terrified that he has wronged Shen Qingqiu. The same one that saved his life. The same one who never fights fair, who is smug and lazy, who started cultivating too late. The same one who protected the disciples the other night, ending up wounded. The same one who tried to stab him in the back and once promised he would kill him. The same…

He is no longer sure. The only certain thing is that he saved his life.

Liu Mingyan's laugh sounds like bells.

“I'm glad you two are getting along. After all, you've always had that obsession with him...”

“Mingyan!” He scolds her, stunned to hear those shameful words from his little sister's mouth, a pink tinge appearing on Liu Qingge’s cheeks.

“What? It’s true!” She scoffs. “You only talked about Shen-shibo!”

“They were complaints!”

“So what? You never talk about your disciples or your friends... Do you even have friends? It has always been Shen-shibo. First you complain because he bothers you. And now you complain because he doesn't bother you so much anymore.”

Liu Qingge stops in the middle of the street. Maybe his sister is right and his interest is because he wants to be friends with Shen Qingqiu? That would explain why he thinks so much about him. And gets worried whenever he is hurt. Liu Qingge believed that it was because of the debt, but that didn’t explain the need to gift him a fan or how he rejoices whenever he sees Shen Qingqiu use it. Nor why does he have the urge to impress him with a monster or to propose a night hunt together when he used to hate them before. 

I want to be his friend , he understands (wrongly).

Liu Mingyan gives him a subtle nudge. When Liu Qingge raises his head, he discovers Shen Qingqiu on the street. They both look at each other in awkward silence. They are too close to the Warm Red Pavilion. Liu Qingge can feign ignorance, after all, what would he do going to the Warm Red Pavilion with his little sister? It's stupid! However, Shen Qingqiu's presence is not so absurd and it also reminds him of the discussion they had.

“Oh, shidi,” Shen Qingqiu purrs, although there is something dangerous hidden in his voice. Liu Qingge feels a chill upon hearing him. “What are you doing here?”

“Walk. Accompany Mingyan.” 

He can perfectly notice how his sister rolls her eyes at his improvisational skills.

“Hm.”

Shen Qingqiu's gaze has always been suspicious and that day is no exception. He is always frowning as if he sees the worst in the world and people. Fortunately, he also has to understand how ridiculous it’s to imagine Liu Qingge heading to the Warm Red Pavilion with his little sister. However, now he has an even worse problem: Shen Qingqiu is clearly going to the Warm Red Pavilion. If it was already difficult for Liu Mingyan to ask questions without arousing suspicion, now it will be impossible.

He needs a new plan. He needs to get Shen Qingqiu away from the brothels while Liu Mingyan investigates.

“Come with me,” he babbles and Shen Qingqiu squints suspiciously. Liu Qingge definitely hates improvising and anything that doesn't involve a sword. “I bothered you the other day. Let me buy you a meal. As an apology.”

Now Shen Qingqiu looks surprised. Liu Mingyan gives him a support slap on the back. Although her face is hidden by a veil, he knows that she is smiling.

“This one has pending tasks. Shen-shibo, please take care of my brother,“ she bows before leaving. 

And the two of them are left alone, enveloped by an even more awkward silence. Liu Qingge waits for Shen Qingqiu's decision as he wonders how subtle it would be to carry him onto his shoulder and go away if he decides to continue to the Warm Red Pavilion. 

"Do you have a place in mind?"

His question surprises him. And it also makes him happy. It’s another proof that Shen Qingqiu is changing to be a nicer person.

“Mn, there is a place that I always go to with Liu Mingyan. She likes it.”

Liu Qingge only knows how to recognize weapons and talent, food is indifferent to him, so he trusts his sister's judgment. Shen Qingqiu nods and walks to his side, waiting for him to guide him.

After so many years of rivalry and arguments, it’s odd to walk alongside Shen Qingqiu without speaking. They aren’t used to silence, but rather to grunting and exchanging complaints before blows. They aren’t used to quiet, but to fight. However, Liu Qingge finds that it is okay to just walk, although he also feels nervous and impatient. He prefers silence to empty conversations or Shen Qingqiu's malice, so he doesn't try to start a conversation either.

Perhaps he could get used to that new relationship with Shen Qingqiu.

Perhaps... he wants to improve his relationship with Shen Qingqiu.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: What are the secondaries thinking?
Shang Qinghua: Why my villain is acting so OC??? SYSTEM!!!!
Liu Qingge: Mingyan is right, I have strong feelings of friendship for Shen Qingqqiu.
Liu Mingyan: ...I've never said that.

CURIOSITY # 1
I love writing Shen Jiu's POV. I have the headcanon that he is very intelligent, but his toxic feelings often prevent him from seeing the true reality. He suspects a traitor, but he has never thought that could be someone like Shang Qinghua. He is suffering because no one suspects that something has happened to him, but they do! Behind your back because they aren't idiots and they aren't going to say it to your face!

CURIOSITY # 2
Liu Qingge is going on a date with Shen Qingqiu! But with what Shen Qingqiu? Is it Shen Jiu who was really going to visit the brothels or is it Shen Yuan and Liu Qingge has again jumping to conclusions? >:D I want to start writing more scenes with the POV of other characters to see if you too can recognize the correct Shen.

CURIOSITY # 3
I hope our Liu-shidi had paid attention to the class. Shen Qingqiu has talked about terrible monsters... like succubi hehehehehehehehe

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

Liu Qingge and Shen Qingqiu go on a date and neither of them notices it

Chapter Notes

Congratulations, Shen Jiu and Liu Qingge! You have unlocked "The Most Uncomfortable Date"! Enjoy it! ❤️❤️

See the end of the chapter for more notes

There is an unwritten rule that ensures that in Shen Jiu's fate nothing turns out as he expected.

After a stressful morning dispelling Shang Qinghua's suspicions, he needs the comfort of the prostitutes at the Warm Red Pavilion. However, he has had to run into a thousand times inopportune Liu Qingge and his sister. To his surprise, instead of reproaching his obvious intention to go to a brothel, Liu Qingge has invited him for a meal. Perhaps he still hadn't realized his intentions. Liu Qingge is as blunt as innocent, so Shen Jiu agrees to avoid another of his speeches. And maybe that's a good chance to understand better what he's thinking and why he's acting so strange lately.

The two walk with no intention of breaking the silence. Hiding behind his fan, Shen Jiu watches over Liu Qingge. He's as proud as ever, moving with that battlefield arrogance that doesn't fit in the streets of a normal city. There is nothing wrong with him, but since Shen Yuan's arrival, he has been acting weird. And that worries him because his new attitude is sticky and suffocating, plus he already has had several opportunities to discover them.

Perhaps Shen Jiu should listen to Shen Yuan's proposals to compensate Luo Binghe for his guard dog activities. To his misfortune, their secret persists thanks to that irritating teenager.

Liu Qingge stops when he reaches a nice-looking local. It is a quiet place surrounded by a sweet aroma. It doesn't seem like a site that someone like the War God would visit regularly and that idea makes Shen Jiu laugh maliciously. However, Liu Qingge knows where to go and even the best table, set apart from the rest in a quiet corner.

“Wow, shidi,” he says when they sit down. “Your tastes continue to surprise me.”

“Mingyan,” he comments as an explanation.

That fits with what he knows about his detached personality, although Shen Jiu has another theory: good taste is part of the flesh of a rich boy like him. It’s another instinct, as his ability to fight. That irritates him. Shen Jiu has worked very hard to create the image of Shen Qingqiu and Liu Qingge, completely indifferent to social conventions, achieves it intuitively.

Other than the promise of a meal, nothing ties them together at that moment. The silence between them grows until it becomes immense and uncomfortable. Shen Jiu sighs as he thinks of different strategies to distract Liu Qingge and return to the Warm Red Pavilion without him suspecting anything.

In front of him, Liu Qingge frowns.

“Your classes have been good,” he concedes with a grunt. “I expected them differently.”

“Let me guess: more indecent stuff and fewer monsters?”

Liu Qingge nods. And they end up again trapped by silence. Shen Jiu can't believe that Liu Qingge, the same one who is absent from all Peak Lords meetings and only wakes up when he speaks, is looking for a topic to converse with. Shen Jiu fans himself as he gazes at his shidi with different eyes.

Why have you changed so suddenly?

“Did you find any monster interesting?” Shen Jiu asks him with false indifference and without understanding why he has fallen in his game.

There is a flash of enthusiasm in Liu Qingge's eyes.

“I was surprised that there were so many poisonous monsters,” he recognizes. “But they seem weak. My disciples will be able to defeat them without problems.”

“But did you listen to me when I talked about their properties or did you just stick with the names?” Shen Jiu makes an immense effort to not roll his eyes. “The problem is not defeating them, the problem is that if you don’t defeat them correctly, they can poison you with their saliva, spikes, and other fluids.”

“That is an interesting challenge.”

“It's not a challenge, shidi!”

“It also seemed to me that you exaggerated the information,” he adds, calm and collected, using the same voice as always that he separates the world between right and wrong. “I faced succubi as a disciple and nothing happened.”

“Nothing?” He repeats, incredulous. “Have you forgotten that you later showed up at Qing Jing Peak and chased me like a maniac to fight you? You broke a wall and a guqin!”

Liu Qingge frowns, confirming Shen Jiu's worst fears: yes, he had forgotten about that incident. As usual. Liu Qingge goes through life with his sword and ambitions, pursuing his goals as the worst of calamities. It is the privilege of having the power to answer to no one (perhaps Yue Qingyuan) and that no one has ever defeated him.

Shen Jiu huffs. Their conversation dies when Liu Qingge orders the food. Since he pays and knows the place, Shen Jiu lets him choose. A few minutes later, they are served various dishes that smell good but are not as tasty as Luo Binghe's food. Damn brat , he thinks as he picks up his chopsticks. If it weren't for Shen Yuan insisting on your glorious future, I would make you our cook and you would never touch a sword again. Nor a musical instrument .

They eat in silence. Inconsistently, Shen Jiu glances at Liu Qingge. On one of those occasions, he discovers that he is doing the same. They both hang their heads and pretend that nothing has happened.

“Do you like it?“ Liu Qingge asks with a hint of uncertainty in his voice as if his opinion matters to him. Which is absurd.

“Not bad. But the food at Qing Jing Peak is better. You would be surprised by the difference.”

Liu Qingge nods and a satisfied smile almost appears on his lips.

“Another day.”

Wait! Did you just invite yourself to my house for dinner? Shen Jiu looks at him with wide eyes, surprised at his nerve. Liu Qingge ignores his stunned gaze to distract him with another question.

“Last night hunt was good. We should repeat. For the disciples of course.”

Good? GOOD? Shen Jiu growls silently as he continues to eat. I'm not going on a trip with the brats and you again unless Yue Qingyuan begs me. But Liu Qingge's eyes shine with that determination that no one had managed to quench and that he had seldom managed to blur. Maybe next time Shen Yuan can go to my place... What am I thinking? I can't give Xiu Ya to him! And without my sword, others will be suspicious. And maybe it will be several nights. It is too dangerous for him.

Perhaps Liu Qingge could take all the disciples away? It's the perfect answer: no snooping for a few days, his peak quiet, and he and Shen Yuan could leave the house together. Shen Jiu sighs at the thought of everything that can go terribly wrong by leaving Liu Qingge in charge of so many mindless teenagers.

They finish eating, alternating between silence and a brief exchange of questions and comments that are more reminiscent of an interrogation. When they get up to leave, Shen Jiu is so eager to get away from him that he bumps into a young woman carrying a tray. Several cups of tea spilled all over him, splashing his robe and ruining his paper fan hopelessly.

“Are you fine?” Liu Qingge walks over, but he slaps him away.

At least he's smart enough to not bother him when he's so furious.

Forgetting the Warm Red Pavilion, Shen Qingqiu unsheathes Xiu Ya to fly back to the sect. The day has gone from bad to worse and when he lands on Qing Jing Peak, the first thing he does is look for Luo Binghe, who is training with Ming Fan and Ning Yingying.

“Luo Binghe!” He calls him. “Watch out for Liu Qingge to never get near the peak again.”

It is an impossible mission given how stubborn his shidi is, however, the brat's eyes shine with the intensity of all the stars in the sky and he responds with a huge smile.

“Yes, shizun!”

Of course, the day can end even worse. When Shen Jiu is about to reach his bamboo house, appears the last person he expected to see and with whom he is in no mood to ignore her reproaches: Qi Qingqi.

 

 

Qi Qingqi surprised the two of them.

Shen Yuan had considered her one of the most difficult targets in his new plan How to Improve the Opinion of the Rest of Peak Lords About the Scum Villain , yet she showed up at Qing Jing Peak to announce that she had been keeping an eye on his classes and was content with allowing Shen Qingqiu to explain her disciples about monsters. With her conditions, of course.

Shen Qingqiu told their conversation to Shen Yuan after venting about his stressful day while Shen Yuan reaffirmed his opinion that he was quite dramatic. Liu-shidi has invited him to eat and above he complains? The audacity!

“You will deal with Qi Qingqi and the Xian Shu Peak girls tomorrow,” he growled. “I have no patience to bear their nonsense and you also know the lesson.”

And so, Shen Yuan is enjoying a beautiful day at Qing Jing Peak followed by Luo Binghe and Ning Yingying. He has sent the rest of the teenagers to write another essay to please Shen Qingqiu and he has taken those two to receive the disciples of Xian Shu Peak. Shen Yuan chuckles at the thought that thanks to his ingenuity, he is going to gift Luo Binghe a golden moment with his two future main wives. It's time for the ships to set sail!

Since Qi Qingqi refuses to let the infamous and perverted Shen Qingqiu step on her peak, she has brought her disciples to Qing Jing Peak. Of course, she will also be present during the class and will examine him. That last part makes him a bit nervous, but Shen Yuan is willing to improve her image of Shen Qingqiu.

“Yingying, please guide the disciples. Binghe, do you see the girl with a veil? It's Qi Qingqi's head disciple, take the bestiaries to her.” 

Shen Yuan hides a satisfied smile behind his fan as he watches his white lotus approach Liu Mingyan. He is a bit sorry for Liu Qingge's sister, no one can resist Luo Binghe's charming smile! They will no longer be joined by revenge against Shen Qingqiu (he wishes), so now they have a chance for a sweeter and more beautiful love to bloom.

Shen Yuan is still keeping an eye on them as he walks to meet Qi Qingqi. Of all the Peak Lords, she is the one who scares him the most. He is not surprised that even Luo Binghe did let her live in PIDW without joining his harem.

“Greetings, shimei.” Shen Yuan knows how to be polite. Shen Qingqiu has persecuted him for several days to correct his posture and mannerisms, yet that morning he tries to be more elegant than arrogant.

She gazes at him as if searching for the seven differences between him and the original. Shen Yuan gulps, nervous that perhaps Qi Qingqi suspects their secret.

“Shizun!” Luo Binghe yells, almost crying in frustration, before a thud lands on the grass, causing the wind to shake their clothes.

Shen Yuan blinks without understanding what Liu Qingge is doing here again. 

Quickly, he covers his face with the fan to not reveal his surprised expression. Liu Qingge walks towards them with his usual confidence as if his presence is as normal as the smiling girls sitting on the ground or Qi Qingqi.

“Greetings also for Liu-shidi,” he manages to say nervously. “What brings you to my peak? I am busy with Xian Shu Peak.”

Liu Qingge frowns and examines him entirely until his gaze stops on his hand. Shen Yuan trembles, beginning to suspect that this is a trap from the Peak Lords who have discovered their secret. He remains silent as Qi Qingqi greets Liu Qingge, just as shocked as he is, but far more amused by the situation. There is mockery in her voice and a malicious glint in her eyes when she mentions Liu Mingyan's name.

After answering Qi Qingqi's questions, Liu Qingge stretches out his arm towards Shen Yuan. And he hands him a fan.

A very nice fan, by the way, white with black cranes, but that still does not explain what he does there.

“Yours was ruined because of me,” he finally says. “For you.”

Shen Yuan catches it remembering Shen Qingqiu's complaints about their encounter. Although he knows that he should give it to the real Shen Qingqiu, Shen Yuan hopes he can keep it. It’s very pretty, like the other one he gave him, and Shen Qingqiu has thousands of fans.

“Thanks, shidi. I really appreciate it.” A sincere smile escapes Shen Yuan, terribly OC, but he doesn't care. His mission is to earn Affection Points with all the Peak Lords!

Liu Qingge is smiling too, so his plan is working. Now is the time to surprise Qi Qingqi with his knowledge of monsters. Turning around, he discovers that Ning Yingying and Liu Mingyan are pulling Luo Binghe's cheekbones.

( "Liu-shishu and shizun make a good couple, right?" Had commented Ning Yingying cheerfully.

“NO!” Luo Binghe's eyes widened in horror. “Shizun doesn't want to see him! They always argue. Even shizun has personally asked me to keep Liu-shishu away.” He added the latter proudly, puffing out his chest.

The two girls laughed.

“I don't think they will argue much more. My brother wants to improve his relationship with Shen-shibo,” Liu Mingyan whispered enigmatically. “Look at them: I don't think they are going to argue much today.”

“They seem so happy! Even Shizun has blushed!”

Luo Binghe had also blushed, but from a mix of envy and rage, also upon discovering how adorable his shizun was.

“I'm going to kick him out!”

“No, you don’t!” They laughed, prodding his cheeks to keep him still. “In any case, he will kick you out.” )

Oh, the love of youth. Shen Yuan thinks while humming. He wishes to freeze the time at that moment: Luo Binghe being an adorable white lotus enjoying his adolescent loves, Liu Qingge acting like a potential friend would, and Qi Qingqi still hadn't snarled at him with her usual sarcasm. However, Shen Yuan feels a chill as he remembers that the Alliance Conference is approaching. And, although he tries to ignore that thought, he has frost in his stomach, a bitter taste in his mouth.

Shen Yuan still hasn't dared to ask the System if he can avoid pushing Luo Binghe into the Abyss. And he won’t do it now, but later.

Instead of leaving, Ning Yingying sits down with Liu Mingyan and the other female disciples. After hesitating, Luo Binghe joins his future wives, although the boy is more tense than usual and doesn’t stop giving Liu Qingge grim looks. Shen Yuan almost laughs. Don't worry, Binghe . He smirks behind his fan. Liu-shidi won’t be a match for your harem. You will have to earn his approval when you ask for Liu Mingyan's hand, though .

Speaking about Liu Qingge, he also stays, but together with Qi Qingqi, and at times they both converse in low voices.

Shen Yuan talks to them with great enthusiasm about monsters and their poisonings. Although he has rehearsed together with Shen Qingqiu, it is the first time that he has explained it in front of other people and that makes him feel a bit nervous, but he quickly forgets the tension and ends up enjoying the lesson. The best is when he finishes and can answer the doubts of their disciples. Even though that class is not for Luo Binghe, he is the one who raises his arm the most times. Shen Yuan allows him, as he does with his usual happiness. This protagonist, so interested in future papapa plots! He looks like a bun but has a stallion's heart.

When Qi Qingqi is gathering his female disciples to return to his peak, Liu Qingge walks over to him. Shen Yuan looks at him curiously, ignoring Luo Binghe's sour gazes and Ning Yingying and Liu Mingyan's laughter.

“This time you have told it differently,” he points as he stands next to Shen Yuan.

Were you actually listening, shidi? For the second time? Shen Yuan blinks, stunned and speechless. Fuck what Shen Qingqiu thinks, I want you by my side! You are best friend material!

But before making plans for the future, he first has to dispel possible suspicions. Shen Yuan plays with the fan while he smiles at him. He knows that his smiles always confuse Liu Qingge.

“It's boring to always say the same thing with the same words, don't you think Liu-shidi? So you will not be bored.”

A faint blush colors his cheeks. Cute , Shen Yuan thinks.

“You could have told more details about those monsters. It would have been more interesting,” he mutters without his usual complaints.

“Mn… Perhaps next time.”

Liu Qingge looks into his eyes and nods.

“Next time,” he says before turning around and leaving.

Shen Yuan doesn’t have time to conclude his strange attitude, as two disciples run towards him with affectionate intentions even though they can’t hug Shen Qingqiu . But he always makes an exception, so he pats Ning Yingying and Luo Binghe's heads before saying goodbye and heading back to the bamboo house.

“How has it been?” Shen Qingqiu asks him when he walks in.

Surrounded by OOC characters, Shen Yuan is increasingly aware of how rare the original Shen Qingqiu is. Of the two, he is the one who least follows the PIDW script, which is positive for their survival.

His plans have changed: now they have to survive together, as fate has tied them to the same future. Shen Yuan closes his eyes as he decides that the other will be Shen Jiu. He needs to see him as a different person instead of the character he hated so much. And in his heart, he feels that there is a difference between Shen Qingqiu and Shen Jiu .

“It has been great!”

He babbles as he finishes closing the door. His enthusiasm is real and Shen Yuan immediately forgets his doubts to tell him everything that has happened. Shen Jiu frowns upon hearing that Liu Qingge has bothered again, but Shen Yuan hands him the fan before he complains again.

“He wanted to apologize for the incident of the other day.”

He still hopes that Shen Jiu will reject it by associating with Liu Qingge, however, he lets out an appreciative sound and contemplates it with interest.

“It’s… unexpectedly nice,” he mutters.

Shen Yuan sighs even though inside he cries. Exhausted, he walks to his room to sit on the bed and face the truth that he has been avoiding all that time.

System, can we skip the Abyss Arc?

The System’s answer fills him with panic and anguish, with despair as he realizes that it is almost impossible to fight against destiny and perhaps all his efforts have been in vain.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: Status of the romance plot
Shen Yuan & Liu Qingge: I want to be your friend.
Shen Jiu: I want a vacation from the people.
Also Liu Qingge: Shen Qingqiu has invited me to eat at his Peak and to talk about more monsters. Everything is going well.
Luo Binghe: Isn't PIDW a story about my harem and not about Liu Qingge's harem? Author, I want to grow up!

 

*Qi Qingqi has joined Liu Mingyan and Ning Yingying's team of shippers*

 

CURIOSITY # 1
Let's bet: will the succubi subplot be different, or has Liu Qingge ignored Shen Qingqiu's two explanations about the dangers of their poison? >:3

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu has a nightmare

Chapter Summary

An ideal night to improve their sibling relationship.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Stress is a monster woven with dark feelings and Shen Jiu had let it grow.

The monster is immense and that night it traps Shen Jiu in a heavy sleep, similar to sinking into the black waters of an abyss. The nightmare begins as always: with the fire that devours the Qiu mansion. But from the ashes emerges familiar figures that he recognizes as their features were drawn: Yue Qingyuan, Liu Qingge, Mu Qingfang... All the Peak Lords gather around him along with his disciples. Shen Jiu watches as they discover his secret and everyone, absolutely everyone, chooses Shen Yuan.

The familiar fear of losing everything grows until engulfing him. Shen Jiu wants to speak, but he can’t find his voice. He can only see how Shen Yuan laughs innocently and that makes the disciples happy. Liu Qingge also smiles before giving him another fan and Yue Qingyuan looks less tired and more of the Qi-Ge of the past. Shen Jiu is trapped by cobweb-like shadows and cannot move. But the weight of the darkness is lightened when Shen Yuan turns and looks at him and also smiles at him and reaches out a hand to him and…

He disappears. Between dust and bamboo leaves.

And a hole grows in his chest. It’s an old fear that opens like a mouth to devour him whole and Shen Jiu falls as everything disappears. He falls and falls and...

Shen Jiu awakens with ragged breathing and the echo of the nightmare tangled in his heart. His hand holding the sheets is shaking. Although he got used to bad dreams in the past, so much has happened since the last nightmare that he feels some uncertainty. Shen Jiu lets out a growl as he rubs his eyes.

He doesn’t remember what he has dreamed of, only fleeting images and emotions. Perhaps I have dreamed again when Qi-Ge abandoned me? he thinks with a frown. What he does remember is that before waking up someone hugged him. It was a brief but comforting hug that made him feel like he isn’t alone.

What nonsense.

Although the nightmare is over, Shen Jiu has escaped from one prison to end up in the nets of insomnia. Aware that that night he won’t rest (and he’s afraid to try again), he gets out of bed and places a green robe over his inner robes. Shen Jiu moves by inertia, trying to erase his last memories of the dream. He has no purpose, however, he stops when he discovers that there is light in Shen Yuan's room. After letting out a hiss, although he heads towards it with impatient steps, he opens the door carefully. Just in case.

He is not surprised to find that Shen Yuan is still reading a bestiary without realizing that it’s dark outside the window. Shen Jiu clears his throat and his double startles, closing the book guiltily.

“What?” He splutters. “Who? What time is it?”

“Late,” he growls.

Shen Yuan giggles nervously as he rubs his eyes. What a way to waste your cultivation, voluntarily deciding to not sleep to continue reading something rather than waiting for the next day , Shen Jiu huffs.

“Sorry, did I wake you up?”

Shen Jiu decides to not answer, although he hesitates between a lie and a half-truth. In the end, he shrugs and finishes opening the door with a gentle kick.

“Since you are not sleepy, follow me.”

Shen Yuan lets out a muffled complaint that means perfectly: Yes, I'm sleepy, it's just that I was reading something very exciting and I couldn't stop, but now I feel my eyes close . Shen Jiu doesn't care. He picks up his guqin and hands it to Shen Yuan, who looks at him first and then at the instrument with wide eyes with curiosity.

“I've never heard you play,” he explains, sitting in front of the table. “Your calligraphy is pretty decent and you also know how to defend yourself with the sword, but if you want to teach the brats music you need to have the level worthy of the Lord of Qing Jing Peak.”

“Oh,” he mutters, still surprised.

Shen Yuan sits in front of him, the guqin on his knees. He is about to start playing when Shen Jiu cuts him off with a gesture.

“What songs do you know?”

Shen Yuan nervously lowers his gaze and responds with stutters. Shen Jiu frowns, wary of his doubts. All the melodies that Shen Yuan has mentioned are traditional in Qing Jing Peak, but that is not enough to pass his exam. Shen Jiu orders him to play a fragment of all of them. He plays the guqin reflecting the same doubts with which he has responded.

“You know the melody, but you hesitate too much and that causes you to lose harmony,” he points at him. Before correcting his mistakes, Shen Jiu needs to know the cause behind them. “I make you nervous?”

“A little,” he acknowledges with a sigh.

“Why? We are alone and not surrounded by twenty squeaky brats.”

Shen Jiu finds that even more stressful.

“Because they will forgive me for any mistakes...” he murmurs. “But you...”

Shen Yuan mutes when Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow. No, he's not going to forgive him for any mistakes, but he's not a monster either. Shen Jiu takes a deep breath, although this is one of those times when he doesn't feel anger building in his chest. The nightmare has left him tired and vulnerable.

“I won’t punish you.” Shen Jiu crosses his arms as he stares at him. “But I'm not going to let you get away either: you will learn how to play the guqin perfectly.”

“For the classes?”

Shen Yuan looks confused. Shen Jiu ignores him, although deep down he also doesn’t know why he has made that decision. Perhaps out of pride, perhaps because he needs an excuse to not go back to bed, and music has always accompanied him on sleepless nights.

“I'm not going to punish you,” he repeats. “If you learn to play correctly, you will be able to teach more. So relax.”

Shen Jiu is aware that his rough words, almost orders, are not the most suitable for anyone to relax. But he doesn't know how to speak kinder either. Instead of listening to him, Shen Yuan rests his hands on the instrument.

“Can I tell you something without you getting angry?”

“I can try.”

Shen Jiu never makes promises that he cannot keep.

“I don’t know how to play.”

“That’s ridiculous,” Shen Jiu frowns. “You haven’t done well, but it has been a better disaster than most of those who are starting.”

He has deduced from his words and his own suspicions that Shen Yuan had to learn recently to fill his role.

“I didn’t know how to play, but I received the ability when I occupied your body. Just like fighting or spiritual powers.”

Yes, Shen Jiu has a good reason to be angry. He hasn’t only tried to steal his position and name, but also all the skills he has acquired after years of suffering. He has literally bled to get so far but someone (perhaps a heavenly official?) would decide to eliminate him and put an imitator in his place, gifting him his talent.

Oblivious to his furious thoughts, Shen Yuan continues speaking.

“Although I know how to play the guqin, I don't know the songs. Do you understand me? In my first days, I asked the disciples what their favorite songs were. I memorized the names and then asked them to play them to try to learn them myself.” He lets out a sigh. “With you, I am nervous because you will know how to recognize if the songs I am playing correctly or I have invented them.”

“So they blessed you with a musical talent,” he splutters, still shaken with envy. “How lucky you are.”

“I didn't want to be here either, okay?” The two look at each other. Shen Yuan seems nervous, also a bit annoyed. “I didn't want to have to learn to be you or follow a script to make things happen, even if I hate it.”

Shen Jiu suspects that there is something else hidden in his voice, but Shen Yuan plunges back into the hermetic silence of the early days when they still didn’t trust each other. Shen Jiu gets up and walks towards him, ignoring Shen Yuan's tense posture. He sits down next to him and slides the instrument so that it is between them. That is a gesture that he wouldn’t have made on another occasion, but some words from Shen Yuan have made him shake.

“Although I hate that you have benefited from my abilities, I recognize that you also have your merit,” he says in a low voice as if is afraid someone else might hear that moment of weakness. “I guess you also have to work hard to be Shen Qingqiu even if it has been in a different way than mine.”

Shen Yuan is looking at him, still fearful in his eyes, but also intrigued and suspicious.

“Are you okay?” He finally says. “You look pale. Are you sick? Have you poisoned yourself again?”

“Shen Yuan!” Shen Jiu hisses. “I also consider that you have acted stupidly. If you don't know how to play, you may have told me to teach you.”

“You hate to teach!”

That’s true.

“You don't go to bed tonight until you learn a song correctly,” he ignores him. “If you're not sleepy and need to kill time with boring bestiaries, don't worry, we can spend the nights perfecting the four arts.”

Shen Yuan is visibly horrified and Shen Jiu can't take it anymore and ends up laughing.

“Are you making fun of me? You have a sense of humor!!!!” Shen Yuan is still restless, but he just joins his laugh. It doesn't last long. “Because it's a joke, right?”

His voice trembles and Shen Jiu is very tempted to say no, but in the end, he sighs and nods.

“Partially. I appreciate my hours of sleep and you should do the same. If you continue to stay awake, I will confiscate your bestiaries. Or I will send you calligraphy exercises so that you can make better use of your time.”

“Or fall asleep of boredom,” he grumbles. “Ey! You said the other day that my calligraphy was fine!”

“Fine it’s not excellent.”

“Your standards are impossible. You know, right?”

“If I can do it, you, precisely you, also can.”

Shen Yuan grumbles as he runs out of arguments Shen Jiu notes with satisfaction that victory. He begins to play some random notes under the watchful eye of Shen Yuan, slightly dazed by sleep.

They remain for a while in a silence dotted with musical notes. Until Shen Yuan speaks again.

“Were you serious about teaching me?” He asks uncertainly, playing with the edges of his sleeves.

“Mn.” Shen Jiu stops playing while appreciating one of those comments that he has made earlier. Shen Yuan is right: he hates teaching, although he is capable of making only one exception. “We could make a schedule.”

“So you can teach me and balance your Peak Lord duties?”

“No. On dividing up Shen Qingqiu's tasks between ourselves.”

It's funny, but this is the first time that he has spoken of Shen Qingqiu as if he were someone else. And it is liberating. To be Shen Qingqiu means to represent every day a figure that he has created from nothing and that must be absolutely perfect. And it’s tiring. Until Shen Yuan appeared, he hadn't realized how frustrated he was living a lie that he had locked himself in.

“We can divide up the different classes and alternate between your... strange excursions with my theory classes.” Shen Jiu pretends to focus on the guqin strings to ignore Shen Yuan's bright gaze, the wide smile that he is drawing. “We can alternate between mornings and afternoons, so we can both go out every day. We can also work together on Shen Qingqiu Peak Lord's duties.”

A malevolent smirk escapes him at the thought that everyone else will be shocked by Shen Qingqiu's inhuman efficiency. 

“That’s… Great!” Shen Yuan reacts as he had intuited: with genuine joy and that typical enthusiasm before planning something new. “Should we start the schedule now?”

“No. I already told you: you don't go to bed until you learn a song.”

Shen Jiu ignores all his complaints and starts to play one of the simplest melodies.

 

 

Shen Jiu is a horrible person who has left him without sleep and also forces him to get up early. Shen Yuan grunts and yawns when the two of them eat their breakfast. He is left with the consolation that Luo Binghe's food is still delicious and is a good reason for getting out of bed. Shen Yuan feels those horrible regrets again when he thinks about Luo Binghe's fate.

He glances at Shen Jiu. Last night he definitely became a different person from the scum villain. And that makes him feel even more uncomfortable when he remembers his future. Their future. Shen Yuan puts down the chopsticks and takes a deep breath. Shen Jiu made an unexpected decision that ended up breaking the chains between them. However, he still hides many secrets.

“I need to talk to you about the Alliance Conference.”

Shen Jiu raises his head. He seems intrigued, though he immediately frowns.

“Another event that you know and that should happen as you have been told?”

Shen Yuan is surprised by his sagacity. He nods, still hesitating for the right words to present his dilemma to him. And if he should tell him the truth about Luo Binghe.

“Let me guess: that brat Luo Binghe will win.”

“Indeed. He will start without attracting attention, as he will end up protecting a very large group of disciples from other sects. Especially the Huan Hua Palace...”

“Why doesn’t it surprise me?” Shen Jiu clicks his tongue, annoyed. “That sect is a nest of vermin. If you don't have the level, then don't show up to the Alliance Conference or disturb my disciple.”

Shen Yuan would have laughed at his reaction if the uneasiness weren't a twisted snake in his stomach.

“However, Luo Binghe will win in the end.”

“Should I be surprised?” His words are sour and dismissive.

“Luo Binghe will face Nu yuan chan, various human-headed spiders, and finally defeat a Moon Python Rhinoceros.”

Shen Jiu, who had rolled his eyes, regains his composure.

“What are you talking about? Those monsters are too dangerous for the disciples to be in the Alliance Conference.”

“And… that’s the problem.”

Chapter End Notes

New achievement unlocked: teach your non-brother ✅
New achievement unlocked: joke with your non-brother ✅

 

That dream is important. Don't be like Shen Jiu and don't forget it 👀

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Yuan misinterprets Luo Binghe's words and Shen Jiu misinterprets Shen Yuan's

Chapter Notes

Aish, misunderstandings... Chaos is guaranteed!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Hiding behind his fan, Shen Yuan watches over the disciples. His gaze is fixed on Luo Binghe, who seems to show off sword exercises more than usual. Surely to impress Ning Yingying. On another occasion, Shen Yuan would have laughed at his innocent attempts to attract attention, but that morning he feels bitter discomfort as he remembers that that sword will be shattered.

"Luo Binghe, come here." Shen Yuan calls him when the disciples finish their exercises.

Luo Binghe reacts immediately. He runs up to him with the same enthusiasm as a pomeranian puppy. Shen Yuan can't help but wonder if that will be the last time he will see his smile. His thoughts are irrational, but he is not only afraid of what he can become but also feels immense sadness. Shen Yuan already suffered reading his story, but this time it's worse now that he knows Luo Binghe is real.

“Yes, shizun?” He asks with bright eyes.

“Do you want to be strong?”

Although Luo Binghe still smiles, his expression becomes more serious and determined.

“Yes, shizun! I...” The boy looks into his eyes with the intensity of a shonen protagonist. “I want to be strong so I can protect the one dearest to me, no matter what hardships I will suffer.”

Shen Yuan sighs before ruffling Luo Binghe's hair. Sorry , he thinks when Luo Binghe returns together with the rest of the disciples. But nothing will make you stronger than the Abyss . He is left with the smallest consolation that this is Luo Binghe's wish.

After talking to Luo Binghe and making a horrible decision that he is afraid he’ll regret, Shen Yuan looks away at the bamboo house. His lungs swell with determination as he decides that he will also tell the truth about Luo Binghe to Shen Jiu. However, the System beeps, loud and annoying. Shen Yuan curses silently as he raises a hand to his head. He may not be able to reveal Luo Binghe's secret aloud, but Shen Jiu is smart. Perhaps there is another way to tell him the truth without him being punished.

 

 

Shen Jiu crosses out Ning Yingying's name from the list of candidates for the Alliance Conference. He frowns as he wonders if it will be suspicious to also remove his Head Disciple. And everyone else except Luo Binghe. Although that decision would only protect his own, all the other brats remain in mortal danger. Shen Yuan doesn’t know the exact numbers or even which peaks will be hit the hardest.

In a fit of rage, Shen Jiu smashes the list with his qi. He hates feeling cornered. Although he is supposed to be Cang Qiong Sect's strategy and also has unique information about the future, he is caught in doubts. Shen Yuan hasn’t confirmed it, but Shen Jiu suspects that the demons' involvement is part of the sabotage. Perhaps related to the last demon invasion. If he sends a few brats, it will be a way of shouting that he knows what is going to happen. That will make him a traitor and Shang Qinghua already suspects him. Shen Jiu doesn't want to be wrongly accused, but the only way to avoid it is to do nothing and have the brats die. That would be playing the demon’s game, which makes him feel even more furious.

The third option is to avoid the Alliance Conference.

But then Shen Yuan will die.

Shen Jiu clenches his fists until he digs his nails. For some inexplicable reason, the prospect of Shen Yuan dying fills him with an icy feeling. After all, he is still a despicable person, cruel and selfish, capable of allowing a massacre because he doesn’t want to feel alone again. His gaze looks for the door to the secondary room. Shen Yuan's room. There must be something wrong with him to have started to care about someone dangerous, with too many secrets, and who started as his prisoner. His mistrust insists that everything can be part of a devious trap. Shen Yuan's concern may be false, perhaps he is trying to deceive him to gain freedom and, one day, impersonate him permanently. But Shen Jiu begins to get tired of so many doubts and something inside him treasures those last weeks.

The door opens. Shen Yuan enters with the same sullen spirit with which he told him the truth about the Alliance Conference. Shen Jiu wants to believe that he is not pretending. Shen Yuan is too soft, he loves those brats and it is hard for him to sleep thinking that they might die.

Shen Jiu wants to promise him that he will fix it. And that is stupid, irrational, and dangerous. Shen Jiu hates those kinds of promises, but he feels the urge on the tip of his tongue. What matters is not the words, but the magic they hide, capable of making a special person smile.

“Don't worry so much and assume it.” He growls instead. “If you don't want to die, accept that others will suffer.”

That is his roundabout way of acknowledging that he won't allow Shen Yuan to die.

Shen Yuan lets out a groan. He begins to wander around the room with increasingly restless and impatient steps. At this rate, Shen Jiu will also become dizzy.

“There's something I haven't told you about Luo Binghe. I can't tell you directly either,” he starts, gesturing very quickly with the fan. “So, please listen to me carefully: the last monster that Luo Binghe will defeat will be the Moon Python Rhinoceros. Then his sword will break.”

Shen Yuan pauses, biting his lip as he raises a hand to his head. As if it’s hurting him. Shen Jiu doesn't think about what he's doing when he rises from the table to walk toward him with impatient strides, instigated by stress and that visceral, suffocating fear that he shouldn't feel.

“I’m fine...” he splutters with his eyes closed when Shen Jiu grabs his wrist to convey qi to him. “As I was saying...”

“I don't care about the damn Luo Binghe,” he hisses. “What’s wrong with you?”

Shen Yuan takes a deep breath. Although he manages to open his eyes, he is still pale.

“Nothing. It’s just a headache.”

“If you can't say it, don't say it.”

Shen Jiu hates feeling that irrational panic, which reminds him of when he was a miserable child on the street and every night he fell asleep fearing that Qi-Ge would disappear when he opened his eyes.

“It’s fine. I'm not going to tell you anything that I can't tell you, but it's important to the story that you know some details.” Shen Yuan growls through his teeth. And although they are alone, he acts like he is talking to someone else. Shen Jiu notices a chill down the back of his neck, wondering not for the first time if they are being watched by someone invisible or superhuman. A god perhaps. “A rift will open to the Endless Abyss.”

“WHAT?”

“Luo Binghe must fall in the Abyss.” It seems that the threat has freed Shen Yuan, as he speaks more confidently. “But he will survive.”

Shen Jiu huffs, turning away from Shen Yuan now that he knows he's okay. However, he grabs his arm.

“He will survive in the Abyss, the place where all mortals perish and only the most powerful creatures...” he coughs, “...demons...” he coughs again. ”...survive, do you understand what that means?”

Shen Jiu frowns in disgust. He already knew that the fate of that brat was special, but that's too much. At another time, it would have been inconceivable to him, but after so long Shen Jiu discovers that he trusts Shen Yuan's prophecies. The envy that poisons his heart grows as he accepts that Luo Binghe will be the first human to survive the Endless Abyss.

He clicks his tongue as he turns his back on him to hide his ridiculous feelings.

“It means that you don't have to worry about that brat.”

“He will suffer hell for five years!”

“That's nothing,” he mutters as he remembers his own hell. “Five years, huh? And for sure he will return stronger and more powerful.”

“Yes!” Shen Yuan yells, almost exclaims, with an odd expression. Not quite excited, rather stressed. “In the Abyss, Luo Binghe will grow to his full potential. He will face a lot of huge, poisonous, and deadly monsters. Although he will defeat them all, he will suffer during all those fights. He... He will return in a rage. It could be said that our white lotus dies in the abyss.”

“What white lotus?” He rolls his eyes. “ We don’t have any white lotus.”

Shen Jiu recognizes how stupid it is to envy a boy whose destiny is to suffer an unimaginable hell for five years, but he can't help but think that Luo Binghe is lucky. According to Shen Yuan, that will make him stronger, while Shen Jiu's hell broke his future and filled him with fear, with invisible wounds that still bleed. Many years have passed, but his past still marks his character, his relationship with everyone else, his coldness in reacting to his disciple’s misfortune.

“In the Abyss, he will find a sword...”

“Oh!” Shen Jiu can no longer control himself and releases all his poisonous sarcasm. “Lucky him! His spirit sword breaks, but he will eventually find one at the bottom of the Endless Abyss. Let me guess, will it also be a special sword?”

“Yes! But it won’t be a spiritual sword. You will never find a spirit sword in the Abyss. But it will be a very powerful sword, famous for its non-spiritual energy. You know, that other energy that is so abundant in a demonic place...”

“Got it, it's a demon sword.” He frowns. “Don't tell me that he will master it too.”

Shen Yuan nods, perhaps a little uneasy at his icy gaze. At that moment he is no longer surprised that Luo Binghe, a talented cook and tenacious survivor, can achieve the impossible of mastering a demonic sword.

“But that will have a cost, right?” He desperately needs to hear something negative about Luo Binghe.

Shen Yuan nods again.

“He will tend to suffer from qi deviations. But he will discover that he can reverse the effects of the sword with dual cultivation.”

Shen Jiu decides to ignore the thought that Shen Yuan wanted to teach dual cultivation for Luo Binghe's sake. He raises the fan to the tip of his lips while he values that information. It is an unorthodox method, but some human cultivators compensated the demonic energy of swords, talismans, and other artifacts with such strategies.

“But if it's a sword as powerful as you say, he'll need..." He rubs his eyes as he sighs. "How many?”

“A lot of. I lost count, but I think he will marry three hundred women.”

Shen Jiu looks at him with wide eyes. Every piece of information he discovers is more ridiculous than the last.

“Are you kidding me?”

“No. And many of his marriages will be very important. He will marry the Little Palace Mistress from Huan Hua Palace, so...”

“He will become the lord of the Huan Hua Palace,” he completes between grunts. “Why are you worried about him? That brat will have it all in life after a little trip through hell.”

“I’m worried about us!”

Shen Jiu ignores him. He is still assimilating that Luo Binghe, a hideously talented but normal person like the rest, survives the Endless Abyss, masters a demon sword, and becomes the lord of the Huan Hua Palace. Reluctantly, he begins to accept it. But the three hundred women seems a scandal to him.

“Haven't you been kidding me? Where will he find so many female cultivators?”

“Not all of them will be cultivators.”

“Normal women?”

“Not all of them...” Shen Yuan is staring into his eyes very intently as if he needs him to solve a riddle that he hasn’t said. “Not all will be human.”

Shen Jiu almost broke the fan.

“DEMONS TOO?”

Shen Yuan nods, looking away.

“To return he will have to go through the Demon Realm. He won’t do it peacefully.”

It is as if all the pieces of an enigma have begun to fit together.

“Thanks to Luo Binghe, will the fights between humans and demons end?”

“It could be said that he will unite both realms.”

Shen Jiu thinks he understands what Shen Yuan was referring to when he told him when they met that Luo Binghe's fate was so special. The true story of that boy will begin with the Alliance Conference when he defeats those legendary monsters. Then he will fall to the Endless Abyss where he will survive, find a demonic sword, and be able to master it. So, perhaps enraged against the demons that ruined his life in the Alliance Conference, he will destroy the Demon Realm and become a human hero.

The force that has brought Shen Yuan must be a Heavenly Officer. After destroying demons, becoming the lord of the Huan Hua Palace, and marrying an endless harem, it stands to reason for Luo Binghe to ascend to the Heavens.

Comparisons are useless, yet Shen Jiu feels miserable comparing his life to his. Is his destiny ultimately limited to being the chosen child's shizun? Well, it's better than being a slave. Although reluctantly and enviously, Shen Jiu can aspire to gain power alongside Luo Binghe. The brat is very innocent and seems to always listen to him with enthusiasm. Also, he cooks very well and he wants to continue enjoying his food.

“There are still a few months until the Alliance Conference,” he says. “Let's get that little beast ready. And let's think of a way to prevent the rest of the useless from dying.”

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Shen Yuan: See if you can solve my riddle! Luo Binghe will survive in a place where absolutely all humans die and only the strongest demons thrive. Luo Binghe will master a demon sword. Luo Binghe will conquer the Demon Realm and have demonic wives. What will Luo Binghe be?
a) A normal person.
b) A powerful Demon Lord.
c) An honorable human cultivator.
Shen Jiu: C.

CURIOSITY # 1
They have deleted the page where I read Scumbug, so I can't check the exact dialogs anymore. Let's pretend that the characters act and speak differently from the original since they are having different experiences in this fic. * applicable to the rest of the story *

CURIOSITY # 2
Isn't it wonderful when all the characters have made up their own story in their heads and none of them are aware of what is really going on? *evil laugh*

ANOTHER BONUS: Summary of 'Found Brother' according to the characters.
Shen Yuan: I have transmigrated to PIDW. I am the prisoner of the scum villain... But maybe the villain is not really bad people? But we can't escape the PIDW plot...
Shen Jiu: My life has been horrible, but suddenly there is a person who makes me feel better, even though I don't want to accept it. Also, it seems that my disciple will be a hero. Disgusting.
Liu Qingge: Shen Qingqiu has been acting strange since he saved my life. Now I want to be his friend and do friend things with him.
Liu Mingyan: My brother is an idiot and needs my help.
Luo Binghe: I am the happiest person in the world who also has the best shizun. I have to protect shizun from Liu-shishu's evil intentions!

 

In the next chapter we finally get a double ration of Liu-shidi!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter
✰ Tumblr

Liu Qingge and Shen Qingqiu have a double date

Chapter Notes

Do you remember that Shen Qingqiu had promised Liu Qingge two dates? Liu Qingge does.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Shen Jiu is walking through Qing Jing Peak carrying a pile of scrolls when he sees several disciples practicing with the sword. Once again, Luo Binghe stands out the most. Shen Jiu squints his eyes, torn between envy and his new interest in benefiting from the brat's future fame. After letting out a sigh, Shen Jiu approaches the disciples.

“Ming Fan!” He calls out to him. “Today you will accompany me to the Peak Lords' meeting.”

His Head Disciple bows his head.

“Yes, shizun!”

“Luo Binghe!” His gaze is now fixed on the other boy. “Your movements are pretentious. Trying to master techniques above your level is dangerous and counterproductive. You don't want to break your sword before the Alliance Conference, right?”

His concern, camouflaged with antipathy, is genuine. Without a sword, he would be forced to remove Luo Binghe from the list. And even if he could go with a training sword, Luo Binghe won't be able to defeat those monsters. His fate will be truncated and many will die.

“Sorry, shizun! This disciple wants to make shizun proud at the Alliance Conference.” Although the boy bows like Ming Fan, his admiration is different. He is just as loyal, but there is a spark of rebellion and determination in his eyes. “I promise that I will take care of Zheng Yang and that it will never break.”

Oh, be careful with your promises, child. Shen Jiu almost smirks as he remembers that according to Shen Yuan's prophecy, Luo Binghe's sword will shatter. He gestures for Ming Fan to follow him, but before leaving, Shen Jiu takes one last look at Luo Binghe.

“Do you dare to bet? If your sword breaks, you will cook forever for me.”

“I accept.” Luo Binghe sounded defiant. “What if shizun loses?”

“I never lose.”

Not while the future backs me up , he thinks as he walks away accompanied by Ming Fan, completely oblivious to Luo Binghe's intense gaze.

The meeting is going to be held at Qiong Ding Peak. Between gambling (tricking) with Luo Binghe, getting distracted by picking up the scrolls, and wasting time with Shen Yuan (who had insisted on teaching him a ridiculous game for making decisions called: rock, paper, or scissors), Shen Jiu arrives the last. He hates being late. And even if it’s not true, Shen Jiu feels that everyone is looking at him, that they will whisper about the reasons for his delay. Perhaps they will call him lazy or careless again. He walks with his head straight and followed by Ming Fan.

Shen Jiu sits down at his place and the meeting begins. Unsurprisingly, the main theme is the Alliance Conference. There are many topics to discuss: the volunteers who will help the Huan Hua Palace, the budget, the lists that each peak has drawn up... Shen Jiu listens without intervening, only making occasional faces that he hides behind his fan. He would rather interrupt his banalities but their plan calls for subtlety.

There is something that he hasn’t told Shen Yuan. Perhaps because he doesn’t want to worry him: the Shang Qinghua matter.

The previous step in the plan is to dispose of him discreetly. Shang Qinghua mustn’t find out who will come up with the idea that will change everything so he will never suspect that Shen Qingqiu has inside information because he has conspired with demons.

When the meeting seems to be over, Shen Jiu slaps his table with the fan. He needs a single blow, dry and forceful, to silence the voices that had begun to spread and for no one to get up despite their intentions. Although the silence has returned, a resigned sigh is heard. Shen Qingqiu's interventions have never been anyone's favorite. Perhaps Yue Qingyuan’s, the only one who clears his throat before smiling at him.

“Does shidi have anything to add?”

“I want to exchange a few words with the Peak Lords who are planning to bring disciples to the Alliance Conference.” He pauses theatrically before staring at Shang Qinghua. “I have brought my Head Disciple to take care of the corresponding paperwork, but if the Lord of An Ding Peak is not very busy, he can also stay...”

An Ding Peak is one of the peaks that doesn’t bring disciples to the Alliance Conference, as they work on the previous preparations. Of course, mentioning extra and expendable work while he is already saturated makes Shang Qinghua turn pale and get up first.

“Sorry, Shen-shixiong, my disciples and I are very busy...”

The other Peak Lords also say goodbye without losing that opportunity to flee. In the end, only the representatives of Qing Jing Peak, Qiong Ding Peak, Bai Zhan Peak, Xian Shu Peak, Wan Jian Peak, and Ku Xing Peak remain. Mu Qingfang hesitates, as his disciples attend without participating as they will heal the wounded. With a nod, Shen Jiu gestures for him to stay.

“I have been thinking and making a list is the worst method to decide which disciples will participate in the Alliance Conference,” he starts, trying immensely to keep his voice from being unpleasant. Shen Yuan has been teaching him. “I want to propose a different method: an exam divided into different parts. Each of them will be held on one of our peaks. The objective of the test is that the disciples won’t be chosen by their teacher, but by consensus among all of us.”

Although Shen Jiu tries to keep calm as he unfolds the scrolls, his pulse has quickened. His horrible fame works against him, although the gazes of his martial brothers are more curious than when he proposed the dual cultivation classes. And perhaps the success of those classes has cemented that on this occasion they seem to contemplate his possibility instead of rejecting it. Shen Jiu ignores Yue Qingyuan, as he knows that he will always support him, and looks at the others.

“I have drawn up a draft of how the exam could be, although I intend that we plan it together.” That part is Shen Yuan’s idea, who thinks the other Peak Lords will be more assertive if they can actively collaborate. “I propose that each peak organizes a test that will assess different abilities of the disciples. As it is a simulation of the Alliance Conference, they will be able to participate individually or in groups. Ideally, the tests would be unpredictable and could be solved with different answers, just like they will do at the Alliance Conference.”

The pressure on Shen Jiu's chest is somewhat eased when he discovers that the others seem to be pondering it and their expressions are more curious than skeptical. Liu Qingge crosses his arms and stares at him, causing Shen Jiu to lose his composure a bit.

He and Liu Qingge always discussed all proposals in the meetings, even those that didn’t affect them. Has he changed that much or will he remain the same?

“I also think that only the strongest disciples should go,“ he says and Shen Jiu lets out a sigh of relief. “What did you think about those tests?”
