“Evaluate according to our areas of knowledge: I will be in charge of presenting hypothetical situations with monsters and they must know how to face all threats. I had also thought that Liu-shidi could evaluate their fighting skills, Wei-shidi the state of their swords...” He lists his ideas and also listens to what they want to add. Truth be told, Shen Jiu is indifferent to what they do in the other peaks. The real test will take place at Qing Jing Peak. “Mu-shidi's disciples will stand by, but I also consider that he must take a test on basic notions of first aid.”

Shen Jiu fans himself satisfactorily while Ming Fan writes and the other Pear Lords discuss the plan. They have accepted it... unexpectedly well. Everyone has many ideas: Liu Qingge seems eager at the idea of beating other disciples, Mu Qingfang is also excited to teach classes…

“Just out of curiosity, Shen-shixiong,” Qi Qingqi intervenes, still looking at him with suspicion, but also interest. “Why are you so interested in the education of the entire sect?”

To save their pathetic lives, he thinks.

“Is it not obvious? I plan to win the Alliance Conference,” he responds arrogantly. “One of my disciples will win, but yours must also beat the ones from Huan Hua Palace.”

Of course, that unleashes an earthquake of opposing opinions and challenges. There is no longer suspicion in Qi Qingqi's eyes when she stands up triumphantly and exclaims that Liu Mingyan is also aiming to win. Liu Qingge seems undecided between supporting his sister or one of his disciples.

The meeting has ended in chaos, but Shen Jiu is very satisfied when he finally tells Ming Fan that he can leave. He hasn't even needed to resort to his not-so-secret trick: appeal to Yue Qingyuan. That victory is entirely his and Shen Yuan's.

He is walking towards the Rainbow Bridge with slow steps, enjoying the lovely day when Liu Qingge catches up with him. Shen Jiu lets out a weary sigh. But Liu Qingge for once hasn't complained and even supported him, so he wipes his grimace away and gulps his bitter words.

“Does Liu-shidi want to talk about something?” He probes him.

“You're not thinking of telling the disciples which beasts will appear at the Alliance Conference, are you?”

Shen Jiu forgets all his good intentions and lets out a furious hiss.

“Why do you always think the worst of me?” Although Liu Qingge is right: he plans to tell them about all the monsters... who shouldn’t be but will be. “I will win without cheating.”

Liu Qingge crosses his arms, unconvinced. Still annoyed, Shen Qingqiu walks faster to outrun him. However, Liu Qingge pursues him.

“Sorry.”

Shen Jiu stops.

Shen Jiu turns around very slowly.

Shen Jiu looks into his eyes with stupefaction.

“Have you apologized or have I heard wrong?”

Liu Qingge meets his gaze defiantly, though his posture is somewhat tense.

“I have offended you by assuming something wrong, so I apologize.” His words come out in fits and start, with the clumsiness of someone who has never made a mistake before and doesn’t know how to apologize.

Suddenly, Shen Jiu realizes that Liu Qingge probably had suspected him since the meeting but he wanted to confirm it when they were alone. Perhaps to not influence the other Peak Lords or avoid further unfair accusations as has happened in the past. That little detail makes him feel strange and Shen Jiu turns his back on him so that his expression doesn’t betray him.

“Apologies accepted,” he murmurs in a voice that is softer than furious.

Instead of leaving, Liu Qingge walks up to his side.

“What monsters? I hope they are dangerous.”

“Human-headed spiders...”

“Once I ended up with a nest of those. They are unpleasant, but easy to defeat.”

“...Moon Python Rhinoceros...”

“I like this. I've never found one, but one day I want to defeat it. Several of them.”

Shen Jiu hides a laugh behind his fan.

“Don't be pretentious, shidi. That monster is dangerous even to the dreaded War God.” He shakes his head to erase the smile that was escaping him. “Nu yuan chan...”

“Oh! I have defeated two of those.”

“Really? I've only read about it, what are they like?”

They speak without Shen Jiu noticing that they are crossing the Rainbow Bridge together. Their conversation about monsters turns into one about their respective experiences and memories of their night hunts. Although he always considered such trips a nightmare, suddenly not all anecdotes are bad. Shen Jiu forgets to hide his cruel laughter by mentioning all the times that Liu Qingge made a mistake facing the wrong monster. And Liu Qingge takes revenge by mentioning his accidents.

When Shen Jiu realizes it, they have reached the bamboo house. Shen Yuan's secret presence brings him back to reality. Shen Jiu clears his throat and tries to regain his cold expression.

“See you, shidi.”

“See you, Shen Qingqiu.”

Liu Qingge nods. His response is firm, more like a promise than empty, polite words.

Shen Jiu enters the house wondering what has happened to him to end up spending so much time with one of the people he least tolerates. And quite a nice time. However, he immediately forgets it when he hears Shen Yuan's voice. Shen Jiu walks up to his room, where Shen Yuan was writing.

“How has it been?”

“Fine.” He proceeds to give him an accurate summary of the meeting. “In the next few days, we will have to organize the exam. This brings us to two problems: first, others mustn’t discover ours. It's too much of a coincidence that we are going to train all the disciples how to defeat unexpected monsters. Second, we have to ensure that Luo Binghe wins the other test.”

“Don’t worry! He will!” As always, Shen Yuan is delusionally optimistic when it’s related to that brat. “I have good news too! I think I have an idea to facilitate Luo Binghe's journey through the Abyss. And give him a reason to come down himself...”

 

 

It all starts one morning at Qiong Ding Peak with almost all the Peak Lords discussing the exam. Shen Yuan is very excited which is why a smile escapes him when Liu Qingge stands next to him.

“Liu-shidi?”

“Do you remember you told me that your disciple's food was the best?”

“Hmmm...” No, Shen Yuan doesn't remember, although that's something he could have easily said, so he nods.

“Is your invitation still standing?”

“Hmmm… yes?”

Liu Qingge also smiles. He has a very pretty smile that doesn’t fit with the terrible War God.

“See you tomorrow.”

His perfect day is broken when Shen Yuan informs Shen Jiu.

“WHAT HAVE YOU DONE?” He yells. Not furious, but pale and a little scared. “I've never promised anything! He has invited himself!”

“I didn't know that!”

“If I had invited the damn Liu Qingge home I would have told you!”

“Sorry!”

Shen Jiu lets out a snort before reaching for his fan.

“You have accepted, you will deal with him.”

And this is how Shen Yuan finds himself that day sitting in the bamboo house, the scum villain hiding in his room enjoying some tanghulus that he has stolen, a secondary that should be dead sitting in front of him, and the main character bringing a tray saturated with delicious food.

Sometimes Shen Yuan believes he is living in fanfic and not in the original work.

"It smells good," Liu Qingge concedes.

“Thanks, Liu-shishu.”

Luo Binghe's smile is not like always. Less sincere, a bit forced. Shen Yuan wants to hit him on the head with the fan. It's your future brother-in-law! Your first wife's brother! Be nice, Binghe!

Luo Binghe has prepared a feast worthy of the culinary talent of the protagonist. Shen Yuan smiles as he thinks about what Shen Jiu is missing out of stubbornness. After congratulating Luo Binghe, the boy reluctantly leaves and Shen Yuan can enjoy delicacies that melt in his mouth.

For a few minutes, he is enjoying it all and forgets that he is not alone.

“Are you liking it, shidi?” He smiles in a belated apology for forgetting about his guest.

Liu Qingge is also silent, so he assumes that he is loving it.

“It's good, maybe a little spicy for my taste.”

“Spicy?” Shen Yuan frowns. “How strange, mine is tasty. Let me try...”

Shen Yuan is unaware that Liu Qingge blushes slightly as he extends the chopsticks to his plate. Later, he is the one who blushes intensely when he takes a bite that burns, that itches, that leaves his throat dry, and makes him cry.

A LITTLE SPICY? He thinks while he chokes. Liu Qingge exclaims his name and gets up to sit next to him as he continues to cough. THIS IS INHUMAN, WHAT KIND OF RESISTANCE DO YOU HAVE SHIDI????

The spicy taste takes a long time to wear off even though Shen Yuan won't stop drinking. With teary eyes, he looks at the smudged figure of Liu Qingge, who is handing him another cup.

“Thanks, shidi...” He splutters. “I’m fine. It's just that I can't stand the spice.” He swallows hard before trying to regain his composure. “Do you want some from my plate? Luo Binghe must have made a mistake with the spices.”

Liu Qingge sits up very tense, red as if the spicy taste is slowing him down.

“No...” He blinks, staring at something behind Shen Yuan. “Was that door open before?”

Shen Yuan stiffens. He remembers very well closing that door so as not to disturb Shen Jiu or that Shen Jiu is discovered.

“My cat,” he babbles before going to close it.

Liu Qingge is already sitting in his seat again when Shen Yuan returns to the table.

“I didn't know you had a cat.”

“Hahaha… yes… Should I ask Luo Binghe to bring the desserts?”

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Shen Jiu: hehehehe free and delicious meals for eternity.
Little Bingbing: Is this a... marriage proposal????
Liu Qingge: *interprets that Shen Yuan has invited him one day to talk about monsters*
Liu Qingge: *talks about monsters with Shen Jiu*
Liu Qingge: *interprets that Shen Jiu has invited him one day to speak to eat*
Liu Qingge: *eats with Shen Yuan*
Shen Yuan: I have a plan to stop Luo Binghe from hating Shen Qingqiu! :D
Author: Tssss, don't spoilers >:3

CURIOSITY # 1
I've created a series to collect all the extras from 'Found Brother'. Next week I plan to post one to celebrate 1000 kudos (THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT) and now I'm uploading Snippets for #WeekOfComfortForShenJiu.

(Also, I have started to publish a new fic in case you like Bingjiu and Liujiu -> Happy System)

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu and Liu Qingge buy a gift for their siblings

Chapter Notes

Author: *points to the chapter tittle*
Author: *points to the story tittle*
Author: PLEASE, SHEN JIU, NOTICE MY HINTS!!!! YOU HAVE THE TRUTH IN FRONT OF YOUR NOSE. THE PARALLELS CAN'T BE MORE EVIDENT.
Shen Jiu: Why I have positive feelings for Shen Yuan? What a mistery.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Only one Shen Qingqiu can go to the Alliance Conference.

“Please!” Shen Yuan insists even though Shen Jiu has already refused more than a hundred times. “I prefer to supervise it myself. If it goes wrong...”

“You have confirmed to me that your life will be safe as long as Luo Binghe reaches the Endless Abyss no matter how.” Shen Jiu interrupts him, using the fan to aim at him. “Don’t worry. In case our plan fails, I'll push him myself.”

“That is what I want to avoid!”

Shen Jiu clicks his tongue, belittling Shen Yuan's drama. The brat will be fine. However, the one who worries him is Shen Yuan. Shen Jiu still remembers that the other day he almost revealed their secret when he heard that Shen Yuan was choking. That is a shameful secret that he has tried to hide. At that moment he feels that same illogical panic. Let Shen Yuan be alone in an intensely dangerous place plagued with horrible monsters? No way.

Of course, that is not the excuse he gives.

“The Alliance Conference will be dangerous and I still don't trust you enough to lend you Xiu Ya. My answer is no.”

Shen Yuan bows his head resigned. Perhaps he will continue to insist since he is as stubborn as Shen Jiu. But he is the one with the power to decide who will go and he will never change his mind, even if Shen Yuan keeps insisting until the last day. Still, Shen Jiu feels an unexpected urge to promise him that he will take care of it. Nonsense, he thinks.

“I’m going outside for a walk,” he announces, turning his back on him to head for the door. “Later we will talk about the Alliance Conference.”

Shen Jiu needs to get away from the bamboo house, Luo Binghe’s dilemma, and Qing Jing Peak, so he leaves the sect to descend to the city at the foot of the mountain. As he walks the streets, Shen Jiu remembers that he hasn’t visited the Warm Red Pavilion in a long time. At first, because he wanted to avoid annoying comments (and it would upset him if Shen Yuan also judged him like the rest). Later, because his nightmares are over. Since that last strange dream, he hasn't had a bad night again.

It’s an objective fact that Shen Yuan almost killed him and, somehow, has destroyed his life. However, he has also brought him tranquility that wasn’t there before. His days are more chaotic now, but Shen Jiu has remembered what fun is, he also has another person to talk to... someone he almost trusts.

Shen Jiu hasn't felt like this for years. That reminds him of his happiest and most miserable time when he was a filthy kid who had his Qi-Ge. Now he is rich and powerful, but he is alone.

Or perhaps not.

His erratic steps lead him to a market. For once, Shen Jiu doesn't care that there are so many people. This allows him to hide in the crowd and feel that for once no one is watching him. Shen Jiu wanders among the stands looking for nothing in particular. He kills time with silly excuses that help him forget all his doubts and worries.

Shen Jiu stops in front of a stand with jade and silver crowns. His fingers caress an especially elegant one, with light green ribbons. Months ago, he gave Shen Yuan his old clothes and accessories that he no longer liked. At that moment, he understands that Shen Yuan has nothing that belongs to him, only the fan that Liu Qingge gave him and he is always using.

Perhaps Shen Jiu could gift him something that would be entirely for Shen Yuan.

“Shen Qingqiu?” Asks a familiar voice.

Shen Jiu snorts before hiding behind his fan. Of all the people in the world, he has had to be discovered by Liu Qingge. His shidi's gaze lingers on his fan and to his shame, Shen Jiu discovers that he has chosen the one he gave him. Sadly, the brute Liu Qingge has an inexplicable talent for choosing beautiful things.

“The same,” he growls, trying to ignore him. “What are you doing here?“

“Buying a gift for my sister. And you?”

“Buying a… thing for myself.”

Shen Jiu has always preferred to lie, allowing others to believe that he is selfish, conceited, or cruel. Ignoring Liu Qingge, Shen Qingqiu indicates to the saleswoman that he wants that crown.

After putting the package in his qiankun pouch, Shen Jiu tries to walk away, but there are so many people that he has no choice but to go in the same direction as Liu Qingge.

“Do you have plans?” Liu Qingge asks, walking beside him.

Talk to my double about how to save your brats, train my hateful disciple destined to be a hero... Shen Jiu shrugs. Maybe nothing would happen if he takes the day off for once.

 

 

In another life, in another world, Shen Yuan claimed in a blog that anyone could have written PIDW better than Airplane. Ironically, he is trapped in a complicated and almost impossible-to-resolve situation. And his only plan is to rewrite a scene from PIDW.

Shen Yuan has asked the System the conditions to surpass that arc. The only essential condition is that Luo Binghe should end up in the Abyss to continue the plot. What if the reasons were less traumatic than being pushed by his shizun? That could change everything! Shen Yuan is convinced that his current sweet White Lotus doesn’t hate Shen Qingqiu. Even Shen Jiu is surrendering to the protagonist's charms!

Now Shen Yuan has the uncomfortable pressure to write a logical script that maintains the plot without making Shen Qingqiu the villain.

It’s the night when Shen Jiu returns.

Shen Yuan is working on his script but gets up at the sound of the door closing. He leaves his room, but first picks up the white cat that now lives with them. (Yes, they now have a cat although Shen Jiu still pretends it doesn't exist). He intends to speak seriously with Shen Jiu about the representation of that scene, however, he surprises him by handing him a package. Shen Yuan releases the cat to open it. Inside there is a crown of jade and silver, with ribbons the same green as the first bamboo shoots.

It's pretty, but he doesn't understand why he gave it.

“What’s that?”

“I was leisurely strolling in the market when Liu Qingge started to annoy me, so I had to buy something to distract him. I don’t like it. For you.”

Shen Yuan narrows his eyes. Shen Jiu spoke without looking at him. Also, whenever he is upset, the first thing he does when he arrives at the bamboo house is to complain, not to wait for him to ask. Although Shen Yuan suspects that he is hiding something else, in the end, he doesn’t give it more importance. He has more urgent things to worry about than a crown.

In the last few weeks, they have been actively preparing for the exams with the rest of Peak Lords. They have helped make the disciple screening and secretly trained everyone on the beasts that Shen Yuan remembers appeared in the book. Shen Jiu has even given Luo Binghe private sword lessons, worried that his technique was too arrogant (Shen Yuan found it too cute), but they have been putting off the key part of his plan for lack of time.

Now that Shen Yuan has the clearest ideas, he doesn’t intend to run away anymore.

“We need to talk about the Endless Abyss,” he announces, very serious. Shen Yuan would have preferred to go himself, but he has already accepted that he will never get Shen Jiu to change his mind. “Do you remember all the times you have made me rehearse to be the Shen Qingqiu that you have decided? Well, now it will be the other way around. Okay, you will go to the Alliance Conference, but you will do what I tell you.” Shen Yuan pulls the script from his sleeve. “I have written what should happen. And you won't go until you know your role by heart, understood?”

In the end, Shen Qingqiu is just a character from a book. And now they have the power to write what Shen Qingqiu will do. One will be the actor and the other the writer. And together they will change the end of this book.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: Why is there suddenly a cat?
Author posts Found Brother: Snippets.
Shen Yuan and readers: Please, can we keep the cat?
Shen Jiu: NO
Author: ... democracy wins.

CURIOSITY # 1
Shen Jiu recognizing Shen Yuan as an independent person who needs his own things and giving him a gift is another of those scenes that I thought at the beginning AND THEIR RELATIONSHIP HAS FINALLY ADVANCED ENOUGH.

BONUS 2
Shen Jiu, growling: Liu Qingge has a talent for choosing beautiful things.
Liu Qingge: *choosing Shen Qingqiu*

CURIOSITY # 2
This chapter has been shorter than others, but in the next one we are going to Jue Di Gorge! Are you ready for the Alliance Conference? Little Bingbing is eager to impress you all! (Lie, he only cares about his shizun)

The pieces are already arranged on the board. What will win: the fate or the ingenuity of two Shen Qingqiu? See you next week!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Luo Binghe and Shen Qingqiu cannot escape their fate 「 END FIRST PART 」

Chapter Notes

Author: What do you do when you have special information about the future?
Shen Yuan: Change the future to avoid unnecessary suffering 😌
Shen Jiu: Gambling and trick the others 😈

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Shen Jiu will never acknowledge that he is as nervous as Shen Yuan. 

Of course, it’s Shen Yuan’s fault. Since he has been retouching the script for the last few days, chasing him to make sure he knows his role by heart, adding tools to the qiankun pouch that will be given to Luo Binghe... Inevitably, Shen Jiu has caught his stress.

“I've got you several books from the library. Some bestiaries, but also history books that I think you will like. In case you get bored, you can practice your calligraphy. I will read your exercises when I return. I have also sent Luo Binghe to prepare food for you these days. I have protected it with some talismans so that it doesn’t rot. Qing Jing Peak won’t be totally deserted, so be careful when you leave the house. You can of course go outside a bit, although I would prefer you to stay inside to avoid misunderstandings. Understood?”

Yeah, Shen Jiu is a clear example of a calm person and Shen Yuan is the only one nervous of the two. He should learn from him.

Despite his reassuring words, Shen Yuan wrung his hands. He tries to smile but fails and ends up sighing.

“I'm still worried about Binghe.”

Shen Jiu wants to growl that this is ridiculous, that Luo Binghe is the only one whose future is guaranteed and Shen Yuan should worry about himself. But saying it out loud would perhaps be acknowledging that he is worried about Shen Yuan. So Shen Jiu crosses his arms with a sneer.

“Don’t.”

Obviously, his advice is useless. Shen Jiu huffs before pulling the qiankun pouch out of his sleeve to give to Shen Yuan.

“Go. Say goodbye to the brat.”

And finally, Shen Jiu makes a huge and bright smile appear on Shen Yuan's face. After thanking him, Shen Yuan leaves the bamboo house with the qiankun pouch in hand. They have prepared a qiankun pouch for each disciple, but Luo Binghe's is special. His has medicinal herbs, spare robes, a knife, supplies…

Shen Jiu assumes that Shen Yuan will want to say goodbye to all the disciples, so he waits patiently, checking the house one last time to make sure Shen Yuan is not missing anything. His gaze rests at the hideous white cat that Shen Yuan has adopted.

“Watch him or I'll cook you,” Shen Jiu warns the animal.

Obviously, the cat doesn’t respond.

A few hours later, Shen Jiu rides a horse while leading a bunch of restless disciples out of Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. Despite his intentions, chaos is guaranteed and the disciples from the different peaks have mixed. That is their fault because with so many activities young people have made friends in other peaks. Even so, Shen Jiu frowns, annoyed at the noise.

Another horse approaches him and soon Liu Qingge rides alongside him. Shen Jiu glances at him, wondering if he's too early to play a little prank on Liu Qingge. Proud as he is, he would bet without hesitation about who disciple will win the Alliance Conference. Shen Jiu squints maliciously as he thinks about what they could bet.

While Shen Jiu thinks evil, Liu Qingge hands him a sachet of pastries. They look homemade and Shen Jiu eagerly accepts some sweets that have been so graciously offered to him. If he were someone else, perhaps he would suspect that they are poisoned, but he can trust Liu Qingge's righteousness.

“And this surprise, shidi?”

“Are they good?” He asks instead of answering.

A few meters ahead, Luo Binghe has turned and glanced at the two immortals with narrowed eyes as Ming Fan, Ning Yingying, and Liu Mingyan gossip with each other.

“Hmm… Not bad.” Shen Jiu hesitates before pulling out from his sleeve another sachet almost identical to Liu Qingge's that Luo Binghe had given him that morning. Time to lay a trap for his shidi! “You should try the ones my disciple has made. They are better.”

Liu Qingge's expression darkens, a slight annoying blush staining his cheeks, as he purses his lips. In front of them, Luo Binghe smiles and points at them as he talks to his friends.

“You know? I have high hopes for my disciple. I’m sure that he will win the Alliance Conference...”

“The next ones will be better,” Liu Qingge assures before spurring his horse forward.

Oh, no. Liu Qingge is not allowed to leave him with the word in his mouth. Annoyed, Shen Jiu also accelerates, willing to take revenge for all past and present offenses. The two immortals pass in front of the four disciples, who follow their teachers with little dissimulation.

“Shidi!” Shen Jiu calls him. “Do you know what my disciple is even better at than cooking? At hunting monsters.”

“Really?” 

Liu Qingge has frowned and stares at the brat who has puffed out his chest and smirks a few meters behind them. Shen Jiu, completely oblivious to the duel of gazes between his disciple and his shidi, continues speaking.

“Yes. He is my most diligent and talented disciple. Do you remember how he defeated that demon?”

When he is finally going to throw the bait at him, Liu Qingge clenches his fists and lifts his head.

“I’m a better hunter than he is.”

“Evidently?” Shen Jiu mutters in confusion, erasing Luo Binghe's smirk. “But you won’t participate in the Alliance Conference, he will.“

Luo Binghe smiles again, albeit with even more determination than before. The fire of winning and making shizun proud, the fire of one day being a better warrior than Liu Qingge. Shen Jiu oblivious still doesn't look back and can’t catch all those nuances in Luo Binghe's gaze. He is keener to understand Liu Qingge's attitude and why he seems about to announce that he will also participate. Perhaps his approach has been wrong. Shen Jiu sighs before patting him on the forearm.

“Shidi, don’t be upset. You already had your glorious time when you were a disciple.” He smiles, leaning toward him as far as his horses allow. “Do you want to do something fun? Let's bet. If Luo Binghe loses, I will train with you as much as you want.”

His plan is perfect. Liu Qingge will be unable to refuse that bait. However, Liu Qingge turns around and their faces are suddenly too close.

“Fine,” he says with determination and a hoarse voice. “If I win, we will go on a night hunt together, with no one else.”

Shen Jiu blinks in surprise. But since Luo Binghe will win, he doesn't mind that abrupt change. Right now, he would be able to accept anything impossible. Shen Jiu draws a mischievous smirk on his lips before nodding.

“But what will happen if Liu-shidi loses? Mn?” He teases him. He wishes he can hit his chest with his fan, but it's not a good idea when he's riding. “If shidi wants me to go monster hunting with him, then you will have to stay with me learning manners.”

An intense blush runs down Liu Qingge's cheeks. Shen Qingqiu savors that unusual image. And knowing that he will win, he decides to raise the bet.

“What about a month?”

Liu Qingge holds his gaze. And after a hesitant moment, he nods bravely.

“Fine.”

No more abruptly slammed doors! No more dead monsters staining my peak! Shen Jiu celebrates. He can finally get revenge for all those times Liu Qingge has ruined his clothes by dragging him into an unwanted spar. But Liu Qingge has been behaving in recent months, so he won’t be very cruel.

Shen Qingqiu is still savoring his victory as Liu Qingge raises his head and smiles at him.

“I know where we will go.”

“Aren't you overconfident, shidi?”

“You have never beaten me.”

“My disciple will.”

“Your disciple has to win everyone.”

And with a jerk of the reins, Liu Qingge accelerates and drives away. Shen Qingqiu frowns as he feels a bit of insecurity in his stomach, but he trusts Shen Yuan. Shen Jiu shook his head, correcting himself: he trusts Shen Yuan's words. Luo Binghe will win.

At that moment, four disciples on horseback approach him.

“Shi-shizun?” Luo Binghe splutters, his hands twisting the reins and his cheeks colored. That his friends are laughing doesn't help his nervousness. “What if this disciple wins?”

“Mn?” Shen Jiu turns around, surprised to find his disciples there. Seeing Ning Yingying, he again notices insecurity. She is only there because Shen Yuan has promised him that nothing will happen to her since she has another key role in Luo Binghe's future. “Everything. It is not a bet, it is a promise.” He ruffles his hair before turning his back on his and continuing on his way.

When they arrive at the location where the Alliance Conference will be held, it is an open secret that the hateful and arrogant Shen Qingqiu is boasting that his disciple will win everyone. That has unexpected consequences: now everyone wants to challenge him with stupid bets. Shen Jiu ignores all of them, not out of insecurity, but because he doesn't want to waste his time. He only has two more goals: to fleece the old palace master and Yue Qingyuan.

Unfortunately, Yue Qingyuan never falls for his tricks.

“Shidi should be more careful,” he comments to him as they both walk through the stands dedicated to the masters.

Shen Jiu wants to trick him into betting the truth on why he never returned to rescue him, but Yue Qingyuan dodges all of his traps. Annoyed, Shen Jiu goes off to watch the show accompanied by Liu Qingge.

“Your disciple is not in the top ten yet,” he comments, too animated.

Shen Jiu huffs. Although Shen Yuan had already warned him that a lot of brats would take advantage of Luo Binghe in the beginning, the sight of them pissed him off. He has trained his own so that only the most qualified are in Jue Di Gorge. The Huan Hua Palace should train it's own better and show off less. Shen Jiu squeezes his fan tightly, looking forward to the moment when Luo Binghe gets rid of those vermin.

Because of their bets, everyone is keeping an eye on Luo Binghe, ignoring the other disciples who are in the top ranks. There is a suppressed exclamation when Luo Binghe stumbles upon a huge monster. And there is several applause as Ning Yingying, Ming Fan, and Liu Mingyan steal his prey.

Shen Jiu ignores the teasing from the others and frowns suspiciously. That wasn’t part of Shen Yuan's warnings.

Nor did Luo Binghe decide at that moment to go on his own and abandon everyone who followed him.

Strange, he thinks, his gaze fixed Luo Binghe’s figure slaughtering monsters. He should continue with those useless kids until the Nu yuan chan appears. Bah, that’s better.

Despite his confidence, Shen Jiu begins to tense up, as not only has Luo Binghe entered the top early, Liu Mingyan is also surprising all expectations. Qi Qingqi approaches the two of them without hiding her satisfied smile. Both exchange a challenging look as Liu Qingge nods each time his sister scores more than Luo Binghe.

The fact that Shen Jiu, despite arrogantly boasting that his disciple is the best, has only bet with two people, makes everyone cheering for the rest of the disciples and savoring his impending defeat. Everyone wishes to see him defeated, but the game changes when the legendary monsters Shen Yuan warned him about appear. Finally , he thinks with a smirk.

Who laughs last, laughs best.

Although all of Cang Qiong Sect's disciples have the necessary tools to survive without difficulty, Luo Binghe is the only one who continues to climb ranks at legendary speed. Unfortunately, no one has noticed it, because everyone is more concerned thinking about how to save the disciples.

Oh, Shen Jiu will laugh a lot when everything is over and the others find out the ranking.

All cultivators are divided into those with the martial skills to defeat monsters, those who will focus on saving disciples, and the healers. Shen Jiu is part of the first group and flies together with Liu Qingge into Jue Di Gorge.

Since Liu Mingyan is in the north and Luo Binghe is in the south, the two will be separated. In a fit, Shen Jiu grabs Liu Qingge's arm. It's stupid, but according to Shen Yuan, he should already be dead.

“Be careful, shidi.” He growls. “I will never forgive you if something happens to you before enjoying my prize.”

Liu Qingge proudly puffs out his chest and gives him a confident smile.

“Of course, who do you think I am?” His smile suddenly disappears. “Be careful you too. If you are in danger, use a signal. No matter where you are, I will find you.”

Shen Jiu feels warmth inside his chest, but also a cold past, an echo of his worst memories. They part without saying anything else and he rushes to find Luo Binghe. Despite the chaos around him and the monsters he has to kill, his mind is clear. Shen Jiu repeats to himself the corny, cheesy speech Shen Yuan wrote to him. Shen Jiu believes that Shen Yuan is exaggerating, even so, he will respect the script.

He finds Luo Binghe fighting human-headed spiders. At least that part is correct. Despite all the changes, important things happen just as Shen Yuan predicted.

Shen Jiu lands gracefully after slaughtering a few human-headed spiders. They are disgusting and nasty critters.

“Shizun!” Luo Binghe exclaims, with too-bright eyes and an immense smile improper in a distressing situation. “You've come for us!”

“I have come for you.” He clicks his tongue in disdain before turning his head to stare at the others. Obviously, not from his sect. “Why should I waste my time with some useless brats who are delaying my disciple? Come on, move.”

Even though they bow their heads, they follow him obediently. Shen Jiu guides them ignoring Luo Binghe's intense blush. They go to a place that is part of the scheme that Shen Yuan made for him. The plan is simple: leave the disciples in a safe place and accompany Luo Binghe to where the rift into the Abyss will open. As they walk, Shen Jiu watches over the useless as he allows Luo Binghe to slaughter the monsters. After all, he has to win.

“Binghe!” He calls him. “I suspect there is a Moon Python Rhinoceros near, do you think you can defeat it?”

“Of course, shizun!”

“I know. That's why I trust you to keep an eye on the surroundings while I get rid of the clumsiest ones.”

Shen Jiu missed a meaningful glance at Luo Binghe's sword. Goodbye, Zheng Yang. Hello, eternal delicious meals. He is in an excellent mood when he takes the other disciples, who look at him without hiding their hatred. Obviously, they are from the Huan Hua Palace: spoiled, emotional, but without common sense. When they reach the safe place, Shen Jiu discovers that Shang Qinghua is already there with more disciples. Some are from the Cang Qiong Sect who seem more prepared than the Peak Lord.

“I leave you to these, shidi. Keep an eye on them.” 

“Shen-shixiong! Where are you going!”

“I have left my disciple alone.”

“Your disciple? Great, great. Go with him!”

Shen Jiu returns to Luo Binghe's side. The boy is surrounded by an unnatural, false calm, which Shen Jiu knows will soon break.

“Shizun!”

“Is there any sign of the Moon Python Rhinoceros?”

He shakes his head.

“Not yet.”

“Well, it will appear soon.”

For the first time, Shen Yuan is wrong.

No Moon Python Rhinoceros appears, but a demon with pale skin like frost.

Shen Jiu frowns. He can feel the power of that demon despite the distance. His presence freezes the atmosphere. As hasty as ever, Luo Binghe steps in front of him with his sword already drawn, but Shen Jiu ruthlessly pushes him away.

“Don’t be an idiot!” He growls. “He is out of your level. Go find that Moon Python Rhinoceros, I'll take care of the demon.”

“But shizun...”

Despite how heavy and insistent Shen Yuan was with the damn script, he has never been the problem, but everyone else. Starting with his stubborn disciple.

“Go!” He exclaims when the demon attacks them.

The demon is also off his level, but Shen Jiu is cunning and knows how to survive. His foolish disciple will only get killed and that will ruin his perfect future, Shen Yuan's life and he will run out of delicious meals. Checking that Luo Binghe doesn’t leave, Shen Jiu creates a barrier between the two and blocks the demon's ice attacks.

“Not bad for a mortal,” his enemy concedes. “But not enough.”

Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow. The demon has the same stupid arrogance as Liu Qingge, so he will use the same tricks: fighting dirty.

For a few minutes, the demon eats his own words and various fire spells.

Luo Binghe cheers him on with admiration which is stressful. The brat should be watching for the arrival of the Moon Python Rhinoceros, not his shizun. Shen Jiu dodges several ice spears and uses his fan to direct his qi into the demon's eyes. If he had no other priorities, he could try to catch him and interrogate him later about the sabotage. Sadly, he has a very busy schedule: saving an idiot, ensuring that the idiot breaks his sword by destroying a Moon Python Rhinoceros, delivering a cheesy speech to convince the idiot to jump into the Endless Abyss, and giving him the directions where he will find a new sword. 

Waiting for five years for the idiot to return with Shen Yuan and a tamed Liu Qingge.

His perfect plan breaks through the barrier when the demon's power hits it. Although Shen Jiu has dodged the ice blocks, the demonic qi has left him dizzy and he recoils to catch his breath. In that interval of doubt, the idiot intervenes.

“LUO BINGHE! IF HE DOESN'T KILL YOU I WILL.”

With insulting ease, the demon smashes Zheng Yang.

Well, one thing is done. Shen Jiu huffs. Although that means Luo Binghe will no longer be able to face the Moon Python Rhinoceros. Reluctantly, he pops the signal to summon Liu Qingge and pounces on the demon to save his disciple. But the demon eludes him. He has grabbed Luo Binghe by the neck and is looking at him with an interest that he has never devoted to Shen Jiu in a single moment.

“Neither human nor demon. Interesting.”

Then, he brushes his forehead with a finger.

Shen Jiu pulls away when a wave of demonic qi leaves Luo Binghe's body. Paralyzed, he sees how a demonic seal is drawn on the young man's skin. The ice demon finally frees Luo Binghe, who falls to his knees.

And with an immense roar, the Endless Abyss opens.

The air smells of sulfur and blood. The landscape has been destroyed by ice and now the fire illuminates them. Shen Jiu stares frozen at Luo Binghe, who struggles to get up.

“You are a demon,” he splutters. “You...”

Reality hits him.

Shen Yuan has lied to him.

Shen Yuan knew it. Shen Yuan has known this from the beginning and has been deceiving him. All the pieces begin to fit together: Shen Yuan knew about the demonic invasion and the sabotage of the Alliance Conference because he is in league with the demons. Shen Yuan has tricked him into training a powerful demon.

Shen Jiu notices a familiar, bitter taste in his throat: the disappointment of trusting the wrong person. Of course, someone who has tried to kill you to usurp you is an enemy. That was why Shen Yuan had insisted so much on being at that moment. He is a traitor. A liar.

“Shizun, I...”

Luo Binghe tries to get closer to him but stops when Shen Jiu raises his sword. He ignores the brat's tears to look at him with disgust and contempt.

“You shouldn't be here, monster.”

“Shizun! I don't want to hurt anyone!” Luo Binghe raises his hands before taking another tentative step. “I don't want to be a demon! I just want to stay by your side...”

“Jump.”

“What?”

Luo Binghe opens his eyes with horror. Shen Jiu has erased the cloying speech about the glorious destiny that awaits Luo Binghe to convince him to jump. Still, despite the rage of a betrayal, Shen Jiu clings to the memory of Shen Yuan caring for him when he was injured, striving to teach all the disciples to survive.

He needs to believe that Shen Yuan is not bad. But for Shen Yuan to answer his questions, he needs to live and Luo Binghe must fall into hell.

“Shizun, why?” He has dropped his arms and cries tears as red as the seal that shines on his forehead. “Do you hate demons that much?”

Shen Jiu grits his teeth. That damn brat never listens to him. Furious, but also scared by someone who doesn't deserve it, Shen Jiu extends the sword and skewers it across Luo Binghe's chest. Not to pierce his heart but as a warning.

“If you don't jump, I'll kill you.”

When you have been betrayed so many times, it is easy to turn your heart to stone and ignore the bleak gaze of a child who has had to grow up too soon. Luo Binghe, stubborn, doesn’t move. Shen Jiu grits his teeth. The situation is too troublesome: Liu Qingge will soon arrive, at any moment others will appear. If they discover him with a demon, he will be accused of sabotage and will sink the reputation of the sect. However, none of that is what really worries him. But the safety of Shen Yuan.

Believing in Shen Yuan means becoming a villain.

And that’s how Shen Qingqiu pushed Luo Binghe into the Endless Abyss.

Chapter End Notes

End of the first parte: How the scum villain adopts Shen Yuan. The next part will be Shen Yuan protects the scum villain from the protagonist :D

When I was planning the story a few months ago, one of my favorite ideas was what would happen if Shen Jiu followed the original script for someone else's sake; what if Shen Jiu chose to be the villain for Shen Yuan, despite his attempts to change the history.

Little Bingbing leaves the fic for a few chapters in which he will be updating. After the lapse of a few years, we will find out if Bingbing has become an insecure Bingmei or a spiteful Bingge. And he will join the romantic plot. Liu Qingge needs a rival ;)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
★ Twitter
✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu and Shen Yuan argue

Chapter Summary

SECOND PART: Shen Yuan protects the scum villain from the protagonist

Chapter Notes

Bingbing updating: 0%

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Liu Qingge lands on an ice-shattered paramo. The ground is cracked and smoke emerges from the rifts. It reeks of blood and brimstone. Amid that desolate chaos, Shen Qingqiu stands out. His green clothes shine, also the blood that stains his sword.

“Shen Qingqiu!” He yells, running to his side, Cheng Luan drew in his hand. Despite the worry pounding through his veins, Liu Qingge remains alert to potential threats. “Are you hurt?”

Shen Qingqiu shakes his head, although his gaze is clouded. He seems to be looking into infinity, into nowhere. Despite Liu Qingge's uneasy questions, Shen Qingqiu refuses to answer. Perhaps he has even stopped listening to him.

Suddenly, Shen Qingqiu crouches down and begins to pick up the shards of a sword. One by one. The pieces were mixed with frost and Liu Qingge hadn't seen it at first.

“Shen Qingqiu, are you okay?” He insists, grabbing his arm so that he looks into his eyes.

“No.” Although Shen Qingqiu's face is serene, his eyes burn. “I’m furious.”

 

 

Shen Yuan hates waiting.

He has always been an impatient reader. He even paid for chapters of the infamous PIDW novel because he needed to know what was going to happen! But now, he has no choice but to wait. And without clocks, alone and in silence, time slides too slow. Shen Yuan notices how impatience grows under his skin like an entourage of ants. His only company is a sleeping cat, bestiaries he can't focus on, and the System's voice.

Despite all his questions, the System's answer is always the same: The story is progressing correctly.

Until his vision turns red and a countdown appears, racing his pulse. Until the numbers freeze and the System congratulates him for having passed the Alliance Conference Arc. And then Shen Yuan knows with absolute certainty: Luo Binghe has fallen into the Endless Abyss.

When he first read it, Shen Yuan felt fury at the hateful Shen Qingqiu and the injustices Luo Binghe had suffered. Now he is afraid. It is a frosty fear like mist, spreading from his chest to the rest of his body. Shen Yuan closes his eyes and in the tranquility of his house, he wishes that Luo Binghe doesn’t suffer and he returns soon. Without revenge, no ridiculously large harems, and they return to those days with Luo Binghe keeping watch whenever Liu Qingge arrives unannounced and Shen Jiu acting like a sullen cat.

Again, Shen Yuan waits.

Sleep weighs on his eyelids when he finally hears noises outside. Shen Yuan's pulse has quickened. According to the System, everything went well. But he feels doubt in his lungs. Inadvertently, Shen Yuan holds his breath as he hears familiar footsteps heading towards Qing Jing Peak.

If all has gone well, the only missing disciple will be Luo Binghe. No one else has been hurt and Shen Jiu and he won’t be haunted by any future torture.

Why is he so nervous?

The door is forcefully opened and Shen Yuan takes a step forward, impatient, but his legs freeze when Shen Jiu glares at him. It is a furious and terrifying look, and Shen Yuan suddenly wishes to disappear.

“You lied to me,” Shen Jiu groans after slamming the door shut. “That beast is a demon.”

“What?” He splutters, without understanding what he's talking about. ”Wait! Wait! What are you talking about?” 

Shen Yuan watches wide-eyed as Shen Jiu flashes a cruel smile. That is the true face of the PIDW scum villain. And it is terrifying. His gaze leaves Shen Yuan speechless and trembling. However, there is a glint of disappointment in his eyes before Shen Jiu grabs a package from his sleeve and throws it. Zheng Yang's shards spread across the ground before Shen Yuan's feet.

“Are you still trying to fool me? Do you want me to believe that you didn't know that Luo Binghe is actually a demon and we have trained our enemy?”

Shen Yuan just wants to hide. His accusations make him dizzy, his head hurts. He gazes at the shards of the sword as if it were Luo Binghe's corpse. What has gone wrong? I don’t understand… Shen Jiu keeps talking, vomiting angry words as he remains paralyzed by the silence.

“This is how you found out, right? The demonic invasion, the sabotage of the Alliance Conference, and Luo Binghe's demonic heritage. This is why your information is so selective. You are an ally of the demons.”

Shen Yuan finally raises his head. Something gurgles in his chest, a combination of fear and anger. Despite his rage, Shen Jiu suddenly no longer scares him. Perhaps because he seems tired, about to break down. And his weakness gives Shen Yuan the strength to dare to speak.

“Of course I knew,” he splutters in a whisper. “I told you. I tried to tell you. This is something that I couldn't tell you directly, so I found another way to tell you.” The System beeps in his head, but he ignores it. He is no longer breaking any rules since the villain has already discovered the nature of the protagonist. “Of course I told you! I told you that Luo Binghe would survive in a place where all humans die and only the most powerful demons triumph! I told you that he would master a demon sword! I told you that he would unite both realms starting with ruling the Demon Realm! I told you that he would have demonic wives! And you told me you understood!”

Shen Yuan screams until he runs out of air. Fear pulses in his chest, right over his heart, until it suffocates him. In front of him, Shen Jiu's eyes wides in horror. Pale and confused, he no longer says anything.

“I thought you knew it,” he adds with weariness and frustration. “In this story, Shen Qingqiu is Luo Binghe's worst enemy. He will return for revenge. After five years in hell, he will return to destroy everything: Cang Qiong Mountain Sect, the Human Realm... you too. The two of us now.” He adds bitterly. "That's what I was trying to change. I was hoping that if we convinced Luo Binghe to jump instead of pushing him, the future would be different."

Shen Yuan doesn't need Shen Jiu to say anything to know that that future has already been broken.

“Shit,” he growls angrily, as panic begins to spread throughout his body. “What have you done?”

He is terrified of hearing the truth. Because sometimes a single gesture is enough to destroy all good memories and darken a heart.

“I pierced Xiu Ya in his chest.” Shen Jiu speaks in a monotone voice. He lowered his head and stares blankly at the shards of Zheng Yang scattered on the ground. They shine like fallen stars. “And I pushed him to the Abyss.”

Shen Yuan is trembling. Because all his nightmares have grown and come true, locking him in a book whose terrible end has just been decided.

 

 

They remain in silence for a few minutes. Shen Jiu can feel Shen Yuan's panic, immense and absorbing, a shadow that covers the bamboo house. However, he doesn’t say or do anything. In his head, there is only space for all those screams against himself. Shen Yuan hasn’t tricked him. Shen Yuan didn’t want to lie to him. It is he who misinterpreted his words. It is he who met Luo Binghe's painful gaze and drew the worst of conclusions. It is he who has condemned them all.

Slowly, very slowly, Shen Jiu puts a hand to his head as he closes his eyes. Perhaps his destiny has always been destruction. Shen Yuan is the one who saves lives while he snatches them. It’s Shen Yuan who makes people friends and happy, he only brings suffering.

Maybe he should be left alone.

“Now what?” He mutters, too tired to mend his indifferent facade. “Tell me. What will happen when Luo Binghe returns in five years?”

“He will make you his prisoner. He... will torture you.” There is an inflection in his voice that reveals that there is something else that Shen Yuan doesn’t dare to utter. “He will kill monsters, find strange treasures, conquer all sects and merge both realms. No one will stop him.”

“I understand.” Shen Jiu takes a deep breath. “Leave.”

“What?” Shen Yuan looks at him in confusion. It's so surreal to see those emotions on his own face. Shen Yuan gives his features a touch of vulnerability, of sincerity, that betrays him as a different person.

“Have I not been clear enough? Get out. Now.” Shen Jiu turns his back on him. “I have created this mess, I will fix it. Get out. Right now.”

He intends to store his luggage and rest after a horrible night, however, the fool of Shen Yuan grabs his arm.

“Haven’t you understood me? No one will be able to stop Luo Binghe! And you are the person he will want to do the most harm to! And he will.”

Shen Jiu clicks his tongue dismissively. He still has a hard time imagining his disciple as a terrifying enemy. Also that the brat is capable of doing even more damage to him than he suffered in the past.

“You didn't want to be me. Don't be. Get away from the sect and Luo Binghe's revenge. Use your name, dress as you want, and travel to find those monsters that you are so passionate about.” Shen Jiu grabs Shen Yuan's hand to coldly push him away. “One Shen Qingqiu is enough.”

Perhaps Shen Jiu recognizes that Shen Yuan is a good person. He is the one who only sees the worst in people and is fooled by his own anger. During all those years he has strived to create a perfect facade to hide everything that is broken inside. Shen Jiu only knows how to hurt, but for once he wants to protect someone.

So go away. Please. You have made me stop feeling lonely, but I have only condemned you to death. That's not fair. Go away and don't let Luo Binghe ever find you. Take the cat, those books, and all your ridiculous ideas. You are the closest thing I have to a friend and that is why I don’t want anything bad happening to you. 

Shen Jiu averts his gaze, preventing Shen Yuan from reading his true thoughts in his eyes. He has to pretend to be cold and cruel. It's better if Shen Yuan hates him. Only the living can hate.

“No.” Shen Yuan intercepts him, stubborn and defiant. “I stay. I have nowhere to go and I will not abandon anyone. I know what will happen, I... I'll change it! I promise you! I will find a way to change the future!”

Shen Jiu listens to him wrapped in a feeling of uncertainty. He is unable to believe Shen Yuan, too naive, too optimistic. The world is cruel and happiness doesn’t exist.

But…

Shen Yuan can go. Nothing impedes him. Shen Yuan may go away and be selfish, but he has decided to stay. That certainty cuts through all his doubts. Shen Jiu may have gotten used to Shen Yuan's presence, but he has always distrusted him. He also doesn’t know how to trust other people. Everyone abandons him, they judge him, they hate him. But Shen Yuan has decided to stay.

Qi-Ge left, Shen Yuan no.

Suddenly, Shen Jiu feels his eyes sting. He needs all of his self-control to keep from breaking down in tears. He can trust Shen Yuan. He will never be alone again. He can trust someone who has had the opportunity to betray him and has not. He is no longer alone with his fears.

He.

Can.

Trust.

Shen Yuan.

And he promises that he will and will never distrust him again.

“Fine,” he growls, turning his head. “It's late, tomorrow we will talk about Luo Binghe's problem. Go to sleep.”

After so long, that night Shen Jiu has a nightmare again.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: Who is the older brother?
Shen Jiu: Me, obviously. I'm the original, I lived longer and also have a sword.
Shen Yuan: But you have no sense of survival! I'm the one who has to take care of you when you are poisoned. And now I'm going to have to fix your messes!
Yue Qingyuan: ... what about me?

CURIOSITY # 1
This is the interlude that precedes the central core of the second part: Shen Yuan protects the scum villain from the protagonist. Although I really like misunderstandings, this has only been the blow that both needed to assume certain decisions (the real angst will come later, don't worry 🖤).

They are already 98% brothers!

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shang Qinghua is afraid of the scum villain

Chapter Notes

Bingbing updating: 25%

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Thanks to his amazing talent, Liu Qingge has always overcome all the challenges that he has set for himself. Generally, they are physical, like mastering a new technique or defeating a monster. However, ever since Shen Qingqiu invited him to eat at his house after bragging about his disciple's culinary techniques, Liu Qingge has started to feel that he can do it too. And better.

His first attempt, a few pastries that he offered Shen Qingqiu on the way to the Alliance Conference, were a moderate success. However, the Alliance Conference was a failure and now Liu Qingge has another reason to improve his cooking. Despite the monsters' threat, Cang Qiong Mountain Sect only lost one disciple, the same one that Shen Qingqiu bragged so much about, the same one who nonetheless won.

Since Liu Qingge lost the bet, he regularly visits Qing Jing Peak. Shen Qingqiu's mood swings are more sudden. Sometimes he is unbearable and sometimes he smiles at him as if he had forgotten that the day before he yelled at him for punching a hole in the wall. Sometimes he gets lost in his thoughts and worries cloud his gaze.

Like the good friend that he is, Liu Qingge wants to make Shen Qingqiu feel better and that is what motivates him to improve his culinary technique.

Today he makes pork rice and fried tofu in garlic sauce. His new routine consists of training before the sun rises, cooking, training more, and heading to Qing Jing Peak. Like every day, something inside Liu Qingge writhes in doubt about what Shen Qingqiu's mood will be like. As he approaches the bamboo house, he recognizes a figure dressed in green who is reading some scrolls sitting in the garden. Liu Qingge would love to erase that worried look and promise him that he will never let anything bad happen to him ever again.

But Liu Qingge was late and was unable to save his disciple.

“Oh, Liu-shidi!” Shen Qingqiu raises his head from the scrolls to look at him. “It is always a pleasant surprise to see you again.”

Liu Qingge nods. It seems Shen Qingqiu is in a good mood today. At the same time, he seems especially restless. Shen Qingqiu picks up the scrolls with impatient, too abrupt movements. Liu Qingge kneels, but Shen Qingqiu rejects his help with a smile.

“Did Liu-shidi bring something to eat?” He asks when the two enter the bamboo house. His gaze is undisguisedly hanging on the package Liu Qingge is carrying.

Although Shen Qingqiu still hasn't recognized that his food is the best, Liu Qingge is satisfied to make Shen Qingqiu's smile shine. Even when he's in a worse mood, Shen Qingqiu receives his food with a lot of enthusiasm and that makes him feel happy. And fills Liu Qingge with the determination to keep improving.

The food is still hot thanks to some talismans. They both sit at the table and Shen Qingqiu prepares dishes. The first week Liu Qingge started cooking for him, Shen Qingqiu left half the plate to eat later , so now Liu Qingge does twice as much so Shen Qingqiu won't starve.

When they eat together, Liu Qingge doesn’t usually speak. He listens quietly to Shen Qingqiu's talk, although since the Alliance Conference Shen Qingqiu is usually lost in brooding silences. Sometimes, when he's grumpy, he hardly says anything. Today is one of those days when Shen Qingqiu is in high spirits and speaks for both of them.

A white cat smoothly walks over to sit on Shen Qingqiu's lap, who gives him bits of food too enthusiastically.

“You never told me what its name is,” Liu Qingge comments.

“It still has no name. We have a little debate... between my disciples and me, of course!” Shen Qingqiu laughs, strangely nervous. “I had thought of Copycat since it reminds me of someone.”

Liu Qingge doesn't know what Copycat means, but he agrees with him: the cat reminds him of Shen Qingqiu, specifically the past Shen Qingqiu before he saved his life. Of course, he decides to shut it up so as not to provoke his bad mood.

 

 

Since the night Shen Jiu decided to trust Shen Yuan, he has barely slept. Nightmares haunt him, plague his chest with restless worries that race his pulse. He is more nervous, tired, and upset, but all those fears that grow during the night also force him to act before the five years are gone.

Today, Shen Jiu shows up at An Ding Peak without warning, startling Shang Qinghua. Despite the obvious nervousness of his shidi, Shang Qinghua has no choice but to invite him to his house and serve him tea.

“What is the pleasure, Shen-shixiong?” He asks with an uneasy voice and the same panic in his eyes when someone brings up budgets in the meetings. “Do you want to talk about the reforms of your house?”

“Not today.” That is a pending task. He first reformed the house to keep Shen Yuan's existence a secret. Now, he wants to make it a more pleasant place. “It is another matter that brings me here. Tell me, Shang-shidi, when did you start colluding with demons?”

Shang Qinghua drops his teacup on the ground. He has turned pale and his hands are shaking as he begins to stutter.

“Wha-what are you talking about, Shen-shixiong?”

When he misinterpreted Shen Yuan, his impulsiveness linked two events. That same night, after calming down, Shen Jiu continued to value those ideas from a different approach.

“It’s suspicious that Cang Qiong Mountain Sect suffered two demonic attacks in such a short time. Attacks that share the same chance: demons couldn’t have done it alone.” Shen Qingqiu puts down his cup of tea and slaps the table with his fan to accompany his words. “First, the invasion.” Hit. “Someone told the demons when the sect would be most unprotected.” Hit. “Next, the sabotage of the Alliance Conference.” Hit. “Someone helped the demons infiltrate those monsters.” Hit. “Any sect could have contributed to the sabotage, but only someone from Cang Qiong knew when we would be most vulnerable.” Hit. “Of course, the Cang Qiong Sect is immense, but only a Peak Lord possesses all of this information.”

And narrowing down between the twelve Peak Lords had been very simple once he remembered that Shang Qinghua was the main one in charge of organizing the Alliance Conference. With that suspicion in mind, Shen Jiu began looking for other clues that would give him away.

“There are several reasons why I understood that it could only be you, but the most important one happened at the Alliance Conference.” He continues, pointing the fan at him. “My disciple and I were attacked by a demon after I said goodbye to you. It was strange, do you know why, Shang Qinghua?” He refuses to call that traitor shidi again. “There were many monsters, but not a single demon. That was the only demon and he came to specifically attack us.”

Shang Qinghua listened to him with his mouth open and terror reflected in his eyes. It was a real mystery how he had deceived them when little theories without proof were enough to unmask him.

“Fortunately for you, I have recently challenged a powerful demon.” Shen Qingqiu retrieves his cup of tea with a sly smirk. “And I'd like to have a spy to tell me what he's doing and what he's planning. If you don't like it, I can always talk to Zhangmen-shixiong.”

In fact, Shen Jiu doesn't trust Yue Qingyuan's judgment. He is too good and soft, capable of forgiving a treacherous rat or ignoring his accusations for lack of evidence. However, Shang Qinghua doesn’t know this. The important thing is that he believes that Shen Jiu has the power to destroy him with a single word.

“Shen-shixiong, I… I...” Shang Qinghua babbles unable to formulate coherent words.

“You what? Didn't you want to do it? It's too late for that.”

Shang Qinghua bows his head. For a moment, Shen Jiu fears that the cultivator will end up in a qi deviation.

“Do you want me to spy on Luo Binghe for you?” He finally splutters, stunned and on the verge of a nervous breakdown.

“I never said Luo Binghe is a demon. But yes.”

“You're going to get us to kill both of us.”

“I have no intention of that beast killing me.” Not to put his hands on Shen Yuan. “Of course, I won't let you try to betray me either. If you don't like my conditions, we can talk to Zhangmen-shixiong.”

“Wait! Wait! Shen-shixiong!”

“Shen Qingqiu for you.”

Shang Qinghua wrings his hands nervously before closing his eyes and taking a deep breath.

“How can I help you? My... source of information is limited and right now your disciple is out of my reach.”

Shen Jiu smiles, savoring his victory.

“I want you to tell me absolutely all the details about how you infiltrated the demons in the sect and the monsters in the Alliance Conference. I want to know more about that ice demon and the current state of the Demon Realm. I want you to keep me informed about Luo Binghe's movements. I want you to double my salary.”

“Why do you want…?”

“Is there a problem, Shang Qinghua?”

“No! No! No!”

“Great,” his smile becomes more treacherous and crooked. “And don't forget: if I fall, you will fall with me.”

Shen Jiu is in a good mood when he returns to Qing Jing Peak. His visit to An Ding Peak is a little secret since he doesn't want to worry Shen Yuan. Shen Jiu knows that Shen Yuan is terrified, although he tries to hide it behind a carefree smile. It is because of Shen Yuan that he won't sit idly by for five years. Come back when you dare, Luo Binghe, he thinks. I'll be ready.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS 1
Liu Mingyan: Gege, has someone told you that you are too competitive?
Liu Qingge: I am not.
Liu Mingyan: What if someone is a better swordsman than you?
Liu Qingge: I will train to be the best.
Liu Mingyan: What if Shen-shibo says that his disciple is the best cook?
Liu Qingge: I will learn to cook better.
Liu Mingyan: What if Luo Binghe will have a triple digit harem?
Liu Qingge: *grabs Shen Yuan and Shen Jiu by the waist*
Liu Qingge: My harem will be better 😤

CURIOSITY # 1
I know many of you want the cucumberplane friendship, but... what about scumplane friendship? (Don't worry! Eventually Shen Yuan will find out who Shang Qinghua really is, but this misunderstanding is funier).

BONUS: Meanwhile in the Endless Abyss
Luo Binghe: Is Shizun eating properly without me?
Luo Binghe: I remember when cleaning I found TWO charred congees 😰
Liu Qingge: Don't worry.
Liu Qingge: I won't let Shen Qingqiu starve 😤
Luo Binghe, drinking vinegar: Now I'm EVEN MORE worried (ﾉಥ益ಥ）ﾉ ︵┻━┻

BONUS 3
Liu Qingge: Shen Qingqiu eats for two people, how strange.
Liu Qingge: Shen Qingqiu has a huge appetite.
Shang Qinghua: Shen Qingqiu wants double the salary, how strange.
Shang Qinghua: The scum villain is a scoundrel.

 They are less and less subtle and soon they will be discovered 🤭
