★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu and Shen Yuan seek the Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds

Chapter Summary

Bingbing updating: 50%

Chapter Notes

The previous chapter is pretty quiet and I DIDN'T EXPECT SO MANY COMMENTS????? THANK YOU SO MUCH! Your feedback gives me a lot of strength to continue writing 🥰❤️💚❤️💚

The Shen brothers are finally going on a trip together! In the end, dreams come true, even if they seem impossible at first.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

What Shen Yuan admires the most about Shen Jiu is his impudence.

He is the only one capable of announcing without his voice shaking that he will be leaving on a little trip. Alone. With a carriage just for him. No, Ning Yingying, this teacher doesn't need any help. No, Ming Fan, he doesn't need anyone to drive that carriage.

If Shen Yuan wasn't so stressed out, he would have found it funny.

Shen Yuan has a plan. The plan is still not very good. In fact, it is so ambiguous that Shen Jiu scoffs with his characteristic malice saying that it is not even a plan. Well, it's better than nothing.

First, they need to improve Shen Qingqiu's image. And Shen Jiu isn't helping by scaring Shang Qinghua for no reason and making decisions that may seem conceited, outlandish, and absurd.

Okay, they need a carriage to get the two of them out of the sect without being discovered. But they also need a reason to take a carriage, in addition to "Shen Qingqiu does whatever he wants." So, Shen Yuan insists until Shen Jiu yields. Now, Shen Qingqiu has taken a carriage because he is going to look for medicinal plants. His decisions are now understandable and they also get merits with Mu Qingfang. Great job!

Second, they need to prepare for Luo Binghe's arrival.

And so, that morning the two of them sneak out of Cang Qiong Mountain Sect: Shen Yuan hiding inside the carriage and Shen Jiu driving it. It's exciting and a bit scary in case they are discovered. To avoid meddling, Shen Jiu has made them get up early at an inhuman hour. 

Perhaps Shen Yuan has fallen asleep for the first ten minutes inside the carriage while leaving the mountain.

Finally away from the sect, Shen Jiu stops for Shen Yuan to come out and sit by his side.

Despite Luo Binghe’s threat, who occupies all his thoughts and robs his peace of mind, Shen Yuan allows himself to relax that day. It is the first time since the Shang Hu City mission that he has left the sect and is nervous, excited, and impatient. The morning seems even brighter outside than from the bamboo house.

He sighs, closing his eyes as the sun caresses his face.

“You look happy,” Shen Jiu comments. He speaks without looking at him, his attention fixed on the road. His voice sounds less harsh, almost soft.

“It’s a nice day!”

Something has changed since the Alliance Conference. Shen Yuan believed, seeing him so angry and upset, that Shen Jiu hated him. He still doesn't understand why he decided to help him. Shen Jiu is Shen Qingqiu, the villain he hated, the reason behind Luo Binghe's suffering. Shen Yuan should have fled to save his own life. However, Shen Jiu is not really Shen Qingqiu. He is the person with whom he shares a house and who has started to act almost like a friend. And Shen Yuan is unable to flee, saving his life but condemning Ming Fan and the other disciples, Liu Qingge, and the Peak Lords.

Something changed. Perhaps he is naive in believing that he can fix everything, even the scum villain. But Shen Jiu is acting differently. He is still an unpleasant and unsympathetic person, spending half his time complaining about everyone and the other half seeking arguments. But not with him. Not anymore. Shen Yuan no longer needs to pluck up the courage to tell him that his attitude towards the carriage has been arrogant since Shen Jiu listens to him. And the two talk until they reach an agreement.

But Shen Yuan is afraid of making a mistake. Shen Jiu is such a cold person that it is impossible to know his thoughts. Or feelings. Although Shen Yuan has questioned him, Shen Jiu refuses to tell him what he thought of Luo Binghe until he discovered that he was a demon. Or why is he acting so nasty towards Yue Qingyuan and refusing to let Shen Yuan represent Shen Qingqiu if he detests the sect leader so much. Or what he really thinks of Liu Qingge. 

What he thinks about Shen Yuan.

Shen Yuan is afraid that he has started to consider him a friend, but Shen Jiu is unable to appreciate anyone.

They travel quietly until silence grows unbearable. Shen Jiu clears his throat before speaking.

“I know you don't like getting up early, but I could only teach you how to handle the sword correctly when the disciples are sleeping.”

Shen Yuan looks at him curiously, surprised by his comment.

"And why not at night?"

It is no secret that Shen Jiu is suffering from horrible insomnia. Shen Yuan doesn't mind going to bed later to practice music. In his afterlife, he spent almost every night reading and has found that music helps Shen Jiu. Although he would rather have his roommate visit Mu Qingfang.

“Your qi will flow better if you have rested,” says the same person who never rests. “And I will only allow you to go on missions if you know how to handle Xiu Ya.”

“Wait!” He exclaims so loudly that even the horses get scared. “Will you let me out of the sect? And with Xiu Ya?”

“Yes, I hate wasting my time on missions and you like it.” Shen Jiu continues to stare at the road, which adds a touch of nonchalance to his words. “But you can only go if you know how to defend yourself correctly.” Correctly in the language of Shen Jiu means perfectly . “Shen Qingqiu only uses Xiu Ya and it would be strange if we pick up another spirit sword, so yes, I will lend you my sword.” Shen Yua longs for Xiu Ya. It is a stupid dream to believe that was also his sword. “And for that, you need classes. I would also feel calmer if you could protect yourself from Luo Binghe when he returns.”

Shen Jiu is the only person who grants a favor in a grumpy manner and erases all possible enthusiasm. Even so, Shen Yuan has mixed feelings. He doesn’t know whether to be scared or rejoice. It's confusing because it almost seems like Shen Jiu is worried about him. But it’s surely his imagination.

A while later, when Shen Yuan feels hungry, he pulls out of his sleeve the package that Liu Qingge has prepared for them. This time its baozi bread. Shen Yuan distributes them by savoring in advance.

“Do you want me to replace you?” He asks Shen Jiu.

“Can you drive a carriage?”

“I can learn!”

Shen Jiu almost let out a laugh. It’s more of a hiss, but his smile is real and this time Shen Yuan hasn't imagined it.

“Eat and stop talking nonsense.” And he adds after a pause. “But if you eat my part, you will walk the rest of the way.”

Shen Yuan laughs. Is it so hard for Shen Jiu to admit that Liu Qingge brings them some really good food? It doesn’t have the legendary level of the protagonist, but it’s getting more and more delicious with time.

“Who do you think will cook it? Can you imagine it is Liu Qingge?”

Shen Yuan scores another goal by making Shen Jiu choke on laughter. The idea is as absurd as funny. Shen Yuan is unable to imagine the serious Liu Qingge locked in a kitchen.

“He would probably use Cheng Luan instead of a knife,” Shen Jiu comments maliciously.

This time they both laugh at the same time.

“It has probably been a disciple,” Shen Yuan wonders. “It is also just as rare to imagine a Bai Zhan Peak disciple cooking as Liu Qingge, honestly.”

“Mn.” Shen Jiu makes a pause that Shen Yuan already recognizes as hesitant. That's weird. Shen Jiu usually always has very clear ideas. Sometimes even too much. “A disciple who cooks instead of training doesn’t fit into Bai Zhan Peak.”

“Oh!” He turns to him to pick his cheek. “Are they my imaginations or do you seem concerned about an unknown disciple?”

Shen Jiu growls, turning his face away.

“I could get you that disciple.”

“What?”

Shen Yuan blinks, confused.

“Liu Qingge probably won't want them. And they would be more comfortable if they was at Qing Jing Peak than having to bring food from Bai Zhan Peak every day.” As always, everything he says is reasonable. But Shen Yuan is convinced that he recognizes something anomalous in his tone of voice. “And you miss the little beast. Don't fool me, I know. Would you like to have your own disciple?”

First the sword and now a disciple. It's too many emotions put together and Shen Yuan's head is starting to hurt. That is terrifying! Shen Jiu doesn't seem to appreciate anything or anyone, but his actions lately are contradictory. Shen Yuan doesn't know what to think. Shen Yuan is afraid that he is delusional and is just another misunderstanding.

“Please, don’t steal anyone’s disciple.” He responds with a sigh.

“It wouldn’t be the first time.”

“Shen Jiu!?”

He's definitely the cheekiest person in the PIDW world.

They travel to the Bailu Forest without stop talking, gossiping a lot, and dodging the topic of the future. Shen Yuan is tired when they finally reach their destination. A gasp of astonishment escapes him when at last that immense and disproportionate forest.

“I hope those seeds are there,” Shen Jiu growls, clicking his tongue. “I don't want to explain anything to that old truant.”

Shen Yuan doesn't ask anything, but Shen Jiu's contempt for the Old Palace Master hasn’t gone unnoticed. Nor is it anyone they need to worry about. But yes, it is better if they avoid attracting the attention of Huan Hua Palace.

Evidently, a few minutes later they bump into someone from Huan Hua Palace.

“Master… Shen?” A disciple with age and bearing similar to Luo Binghe mutters.

As if that weren't enough, the disciple's gaze shifts from one to the other. And although the IQ of the PIDW characters is usually quite low, that young man knows how to do calculations and from his expression, the result of that sum is not what he expected.

Maybe and only maybe they have been overconfident those days. How many possibilities were there that precisely someone from another sect would be the first to catch them? Uneasy, Shen Yuan raises his fan. Beside him, Shen Jiu has outlined his most arrogant expression, as if daring him to hint that there is something wrong. Obviously, the poor disciple doesn't dare to say anything.

But maybe he does it later and very dangerous information reaches the wrong ears.

"This teacher has suffered a temporary complication," Shen Yuan comments, hiding all his nervousness behind a neutral expression. “Have you heard of the Apple with Two Souls?”

Shen Yuan has immense knowledge of all the shitty plots of PIDW. Understanding what he is referring to, the disciple relaxes and nods. What’s more, Shen Jiu lets out a growl of approval.

“That was smart,” he compliments him with a whisper.

They haven’t managed to get rid of the disciple, who has insisted on accompanying them after convincing him that they are just one person and that they are searching for medicinal plants nearby Huan Hua Palace. Shen Yuan considers him to be a very nice boy, avoiding conflicts between sects by keeping his secret.

But what makes him most excited is the recognition of the eternally fussy and dissatisfied Shen Jiu.

Unfortunately, Shen Yuan can’t tell him that he knows Apple with Two Souls due to a horrifying chapter in which Luo Binghe and Wife 27? suffer a peculiar incident. By mistake, Wife 32? ate the Apple with Two Souls and split into two separate bodies: a more emotional one that represented her heart and a colder one that represented her logic. The approach was interesting. The two bodies of Wife 38? acted differently despite being the same person, but it became an excuse to end in a threesome.

“His name is Gongyi Xiao,” Shen Jiu whispers to him again. Shen Yuan stiffens as he recognizes another minor character of the novel. “He is probably the only decent disciple of the Huan Hua Palace.“

“Probably not, he is,” he says by mistake.

Obviously, Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow at grasping that information that he shouldn't possess.

“Is he important in the future?”

“No. He also will end up miserably. Luo Binghe will send him away for daring to woo his future wife.”

Shen Jiu nodded. And he continues to be strangely thoughtful, even when Shen Yuan ends up talking to Gongyi Xiao (he's excited, okay? He's another character with incredible potential like Liu Qingge who was wasted by Airplane's terrible storytelling. And Shen Yuan is supposed to be the heart and Shen Jiu logic , so he must be sociable), when they get disturbed by a snake, and when they finally reach the cave.

He says nothing until he grabs Shen Yuan by the arm before he enters the waters of a lake.

“What are you doing?”

“The seeds are in the center of the lake.”

“Why do you want to get wet when there is a disciple here?” Shen Jiu rolls his eyes before turning to Gongyi Xiao. “Bring us the seeds.”

Shen Jiu's nerve continues to surprise Shen Yuan.

The innocent Gongyi Xiao does whatever he asks of them. He brings them the seeds and even listens to Shen Yuan when he tells him to leave the poor demon snake alone since it is harmless. He even offers to guide the carriage while Master Shen recovers from the poisoning.

“It’s not necessary,” Shen Yuan quickly adds.

“It’s not a bad idea,” Shen Jiu says at the same time.

The two Shens look at each other. 

And Gongyi Xiao is smart enough to walk away and leave space for them to argue.

“If you're tired, I can drive the carriage myself.” Everything would be easier if Shen Jiu recognized his limits. “But we have to return to the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect alone. If they hear the nonsense of the Apple with Two Souls, Mu Qingfang will investigate and he will recognize that we are not poisoned.”

“I have a better plan,” Shen Jiu says with proud satisfaction. “He takes us to the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. He stays in Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. Huan Hua Palace doesn’t deserve a disciple with his talents.”

“What did I tell you about stealing disciples?” Shen Jiu's impudence begins to worry Shen Yuan. ”Furthermore, Luo Binghe will want to destroy our disciples as well. We would be putting him in danger!”

“He already has a miserable end, what difference does it make? Wouldn't you like to also save him as we are going to save our disciples?”

“Seriously, Shen Jiu, you can't take people away without even asking them first. And no. We are not doing it.”

“We are two and he is one.” He growls. “And he seems to admire us and you have liked him. I don’t see the problem.”

“Huan Hua Palace will probably not think the same.”

Shen Yuan settled the discussion by returning to the carriage.

“This teacher appreciates your offer, but we must go.”

“It was a pleasure, Master Shen!”

“In gratitude for your services, you can come to visit us whenever you want to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect,” Shen Jiu intervenes without giving up. Shen Yuan can see that he is smiling behind his fan. “This teacher has appreciated your attitude very much and would like to reward you.”

Shen Yuan tramples him in the subtlest way he can.

They don't speak again until the two of them get back on the road.

“Now seriously, which one do you prefer? Liu Qingge's mysterious cook or Gongyi Xiao? Or maybe both?”

“We are not going to kidnap anybody!”

“I know. But there are other ways to convince possibly dissatisfied disciples with their teachers.”

“And antagonize Liu-shidi and the Old Palace Master? We agreed that we were going to improve Shen Qingqiu's image!”

For a few seconds, Shen Jiu doesn't say anything. Then he clicks his tongue, annoyed.

“My life used to be better when I didn't have to worry about what other people thought of me.”

But now we wouldn’t be in this mess!

 

 

Despite the stress of leaving and entering the sect without being discovered, Shen Jiu acknowledges that he has enjoyed that little journey with Shen Yuan. It was fun. He liked that the two of them were alone in a different environment than the bamboo house without fear of being discovered and acting normally. Without neither of them pretending to be someone else.

His gaze lingers on his Sun and Moon Dew Flower seed. He hasn’t read anything about that plant, but according to Shen Yuan, it will serve to create a second body and escape death. He clenches his fist, holding tight to the seed. Although he hasn't said anything, he doesn't like that plan. Faking his death won't fix Luo Binghe's problem. Shen Yuan has spoken to him of the destruction of the sects, the merge of both realms, of the cruel and unjust deaths. None of that will go away even if Shen Qingqiu does.

Shen Jiu recognizes that he is not a good person. But he is consistent with his actions. Using Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds is a cowardly decision. He won’t run away.

He won’t abandon anyone.

Of course, he hasn't said anything to Shen Yuan. Because the most selfish part of Shen Jiu is relieved knowing that Shen Yuan has an alternate body and nothing will happen to him.

“Now we should choose the place where we will plant our bodies!” Shen Yuan comments happily, returning with several maps in his arms. “We should choose a place with a lot of spiritual energy.”

Although Shen Jiu's expression is empty, his throat is dry.

“It is better if we look for different places. And keep it a secret.” His gaze stops at the scroll on which Shen Yuan has written down all the information about Luo Binghe's abilities. “You said that with his manipulation of dreams and blood it is almost impossible to keep a secret from him. In that case, we should not know the location of the other's body. You know, in the worst case one gets caught we couldn’t say anything.”

That is a very cowardly lie. Because Shen Jiu keeps his seed in a box and hides it deep inside the bamboo house.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS 1: Shang Qinghua
Shen Yuan: Why are you bothering Shang Qinghua? 🤨
Shen Jiu, who doesn't want to tell him the truth about his scheming to protect Shen Yuan: It's my hobby.
Shen Yuan: PLEASE 😭

CURIOSITY # 1
When I planned the beginning of the story, I discovered a problem: Shen Jiu would never arm a possible enemy with his own sword. So, bye Xiu Ya. Chapter 19 is that crucial point where Shen Jiu begins to trust Shen Yuan. And now Shen Jiu will finally lend Xiu Ya to Shen Yuan.

Why are you such a complicated person!!??

BONUS 2: status of the Shen brothers
Shen Jiu: I ... appreciate Shen Yuan????
Shen Jiu: Am I starting to see him as a brother????
Shen Jiu: The idea of Shen Yuan being injured or killed makes me feel sad?????
Shen Jiu: Fine, I accept it, I care about my double. BUT I'M GOING TO HIDE ALL MY FEELINGS BECAUSE I DON'T KNOW HOW TO ACT NICE WITH ANOTHER PERSON.
Shen Yuan: Shen Jiu is acting weird???
Shen Yuan: Maybe... WE ARE FRIENDS?
Shen Yuan: It's like Liu Qingge. We used to be rivals and now we are friends.
Shen Yuan: Friendship is beautiful :D

BONUS 3: Disciples
Shen Jiu: Shen Yuan misses the little beast :(
Shen Jiu: I have a brilliant idea! I will bring (kidnap) him another disciple :)
Little Bingbing: My shizun sense warns me of danger! I have to come back soon! ÓAÒ

Shen Jiu is that cat that instead of bringing you dead animals brings you disciples (alive). He's proud, okay? It's his manner of showing his affection. Please, someone pet the cat.

BONUS 3: Disciples 2
Shen Jiu: Can we take Bai Zhan Peak's cook?
Shen Yuan: No.
Shen Jiu: We are two. We ambush him and take him to Qing Jing Peak. Nobody will know.
Shen Yuan: NO.
Liu Qingge: 😳😳😳😳

The day all misunderstandings will resolve Mu Qingfang will have to deal with many qi deviations.

P.S.
Do you think only Shen Yuan misses Bingbing? 👀

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Liu Qingge realizes his feelings

Chapter Summary

Bingbing updating: 75%

Chapter Notes

THE SUCUBUS MISSION IS HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Shen Jiu tries to read, but he feels an uncertainty in his heart that prevents him from concentrating. Although Shen Yuan has already gone out several times on short trips outside of the sect, this is his first mission. Succubi are simple demons to defeat and Liu Qingge accompanies him, but... worry has become entangled in his shadow and doesn’t leave him alone.

Finally, he hears steps. Shen Jiu doesn't move, refusing to show vulnerability, even though inside he is happy that Shen Yuan has returned. The door opens and Shen Yuan enters the bamboo house. Shen Jiu frowns upon seeing him.

“Why are you soaked?” His voice escapes, strangled with disgust. “Your hair is a mess! What happened?”

“Liu-shidi has been affected by the succubi’s poison,” he grunts, leaving the remains of a paper fan on the table. Shen Jiu recognizes him as one of Shen Yuan's favorites. “I had to throw him into cold water. He has pushed me for revenge.”

Shen Jiu puts a sleeve over his mouth to hide a smile.

“Please, tell me what happened.” He clears his throat to stifle a laugh. “Despite our classes, has our dear shidi been fooled? Oh, I would have loved to see him drenched like a cat!”

Shen Yuan, on the other hand, has no qualms about laughing. He has always been the more open of the two and barely hides it anymore, but Shen Jiu doesn't care.

“His expression has been very funny! And he does act a little like a cat. He almost snorted at me, all soaked and disheveled!”

Shen Jiu hums, fanning himself languidly, as he tries to picture the pristine and ever-perfect Liu Qingge with his hair in his face, perhaps his tousled ponytail and wet clothes clinging to his muscles. He shakes his head before a mischievous daydream turns into something else.

 

 

Liu Qingge walks down Bai Zhan Peak with impatient steps. Despite the cold water bath, he still feels a warmth in his chest spreading to his face. His disciples, clever and cunning, flee when they see him. They recognize that he is nervous and wanting perhaps to hit something until he rips off that heat.

Before reaching his rooms, he catches a random disciple.

“Shen Qingqiu’s bestiary,” he demands.

Liu Qingge remembers very well the classes that Shen Qingqiu gave on poisonous beasts and that all the disciples received a book written by him. And right now, with the succubus venom still under his skin, he needs that book.

Or ask for help, but his pride prevents it.

Back home, Liu Qingge takes off his crown and wet clothes. Half naked, he sits in a lotus posture and opens the bestiary to find the succubus section. Although he didn’t give importance to the succubi, too weak demons that he had already faced, he heard the lesson twice. His cheeks burn at the thought that he, despite everything, has fallen into such an obvious trap. And on top of it, in front of Shen Qingqiu! It's a miracle that his shixiong still hasn't made fun of him. Liu Qingge deserves it.

Liu Qingge knew the risks of succubi and that is precisely why he offered to accompany Shen Qingqiu, worried that those devious demons would try something. Succubi stalk attractive mortals, and Shen Qingqiu is one of the most beautiful in the sect. (Something inside Liu Qingge trembles as he remembers how Shen Qingqiu has mocked him and his pretty face .)

However, the protector was the one affected by Madame Meiyin's words.

Um… the other party is younger than you.

Liu Qingge gulps, recalling the succubus prediction with a racing pulse.

Your first meeting was unpleasant. You may have disliked each other, even. However, a crucial event happened and led to you turning your relationship around.

Two very different memories, drenched in bewilderment, shame, and the same warmth he feels now, shake him: the first time he was affected by succubus venom. He returned to the sect even more restless than now and did not stop until he found Shen Qingqiu and challenged him to a duel. At that time he couldn't stand him. But then Shen Qingqiu rescued him from his qi deviation and saved his life.

Since then, their relationship has changed forever.

This person is always by your side.

His breathing quickens, thinking of that month he visited Qing Jing Peak every day. Shen Qingqiu scolded him for his manners and he silenced him with food. Sometimes they even played weiqi.

You have saved each other’s lives. Your destined one rarely pays attention to those around them, Immortal Master. However, once they come to care about someone, they do it full-heartedly, without any reservations.

Liu Qingge covers his face with both hands while letting out a groan. Until Shen Qingqiu saved his life, he was always outside the sect traveling, seeking threats, and hunting monsters. Now…

A beauty second to none.

Shen Qingqiu thinks that he has a pretty face. He's been messing with his looks all morning.

Exceptional potential, powerful spiritual energy. They come from a distinguished household and descended from a noble bloodline.

Liu Qingge knows that the succubus' words sought to confuse them and then attack them (which she did). Yet where did she get so much information from? Did she know that he came from the famous Liu lineage?

His gaze desperately searches for those answers in the bestiary. Sadly, Shen Qingqiu only wrote about the poison and there are hardly a few lines dedicated to the prophetic abilities of the succubi. According to Shen Qingqiu, they are limited and very specific. Succubi can read mortal hearts, distinguish soulmates, and recognize love.

They might part for a short time, but they’ll meet again quickly. It is Immortal Master’s fated one who does the chasing. I’m jealous, Immortal Master. This person is staggeringly devoted to you.

“Nonsense!!” He grunts before getting up. He still feels the heat of the poison in his heart, so he decides to take another cold bath and then goes to meditate. According to the bestiary, the poison can last up to seven days if it’s not cured with dual cultivation.

Well, Liu Qingge will avoid everyone (especially Shen Qingqiu) for seven days.

 

 

 

Eight days after Shen Yuan's mission, Liu Qingge returns to the bamboo house. And this time he knocks on the door.

“You're improving, shidi,” Shen Jiu greets him with a smug smirk. “What is the pleasure?”

Liu Qingge still needs more classes, since he reaches out to offer him a fan without elegance or manners. Although he tries to meet his eyes, he finally looks away when an intense blush covers his cheeks.

“For you.” He splutters. “You lost the other fan because of me.”

“Oh!” Shen Jiu picks it up delicately, as Liu Qingge's strength has almost split the fan in half. Like all the ones he has given to them, it is pretty. This one is light blue with drawings of pink petals. “Shidi has very good taste. Too bad he's still a brute.”

Liu Qingge mutters something under his breath before turning his back on him and leaving so fast that he seems to be running away. How strange , Shen Jiu thinks before closing the door. Although before the distraction he and Shen Yuan were talking about possible plans to protect Luo Binghe's sect, he now can only think of Liu Qingge's strange attitude.

“Shidi has brought you a gift,” he says, throwing the fan at him. Truth be told, Shen Jiu would rather keep such a pretty fan, but he acknowledges that the gift is not for him. 

Shen Yuan accepts it with bright eyes and much joy. Shen Jiu watches him, still with suspicion in mind. He thinks back to Liu Qingge's attitude, so unexpected, almost docile, and embarrassed.

“Did something else happen during the succubus mission?”

“Mn?” Shen Yuan raises his head, confused. “What are you talking about?”

“Liu Qingge is acting strange. Almost as if...” The words catch in his throat and he winces. “Like he's infatuated with you. Or Shen Qingqiu.”

Shen Yuan's eyes widened before breaking into laughter. No meanness or mockery, just as if he had been told the funniest joke in the world. 

“No way! Liu Qingge is the second most straight man in the world!”

Still wary, Shen Jiu sits in front of him.

“What’s straight ?” He demands, annoyed as always Shen Yuan says a word that he doesn't know.

“You know, the normal.”

“It won't be very normal if I don't know what you're talking about,” he growls.

Shen Yuan's smile becomes more mocking. He has opened the fan, but without hiding behind it.

“Men who like women. Like Luo Binghe, the most straight man in the universe.”

“Oh.” A faint blush stains his cheeks. “Don’t be ridiculous. Perhaps that is normal among mortals, but in the cultivation world things are different.”

Now it is Shen Yuan's turn to open his mouth in surprise.

“Seriously?”

“Yeah. There are many reasons to choose your cultivation partner, not just their gender. For example, many of Xian Shu Peak's disciples prefer women.”

But Shen Yuan is right. Liu Qingge will one day choose someone with potential comparable to his own, not the crippled cultivation of any Shen Qingqiu. After clearing up the misunderstanding, Shen Jiu forgets about it to focus on the plans he was discussing with Shen Yuan.

Still, there is something inside his chest that doesn't know whether to be relieved or disappointed.

“Now that you mention it...” Shen Yuan mutters after a while in silence. “Madame Meiyin said something about my soulmate. But the description was very ambiguous and in the end, she didn’t finish her prophecy. She said it was confusing, as she could read two different lives on the palm of my hand.”

“I'm not surprised: you stole my body.“

Shen Yuan bows his head at first, embarrassed, but then he smiles mischievously.

“Do you want to know how your soulmate is?”

Shen Jiu tenses. He once believed in those tales, but there is nothing like that. The people you love leave you without an explanation, they hate you when you destroy their life. Meanwhile, you may end up appreciating the people you used to hate.

“Don’t say foolishness.” Shen Jiu sighs, wiping the bitterness out of his voice before forcing a smirk. “I just hope our soulmate is better than the cat.”

 

 

Liu Qingge flees the bamboo house thinking of burning a book. The bestiary said that in seven days the poison would be gone! Why has he still got so nervous seeing Shen Qingqiu, as graceful as ever? Liu Qingge notices his heart racing and his cheeks flushed. It’s ridiculous and embarrassing, but as he leaves Qing Jing Peak, he can only think of Shen Qingqiu's different smiles. Before he couldn’t bear them, now he appreciates them. He prefers his grins to his frowns or rolling eyes. Liu Qingge likes that sincere, wide, and bright smile when Shen Qingqiu is in a good mood and enthusiastically talks to him about some monster. But he also appreciates that other smile, more sarcastic and sometimes mischievous.

Feeling that his nervousness doesn’t fade, Liu Qingge flies to Qian Cao Peak. Impatient, he looks for Mu Qingfang and practically extends his wrist in front of his nose even though the healer is who usually chases after him to check on his injuries.

“I’m poisoned,” he announces.

Mu Qingfang pales.

“It has to be something very serious for Liu-shidi to voluntarily seek me out.” Despite his concerned tone, there is irony in his voice. “Mn… Your meridians are fine, shidi. When were you poisoned? What symptoms do you notice?”

“Eight days ago, succubus poison. Shen Qingqiu's bestiary says that without dual cultivation it takes a week for the poison to disappear.”

“And it has disappeared.” Mu Qingfang lets go of him to give him a friendly slap on his forearm. “But you have done well to consult with me. I hope you will do it again in the future. And if only that stubborn Shen-shixiong would do the same!”

Liu Qingge listens to him paralyzed and confused. This is the first time the healer has made a mistake. He still notices the poison inside his heart. Neither his nervousness, the tachycardia, or blushing is normal. The last time the poisoning wasn’t so serious and yet it only disappeared when he defeated Shen Qingqiu in combat, knocking him to the ground. The memory of Shen Qingqiu, disheveled, his clothes open to show his collarbones, only aggravates his current symptoms.

“Fuck.”

He needs another cold bath and meditation.

Since his trusted doctor had failed him, in the following days Liu Qingge didn’t know who to talk to about his problem. He demanded missions from Yue Qingyuan away from the sect, but Shen Qingqiu pursued him in his dreams. Also the damn words of the succubus. Liu Qingge needs to ask someone for help, but there are only two poison experts in the sect: the healer, who has mistakenly considered him cured, and Shen Qingqiu, the reason for his symptoms.

In the end, Liu Qingge decides to talk to Liu Mingyan. She is the person he trusts the most in the world and if she was able to infiltrate a brothel to find answers (although in the end, he asked her not to do so, deciding that he would wait for Shen Qingqiu to tell him the truth) maybe she can also sneak in the Qing Jing Peak Library.

Liu Mingyan sighs after sipping her cup of tea.

“You are not poisoned, Gege. Your symptoms were already there before you faced the succubi, but you have only noticed it now,” she patiently explains to him after hearing his problem. 

“So what is it?”

Liu Qingge hates problems that he cannot solve with a sword. Thanks to his powerful cultivation, he has survived a lot of poisonings and accidents. But now he is affected by something nameless that keeps him from sleeping and makes him behave like an idiot in front of Shen Qingqiu.

“You are in love.”

He opens his mouth intending to protest, but then…

He understands that his sister is right.

He has fallen in love with Shen Qingqiu.

Chapter End Notes

FINALLY!!!! LIU-SHIDI HAS ACCEPTED HIS FEELINGS!!!! AN APPLAUSE PLEASE!!! THANK YOU MINGYAN FOR YOUR HARD WORK IN THIS FIC!!!! 🎉🎉🎉🎉🎉🎉🎉🎉

CURIOSITY # 1
I have the headcanon that Liu Qingge discovers his feelings during the succubus mission. BUT THIS TIME YOU WILL HAVE YOUR ENDGAME! (My heart always breaks at the thought of Liu Qingge having such a loyal crush for Shen Qingqiu despite everything.)

Although I wanted to tell the scene in the dialogues and thoughts of Shen Yuan and Liu Qingge (long live the unreliable narrators! >:D), just in case, in this AU Madam Meiyin's words are intentionally ambiguous to refer also to Bingbing and Liu Qingge. Shen Yuan and Shen Jiu theoretically have the same hand lines, will they also share soulmates? Or do they have their own soulmate? Does fate bind you to a single person or can you love several? Maybe that question is resolved by the end of the story 👀 But I will love reading your theories!

BONUS 1: Worst misunderstanding
Shen Yuan 'Everyone is straight starting with me': Luo Binghe is a harem master! Liu Qingge is the second straightest person in this world!
Shen Jiu 'I have a lot of emotional deficiencies': You have earned my trust and I will absolutely believe everything you tell me.

Is this the recipe for a catastrophe? Evidently >:D

CURIOSITY # 2
Besides the new misunderstanding that Romantic Interests are going to suffer, I wanted to start planting the seeds that this world is openly LGBT (it's a fantasy world, let's skip the homophobia ~). Shen Yuan, my love, a long arc of development awaits you too.

CURIOSITY # 3
I have finally been able to write Liu Qingge's promised gay panic! Bingbing still hasn't returned to the plot yet and Shen Jiu and Liu Qingge are already a bit horny. The fic's rating is in danger and the author is suffering.

BONUS 2
Liu Qingge: Now that my feelings are clear, it's time to start courting Shen Qingqiu.
Little Bingbing: That's it, I can't take it anymore. Tell the travel agency that I cancel the rest of the years crossing the Abyss.

Little Bingbing returns in the next chapter! ONE Shen Qingqiu will go to Jinlan City and meet a Black Bingbing. Shen Jiu or Shen Yuan? Bingmei or Bingge? Tell me your theories and I'll release the chapter soon! 😈
