★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Qingqiu meets Luo Binghe in Jinlan City

Chapter Summary

Bingbing updating: 100%

Chapter Notes

BLACK BINGBING IS HERE!!!!!!!!!!!

Also, this is the chapter of ❤️ HOLDING HANDS ❤️ (unilateral)

This chapter is quite intense, hope you like it.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It has been a long time since Liu Qingge went on a mission with Shen Qingqiu. Although they are not alone, since Mu Qingfang accompanies them to Jinlan City, now that he is aware of his feelings he is nervous and tense. His gaze is hanging on Shen Qingqiu, as graceful as ever, in the way his fingers caress the fan he gave him. When Shen Qingqiu turns to look at him, Liu Qingge turns his head away and pretends to ask the healer if he needs him to carry something.

Yue Qingyuan comes out to greet them, although it’s no secret that he does so because he has always had a slight soft spot for Shen Qingqiu. Liu Qingge turns his back on the two of them, slightly flustered and uneasy inside his chest. It is impossible to be the only one who has noticed how beautiful and intelligent Shen Qingqiu is, the smiles that he hides behind his growls, and how honest he is despite the rumors. Restless, Liu Qingge looks at his two martial brothers out of the corner of his eye and not understanding why he has such absurd thoughts. Although there has always been something anomalous in the relationship between Yue Qingyuan and Shen Qingqiu, it’s not romantic.

Yue Qingyuan has already given everyone a few last pieces of advice (and stared at Liu Qingge to ask him to please not be reckless) when Shang Qinghua appears running, hair tousled by the air and pupils dilated.

“Shen-shixiong!” He screams but falls silent when he finds that four Peak Lords are staring at him very intently, with curiosity and a bit of bewilderment. Shang Qinghua begins to babble unintelligible words.

Liu Qingge is not the only one confused. Shen Qingqiu looks puzzled, and although Yue Qingyuan smiles, he has slightly frowned.

“Is something wrong, shidi?”

“I have to talk with Shen-shixiong. It’s a personal matter. Nothing important.” He clarifies, but so vehemently that Liu Qingge suspects it's not true. Intrigued, he looks at Shen Qingqiu, who doesn't seem to understand what Shang Qinghua is referring to.

“If it is not important, we can discuss it when I return from the mission.”

“He's probably in Jinlan City! The matter we talked about the other day!”

Shen Qingqiu frowns and Shang Qinghua bows slightly before disappearing again running. Liu Qingge has always considered him to be a strange cultivator, very different from the rest of the immortal masters, but his attitude today is especially unexpected. Intrigued, he finally dares to stand beside Shen Qingqiu.

“What is he referring to?”

“Honestly, Liu-shidi, I don’t know.” Shen Qingqiu sighs, his fan (the fan he gave him) brushing his lips. “We have been talking about some renovations to my house for a long time. It's probably nothing important, shall we?”

Liu Qingge nods and tries to forget all those indecent thoughts to focus on the mission. The afternoon before he had been having tea with Liu Mingyan and his sister had offered him a lot of useless advice. This is not a date or a pleasure trip, but rather solving the mystery of a plague that has already killed too many people. But Liu Mingyan had poisoned his head with excuses to spend more time together with Shen Qingqiu. "Don't be separated from him," she had whispered to him. "Maybe you have the opportunity to protect him and carry him in your arms. And you must find an inn where there is only one room. That never fails."

After taking a deep breath, Liu Qingge forgets the echo of his sister's voice and returns to the present, willing to impress Shen Qingqiu and save lives at the same time.

In reality, Liu Qingge doesn't understand why they chose him. It is a plague, they need a doctor like Mu Qingfang and a scholar like Shen Qingqiu. Liu Qingge is not subtle and he cannot end a disease with his sword. But he doesn't regret it either. He likes to listen to Shen Qingqiu's theories, walk beside him, help him enter the city, capturing those casual touches like his hands brushing against each other.

Jinlan City is a large city but covered in a patina of decadence and desolation. But even at that moment, Shen Qingqiu shines and even dares to joke when they meet Yang Yixuan, a brat who tries (unsuccessfully) to keep them out. Yang Yixuan has no qualms about telling them everything he knows or guiding them to his house, where there is a sick monk.

“Liu-shidi should welcome him as a disciple.” Shen Qingqiu teases him, using his fan to hit him on the cheek until Liu Qingge snorts. “He fits the profile of Bai Zhan Peak. He is brave, feisty, and full of energy. He will be terrifying with a sword!” Shen Qingqiu pauses, contemplative. “You know? The boy has potential. You should keep him before someone tries to kidnap him.”

“Don’t say nonsense, Shen Qingqiu.”

There is something wrong with the city, something that stains the air, freezes the atmosphere, and turns off all voices. It is something invisible and that makes it more terrifying. Liu Qingge stands the whole time with his hand on Cheng Luan's hilt, ready to face those enemies that he senses but doesn’t see.

While Mu Qingfang stays at the Finely-Crafted Weapons shop to develop a cure, the two of them go out to investigate the city. Liu Qingge doesn’t want to part, but they must. Before leaving each in one direction, he holds Shen Qingqiu's hand.

“Be careful,” he asks him. “If you have problems, call me like last time.”

And this time, he won’t be late. It is a promise.

 

 

Shen Yuan knew there was something wrong with the city and discovered it too late when the sower infected his hand. However, his satisfaction in solving the mystery disappears when he meets Gongyi Xiao, who is no longer Huan Hua's head disciple.

And then Luo Binghe appears.

The System awakens from its slumber, filling his head with updates and beeps, shrill noises that almost silence the "Shizun" that Luo Binghe purrs with a satisfied smile. It is a predatory smirk, an echo of the innocence of his white lotus that has darkened hopelessly.

Shen Yuan stretches his fan to hide his nervousness, the fear that he doesn’t want to reflect on his face, and the stupefaction. That's wrong. The presence of Luo Binghe, two years before what the novel said, is as bad as this plot that shouldn’t exist. Much to their regret, they have literally followed the book. Why have their decisions triggered events that shouldn't exist?

Perhaps Shen Yuan should have imagined that training Luo Binghe and preparing him to survive the Abyss would mean that he had the tools to return sooner.

Shen Jiu is going to kill me, he thinks. If Luo Binghe doesn't dismember me first. Of course.

Shen Yuan remains silent, crouching behind his cold and perfect facade, as Luo Binghe orders the Huan Hua Palace disciples around. He notices that the other disciples blindly follow Luo Binghe and the hateful looks they give to Shen Yuan. It's worse than Luo Binghe's contempt, as they don't bother to fake their dislike for him. The only one who doesn't do it is Gongyi Xiao, also the only one who also keeps his distance from Luo Binghe.

If it weren't for Shen Qingqiu's inevitable fall from grace, perhaps Shen Yuan would accept Shen Jiu's proposal and take Gongyi Xiao away from the viper's nest that is Huan Hua Palace.

Luo Binghe offers to take the sower’s corpse to the Finely-Crafted Weapons shop and Shen Yuan has no choice but to accept despite the fear in his gut. But Luo Binghe can't attack him. He won't. Liu Qingge is nearby and there are too many witnesses. Luo Binghe is not so naive to reveal his true nature so soon. Right now, violence and darkness hide behind an almost kind smile.

However, Shen Yuan is terrified.

Master and disciple walk silently through the abandoned streets of Jinlan City. Shen Yuan goes ahead to guide Luo Binghe, although what he wants is to flee, return to the bamboo house and warn Shen Jiu that all his plans have been rushed.

“After these years shizun is not going to say anything to this disciple?” 

Luo Binghe's voice sounds sad and turns into a chill under Shen Yuan's skin. He squeezes the handle of the fan without daring to turn around. He doesn't know what to say. It's too late to be the kind shizun of the past.

“We must hurry,” he comments, trying to stay calm. “Mu-shidi needs that corpse to develop the cure. We can talk later.”

That is a desperate promise, a lie since Shen Yuan only thinks of hiding behind Liu Qingge's shadow until they return to the sect.

Obviously, Luo Binghe is not fooled.

Shen Yuan keeps walking when he hears a thud. Turning around, he discovers that Luo Binghe has thrown the sower’s corpse on the ground and stares at him with an intensity that freezes his legs.

“You know the truth, right?” Luo Binghe asks him. And the sadness in his eyes seems a little more real and less feigned until it turns to rage. “The other shizun told you.”

Shen Yuan's eyes widen and he feels his lungs gasp for air. There is a question in his throat that he can't pronounce. Paralyzed and confused, he watches as Luo Binghe approaches him with determined steps. Unconsciously, he backs away until his back hits the wall.

“What are you talking about?” He finally splutters.

Luo Binghe has stopped in front of him. Now he is taller and wider, more powerful and Shen Yuan feels tiny and insignificant compared to his shadow.

“This disciple always knew that he had two shizuns. A kinder one.” Luo Binghe reaches out to hold his chin and prevent Shen Yuan from shunning his gaze. He is smiling like he did in the past and it doesn't seem like a lie. “And a colder one.”

His grin turns into a furious scowl.

And Shen Yuan listens to him with his heart almost in his throat and both hands gripping the fan. He suddenly remembers that Luo Binghe always cooked disproportionate amounts of food, ideal for two people. That Luo Binghe took on the role of a guard dog, and if it weren't for the fact that he always yelled at the visitors, Liu Qingge would have discovered them long ago.

Luo Binghe knows. Luo Binghe has always known.

“What did the other shizun tell you about the Alliance Conference?” His voice is dangerous, it hides anger and pain. “Out of shizun’s fear, this disciple assumes that he already knows his true identity. But does he know what the other shizun did?”

Shen Yuan listens to him, still stunned by the revelation. And another truth hits him until all his plans are broken. Looking up, he understands that Luo Binghe is sad and frustrated, but his hatred is not towards him. Luo Binghe doesn't hate him. He is the kind shizun . Everything he did has been worth it, and Shen Yuan has avoided that cruel future.

He can live. Luo Binghe doesn’t dream of ripping off his limbs and torturing him to madness.

But only him.

Luo Binghe is furious at Shen Jiu. Shen Yuan can understand it, but he refuses to let the story end as PIDW.

“He told me. Everything,” he adds before Luo Binghe accuses Shen Jiu of misrepresenting the truth.

The demon stiffens and his eyes glow a little redder.

“Did he tell you that he tried to stab me in the heart? How did he push me to hell despite my pleas?” His breathing sounds quick and demonic qi begins to surround him.

Shen Yuan doesn't dare to answer because he knows it. That has always been the problem: he has always known too much. Actually, it's my fault, he thinks. Shen Jiu pushed you because I would die if he didn't.

Guilt is like a flower that grows in his lungs and spreads down his windpipe. He feels the bitter taste of regrets with every inspiration.

“I’m here thanks to shizun’s kindness.” Luo Binghe continues to speak, his hand releasing Shen Yuan's chin to caress his cheek. “Shizun's qiankun pouch saved this disciple in the Abyss. This disciple also remembered all his lessons. So shizun shouldn't be afraid of my demon nature. Because this disciple will do his best to always protect shizun.”

That's wrong. All his words are wrong. Shen Yuan gave Luo Binghe the qiankun pouch, but they prepared it between the two of them. Shen Yuan prepared the funniest lessons about monsters, but it was Shen Jiu who tried to teach Luo Binghe music, painting, and calligraphy.

Shen Jiu pushed Luo Binghe into the Abyss, but Shen Yuan's hand is also behind that decision.

He is not perfect. He is not the good master and Shen Jiu is not just bad. But Luo Binghe has built a wrong image of both of them.

“What about Shen Jiu?” He interrogates him and his former disciple's expression darkens, refusing to answer. And his silence is worse than acknowledging all the bloody wishes that Luo Binghe hides in his heart. “Listen to me, Luo Binghe. What happened at the Alliance Conference was a misunderstanding.”

“Is that what the other one told you? A misunderstanding?” Luo Binghe flashes a crooked and sarcastic smile. “Did he tell you that the legendary sword Xiu Ya aimed at the wrong demon?”

“It’s hard to explain!” Shen Yuan wants to scream in frustration. “But he had his reasons.”

Luo Binghe sighs. And his anger disappears, devoured by disappointment.

“Of course, shizun would rather believe the other shizun and his lies than this disciple.”

“That’s not true! I believe in you, Luo Binghe.”

But I also know that your mind is now affected by Xin Mo.

Luo Binghe stares at him for a few seconds before moving even closer, until Shen Yuan is trapped between him and the wall. Overwhelmed at feeling him so close, his chest almost crushing him, Shen Yuan averts his gaze and Luo Binghe grabs his face again. His thumb stops on his lips.

“Prove it.” Luo Binghe says. “If shizun drinks my blood, I will trust him too.”

Shen Yuan feels his heart stop. It is a trap. It has to be. Demon blood is almost poison, a form of torture. It is surrendering to Luo Binghe's will. And he knows it. It’s not an innocent request. It takes a lot of confidence to accept the blood of a powerful demon. Shen Yuan cannot accept it. What if it's a trap? What if he really hates both of them?

He can't, but he needs to. He needs to trust Luo Binghe and show him that he can trust him too.

“Fine,” he nods with a dry throat and fear spreading throughout his body.

And Luo Binghe finally flashes his first authentic smile.

When the demon pulls away, Shen Yuan feels that he can finally breathe again. Although his pulse is still racing when Luo Binghe uses a knife to cut his wrist and offers it to him. With nervous fingers, stiff with anguish, Shen Yuan grabs Luo Binghe's wrist. His movements are slow, delaying an inevitable decision. But inside him there is something that still doubts and mistrusts, there is a voice that screams that he should flee away.

Shen Yuan closes his eyes before accepting Luo Binghe's blood.

It is unpleasant and sticky. If he could, Shen Yuan would kill the author for having such disturbing ideas. Unfortunately, Airplane is not in that world and he cannot suffer the consequences of all his horrible kinks.

Shen Yuan tries to regain his dignity when he raises his head and uses a handkerchief to wipe his lips. Suspicious, he watches over Luo Binghe, who is healing the wound thanks to his abilities. He seems happy, maybe too much. But he never uses his new control to hurt him. On the contrary, Luo Binghe takes Shen Yuan's hand and strokes the sower's wound until it is erased.

“Thanks,” he mutters, his fingers still clinging to his hand. “Shizun's trust means a lot to me.”

Shen Yuan nods, still guilty.

Luo Binghe is wrong, but despite that supposed confidence, he doesn't want to believe him.

“This teacher can justify what the other shizun did.” He looks into Luo Binghe's eyes. “Now it's your turn to trust me. Please. When we finish the Jinlan City mission, listen to this teacher's explanation.”

And perhaps with more time Shen Yuan can organize his ideas to avoid a disaster.

Luo Binghe purses his lips with disgust but agrees. Since they don’t have any more unfinished business, the demon picks up the sower’s corpse and Shen Yuan guides him back to the Finely-Crafted Weapons shop. Although they walk together, their shoulders almost brushing, there is an even greater distance between them than before.

An abyss for all that Shen Yuan knows and doesn’t dare to say.

Liu Qingge is in front of the store when they return. He frowns upon discovering that Shen Yuan is not alone, although, from his expression, it takes him a while to recognize Luo Binghe.

“Is he...”

“Mn. It seems that my disciple survived the Alliance Conference.“ Shen Yuan waves his fan a little nervous, he has forgotten to ask Luo Binghe what his intentions are with the Huan Hua Palace.

Before, he believed Luo Binghe wanted to conquer it, but perhaps he is wrong. And Shen Yuan has decided to trust Luo Binghe.

“Liu-shishu,” Luo Binghe bows, although there is a certain impertinence in his voice, in the way he looks at his martial uncle. He smiles again. His smirk is arrogant and mischievous, a bit malicious. “This humble must go. Someone must hunt down those sowers.”

Liu Qingge stiffens, ready for action, upon discovering the corpse.

“Demons?” He guesses. “I will hunt them too.”

“This humble will be delighted to collaborate with the War God.”

Shen Yuan wants to hit his wayward disciple with the fan. Liu Qingge is too distracted thinking about hunting and hasn’t realized it, but he has noticed the mockery hidden in Luo Binghe's words. He is challenging him. He is hinting that he is the only one who can hunt sowers. Shen Yuan sighs while shaking his head.

“This teacher will help Mu Qingfang. Don't act like mindless brutes.”

When he turns around, the two of them are glaring at each other. An aura of competitiveness grows, a tension that is broken when they run off in opposite directions. Shen Yuan doesn’t care.

He is tired, stunned by so many emotions, worried about what will happen. And guilty. Guilt doesn't fade even when he says goodbye to Mu Qingfang and goes to rest. Perhaps he should speak to Shen Jiu before Luo Binghe. He still has the fake jade guanyin in his inventory. If Shen Jiu gives it to Luo Binghe, perhaps his anger will soften.

With those ideas in mind, Shen Yuan closes his eyes and tries to rest.

The next day begins better than he imagined after the return of the protagonist, although Shen Yuan hides a concern that devours him inside. He remains taciturn as Mu Qingfang explains that he has developed an antidote and when Luo Binghe returns to announce that he has hunted more sowers than Liu Qingge. The War God seems wounded in his pride and remains upset all morning. It’s tempting to tease him, but Shen Yuan can't find the right moment.

He only thinks of returning to the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect.

Shen Yuan stands aside as the city regains its vitality and the other sects return. He greets his other martial brothers, not understanding why Shang Qinghua is still so nervous or why Liu Qingge is startled every time Luo Binghe approaches. In other circumstances, he would laugh to see that his arrogant shidi has tasted his first defeat, but none of that matters.

He also ignores the hatred from the Huan Hua Palace's gazes.

But Shen Yuan has no choice but to return to reality when the situation spirals out of control. The sowers accuse him of a ridiculous crime. Qiu Haitang emerges to reveal Shen Qingqiu's past. The Huan Hua Palace announces that he mistreated Luo Binghe, who remains silent.

It's too soon. Nothing is happening as it should and Shen Yuan freezes.

But some changes are positive. His sect defends him. Liu Qingge stands in front of Shen Yuan to duel for him, Yue Qingyuan announces that they are infamies and Cang Qiong Sect will never deliver Shen Qingqiu. Even Qi Qingqi or Shang Qinghua are supporting him.

It’s nice.

But the most intriguing thing is Luo Binghe's silence. While the others argue, Shen Yuan watches over him hiding behind his fan. Luo Binghe's silence is unexpected. And suspicious. He is obviously uncomfortable and Shen Yuan now knows that it is because he doesn’t want to accuse him unfairly.

But he doesn’t defend him either.

These accusations are frustrating for the absence of solid evidence. Right now, if Shen Yuan refused, he could avoid the trial plot. In the book, the hatred of the protagonist was the real reason behind Shen Qingqiu’s imprisonment. And now Luo Binghe remains silent while uncertainty grows within Shen Yuan's chest.

And he finally understands him.

Luo Binghe is divided. He doesn’t want to imprison Shen Yuan, the nice shizun, but Shen Jiu. Luo Binghe doesn't say anything because he wants Shen Yuan to return to the Cang Qiong Sect. But the accusations won't disappear. Perhaps they will return with evidence for the next time to lock up Shen Jiu, his real target.

And Shen Jiu is guilty of almost all of those crimes. But Shen Yuan doesn't care, since he promised that he would protect the scum villain from the protagonist's wrath.

“That’s ridiculous!” He finally grunted before handing Xiu Ya to Liu Qingge. Shen Jiu will kill him if the Huan Hua Palace puts its stinky hands on his sword. “Enough. These demons plan to divide us and cause a conflict with their downfall. This master won’t allow it.”

Shen Yuan takes a step forward, but Liu Qingge grabs his wrist instead of his sword.

“What are you doing, Shen Qingqiu?” He hisses. “You stay with us.”

Shen Yuan makes an immense effort to not agree and return to his side. Liu Qingge is too proud to admit it, but there is a plea in his eyes and it is so obvious that it hurts.

“This master rejects all accusations,” Shen Yuan announces, turning his back on his sect to face the Old Palace Master. “To show my goodwill, I agree to be locked up, but only on the following conditions: if during an agreed time you don‘t find solid evidence, there will be no trial and I will be released. If that evidence appears, I agree to remain locked up for as long as it’s necessary until the trial.”

Shen Yuan has never liked the character of the Old Palace Master, but now he finds him obnoxious and disgusting. His smile is cruel and false, his eyes shine with greed.

“These are very serious accusations, Master Shen.”

“Anyone can make up the worst charges. That they are horrible doesn’t mean that they are true.” Shen Yuan points his free hand at the sowers. “They are murderers, demons that feed on human beings. Are you suggesting that their testimony is more valuable than mine? I want proof. They have accused me like they could accuse Mu Qingfang or anyone else.”

“But the hand!” A disciple of the Huan Hua Palace protests, one of those who looked at him yesterday with hatred.

“It is cured and this master will explain the reasons behind the cure at the appropriate time.” Shen Yuan is not stupid and for his strategy to work he needs Luo Binghe on his side. Then he points his hand at Qiu Haitang. “I'm sorry, but I don't know you miss. It is the first time that we have met and I can assure you that I don't know the Qiu family.”

Shen Yuan feels a little bad when she clenches her fists and teeth in frustration. In the book, he found it very satisfying that Qiu Haitang achieved her justice, but his life is no longer a book.

“If you don’t accept my conditions, this master will not accept this humiliation.” Shen Yuan stares at the Old Palace Master, challenging him with his gaze. “I think charging an innocent person without fair, verifiable evidence can be a very dangerous precedent. Do we have a deal or not?”

The Old Palace Master has erased his smile.

“10 days,” he announces.

“Too much,” Liu Qingge growls, still holding onto Shen Yuan's wrist tightly. “5 days.”

“A week,” Shen Yuan intervenes. “Or nothing.”

“Fine.”

Shen Yuan knows that everyone is unhappy, but they cannot complain. They will not be locked up in the infamous Water Prison! After sighting resignedly, Shen Yuan turns to look at Liu Qingge one last time.

“Don’t worry, Liu-shidi,” he promises him. “Everything will end well.”

Liu Qingge has pursed his lips and is not looking at him, but at the Huan Hua Palace with fury. If they were a huge monster, he would have already defeated them. Reluctantly, Liu Qingge releases Shen Yuan's wrist, but then hugs him tightly, refusing to let go.

Shen Yuan feels like his heart is a bit broken when he finally separates from his sect to walk to Huan Hua Palace. Gongyi Xiao approaches with an immortal binding cable and an apologetic look.

“Sorry, master Shen,” he says before tying Shen Yuan's wrists and then his arms behind his back.

Feeling his qi disappear is terrifying. Suddenly, Shen Yuan begins to doubt whether that was a good idea. He regrets it, but it's too late to back down. He tries to hold his head high and pretend that nothing is affecting him. Before leaving together with Huan Hua Palace, he takes one last look at his sect. They are furious. Yue Qingyuan seems to be preventing Liu Qingge from drawing his sword and destroying the nearest buildings, Qi Qingqi mutters insults and Mu Qingfang tries to calm her down. Shang Qinghua is pale and wrings his hands.

They are also his new family.

Shen Yuan turns his back on them one last time. As he walks, Luo Binghe soon stands beside him.

“Don’t worry, shizun,” he promises him with a whisper. “I’ll stay with you. I'll talk to the Old Palace Master to untie you. He likes me, he will listen to me.”

When they have to fly to Huan Hua Palace, Luo Binghe is the one who offers to take him in his sword. Although his presence calms him down and makes him feel a bit protected, Shen Yuan's uneasiness is growing increasingly. It seems like he won't be able to run away from his conversation with Luo Binghe.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
*During the task distribution*
Shen Jiu: I will be in charge of teaching music, poetry and art. I will also evaluate their calligraphy exercises and mastery of the sword.
Shen Yuan: I will talk to them about monsters and poisons, I will teach them to face dangers and to have common sense.
*But they both forgot to teach manners and that's why Black Bingbing doesn't respect personal space*

CURIOSITY # 1
Binbing knows!!!! The secret is no longer a secret. Although the others haven't discovered it yet, there is nothing left until the moment of the revelation.

Don't let Bingbing fool you. He is a mixture of very intense feelings, some positive and some negative. When I planned the first part of the fic, I found it interesting that both Shens will influence Bingbing. And he became obsessed with both of them. After all, Bingbing is the worst unreliable narrator since he misrepresents everything that happens to him.

BONUS 2
Shen Yuan: I'm going to give myself up because Binghe won't hurt me so I can protect Shen Jiu.
Black Bingbing, happy to have his kind shizun in his hands: Good idea UwU

CURIOSITY # 2
I hate this plot with a passion because THE EVIDENCE ARE RIDICULOUS, YOU CANNOT LOCK A PEAK LORD JUST BECAUSE SOME DEMONS AND AN UNKNOWN WOMEN SPEAK BAD ABOUT HIM. Whenever I read this arc I get very stressed and I'm turning my frustration on the story. This is where canon divergence begins!!

BONUS 3: What would have happened if Zhuzhi-lang had told the sowers that there are two Master Shens?
Sowers: We only did what the two Shen masters told us! Are two! Very bad! We only see one but there are two!
Shen Yuan, fanning himself nervously: They seem to be lying. There is only one Shen Qingqiu. Everything they say are lies.
* And so Shen Yuan avoided going to jail *

P.S.
Tomorrow begins Bingliushen Week (yeah, new fanfic!). The next Found Brother chapter is shorter and maybe I can write it during Bingliushen Week or maybe the Friday after I finish.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Yuan in the Water Prison

Chapter Notes

I'm back! Take warm clothes, it is very cold in the Water Prison >:3

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Shen Jiu appreciates tranquility and silence. For him, staying in the bamboo house is a vacation where he can read or play music. However, Shen Jiu is not used to resting. And there comes a moment when his thoughts fly to his problems: the information that Shang Qinghua has given him about Luo Binghe's advancement, what Shen Yuan has told him about the future, and the mission in Jinlan City.

With a sigh, he gets up to go to his table. While Shen Yuan and the others went to the city, he thought about the clues that he knew to solve the riddle. It has been an interesting exercise and Shen Jiu is almost convinced that the culprits are sowers. When Shen Yuan returns, he will ask the answer, although he is confident of his victory.

When Shen Yuan returns…

Shen Jiu feels a chill, an echo of his worst nightmares trapped in his heart. Suddenly, a cold rise from his chest. Shen Jiu notices frost on his bones and snow sliding down his ribs. It's the fear that Shen Yuan won't come back like Qi-Ge didn't. Nonsense! He thinks, furious. But although Shen Jiu tries to ignore those absurd thoughts, he still has badly healed wounds and others that are still open and throbbing under his skin.

But the cold doesn’t disappear either when Shen Jiu sits under the sun that comes through the window or when the cat approaches him to demand pampering after a whole day of ignoring each other.

I hope Shen Yuan comes back soon , he thinks as he absentmindedly strokes the cat's head.

 

 

The Water Prison is damp and bleak. He only hears the sound of waterfalls and a slow, distant bubbling, like acid. Shen Yuan is left in a cell with no other company than the exhaustion of him and the tug of the ropes as they dig into his flesh. With a sigh, he sits up. Although a part of him wants to hold on to the tiny hope that Luo Binghe will help him, he needs to focus to solve that problem.

Who is behind the sowers? Shen Yuan frowns. He should have suspected something since that plot didn't appear in the original book. Nor is it an irrelevant subplot like the skinner's case. Is it the world pushing Shen Qingqiu to his original destiny? Or something else? Someone is trying to blame me. If it's not Luo Binghe, then who? The only clue he has is his knowledge of PIDW.

The sowers' plot must be a consequence of the changes he and Shen Jiu have caused, but Shen Yuan can't think of any. Although those changes exist. Like Luo Binghe developing different feelings for his shizuns since he always knew there were two of them.

That implies that there are several more changes Shen Yuan wasn’t aware of.

Perhaps he could ask Luo Binghe for help in solving the mystery of the sowers. He's still a Demon Lord, right? Although it’s too early and his power is not as consolidated as two years from now. Shen Yuan is almost convinced that the culprit of the sowers is a demon. Unless he was a human disguised as Shen Qingqiu.

Although refuting the sowers will be easy as surely they will not find any proof since Shen Yuan has not done anything, he needs them to investigate who is pulling the strings and what they want.

The next problem is Qiu Haitang. Shen Yuan bites his lip as he remembers all the truth serums in PIDW. He needs one of those. Please! Is the answer to all his problems! No one will be able to complain about what he says if it is thanks to a truth serum. Shen Yuan has never seen Qiu Haitang before, nor is he behind the sowers nor has he mistreated his disciple. Although it is a choice too risky because of the secrets he hides: Luo Binghe's demonic nature, that he is not the real Shen Qingqiu…

Shen Yuan considers that it has been an eternity since he was abandoned in the dark when the water parted and a woman dressed in gold with a whip in hand entered. He tenses, as he recognizes one of Luo Binghe's wives. What's going on? He thinks. The woman looks at him with the same contempt for a cockroach.

“You're not so cocky anymore, eh Shen Qingqiu?” She says in a voice worthy of a movie villain. But not the main baddie, but one of those secondary villains that give more pity than fear.

However, Shen Yuan is unarmed and tired, lacking spiritual powers, and stiffens when she approaches him. The Little Palace Mistress? He remembers those luxurious clothes and the symbol of the Huan Hua Palace on a tassel around her waist. And for the whip. That wife became famous in the harem for being one of the most aggressive.

“You don't say anything today, Shen Qingqiu?” She shakes the whip, menacing. “Have you lost your arrogance, you infamous scum? You weren't so polite when you mocked our Huan Hua Palace disciples during the Alliance Conference.”

SHEN JIU!!!!!!????? Shen Yuan wants to cry. Why are you like this?

The whip hiss before hitting him on the shoulder.

“Don't ignore me, Shen Qingqiu!” The woman screams. The whip moves in time with her words hitting Shen Yuan on the shoulders or chest. “You are the worst scum! How dare you mistreat our dear Luo Binghe? You don't deserve his kindness!”

Although her blows are not very intense, without his spiritual powers they hurt and cause him to clench his teeth to contain the pain and not scream. Shen Yuan closes his eyes and turns his head away, unable to do anything.

The next blow doesn’t arrive.

When he opens his eyes, Shen Yuan discovers that a hand has stopped the Little Palace Mistress's wrist.

"Binghe!" She yells.

"Luo Binghe?" He mutters.

They are both just as confused.

Luo Binghe is furious and is surrounded by an aura of menace and darkness. Without finesse, he plucks the whip from the Little Palace Mistress and throws it into the acid.

"What are you doing?" He demands.

“Justice! He is a terrible scum who hurt you!”

“He is my shizun.” Although he doesn't scream, his voice is deep and dark, almost a roar. “Leave.”

The woman has paled, although pride prevents her from lowering her head and admitting her mistake. Furious, she clenches her fists and turns to walk away from the prison with impatient strides.

Shen Yuan takes a deep breath, but the atmosphere remains tense and pernicious. Although he wants to thank Luo Binghe, something inside him trembles as he realizes that his disciple has disappeared and a very dangerous demon lurks inside his skin. Shen Yuan stiffens when Luo Binghe kneels in front of him.

“Is shizun hurt?”

Just sore, tired, and very upset. Shen Yuan shakes his head instead of replying.

Luo Binghe has frowned and gazes furiously at the whip-torn clothing and reddened skin. He has the expression of someone capable of murder and Shen Yuan swallows, uncomfortable.

“It’s nothing.” He manages to sputter. 

His words don't calm Luo Binghe. His former disciple pulls out a knife and begins to cut the immortal binding cables. Shen Yuan lets out a surprised groan as he feels his qi circulate again. He is so tired that he even allows Luo Binghe to take his wrist and pass spiritual energy to him.

“This disciple promised that he would protect shizun. I am sorry for not having kept my word.”

“It’s okay, Luo Binghe.” Shen Yuan closes his eyes. “She had her reasons for being mad at me.”

“It was the other shizun who offended Huan Hua Palace.”

And pushed me into the Abyss, Luo Binghe's eyes seem to say.

Even though the heat has returned to his limbs, Shen Yuan feels that it is even colder than before. He wants to defend Shen Jiu, but he neither understands why he did it nor does he know exactly what happened.

And he doesn't dare to tell Luo Binghe the truth. Where does he start? Because they are the characters in a book? That it was his destiny to suffer for the enjoyment of readers like him?

Shen Yuan bows his head and silently waits for Luo Binghe to finish.

“How is the investigation?” He asks when Luo Binghe pulls his hand away.

“Someone burned the sowers by mistake and they are arguing because they don't know how to confirm if their words were true or not. Qiu Haitang has submitted some records of his family.”

“Do you know what Cang Qiong Mountain Sect is doing?”

Luo Binghe shakes his head.

“Has anyone asked to visit me?”

“No.”

Although it’s not a surprise, the answer hurts him.

“Oh.” Sad, Shen Yuan bows his head.

But Luo Binghe's hand holds his cheek and encourages him to look up.

“It’s okay, shizun.” His grin is the only thing beautiful inside the Water Prison and at the same time, there is something twisted about it. “This disciple will always be by your side.”

“Thanks, Luo Binghe.”

But he doesn't have the energy to smile.

“I'm going to talk to the Old Palace Master,” Luo Binghe announces as he collects the fragments of the immortal binding cable. “I will not allow anyone else to disturb shizun. And shizun deserves a better place than this cell.”

But as the rope is removed, Shen Yuan's clothing slides off and several pieces of cloth also fall to the ground, revealing the pale skin on his arms, shoulders, and chest. Shen Yuan snorts, too tired to bother, not realizing that Luo Binghe has frozen.

A rustle of cloth is heard and then Luo Binghe's outer robes end up on top of Shen Yuan just like a blanket.

“Binghe?”

But the demon has turned and is gone, leaving him alone, but less cold.

Shen Yuan covers himself with the outer robes and sighs. Although they haven't talked about Shen Jiu, he doesn't feel any relief. That pending conversation still hangs in the air. Someday it will explode and Shen Yuan trembles because he doesn’t know what he will say. Meanwhile, the remorse of knowing that he is neither perfect nor deserving to be idealized continues to grow.

He is as guilty as Shen Jiu of pushing Luo Binghe into the Abyss.

I'll tell him next time.

But the next time comes too soon. Only a few hours, maybe half a day, Luo Binghe returns with a tray of food. The smell betrays that it has been cooked by him. Although Shen Yuan missed the protagonist's legendary food, regrets are a cyst in his stomach that robs his appetite.

Still, he smiles and tries to eat.

He doesn't want to think about the reason behind his silence, but Shen Yuan is aware that despite all his promises, he is still afraid of Luo Binghe. A three-year fear cannot fade in a few days. He has had so many nightmares, so much stress, that he is terrified to stop being the kind shizun and that is why he eats even though he is not hungry and smiles at him even though he is tired and sleepy.

Because he doesn't want to upset Luo Binghe and stay alone in the Water Prison.

Or end up shattered like the original Shen Qingqiu.

Luo Binghe tells him about the monsters of the Abyss and how he managed to defeat them by following his advice. He is proud and happy, but Shen Yuan is unable to pay attention to him even though he wants to ask him more about his stories. He keeps thinking about those topics that both of them are intentionally avoiding.

"Luo Binghe," he says when his former disciple pauses. "How are the investigations going?"

Luo Binghe blinks, surprised by the change of subject. But right away he smiles.

“Very well. Shizun doesn’t need to worry about anything.”

Ironically, Shen Yuan is concerned about his smile.

Shen Yuan knows his disciple. He knew his disciple. But this Luo Binghe is different. He talks a lot and, but at the same time, he doesn't say anything. Shen Yuan is trapped in a dark corner far from the world without knowing if his charges hold, what his enemies are planning, what his allies will do.

And he wants to trust Luo Binghe, who protects him, who brings him self-cooked food and distracts him.

But he doesn’t know if he can trust the stranger that still doesn’t recognize what he plans to do with Shen Jiu nor if he has already denied the abuse accusation.

But when Shen Yuan is once again left alone with Luo Binghe's outer robes for cover, with no hand ties and a full stomach, those doubts dissipate a bit.

Maybe I could give Shen Jiu the fake guanyin jade? He thinks. Shen Yuan has kept that ace for years and Luo Binghe can't know which shizun protected him since he acted from the shadows.

The next time Luo Binghe returns, he brings more food and stories, but no information about the outside world.

Shen Yuan eats in silence, torn between the satisfaction of knowing that his advice was useful to Luo Binghe and worried about everything the demon is silent about. What if Qiu Haitang has provided solid evidence? What if the Huan Hua Palace is forcing the other sects to celebrate the trial?

Although Luo Binghe doesn't tell him what he needs to hear, he keeps him company and Shen Yuan is grateful. Solitude is sticky and cold. How will Shen Jiu be?

Temperatures drop suddenly and Shen Yuan trembles when an ice demon enters the cell. It is the first time that he sees Mobei-jun and opens his mouth in surprise. He is even more awesome than most fanarts! But what is truly impressive is that that six-foot demon kneels helpfully before Luo Binghe, who looks at him almost indifferently.

“Jushang,” Mobei-jun says with a monotone voice, “the army is ready.”

Shen Yuan's eyes widen as those words dig into his stomach. Still, he tries to smile. Because he wants to believe in Luo Binghe.

“Are you having trouble at the Demon Realm, Binghe?”

“Not this time.”

His answer leaves him more uncomfortable and scary, almost breathless. Luo Binghe sits up calmly, once again not being sincere but not lying either. When he turns once to look at him, his smile is dark and dangerous, showing his fangs.

"Don't worry, shizun. You'll be out of here soon."

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: Black Bingbing's list
-Nice shizun: ✅
-Bad shizun: not yet
-Demonic army: ✅
-Huan Hua Palace: almost
-Demon Realm: ✅
-Human Realm: not yet
-Harem: 1?

CURIOSITY # 1
There are a lot of things I would love to say about this chapter. But you know what? Suspense is more fun! Long live the unreliable narrators! Has Bingbing told the truth? Or has he lied at some point? What is he planning?

What do you think? 👀

CURIOSITY # 2
In this fic, all the main characters have their subplots and arcs. Shen Yuan represents the danger of blind trust and Shen Jiu the danger of excessive mistrust. Too bad that they still don't complement each other.

CURIOSITY # 3
There is another complicated subplot to develop due to the different POVs. In chapter 18, Shen Jiu humiliates and mocks the disciples of the Huan Hua Palace. This is why the disciples in chapter 22 look at Shen Yuan with hatred (who misinterprets their anger since he doesn't know what happened) and is another reason behind the Little Palace Mistress's anger. Although she is the only female character that I don't like in SVSSS, I'm trying to give her a little more depth in this fic.

The next chapter is one of my favorites ❤️❤️ See you next week!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

My brother

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Alone, the silence grows until it drowns him. Shen Yuan is already tired of repeating his thoughts, of rehearsing apologies that he won’t dare to say to Luo Binghe. And he is afraid of what happens outside Water Prison, of the reality that is hidden in Luo Binghe's smiles.

Shen Yuan sighs and rests his head on his knees. Although thanks to his cultivation level he doesn't need it, he would like to sleep. Maybe that way the time would pass faster. He could close his eyes and the days will fade. He doesn't even know how long he's been locked in that dark hole.

At first, when he hears noises, he thinks it is a hallucination. But the noise grows into footsteps that even waterfalls can't muffle. Shen Yuan sits up, tense and worried. They don't sound like Luo Binghe's. He recognizes more than one person. Shen Yuan trembles at the memory of the Little Palace Mistress. He hopes it's not her. Fortunately, this time he is not helpless.

Just tired, bored, and uneasy.

The acid waterfall part and Shen Yuan recognizes the golden uniform of Huan Hua Palace's disciples. And a face identical to his.

But furious.

“Shen Jiu?” He babbles, taking a step back. “What are you doing here?”

Luo Binghe hasn't captured him either, right? A fear sharp as thorns spreads up Shen Yuan's spine. He is frozen when Shen Jiu enters the cell and walks towards him impatiently and angrily, his eyes narrowed and his mouth twisted into a terrifying grin.

Shen Yuan reflexively closes his eyes, terrified that he will yell at him or try to hit him. However, a hand brushes Luo Binghe's clothes away showing the torn fabric.

“Who did this to you?” He hisses.

Confused, Shen Yuan blinks and looks him into his eyes. Shen Jiu's fury is not directed at him, he understands, but at someone else. To the person who has dared to harm him.

“I’m fine! It’s nothing…!”

But Shen Jiu has grabbed his arm and drags him out of the cell. Stunned by confusion, Shen Yuan is slow to recognize that the disciple accompanying him is Gongyi Xiao and that Shen Jiu carries Xiu Ya tied around his waist.

“He comes with me,” Shen Jiu warns the disciple with that tone of voice that admits no retorts.

Gongyi Xiao is pale and looks at Shen Yuan with horror. The boy bows his head, not opposing Shen Jiu's decision but supporting him.

And Shen Yuan still doesn't understand what is happening and no one explains anything to him.

Shen Jiu drags him through the maze, guided by Gongyi Xiao. As they move away from the Water Prison, Shen Jiu's grip softens. Looking at his face, Shen Yuan sees a murderous fury in his eyes. And that the hand that holds his arm trembles, but doesn’t waver when passing spiritual energy.

"Thanks," he mutters.

Shen Jiu responds with a grunt through his teeth.

Leaving the subways of the Huan Hua Palace, they arrive at a courtyard lavishly decorated with gold and white jade. Shen Yuan swallows hard, as there is a crowd arguing loudly. He recognizes the golden robes of the Huan Hua Palace, but also the family uniforms of his sect. The voices gradually fall silent when they recognize them. Shen Yuan flinches, nervous and scared at so many confused and incredulous looks, judging them, wondering who they really are.

“Shen… Qingqiu?”

“They are two.”

“Who is the real one?”

A figure dressed in white pushes his way through the crowd and runs towards them. It is the first time that Shen Yuan has seen Liu Qingge so pale, with a gleam of fear in his eyes, but his steps are determined and he immediately catches up with them.

“Don’t fail this time protecting him, you useless shidi,” Shen Jiu growls, releasing Shen Yuan. And Liu Qingge nods with a determined expression as he remains dazzled by the sunlight.

Shen Jiu rips off the outer black clothes and leaves him with Liu Qingge's protection to face the crowd. His anger is evident, also his hate, but his voice is cold as a glass snake when he speaks.

“Who has dared to harm him?” And he throws the clothes on the floor with contempt. “I demand an explanation, Old Palace Master.”

The man, famous for his weasel smiles, is just as confused as the rest. Even so, he does not miss that opportunity to fight back.

"We could ask you that very thing. Who is the real Shen Qingqiu?"

Shen Jiu lets out a bitter laugh. Shen Yuan is afraid that he has lost control and tries to step forward to support him, but Liu Qingge stops him by placing a hand on his shoulder.

“Stay with me,” he asks him in a whisper.

Before Shen Yuan can reply, Liu Qingge takes off his outer clothes to cover him with them. When Shen Yuan raises his head, he recognizes more familiar figures. There are almost all the Peak Lords, some of his disciples. And Luo Binghe at the Old Palace Master's side.

Their gazes meet and Shen Yuan trembles at the fury in the half-demon's eyes. This time it is different from Jinlan City. He needs to get Shen Jiu away from the protagonist or they will have just uselessly swapped positions.

“You are all stupid. What do you have eyes for if you don't use them? Why do you have a tongue if you only speak nonsense?” Shen Jiu mocks everyone with a cruel laugh. “He is Shen Yuan, also known as Shen Qingqiu. I’m Shen Jiu, also known as Shen Qingqiu. And the answer to your question is so simple that it is an insult to intelligence to have to answer it: we are twin brothers.”

Shen Yuan's eyes widen and he lets out a gasp. Brothers. He knows it's a lie, but even so, happiness spreads through his chest in the form of heat. Brothers. It is not true, he is a liar in the wrong body, but at that moment he understands that he would like to be Shen Jiu's brother.

When he died, Shen Yuan lost his life and this world offered him another.

When he died, Shen Yuan lost his friends, but he has met new people within the pages of a book.

When he died, Shen Yuan lost his family, but now he has someone who could be his brother.

He has to cover his face with his hands to not cry.

“I can't believe you're stupid enough to accept the words of murderers, carrion eaters, demons.” He spits out the last word with contempt and Shen Yuan stiffens as fear devours his happiness. Because Luo Binghe is listening to Shen Jiu's words with an icy grudge on his face. “Anyone can introduce themselves by my name and fool those pathetic demons. Or maybe they have lied to you to wreak havoc. Who was the idiot who dared to lock up a Peak Lord of Cang Qiong Mountain Sect just because of rumors?”

“But the other accusations...” A master from the Huan Hua Palace protests.

“Oh, yes. Where is the lady?”

The crowd parts as Qiu Haitang approaches. There is doubt in her eyes and Shen Jiu looks at her coldly.

“It's the first time I've seen you, miss.” He lies without hesitation. “Tell me, did your slave have a twin brother?”

She shakes her head.

“Too bad, I grew up with my twin brother. In a rich house full of whims.” He keeps lying. “My family was friends with Yue Qingyuan's. Perhaps you trust the word of my sect leader more.”

Shen Yuan nearly choked when Yue Qingyuan confirms Shen Jiu's words with a smile that seems sincere but is more false than a butterfly in winter.

“That’s true. Shen-shidi and I are childhood friends. We grew up almost together.”

“What’s more.” Shen Jiu adds with a wicked smirk. “The boy in your description would start cultivating too late, and Wu Yanzi is famous for crippling cultivation. How could he have become a powerful Peak Lord like us? I wish you the best of luck in finding him, miss. But next time be careful with your accusations.”

Shen Yuan frowns. He's not the only one. Beside him, Liu Qingge's expression has darkened. Shen Yuan knows that Shen Jiu's past is true, but never before has he wondered how a slave managed to become a Peak Lord. He has the same talent as him and although they are not as powerful as Liu Qingge or Luo Binghe's, their ability is outstanding.

It's another contradiction that the book never explained.

Shen Yuan looks at Shen Jiu's figure with many questions bubbling in his head. The accusations were always weak, based on hearsay and people's hatred rather than genuine evidence, but in the original book, he never said anything. Shen Qingqiu accepted the sentence knowing that he would never be free again without bothering to defend himself. Why? Shen Yuan begins to suspect that Shen Qingqiu no longer had any reason to live, while Shen Jiu still has someone to fight for.

Shen Yuan remembers his doubts when they traveled that day. And the stupid fear he felt. But the truth is that Shen Jiu cares about him, even though he is unfriendly and grumpy. He has taught him, he has protected him, he trusts him, and today he is saving him at the cost of ruining his reputation.

“But the worst wasn’t hearing that the Huan Hua Palace had dared to imprison a Peak Lord just for the words of some pathetic demons. Being a big sect doesn't prevent it from being run by stupid and arrogant people. The worst thing was that someone insinuated that Shen Yuan's favorite disciple was mistreated.” His voice is drenched in intense hatred that even makes Shen Yuan tremble. “A cowardly disciple who prefers to keep quiet. A disciple we no longer recognize. From today, our ties are broken, Luo Binghe.”

People let out several groans and even some screams. The Old Palace Master covers his mouth with one hand. Luo Binghe's gaze is dark and it seems to say that those ties were already broken when Shen Jiu pushed him into the Abyss. The two look at each other, ignoring everyone around them without saying anything else.

Until Shen Jiu turns around to return to Shen Yuan's side. And with each step, he irretrievably breaks all the plans that Shen Yuan had prepared to improve the relationship between the villain and the protagonist.

They are trapped by a fate that doesn’t change. And neither can escape being the enemy of the other.

Shen Jiu turns his back on them and gently drags Shen Yuan away from that courtyard, from the people and their accusations.

"Stop, Master Shen," says the calm voice of the Old Palace Master. "You cannot leave with so many questions still unclear."

"Once again, you are wrong."

"What?"

"I can."

His arrogance is terrifying and leaves everyone speechless. Not even Shen Yuan dares to protest. Although he looks back once. To Liu Qingge who has been frozen and confused, to Yue Qingyuan who approaches the Old Palace Master with a conciliatory smile. And to Luo Binghe, whose expression is the most indecipherable.

Shen Jiu doesn't notice because he's too proud to turn around and look back, but Luo Binghe is keeping an eye on the two of them.

Perhaps he is now free, but he has not solved any mysteries. His regrets are still a knot in his chest, Shen Jiu is in danger, and Luo Binghe is an uncontrollable piece in a plot that Shen Yuan no longer knows. But despite all those worries, he closes his eyes.

"Thanks."

"I've gotten that Gongyi Xiao boy in trouble," Shen Jiu comments as he draws his sword. "We should keep him."

"You are incorrigible!"

Shen Yuan can't help it: he starts laughing. He laughs so hard that it hurts, that he needs to hold onto Shen Jiu's shoulder to not trip. It's nice after so much stress. Shen Jiu huffs, annoyed, but helps him to mount Xiu Ya.

“Stop being silly. You are going to fall.” He scolds him.

“Sorry. About what you said before...” Shen Yuan bits his lip. He feels that fear again, which is actually disguised insecurity. “Can I call you Jiu-Ge?”

“Do whatever you want, A-Yuan.”

Chapter End Notes

THE REVELATION! IS HERE! FINALLY!

I have a million svsss fanfiction ideas I'd like to write about. However, a few months ago I chose "Found Brother" for this scene. This chapter is the reason why I thought the story. Everything that has happened was to get to this moment: Shen Jiu breaking in to declare to the whole world that Shen Yuan is his brother (and will kill whoever tries to harm him).

There is still a lot of history ahead, but now I can already die in peace.

BONUS
Old Palace Master: Just according to keikaku.
Black Bingbing: ...
Black Bingbing: >:(

CURIOSITY # 1
Yue Qingyuan has not technically lied.

Subliminal publicity

BONUS: 2
Shen Jiu: Friendship ended with Luo Binghe.
Shen Jiu: Now Qingge is my favourite cook.
Black Bingbing: >:(
Shen Jiu: And Gongyi Xiao is my new sweet disciple.
Black Bingbing: And that's the reason why I became a villain.

BONUS 3: The real plot
Bingbing: I'm a sweet protagonist with beautiful and innocent plans for the future 💚
Shen Jiu: As a good villain, I just ruined your plans.
Shang Qinghua: I don't remember my book being like this...

★ Twitter
✰ Tumblr

Two Shen Qingqiu and eleven Peak Lords

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Things seem brighter, more hopeful, and less threatening after a hot bath. Shen Yuan puts on clean clothes and stifles a yawn. It is past noon, but the stress of his stay in the Water Prison had turned to exhaustion inside his bones. 

He would like to lie on the bed and close his eyes for a few minutes, but Shen Yuan finds the strength to sit in front of the table. To his surprise, Shen Jiu has prepared three cups of bamboo tea. If it was coffee or a more revitalizing drink, Shen Yuan would understand. Right now, he would drink three cups of coffee or more. But it's just tea and the cup is arranged on the table as if they're waiting for someone else.

"Jiu-Ge..." He mutters, cautious. The name on his mouth sounds strange. Shen Yuan wants to get used to calling him that and forever forget that he was once a character in a novel.

At that moment, someone knocks on the door and Yue Qingyuan enters. Although the sect leader smiles, there is fear in his eyes. He looks at the two of them, conscientiously at Shen Yuan and imploring at Shen Jiu.

“Xiao Jiu, I deserve an explanation.”

Shen Yuan stiffens. It is the first time that he hears "Xiao Jiu" instead of the characteristic "Shidi" with which Yue Qingyuan always addressed Shen Qingqiu. They didn't usually coincide much either, as Shen Jiu always avoided that as he now remembers. Is this a hidden backstory? He thinks as he holds his teacup with shaking hands.

“Please, Zhangmen-shixiong, have a seat. It is a long story.”

And the three of them end up around the same table, each with a cup of tea that no one drinks. Suddenly, Shen Yuan is very ashamed and afraid just for existing. He shouldn't be there and maybe being a secret wasn't bad. After years of being Shen Qingqiu, now that they look at him and see him is terrifying. With Luo Binghe he didn't feel like that, perhaps because Luo Binghe never mistook him for another person.

"I found you, Xiao Jiu," Yue Qingyuan mutters in a broken voice. "There was no other baby. Only you. It is unlikely that I wouldn’t have seen another. And there wasn't a child identical to you among the slaves." Shen Yuan’s eyes widen. He knew Shen Jiu's past from the book, but he had never imagined that Yue Qingyuan was another slave as well. "How now do you have a twin brother?"

“It is a complicated story. You won’t like it.“ He warns him with his cold nonchalance. “We met a few years ago by chance. Shen Yuan was a rogue cultivator.” Shen Yuan lifts the teacup to his lips to hide a sigh. His false brother’s lies don't end. “It was a shock at first. Suddenly, there is a person identical to you and I found it terrifying. He also had a talent similar to mine and his knowledge is quite interesting.” Shen Jiu pauses. “So, I kidnapped him and locked him in my house.”

Shen Yuan spits out the tea. And he would have choked if Shen Jiu hadn't slapped his back with one hand while Yue Qingyuan mutters a strangled groan.

“You did WHAT?”

“At first, I found him hateful. Someone like me but that he hadn’t suffered the same.” Shen Yuan raises his head and looks at him curiously. Shen Jiu speaks with his eyes almost closed and his voice is empty as if he has locked all of his emotions. Shen Yuan wonders for the first time if there is still something else about him that he doesn't know yet. “However, Shen Yuan was useful to me. Now I could avoid the most annoying meetings while I did more useful things.”

“Xiao... Jiu...” Yue Qingyuan is so pale that he seems on the verge of a qi deviation. “Did you allow a stranger to take your place as Peak Lord?”

“Yes. But over time Shen Yuan ceased to be a stranger to me. He has helped me with the disciples and together we talked about the dual cultivation classes or the tests we prepared for the Alliance Conference.” Shen Jiu pauses to look Yue Qingyuan straight into the eyes. “I trust him.”

Shen Yuan feels a pleasant warmth in his chest. He stares at his cup of tea, unable to look at the other two. There are too many emotions in a short period.

“Anyway, it's a relief the secret has been revealed. Lately, it was being quite awkward to leave the sect together without being discovered. Or stop that brute shidi from knocking the door down.”

“Xiao Jiu...”

“Shen Yuan has more patience than me, so you can bother him from now on. Although I warn you that his ideas are very strange and he uses an unknown vocabulary sometimes.”

“Xiao Jiu.”

“But you can't monopolize Shen Yuan. I'm a little tired of everyone and everything and would rather go away with him for a while. Although first I would like to dismantle the Huan Hua Palace stone by stone...”

“XIAO JIU!” Yue Qingyuan's scream startles the two Shens. The sect leader runs a hand over his forehead. He seems incredibly exhausted. “Qing Jing Peak cannot have two Peak Lords.”

Shen Jiu smiles. His smile is terrifying, without a hint of joy, typical of a poisonous snake.

“Zhangmen-shixiong, I asked you never to call me that. But you break your word. Again.” There is so much bitterness in his words that even Shen Yuan shivers. “You owe me more than many apologies. You owe me an explanation and never speak to me again. But I can forgive you that debt if Shen Yuan stays.”

An awkward silence sharp as a thousand thorns spreads over the bamboo house. Shen Yuan opens his mouth, but all the words die in his throat. Did you just blackmail Zhangmen-shixiong? For me? He blinks in a daze and his gaze shifts from Shen Jiu's raging determination to Yue Qingyuan's strange sadness.

Fortunately, someone knocks on the door at that moment.

Mu Qingfang enters with an apologetic smile on his lips.

“Next time, I would appreciate Shen-shixiong if you would allow me to do my job before leaving dramatically.” After rebuking Shen Jiu, the healer walks to Shen Yuan, who meekly extends his wrist. “Well, at least I know how to differentiate the two of you. It seems that Shen-ershixiong appreciates his health.”

The normality with which Mu Qingfang talks about them softens the atmosphere. Shen Jiu doesn't relax, but at least he no longer seems willing to destroy an entire sect. Though the temptation shines in his eyes as they wait for Mu Qingfang's verdict.

The healer smiles when he finishes checking him.

"I was scared by the inhuman conditions of the Water Prison, but Shen-ershixiong is just tired. Your cultivation is intact, can I examine your injuries?"

Shen Yuan is a bit embarrassed to undress for such stupid injuries.

"It's nothing. They're just welts."

"A-Yuan..."

"Luo Binghe untied me." He looks into Shen Jiu’s eyes. "He helped me..." Of course, Shen Jiu is thinking about how the past two years he has told him how terrifying Luo Binghe will be. And maybe he is. “We need to talk about him. Alone.”

Shen Jiu reluctantly nods.

On the third occasion, the door opens with a sharp kick that almost knocks it to the ground and startles everyone except Shen Jiu, who covers his face with his hands, and Shen Yuan, who no longer has to hide any secrets.

“SHEN QINGQIU!” Liu Qingge yells. “I should have known! You couldn't be nice all of a sudden!” Shen Jiu throws a fan at his head and he catches it without blinking or being surprised. “Who is Shen Yuan and who is Shen Jiu?”

“I’m Shen Yuan,” he tilts his head to hide the embarrassment that colors his cheeks. Yue Qingyuan was only looking at Shen Jiu and Mu Qingfang has acted as usual, but Liu Qingge's sudden appearance reminds him that he has lied to them for a long time.

And Liu Qingge, loyal, honest, and patient, didn’t deserve it.

"Does it matter?" Shen Jiu huffs. "You always give us the wrong gift. I'm sure you'll mistake us again."

A faint blush covers the cheeks and ears of the War God.

“You…!” He takes a deep breath until he calms down. “The Lingxi Caves?”

“It was A-Yuan.”

“The night hunts?”

“Me. All of them.”

“The succubus mission?”

“A-Yuan.”

Yue Qingyuan clears his throat, interrupting the interrogation.

“Perhaps you should clarify that matter in private, shidi. Before we should...”

But before he can finish the sentence, the Peak Lord of An Ding Peak enters the bamboo house in a hysterical whirlwind, disheveled and pale.

"WHO IS SHEN YUAN?" He screams desperately. His gaze shifts from Shen Jiu's quiet arrogance to Shen Yuan's confusion. "Proud Immortal Demon Way?"

And Shen Yuan's teacup falls from his hands. Another transmigrator? He thinks, stunned, as Shang Qinghua begins to scream with joy.

"I knew it! I knew the plot didn't make sense! HAHAHHAHAHAHAHA!"

Someone clears his throat and then Shang Qinghua discovers that he is behaving like a lunatic. On the doorstep, arms crossed and smiling sarcastically is Qi Qingqi.

"I knew we had to talk about the two Shen Qingqiu, but I didn't expect that the meeting would be at Qing Jin Peak."

Her words bring them back to reality. There are many Peak Lords huddled in the bamboo house. Yue Qingyuan sighs and stands up, ignoring the cup of tea that he hasn’t touched.

“We should reunite at Qiong Ding Peak. This is a matter that the twelve of us should discuss... The thirteen.” He adds while looking at Shen Yuan, who turns his head away, uncomfortable with the attention.

One by one, they all leave the bamboo house. The two of them are the last to leave. In a fit of courage, Shen Yuan grabs Shen Jiu's arm.

"Are you sure of this?"

"More than ever. With that unhinged beast on the loose, you need the protection of a big sect."

Shen Yuan gulps, noting the uneasiness deep in his throat.

"Luo Binghe doesn't want to hurt me. He always knew we were two..."

"Our former disciple is a treacherous vermin," he hissed with a rage that left Shen Yuan speechless. "He has chosen to place with Huan Hua Palace, he kept silent while they wrongfully accused you!"

"But he untied me! He..."

“Give you his robes? And what else? I got you out of a miserable and disgusting cell.”

Luo Binghe promised to release him, but he didn’t.

Shen Yuan shakes his head to chase away those hideous ideas.

“Luo Binghe protected me from the Little Palace Mistress. He kept me company and brought me food.”

Shen Yuan should tell him about the blood, about the threat of the demon army. And after thinking about those details, his trust in Luo Binghe falters.

“I don’t care.” Shen Jiu growls, stubborn. "Do you know how I felt when I found out what had happened? It was the infamous Water Prison, A-Yuan! They didn't even let Liu Qingge visit you when he demanded it!"

Something inside Shen Yuan squirms as he realizes that Luo Binghe lied to him. But maybe it was just an innocent lie. Trembling, he laces his fingers together.

“He doesn't want to hurt me. I know that. He could do it but he didn't. He took care of me, he protected me.” Shen Yuan takes a deep breath. “But I don't know what he wants from you.”

And that's what scares him. Perhaps Luo Binghe would never inhumanly torture him as he does in the book, but perhaps he does it to Shen Jiu and that would destroy Shen Yuan. Feeling an intense panic, Shen Yuan hugs him tightly. At first, Shen Jiu tenses. Afterward, he awkwardly hugs him back.

“I’ll protect you, A-Yuan...”

“You don't understand it, Jiu-Ge! I’m the one who has to protect you!! So, please, stay with Liu-shidi or Zhangmen-shixiong. Stop being alone and keeping your distance from everyone else. Please.”

Shen Jiu growls.

“Now with your words.”

“Gr, fine... I promise you.”

 

 

Once upon a time, there was a young boy.

The boy had a brilliant talent and a heart so big that his emotions were too intense. There was no admiration, but adoration. No appreciation, but blind loyalty. No disappointment, just hatred.

After a miserable life, the boy believed that in Cang Qiong Mountain Sect he would be happy. However, his shizun was a cold immortal who never looked at him. The boy tried very hard, but only received disdain and punishment.

But one day his shizun changed.

His shizun became kinder. He protected him, gave him a balm for his wounds, invited him into his carriage, and handed him another manual. The boy's heart filled with happiness as he finally got his shizun's attention.

After three years in seclusion, his shizun changed again. And he trembled, terrified that the cold shizun that despised him would return. But then, shizun chose him to face the demons. He said: "I trust him."

There were no smiles or those warm glances the boy had grown used to. But shizun said it confidently. He believed in him! The boy tried his best to not disappoint him. And although he achieved a victory, shizun didn’t even look at him. His disdain saddened him and erased his smile. What had he done wrong to make shizun ignore him again? Had he failed despite winning?

That night the boy had a very strange dream. Shizun was there and was back to being nice and even congratulating him. At the end of the dream, the boy met an elder demon.

"I will be your master," said the demon.

But the boy refused. He already had a shizun.

"A shizun?" The dream demon scoffed. "Which of the two are you talking about? I notice two consciousnesses, although I‘ve only been able to bring the one that was asleep."

Two shizuns. The boy's eyes widened. Two shizuns. And then he understood. One shizun was kind and smiled when he thought no one noticed, instructed them with games, and always complimented him. The other shizun was more serious and cold, he kept his distance from everyone and even avoided the other Peak Lords.

The boy wanted to earn the respect of both of them.

"Shizun," he muttered once. "Is it true that all demons are evil?"

The cold shizun huffed and a wry smile spread across his face.

“Only someone like you would ask such a naive question! Don't be silly, Luo Binghe, humans can be worse than demons."

Luo Binghe now finally understands his shizun.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
*before the chapter*
Shen Jiu: Don't worry, A-Yuan. I have a plan UwU
*after the chapter *
Shen Yuan: YOUR PLAN IS BLACKMAIL YUE QINGYUAN????

CURIOSITY #1
I DON'T KNOW HOW TO TAG BINGBING!
Bingbing is a combination between Bingmei and Bingge. Thanks to Shen Yuan, Bingbing was a happy white sheep during his time as a disciple in the sect. But Shen Jiu has taught him his cynicism and pessimism (in addition to the trauma of pushing him into the Endless Abyss). Bingbing will never hurt Shen Yuan, but chapter 24 is an example of emotional manipulation since he was trying to make Shen Yuan only trust him. And he also blackmailed him, forcing Shen Yuan to drink his blood.

I mean, Bingge and Bingmei are after all the same person who grew up with different obsessions (not like Shen Yuan and Shen Jiu).

Subliminal publicity
If you want to read Shen brothers being gremlins and Liu Qingge suffering gay panic, I posted another short story: Victory without violence

BONUS 2
Shen Jiu: Yue Qingyuan, do you remember that I kidnapped Shen Yuan?
Yue Qingyuan, sighs: How to forget it?
Shen Jiu: Since nothing happened, it doesn't matter if I also kidnapped Gongyi Xiao, right?
Yue Qingyuan: Xiao Jiu, please... TT^TT

CURIOSITY #2
Shen Jiu will turn into a crying mess when he finds out the truth about Yue Qingyuan... but not yet. Although his destiny in this fic is to be a great crying mess when he discovers that others like him too. Meanwhile, first hug!!!! Shen Jiu is not used to displays of affection BUT HE TRIES.

(I've reviewed my notes and there are very few chapters left to finish the second part!!!!)
