★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Liu Qingge realizes which Shen Qingqiu he is really in love with

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

That Peak Lords meeting is the most unusual of all the meetings the Qing generation has ever had. It is the first time that they are thirteen. At the Qing Jing Peak seat, there are two identical people today. And although the meeting is to decide what will happen to Shen Qingqiu, Liu Qingge is not paying attention. He is still stunned by the discovery and he can only stare at the twins while the other Peak Lords speak at the same time.

Now that they are together, Liu Qingge appreciates their differences. Shen Yuan holds the fan that he gave to him after the incident with the succubi. Although he seems calm, he is hiding behind the fan and Liu Qingge suspects that he is more nervous than he appears. Meanwhile, Shen Jiu is the one who speaks with a determined and arrogant voice, so sharp that no one dares to ask uncomfortable questions. He holds on his knees the fan that Liu Qingge gave him after the disastrous (date) meal.

"I know it's an irregularity," Shen Jiu says after hitting the table with the fan and catching their attention. "But first, this will be Zhangmen-shixiong's decision." Yue Qingyuan also doesn't speak. He's pale and tired like he's been emotionally beaten. "Second, I warn that A-Yuan and I are not parting ways. I think Cang Qiong Mountain Sect would rather have two Peak Lords from Qing Jing Peak than none."

It is blatant blackmail. In the past, Liu Qingge would have been enraged and challenged Shen Qingqiu for breaking all the rules. But now, he thinks of his own sister. Would he be able to challenge the sect for Liu Mingyan? Surely. Liu Qingge has always relied on his sword more than dialogue.

Furthermore, he has selfish and personal reasons for wanting both twins to stay in the sect. Liu Qingge clenches his fists on his knees and tries to control his racing pulse.

He is still in love, but no longer knows with whom.

"And third, we have a common enemy." Shen Yuan stiffens upon hearing his brother and he turns his head to look at him. "I'm sorry to report that we have a trifling problem with Luo Binghe, our former disciple."

"I thought the problem was the Huan Hua Palace," comments Qi Qingqi, angrily.

"What's wrong with your disciple?" Liu Qingge looks at both twins, still remembering the sense of danger he felt in Jinlan City. Luo Binghe acted with Shen Qingqiu (no, Shen Yuan , he corrects himself) with an improper closeness between disciple and master.

"He is a half-demon."

The Peak Lords pale. No one says anything, everyone looks at them in disbelief. Until Liu Qingge startles all of them by hitting the table with a fist. I knew it! He thinks. I knew there was something wrong! That's why Luo Binghe beat him by hunting sowers: he cheated.

“A… half-demon,” Yue Qingyuan mutters cautiously.

"In case you're wondering, no, I didn't know when I accepted him as my disciple," Shen Jiu growls in obvious annoyance. "I found out during the Alliance Conference and then I sent him to the Endless Abyss. No, Luo Binghe wasn’t behind the Alliance Conference sabotage either."

“But we never knew who sabotaged the Alliance Conference and now the Old Palace Master is allied with Luo Binghe, a half-demon...” Qi Qingqi says with the obvious intention of looking for an excuse to cut off the Old Palace Master's head.

Liu Qingge understands her. After all, she is one of his best friends.

Shen Jiu sighs before demanding their attention again with a fan hit against the table. At this rate, Liu Qingge will soon have to give him another.

"No, the Alliance Conference sabotage was done by another powerful demon named Mobei-Jun. That matter is now resolved."

They all look at him. He doesn’t say anything. Everyone waits for him to clarify his words, but Shen Jiu insists on hiding his secrets. And Qi Qingqi snorts, disappointed. Shang Qinghua lets out a sigh that almost seems relieved. Mu Qingfang is worried and Yue Qingyuan's expression has darkened. It is the first time that Liu Qingge has seen his sect leader so angry and something inside him wants to intervene to protect the two twins. Specifically, the stubborn and proud Shen Jiu, although Liu Qingge is a mess of feelings.

It was almost easy to accept that he was in love with Shen Qingqiu, the fussy and unfriendly man who saved his life, who sometimes smiles and jokes with him. But Shen Qingqiu is now two people and his feelings are still mixed.

"We shouldn't worry about the past, but about the present." Shen Jiu adds after clicking his tongue in annoyance. "Luo Binghe is dangerous."

"He's just a half-demon, not a full demon," Liu Qingge grumbles, still upset that he lost when they were hunting sowers.

Surely this traitor was in cahoots with the sowers.

"He has heavenly demon blood."

Yue Qingyuan covers his face with one hand and sighs deeply. It's a mystery that the sect leader hasn't broken out yet. The rest, on the other hand, are frozen by so many surprises and no one says anything.

Shen Yuan nudges Shen Jiu.

"Luo Binghe has tried to isolate my brother from the sect. His intentions are not clear, but he is dangerous. Please, I need your help to protect A-Yuan."

Shen Jiu makes a feint of a bow, but his twin nudges him again.

"Not that!" He scolds him with a hiss before looking at them. It is the first time that Shen Yuan has addressed the Peak Lords without pretending to be someone else and Liu Qingge can notice his nervousness. "My brother pushed Luo Binghe into the Abyss and he hates him. He is the one he wants to lock up and torture..."

"As if that brat could," Shen Jiu grumbles.

"Please, I need your help to protect Jiu-Ge."

"You can count on me." Liu Qingge speaks without thinking about what he says. Noticing the gaze of both twins, he crosses his arms and turns his head to the side. "I'm the War God of Bai Zhan Peak." He adds as if that justifies his need to protect them. Both of them.

Liu Qingge decides to keep quiet for the rest of the meeting, lost in his thoughts. He hates feeling this nervous, with a lump in his throat and another in his chest, with his heart torn between disappointment, affection, rivalry, and desire.

Before, understanding himself was easier.

Yue Qingyuan ends the meeting by asking everyone to leave to speak with Shen Jiu alone. One by one, everyone gets up to go outside. The Peak Lords whisper among themselves. Liu Qingge feels a dry throat upon discovering that Shen Yuan is alone.

And he decides to approach him when the two meet in the Qiong Ding Peak gardens.

"Oh, Liu-shidi!" He exclaims with a nervous smile.

Shen Yuan is the one who smiles the most. His nature seems much kinder and more relaxed than Shen Jiu's. Liu Qingge still doesn't understand how he could have gotten confused.

He bows his head to Shen Yuan.

"I have never properly thanked you for saving me at the Lingxi Caves."

"It was nothing!" Shen Yuan waves his hand to dismiss it. “Anyone could have done it.”

"And I'm sorry." He grits his teeth, furious. "I failed you in Jinlan City."

"That was my fault, not yours." Shen Yuan sighs seeing that he is still with his head down. And he reaches out his hands to force Liu Qingge to stand up. "I did it to get my brother away from Luo Binghe. I'm the one who should apologize for scaring you. And..." Shen Yuan smiles and Liu Qingge gasps. It's a less awkward, brighter smile that reminds him of all those good times together. "Thank you, Liu-shidi. It made me very happy to know that you tried to visit me at the Water Prison."

Liu Qingge doesn’t reply. He clenches his fists since that was another defeat. Liu Qingge has always had it all: talent, a sword, his blood family, and his martial family. His defeats have been rare and insignificant and yet he has failed his most important person.

At that moment, in front of Shen Yuan, Liu Qingge finally acknowledges his feelings. He is no longer disappointed even when Shen Yuan bows to apologize for lying to him. Because he is in love with his laughs and smiles, with that sweet little voice when he tries to make fun of him, with his conciliatory tone to avoid arguments.

He loves Shen Yuan and would do anything for him.

“Oh, shidi,” says another voice, much more malicious. "That's timely."

Liu Qingge turns around and sees that Shen Jiu has already left and walks towards them. His smile is colder and more artificial.

"I need to talk with you, shidi." He demands and walks past them as if he is waiting for Liu Qingge to follow him. "See you at home, A-Yuan."

It is an inexplicable mystery how no one has discovered them before when they are clearly so different. Liu Qingge bows his head to Shen Yuan and walks after Shen Jiu, the man who once swore to kill him, who visited brothels...

Liu Qingge stops. And he forgets that line of thoughts. He now knows that it was Shen Yuan who defended Shen Jiu from the rumors, confirming that they were false. Liu Qingge blushes with embarrassment as he realizes that he has been carried away by his prejudice once again. Nervous, he looks at Shen Jiu.

"Forget the sentimentality my brother has said," Shen Jiu growls. "Shen Yuan doesn't have a sword. I do. I need your help to protect him."

Liu Qingge blinks, confused.

"You need me?"

“Why are you all so dense?” He sighs, rolling his eyes. "Yes, shidi, I need you. I need your strength and your fame as a War God. And I don't trust anyone else."

Liu Qingge feels his heart beat faster and faster. He believed that understanding his feelings would be as simple as choosing. And for a few minutes, he had convinced himself that his feelings were for Shen Yuan's gentleness. But that grudgingly acknowledged show of appreciation from Shen Jiu has made him happy, very happy. And then Liu Qingge remembers that it was Shen Jiu that he chased the first time he was poisoned by succubi. Shen Jiu is much more grumpy and unfriendly, but that also makes his smiles more unique.

Liu Qingge lowers his gaze. A tremor arises from his heart and shakes his entire body. And he understands that he is in love with both of them.

 

 

“Finally you are alone!”

Shen Yuan turns and sees the Lord of An Ding Peak. Only this time, he knows that Shang Qinghua is not Shang Qinghua. He is not a traitor and a spy, but a person like him.

"Another transmigrator?" Shen Yuan frowns.

"YES!" The immortal has happy tears in his eyes. "Now it all makes sense! Why was the plot drifting, why was Shen Qingqiu so OOC... It's always been you!"

Shen Yuan becomes defensive. He considers that the plot has improved.

"You don't know how long I've been asking the System what was going on. So... It’s Shen Yuan your real name?"

He nods.

"What's yours?"

"Shang Qinghua." He blushes a little perhaps from the shame of sharing a name with such an irrelevant secondary. But Shang Qinghua quickly recovers. "You're amazing bro! And also the reason why I've had nightmares for three years. Shen Jiu is more terrifying than Luo Binghe. Was it also your idea to force me to spy on Luo Binghe?"

"SHEN JIU DID WHAT?"

At least now Shen Yuan understands Shang Qinghua's cryptic message before leaving for Jinlan City.

"Yes! Yes! Yes! He discovered me after the Alliance Conference and threatened me to pass the information on Luo Binghe's progress to him."

Shen Yuan takes a deep breath. This time, it is Shen Jiu who will be scolded when they return to the bamboo house. Meanwhile, Shang Qinghua keeps babbling nonstop.

"I never imagined that I would meet a fan in my book! So now you are the scum villain's brother? What was it like? I never wrote that character to have a brother since he should be miserable and bitter..."

 

 

Shen Jiu sighs as he rubs the bridge of his nose.

"A-Yuan, can you explain to me why you have tried to strangle the Lord of An Ding Peak?"

 

 

Yue Qingyuan is pale and exhausted, but his voice sounds firm and almost furious.

"First, I find out that for years there have been two Shen Qingqiu in front of my nose and neither has said anything to me. Then, that you have kidnapped a person just because he looks like you, that now you want us to accept him as another Peak Lord because he is your brother, your disciple is also a heavenly demon... And now you are trying to assassinate Shang Qinghua? Xiao Jiu, I need an explanation now."

Chapter End Notes

Sorry for the clickbait. The chapter title is Airplane's idea, I'm innocent.

LIU-SHIDI HAS TWO HANDS AND A VERY BIG HEART.

BONUS
I have realized that there is a pattern with all of Shen Jiu's important relationships. He is so aggressive and is always so angry, that there are always "enemies":
-Shen Jiu & Shen Yuan: enemies to brothers.
-Shen Jiu & Liu Qingge: enemies to... lovers. (In progress)
-Shen Jiu & Luo Binghe: master/disciple to enemies.
-Shen Jiu & Shang Qinghua: enemies to... friends? (In progress)
-Shen Jiu & Yue Qingyuan: brothers to one-sided enemies.

Although Shen Jiu has improved thanks to Shen Yuan, emotionally and psychologically he is still a mess.

CURIOSITY #1
Shen Qingqiu is a little shit and this time he hasn't lied, he has only spoken in the singular when he has explained the truth about Luo Binghe 👀 He is my baby bastard.

The only one to whom Shen Jiu has told "the truth" (the kidnapping) is Yue Qingyuan. The others think they are twins.

CURIOSITY #2
This chapter already begins to show what will be Liu Qingge's arc 😈

 

More Shang Qinghua suffering both Shens in the next chapter!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

News about Luo Binghe

Chapter Notes

The fluff before the angst 💙

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Shen Jiu looks at Shang Qinghua as if he is the worst of the scums while the unfortunate author of PIDW whimpers. Shen Yuan is surprised that he agreed to speak with them that morning even though a few days earlier they both nearly murdered him.

Honestly, Shang Qinghua deserves it for creating such a horrible story. And for killing Shen Jiu in the book, along with Liu Qingge, Yue Qingyuan, his disciples, and 99% of the male population. Shen Yuan sighs. He still can't believe the PIDW author is stuck in the role of an irrelevant minor character. Caught between the two Shen, Shang Qinghua trembles under their contemptuous gaze. Although for different reasons. Ironically, Shen Jiu has relaxed knowing that he is not a true spy, but someone forced to play his role like Shen Yuan. Shen Yuan has only been able to tell him that Shang Qinghua is the reason why certain events must happen.

But he is also the reason for other things much more horrible and Shen Yuan doesn’t think to forgive him yet.

"So, Jiu-Ge," he begins as he sets his cup of tea on the table. "When were you going to tell me that Shang-shidi was your spy?"

"When were you going to tell me that you knew he was a spy?"

Shen Yuan blushes with embarrassment.

"I had no evidence and his role is insignificant."

"Hey!"

"Furthermore, his destiny was to die miserably and he deserves it after the demonic invasion and the sabotage of the Alliance Conference."

"Hmh… sorry?"

"It is a comfort to know that he will die miserably." Shen Jiu smiles terrifyingly.

Shang Qinghua seems about to cry.

At least, Shen Yuan now understands the cryptic message before going to Jinlan City. Too bad that he couldn't interpret it in time.

"Do you know what Luo Binghe plans?" He asks Shang Qinghua, who shakes his head.

"I’m a servant of Mobei-Jun and I receive direct orders from him, not from Luo Binghe."

"Useless," Shen Jiu hisses.

"But you have to know something," Shen Yuan insists. "Luo Binghe has returned two years earlier, the Jinlan City sowers event shouldn't have happened and his behavior is… odd. Unpredictable."

"That is probably your fault, not mine," Shang Qinghua grumbles. Although the three of them are sitting in front of the table, he still hasn't touched his cup of tea. "Luo Binghe isn't supposed to have two masters, just one. I... I really don't know what he's thinking about. If this was the original story, now he would only be thinking about revenge."

Shen Yuan swallows hard. He and Shang Qinghuan have paled as they recall the horrendous events that take place at PIDW. Shen Jiu looks at them curiously, his chin resting on both hands and his elbows on the table.

"Don't be exaggerated. He is not the first demon with an army and a tantrum."

Shang Qinghua turns to Shen Yuan with his wide eyes and dilated pupils.

"He doesn’t know?" He hisses, terrified.

Obviously, Shen Jiu can hear him. He raises an eyebrow and although his expression is as cold as ever, his annoyance is evident.

"Know what? The stupid harem of hundreds of women? Is it also your fault that my disciple turns into a beast in heat?"

Shang Qinghua apologizes with teary eyes to avoid being hit again. Shen Yuan ignores his babbling and looks at his brother curiously. It is the first time since the incident at the Alliance Conference that Shen Jiu has recognized Luo Binghe as his disciple. Since then he has refused to say his name, sometimes calling him beast . That little detail burns inside his chest like a spark of hope.

When Shang Qinghua is gone, he will tell Shen Jiu about the fake jade guanyin pendant. Shen Yuan still believes that if Shen Jiu apologizes to Luo Binghe and uses that special item, he will be able to appease his anger.

"We haven't summoned you to hear you whimper," Shen Jiu hisses as he hits the table with his fan. "You are both terrified of our enemy, I can see it. But hiding and running will not change anything. You have both seen Luo Binghe recently. I need information. Now."

Shen Yuan takes a deep breath. In the last few days since his return from the Water Prison, he has avoided that conversation to sort out his ideas. And the curiosity of the other Peak Lords and his disciples haven’t allowed them to speak calmly either.

"I don't think Luo Binghe is behind the Jinlan City sowers," he begins.

His cat hears him speak and appears to rub its head against his back until Shen Yuan grabs the animal and sits it on his lap. The animal purrs and Shang Qinghua looks at it in amazement: "You have a cat too? Very suitable bro," he mutters.

"Why do you think so?" Shen Jiu intervenes. "I know you appreciate Luo Binghe, but you cannot let your affection for him blind you."

"Cannibalism is characteristic of southern demons. Luo Binghe has returned too soon and hasn’t yet unified the Realm Demon, am I right?" He turns to Shang Qinghua.

"That's true. He is in league with the North and Mobei-Jun."

"Perhaps the Jinlan City incident was caused by an enemy from the South who needs food for his troops," Shen Yuan theorizes.

Meanwhile, Shen Jiu listens to both of them very attentively while he takes notes.

"I don't like that we have to face another unknown demon as well," he comments. Shen Jiu has frowned and has a thoughtful expression. "Luo Binghe is a simple enemy since we know his abilities and have emotional ties to him." They both look at him skeptically. "However, if we do not control the unknown demon, the humans will be harmed as happened in Jinlan City. However, it is also an element that we can use to weaken Luo Binghe."

"I don't want to fight him," Shen Yuan reminds him. "Forget what I have told you these years. Luo Binghe wasn’t aggressive with me and helped us neutralize the sowers."

"He lied to get you locked up in that horrible place ..."

"Technically, he didn't lie, he just kept quiet. I suspect he planned to free me without dropping the charges to lock you up. You are his target."

"It's true, Jiu bro!" Shen Jiu's expression darkens upon hearing Shang Qinghua speak. "My evil son only thinks about revenge! You have to be very careful."

"I don't listen to advice from traitors or spies. How do I know you won't betray us?"

Something is haunting his voice and Shen Yuan fails to identify it. It's something slimy and cold, which makes Shang Qinghua pale even more.

"I would never do it."

"You have already betrayed the sect twice."

"But I decided to help you these years! I also didn't tell Zhangmen-shixiong that you blackmailed me to get double the salary! And now I understand why."

"Oh." Shen Yuan smiles. His brother is so cold that those gestures always warm his heart. "But you can't blackmail your martial brothers, Jiu-Ge. Or kidnap anyone. We've already had this conversation."

Shen Jiu clicks his tongue with disdain. Unfortunately, he is not going to change his mind. I have to do something about his criminal impulses , Shen Yuan values. Reforming a scum villain is pretty tricky.

"There is something that can explain Luo Binghe's attitude: Xin Mo." Shen Yuan continues, willing to fight for a happy future in which the darkened protagonist and the redeemed villain can be friends. Or, at least, acquaintances without murderous intentions. "Thanks to our help and teachings, it is understandable that Luo Binghe took less time to cross the Endless Abyss. However, mastering Xin Mo is quite hard."

"Stupid parasitic sword," Shen Jiu growls as he consults his notes. "From what you told me, Xin Mo can only be quenched with violence and dual cultivation, right?"

"Indeed. Luo Binghe will have no problem with..." Shen Yuan blushes at the thought.

Nothing more needs to be said, as Shen Jiu nods in understanding.

"With such an exorbitant harem and his knowledge, he will be able to perform dual cultivation safely and responsibly."

"WAIT A MOMENT!" Shang Qinghua has stood up and looks at both brothers with perplexity. "Did you teach my protagonist stallion sex ed?"

"Stallion?" Shen Jiu repeats with a confused expression.

Shen Yuan prefers to ignore him.

"Right now his harem will surely be small. Perhaps Sha Hualing and some demoness, although in Huan Hua Palace he is already quite loved. Probably some female disciples have already surrendered to his charms."

"Sha Hualing no," interjects Shang Qinghua. "She is one of her generals. I have seen her in several meetings that Mobei-Jun attended. There is nothing between them."

"How odd..."

"Better." Shen Jiu nods and Shen Yuan seems to see a satisfied grin behind the fan. "If he turns into a beast that collects women to quench a demonic sword, I will castrate him myself."

"Even if they are demons?"

"Yes. Demons or humans, all women deserve to be respected."

Shen Yuan bows his head with shame, ignoring Shang Qinghua's malicious laugh. One of Peerless Cucumber's most famous comments was the demand for the castration of Shen Qingqiu. And the author remembers. And he also remembers. When Shen Jiu reaches for his cup of tea to drink, Shang Qinghua nudges Shen Yuan.

"If you say anything to him, I'll tell him all the crap you wrote," Shen Yuan warns him through clenched teeth.

Shang Qinghua nods and the two make a pact of silence.

"I'm not worried about dual cultivation. Even if his harem is small, with a cultivation partner the problem is solved," Shen Jiu continues. "The problem is the violent and murderous impulses of that sword. As long as he fights the demons, there will be no problem. But once he conquers the Demon Realm as you have predicted, he will have to quench those impulses elsewhere. The best thing is to snatch the sword from him and seal it. "

"Luo Binghe will never allow it," Shen Yuan sighs.

"I didn't say that I need his permission."

In addition to blackmail and kidnapping, Shen Yuan adds robbery to Shen Jiu's list of hypothetical crimes.

"But it's not a bad idea," he confirms after pondering. "The link between him and Xin Mo is still weak. We can remove it from him."

"And we have Zheng Yang's shards, I will speak with Wei Qingwei to re-forge it."

Shang Qinghua wipes a fake tear away.

"You know guys? Listening to you makes me feel hopeful. Maybe none of us will die!"

"Remember that if at any time you betray us, lie to us, or give us false information to benefit Luo Binghe, I will kill you in the most painful way possible."

"Yes, yes..." Shang Qinghua shakes a hand dismissively. "You always tell me the same thing, Jiu bro."

"Stop calling me that!"

"You won't let me call you shixiong because you don't consider me a martial brother anymore! Why not Jiu bro?"

Shen Yuan covers his mouth with his fan to stifle a laugh as Shang Qinghua leaves the bamboo house before Shen Jiu throws a kettle at his head.

 

 

Shen Yuan needs time to get used to his new life as himself. He's been imitating someone else for so long that he's forgotten what it's like to be Shen Yuan. And there is something that he has not confessed to anyone, not even his brother: he is afraid to show his true nature.

Although hated by all, Shen Jiu is elegant and refined, unfriendly without being rude. Instead, he is critical and lazy, very different from a distant immortal. Therefore, the presence of Shang Qinghua is a relief, because when the two of them are alone, Shen Yuan can act as himself without fear of consequences.

Shen Jiu doesn't like when he spends time with that rat and often accompanies them.

That morning, the two examine their disciples at Qing Jing Peak while discussing Luo Binghe. His inactivity in recent weeks seems to indicate that he must be busy with his demonic conquering. Although Shen Jiu is more concerned with the silence of the Old Palace Master.

"That scum must be planning something."

"His daughter's wedding with Luo Binghe?"

Shen Jiu hums thoughtfully.

"We must avoid that wedding," he finally responds. "I don't care if Luo Binghe entangles with some female disciples, but the Little Palace Mistress is the heiress to the Huan Hua Palace. If Luo Binghe takes over one of the two most powerful sects, we'll be in trouble."

Shen Yuan rolls his eyes. Seriously, Jiu-Ge? Two of the most powerful sects? What about Tianyi Overlook and Zhao Hua Temple? However, despite the tension they feel, Shen Yuan smiles at the thought of how much fun it would be to ruin the Little Palace Mistress's wedding as revenge for what happened in the Water Prison. Then he remembers Luo Binghe's anger and his temper fades slightly.

Curious, he glances at Shen Jiu. Despite his confident and indifferent appearance, he knows that his brother has had nightmares recently. Sometimes Shen Yuan gets up to play a song to him until Shen Jiu's breathing calms down.

They walk silently, pretending to watch over their disciples, but lost in their thoughts, when Liu Qingge appears with his characteristic brusqueness. Shen Yuan smiles at him as Shen Jiu snorts, though he knows deep down that he doesn't displease him as much as before.

Shen Jiu has always complained a lot about Liu Qingge. However, there are a lot of people he detests: the Old Palace Master, Yue Qingyuan, Shang Qinghua... He never talks about them, as if none of them deserves that honor. With Liu Qingge he does it and that is why Shen Yuan suspects that he is special to Shen Jiu. Better , he thinks happy. Liu-shidi is a great friend, the best uber driver, and so honorable that it is hilarious to tease him. I'm glad the two of them are getting along better.

"Wait," he whispers to Shen Jiu while holding his arm and covering his face with the fan so Liu Qingge cannot read his lips. "Let's see if he can recognize us."

"Oh," Shen Jiu's soul is mischievous since he smirks maliciously.

Fourth crime: identity theft. But this time, they are both guilty.

The two of them turn to face their shidi, who stops in front of them.

"Hi, shidi!" Shen Jiu greets him with a sweet voice and an almost flirtatious smile. Meanwhile, Shen Yuan tries to stay serious while he holds back his laughter. "What is the reason for your visit?"

Liu Qingge takes out from inside his robe two fans, as beautiful as all the ones he has given them. And as always, his attitude is stiff and he avoids looking into their eyes. Liu Qingge extends an arm with the two fans as he waits for them to accept it. And they do, of course.

"It's nice," they reply at the same time.

"Thank you, shidi," Shen Jiu has the gall to put his arm through Liu Qingge's and rest his head on his shoulder.

Shen Yuan frowns. And not because he's imitating Shen Jiu, but because his brother's impersonation is very bad. Okay, it's true that he always smiles at Liu Qingge and sometimes gets close to him because he likes to stay around him, but Shen Jiu acts too flirtatious.

And Shen Yuan is NOT flirting with the War God. He would never dare to do something like that!

Shen Yuan uses his new fan to separate the two of them.

"Enough. Liu-shidi, don't abuse my brother." Now he's the overprotective one, right?

Liu Qingge blushes adorably. It is surprising how a man so serious and with so few words, with the emotional capacity of a stone and who only thinks about fighting and swords, it is so easy to shame.

"I never...!" He babbles while Shen Jiu covers his smile with the sleeve. Still, they hear him laugh.

"Don't be like that, Jiu-Ge!" Shen Jiu protests with a mocking voice. "Shidi was just being nice. He has even given us a beautiful gift."

"A beautiful gift, indeed."

"We should thank shidi."

Liu Qingge takes a step back when they turn to look at him.

"Do you want to eat with us tomorrow?" Shen Yuan proposes.

"At Bai Zhan Peak..."

Shen Yuan uses his fan to lightly tap Shen Jiu on the head. When he looks at him, offended, Shen Yuan meets his gaze. Don't be cheeky, he thinks. I know you want to go to Bai Zhan Peak to take advantage of his disciple's food. And kidnap them. This is not how gifts are appreciated!

As if you could stop me, Shen Jiu's gaze seems to answer.

"Fine," Liu Qingge replies, startling both brothers.

He is smiling. And damn it, his smile is even more adorable. Shen Yuan uses the fan to cover his face and hide his expression. Liu Qingge's existence should be illegal. He is too handsome, kind, and caring.

"Peak Lords Shen! Peak Lord Liu!"

The three of them turn when they hear someone calling them. A disciple from Qiong Ding Peak runs towards them with a hasty expression. His voice breaks the tranquility and exchanges their expressions: Shen Jiu wipes his smile to regain his icy expression while Shen Yuan bites his lip with nervousness.

Yue Qingyuan still hasn't decided what will happen to him.

"Shizun needs you at Qiong Ding Peak. Right now."

Liu Qingge and Shen Jiu draw their swords at the same time. Although his brother gives him a questioning look, Shen Yuan shakes his head to ride on Liu Qingge's sword. For some reason, he feels more comfortable when Liu Qingge takes him to places. Without hesitation, Shen Yuan grabs his shidi's waist from behind. Despite his muscular body, Liu Qingge has a slim waist and is very easy to hug. Although today he is more tense than usual. Perhaps for having made fun of him a few minutes before.

In less than one incense stick, they reach Qiong Ding Peak. Despite landing on the grass, Shen Yuan is reluctant to let go of Liu Qingge. He no longer hugs him, but unconsciously his hands are still clinging to his outer clothes.

Shen Jiu blindly trusts that Yue Qingyuan will allow him to stay in the sect, but Shen Yuan has doubts. Nervous, he gulps and finally walks away from Liu Qingge.

The other Peak Lords are already inside when they arrive. Shang Qinghua runs to his side with an obvious expression of stress that only makes Shen Yuan's guts twist. He knows that Cang Qiong Mountain Sect is not his place. But he is worried that Shen Jiu will be reckless to stay by his side. Or Liu Qingge. But Shen Jiu needs the support of his sect until Shen Yuan resolves the misunderstanding with Luo Binghe.

However, there is a fourteenth young man surrounded by the Peak Lords. Shen Yuan opens his mouth in confusion, recognizing Gongyi Xiao. His gold clothes are dirty and torn on the sleeves, and he has a scratch on his cheek that is still healing.

"Gongyi Xiao?" Shen Jiu comments, sharing the same perplexity as him. "What are you doing here?"

Still, Shen Yuan appreciates that his brother seems happy. He nudges him before the others guess his wayward thoughts.

"Master Shen. Young Master Shen." The young man bows. "I've come to talk to you. And the sect leader Yue."

"Please have a seat," Yue Qingyuan asks.

In recent weeks, he seems to have aged from stress.

Intrigued, all the Peak Lords head to their sites. This is one of those rare times when no one whispers. And the silence grows until it intertwines with the air.

"Young Gongyi Xiao arrived today carrying news about Huan Hua Palace. Luo Binghe has revealed his demonic nature and taken control of the sect."

Liu Qingge frowns as the others speak in uneasy voices. The ones who used to have doubts about Luo Binghe's demonic heritage are the ones who speak the loudest and ask more questions.

"I don't understand," Shen Jiu comments. His hand grabs Shen Yuan's wrist as if he is afraid that he might disappear. "We haven’t heard of any wedding with the Little Palace Mistress."

"There has been no wedding, Master Shen." Gongyi Xiao explains. "He has taken the Huan Hua Palace by force."

The news unleashes a hurricane of hisses and worried voices. As one of the most powerful sects, Huan Hua Palace possesses talented cultivators, fortune, and many defenses, in addition to traps and arrays. Shen Yuan gasps as he remembers when Mobei-Jun spoke to Luo Binghe about the army.

"Huan Hua Palace has been isolated for a few days and if it weren't for Gongyi Xiao managed to escape, we still wouldn't have found out." Yue Qingyuan intervenes. His expression is serious and he speaks with determination. "Soon, the entire cultivation world will discover that Luo Binghe's demon nature... and his intentions."

Shen Yuan bows his head. His pulse trembles. He doesn’t want to face Luo Binghe, as he knows how the war will end. And although his heart suspects that Shen Jiu might rival him this time, Luo Binghe doesn't deserve it either.

Because it's his fault. Not Shen Jiu's for following his words. Not Luo Binghe's for being born. It’s his. Only his. It was Shen Yuan who had the arrogance to try to change the story. But in the end, he has just entangled with inevitable plots.

"We should announce it now," Shen Jiu comments with determination and ignoring his discomfort. "We will take that advantage from him and be able to unite the other sects and rogue cultivators."

"We should be careful," Qi Qingqi shakes her head. "Luo Binghe was a disciple of Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. The others could accuse us of being in league with demons."

"I severed our disciple-master ties."

"Shen-shixiong, there are rumors that you are both behind the Jinlan City sowers. Or that you are demon twins."

"Stupid Old Palace Master," Shen Jiu curses. "Still, I think we should seize this opportunity. At least the others will be aware of what kind of threat Luo Binghe is. At worst, we can spread rumors."

His suggestion is accepted with murmurs and thoughtful expressions. And Shen Yuan feels increasingly uncomfortable and tense. Until he can't take it anymore and gets up.

"Jiu-Ge, we need to talk. Alone."

His brother holds his gaze. Then, he finally nods. Shen Jiu gets up as well and the two of them walk outside, but before leaving, he stops at the threshold.

"This master is indebted to Gongyi Xiao for helping him rescue his brother. As a just reward, Gongyi Xiao can stay at Qing Jing Peak if he wishes."

Shen Yuan sighs. From his expression, Shen Jiu is thinking of using that opportunity to officially adopt Gongyi Xiao as his new disciple. And since he has left Huan Hua Palace, even though it’s a good idea, his humor prevents him from savoring that moment. Tension is smoke inside his throat, fear tangled in his lungs. Once alone in the gardens of Qiong Ding Peak, Shen Yuan confronts Shen Jiu's icy and almost indifferent grin.

"We can't face Luo Binghe," he reminds him with a growl. "Unless you intend he merges both realms and destroys all sects. And we have a plan! Luo Binghe is weakened. We can infiltrate and take the sword from him. Shang Qinghua can provide us with the information and Liu-shidi can help us. No one needs to get hurt!"

But Shen Jiu's expression is heartless and Shen Yuan's pulse quickens.

"A-Yuan," he begins and uses that tone that already warns that his words will be bitter. "Have you considered what would happen if Luo Binghe is not affected by Xin Mo?"

Shen Yuan frowns.

"What are you talking about?"

"We have assumed that Luo Binghe's mind it’s affected by Xin Mo, but what if he keeps the sword controlled with violence and dual cultivation? He has not razed Huan Hua Palace, he has conquered it. It’s a strategy, A-Yuan, not a violent impulse. Luo Binghe is well aware of what he's doing. "

"But...!"

"Luo Binghe is no longer an innocent child, but the monster that the Abyss and I have forged." Shen Jiu closes his eyes and sighs. "There is a fairly high probability that he made all those decisions because he wants to, not because he is forced by a sword."

Shen Yuan takes a deep breath as he recalls his last encounters with Luo Binghe. And it pains him to admit that perhaps Shen Jiu is right. Luo Binghe lied to him, Luo Binghe kept him locked up. But Luo Binghe also protected him, took care of him. He wants to believe that there is still a bit of his lovable Luo Binghe with his eyes glowing from the illusion within the Demon Lord's heart.

He raises his head upon hearing Shen Jiu sigh.

"In the hypothetical case that the sword has controlled his mind, how can we save him?" He snorts. And his voice sounds resigned. He doesn’t believe in that possibility, but he does believe in Shen Yuan and that is why he won’t reject it without valuing it.

Shen Jiu's appreciation is strange. Sometimes cold and distant, sometimes it seems like he doesn't have a heart, but he cares for him and listens to him even if they don't think the same.

"I had thought of self-destruction."

"What?" Shen Jiu's eyes widen in panic. "Don't even think about doing it, A-Yuan! Or I'll resurrect you to kill you."

"Listen to me first! With self-destruction, we can calm excess demonic qi without dual cultivation. And we have alternate bodies, remember? Even if one of us sacrifices, then we will return."

Shen Jiu listens to him with tight lips and fear in his eyes.

"No."

"But..."

"Luo Binghe is my responsibility. I..." He closes his eyes. "In the one who made the mistake. If Luo Binghe is a threat, I will kill him."

"But Jiu-Ge!!"

"But if Luo Binghe is only possessed, I will self-destruct. Understood? Don't do anything reckless." Shen Jiu looks into his eyes. "Promise me, A-Yuan."

For some reason, Shen Yuan feels a bitter taste in his throat while a chill sinks into his flesh.

"I promise you."

It is a promise that hurts, that reeks of fear. Although Shen Jiu smiles, something darkens his gaze. Like a drop of sadness that disappears in a blink of an eye.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: How Black Bingbing imagines Gongyi Xiao's arrival at Cang Qiong Mountain Sect
When Gongyi Xiao arrives at Qing Jing Peak, a disciple warns him that both Master Shen are waiting for him at the bamboo house. Gongyi Xiao walks nervously and slowly until he reaches the house. When he knocks on the door, a sensual voice tells him that he can enter.
The house is dark, lit only by fragrant candles. Lying on the bed are Shen Jiu and Shen Yuan, both with their hair loose on their shoulders and dressed in translucent silk inner garments. Gongyi Xiao gulps as he gazes at those half-naked immortals. He can see his collarbones, a nipple, their pale and delicate skin...
"Did you call me, Master Shen?" He mutters.
Both twins sit up to walk sensually towards him.
"You are already very close to us, dear Gongyi Xiao," Shen Jiu says as he uses his fan to lift his chin.
"Please don't call us Master Shen," Shen Yuan purrs.
"What should I call you then?"
"Shizun."

(That night Black Bingbing drank vinegar in his newly conquered palace and his very large and very cold bed without anyone else.)

BONUS 2
Liu Qingge: I have faced terrible monsters.
Liu Qingge: I have traveled to the Demon Realm.
Liu Qingge: But there is nothing more terrible than courting TWO evil twins.
(And the Shen Brothers still don't suspect anything despite their obvius flirting... by Liu Qingge's POV.)

CURIOSITY #1
Good news: Gongyi Xiao has reached Cang Qiong Mountain Sect! A good boy deserves a good sect! Shen Jiu has already prepared the adoption papers, while he orders to reforge a sword, makes plans and annoys Liu Qingge. The Peak Lord of Qing Jing Peak has a very busy schedule.

I'm hiding Black Bingbing's POV in this part intentionally because I prefer to read your theories and impressions. (I really love reading your theories!) Now you have the same information as the Shen brothers :3

BONUS 3
Shen Yuan: Jiu-Ge, what will you do when you steal Luo Binghe's sword?
Shen Jiu: First, I'll seal his demonic powers. Then I'll use it to cut wood.
Shen Jiu: I will condemn that sword to a vulgar life as a household object and finally I will search for a volcano and throw it into the lava.
Meanwhile, Xin Mo in the sheath: *trembles*

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Luo Binghe attacks Cang Qiong Mountain Sect「 END SECOND PART 」

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Yue Qingyuan sighs, exhausted and with dark circles under his eyes, while Shen Jiu waits. It has been a long time since they were alone in a room. And although it is long and wide, without the other Peak Lords it turns narrow and suffocating.

"Every Peak has its Peak Lord," he begins and the uncertainty in his voice makes Shen Jiu uneasy. "We have always been twelve and we can only abandon our position at the end of our generation. However, your... brother can stay in Qing Jing Peak as an elder."

Shen Jiu hates that Yue Qingyuan sounds so sad, almost hurt. 

But at least this time he hasn't failed him and Shen Jiu takes a deep breath.

"Thank you, Zhangmen-shixiong."

Yue Qingyuan grimaces.

“One last thing, shidi.” He says before Shen Jiu heads for the door. "I know you'd rather be called Shen Jiu, but you're still Shen Qingqiu. And now more than ever the Qing generation needs to be united."

He clenches his teeth. The brand owned by the Qiu passed from his skin to his name, as if he still belonged to them. But Shen Jiu hides his slave number. Both names are terrible, but one is more tolerable than the other. Perhaps because Shen Qingqiu never existed.

Outside, everyone else is nervously and impatiently awaiting the verdict. Shen Yuan is between Liu Qingge and Shang Qinghua, although the other Peak Lords are there as well, in addition to Gongyi Xiao and Qing Jing Peak's older disciples. All that support makes Shen Jiu smile, although he hides behind the fan to prevent others from seeing that show of weakness.

If one day he disappeared, nothing would happen. They will take care of Shen Yuan and Shen Yuan will take care of Qing Jing Peak and the sect.

"Greet Shen Yuan, the new elder of Qing Jing Peak."

Everyone comes to Shen Yuan and some to Shen Jiu to celebrate. In other circumstances he would have been envious, but not today, not right now.

"Jiu-Ge," Shen Yuan has approached him without him noticing. "What are you thinking about?"

"I was right. Gongyi Xiao suits in our elegant green and white uniform much better than that hideous golden thing of Huan Hua Palace."

Shen Yuan tries to snicker, but he fails.

"You know?" Shang Qinghua mutters at a certain distance. "When they both laugh I have the feeling that they are planning something bad."

The treacherous Liu Qingge nods. He has his arms crossed and watches them without moving or saying anything, although his grin is softer than usual.

"Shizun, shizun!" Ning Yingying and Ming Fan exclaim as they approach them. "How should we refer to Shen Yuan?"

Then, a blast goes through the sky.

And the entire sect trembles when the power of an enemy threat hits the wards. Instinctively, Shen Jiu covers Shen Yuan. All of them have put their hands on the hilts of their swords and wait still tense and expectant. Yue Qingyuan leaves the house with sudden movements and a livid face.

"What's going on?" He demands.

"I suspect we are under attack," Liu Qingge replies. "I will lead my disciples to the sect gates..."

Before he can finish speaking, it breaks out in a chorus of howls, screams, and sharp hisses. Demonic energy spreads through the air like miasma and even Shen Jiu trembles.

"Luo Binghe," he mutters under his breath.

Beside him, Shen Yuan has paled.

Yue Qingyuan's expression darkens, his weariness turned into worry.

"Liu-shidi will command Bai Zhan Peak. Qiong Ding Peak, Wan Jian Peak, and Xian Shu Peak will come to support you. Mu-shidi, prepare your disciples. Shen-shidi," he turns to Shen Qingqiu. "You know the enemy we face. We are counting on you."

Shen Jiu nods as his hand grips Shen Yuan's wrist tightly. This time you won't take him, he silently promises.

"Ming Fan, Ning Yingying," he calls out to his disciples as Yue Qingyuan continues to give orders. "Return with Shen Yuan to Qing Jing Peak. Protect him. Gongyi Xiao, with me."

Ming Fan and Ning Ying also have emotional ties to Luo Binghe. Shen Jiu wants to believe that the half-demon won't hurt them if they get in his way.

"Wait, Jiu-Ge!" Shen Yuan stops him by holding his sleeve when he tries to walk away. "Remember..."

"I know, I know. Stop Xin Mo. Unless he is a cruel and conscious demon."

Shen Yuan gulps, uncomfortable and scared.

"Find out what is attacking us. If it is an organized army commanded by Sha Hualing, Mobei-Jun, or Luo Binghe himself, we are in danger. But if they are primitive demons or uncontrolled monsters without being commanded... then it is a trap."

And they separate.

Shen Jiu has a bad feeling when he rides on Xiu Ya and flies alongside his martial siblings. Killing Luo Binghe is the simple and effective solution, the one that would solve all of his problems. But something inside him rejects that idea. Perhaps because Shen Yuan would hate him if he did.

And being hated by Shen Yuan is terrifying.

Shen Jiu allows the others to move away to organize their disciples as he flies even higher to contemplate the threat. As they feared, hordes of monsters and demons crowd the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect entrance to break down the sect's protections with brute force. Damn , Shen Jiu thinks. It's not a big army, just loud and annoying. Cang Qiong Mountain Sect is powerful enough to get rid of those monsters, but the city is also in danger.

Shen Jiu sends Gongyi Xiao to warn Yue Qingyuan that they must spread their forces in protecting the sect and eradicating all monsters to save normal people. While he flies, Shen Jiu verifies that the horde acts uncontrollably and without being commanded by anyone. Shen Yuan is right, it’s a lure.

The cultivators have arrived. They fly like arrows to face the enemy. But Shen Jiu only has eyes for one dressed in white.

"Shidi, with me! It's a trap!"

And despite the distance, the scandal that rises from a hundred howling throats, Liu Qingge listens to him. And he follows his orders without hesitation.

 

 

"Are you alright shiz ... Shen Yuan?" Ning Yingying corrects herself.

She has taken him to Qing Jing Peak since he still doesn't have his own sword. Shen Yuan tries to smile to reassure her, but the truth is that he is terrified.

This has already happened in the book. Luo Binghe dragged Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. He destroyed the Lingxi Caves, reduced the twelve peaks to ash. He murdered everyone except his wives. Although Shen Yuan tries to remember that this time Liu Qingge is alive, Shen Jiu is supported by everyone, and Yue Qingyuan is still one of the most powerful cultivators, the fear doesn’t fade away.

"Let's get everyone together just in case," he says with the confidence of being Shen Qingqiu the last few years.

Taking action allows him to distract himself from these dire thoughts. Shen Yuan gathers all of his disciples and divides them into groups so that the smallest and swordless are protected by the seniors.

Shen Yuan's footsteps wobble and his legs stop supporting him. Fortunately, Ning Yingying is nearby and catches him before he falls to the ground.

"What's wrong? You look pale."

"I think I've got dizzy..."

Or maybe it's nerves and fear, freezing his bones.

Ning Yingying helps him walk to the bamboo house and Shen Yuan sits down.

"Should I call someone from Qian Cao Peak?"

"It's not safe. We should stay together." Shen Yuan takes a deep breath. "Besides, I think I feel better. It must have been just fainting."

But it's a lie. It is not the physical exhaustion that keeps him immobile, but those long chapters on destruction and torture. Yue Qingyuan was pierced by so many arrows that all of his bones were destroyed. Ming Fan was eaten alive by ants. Ning Yingying was reduced to one more flower in an immense harem. Shen Qingqiu...

Shen Yuan takes a deep breath.

His Luo Binghe is different from the one in the book, but his latest actions contradict what he had believed. But despite everything, Luo Binghe is still his disciple, his favorite protagonist. And neither does he want Luo Binghe to hurt anyone or anyone to hurt him.

In the end, Shen Yuan sends Ning Yingying to supervise the others while he makes himself some tea to relax.

"Shizun."

He freezes upon hearing that purr that repeats his name. Shen Yuan turns slowly, very slowly. Luo Binghe is in the center of the bamboo house. Unlike last time, now his red sigil shines on his forehead and his clothes are more ostentatious. It is PIDW's dark Luo Binghe, the one he feared and is now here and...

Shen Yuan takes a step back, terrified, and Luo Binghe's expression darkens.

"Shizun trusted this disciple, but now he is afraid. What kind of lies has the other shizun told you? Or was that Gongyi Xiao?"

Shen Yuan tries to control his racing pulse.

"Weren't you the one who lied to me, Luo Binghe?" He manages to sputter. "Why? You told me that no one wanted to visit me, but Liu-shidi tried. You never told me why you were organizing your army and now you attack my sect."

"I was just trying to protect shizun."

"And now?"

Luo Binghe doesn't reply. A dark aura envelops him, it is subtle, almost priceless and Shen Yuan had not noticed at first, but now it is impossible to ignore. Xin Mo! He understands with horror.

"Luo Binghe, listen to me. You have to get rid of that sword. It's getting into your mind..."

But Luo Binghe grips the hilt even tighter.

“Shizun, I've come for you.”

And he extends a hand that Shen Yuan cannot accept. Luo Binghe sighs, more sad and resigned than furious. And then tiredness spreads through Shen Yuan's body again. Luo Binghe catches him in his arms before he collapses. Neither his legs nor arms react when Luo Binghe carries him in bridal style.

"Luo Binghe, are you using your blood?" He babbles.

And it hurts. It hurts that he doesn't listen to him and uses against him a weapon that Shen Yuan accepted because he trusted Luo Binghe. He carries Shen Yuan outside the bamboo house. He appreciates that his eyes are glassy and can notice his scrambled qi. His qi is like bites, like a rough sea. Shen Yuan wants to calm him down, but he is trapped inside his own body.

Luo Binghe stops near the bamboo forest, hidden enough for others to not see them.

"I thought the other shizun would be with you..." He mutters to himself.

"He is not here!" Shen Yuan hastily spluttered.

And then Liu Qingge arrives.

Liu Qingge lands with a thud in front of them. Cheng Luan glows unsheathed in his hand and his expression is a mask of rage.

"Let him go, demon."

Still holding Shen Yuan, Luo Binghe unsheathes Xin Mo. The sword is covered in dark, sticky shadows like cobwebs.

"Never."

And he throws a wave of demonic qi towards Liu Qingge, so intense that it rips through the bamboo and the disciples scream upon hearing the noise. Liu Qingge manages to stand, protected behind his sword, but he has gritted his teeth in a painful grimace. Still, he charges against Luo Binghe, who uses his energy to keep the cultivator away from them.

Cheng Luan traces silver grooves when striking demon qi, but Luo Binghe's power is a wall that resists all attacks. Shen Yuan is so close to him that he can feel his breathing increasingly hard, how his eyes fog up with the color of blood. Luo Binghe is losing his control and he can only watch as he falls apart without doing anything to prevent it.

"Beast! Get away from my brother!"

With a graceful bow, Xiu Ya blocks an attack that would have struck Liu Qingge. Shen Jiu lands in front of them, pale, worried, and so furious that he's almost scarier than the Demon Lord.

"You have finally arrived, shizun!" Luo Binghe flashes a wild smile that shows all of his teeth.

"I remind you that I severed our ties between disciple and master."

"Did you do it at the Huan Hua Palace or during the Alliance Conference?" Luo Binghe sounds desperate and Shen Yuan weakly complains when he holds him even more tightly. "Why, shizun? Why did you push me? What did I do wrong?"

Shen Jiu doesn't reply. He cannot answer. In his place, he raises the arm that holds the sword.

"Shidi, step aside. I'll take care of it."

That means self-destruction. That means killing Luo Binghe. And Shen Yuan cannot allow either option.

"Wait, Jiu-Ge!" He yells before looking at Luo Binghe. "Binghe, please. Calm down. I can explain it to you."

The pressure of qi doesn’t soften. It is so intense that Shen Yuan would also not be able to move, even if he was free of the blood parasites.

"It was my fault. I was the reason you ended up at the Endless Abyss."

Regrets are worse than fear. Shen Yuan has endured them for too many days. During the Water Prison, fear froze his tongue, but none of them deserves a lie or a half-truth, no one deserves to suffer the consequences of his actions.

"This master always knew that his disciple was a half-demon," he explains under Luo Binghe's confused gaze and Shen Jiu's worried gaze. The two cultivators are tense behind the wall of qi as they try to ignore the darkness that envelops them like a second skin. "Do you believe in destiny, Luo Binghe? Your destiny has always been brilliant..."

No, that's another lie. Luo Binghe's destiny was to suffer and become a monster that makes others suffer without ever finding his true happiness. Shen Yuan takes a deep breath to forget the book and the character. The Luo Binghe that keeps him trapped is real and he deserves an explanation.

"Your destiny was to end up in the Endless Abyss and reclaim your true power. We knew it. So we tried to prepare you as best as possible so that you would overcome all obstacles and return to us safe and sound. But... I'm sorry, Binghe." His voice breaks. "I was wrong. I thought Shen Jiu knew you were a half-demon, but when he found out he was scared. He believed that I had tricked him. But I never wanted anyone to get hurt..." Shen Yuan has started to cry but he keeps talking. "We prepare your qiankun pouch together and..."

A hand brushes his cheek to wipe his tears. And Shen Yuan discovers that he can move now and is not the only one crying.

“Shizun, I’m sorry...”

"It's okay, Binghe. It's okay. Don't let it suppress your heart." Shen Yuan moves to comfort him with a hug. But even though the anger has subsided, his qi remains out of control and dangerous. "Everything that's happened in the past, I'll repay it all for you today."

"A-YUAN NO!"

Shen Yuan smiles before looking at Shen Jiu one last time. Although his figure is blurred by the shadows of qi, he can recognize his expression of horror.

"See you soon, Jiu-Ge."

And Shen Yuan self-destructs.

Chapter End Notes

Planning this fic, I considered the deaths of both Shen (what would have happened if Shen Jiu actually died or kept Shen Yuan's canon sacrifice). In the end, I chose Shen Yuan, because Shen Jiu believes that he is already fine just because he trusts one person, because he thinks he is loved by one person... But the truth is that there are many traumas and many toxic thoughts that need to be cured. And the absence of Shen Yuan will also mark the arcs of Luo Binghe and Liu Qingge.
Furthermore, it is a nice parallel with the beginning of the fic: the story begins with Shen Yuan desperate to live and Shen Jiu terrified that someone will replace him.

Also, Luo Binghe deserves a genuine apology 😤 I'm changing Shen Yuan's arc in order to better develop his future romantic relationships.

The third part of the fic is the angst. Although it will be less fun, it's my favorite part and I hope you enjoy it!

BONUS
Luo Binghe: I attack.
Liu Qingge & Shen Jiu: We protect.
Shen Yuan: I die.

BONUS 2
Shen Jiu: Dying is fine
Shen Jiu: Except when my twin brother does
Mu Qingfang: NO

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Yuan will come back

Chapter Summary

PART 3: Shen Yuan dies to save the scum villain

Chapter Notes

Warning about the third part: Shen Jiu is not fine. He has dragged on many problems since the beginning of the story that at no time has been fixed or cured, but he has ignored it believing that he was already well thanks to the presence of Shen Yuan. But he is not. The third part begins with him and his abandonment and insomnia problems, his grief disorder (first stage: denial), his distrust, anger, insecurity, loneliness, and detachment; his self-destructive and almost suicidal attitude. Although it is a fictional story, I want to point out the importance of therapy. I've added new tags. In case you consider that I should add more warnings, please let me know.

Remember take care of yourselves!

In case you miss comedy in this story, I've written a little extra to celebrate the 2,000 kudos. Thank you so much for supporting me in this story!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The demonic qi unravels into threads until it fades.

Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe share the same horror that freezes them, the same disbelief in their wide eyes. And Shen Jiu runs.

No.

Nononononoononononononononononoonononononnnnnnnnnonoonononononoononononononoonononononoononononoonononononoonononononoononono

NO!

Shen Jiu clings to his brother's body, pulling him away from Luo Binghe's arms, too stunned to react. But he was late. Although Shen Jiu hugs Shen Yuan tightly so that he never disappears, he only catches silence.

The silence of a heart that doesn’t beat, the silence of interrupted breathing. The silence of a voice that no longer sounds.

NONONONONONONOONONONONOONONONOONONONONOONONONONO

Please don’t leave me.

Not again.

Shen Jiu collapses onto his knees. All his strength, all his will, have been erased by a weariness that comes from his deepest memories. He doesn't even listen to Liu Qingge's screams or the insults he dedicates to Luo Binghe. Shen Jiu just contemplates Shen Yuan. His body is still warm and he seems to be sleeping, but it's a lie. He is gone. And it's ironic because at first Shen Jiu hated him, Shen Jiu hated that he had tried to steal his life, but in the end…

Come back. Please. I had forgotten what it was to trust someone. You've made me feel less miserable. Happy. You have to come back because you are my brother...

Shen Jiu closes his eyes to hide all the tears.

Nothing has happened. It's okay. Because you will come back.

After all, that was never Shen Yuan's true body. Shen Yuan has another body buried underground. He is not dead. He will return.

And Shen Jiu is used to waiting.

Shen Jiu stands up with Shen Yuan in his arms. Although his body is light, as if he has bird bones, Shen Jiu walks slowly. All his fears weigh too much and crush him. Shen Jiu raises his head and discovers Liu Qingge pointing Cheng Luan at Luo Binghe’s neck, undecided whether to kill him or not, while the disciples stay away. The scandal must have attracted them, but none dares to approach.

"Stop," Shen Jiu orders in a voice that is too hoarse, too broken. "You are embarrassing A-Yuan."

Liu Qingge lowers his sword and looks at him and then finally reality hits him as tears cover the War God's eyes.

"I'm sorry... I've failed you both," he splutters.

"It's okay, shidi. It's okay."

But his words, instead of reassuring him, worry Liu Qingge even more.

Shen Jiu has arrived with the two and stands between them.

"It's temporary," he tries to explain before either of them does something stupid. "Shen Yuan will be back. And now we should fix this mess. You." Shen Jiu looks at Luo Binghe. "Take away your demons. And I hope you assume the consequences of everything you've destroyed. And you." He turns to Liu Qingge. "Call Shang-shidi. My Peak needs some repairs."

But Liu Qingge remains paralyzed and horrified. Although he opens his mouth, he cannot speak. Only Luo Binghe seems to react to his words. The Demon Lord uses his sword to cut through a portal in midair.

Shen Jiu closes his eyes. He still feels a knot of emotions inside his chest, stretching and stretching and stretching and about to break him. But he is used to pain and will endure it. First, he has to reassure Luo Binghe before his qi alters again and Liu Qingge’s denial. And explain to the other Peak Lords that Shen Yuan has a spare body.

Everything is fine.

Although he's tired and just wants to stay alone and close his eyes and sleep until Shen Yuan comes back and…

Someone grabs him by the waist.

"STAY AWAY FROM HIM, DEMON!"

Luo Binghe drags Shen Jiu and Shen Yuan with him. The portal closes and the last Shen Jiu hears is Liu Qingge's voice calling out his name. The echo of his desperate cry, the bamboo, and his house; the terrified gazes from his disciples, and the familiar smell of Qing Jing Peak have all disappeared.

Shen Jiu blinks. At first, he doesn't recognize where he is. In a very short time, Luo Binghe has refurbished the Huan Hua Palace. Gold has been replaced by red and black. Human and demon servants approach them. Restless, Shen Jiu hugs Shen Yuan's body tighter, but the Demon Lord approaches them and takes him away with gentle, but firm intentions.

"Don't worry, shizun. I'll bring shizun back," the demon assures him with a confidence bordering on insanity.

In his arms, Shen Yuan seems more fragile and delicate. Luo Binghe turns his back on Shen Jiu as he orders his servants.

"Bring me Mobei-Jun. Take shizun to his room."

Shen Jiu could stop him, stop Luo Binghe from leaving with Shen Yuan.

But he doesn’t.

Instead, Shen Jiu allows the servants to guide him to a room. It is light and airy, exquisitely decorated, and reminds him of his bamboo house. This is where you wanted to bring A-Yuan? He thinks as he examines the furniture.

There is something wrong. Shen Jiu at first believed that Luo Binghe kept his brother locked up because he mistook them, later he discovered that the Demon Lord had always recognized them. Shen Jiu understands hatred and resentment, he has spent a lifetime feeding on them. But the adoration that Luo Binghe seems to process for his brother is incomprehensible to him. 

It seems like something else. Something very different from the respect between teacher and student. But A-Yuan told me that he is only interested in women ... Shen Jiu begins to have a bad feeling in his chest. But there is nothing he can do at that moment.

In the end, Shen Jiu sits under the window. No matter the place, waiting is always just as terrible. And now it's the only thing he can do.

So, Shen Jiu waits.

Despite the quiet of the room, there is chaos on the other side of the walls. When Shen Jiu sits up to find out what's going on, he discovers that there are guards at his door and they won't let him out. Resigned, he returns to his place under the window.

At least the views are nice.

Some maids come in to bring him a tray of food. But he is not hungry. The food is cold and intact when they return at night with another tray.

When he was a child trapped in the Qiu mansion, waiting for Qi-Ge was agonizing. Time slipped by very slowly and he was aware of every minute, every hour, every day that it was digging into his flesh. However, waiting for Shen Yuan is more blurry. Soon it dawns. They bring him breakfast, they prepare a bath that he ignores. More chaotic noises and the whispering voices of the servants are heard. It's noon. It’s sunset. It’s night. It is dawn. It's noon. It’s sunset. It’s night. It’s dawn. It's noon...

The door opens.

And Mu Qingfang enters the room.

"Mu-shidi?" Shen Jiu gets up, confused. "What are you doing here?"

His martial brother sighs. He looks exhausted.

"Your disciple appeared at Qian Cao Peak and... I'm sorry, Shen-shixiong. I'm so sorry." Mu Qingfang wrings his hands nervously. "I know this is a tough time for you, but you need to talk to Luo Binghe. He is insane. He has asked me to... heal Shen-ershixiong."

Shen Jiu frowns.

"What?"

"He believes that he can resurrect him."

"That is not possible. Besides, it is absurd." Shen Jiu clicks his tongue as he shakes his head.

"Grief is tough, but he doesn't listen to me. Please, you have to talk to him..."

Shen Jiu interrupts him before pulling a talisman of silence from his sleeve.

"Shen Yuan is not dead," he explains to Mu Qingfang after making sure that no one can hear him.

However, his martial brother adopts the same expression of horror and pity as Liu Qingge. Mu Qingfang reaches out to take his hands while speaking to him in a cautious voice.

"He is gone, shixiong."

"No, he is not..."

"I have seen his body. I can help Luo Binghe preserve it, but his soul has gone to the reincarnation circle."

"No!" Shen Jiu slaps him away. "Can you hear me for once! Shen Yuan is alive. We looked for Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds."

"Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds?"

"Yes. With those seeds, you can plant another body using qi. A-Yuan's soul has only changed body."

Mu Qingfang's expression darkens.

"I've never heard of something like this. Where did you get that information?"

"A-Yuan told me about it. I think he read it in a book."

"What book? From the Qing Jing Peak bookstore?"

"Perhaps..."

"A book that you haven't read?" He sighs. "Where did you get those seeds?"

"Here. In the Bailu Forest."

"So you also planted a body?"

"No..."

"Do you at least know where Shen Yuan's body is?"

He tried so hard to prevent his brother from discovering his lie that he never inquired into those details.

Mu Qingfang's expression becomes more skeptical at his silence. Shen Jiu notices that his heart trembles, that he is drowning.

"You don't believe me," he splutters with wide eyes.

Shen Jiu takes a step back and Mu Qingfang raises his hands while looking into his eyes.

"I’m trying, Shen-shixiong. But it sounds like a tale that your mind has made up to reject reality. The first step in grief is to accept that he is gone..."

Mu Qingfang looks at him with pity and Shen Jiu hates him.

The healer walks over to the table and examines the cold, untouched food. Then he stares at the wrinkle-free bed until he stops at his disheveled appearance.

"When was the last time you ate, Shen-shixiong?"

"I’m an immortal master. I can practice inedia."

"When was the last time you slept?"

Shen Jiu frowns.

"Does it matter? I'm fine." But he is not fine. He is furious, exhausted, and doesn't need Mu Qingfang's voice to cast new doubts in his head. "I trust A-Yuan. He will come back."

"Shen-shixiong..."

He hates the wariness with which Mu Qingfang tries to approach him as if he is not a person, but a wounded and confused animal. Shen Jiu shakes his sleeves to prevent him from touching him.

"I'm telling the truth! But you never believe me!"

Because he is Shen Jiu.

And people only trust Shen Yuan, they only care about Shen Yuan, they only believe in Shen Yuan. It’s normal. He does the same. He doesn't trust himself, he doesn't care about himself, he doesn't believe in himself either.

But he is tired of always facing the misgivings of others. The rumors, the misunderstandings. Why try if they despise him?

"Leave me alone," he hisses angrily.

Shen Jiu only breathes in relief when the door closes. Although the knot in his chest is still inside, stretching and stretching, twisting all that resentment accumulated over time, all those wounds that have never healed.

He returns to his place under the window.

And he waits.

Chapter End Notes

Do you remember that I commented that the most terrifying misunderstanding of all was Shen Yuan telling Shen Jiu that Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe are straight? At least, Shen Jiu is starting to suspect that something is off 👀

BONUS
Author: I have finished processing your request to include a kidnapping in the plot.
Author: Congratulations, Shen Jiu! You are the lucky one!
Shen Jiu: I didn't mean this!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Their feelings

Chapter Notes

I thought writing fanfiction in another language might be fun until I HAD TO WRITE AN ACTION SCENE.
Narration: They fight.
*two hours later*
Narration: They fight... and they get hurt.

And that is the reason why today I publish the chapter so late.

Top 10 worst experiences in this fandom and later there will be longer and more detailed scenes 😭😭😭😭

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The next few days happened in a blur.

Shen Jiu hears from the servants that Mu Qingfang and Luo Binghe have locked themselves in a room to heal Shen Yuan. The room is covered with frost to preserve the body and protect it from decomposition. Luo Binghe only leaves under specific circumstances.

That means Shen Jiu can calmly wait undisturbed.

However, since Mu Qingfang's visit, the servants insist that he must eat. "These are Lord Luo's orders," the humans say. "These are Jushang's orders," said the demons. Thus, Shen Qingqiu stirs the food and drinks so they stop bothering him. At night, he also undoes the sheets, although he doesn’t dare to close his eyes, fearing the nightmares.

The servants also pester him with the baths and Shen Jiu reluctantly agrees. They bring him new clothes, green and white, albeit with black or red decorations. Although they are different clothes than he usually wears, Shen Jiu is indifferent and he allows them to comb and dress him.

One morning the servants announce that he can now leave the room. Even so, most of the palace is off-limits. "Jushang is reforming it," the servants explain with great enthusiasm. The corridors that Shen Jiu can walk through are hardly reminiscent of the originals of the Huan Hua Palace. Luo Binghe has chosen a new undoubtedly demonic aesthetic and from the servants' comments, Shen Jiu deduces that he also wants to make the palace bigger. Why? He thinks. For your infinite harem?

Even so, he notices a bit of fear as he understands Luo Binghe's clear intentions to become the emperor of Shen Yuan's prophecies.

Shen Jiu is only allowed to stay in a specific spot in the gardens. Although it is nice to feel the sun on his face, there is no difference between waiting inside a room or outside. The anguish is always the same and also the fatigue that dulls his thoughts and blurs the hours.

Eight days have passed since Shen Yuan's death when something changes.

Shen Jiu is sitting under a gazebo when he hears noises. The scandal is annoying but common in the palace. Shen Jiu has never given importance to it. Perhaps it is the reforms or the old disciples of the sect rebelling against the demons. But that day the servants around him tense up.

And a cultivator dressed in white appears.

Shen Jiu frowns, confused and stunned. Liu Qingge seems to be part of a dream. There is something unreal about him, how he opens his eyes when he recognizes him and runs towards the gazebo. Shen Jiu still hasn’t assimilated what is happening when he is caught in a hug.

Liu Qingge is trembling, he realizes. Liu Qingge is here and is real. His body is warm and until now Shen Jiu hadn't realized how painful loneliness is. Unconsciously, he lifts his hands to sink them into the folds of his robes.

"Shidi?" He mutters, stunned.

Liu Qingge moves without breaking the hug until his forehead brushes his. And a hand caresses Shen Jiu's cheek as if he is something precious.

"I finally found you," Liu Qingge manages to say in a broken voice.

"Wait? What are you doing here?"

"Rescue you."

Liu Qingge stands up, still holding Shen Jiu. And he stumbles, leaning on his shidi's chest. He can feel that Liu Qingge is tense, almost ready to fight.

"Don't you dare," the servants hiss in a warning.

But Liu Qingge dares.

Shen Jiu is still confused when Liu Qingge grabs his hand to flee. However, exhaustion makes him clumsy and Shen Jiu falls to the ground. But Liu Qingge doesn’t abandon him. He reaches down and gently carries him into his arms while someone yells.

Liu Qingge runs through the gardens and no one tries to stop him. Shen Jiu closes his eyes and grabs onto his neck. All seems part of a dream. Perhaps he is sleeping or perhaps exhaustion has made him sink into one of those desperate desires deep in his heart.

Some guards try to stop him, but no one confronts him and Liu Qingge dodges them until he reaches the walls. Opening his eyes, Shen Jiu recognizes signs of recent fighting and for the first time, he wonders if these marks are from when Luo Binghe conquered Huan Hua Palace or was Liu Qingge trying to enter all this time.

"We need to reach outside Bailu Forest," Liu Qingge warns him when they finally reach the trees. "There is a formation that prevents flying." He grips Shen Jiu tighter. "I'll take you to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect and then rescue Mu-shixiong and Shen Yuan. I promise you. I won’t abandon your brother’s body so you can bury him."

Despite his characteristic confidence, there is sadness in his voice. And Shen Jiu sees that Liu Qingge looks extremely tired. Maybe he's not the only one who hasn't slept all that time.

They enter the interior of the forest when a dark rift splits the air. And Luo Binghe appears, with Xin Mo in hand, his gaze glowing red and rage. Liu Qingge stops and the two silently challenge each other.

"Let shizun go," the demon demands, speaking very slowly. And although he seems calm, his posture is threatening.

Liu Qingge growls, furious.

"You don’t have enough!!?" He hisses, releasing Shen Jiu so that he can stand while Liu Qingge reaches for Cheng Luan's hilt. "Shen Yuan died because of you! And now you want...!!?"

Before he can finish speaking, dark, demonic, and dense qi covers Luo Binghe's figure.

"SHUT UP!!!!"

A wave of demonic qi rushes down on them. Liu Qingge covers Shen Jiu with his body before attacking the demon as well. Soon, both swords collide, engulfed in black and silver sparks.

The strength of both qi knocks Shen Jiu to the ground. And he is unable to get up. There is something that keeps him paralyzed, that freezes his legs, his energy. Maybe it's tiredness. Or maybe it's the confusion of watching them fight.

Although their styles are very different, there is a certain similarity that makes them reflections. They have the same look, the same pain warped in rage.

"I never meant to hurt shizun!" Luo Binghe roars and sounds lamenting, crying.

"He would be alive if he weren't for you!"

Shen Jiu's eyes widen after he understands... their heartbreak is evident. They love him! Shen Jiu remembers Luo Binghe carrying Shen Yuan in his arms to take him away from the sect, Liu Qingge's strange changes in his attitude that became more apparent after the succubus mission. They love Shen Yuan or, at least, they want Shen Yuan.

Shen Jiu notices a bitter taste. None of them have called him by his name. Because Shen Yuan is gone and there is still someone identical to him. The discomfort grows when he remembers that Luo Binghe has locked him in the room that was going to be for Shen Yuan as if he was some kind of replacement.

How could I have been such an idiot? He thinks as he gets up. Surely Liu Qingge hasn't even come for me, but A-Yuan.

Shen Jiu intervenes in the fight. He needs to stop them before Luo Binghe gets out of control and Shen Yuan's sacrifice has been in vain. But he has forgotten Xiu Ya in the room and his qi fails when he raises his hands to stop their swords.

"Shizun!"

"Move away!"

Cheng Luan scratches his left arm, tearing his sleeves and staining the ground with blood while demonic qi strikes him. Even though it’s not an especially powerful blow, Shen Jiu doubles over coughing up blood.

Enraged, Luo Binghe unleashes his energy and attacks Liu Qingge. The air churns with violence and murderous intent. Shen Jiu closes his eyes before putting his hands on the ground and trying to get up. But his injured arm burns and he can't move. Although Liu Qingge doesn't scream, he does hear him groan in pain before a blow shakes the forest.

"Stop..." Shen Jiu tries to sputter. “Don’t… hurt him.”

Luo Binghe returns to his side. The demonic qi softens as he reaches down and gently picks him up. Shen Jiu thinks back to the last time when he did the same to Shen Yuan, and panic ripped through his body. I'm not him. I'M NOT HIM.

But he is too tired and he cannot struggle or open his mouth to speak.

Shen Jiu's pulse is racing as he looks for Liu Qingge. And he breathes in relief when he discovers that he is hurt but alive. Liu Qingge uses Cheng Luan to get up. He has blood on his face and from the way he is holding his chest, perhaps also several broken ribs. Luo Binghe gives him a last look.

"I won't kill you because Shizun appreciates you. But the next time you try to attack my palace, I won't be so merciful." A cruel smile appears on his lips. "Maybe I'll rip your arm off."

Luo Binghe turns around and leaves with Shen Jiu back to the palace. It is the first time that they are alone since the Alliance Conference and the silence grows like a shadow. Shen Jiu no longer understands what his former disciple wants from him: revenge, a replacement...

The same servants and guards who haven’t dared to confront Liu Qingge, receive their Demon Lord with bows. Cowards , Shen Jiu hisses with narrowed eyes.

"Call the healer," Luo Binghe orders them. He has stopped for a few seconds in front of his servants and then continues walking.

The room is cold when they arrive, although there is no frost on its walls or a frozen corpse, just an empty bed and a closed window. Luo Binghe carries Shen Jiu and helps him sit on the edge of the mattress. Although his movements are careful and avoid brushing against his wound, Shen Jiu recognizes that he is tense. Shen Yuan tried to clarify what happened, however, there is much that they haven’t talked about yet and all those silent words create an abyss between them. Luo Binghe is so close that his curls brush his cheek, but Shen Jiu feels that he is so far away that he won’t be able to hear him.

Mu Qingfang arrives quickly, disheveled, with his sleeves rolled up and the exhaustion drawing dark circles under his eyes.

"What happened?"

"An accident."

Shen Jiu purses his lips and looks at the wall as Mu Qingfang stands in front of him to examine the wound. His shidi's skin is icy, but his movements are more precise than Luo Binghe's and he manages to move his arm without hurting him.

"It's superficial. Bring me water. I need to disinfect the wound." He pauses. "I would also appreciate having access to the salves and medicines of your palace."

In other circumstances, perhaps Shen Jiu would have smiled at the image of the lanky healer commanding the Demon Lord. And the most amused is that Luo Binghe abides without question. When he leaves the room, Shen Jiu inhales, discovering that until that moment he had been holding his breath.
