However, Mu Qingfang's presence also makes him uncomfortable, reminding him of the misgivings of their last argument.

Luo Binghe returns followed by more servants who are placed under Mu Qingfang's command. Although the Demon Lord remains distant, he doesn’t leave and watches closely as Mu Qingfang cleans the wound and bandages his arm.

Shen Jiu tries to pull away when the healer finishes, however, Mu Qingfang grabs his wrist to check his meridians. Although he's trying his best to ignore them all, he notices his throat dry when his shidi frowns. There is a concern in his eyes and even Luo Binghe notices, as he leaves the wall he was leaning against and approaches them.

"What's wrong?"

Mu Qingfang ignores the Demon Lord, his gaze fixed on Shen Jiu's.

"Shen-shixiong, your qi is unstable."

Annoyed, Shen Jiu manages to free himself as he clicks his tongue.

"I've been hit by demonic qi. I'll recover with a little meditation..."

"Your physical state is fragile because you still don't eat or sleep, am I wrong?" Mu Qingfang interrupts him. He is no longer tired but disappointed. "You have a superficial wound, but you have bled too much because you have no energy to heal it yourself. And now your qi is altered. You have always been prone to qi deviations, Shen-shixiong."

"You're overreacting."

"I'm not and you know it. Our mental state affects the qi and now you are under a lot of stress."

At least this time Mu Qinfgang hasn't mentioned the forbidden words: grief, denial, and Shen Yuan's death.

"You're right: I need to rest." Shen Qingqiu flashes a fake smile that accompanies his bitter words. "Can you please leave me alone?"

He stiffens, holding his breath, after seeing Mu Qingfang sit up and look at Luo Binghe. It's not a "Let's go back with Shen Yuan" look, but a "We need to talk" look. That complicity keeps him alert and suspicious. Do you trust Luo Binghe more than me? That superb demon who has locked us both up? He wants to yell at him, but he clenches his teeth until his jaw hurts. Do you know that he has hurt Liu Qingge? And we still do not know what happened to the Old Palace Master and his daughter…

Although the door closes, Shen Jiu still feels all those thoughts inside his chest, poisonous like smoke. To distract himself, he picks up the little chaos and changes his robes. He also folds the torn and bloody clothes. When the servants arrive, they take them away along with the sheets that have also been stained when Mu Qingfang cleaned the wound.

That night, Luo Binghe returns with a tray of food. That change in an invariable routine makes him suspicious. Shen Jiu watches as Luo Binghe puts the tray on the table and sits down.

"Shizun." It is the first time since Shen Yuan's death that Luo Binghe has spoken to him directly and his voice makes him tremble. "Would you humor me?"

Suspicious, Shen Jiu crosses his arms.

"Is this Mu Qingfang's idea?" He guesses, raising an eyebrow.

However, Luo Binghe tilts his head.

"Did shizun forget the bet?"

Shen Jiu frowns until the memories return with little bites. The sword. The shards. A bet that he knew he was going to win. But now the reward is indifferent to him, although something inside him (hunger, maybe regrets) twists. Shen Jiu approaches the table with small steps and sits down.

The food is simple, a little white rice with almost no seasonings, and apricots. Still, it smells as good as ever. Nostalgia catches him with the first bite. The food tastes like the old days at Qing Jing Peak, Liu Qingge kicking open the door and Luo Binghe trying to stop him in vain; Shen Yuan covering his hand with a sleeve to hide his laughter and the unfriendly cat climbing up on the table to steal something from the plat.

But everything has changed forever. And those sunny days, without worries or long waits, will never return.

Shen Jiu eats silently, avoiding Luo Binghe's gaze. And he doesn't speak either. The weak smile with which he has reminded him the bet has faded, replaced by a thoughtful grin.

"Mu-shishu has made this special herbal tea," he explains as he hands him a cup of tea. "It will help shizun to sleep."

After a doubt, he accepts.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Shen Jiu: I thought you were straight.
Liu Qingge & Bingbing: ...
Black Bingbing: I'm a demon
Liu Qingge: I'm a cultivator.

CURIOSITY #1
Even though there is no one in the world as dense as Shen Yuan, Shen Jiu is even worse at identifying positive feelings towards him. And these chapters are (and will be) full of details that he has chosen to ignore >:3 Writing his POV is very entertaining because of everything that is left in the shadows.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu has another nightmare

Chapter Notes

Bingjiu Week starts tomorrow and I'll have to take another hiatus, so I have advanced this week's chapter. I hope you like it!

Warning: As you can guess from the title, a suffocating nightmare + untreated mental illness.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

In the dark, the room becomes the same as his bamboo house. Shen Jiu is so tired that he closes his eyes and tries to fool himself. At first, he succeeds. He takes a deep breath as his thoughts fly away. But the pressure in his chest doesn't fade.

shen yuan is missing liu qingge is hurt liu qingge and luo binghe are in love with shen yuan will liu qingge be alright? will he return? shen yuan please come back soon what are mu qingfang and luo binghe planning? what does luo binghe want? do you hate me? why don't you hate me??????????

Shen Jiu exhales, opening his eyes. The room is too cold and it doesn't smell like bamboo, but strangers and medicines. And there is no one else. Just him and different fatigue than usual. Shen Jiu rubs his eyes. Damn tea , he hisses. He had become used to sleepless nights, but now his determination begins to bubble away. Reluctantly, Shen Jiu takes off his clothes and lies down on the bed. He doesn't want to sleep. He is afraid to sleep. But the effect of the narcotic is too intense and defeats insomnia.

Shen Jiu feels that he is sinking into a deep black water lake, which erases all his worries.

But the nightmare catches him.

The darkness engulfs him. He dreams that he is locked in a room without doors or windows. And the room begins to shrink. It's smaller, smaller, smaller, smaller. The walls crush him, break his bones. Shen Jiu opens his mouth to scream, but sand gets down his throat. It's smaller, smaller, smaller, smaller. Although he tries to close his eyes, he is enveloped by the same thick, sticky darkness.

It’s not a room, it’s a mouth. The walls have teeth and fangs, the floor is a slippery tongue. He is going to be eaten in a thousand pieces.

Someone grabs him. Shen Jiu feels tiny and fragile when some arms wrap around his body and rescue him away from that hissing jaw. A greenish clarity dazzles him. And his lungs relax to find himself under a sky so blue it hurts. Shen Jiu walks among the bamboo with cautious steps.

In the distance, someone says his name.

And he would recognize that voice even at the end of the world.

Shen Jiu runs. And the bamboo sprouts are pushed aside to show a house. Shen Yuan is there, playing with a cat. He is not alone. There are some shadows without faces, Luo Binghe, and his other disciples. Shen Yuan raises his head and looks at him.

"Jiu-Ge!"

They are almost all there. Someone takes him by the hand and encourages him to approach with increasingly confident steps.

"Shizun! Shizun!" Luo Binghe says, looking at the two of them with eyes shining like stars. He is an adult now, but he still wears a white and green uniform. "This disciple has improved his sword technique!"

"Oh!" Shen Yuan smiles candidly, sitting down on the grass. "Show it."

Shen Jiu sits with him, allowing nostalgia to entangle him, erasing the suffocating memory of the nightmare.

 

 

Shen Jiu growls with his eyes closed.

The dream is still tangled with his thoughts. Despite the light that has devoured the room, the inside of his head is a hole covered in shadow. Shen Jiu growls again when someone knocks on the door. Someone comes in. Although Shen Jiu opens his eyes, he feels that he is still within an illusion. The servants who enter are more unreal than usual and he is unable to recognize where he is. All the furniture is strange, the sheets are too soft, there is too much noise outside the window.

Shen Jiu covers his face with his hands, still wrapped in the sheets. His body is heavy and awkward, his eyes sting. He feels a doughy tongue and tiredness that cuts through bone and muscle, to wrap itself in his chest, in his skull. How long have I been sleeping? He thinks as he sits on the bed. Although he wishes to close his eyes and continue sleeping, Shen Jiu slowly begins to wake up.

And he remembers that he is not at his house, but at Luo Binghe's palace. Nine days have passed since Shen Yuan's self-destruction and he still hasn't come back.

Something inside him squirms. Maybe it's fear. Or doubts. Remorse. Unsafety. Suspicion. Mistrust.

Shen Jiu gazes without enthusiasm at the food that has been brought to him. From the light coming through the window, it must be almost noon. And although he still notices the nauseous echo of the nightmare, he is so exhausted that he just wants to sleep. Sleep for a whole day and wake up when Shen Yuan does.

Suddenly, Shen Jiu's eyes widen. And despite the clumsiness, he pulls the sheets aside and manages to get up. At first, his legs shake. The servants pretend to bring his clothes closer to him, but he ignores them.

"Where is Luo Binghe?" He hisses.

His heart beats so fast that he hears nothing else, just those rhythmic thumps against his ribs. After so many days of waiting, feeling something is immense and terrifying. It burns. It is anger and suspicion and confusion.

The servants exchange an uncomfortable look.

"Lord Luo is with Master Mu in the frozen room."

"Where?"

"You should eat first, Master Shen. We will tell Lord Luo that you have asked for him..."

Shen Jiu growls and walks through them. He ignores their pathetic attempts to stop him, the food on the table, or the fact that he's disheveled and wearing only his inner robes. Shen Jiu leaves his room chased by the voices of the servants. Although he has never visited Shen Yuan's corpse, he senses where he is.

"Wait! Master Shen...!"

Shen Jiu walks with increasingly impatient and swift steps. Although his legs are still tired and the sudden movement makes him dizzy, he doesn't stop. As he approaches the hallway, several guards try to block him, but he gives them a dismissive look.

"Leave."

Shen Yuan's room is nearby. Shen Jiu jerks the door open and enters, ignoring the chill biting into his bare feet or exposed skin. The room is very similar to his, almost a reflection. The walls are covered in frost and one body has been lying on the bed for nine days with its eyes closed. For a few moments, Shen Jiu ignores Mu Qingfang and Luo Binghe's confusion.

Shen Yuan seems to be sleeping.

And it hurts because he is not the real one.

"What's going on?" Luo Binghe growls. He holds one of Shen Yuan's wrists in his hand.

The servants stand on the threshold of the door, not daring to enter.

"We are sorry, Lord Luo."

"We tried to stop Master Shen."

"But he doesn't listen to us."

"Shen-shixiong?" Mu Qingfang turns away from the bed to walk towards him with cautious steps. "It’s something wrong?"

He stops when Shen Jiu gives him an icy, grim look.

"Thanks for drugging me, shidi," he hisses, taunting each word sarcastically.

Mu Qingfang sighs.

"It was a medicinal tea to help you sleep, shixiong."

But Shen Jiu no longer listens to him. He turns his head towards Luo Binghe while that storm of emotions continues to burn inside him until flames creep up his throat and his voice crackles.

"How could I forget your Dream Demon?" He growls angrily.

Luo Binghe's expression darkens.

"Does Shizun also know about the Elder Demon?" Still, he has the nerve to smile. "I shouldn't have underestimated shizun's knowledge."

Shen Jiu is trembling. And he notices a bitter taste in his mouth.

"How long?"

"This is the second nightmare this humble disciple has intervened in."

And he remembers it. Another horrible dream that only disappeared when someone rescued him with a hug. It was the night he and Shen Yuan spoke perhaps for the first time as brothers. Shen Jiu clenches his fists.

"Liar." He accuses him. "Now I remember. I started to sleep well after that night. But the nightmares returned when I pushed you into the Endless Abyss. I thought it was fear or regrets, but no! It was you all this time!"

With slow and cautious movements, Luo Binghe leaves Shen Yuan's arm on the bed and turns to him.

"I was just trying to help shizun."

"I never gave you permission to get into my head!"

Shen Jiu is startled to notice that someone has approached him. Mu Qingfang looks at him with pity and fear. Despite his rage, Shen Jiu manages to retrieve the fragments of his cold mask. And he gives him a dismissive look.

"Why do you all forget that I am Shen Qingqiu, Qing Jing Peak Lord, the Xiu Ya sword?"

He is not frail or sick or broken, he is just a little tired and very furious.

 

 

Once upon a time, there was a young boy and two shizuns.

Although his shizuns were identical, their hearts couldn't be more different. One shizun was warm like the sun and his kindness made the boy happy. The other shizun was cold and strict, and the boy was afraid of him at first. But when the demons attacked them, the cold shizun said: "I trust him."

And everything changed.

If one shizun was his sun, the other was the moon: sometimes he disappeared into the darkness, sometimes he shone, sometimes he smiled, and his smiles were the most unique and beautiful.

The boy worshiped the sun. He made him feel special. Once he accompanied him in his nightmare, healed his wounds, and taught him to face monsters. Even when he fell into the deepest and darkest abyss, his sunlight was there to illuminate his path and warm him on the coldest nights.

But it was the moon who was once hurt to protect them, who trusted him to keep the white cultivator away, who smiled when he cooked and even bet with him.

The moon boasted with a smile that he would win. The moon pushed him away with a look of hatred. It was also the moon who broke his heart.

Moonlight didn’t reach the deep and sinister darkness of hell.

The boy was bright, but inside his heart, there was a bit of shade. There was resentment, insecurity, hatred, fear, and longing. The boy who had it all trembled and his light began to dim. Did his moon hate him for being a demon? But the boy believed that humans were the worst. It was the humans who mistreated his mother and left her to die. Why did the moon change his mind? Will the sun also hate him when he discovers the truth?

The boy became an adult.

The disciple became a demon.

And he came back, with twisted ideas and different plans.

He wanted the truth. He wanted to take his sun back. Maybe also the moon. A part of him wanted to return to those happy days when he was loved. That was his first plan. But it was a bad plan. Before he was weak, now he had power. All his dreams came true thanks to sacrifices. Why stop? He could change the world. He could destroy everything he hated and create a little paradise.

But all his dreams cost blood.

He has gotten the truth, his sun, and his moon. But his days are still not happy. Now his kind shizun is cold and the cold one is fading.

It has been nine days since the death of one shizun and Luo Binghe has been avoiding the other. He's been suffering doubts and rancor for three years. And all those dark feelings won't fade in the blink of an eye. He still notices them stirring in his chest. Why, shizun? Why did you push me? Why did you never try to talk to me when I came back? I'm here. Do you hate me so much? Do I seem so despicable to you?

But shizun is no longer scary. Unlike Liu Qingge, shizun hasn’t accused him of the death of his brother. And he's still here, he's never tried to run away. Although Luo Binghe still feels that murderous fury and the sword whispers that he should punish him, he is starting to calm down. His heart aches and his inner demons are going to drive him crazy, but his sadness is too immense and dark.

Shizun died because of him.

And he is afraid of not being able to bring him back.

He would love to close his eyes and hug the cold shizun. Cry and scream how much he misses Shen Yuan. And perhaps Shen Jiu would comfort him and promise him that he will return.

But Shen Jiu ignores him. And Luo Binghe finally understands that he is not doing it out of evil, but because he is ill.

"This disciple apologizes." Luo Binghe takes a step, but that seems to make shizun more nervous, so he stops. "Mu-shishu told me that you weren't eating or sleeping."

"I am an immortal Master," he reminds them. But his voice sounds desperate, an echo of the past.

Luo Binghe gives him a conciliatory smile.

"This disciple thought that he could help shizun. But now I understand that it was a mistake. This disciple will not intervene again without shizun's permission." Unless he is suffering. Luo Binghe has learned that he must be more subtle. "But this disciple would be very happy to help shizun. So please, if you need this disciple, ask for it."

His words have calmed Shen Jiu and Luo Binghe approaches him again. His smile disappears as he fixes on the useless servants who don't know how to take care of shizun. Maybe choosing them because of his mediocre appearance was a bad idea. He will have to look for others.

"Shizun," he whispers to him. "Go to your room. This disciple will accompany you to eat if shizun wishes."

Luo Binghe can see Mu Qingfang nod approvingly. He is not an idiot: he knows that the healer doesn’t approve of his mad and desperate desire to resurrect Shen Yuan. But Luo Binghe doesn't care.

Luo Binghe will fix his two shizuns.

 

 

The nights are still horrible, sometimes plagued with nightmares, sometimes punctuated by insomnia. Shen Jiu usually sleeps during the day. Tiredness devours him when he is waiting in the garden or his room and inadvertently he closes his eyes. Then he wakes up in bed as if someone had carried him in their arms.

And time passes. And Shen Yuan doesn’t return.

Neither does Liu Qingge.

And although it’s not the first time, it’s not a surprise, Shen Jiu's heart sinks a little further.

Chapter End Notes

CURIOSITY #1
Yup, Shen Yuan has made the same mistake as SVSSS by confusing Bingbing's intentions 😈😈 I hope that thanks to this chapter, Bingbing's thoughts are clearer now.

CURIOSITY #2
I warned you that the nightmare of chapter 14 would be important 😈😈😈😈

The arc of the relationship between Luo Binghe and Shen Jiu is about trust/mistrust. Right now, Luo Binghe is confident that Shen Jiu will stay with him (despite his doubts, Shen Jiu hasn't tried to run away and so the vigilance has been relaxed and he has more freedom now). In the previous chapter you asked me if Luo Binghe has given him his blood. No. In this fic, demon blood reflects trust. Shen Yuan accepted because he trusted him (and Luo Binghe later betrayed that trust by attacking the sect and using the blood against him). And that's why Luo Binghe still hasn't offered it to Shen Jiu.

But Shen Jiu doesn't trust Luo Binghe. And it's ironic, because Luo Binghe is the only one who would trust him blindly right now if he told him the truth about Shen Yuan.

Shen Jiu could help Luo Binghe in his mourning and Luo Binghe could help him with Shen Yuan's return. However, they are making the same mistake as in PIDW: Shen Jiu is hurting Luo Binghe because of his trauma instead of accepting him.

BONUS: How did Black Bingbing design the dream for his shizun?
Black Bingbing: First, shizun needs his brother.
Black Bingbing: And he is always happiest in his house surrounded by the bamboo forest (note to my future self: plant bamboo in my palace 😤)
Black Bingbing: And the cat! Other disciples may appear as well, though I won't bother designing them ☺️
Black Bingbing: To distract Shizun there is already this humble disciple 🥰
Black Bingbing: And that's all. I already have a perfect dream and ready for shizun :)
Liu Qingge: ...😡

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Luo Binghe is true to his word

Chapter Notes

I'm back! Today's chapter is extra long to compensate for the break. We finally have the POV of more characters! The other chapters were focused on Shen Jiu, but the story has many more details that he is not aware of 😌 Hope you like it!!!!!!!!

Warning: Violence at the end.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

In the past few weeks, Shen Jiu decided to kill time in the Huan Hua Palace library. Although he is so tired that he can barely read, having a purpose makes him feel better. On the worst days, he picks up a random book and tries to focus (he doesn't always succeed). On the few days with more energy and determination, Shen Jiu investigates how to protect his mind from Luo Binghe's dream powers.

That morning, She Jiu tries to concentrate despite the exhaustion and headache after another sleepless night. He is trying, but insomnia catches him without him being able to prevent it. And after the disastrous medicinal tea incident, Shen Jiu has refused any help.

He stiffens hearing footsteps approaching him. The servants are quieter and Luo Binghe much louder. Those intermediate steps can only belong to a person that he does not want to see or speak. When Mu Qingfang appears behind a bookcase, Shen Jiu greets him with a frown.

"What do you want?" He growls at him, ready to control the conversation.

The healer sighs resigned. The dark circles that mark his eyes are even bigger and he is as pale as if he had not seen the sunlight for a month. And maybe it's true.

"I’m leaving, Shen-shixiong. Today I have come to say goodbye."

Shen Jiu keeps his expression indifferent, though something inside him writhes between relief and disappointment. He shouldn't be surprised. He is condemned to be alone.

Annoyed, Shen Jiu turns his back to continue reading. He has finally found a useful book and concentrating is already difficult to also be distracted.

"Shen-shixiong, I have helped stabilize Shen-ershixiong's body to prevent him from rotting. But that won't change the fact that that body is dead."

"I know," he growls acidly.

This is why he hates being alone with Mu Qingfang. He still tries to convince him that Shen Yuan is dead and will never return; that the Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds are a fantasy of his mind affected by a qi deviation.

Sometimes Shen Jiu wonders if he is right.

And that's a terrifying prospect.

"If you know, why don't you stop Luo Binghe from continuing his madness?" Mu Qingfang's voice reflects his exhaustion.

Shen Jiu ignores him.

"He is still your disciple."

"He is not."

Mu Qingfang sighs. And he sounds like he's running out of patience.

"I will speak to Zhangmen-shixiong." He says it like it's a threat, but it only gets Shen Jiu to laugh. "Shen-shixiong, your mind is unclear. We must treat your qi deviation and Luo Binghe... he is dangerous and unstable."

Annoyed, Shen Jiu closes the book and turns to glare at him.

"My mind would be better if you all stopped stressing me."

Mu Qingfang holds his gaze without allowing his mood to affect him.

"You need help, Shen-shixiong."

"What do you want, Mu-shidi?" He almost screams, frustrated that all his conversations always end in the same dead end. "You never listen to me. You don't believe Luo Binghe, but you've helped him preserve a useless corpse. You don't believe me, but you insist on pretending you care..."

"I care."

"That's a lie!" Shen Jiu clenches his fists. "You have never cared!"

"Shen-shixiong, listen to yourself. You are not being reasonable."

He notices an unpleasant taste in his mouth and a cold in his stomach. He hates that helplessness, which reminds him of the past and all those misunderstandings that made others hate him. He had forgotten that it was Shen Yuan who clarified his image, but without him, he was the same old liar again.

"Shen-shixiong," Mu Qingfang insists as he says nothing. "Come back with me to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. Together we can help you."

But he doesn't need help, only Shen Yuan. But even if he returns to the sect, no one will believe him. Perhaps they will lock him up in Qian Cao Peak while he is free in Luo Binghe's palace. Shen Jiu feels cold inside his bones, through his ribs, freezing his legs to stone. Solitude is nice. Surrounding himself with hypocrites who never cared for him is terrifying.

"No."

Mu Qingfang bows his head in defeat.

"How can I help you?"

"Stop insisting," he growls. But Shen Jiu bites his lip, thinking of one detail. "When you return to the sect, visit our house. Shen Yuan had many writings. There you will find the truth about Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds."

I'm not lying , he thinks without daring to say it. His pride makes him bite his tongue like many other times. Shen Jiu breathes a sigh of relief when Mu Qingfang finally leaves him alone in the cold library.

 

 

Since the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect attack, which ended with Shen Yuan's death and Shen Jiu's (and later Mu Qingfang's) kidnapping, the sect has been in chaos. A month later, Luo Binghe has finally freed Mu Qingfang and there will be an emergency meeting between the eleven Peak Lords.

Liu Qingge is restless, almost hysterical. He has been the first to arrive and is unable to sit still while he waits for the rest. From his site, Yue Qingyuan watches over him. Although the leader tries to remain calm, his gaze is rigid and he does not lose his sight. Yue Qingyuan is the reason why Liu Qingge hasn’t been able to leave the sect since his last fight against Luo Binghe. Faced with the severity of his injuries, he ordered him to remain at rest until Mu Qingfang returned.

Liu Qingge hated waiting, hated accepting his leader's arguments, hated doing nothing while Shen Jiu was in the hands of the demon who had killed his brother.

He hated being aware of every single broken piece of his wounded heart.

Almost all of the Peak Lords have arrived already. Only Mu Qingfang is missing.

Liu Qingge is aware of the impatience that flutters inside his chest, the tension gripping his arms, and the urge to take Cheng Luan out to fly to the demon’s palace. Yue Qingyuan made him promise that he wouldn't do anything as long as Mu Qingfang was watching over the two of them.

Mu Qingfang is late.

Liu Qingge suspects that Shen Jiu must be in horrible pain. And he is alone, which is worse. Alone, just with a cruel and selfish demon, who has already tried to attack his sect, kidnap Shen Yuan, lock him in the Water Prison and force him to self-destruct. Liu Qingge hates him more than anything. In the past, he believed he hated Shen Qingqiu, but it was just a stupid rivalry. Luo Binghe is a terrifying monster.

And he trembles because he suspects what he wants from Shen Jiu.

Mu Qingfang hasn’t yet arrived and Liu Qingge feels that hideous helplessness again, which makes him feel useless.

Annoyed, he sits up and heads impatiently for the door.

"I'm going to find Mu-shidi."

"Shidi," Yue Qingyuan stopped him just by raising his voice. "Keep calm."

"How?!" Liu Qingge turns to face his sect leader. "We don't know anything about them! What if that beast has changed his mind?"

"A disciple from Qian Cao Peak has informed me that Mu-shidi has gone to visit Qing Jing Peak before coming to the meeting."

Liu Qingge frowns, uneasy and confused for not understanding his martial brother's intentions. Still, reluctantly, he returns to his place and sits down. Although his posture is tense, ready to run or face someone at any moment.

When Mu Qingfang arrives, almost everyone breathes a sigh of relief. Liu Qingge stiffens and squints at the scrolls and papers the healer is carrying. Mu Qingfang looks exhausted but moves with energy. Upon reaching his site, he drops all the scrolls with a thud. And then he sits up, burying his face in one hand as his posture sags under the weight of concern Liu Qingge senses without understanding.

No one says anything and everyone watches Mu Qingfang, eager to hear his report.

"I've made the worst mistake," he splutters before grabbing a bulky scroll. "At the direction of Shen-shixiong, I went to his house. There I found Shen-ershixiong's writings. This is about heavenly demons and all their abilities."

Liu Qingge leans forward. Although he lacks the patience to read voluminous books, he is desperate to learn more about his enemy.

"But that is not what I was looking for, but Shen-ershixiong's diary..." The healer's voice trembles and Liu Qingge begins to feel fear. There is something wrong with his sunken expression, something terrifying that clouds the air and makes it colder. "I've made a horrible mistake," he repeats. "Shen-ershixiong is alive."

Someone is speaking, many are yelling at the same time, and questions are tangled into noise. Liu Qingge opens his mouth without saying anything. And the stupid hope that he had been harboring all this time grows into a fire.

"How?" Yue Qingyuan's voice, calm despite the uneasy tone, manages to silence the rest. "Was it a mistake?"

After all, there were only three witnesses to his death: Shen Jiu, who said Shen Yuan would return, Luo Binghe, who took Shen Yuan's corpse, and he, who assumed the worst, believed that Shen Jiu was in denial, and unleashed his fury against the demon.

Mu Qingfang shakes his head.

"Shen-ershixiong's body is dead, I have checked it myself. However, it seems that they both knew about the existence of Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds. And that has been my error," he acknowledges with such intense guilt, almost physical, which makes Liu Qingge fidget. "I thought they were Shen-shixiong delusions and refused to believe him. But Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds are real."

"What does that mean?" Liu Qingge is afraid that his hope is wrong and that is why his voice sounds hoarse.

"Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds allow a second identical body to grow from qi. Shen-ershixiong's decision was not suicidal, but calculated: his soul left his original body to move to another one."

Liu Qingge feels that his heart has almost stopped.

"He is alive."

Perhaps it is an illusion. Those are the words that Liu Qingge has dreamed of all along, but hearing them they don't seem real. Confused, Liu Qingge lowers his gaze and faces his clenched fists.

He can still regain the life that was nearly destroyed a month ago.

"I've never heard of seeds like this!" Qi Qingqi splutters. "Is it possible?"

"Yes," Shang Qinghua chimes to everyone's surprise. "I... I also read about those seeds a long time ago. But I had forgotten them. Cucu... Shen-ershixiong has a prodigious memory."

Liu Qingge ignores the babbling of his other martial brothers to look at the healer.

"Where is Shen Yuan?"

"I don't know. Shen-ershixiong never wrote down the exact location as a precaution."

Liu Qingge nods, although deep down he doesn't care: he will find him. And he will also rescue Shen Jiu.

"However, this has made me understand my mistakes. I must apologize." Mu Qingfang rubs his eyes angrily as if he wants to erase the tiredness. "This humble one has made a terrible mistake with Shen-shixiong."

Liu Qingge looks at him expectantly and terrified since he has never seen the healer like this before.

"What happened?" Yue Qingyuan asks. It is a miracle that he remains stable even in that situation.

"I have made a misdiagnosis. Shen-shixiong's behavior has become erratic and I assumed it would be a qi deviation caused by his brother's grief. However, Shen-shixiong was the only one who knew that Shen- ershixiong is not dead. "

Yue Qingyuan's expression darkens as if he understands Mu Qingfang’s.

"What does that mean?" Liu Qingge groans as fear twists his guts. "What's wrong with Shen Jiu?"

"First, that I have been stupid and have lost his trust." Mu Qingfang sounds frustrated. "Second, he is not suffering any qi deviation from mourning, but something else that I am unaware of. And I have wasted our precious time insisting on a misdiagnosis. Third, I have my suspicions that Shen-ershixiong's unstable behavior is not caused by Shen-ershixiong's self-destruction, but earlier. However, since they have been pretending to be the same person for years, I hadn't noticed until now."

Liu Qingge instinctively brings his hand to Cheng Luan's hilt. He needs to act or he will explode.

"What should we do, Mu-shidi?" Yue Qingyuan ignores the others, who are arguing about the veracity of the seeds, to look at the healer.

"I leave you Shen-ershixiong's writings. I'm afraid that Luo Binghe's character is even more unstable, although he seems to focus all his efforts on reviving his shizun. Still, I recommend studying the heavenly demons and the sword Xin Mo in case a confrontation is inevitable." He gets up without finishing speaking. "For my part, I am going to study Shen-shixiong's symptoms to understand what is happening to him and treat him."

"I can help!" Liu Qingge exclaims, sitting up as well. "If he needs a qi transfer, I..."

"I appreciate your offer, Liu-shixiong. But I fear that his altered qi is a reflection of his mental state and not the other way around as I had assumed."

Liu Qingge hates feeling so useless.

 

 

Now that Luo Binghe has protected his shizun's body from decomposition, he can take up other matters that he has neglected this past month. Sometimes, Luo Binghe feels like he is overflowing: too much unfinished business, too many unattainable goals, too many enemies to defeat. Under his skin, there is a fatigue that doesn’t disappear when he sleeps.

At least, he's left with the consolation that his cold shizun has chosen to stay with him. Mu Qingfang made no secret of his intentions to take Shen Jiu back to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect or try, at least. Luo Binghe almost panicked, terrified at the prospect of losing another shizun. He is aware of his delicate health and that is why he will gather the best healers in his palace. Or he will retain Mu Qingfang.

Fortunately, he and Mu Qingfang have reached an agreement, and Shen Jiu has chosen to stay by his side. Luo Binghe will guarantee the safety and wishes of his shizun. If he wants calm and solitude, Luo Binghe will protect him until he is better.

(Shizun has chosen him and that is perhaps the best thing that has happened to him in recent years.)

Now, he can organize his schedule between securing the power of the palace and continuing to conquer the Demon Realm. Sha Hualing and Mobei-Jun have been controlling his army while he solved his shizuns’ problem. Unfortunately, everything has gone awry, forcing him to make rash decisions.

Luo Binghe enters his future courtroom. The reform of the palace is slow. He plans to erase the extinct sect's golden past and create a city fit for an emperor. There is already a woman kneeling on the ground when he arrives. His expression turns into a grimace as he recognizes the Little Palace Mistress. The proud lady has turned into a disheveled and tearful thing. She reeks of the dirty waters of the prison and her luxurious clothes are now rags.

"Greetings, miss." Luo Binghe sneers, making her sob. "This Lord apologizes for not being able to attend to you earlier. I hope you were able to enjoy my hospitality."

The woman raises her head. The remaining fragments of pride gleam in her reddened eyes.

"Monster. Demon." She spits in anger and disgust, though fear pales her skin. "What hospitality? You are destroying my home!"

Luo Binghe raises an eyebrow, delighted that she has fallen into his trap.

"Oh, I have given you the same hospitality that you gave to shizun. If you are dissatisfied... Should I hit you too?"

Her breathing quickens. Luo Binghe can smell her panic. The woman presses her bound arms against her body as if she could protect herself. Fortunately for her, he has no intention of wasting any more time. Luo Binghe starts walking around her.

"You are no longer the Little Palace Mistress, what should I call you now?" Luo Binghe looks at her, but she has lowered her head and refuses to speak. "Little Beggar? The Mistress Who Lost Her Palace?"

"Xiao Gongzhu," she finally growls. Her voice is drenched in frustration and shame.

Luo Binghe stops in front of her and kneels to look at her face.

"Stupid Xiao Gongzhu." Although he smiles, his expression is cold and there is hatred in his eyes. The woman shivers. "You and your stupid father have screwed up everything."

That gets her to react.

"What happened to my father? Where is he!?"

"He ran."

"You’re lying!"

"Unfortunately, it is true." Luo Binghe clenches his teeth. "That coward rat abandoned all of you and ran away. But don't worry: I'm looking for him. And you'll know when I find him."

Xiao Gongzhu's eyes widen as he understood his implied threats and sweet promises of torture. She looks even more pitiful, but it's not enough.

She dared to hurt his shizun. Although deep down Luo Binghe should be grateful to her because that trigger prompted him to talk to the Old Palace Master. And so he discovered that the man had no intention of freeing Shen Yuan, but was planning to force a trial and take away his power. The fool said to Luo Binghe with a smile: "I will destroy that evil man."

That was when Luo Binghe decided to gather his army and conquer Huan Hua Palace by force. But then, the second shizun appeared. Luo Binghe didn’t prevent Shen Jiu from taking Shen Yuan because thanks to his blood, his kind shizun would remain attached to him, and the two of them would be safe away from the man’s intrigues.

But the Old Palace Master announced that he would condemn both of them. He gathered all the elders and Luo Binghe in a secret meeting. At first, he seemed ridiculously angry and humiliated. Luo Binghe secretly laughed until the sect leader said that they would both lock up. When Shen Yuan escaped from the prison, he had broken his word and the Cang Qiong Sect had betrayed their trust. If the sect didn’t hand over the traitors, Huan Hua Palace would take action.

It was just as Shen Jiu warned him as a boy: humans can be worse than demons.

Then, Luo Binghe decided to appropriate the Huan Hua Palace and erase that impure sect forever.

He just wanted to protect one shizun and get answers from the other.

Luo Binghe stands up to look at Xiao Gongzhu from above. She looks as miserable as a worm.

"You no longer have power or allies. You have lost everything." Although she tries to hold her ground, her body trembles on the verge of crying. "Your life doesn't even matter. I would use you to attract your father, but he has abandoned you too. That's how useless you are." Luo Binghe appreciates with satisfaction that her cruel words are widening all the cracks created after a month in isolation in the Water Prison. Still, he smiles sweetly. "My grudge is against your father, not with you. You have already paid for your crimes and I don’t plan to hurt you further. I’m going to change the world, Xiao Gongzhu."

"You're going to destroy it," she sobs.

"Some things must be destroyed to build new ones. What do you think I am?"

"A demon."

"You're wrong: a half-demon. I want to achieve peace between humans and demons."

She looks at him in surprise and disbelief. He doesn’t care: he doesn’t seek her approval, but to discover if she is a useful tool or a burden to get rid of.

"I'm going to give you a chance to prove your usefulness to me. Just one. If you succeed, you will earn yourself a place in my new world. If you fail, you will prove to me that you are as useless as you seem. I don't recommend you betraying me," he adds maliciously. "The only sect that has almost my power right now will never listen to you. Furthermore, Cang Qiong Sect is doomed to disappear. I hope you choose better this time."

Luo Binghe has selected all of her words carefully to tempt her, but also to control her thoughts.

"What do you want me to do?" Xiao Gongzhu mutters without hiding her mistrust.

"Find Qiu Haitang."

That mysterious woman disappeared when Shen Jiu rescued her brother. No one else has seen her again, but Luo Binghe suspects that she may help him understand Shen Jiu. His shizun's nightmares are chaotic and blurry. Strangely, one of his shizuns suffers while the other's dreams are calmer. Luo Binghe intuits that they hide dark secrets that brings a new meaning to Qiu Haitang's words.

That would also explain why Shen Jiu warned him that humans were worse than demons.

Luo Binghe will ask him directly, but he is aware that the pain has left him in a dangerously vulnerable state. When he is better (and Shen Yuan has returned), together they will create a better world. Meanwhile, Luo Binghe will ensure his power.

He needs his shizuns’ support before he conquers the Human Realm.

Xiao Gongzhu accepts their deal and Luo Binghe orders some demonic servants to take her to a room so that she can shower and change her clothes. He acts nice, willing to teach her that he is both a powerful and caring ally. Despite his demonic heritage, he is not cruel. She was unfair and he punished her. But if she is useful, he will reward her.

Her father is the evil one. Her father wanted to abuse his power. Her father abandoned her.

Those are the ideas that Luo Binghe wants to put into her head.

Luo Binghe stiffens as he notices that one of the protective seals surrounding the palace has been broken. He frowns. Someone stupid enough has decided to attack him.

Xin Mo purrs into his sheath as Luo Binghe leaves the room to go after the intruder.

He is not surprised to discover Liu Qingge attempting to penetrate the palace's defenses. Hatred burns in his stomach when the two of them look into each other's eyes.

"I told you to not come back," Luo Binghe reminds him in a calm voice but on the verge of breaking.

"I’ve come for Shen Jiu." Liu Qingge already has his sword drawn and points the blade at him. "Let me see him."

"Never."

In an instant, he also unsheathes Xin Mo.

The two of them challenge each other in silence, without moving, just keeping an eye on their adversary.

Liu Qingge is the first to attack.

He moves swiftly, but Luo Binghe stops his assault without difficulty. Xin Mo vibrates in his hands ecstatically. It's been a long time since the last massacre and his sword hunger is contagious. Luo Binghe longs to tear that cultivator apart until he begs for his forgiveness. Jealousy moves his arms when he attacks him. He always dreamed of being like Liu Qingge, just as beautiful and perfect, being the person that Shizun would always trust.

He hates him. He hated him very much.

Liu Qingge is the reason why he lost control and shizun died.

Both engage in furious and violent combat with which they destroy their surroundings. Trees burst into splinters and qi burns devour the grass. Luo Binghe feels alive after a month accompanying a corpse. But he is also afraid.

Last time, Liu Qingge almost took Shen Jiu away.

He wouldn't bother you anymore if you killed him , the sword whispers to him. Tear off his arms and legs. Tear his guts out, crush his head. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him.

Xin Mo's voice has grown louder in recent years. Their ideas sink into his blood until they burn. Xin Mo takes his worst wishes and twists them to make them more tempting.

While Liu Qingge's attacks are precise and coordinated, Luo Binghe's become more savage and violent, so brutal that the cultivator must grasp his sword with both hands or he will disarm him.

Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him.

The seal on his forehead glows as his demonic qi surges in waves that strike his enemy. Last time he managed to defeat him like this, but today Liu Qingge grits his teeth and continues to insist, as stubborn as he is.

Although he is a better swordsman, Luo Binghe finds with satisfaction that he is more powerful. And his perfect technique is unable to overcome his pure and uncontrolled power. Luo Binghe smiles, showing his fangs, as Liu Qingge starts to back away. His rival has clenched teeth and is sweaty. The qi has ripped his sleeves and strands of hair fall down his face. Luo Binghe uses a feint to trick him. Liu Qingge prepares to counter an attack, but he moves faster and manages to kick him in the stomach. With a grunt, the cultivator almost lost his balance, but swallows the pain and doesn’t fall.

The fight gets dirtier. Luo Binghe manages to land a punch in his face and takes advantage of his opening to sink Xin Mo into his flesh.

Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him.

The temptation is immense, but Luo Binghe pulls the sword away and pounces on him like an animal. Despite the desire that beats in his sharp nails, in the teeth that he wishes to sink into his throat until it tears, Luo Binghe controls his most beastly side. For shizun. Neither Shen Yuan nor Shen Jiu will forgive him if he kills that stupid meddler.

Liu Qingge has also lost his weapon. He is a bloody mess when Luo Binghe pins him to the ground with one hand at his throat, almost choking him and the other twisting his arm.

"I told you to not come back," he growls, almost roaring.

Despite his defeat, the cultivator looks at him defiantly. He may be hurt, his pristine appearance has disappeared under wounds, blood, and dirt, but in his eyes, the arrogance of believing unbeatable still shines.

"You can't stop me, demon."

"Of course I can. I'm doing it right now."

Liu Qingge tries to move, but Luo Binghe's weight has him pinned down. He manages to drag his free arm to grab Luo Binghe's wrist and dig his nails into it.

"I know what you want," he growls with difficulty. "I won’t allow you to touch Shen Jiu."

Luo Binghe tilts his face towards his defeated enemy.

"I'll make him want it," he promises with a smirk. "Why are you worried about shizun? I will never hurt him. And I am true to my word." His smile becomes more twisted and cruel. "You should worry about yourself. I told you I'd rip your arm off if you come back."

There is a flash of panic in Liu Qingge's eyes as he stretches out his right arm and begins to twist it. He doesn't scream, maybe neither can he with his other hand holding his throat.

And Luo Binghe twists the limb, savoring the noise of his bones and ligaments breaking. He twists and turns until...

Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him. Kill him.

It would be so delicious to mutilate the War God forever. However, Luo Binghe lets go of Liu Qingge before ripping off his limb. His arm falls, limp, and twisted at an impossible angle. Liu Qingge's breathing sounds raged and he has his eyes closed, perhaps on the verge of blacking out. When Luo Binghe takes his hand away, he appreciates that he has a collection of bruises on his neck.

It’s not enough, Xin Mo keeps screaming, but Luo Binghe calms down and gets up. After retrieving the sword from the ground, he slices through a portal in midair and then picks up Liu Qingge's body without delicacy.

On the other side is Qiong Ding Peak.

Several disciples shout when they see them. Most run away, probably to warn their shizun about him, while the older ones watch him suspiciously. As Luo Binghe had guessed, Yue Qingyuan arrives right away.

The sect leader carries Xuan Su in his hand, though still sheathed. His posture is tense, but unlike others, he knows how to control his emotions.

Luo Binghe throws Liu Qingge's bloody body to the ground, right in front of him. Yue Qingyuan crouches down to examine his shidi's vital signs.

"What does this mean, Luo Binghe?"

"Next time, he won't be so lucky," he warns him. "Next time, I'll assume Cang Qiong Sect is challenging me."

Since the incident a month ago, Yue Qingyuan has spoken with Luo Binghe to demand the release of Mu Qingfang and Shen Jiu. Luo Binghe knows that he doesn't want a confrontation, but he will attack if he has no choice. Despite the big talk he has with Xiao Gongzhu, his power is still unstable and it is not convenient for him to face Cang Qiong Mountain Sect so soon. That is one of the reasons why he withdrew his fake monster army when Shen Yuan died (the other reason, because Shen Jiu asked him to).

But Yue Qingyuan has a terrible weakness: he cares too much about his martial siblings and that makes him a coward. He agreed to not intervene with the promise that Mu Qingfang will take care of Shen Jiu and will also not do anything if he threatens to destroy everyone.

Yue Qingyuan has worried wrinkles as he examines Liu Qingge's injuries.

"I hope we can keep the peace, sect leader Yue."

Luo Binghe doesn't say anything else: his message is clear.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: Character status according to the sleeping System
Luo Binghe keeps improving his manipulation arts!
Luo Binghe: +500 black points.
Luo Binghe: -200 points to understand what Shen Jiu really needs.
Mu Qingfang has finally discovered mental illness.
Mu Qingfang will soon evolve from Sect Healer to Therapist.
Liu Qingge has been too impulsive!
Liu Qingge: -900 health points.
Shen Jiu has unlocked the second stage of grief: anger.
Shen Jiu: +100 depression points.

I was surprised by a wonderful fanart. Thank you, moose!

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

But Shen Yuan doesn’t come back

Chapter Notes

Another f*cking LONG CHAPTER. I ALMOST DIE WRITING THIS -A- This chapter has been thanks to my sister, great beta and better psychologist, who has advised me. Yes! It's time for therapy! After the hurt, it is the moment of comfort!

Therapy is important.

(Me: I will never write such a long chapter. Never again.
My sister: *laughs*)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Mu Qingfang returns a month later.

To Shen Jiu's surprise, he still looks exhausted and stressed. He deserves it, he thinks bitterly. Although he is still upset, angry, and disappointed, Shen Jiu is also very tired. And that's why he doesn't growl when he sees his martial brother around the palace gardens.

"Shen-shixiong," Mu Qingfang greets him.

He wants to ignore him just as Mu Qingfang ignored his words, but his presence is a novelty in the monotony of a routine of waiting, trying to read, trying to sleep, trying to not lose hope. It also relieves him of the pressure of feeling that the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect had forgotten about him.

There are very few reasons why Mu Qingfang would return. The most important: he has found Shen Yuan's writings. Shen Jiu pulls a silent talisman from his sleeve and creates a safe space for both of them. Afterward, he indicates that he can sit next to him.

Mu Qingfang takes some letters and packages from his qiankun pouch and hands them to Shen Jiu.

"Your disciples have written to you," he explains.

Shen Jiu picks it up curiously but puts it on his knees instead of opening the letters. He'll do it later, when he's alone.

"I’m not lying," Shen Jiu growls as Mu Qingfang doesn’t say anything.

His shidi closes his eyes before lowering his head.

"This humble one made a mistake and would like to apologize to Shen-shixiong."

Shen Jiu is used to having his words and actions misinterpreted. He already accepts it with resignation, rejecting all apologies for not believing they are sincere. Mu Qingfang's makes him squint his eyes suspiciously.

"I hope, Mu-shidi, that the sect is acting now that the truth is known."

"We are trying," he sighs. "Your brother didn’t write the location of his body as a precaution. And we have other problems."

Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow, encouraging him to explain. What's more important than finding Shen Yuan? Isn't Shen Yuan the one who everyone loves?

"We are also studying all the information we have about heavenly demons. We have... different opinions about Luo Binghe’s problem." Mu Qingfang speaks slowly, almost afraid of saying the wrong words. "I was with him for a month. He is powerful but unstable and Shen-ershixiong's death has affected him. Shen-shixiong, why haven't you told him the truth?"

Shen Jiu tenses, uncomfortable.

"Because he is obsessed with Shen Yuan."

"He still thinks he's dead and that is affecting his mind."

"He was already dangerous before Shen Yuan self-destructed," Shen Jiu clenches his fists.

"Even as a disciple?"

"What are you talking about?"

"Was Luo Binghe dangerous when he was your disciple?"

"No." Shen Jiu frowns. "I don't know anymore. Maybe he was, but he's a lying demon who tricked us."

"I remember him. He was a very diligent disciple who always tried to show his best."

"People change."

"After these months, I wonder if the boy who studied in my garden has turned into a demon or is it the fault of that sword." Mu Qingfang looks into Shen Jiu's eyes. "Demonic swords are dangerous and I fear that the one he uses is especially harmful. We have found that Luo Binghe is prone to qi deviations, but what worries me is that that sword will control his actions. We should tell him the truth about Shen-ershixiong."

"No." He purses his lips until they turn white.

"The trauma of his death is affecting him, Luo Binghe also has the power to help us bring Shen-ershixiong back..." Mu Qingfang takes a deep breath and pauses. "And his attempts to resurrect Shen-ershixiong are harming him. His condition is delicate and yet he is wasting his energy daily."

Shen Jiu clenches his fists even more, digging his nails into his flesh.

"He's dangerous," he repeats. "I will keep him away from my brother."

"But you two intended to reforge his other sword."

"You can do it. I didn't get a chance to ask Wei Qingwei, but now you can work on it if you're so worried about Luo Binghe," he mutters spitefully.

"If you consider Luo Binghe to be obsessive, dangerous, and without redemption, why are you staying here instead of returning to the sect?"

 

 

Mu Qingfang's visit left him with a headache. Shen Jiu no longer knows if he planned to convince him to come back, to do something with Luo Binghe, or to inform him of all the unsolvable problems they have. Sometimes Shen Jiu feels like he is drowning among so many dark thoughts.

The sword. Luo Binghe. Shen Yuan. Qi deviation. Dream Demon. Liu Qingge. Shen Yuan doesn’t come back. Why hasn't he come back yet?

Shen Jiu opens his eyes. He is lying on his bed. The afternoon slides to the other side of the window and he still has all the unopened letters. But he lacks the courage to read what has been written to him. I'll do it later , he thinks as he sighs.

Mu Qingfang's words have left him shaken. They spoke during a shichen, but it feels like forever. The most confusing thing about their conversation was that the healer only asked him questions.

Questions that still haunt him, echoing inside his head. Some questions, the most dangerous, Shen Jiu tried to ignore despite the gaze of his martial brother.

He sits up after hearing a noise on the other side of the door. Despite his exhaustion, he decides to leave his room. It's all those questions' fault, churning inside his stomach and prompting him to investigate what's going on with Luo Binghe now.

Shen Jiu finds Luo Binghe sweaty and bloody outside. He wears black armor and the symbol on his forehead glows like his eyes. They both look at each other. Luo Binghe is surrounded by servants and one of his generals, the ice demon. They reek of war and slaughter, and Shen Jiu wonders if it was to quench the sword or because of those intentions that he doesn't understand.

Damn Mu Qingfang and damn questions , he thinks, annoyed. Shen Jiu shakes his head to chase away those thoughts before crossing his arms, judging his former disciple.

"Shizun," he greets him, bowing his head respectfully. However, Luo Binghe is tense, perhaps uncomfortable with his presence, perhaps not expecting him to take an interest in his affairs.

"Humans or demons?"

"Demon rebellious."

Although Shen Jiu remains nonchalant, something inside him calms down. Luo Binghe hasn’t shown the intention to attack human cities. For now.

Shen Jiu is not naive, but rather suspicious.

"Leave," he orders everyone with a flick of his sleeve.

The servants disappear without hesitation, only the ice demon ignores him until Luo Binghe dispatches him with a nod. The Demon Lord watches expectantly at Shen Jiu, who approaches him still with all those questions stuck inside.

"You look awful," he clicks his tongue.

"Is shizun worried about this humble disciple?" He has the nerve to smile at him.

Luo Binghe doesn't seem hurt, but Shen Jiu can sense that he's not well. His demonic qi is uneven and outstrips the other. There is no balance between his two natures. Shen Jiu already knew it, he has known since the day Shen Yuan sacrificed himself to calm Luo Binghe's chaos, but he has wanted to ignore it. Because recognizing that Luo Binghe's inner demons continue to devour his heart is to accept that Shen Yuan's sacrifice was useless.

And Mu Qingfang's voice sounds like an echo.

"Follow me," he growls, turning his back on him.

They walk up to Luo Binghe's quarters. It is Shen Jiu's first time entering and although he feels uncomfortable stepping on the demon's rooms, he has no intention of having Luo Binghe dirty his.

Shen Jiu forces his disciple to sit down and then orders some servants to prepare a bath. Luo Binghe is still irritatingly perfect since he is just tired and without any injuries. Even so, Shen Jiu is unable to keep ignoring those other invisible wounds that derail his qi and perhaps his thoughts.

And he doesn't want to tell him the truth. He can’t do it. He will protect Shen Yuan from Luo Binghe's obsession, but he no longer feels comfortable allowing the demon to continue wounding himself. Leaving would be very easy, abandoning him too (he already did it once), but this time Shen Jiu sits next to Luo Binghe and takes his wrist to pass him spiritual energy.

Neither says anything.

Shen Jiu's energy is affected and soon he feels the demonic qi trying to devour his veins. With a weary sigh, he releases Luo Binghe, ignoring his expression (and his hungry smile, the adoration in his eyes).

"Thanks, shizun."

"If you are grateful," Shen Jiu sits up, brushing off his clothes to make sure they haven't gotten stained. "Stop bothering this master and take care of your health."

 

 

Three months after Shen Yuan's self-destruction, Mu Qingfang returns. They meet again in the garden. This time, Luo Binghe has prepared tea and pastries, but the Demon Lord has left them alone. Even so, Shen Jiu places another silent talisman to prevent anyone from hearing them.

"Your disciples send you regards," Mu Qingfang begins, giving him new letters.

He picks them up with a heavy heart since he hasn’t opened the previous ones yet. He never found the strength and the weeks passed too fast. This time he will do it soon.

"How are you feeling, Shen-shixiong?"

Shen Jiu shrugs.

"Normal."

"Normal is not necessarily good," observes the healer. "You look tired."

Because there are nights when he still doesn't sleep. Because he spends every day waiting when he doesn't have the energy to do anything. Because...

"I’m clearing Luo Binghe's meridians with my spiritual energy," he replies instead.

Mu Qingfang looks at him with concern.

"Shen-shixiong, your health is also delicate and you always had a predisposition for qi deviations. It is not safe."

"You said I should do something with Luo Binghe, right? That's what I'm doing."

He is so stubborn that Mu Qingfang sighs.

"Wouldn't it be easier to tell him the truth about Shen-ershixiong?"

"No." Shen Jiu takes a deep breath. "I will control Luo Binghe."

Because Shen Yuan will return one day and he will be there to protect him. And next time, Luo Binghe will not suffer any qi deviation that forces anyone to self-destruct.

Shen Jiu looks at the mountain of letters. He wants to ask Mu Qingfang about Yue Qingyuan, Liu Qingge, and the others, but in the end, he decides to remain quiet. Liu Qingge hasn’t returned since he learned that Shen Yuan is alive. And although Shen Jiu doesn’t want to be jealous of his most important person, he inevitably feels expendable and forgettable again.

"Shen-shixiong, have you thought about what I told you about going back to the sect?"

"No. Someone must keep an eye on Luo Binghe."

 

 

Mu Qingfang returns four months after Shen Yuan's self-destruction with more letters that Shen Jiu is still unable to open. He doesn’t even know who has written to him, because he is afraid of discovering in all those who have not.

"How are you feeling, Shen-shixiong?"

Uneasy. Worried. Tired. Disorientated.

"Normal."

"Your disciples always ask me if Shen-shixiong has written back to them. Have you thought about doing that?"

Shen Jiu shrugs.

"Maybe you could do it," Mu Qingfang suggests. "What do you usually do in the palace?"

He frowns, not acknowledging that his days are empty, and yet they fade very quickly. Before he was always burdened with reports and works, investigations, and his disciples’ studies. Suddenly fear embraces Shen Jiu underneath his skin. He no longer remembers when he lost his motivation.

"Shen-shixiong?"

Mu Qingfang looks at him patiently, waiting for an answer that gets stuck in his throat.

"I'll write to them," he replies, fleeing the truth. "Do you have news?"

"We still don't know where Shen-ershixiong is buried. We have found a list of places that he would have liked to visit. Or perhaps he has visited. We are investigating them." Mu Qingfang tries to smile to calm Shen Jiu's uneasiness. "Wei Qingwei has reforged Zheng Yang."

"Nice."

The healer has his hands on the table and his fingers interlock nervously.

"You know? Liu-shidi..."

"I don't want to talk about him."

Liu Qingge will likely be in charge of traveling to all those amazing places to search for Shen Yuan. It's okay. Shen Jiu trusts Liu Qingge. And even though it hurts, Liu Qingge is a better suitor than Luo Binghe.

He just has to forget about him and those stupid feelings that scratch his battered heart.

"Shen-shixiong, have you thought about going back to the sect?"

"I already told you that I have to watch over Luo Binghe."

"What about one day? If Shen-shixiong prefers to stay here, we won't stop you. But you can come to visit us someday."

"I will think about it."

 

 

Five months after Shen Yuan's self-destruction, when Mu Qingfang hands him more letters, Shen Jiu freezes. The healer looks at him expectantly until he sighs.

"Shen-shixiong didn't write back, am I right?"

He has forgotten. As he always forgets to read the letters. They are a monster that grows in his room and that he never dares to confront.

"I've been busy."

"You haven't come to visit us either," Mu Qingfang points out.

Shen Jiu grits his teeth after feeling judged. As always. It's an old feeling that he never gets used to. He notices all of Mu Qingfang's accusations (the ones he says and the ones he doesn't) on his skin.

"Why do you insist so much?" He groans, unable to control himself. Maybe it's the shame of letting the days go by without ever daring to make that decision. "You always ask me the same thing. Why?"

"I want to understand why Shen-shixiong doesn't want to go back to his family."

"Because you are not my family!"

He instantly regrets what he has said. Shen Jiu grabs a cup of tea as an excuse to remain silent.

"Maybe Shen-shixiong doesn't want to go back because he's afraid that his house is empty?" Mu Qingfang's voice is soft and kind. "I know you miss him."

Shen Jiu doesn't understand why he suddenly wants to cry.

"Yes. Don't insist again."

"If you go back to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect you don't have to go back to Qing Jing Peak..."

"Don't insist," he growls at him.

All of Mu Qingfang's visits always leave him shaking. As if with patience and questions, he was trying to cross all of his shields.

 

 

Shen Jiu is hysterical when Mu Qingfang returns six months after Shen Yuan's self-destruction. Six months. Half-year. And he hasn’t come back. Shen Yuan hasn’t come back.

"Shen-shixiong?" Mu Qingfang watches him tense, sensing his stress. "What's wrong?"

Shen Jiu feels the urge to break something, to get up and scream, to cover his face with his hands, to bite his nails, to move until exhaustion is ripped from his body.

But he remains immobile.

"Shen Yuan hasn't returned yet," he mutters.

"He will," the healer tries to comfort him.

But he's lying, right? He sure is lying. And Shen Jiu understands. Maybe everyone knows that Shen Yuan will not come back and they are deceiving him.

He lets out a dry, bitter laugh.

"He won’t. Why have I been such an idiot?"

"Shen-shixiong?"

"Half a year, Mu-shidi! He should have returned by now!" Shen Jiu's throat and eyes itch. His voice has been broken into pieces, into sharp words. "You knew it right?"

"Know what?"

"That Shen Yuan is gone! Of course, he is gone! Why should he return? His soul must have reached his new body as soon as he self-destructed. Maybe he even looks different! Shen Yuan is finally free and he's gone far away from everyone... "

He has abandoned me. That's what he doesn't dare to say out loud. He left without me.

"Shen-shixiong!" It is the first time that Mu Qingfang has raised his voice since those visits began. "What are you saying? Shen Yuan would never abandon you..."

"He has."

The healer takes a deep breath before looking at him decisively.

"There are no records on Sun and Moon Dew Flower seeds. We don’t know how it works exactly nor do we have previous cases to predict what will happen. We cannot rule out the possibility that the process has failed, that it has been left incomplete, or even that Luo Binghe's enchantments to summon his soul are interfering. The possibility that he died is more likely that he abandoned you. Why was that your first thought? "

"It's not that implausible."

"Liu-shidi told me that Shen Yuan's last words were for you. He said that you would see each other soon, do you really think Shen Yuan would abandon you?"

Shen Jiu doesn't hesitate when he looks into his eyes and nods.

"That will never happen, Shen-shixiong." Although Mu Qingfang tries to speak in a calm voice, to Shen Jiu it sounds mocking. "He loves you, he is your brother. He will never abandon you..."

Every word accumulates inside his chest. Shen Jiu closes his eyes, but he can't escape Mu Qingfang's stupid naivety.

"But it already happened."

The healer blinks in surprise. Shen Jiu quickly rubs his eyes to erase all those treacherous tears.

"How?"

"Forget it."

"Shen-shixiong..." Mu Qingfang hesitates. "Something happened in the past with Shen-ershixiong?"

Unable to answer, Shen Jiu shakes his head. Mu Qingfang looks relieved. He reaches out a hand to find his for a comforting touch.

"I can assume it was a bad experience, but Shen-ershixiong is different. He is your brother and..."

"That doesn’t mean anything."

"He is very close to you."

Shen Jiu has started biting his lips. He notices the taste of blood inside his mouth.

"That doesn't mean anything," he repeats. "Qi-Ge did it."

"Gi-Ge?"

"My... older brother."

There is something inside him that has been broken into pieces. Shen Jiu closes his eyes with the hope that Mu Qingfang and his curiosity will disappear, that they will leave him alone, surrounded by silence.

But when he opens his eyes, the healer is still in front of him. He doesn't say anything, just waits patiently for him to continue speaking. Shen Jiu tries to repair all the shields, all the walls that he built years ago to protect himself. But all of his protections are cracked.

"It's not important," Shen Jiu says in a brittle voice. "It happened a long time ago. It doesn't matter anymore."

"It matters," Mu Qingfang corrects him. "Because it still affects you."

And those words make Shen Jiu aware of a wound that has been with him since he was little. It is an immense wound, which has grown with him, bloody and putrid.

"Do you want to talk about Qi-Ge?"

"No."

"It's okay." To his surprise, Mu Qingfang doesn't insist and Shen Jiu relaxes a bit. "Although I don't know him, I dare to say that Shen-ershixiong is different than Qi-Ge. He chose to self-destruct to protect you and he promised that he would return."

"Qi-Ge also left to protect me and promised that he would return," he growls bitterly, his teeth clenched.

"Maybe Qi-Ge..."

"Let's not talk about Qi-Ge! I found him. He was happy and rich and powerful. He had forgotten about me."

Shen Jiu looks away. It's getting harder to control his tears and his voice.

"Okay, we won't talk about Qi-Ge, but about Shen-ershixiong. Why do you think he would abandon you?"

"Because I forced him to be Shen Qingqiu." On this occasion, the response is immediate. "He always told me that he hated it. I kept him locked in the bamboo house so that no one would discover us. I always threatened him, I punished him with copying the rules and writing a manual more than three hundred times. I was never nice to him. Why should Shen Yuan return with me?"

"So the problem is not that you don't trust Shen Yuan, but that you don't trust yourself."

Shen Jiu opens his mouth, speechless.

"Of course," he acknowledges dejectedly. "I'm a problem."

"No, Shen-shixiong, you have a problem. It is different."

"I don’t see the difference."

"Being a problem means that everything it’s your fault and there is nothing you can do to change it. However, having a problem means that there are things you cannot control. And we can help you."

 

 

Seven months after Shen Yuan's self-destruction, Mu Qingfang brings not only letters but also a pile of scrolls.

"I have thought that I can give you the latest works of your disciples," he explains. "I know you're not doing anything. I don't want to pressure you, but I think it would be good if you are distracted. Maybe correcting them is easier than writing a letter."

Shen Jiu nods before taking the exercises. Although he hates being told what to do, deep down inside he recognizes that Mu Qingfang is right. At least that will allow him to distract himself and forget all those dark thoughts that do not leave him alone.

"If Shen-shixiong doesn't mind, your disciples would like to come to visit you. They could come once a week. Do you think that is enough time for you to correct their work and send them new exercises?"

"Why are you bothering?" Shen Jiu looks at the healer suspiciously.

"Even though you are no longer in Cang Qiong Mountain Sect, you are still our Qing Jing Peak Lord. We haven’t forgotten."

Lately, Mu Qingfang's words manage to break through all of his protections. Sometimes they point out injuries that Shen Jiu was trying to ignore. Other times, they comfort him. Shen Jiu takes a deep breath, remembering the time when he yelled at him and Luo Binghe that he was still Shen Qingqiu.

Shen Jiu fiddles with the tray of tea and sweets that Luo Binghe prepares every month. Mu Qingfang always waits for him to speak and only adds something when the silence is too thick.

"There is something I don’t understand, Shen-shixiong. You are not locked up or unarmed, but you have never shown interest in returning to us. Why?"

Shen Jiu shrugs.

"We always talk about the same thing," he says while selecting an osmanthus cake. "Why?"

"You cannot always dodge all questions with other questions, Shen-shixiong." Mu Qingfang sighs. "Some of your martial siblings are worried that Luo Binghe will retain you with hypnosis or demonic tricks."

Shen Jiu almost rolls his eyes. He knows that nobody cares about him.

"And what do you think?" He looks at the healer. "If you considered Luo Binghe a threat to me, you would have tried to separate us, right? Unless you prefer to sacrifice me to end a worse enemy."

Mu Qingfang pinches the bridge of his nose.

"We also have to talk about your mistrust of everyone. It is unhealthy, Shen-shixiong."

"It's a defense mechanism."

"Now what are you trying to protect yourself from?"

Mu Qingfang has become more accurate with his questions. Despite the distance, the healer doesn’t need to move to catch his soul. Shen Jiu picks up another cake, ignoring him.

"Maybe you are scared?"

"Of course not!" He nearly smashes the cake, offended. "I’m not a vulnerable child, Mu-shidi."

"We are all vulnerable, Shen-shixiong. And I suspect that you use your mistrust because you fear that you will be betrayed. That you will be abandoned again as with Qi-Ge."

Shen Jiu grits his teeth.

"We won't talk about Qi-Ge."

"Then answer me and finally be honest: why do you avoid going back to the sect?"

There are so many reasons that Shen Jiu goes blank. He must choose carefully or Mu Qingfang will continue to crumble his soul.

"There is no difference between waiting here or waiting at Cang Qiong Mountain Sect."

"Right now, I could make you a list of differences." Mu Qingfang is more serious than usual and that makes Shen Jiu uneasy. "First, there is the house you have been living in all these years."

"A house is just a house. I have a similar room here."

"Second, you can move freely."

"I can also move freely."

"You haven't left the palace in seven months and we always meet in the same place."

"Just because I can go where I want doesn't mean I want to."

Shen Jiu plays with his cup of tea while Mu Qingfanf sighs.

"You know what I suspect, Shen-shixiong? That Luo Binghe doesn't need to lock you up because you've already done it yourself. You're isolated and you know it, but you don't care. There are two reasons why I think you're afraid to go back to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect."

"I already told you: I'm not scared."

"First, you have never considered Qing Jing Peak your home. Second, deep down you are grateful that Luo Binghe allows you to isolate yourself." Shen Jiu slams the table with his cup, but Mu Qingfang stops him with his gaze. "Look into your heart, Shen-shixiong, and then tell me I'm wrong."

He can’t do it. The impulse is in his throat, but no air is coming from his lungs. Shen Jiu feels like he's drowning. There is a knot in his chest so big it crushes his ribs and heart.

"We'll go slowly, is that okay, Shen-shixiong?"

He nods weakly, not entirely aware of why he's doing it.

"Do you consider Qing Jing Peak your home?"

"No."

"Do you consider Cang Qiong Mountain Sect your home?"

"No."

"A few sessions ago, you told me that you didn't consider us your family, is that true?"

Shen Jiu wonders how those visits have turned into sessions .

“Yes.”

Answering with monosyllables is easy. And those questions are less annoying than others. At least they don't make him feel broken or flawed, cruel and heartless for not responding to letters or hiding the truth from Luo Binghe.

"Why?"

Shen Jiu takes a deep breath.

"I prefer yes or no questions."

"But those answers don’t allow me to help you, Shen-shixiong."

"Why do you always say that you want to help me or that you care about me? It's a lie."

Mu Qingfang sighs wearily.

"It isn't, Shen-shixiong. You worry us." He raises his hand, asking for his silence when Shen Jiu opens his mouth. "You are our martial brother. We are all concerned about your health. That is why I am here. You always get angry when I tell you, so could you explain it to me? I want to show you that all those doubts are inside your head."

"Because you've never cared about me, but for Shen Yuan." That is a truth that he has hidden with resentment in the bottom of his heart, without understanding that it only hurt him. But this time he decides to tell it to Mu Qingfang. Because after seven months, he knows that he will listen to him. "You all hated me until Shen Yuan arrived. Shen Yuan is the Shen Qingqiu you all want, not me."

"I admit that we haven't had time to get used to the fact that you are two and not one," he acknowledges. "That's why we need you to let us meet you..."

"You already knew me! I was alone when we were disciples. And you hated me. Everyone. You never tried to listen to me. Never."

His breathing is ragged. Releasing all that grudge is liberating, but it also leaves him physically exhausted.

"Please, Shen-shixiong, go on."

"Never mind."

"If it affects you, it is important. What happened?"

Shen Jiu closes his eyes to try to protect himself.

"I never used prostitutes for carnal pleasure. I would never buy a woman's body. But you spread those rumors and even Qi Qingqi vetoed me from her peak. I never tried to kill Liu Qingge. A ghost attacked him from behind and I protected that ungrateful brute. But it doesn't matter. I’m the lustful and traitorous Shen Qingqiu. My cultivation is weak because I am lazy, not because I was crippled. Are you satisfied, Mu-shidi?"

Mu Qingfang's expression has darkened. It is difficult for him to maintain his serene attitude as a doctor. Shen Jiu lowers his gaze. Now he feels too exposed. Vulnerable. Fragile.

"Shen-shixiong, you shouldn't feel embarrassed about any of this. It wasn't your fault, but... ours. Do you want us to continue talking about this?"

"No." He takes a deep breath. "Not today."

"Do you prefer to rest?"

"Please."

"Shen-shixiong, I haven't told anyone anything we talked about. And I won't. But would you want me to inform the rest of your martial siblings about their mistakes?"

Shen Jiu shrugs.

"Does it matter?"

"Of course. If it affects you, it matters. You are important, never forget it."

 

 

After eight months of waiting, Shen Jiu is finally relieved when Mu Qingfang arrives. And guilt, when he gives him more letters.

"Can you ask them to stop sending me correspondence?" Shen Jiu acknowledges with a sigh. "I started to read the first ones. But having more overwhelms me. I feel like I'll never finish."

"It's okay. I have also noticed that you have only sent musical exercises to the disciples who have visited you."

Because they are the only duties that he cannot correct at the moment, but when they return.

"It's okay, Shen-shixiong. You've started to move and that's good."

"It's frustrating," he growls. "I want to do more, but I always end up very tired or sleepy. I leave it all for tomorrow, but the next day I don't get it either."

"As I said, Shen-shixiong, it's fine. Try to do little every day until you get back on track. I've been researching what you suffer from."

Shen Jiu looks at him curiously.

"Poison? Drugs? Is it Luo Binghe's thing?"

"What have we talked about your excessive mistrust?"

"I have my reasons!"
