"Not everything is deceit or betrayal, Shen-shixiong. And I think your suspicion is yet another symptom."

"About what."

"An invisible disease that affects your head."

Shen Jiu stiffens defensively.

"I'm not crazy."

"You are not. You have wounds, some are still open, others are scars that have marked you. But they just cannot be seen. They are part of you that condition you. They are your problem."

"That's called trauma. And I'm fine."

"If that was true, why didn't you plant your Sun and Moon Dew Flower seed?"

Shen Jiu frowns, not understanding what Mu Qingfang is referring to.

"Because I am consistent in my actions. Those seeds were our resource in the case facing Luo Binghe ended badly."

"In case you died. However, you decided to not plant them. You decided to die, Shen-shixiong. And I suspect it was because you believed that no one would miss you. Do you already understand what kind of disease you have?"

Shen Jiu raised his head, proud.

"I'm fine."

 

 

Nine months have passed since Shen Yuan's self-destruction and Shen Jiu finally can understand that he is not fine, that his tiredness is not normal, nor his lack of concentration. And even though he's trying, he can't recover. The only thing that relieves him is talking to Mu Qingfang and ripping off weights that he wasn’t aware of.

"I will never tell anyone what we talked about."

"I know."

"Was what Qui Haitang told about your past as a slave and Wu Yanzi true?"

Shen Jiu takes a deep breath.

"Yes."

"Shen-shixiong, what do you think I'll do with that information?"

He frowns, confused, and looks at the healer.

"Others might call you a criminal, Shen-shixiong. Have you thought that I could betray you?"

"No."

Mu Qingfang smiles.

"That's good. See? You can trust other people. I will keep your secret just like I have kept the others. I will never use them against you, but to help you. I can understand that you have met horrible people and need to protect yourself, but you also need to find people you trust."

Lately, Mu Qingfang poisons him with a warm and pleasant hope, which Shen Jiu no longer rejects.

"Shen-shixiong, when Qiu Haitang accused you, Cang Qiong Mountain Sect came out to defend you. And we still didn't know the truth about Shen Yuan. We defended our martial brother. We did it once and we will do it again."

 

 

Ten months after Shen Yuan's self-destruction and the same question.

"Shen-shixiong, how do you feel if I propose to go back to the sect?"

Uneasy. He has been in the palace for so long that the prospect of leaving the quiet makes him uncomfortable. As always, Mu Qingfang doesn’t pressure him, although he senses that this time he will not be able to run away so easily.

"Shen-shixiong, you've never had something to consider a home, have you? Could you give us a chance?"

You'd be better off without me. Shen Jiu sighs. I only bring you problems.

"Can we talk about another thing?"

"Shen-shixiong, you don't want to talk about Qi-Ge, or what happened with the Qiu or Wu Yanzi. I can understand it and I will not pressure you. But I am worried that despite so many months you insist on isolating yourself. Now I understand that you are imitating the same defensive attitude as in the past when we were disciples and rejected you because of our prejudices. But there is no reason why you should hide or protect yourself. "

Although he knows that Mu Qingfang is right, Shen Jiu cannot find the words to justify himself.

"You have been alone for a long time, Shen-shixiong."

"My disciples visit me. I have Luo Binghe."

"I’m also worried about Luo Binghe. You have improved, but he doesn’t even allow us to help him. The reasons why he isolates you are also disturbing." Mu Qingfang rubs his eyes, tired. "Maybe he does it because he confuses what you want with what you need. Or because he wants to keep you in control. Both options are possible."

"Maybe I’m weakened, but my former disciple has no control over me."

"If you decided to go back to the sect with me today, do you think Luo Binghe would allow it?"

Shen Jiu frowns and shakes his head.

"But he would if I explained that I'll come back later."

"Why should you return if he kidnapped you and kept you away from us during all this time?"

Although that is a truth that Shen Jiu has always been aware of, it is another one of those issues that he has preferred to ignore, like that Luo Binghe's problem was caused by him.

And so he must stay.

"I must stay with him to clear his meridians."

"For health reasons, you shouldn't do it, why hasn't he looked for anyone else?"

"What other human cultivator of high cultivation would offer to help him?"

"Myself. And I already offered, but he has always refused. That dependency between the two of you is a chain, Shen-shixiong. Perhaps you are comfortable with all his servants, but little chores like making your bed or cooking would help you." Mu Qingfang sighs, but his gaze doesn't soften. "This time I’m going to send you a mission: I want you to visit us this month. I will help you so that you feel comfortable and be able to advance in your treatment. But if you can’t do it, we’ll talk about it in our next session without any further evasion, understood?"

Shen Jiu reluctantly agrees. Mu Qingfang extends a hand and places it on top of his.

"And most importantly: if Luo Binghe prevents it or you notice that he controls you without letting you go free, you have to tell us. We can help you."

This time, Mu Qingfang leaves a different shadow for the questions’ echo. They both knew that to achieve such a simple mission, he must start by talking to Luo Binghe. And even though they have been together all those months, there is still an abyss between them that only closes a little when Shen Jiu cleans his meridians or he prepares food for the two of them. Luo Binghe is usually busy with his demonic conquests and he avoids it whenever he can for...

...fear. Even though he always tells Mu Qingfang that he is not a coward, fear paralyzes him. It is the fear of returning to the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect and discovering that nothing has changed despite his absence. The fear of facing painful truths or that he has any solution.

But as Mu Qingfang has taught him, Shen Jiu tries to control those parasitic thoughts and prevent them from multiplying. He locks them up so they can leave him alone. Right now, he should only care about his mission.

But he will wait for Luo Binghe to return. And then he will find the right time to talk to him. If not today, he will try tomorrow. Or the day after tomorrow. It's okay if he waits until he feels strong enough to do it.

 

 

Eleven months have passed since Shen Yuan's self-destruction and Shen Jiu waits for Mu Qingfang with his eyes closed, one arm on the table, and the other hand covering his face.

"Shen-shixiong?"

In the end, he was unable to try. He delayed it every day, just like the letters. Now he finally knows what the answer to Mu Qingfang's questions is: he is unable to return by himself.

"I need help.” He mutters with a broken voice. “Perhaps... I have a problem."

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: What would have happened if Mu Qingfang didn't respect doctor-patient confidentiality?
Mu Qingfang: I can't believe it!
Mu Qingfang: All of Shen-shixiong's problems started because his Qi-Ge is a bastard who abandoned him.
Yue Qingyuan: ... 😥

CURIOSITY #1
Writing the scene Bingjiu I felt that I was cheating on Liujiu. We will have Liu Qingge's POV in the next chapter!

CURIOSITY #2
To those who bet that Shen Yuan would be dead for more than a year: congratulations! You're winning! :D

*Author runs*

------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Their different plans

Chapter Notes

Today's chapter is 75% drama and 25% other things with a bit of humor (finally!!!!). And it's time to introduce you a new ship 👀

This chapter is parallel to the previous one. There are some hints that link their scenes. Will someone discover them?

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The worst pain is not from his broken bones, but his shattered pride.

Liu Qingge awakens on Qian Cao Peak, stunned by a mist trapped within his head. He can barely move and the noises confuse him. The last memories before he lost consciousness run through his mind like new blows.

He was defeated. Again.

When Yue Qingyuan enters the room, he has already sat on the bed, ignoring the fire burning in his muscles. The sect leader's gaze is cold and judges him without words. Liu Qingge clenches his teeth until his jaw hurts. Losing is painful and humiliating, but his leader's disappointment is even worse.

Yue Qingyuan sits in front of his bed.

"Why did you do it, shidi?"

"You wanted me to stay idly!?" Liu Qingge hisses. His throat is hoarse and his words are spun with groans. "You said I could wait until Mu-shixiong returned."

"That didn't mean you could disappear the same day."

"That monster has Shen Jiu locked up! And Shen Jiu is sick! He needs us!"

"I know," Yue Qingyuan closes his eyes and breathes. Weariness casts a shadow over the sect leader's features. "But now you have put us in a very difficult position. If you ever face Luo Binghe again, he will kill you."

"Let him try," Liu Qingge growls, his left hand gripping the sheets so tightly that he almost tears them.

"Shidi, you have been sleeping for two weeks and Mu-shidi is afraid of the sequelae of your arm. You must rest."

Liu Qingge hates his weakness and having Shen Jiu so far away, in a jail that he cannot access, but he also hates the passivity of the leader he wants to trust. Furious, he looks Yue Qingyuan into the eyes.

"How long? Until Shen Yuan returns and Luo Binghe kidnaps him as well? Or until he injures Shen Jiu? How long should I wait, Zhangmen-shixiong?"

Although the frustration on his face is similar to his, Liu Qingge is tense with rage while Yue Qingyuan has been defeated by tired sadness. And without the need for words, he finds knows who has given up.

"Mu-shidi and I are working to get Shen-shidi back."

"It's not enough."

"Liu-shidi." And this time his voice is a warning. "Have you ever wondered why Shen-shixiong hasn't tried to escape if he's not locked up or unarmed?"

"That beast has done something to him."

"Mu-shidi has other theories." Yue Qingyuan sits up with his hands behind her back. "Rest, Liu-shidi. You are forbidden to leave Qian Cao Peak until your arm is healed."

"And what about Shen Jiu!?"

"Mu-shidi has negotiated with Luo Binghe. He has permission to visit Shen-shidi every month." Yue Qingyuan sighs. "Mu-shidi will also investigate what kind of illness affects Shen-shixiong and how to cure him."

Liu Qingge tries to get up, but his broken arm is a dead weight that burns every time he jerks around.

"Is not enough."

"Luo Binghe has already announced that he will take it as a sect attack next time. And an enemy that has defeated our War God is an enemy that we cannot afford as long as Shen-shidi's state is unstable."

Liu Qingge is left alone in a room that smells of spices and medicinal herbs. Although the sun warms through the window, he feels a chill that rises from under his skin. He rubs his eye with his left hand. But it's too late.

He has started crying.

Liu Qingge doesn't remember the last time he cried, but he also doesn't remember when he felt so useless and miserable. He's gotten used to being powerful, almost perfect, and now he's lost everything.

He is no longer the unbeatable War God that everyone admires, but the one who has lost against a demon.

 

The first time Shen Jiu cleared his meridians, Luo Binghe knew it was wrong.

But he is unable to stop shizun when he repeats it another night. His qi is soft like the breeze in a bamboo forest and calms the darkness inside his veins. Even so, Luo Binghe has a crooked smile whenever Shen Jiu takes his wrist. He's the one who swore to protect both shizuns but in the end…

You failed. Xin Mo whispers to him. You failed because you aren’t powerful enough. One is dead, the other will disappear. He will abandon you for the white cultivator. Kill him. Lock him up. Chain up your shizun and acclaim him as yours. Be the monster you want, be the monster that others fear. They are afraid of you, they will never accept you. So, KILL THEM.

Shen Jiu not only eases the chaos of his two natures, but it also silences the voice of the sword. Although Luo Binghe accepted exhaustion as a punishment for killing Shen Yuan, that small instant of comfort soothes his wounds. Sometimes when he fights to blood against demons, Luo Binghe feels good. He deserves a thousand times that pain and more if it will make Shen Yuan return. But it is when Shen Jiu takes his wrist and cleanses his meridians that the Demon Lord finally breathes without sorrow in his heart.

This is wrong. He is the one who should be powerful enough to protect his shizun. Luo Binghe hates his fragility, that moment when all his wishes are incomplete. But it's nice that Shen Jiu takes care of him. Pleasant and addictive. In the end, he closes his eyes and rests his head on his shoulder.

Someday he will protect his two shizuns and they will never be hurt again. Someday in the future...

And Xin Mo purrs. His voice may become an almost silent whisper, but it never disappears.

 

Liu Qingge is still not healed when one night he sneaks off Qian Cao Peak. Pain accompanies him with every step, but he has become used to ignoring it. After a month and a half of forced rest, he feels weak and fragile. He hates it. It's as if Luo Binghe not only broke his arm but the person he used to be.

Before leaving the sect, he made a detour to Bai Zhan Peak to change his clothes and search for weapons and supplies which will help him to rescue Shen Jiu.

Yue Qingyuan awaits him in front of the door of his house.

"Although I'm not surprised, you still disappoint me, shidi."

His gaze is the same as the last time they spoke. Liu Qingge tenses when the sect leader walks up to him. Although he doesn’t distinguish intention to fight or drag him to Qian Cao Peak, he knows that he will prevent him from returning to the palace.

"Follow me, shidi. I need to tell you something."

His voice is lower than usual. The Yue Qingyuan who walks beside him that night seems like a shadow, a stranger instead of his sect leader. Maybe it's the suspicion that has grown in his heart or the frustration that no one else shares his rage against the demon who killed Shen Yuan and kidnapped Shen Jiu.

They walk in silence to the Lingxi Caves. Liu Qingge pretends to not limp and that the pain is tolerable, even though every step is torture. He is not weak. The War God is not broken. So he swallows all the grunts and complaints as he follows his leader.

At night, the Lingxi Caves are a labyrinth of sinister shadows. Yue Qingyuan walks with the determination to have a clear goal while he feels cold memories in his gut. Enclosed within those walls reverberates the echo of his qi deviation and his first encounter with Shen Yuan. He saved his life even though Liu Qingge still believed that he was his enemy.

Everything changed here.

Yue Qingyuan takes him to a natural room carved out of the rock. It is wide and the spiritual energy is very powerful, although there are bloodstains on the walls. The sect leader places his hand on the stone.

"Once, when I was a disciple, I wanted to save someone very important to me."

Liu Qingge frowns, but intrigue encourages him to listen without interrupting.

"That person was also trapped. He belonged to a wicked family, more cruel and heartless than some demons. I promised him that I would rescue him and tried to keep my promise. When I entered Qiong Ding Peak, I studied and trained day and night. I pressed all my limits and I went for a sword ahead of time. " Yue Qingyuan's voice has turned into a whisper broken by the pain of the memories. "I rushed too much. That person deserved it, but I only managed to put my life in danger. My shizun locked me here for a few years when I was caught in a qi deviation that almost killed me."

Liu Qingge is not stupid and understands the message of his story. That's why he looks away when Yue Qingyuan raises his head towards him.

"I've been a cripple since then."

That incomplete secret is bitter and freezes the air that reaches his lungs. Liu Qingge takes a deep breath, though his left hand unconsciously searches for his injured arm.

"I don't care."

"Shidi, let me finish my story." Yue Qingyuan smiles. And it is such a sad and defeated smile that something inside Liu Qingge trembles. "When I was finally able to leave the Lingxi Caves with my sword, I went for that person. But I only found the ashes of a house."

The sect leader turns his back on him and walks into the corridor they have come through with one hand stroking the stains on the walls.

"I've been wondering for years what would have happened if I had made another decision," Yue Qingyuan confesses to him. "I also thought that it didn't matter if I got hurt, but in the end, I couldn't rescue him or prevent him from suffering something even worse."

Liu Qingge gulps and waits for the question that he knows will come now.

"Shidi, what are you planning to do?"

"Rescue Shen Jiu."

Yue Qingyuan smiles when he looks at him, still with that nostalgic sadness darkening his features.

"As I expected. Sorry, shidi."

Liu Qingge's eyes widen as he feels powerful qi shaking the cave and covering the walls in a bluish glow. He tries to run up to Yue Qingyuan, but he trips against a barrier that separates him from the exit.

"Zhangmen-shixiong!!!!" He screams as he punches the spirit energy. "Release me!!"

"You have left me with no other chance, shidi." Yue Qingyuan sighs with weariness, with compassion that Liu Qingge refuses to accept. "Dying or ending up crippled will only make Xiao Jiu even more miserable. I know that better than anyone." Although it is not the first time he hears that name, tonight Liu Qingge squints his eyes and glares at Yue Qingyuan. "You will stay here recovering. The rest of us will take care of Shen-shixiong."

"Don't you dare!" He hisses before hitting the wall again.

And although all his efforts are futile, Liu Qingge tries desperately. It's the only thing left for him: his anger and despair. The rest are shards accumulated inside his chest that tear him apart with every beat, with every breath.

 

 

Luo Binghe is busy with so many pendant tasks that sometimes he feels like he is drowning in blood and ash, in the cold of a room covered in frost, in his unrealizable dreams. Then, Xin Mo's voice grows into a cruel scream.

But he has shizun.

Xin Mo has also tried to cast doubt on Shen Jiu. He is cruel. He pushed you. He hates you for being a demon. He disgusts you for being a human. He wants to kill you for what you did to his brother. I know. But all those doubts die every night Shizun cleans his meridians.

Shizun, forgive this disciple for being such an idiot, he thinks as Shen Jiu's icy fingers brush against his skin. I forgot that the kindness of the moon shines less than the sun, but it is just as beautiful.

Luo Binghe wants to help him too, but he still doesn't understand what happens to Shen Jiu. Mu Qingfang has explained to him that it is a dangerous sadness, a poison that has robbed him of his energy, determination, and the will to live.

Although Luo Binghe hides many dark desires, for shizun's sake he listens to Mu Qingfang.

 

 

"Have you told Shen-shidi what happened to Liu-shidi?" Yue Qingyuan asks Mu Qingfang before he goes to Luo Binghe's palace.

"Not yet. I'm afraid that it will make him feel guilty."

"But maybe he never forgives Liu-shidi."

"For what? Being hurt?"

Yue Qingyuan sighs.

"Tell him when you think he can hear it without the truth hurting him. It’s okay if you put all the blame on me." His smile is sad. “He already hates me.”

 

 

Liu Qingge hates the loneliness of the Lingxi Caves. Sometimes they visit him: Mu Qingfang checks his wounds and tells him about Shen Jiu, Liu Mingyan keeps him company and Yue Qingyuan tries to talk to him, but it is not enough and his anger has grown to accuse his martial brothers of doing nothing.

"We have reforged Zheng Yang," Yue Qingyuan tells him.

"That beast doesn't need a new sword."

"We have made a list of places to look for Shen Yuan."

"Why weren't you looking for him already?"

He doesn’t want to hear their news. And although Liu Qingge tries to meditate to recover sooner, his thoughts are in chaos. He is worried about everything that he doesn’t know, about those shadows that the sect cannot discover.

And loneliness is terrifying when days turn into months.

He is trying to meditate when he hears a meow. Liu Qingge opens his eyes and looks to his right. There is a white cat in the caves. It shouldn't be there, but he recognizes it: it's the twins' cat. The animal walks toward him. It has the same angry look as Shen Jiu and growls at him as he slaps his knee with a paw.

"Where are they?" He seems to say with his meows. "Why have they abandoned me?"

"Sorry." Liu Qingge's voice breaks and he notices another storm in his throat. Ignoring his snorting and scratching, he hugs the animal and begins stroking its head. "I miss them too."

In the end, the cat sits on his lap. And even though he doesn't speak, his company makes him feel less alone.

 

 

You're an Idiot. Xin Mo whispers to him. You have opened the doors of your palace to your enemies.

From the distance, Luo Binghe gazes at the disciples who have come to visit Shen Jiu. They are a small group of four and although he hates that idea, Mu Qingfang has assured him that it is for his sake. So, he accepted. Even though the monster that lives within him roars with envy as tired smiles return to Shen Jiu's face and his eyes light up a bit. He also wants to make him so happy. Why doesn't he get it? Is he not enough?

Luo Binghe agreed to that plan with some conditions. Among them, Gongyi Xiao cannot return to his palace and all visits will be brief.

Shen Jiu gathers them in the gardens to tell them about their progress. Although Luo Binghe is busy, he continues to watch over them in the shadows. Suspicious of the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect's intentions although Mu Qingfang seemed sincere when he scolded him for isolating Shen Jiu.

Luo Binghe frowns. There is a girl that he doesn’t recognize. During the years that he was absent, he forced Shang Qinghua to keep him informed of the new disciples (possible rivals). If his shizuns had accepted such a beautiful young woman, he would know it. Furthermore, she doesn’t go with them, but instead, she sits aside to write in a notebook.

With suspicion in mind, Luo Binghe walks towards the stranger. A cruel, twisted smile escapes him. Dressed in the Qing Jing Peak uniform and without her veil, Liu Mingyan is almost unrecognizable.

"Long time no see, Liu-shijie," he says, stopping in front of her.

Despite being discovered, Liu Mingyan doesn't seem concerned. She smiles at him like in the past. Luo Binghe extends a hand, demanding the notebook she writes in. Liu Mingyan hands it to him without hesitation.

She is a spy. KILL HER. KILL HER. KILL HER. Tear off her limbs and send them to her brother for playing dirty.

Luo Binghe frowns. There are no notes or plans written down in that notebook, but the description of a scene.

"What is this?"

"I’m writing a novel, Lord Luo."

"A novel?"

Luo Binghe chokes on turning the page and reading a very explicit scene of two men fucking in a palace garden. The terrible Demon Lord looks at the writer, who smiles with innocence and sweetness.

"Don't say anything to Shen-shibo, please. I'm supposed to take care of his disciples, not engage in other pursuits."

Luo Binghe ignores her guilty expression, still staring at the pages of the notebook. He clears his throat, regaining his composure. And he turns to another page since he must make sure that there are no secret messages. He is not interested in the story, of course, nor in the details.

"I didn't know what you wrote, Liu-shijie."

"It's my little secret, Lord Luo."

"It's a good story," he comments before handing her the notebook back.

"Do you like it?"

Luo Binghe doesn't nod despite the curiosity that purrs along with all his hungry monsters.

"Why are your protagonists a Demon Lord and an Immortal Master?"

"Coincidence, I guess." Liu Mingyan stands up when she sees that Shen Jiu is saying goodbye to his disciples. "Can I come back next week? I can't write this story in Cang Qiong Mountain Sect... for obvious reasons."

Luo Binghe turns his back on her.

"Only if I can read the rest later."

 

Sha Hualing is so disappointed that she would destroy something with her nails. Specifically, the veil that covers Liu Mingyan's face. Luo Binghe convinced her to keep an eye on the writer with the incentive that she had removed her veil, but that day she had come in her usual clothes.

Too bad , laments the demoness. The beauty of that human is so legendary that the curiosity stings her nails.

She is so distracted writing that it would be easy to snatch the veil, but Luo Binghe is inexplicably interested in her novel and Sha Hualing doesn’t dare to disturb him. Intrigued, she sits next to Liu Mingyan to read over his shoulder.

"Oh."

 

 

"You are a bunch of cowards," Liu Qingge hisses while Mu Qingfang examines his arm. Although it no longer hurts, the healer insists on checking him almost daily for fear that he may not be able to move it as before. "It's been half a year since that beast kidnapped Shen Jiu. And he's still locked up."

"I'm afraid that Shen-shixiong doesn't want to come back."

"I don’t believe it."

"He is neither bound nor unarmed, Liu-shidi."

"That beast must have used hypnosis or demonic tricks!"

Mu Qingfang sighs. Behind him, Yue Qingyuan is tense and uncomfortable.

"I wish it were that simple, Liu-shidi, but it is Shen-shixiong himself who has chosen the palace. Although we are making progress, there is still much that I still don’t know about his fears."

"Shen Jiu is not a coward," he growls.

"We all have fears, Liu-shidi. And his are the reason why he is so tired. Sometimes, some monsters live inside our heads and we cannot defeat them with a sword."

He frowns. And although he finds it difficult to accept that idea, Liu Qingge thinks of the frustration that prevents him from sleeping or the poisoned memory of his fighting against Luo Binghe. Perhaps he can understand Mu Qingfang's words, although that doesn’t reassure him, but rather worries him even more.

"Why? What happened to Shen Jiu?"

All of his monsters have been born from terrible situations that have left him different scars. Shen Jiu's must be similar. Liu Qingge trembles, angry and worried, at the possibility that Luo Binghe has hurt him.

"I don't know, but I suspect it happened a long time ago, perhaps during his childhood, and still hasn't recovered."

Liu Qingge frowns and looks at him.

"What exactly are you talking about? What do you know?"

"I can't tell you, Liu-shidi."

"Why not!? I want to help Shen Jiu too!"

"Because it has been very difficult to regain his trust and I cannot lose it."

"I won’t say anything."

"Shidi," Yue Qingyuan reproaches him, breaking his silence. "Don't be impatient and listen to Mu-shidi. Shen-shidi is an extremely distrustful person. Perhaps right now, he only trusts Shen-ershidi. Betraying his trust is a worse crime than abandoning him."

Neither speaks for the next few minutes in which Mu Qingfang applies a balm to his shoulder joint to ensure proper recovery.

"Furthermore, we have another problem with Luo Binghe," he mutters cautiously, glancing at Yue Qingyuan.

Liu Qingge stiffens.

"What has he done now?"

"Nothing. It has been almost seven months since he attacked us and since then he has not been aggressive against humans. Our guards report that he has simply refurbished the palace and the former members of the sect now work for him. We know for sure that the elders were killed. And perhaps the Old Palace Master, who is missing." Mu Qingfang keeps his medicine away and Liu Qingge dons his outer robes again. "The only madness he is trying to commit is to resurrect Shen-ershixiong. But despite that, he pampers Shen-shixiong and has never stopped me from moving forward with the treatment."

"He's still holding him prisoner," Liu Qingge growls without hiding his hatred.

"I know."

"What is the problem, shidi?" Yue Qingyuan intervenes.

"I suspect that he is holding on to Shen-shixiong to keep calm. Right now, Luo Binghe is a volcano that can erupt at any moment." He explains to them. "Shen-ershixiong's death has affected him and he is still not over it. The dual nature of his qi is dangerous and he only forces his limits instead of controlling them. Furthermore, that damn sword affects his most visceral emotions, like anger or desire. "

Liu Qingge punches the wall.

"And that's why we must get him away from Shen Jiu!"

"However, despite my fears, Luo Binghe is controlled. Shen-shixiong is the reason that keeps him stable. If we separate them, I fear that all of his inner demons will get out of control."

"I don't care," Liu Qingge hisses.

That would give him an excuse to face him again.

"Even if that puts Shen-shixiong in danger?"

His answer leaves Liu Qingge speechless for a few seconds.

"He is already in danger. Luo Binghe is not stupid and knows the benefits of dual cultivation. That unfilial beast desires his masters." Liu Qingge turns to Yue Qingyuan and bows his head. "Please. I'm recovered now. Let me out."

The sect leader hesitates.

"Not yet."

 

 

"For the next chapter, I was thinking that the Demon Lord's rival might enter the Immortal Master's room at night."

"Luo Binghe will kill you if you write that."

"The Demon Lord will arrive on time, don't worry." The human has a mischievous laugh that reminds her of a succubus. "Then they will fight and the Demon Lord will claim the Immortal Master as a trophy. Readers want tension and drama!"

"It's still a bad idea, but I suspect he'll like it, so..." She shrugs.

"I have several ideas, can you advise me?" Liu Mingyan is so close to her that her shoulders touch. Maybe she's smiling, but Sha Hualing can't tell because of that stupid veil. "I was thinking of writing the scene from the point of view of the love rival. He is a new character and that will surprise the readers. Also, it will be spicier if he sees how the Demon Lord fucks the Immortal Master."

"You have terrible ideas for being human."

"Thank you. Do you think the scene is realistic if the rival faces the guards first?"

"No, he will alert everyone before reaching the Immortal's room. I would suggest you..."

 

 

Shizun sighs while cleaning his meridians. Luo Binghe contemplates him. Mu Qingfang's latest visit has left him more stressed than usual. Although during those almost ten months the healer has managed to mend the broken pieces of Shen Jiu, this is the first time that he seems restless. Shen Jiu bites his lip. Luo Binghe has the feeling that he wants to say something to him, but in the end, he never speaks and he doesn't insist either.

"Done." He clicks his tongue as he releases his wrist.

As always, giving him spiritual energy leaves him exhausted. Even so, he always refuses his help when they get up. It's frustrating. He would like to make up for the kindness of his shizun, even if it is to pick him up and carry him to his room.

"You can't stay like this forever, Luo Binghe," Shen Jiu tells him as he walks to the door. "You should find a cultivation partner."

Despite the rejection, the Demon Lord smiles.

"But I only want shizun."

Shen Jiu turns to look at him with disdain similar to the past and that still makes him shiver.

"Don't be ridiculous. First, I hope you haven't forgotten that I am not Shen Yuan. Second, I will never allow you to get close to my brother again when he returns."

This is the most important comfort that Shen Jiu gives him. Not the warm that cleanses his body of tainted qi and bloody weighings. Not his company when they eat together. Not the fact that he doesn't abandon him.

Shen Jiu is the only person in the entire world who also believes that Shen Yuan will return. And that gives Luo Binghe the strength to continue perfecting the resurrection spell. They share the same hope and dream of the same future.

 

 

The time inside the Lingxi Caves is reminiscent of a fuzzy dream. Liu Qingge has been locked up with the sole company of a grumpy cat for so long that when Yue Qingyuan voids the seal, he is left paralyzed and confused.

The first breath of air when leaving tastes like freedom.

Of course, he draws Cheng Luan to fly after Shen Jiu. However, Yue Qingyuan grabs him by the neck of the outer robes and drags him to Qiong Ding Peak.

"Let me go!" Liu Qingge hisses. "You told me that Shen Jiu has asked us for help!"

"Should I remind you of Luo Binghe's threats?"

He grits his teeth, furious, but for once he doesn't answer: "I don't care." Instead, he growls and reluctantly follows the sect leader into the meeting room. All the Peak Lords are already reunited, but also his sister.

Surprised, he gazes at Liu Mingyan.

"What are you doing here?"

"Helping you, Ge. While you were recovering, this humble one walked inside Luo Binghe's castle. I know all its entrances and weak points, where Shen-shibo's room is, and the best way to get there without being discovered."

"We have a plan, shidi," Yue Qingyuan explains. "We are going to rescue Shen-shixiong. But this time you will be discreet. This sect will never abandon its own, but neither will allow anyone to sacrifice themselves in vain anymore."

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: What would the characters do if they stole my AO3 account?
Luo Binghe deletes the tag Liushen and Liujiu
Luo Binghe raises the rating to E
Yue Qingyuan downgrades to T
Liu Qingge deletes the Bingjiu and Bingyuan tag
Liu Qingge adds the warning "Major Character Death"
Liu Mingyan adds the tags Liushen, Liujiu, Bingjiu and Bingyuan
Mu Qingfang deletes the warning "Major Character Death"
Luo Binghe adds the warning "Major Character Death"
Liu Mingyan raises the rating to E
Sha Hualing changes the M/M to F/F
Liu Mingyan changes the F/F to Multi
Liu Mingyan changes the title to "Resentment of Chunshan"
Shen Yuan removes the warning "Major Character Death"
Shen Jiu removes all ship tags
Shen Jiu changes the title to "Found Brother"
Liu Mingyan publishes 69 extras M/M/M and E in the "Found Brother" series

CURIOSITY #1
I missed writing funny scenes. Thank you, Mingyan, you are my hero.
