★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Liu Qingge rescues Shen Jiu

Chapter Notes

BONUS THAT I FORGOT TO POST IN THE PREVIOUS CHAPTER
Liu Mingyan: When you were studying the blade, I wrote porn.

I never imagined that I could write a fanfic >100k words, thank you very much for all your support and feedback!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

His heartbeat swells when Liu Qingge and his sister leave Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. Although impatience bites into his guts and legs, his steps are hesitant. Liu Qingge still feels that he is dreaming. The world outside the Lingxi Caves is too intense and bright, dizzying. He closes his eyes and takes a deep breath before unsheathing Cheng Luan.

"Ge, are you okay?"

Liu Qingge growls, although he no longer remembers when he was at peace for the last time. A year of tension and uncertainty, of anger and frustration, is too much and has worn him out on the inside.

"I'll be fine when we rescue Shen Jiu."

His sister nods at him. Her eyes sparkle when she unsheathes Shui Se.

"Let's go."

It feels like an eternity since the last time Liu Qingge headed to Luo Binghe's palace. His right shoulder burns in memory of his defeat. Liu Qingge frowns and accelerates the flight. In recent months, Yue Qingyuan and Mu Qingfang have taught him to be patient. And he's trying, but it's been a long time without him feeling alive. His blood boils with the desire to fight, to keep moving, and never stop again.

But for Shen Jiu's sake, he stays behind Liu Mingyan.

There are several protective arrays within the Bailu forest, but his sister knows how to get through them. When he asks her, she shrugs and mutters: "Chapter 24."

After sheathing their swords, they walk to the palace. Liu Mingyan scolds him whenever he makes unnecessary or too loud noises. The key to his plan is stealth and surprise. And although in other circumstances Liu Qingge would say that it is a dishonorable plan, on this occasion he doesn’t hesitate to follow all of her indications.

Liu Mingyan also knows which wall is the most unprotected and how to reach the palace. She prevents him from getting into fights by distinguishing soldiers and servants but instead dodges them like cowardly rats.

As they advance, Liu Qingge gazes at the past Huan Hua Palace. The sect has disappeared, replaced by the home of a demon emperor. Despite what Mu-shidi says, that beast is up to something. Liu Qingge grits his teeth, wanting to eradicate that place with fire.

Shen Jiu's room is at the end of a maze of pavilions, courtyards, and guard posts. As they get closer, Liu Qingge's heart races with impatience and longing, but also restlessness. He is under the impression that Luo Binghe will appear from around every corner. All shadows have his demonic sigil and silence can hide his cruel voice.

And perhaps he wishes to meet him again to turn all his rage into a mortal fight.

"If you go straight ahead, you will find Shen-shibo," Liu Mingyan whispers to him.

Liu Qingge nods. Before leaving, they discussed the plan. Liu Mingyan didn’t go into details but promised that she would keep one of Luo Binghe's demon generals distracted. When his sister disappears, he sneaks into the room.

His pulse trembles when he finally opens the door.

Shen Jiu is reading a letter and is slow to look up. But when he sees him, his eyes widen in surprise. Shen Jiu lets out a strangled sound as he enters the room and walks, almost running, towards him.

"Shidi? What are you doing here?"

It's been so long that he almost forgot his voice. And although it sounds cold there are hints of relief or perhaps curiosity. Liu Qingge's heart constricts. Shen Jiu's skin glows with paleness, and exhaustion stains his usual beauty. Instead of wearing his Peak Lord robes, his clothing is luxurious and elegant, with red and black decorating the green. Shen Jiu gasps like a cat when he carries him in his arms.

"I've come for you. We're leaving."

Liu Qingge can feel that he is tense. His nails dig into him instinctively, but those few words make Shen Jiu squeeze his eyes shut and cling to him. Liu Qingge is aware of his racing pulse, but the only response he receives is silence.

After retrieving Xiu Ya, Liu Qingge leaves that room without stopping or looking back. The hardest part is escaping the palace without being discovered. Liu Mingyan has repeated it to him a thousand times: he cannot let them to see them or Luo Binghe will appear and they will miss a unique opportunity. "You won't just be defeated," she warned him with sharp seriousness. "Right now Shen-shibo is barely vigilant. If we fail, maybe even Mu Qingfang won't be able to see him again. Don't seek him out for revenge or fight him, understand?"

Liu Qingge takes a deep breath and follows his sister's instructions. With each step, he accelerates. Until the forest devours them. Until they return under the blue sky and he can unsheathe Cheng Luan.

Shen Jiu wriggles in his arms as he climbs onto the sword.

"You can let me go now, shidi."

"No."

He will never let go of him again.

 

 

Shen Jiu shrugs. And that indifference is terrifying and odd in him. Until that moment, Liu Qingge hadn’t understood what Mu Qingfang was referring to when he tried to explain to him that Shen Jiu is unwell. Liu Qingge hugs him tighter.

Shen Jiu falls asleep on their way to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect.

Everyone is gathered at the entrance of the sect. There are cheers and relief when Liu Qingge lands with Shen Jiu in his arms, who meows in his sleep. His eyebrows are twisted and he has one of his characterístic grimaces. Liu Qingge sighs, though a tiny smile escapes his.

He had missed him. He had missed his presence at Qing Jing Peak, his sarcastic complaints and comments, his stubbornness.

Shen Jiu's disciples surround Liu Qingge. They look like a bunch of ducklings. Although he never wants to let go of him again, Liu Qingge allows Gongyi Xiao to take his shizun and carry him to Qing Jing Peak to rest.

"So noisy..." Shen Jiu splutters, his eyes still closed when Liu Qingge turns away from him.

Later, he will return to his side, but now Liu Qingge needs to be reunited with the other Peak Lords.

"Well done, shidi," Yue Qingyuan congratulates him with a smile that doesn't hide the concern from his eyes.

He's not the only one. Almost everyone watches the sky expectantly. Luo Binghe will appear at any moment. It is a certainty that Liu Qingge notices in his chest, inside his lungs.

"I'm still afraid that I made a mistake," Mu Qingfang sighs.

"It was the best option." Qi Qingqi and Liu Qingge belong to the action, while Mu Qingfang or Yue Qingyuan have defended patience and dialogue. "Shen-shixiong asked us for help. Talking to Luo Binghe wouldn’t have guaranteed anything. In the worst case, he would further shield his strength or take his shizun to the Demonic Realm."

"I know." He sighs. "But let me talk to him first."

Liu Qingge reluctantly nods. That is the agreement they had reached: after rescuing Shen Jiu, Mu Qingfang will try to explain to Luo Binghe why they have done it.

If Luo Binghe responds with violence or tries to kidnap Shen Jiu again, Liu Qingge and Yue Qingyuan will confront him.

As the disciples return to the interior of the sect, almost all the Peak Lords stand at the entrance, ready to defend their home and theirs from that demonic and unpredictable shadow that has drowned them for so long.

 

 

Shen Jiu rubs his temples. Why after many empty nights has he just fallen asleep in Liu Qingge's arms? And he still notices that heavy dream flooding his head and muddying his thoughts. The laughing voices of his disciples only make him even dizzier. After a frozen eternity, he is confused and his heart beats in terror. Everything has happened too fast. And without the security of the palace, he feels vulnerable.

"This master needs to rest," he growls.

Only tiredness prevents shame from destroying his self-control. He has fallen asleep. In Liu Qingge's arms. Everyone has seen him. And now his disciples are leading him into HIS home as if he is made of glass. Shen Jiu shakes his sleeves until the others take a few steps back. And he breathes a sigh of relief when they stop suffocating him with their closeness.

There are too many voices, too many people around him, too many unanswered questions. Why has Liu Qingge, precisely him, come? Why didn't he arrive earlier? Was he busy looking for Shen Yuan?

Shen Jiu flees home and locks himself inside. With his eyes closed, he leans his back against the door. Luckily, he will be able to rest a bit before facing the others again...

But he is never lucky.

"Jiu Bro!!!!"

Shen Jiu growls.

"The most useless spy in the world," he snorts, "What are you doing in MY HOUSE?"

That cowardly rat is sitting at his table. Or he was sitting at his table. Shang Qinghua jumps up and gets up, though he keeps pestering him with his nervous little voice.

"We've missed you, Jiu Bro! It's a relief to see you well and alive. I already thought Cucumber Bro would kill me after my son ripped your limbs off."

"I'm not in the mood to listen to your nonsense." Shen Jiu crawls up to the table and drops down.

He doesn't understand why he's still somnolent after having slept so long. Despite his efforts, Shen Jiu still feels weak and tired. His gaze contemplates his house. After a year of absence, he is surprised to find that there is no dust. The interior is clean and tidy, although too cold. It no longer smells of food or ink, but of emptiness.

"What do you want?" He growls at Shang Qinghua, suspicious of his presence.

"I have to talk to you, Jiu Bro!" Shang Qinghua sits in front of him. Although Shen Jiu should be used to his impatience by now, he seems more nervous than usual today. "Listen carefully to me, Jiu Bro. I've already found out what happened to Cucumber Bro."

Immediately, Shen Jiu opens his eyes and his weariness disappears, replaced by an expectant tension and fear that has grown in the last year.

"Speaks." His order sounds harsh.

"Do you remember when you planted the seeds?"

"Of course."

"Was it by any chance in the same year that you pushed Luo Binghe into the Endless Abyss?"

Shen Jiu frowns, but he nods. To his surprise, Shang Qinghua sighs. And his smile no longer seems so irritating, but relieves him, because the spy's concern is real.

"This is what I think happened. You planted the seeds to have a spare body in case Luo Binghe made other more drastic decisions than kidnapping the two of you. Although I still don't understand how you managed to seduce my son... Ouch! " Shen Jiu throws him a fan that he finds handy. "That Luo Binghe dreams of a harem doesn't surprise me, but with both of you? I mean, it's better than your original destiny, but the demonic pillar... Ouch! That hurt, Jiu Bro!"

"Stop babbling," he hisses at him. "Tell me what you know."

"Okay! Okay! Do you remember that Luo Binghe should be back in five years?"

Shen Jiu frowns. He will never understand how someone as irrelevant as Shang Qinghua possesses knowledge of such concrete details.

"Indeed."

"But Luo Binghe returned two years earlier than planned! Cucumber Bro assumed you would have five years for the seeds to grow. Five years, Jiu Bro, not three. Do you understand now?"

His eyes widen and his breathing almost stops.

"You mean... His body wasn't ready when A-Yuan self-destructed?"

"Exactly! A tree takes time to grow, right? The body would be ready in five years, not three."

"And what does that mean?" His voice trembles and he doesn't dare to utter the full question.

Not understanding his panic, Shang Qinghua giggled a hand.

"Easy: his soul is trapped in an incomplete body. For Cucumber Bro, these years will happen in the blink of an eye. He will surely wake up when the body is ready."

And it's been a year now, which means...

"A-Yuan will be back in a year," Shen Jiu mutters with his heart stuck in his throat.

He rests his forehead against one hand as he sighs. And he lets out a dry laugh. His shoulders tremble, Shen Jiu feels that his bones are going to collapse.

Why have I been such an idiot? A-Yuan was able to leave long ago, so why did I distrust him? He blinks at the tears welling up in his eyes. Mu Qingfang was right when he warned him that his mistrust is harmful, that it blinds him, obscuring reality until it distorts it.

And then, raging darkness covers Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. And although he cannot see him, although they are both far away, Shen Jiu shivers.

Luo Binghe has arrived.

Chapter End Notes

CURIOSITY #1
And finally Shen Yuan's mystery has been solved!

If I remember correctly, in SVSSS Shang Qinghua uses the fertilizer to accelerate the growth of the seeds. In this AU Shang Qinghua hasn't been involved in the plan and thus hasn't make any mess... Rather, it was the Shen Brothers who made a math mistake 😆 Now they will only have to patiently wait a year for him to return.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Madness and loneliness devour Luo Binghe's heart

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Fear intertwines with dark qi when Luo Binghe arrives at Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. Xin Mo taunts him with a metallic laugh. They both know that the last time one shizun died. But he has lost the other and Luo Binghe won't stop until he gets him back.

His steps are slow but determined. The demon's heart beats in anticipation of smashing and killing, of eradicating this sect of thieves and traitors. The promises whispered by the sword that day sound sweeter. Luo Binghe squints as he recognizes the Peak Lords in front of the sect's entrance. They are waiting for him. Of course, they are waiting for him. They knew that he would return for his shizun, just as they should know the consequences for betraying him.

Even so, Luo Binghe hasn't brought his army... yet. He will offer them one last chance. Xin Mo laughs, calling him naive and useless, soft-hearted, and a loser. It is becoming increasingly difficult to ignore the insults of the sword. And when he lifts his head and his gaze meets Liu Qingge's, he seems to read those same insults on his proud expression. Arrogant. Satisfied. Because he has beaten him with tricks and deceptions.

Luo Binghe will not destroy Cang Qiong Mountain Sect for the sake of his two shizuns, but he wishes to demolish the twelve peaks and bury its name in the mud. And he might if they insist on war.

The fault will be theirs and none shizun could blame him, right?

Mu Qingfang has the guts to dare to step forward and welcome him. Although the healer is visibly nervous, he bows his head with the same respect as in his palace. A mockery. Behind him, the others remain tense and Liu Qingge has one hand on Cheng Luan's hilt.

"Lord Luo."

"Where is shizun?" He growls. In his voice burns fire and hatred, but also fear that he tries to hide.

Luo Binghe needs to get Shen Jiu back and protect him. He will lock him in a room that no one else will be able to enter, perhaps deep within the Demonic Realm. Shizun will drink his blood and they will be chained forever, he will not need the help of a lying healer either, as his blood will heal his wounds.

And when Shen Yuan comes back to life, Shen Jiu will smile again and the three of them will be happy.

FOREVER.

Luo Binghe is a master of dreams, to imagine and create them. After surviving the Endless Abyss and crowning himself Emperor of Demons, there is no longer an impossible goal for him.

"Shen-shixiong asked us to return to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect."

Luo Binghe clenches his fists tightly.

"You're lying."

"No. Shen-shixiong's recovery is delicate and he needs the support of his sect. He has been isolating himself for the past year."

"That's not true. He has me."

"He needs more people."

"There's no need."

Because humans can be worse than demons, that was the warning his shizun gave him when he was younger.

"Lord Luo," Mu Qingfang interferes in a deep voice. "We are his martial family and we also want to take care of him. Shen-shixiong needs to regain his routine. Although I know you want to take care of him, that overprotection is hurting him."

Because he only knows how to hurt and destroy, right? Like Shen Yuan, who died because of him.

"What's the problem with Shen-shixiong returning to his house?" Mu Qingfang continues and every one of his words pierces him. "You are his disciple, you can visit him as long as your intentions for the sect and our shixiong are peaceful."

But Luo Binghe needs his shizun or loneliness will grow like night and turn his palace into an icy grave.

Why are you listening to him? He mocks you even though he calls you lord. You should conquer them! If the sect belongs to you, your shizun will also be yours wherever he is.

That is the perfect solution. Luo Binghe notices the temptation in the knuckles, in the eyes that glow like freshly spilled blood, in the urge to swing the sword and feed Xin Mo with the cries of those traitors.

"How can I trust you, Mu-shishu?" Luo Binghe draws a crooked smile. "You never informed me of this change. You haven't rescued shizun, you stole him when I was distracted. You have betrayed my trust..."

"Shen Jiu is a person, not an object." Liu Qingge intervenes, interrupting him, and Luo Binghe's hatred burns when his gaze meets his rival's. "We didn't steal him, it was you who kidnapped him first."

“Liu-shidi...” Mu Qingfang warns him.

Luo Binghe takes a step forward. His hand seeks Xin Mo's hilt, mirroring Liu Qingge.

"You are an ungrateful human. I have forgiven you twice despite all my threats. And unlike you, I keep my word."

Much to his regret, he cannot kill Liu Qingge despite that cruel and petty desire that he feels whenever they meet. Liu Qingge is (sadly) important to both shizuns, but...

...you can tear him into a thousand pieces. Rip off his legs and he won't return for your shizun again. Tear off his arms and he will never fight again. Gouge out his eyes and he will never look at your shizun again. Tear his tongue out and he will never challenge you again. You don't have to kill a man to destroy his legend.

As if he could read his mind, Liu Qingge stiffens, his posture ready to attack even though he still hasn't drawn his sword.

"Stop, both of you!" Mu Qingfang hisses, though uneasiness has made him pale. "If you appreciate Shen-shixiong, stop fighting and listen to me."

"There is nothing to hear." Although Luo Binghe addresses everyone, his gaze is fixed on Liu Qingge. "You have betrayed my trust. Give me back my shizun or Cang Qiong Mountain Sect will disappear tomorrow."

"Never."

Liu Qingge doesn't even wait for the sect leader's response and steps forward with iron arrogance. As if all of his defeats were just a bad dream and he had a chance to face Luo Binghe and win.

This time...

KILL HIM. KILL HIM. TORTURE HIM. MUTILATE HIM. KILL HIM. TORTURE. MUTILATE. KILL. TORTURE. MUTILATE. KILL. TORTURE. MUTILATE. KILL. TORTURE. MUTILATE. KILL.

This time he will lock that annoying human in the worst prison in the Demonic Realm until his shizuns forget about him.

They attack at the same time. Mu Qingfang yells something, restless and desperate, just as the steel of both swords collide. The two look into each other's eyes for a few seconds, sharing the same hatred. And Xin Mo beats happily in his hands, hungry for blood. The sword moves almost by itself, seeking the cultivator's flesh to pierce through.

The other Peak Lords, minus Yue Qingyuan, fall back to dodge the aggressive waves of qi that shake the earth and the bamboo trees. The sect leader has one hand on his sword.

"Stop!" He orders them. "Shidi, come back immediately."

But Liu Qingge grits his teeth and resists, perhaps sensing that Luo Binghe is tired of forgiving him.

"Lord Luo! Are you going to ignore that it was Shen-shixiong who wanted to be here?"

That's a lie. His shizun is helping him to control his qi and fuels his hopes when his dream of resurrecting Shen Yuan falters. Shizun keeps him company and Luo Binghe watches over him from the shadows until the day he gains his trust. Shizun has never tried to abandon him, it has always been them.

They have put those ideas into Shen Jiu's head.

Perhaps even the disease is a lie. 

Maybe they are the ones who have made him sick.

They are dangerous.

They.

Must.

Disappear.

"Stop!" Someone yells.

But Luo Binghe no longer listens to anyone. He fights with all of his might, seeking not only defeat but Liu Qingge’s submission. When he falls, nothing will stand between him and his shizun.

After exchanging several ferocious blows, Luo Binghe discovers that his opponent's right arm is weaker. So he pursues that side of him, although Liu Qingge tries to dodge him, aware of his weakness. But that arm trembles every time Luo Binghe hits him and he lacks the strength to counterattack.

"Please! Listen to me!"

The demonic sigil on his forehead flashes as he claws victory, pushing his rival into inevitable defeat. Liu Qingge hisses in pain when Xin Mo manages to cut his shoulder, but he moves fast and a serious wound remains a scratch.

"IT'S ABOUT SHEN JIU!"

The steels stop in one last bite that releases a wave of qi. And although their swords are still intertwined, the two turn their heads. Shang Qinghua just appeared in front of the door. He trembles like a little mouse, wringing his hands and pale as snow.

"Shen Jiu is gone!"

Liu Qingge stumbles as Luo Binghe's eyes widen. In his chest beats the hope that Shen Jiu has returned to his palace.

"Where? How?" Liu Qingge turns his back on his rival and furiously walks towards Shang Qinghua, who is screaming pathetically. "WHEN? You were supposed to watch him!"

"But he wanted to leave!"

"No one has seen him leave the sect," Qi Qingqi observes. The other Peak Lords, despite the safe distance, is still there. Their gazes watch over both Luo Binghe and Shang Qinghua.

"Shen Jiu knows secret ways. He..." Shang Qinghua clears his throat. "He used them to sneak out of the sect secretly."

Luo Binghe doesn't know what he is referring to, only that the others seem uncomfortable and Mu Qingfang has paled. The healer is the first to rush into the sect, followed by Liu Qingge.

Without shizun, it makes no sense for him to stay there, although his resentment against Cang Qiong Mountain Sect doesn’t disappear when Luo Binghe opens a portal back to the palace.

He will wait while he makes a decision. Just in case, Luo Binghe invokes Sha Hualing. The demoness appears disheveled and with makeup marks on her neck.

"Gather your troops. Shizun has left Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. Find him and escort him to the palace." Luo Binghe pauses. "The demonic palace."

This strength still needs to be perfected. It will be safer if both shizuns stay in his other home. Sha Hualing leaves after a nervous bow, and Luo Binghe enters his palace to prepare for the transfer of Shen Yuan's inert body to the Demonic Realm. A tense calm surrounds Luo Binghe. Not even his servants dare to make any noise. The tranquility of their Demon Lord is fragile as glass. And they all wait for the moment when it will explode into sharp and deadly shards.

The night falls. And cold covers the rooms of the palace. Sha Hualing returns head down and he smells fear in his general. She has failed. Luo Binghe clasps his hands behind his back. Despite the distance between them, he can feel her pulse rapid like a bird's.

"Where is shizun?"

She throws herself to the ground.

"Master Shen is missing!"

Luo Binghe takes a deep breath. His control melts into threads.

"Cang Qiong Mountain Sect?"

The demoness shakes her head.

"They're looking for him too. That cultivator Liu has organized several search teams."

Fear eats his guts, freezes his bones, and hurts his heart. Luo Binghe digs his nails into his skin as he tries to keep calm. He already lost one shizun, he won't lose the other.

"We will find him before Cang Qiong Mountain Sect," he orders. "Look for that useless spy. I want him to keep an eye on Cang Qiong Mountain Sect's every move. Also, search for rumors in the Demonic Realm."

Luo Binghe has collected many enemies in recent years. Perhaps they have caught Shen Jiu and plan to harm him or hold him hostage. Xin Mo purrs at the idea and Luo Binghe promises that he will hand over anyone who has dared to kidnap his shizun.

While Sha Hualing looks for Shen Jiu and Mobei-jun protects Shen Yuan while transporting him to the demon palace, Luo Binghe returns to his room. And on his bed of icy sheets, he closes his eyes to use his dreaming abilities and search the mind of his shizun.

Many months have passed since he last tried. Luo Binghe frowns. He can't find him. Shen Jiu's consciousness is mute and he cannot summon him even with a false dream. A bitter taste slides down his throat as he insists over and over again.

Someone has blocked his mind.

Or shizun has forbidden him to enter inside his head.

Dawn slides across the sky after a night in which the calm has gradually cracked. Humans and demons are searching for the missing cultivator. There are no rumors. He is also not hiding in the sect. Luo Binghe's enemies stay in their hiding places and laugh without acknowledging the authorship of the disappearance.

Shizun is not there.

Before he had two, now none.

Shen Yuan is frozen like a corpse and Shen Jiu can no longer warm his hope or repair his meridians. The venom in Xin Mo's voice tinged his eyes with despair. He must find his shizun. If he is hurt, he will heal him. If he is dead, he will resurrect him.

But he must find him soon, before anyone else. Either the humans will burn his body or they will keep whispering more lies. Or the demons will eat his corpse and send their pieces to him.

It's all Cang Qiong Mountain Sect's fault. They kidnapped him. They broke his promises, betrayed his word, made him lower his guard with promises of cooperation.

Everything is the fault of the rebellious demons, of that rotten world, of the thousand fronts that he has open and that he can no longer control.

Maybe... it's his fault too.

Have you already noticed? Your shizun is running away from you. No one has kidnapped him, he abandoned the sect he has hidden. You should have given him your blood when you could.

His breathing is ragged. Luo Binghe's chest aches, as if all the shards of that broken peace have sunk into his heart. Stupid. He has been stupid and naive. Shizun has abandoned him.

But he has Shen Yuan, why doesn't shizun come back?

Why has shizun abandoned his sect as well?

There must be something else, right?

Where are you? Luo Binghe thinks, suffocated by stress.

Shizun must be injured and that's why he doesn't come back.

Idiot. Your shizun has fooled all of you. He learned to protect his mind from your powers and used cultivators to distract you. Don't you see the evidence? Your shizun is cunning, a dangerous animal, not an adorable kitten. You should have tamed him, chained him up, and made him love you. And I can help you.

Luo Binghe covers his face with both hands.

And he yeLLS UNTIL HIS THROAT HURT.

 

A week has passed and shizun is still missing. Sha Hualing says that none of his enemies have made any moves and the cultivators have also found no signs of demons nearby. Shang Qinghua assures him, trembling and in a shrill voice, that it was Shen Jiu who decided to leave and even prepared a bag with supplies. Mobei-jun warns him that if he continues to waste his power in preserving Shen Yuan's body in the end his qi will spiral out of control.

And Xin Mo talks nonstop, whispers to him at night, his screams echoing inside his head. His voice is increasingly tempting and dangerous, a sweet promise to erase all his worries.

"Mobilize the army," Luo Binghe orders his generals, gather in his war room. "If shizun is running, I'll make him come back."

"Will we attack Cang Qiong Mountain Sect?" Shang Qinghua, the useless spy, asks almost hidden behind Mobei-jun's bulk.

And Luo Binghe smirks.

"No. Catch all the monsters and send out all the rogue demons. Let them face my enemies. I will weaken them without wasting my strength." The Demon Lord contemplates the map spread out on the table. "We will start to conquer the Human Realm."

And shizun will no longer be able to hide anywhere.

Someone knocks on the door and enters a former disciple of the Huan Hua Palace who decided to switch sides and serve him. The human kneels.

"My Lord, Xiao Gongzhu has returned with the woman you were looking for."

Chapter End Notes

CURIOSITY #1
It would be a shame... if Black Bingbing lost control when Shen Jiu was improving, right? >:3

Ironically, I wanted the next chapter to be lighter and funnier, but I'm not so sure anymore...

BONUS
On a typical day in any city, several posters cover the walls of the houses.
Poster 1: Lost kitten. Responds to the name of Shen Jiu. If you find him, call Can Qiong Mountain Sect.
Poster 2: Lost kitten. He is sad and confused because he has lost his brother. He belongs to the Demon Lord. Great reward.
Poster 3: Lost kitten. He likes fans. He scratches a lot. Bai Zhan Peak War God is looking for him.
Poster 4: New Edition of Liu Su Mian Hua's Novel Saga! The beautiful immortal cultivator runs away from his two lovers, who will find him and ****** first?

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu doesn't want to be found

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Luo Binghe's facade is fragile like cracked glass. The demon holds all his fragments behind an empty expression when he goes with Qiu Haitang. She will only see the darkness from several days of fruitless searching, his fear turned into a rage instead of insecurity, his weak and trembling heart after being abandoned by shizun again.

Qui Haitang awaits him along with Xiao Gongzhu. One of the women looks restless and nervous, the other proud. Luo Binghe watches them as Xin Mo tempts him with sweet murders. One accused Shen Jiu, the other wounded Shen Yuan. Perhaps both are the reason why his shizun has left and is not coming back.

No one will miss them if they disappear.

"Go away," he ordered Xiao Gongzhu with a voice hoarse and sharp as his sword.

Perhaps he roughly expels her because she is dangerous and selfish and should not listen to his conversation with Qiu Haitang. Or maybe because Luo Binghe knows that he wishes to hurt her. No excuses, just for the pleasure of breaking bones and tearing muscle until all the darkness that makes him feel sad, lonely, and miserable is relieved.

The woman purses her lips in fury and humiliation. The dethroned princess hasn’t yet accepted that she is now just a shadow to fulfill his whims. She leaves without whispering another word, leaving them alone.

Qiu Haitang wrings her hands, unable to meet the Demon Lord's gaze even though a year ago she desperately sought him out to tell her story. And he made the mistake of not listening to her.

“My lord,” she mutters respectfully. “Did you want to see this humble one?”

Luo Binghe nods with a grunt. He approaches her with predatory steps. His gaze is also hungry: for information, to try to get closer to that shizun that he finds so hard to understand.

"You disappeared when Shen Jiu rescued his brother and rejected all accusations. Why? Where did you go?"

The woman bows her head. Like Xiao Gongzhu, she also had her little palace and her haven of riches. But they burned. Unlike Xiao Gongzhu, she has already accepted that her life has irretrievably changed, although Qiu Haitang continues to cling to those threads of her past that have become tangled in painful knots.

"This humble one was taken aback by Master Shen's words and I decided to investigate whether they were true or not."

For the first time in many days, Luo Binghe draws a sincere smile.

"Follow me, miss. This Lord will be delighted to hear you."

A year later Qiu Haitang hadn't changed at all: she was still desperate for someone to hear her story and feel sorry for her.

Luo Binghe led her to his office to enjoy a private conversation. Although he orders tea and pastries to be served to make the woman feel comfortable, he also makes sure that his silent talismans are active. No one else should know those secrets.

"In your opinion, miss," he says, fiddling with his cup. "The man you are looking for and my shizun are or are they not the same person?"

Qiu Haitang takes a deep breath. Her discomfort is reflected in her tense posture and the force with which she clenches her fists.

"Physically they look alike as if they were family... or the same person."

"But many years have passed since the last time you saw each other," he observes.

"I know! But A-Jiu was my fiancé. He was always with me. I know him very well... I used to know him very well." She corrects herself, spitting out the words bitterly.

And Luo Binghe listens to her as envy burns inside his chest, black flames suffocating his hungry heart.

"You think my shizun was your fiancé." Although he tries to control himself, his words are deep roars, typical of a wild animal. "No. My mistake, sorry, miss. You think my shizun is your slave."

For the first time, she lifts her head and looks into his eyes with the echo of past arrogance.

"My family released A-Jiu."

But Luo Binghe prefers to think of slaves rather than fiances, although both words leave a bitter aftertaste in his mouth. His shizun belongs to no one (only him). But there is still a lot that he doesn't understand and that is why he needs to listen to Qiu Haitang, even if he doesn't want to accept her truths as real.

"Besides, they have the same name," she mutters under her breath. "What I don't understand is why he now has a brother. A-Jiu was alone, we were his only family. We would know if there had been another child identical to him! Of course, we would have freed him too! We were going to be family!"

Luo Binghe drums his fingers on the table. And he frowns, fully aware of the differences between his two shizuns. It wouldn't surprise him if they had been raised in different environments.

"You've been researching for a year, what have you found?"

"Nothing," she acknowledges as she ducks her head. "But it is suspicious. I wanted to investigate the origins of the sect leader Yue to search for Master Shen's family. But I haven’t found anything: not a house, not a city, not names. I’m sure, my Lord: my A-Jiu and Master Shen is the same person." She takes a deep breath. "But I don't know who his brother is, or what family he belongs to or why sect leader Yue is involved... Because he is involved. Perhaps Master Shen is blackmailing him to use him as an alibi."

"It's an interesting mystery, miss." Luo Binghe acknowledges with a thoughtful expression. "Are you sure my shizun massacred your family?"

"Of course!"

"But my shizun loved you, didn't he?" Al Demon Lord is unable to contain the sarcasm from his voice. "And you were very attentive and kind to him, why would my shizun kill your brother?"

Qiu Haitang closed her eyes, thus hiding her deep sadness.

"I don't know," she acknowledged in a whisper fainter than an echo.

"What if it wasn't him?"

"Are you talking about Wu Yanzi?"

Luo Binghe had already forgotten that that unknown man also had his role in that tangled story.

"Do you have solid evidence for the presence of Wu Yanzi or just tales and rumors?" She looks at him indignantly, but her silence is an eloquent response. "This Lord thinks it was my shizun's real family who killed yours, miss."

Qiu Haitan's eyes widen in surprise.

"What are you talking about?"

"I have always known that my two shizuns were very different from each other. I wouldn’t be surprised to find that Shen Yuan was happily raised with his family while Shen Jiu was abandoned. Or perhaps kidnapped to be sold as a slave." Luo Binghe again taps his fingers with rhythmic strokes. "Shizun is graceful as a noble. A powerful family has powerful enemies. That might explain why they grew up apart... and why they eliminated your family to get Shen Jiu back."

Qiu Haitang bites her lip. And he doesn’t need words to know that she regrets having been a naive child during that time.

"I was unaware of my brother and father's affairs," she acknowledges with a sigh. "But if they had threatened us, I think I would have noticed."

"Miss, if you married Shen Jiu he would become part of your family."

"Why then did they leave me alive?" Tears pool in her eyes. "Why take my loved ones away from me if I was the problem!?"

"Maybe my shizun interceded for you. Did it ever seem strange to you that only you survived?"

Although she opens her mouth, she only mutters strangled noises that are mistaken for sobs. Luo Binghe takes his cup of tea and drinks for the first time.

"Maybe Wu Yanzi is just a rumor," he continues to unravel his theories. "A powerful family can erase their trace. That's why you can't find them. They used Wu Yanzi's excuse to hide the truth."

Luo Binghe speaks with ice confidence: cold, but that the sun can melt. However, he prefers to appease a possible enemy of his shizun and avoid a disaster like another trial. In addition, his theory would fit into that mystery marked by contradictions. Luo Binghe's expression darkens. The nightmares are one of the most striking differences between the two shizuns: Shen Yuan doesn’t have any and Shen Jiu suffers too many.

The life of one has always been happy and the other has endured the hardships of slavery.

Luo Binghe's blood bubbles and burns, seething with rage against that rotten world. Humans hurt his shizun, that's why Shen Jiu warned him when he was little. I’ll promise you, shizun, he thinks as he clenches his fist and the cup explodes into pieces. I will create a better world for us. Even though some porcelain shards have been stuck in his hand, Luo Binghe doesn't react. The pain from the cuts is paltry compared to the injuries from his past.

He also knew cruelty and harm when he was little. The Demon Lord finds it easy to empathize with his shizun: perhaps their stories are more similar than they seemed. But he had a kind mother, who cared for and protected him, while Shen Jiu was alone until he was adopted by the Qiu.

Thanks to that gesture, Luo Binghe ignores his jealousy and allows his shizun's former fiancée to leave with a generous reward. And the promise that if she finds more information she will look for him again.

Luo Binghe planned to conquer the Human Realm with the support and advice of his shizun, but now he has no choice but to use it to force him back. And after talking to Qiu Haitang, now his ideas have been clarified.

He will eliminate poverty and slavery. He will make the rich and powerful pay for their crimes.

 

 

As humans and demons search for the lost cultivator, Shen Jiu hides behind a bamboo hat and black robes. Four months after his escape they still repeat the same description: green clothes like bamboo, a fan, and the elegant attitude of a scholar.

The first thing he did upon leaving the sect was to dress up as a rogue cultivator. No one will mistake the virtuous Shen Qingqiu for someone who seems to be playing with demonic cultivation.

Shen Jiu is tired of waiting, of the fatigue that covers his head with fog and freezes his bones, of feeling insignificant and that is why he has decided to search for Shen Yuan. Armed with Mu Qingfang's list of places where he may be buried, he travels without stopping and ignoring the convulsions of a shaken world.

Aware of the persecution, Shen Jiu avoids the inns and prefers to stay in the brothels. Someone like Liu Qingge will never dare to enter there and Luo Binghe was too young when he used to visit the Warm Red Pavilion. Also, brothels are the best places to pay attention to rumors.

"Did you hear? The Demon Lord has also conquered Shang Hu City. His army is now heading to Jinlan City."

"I'm scared when they get here! They say his army is made up of humans and demons alike."

"Oh, but he hasn't destroyed any of those cities. The Demon Lord appropriates the treasures but allows the citizens to get on with their lives. He has even meted out justice."

"Everyone knows that the Demon Lord is looking for his shizun."

But Shen Jiu doesn’t walk through cities but forests and places rich in spiritual energy. Although Luo Binghe is cornering him, he can still wander safely.

"Oh! Have you read the new volume of the Resentment of Chunshan ?"

Shen Jiu nearly choked on his liquor. After retrieving Shen Yuan, he will find the infamous Liu Su Mian Hua and tear off her fingers one by one. His cheeks burn as he remembers the hideous obscenities he once read by mistake. Since then, he has always destroyed all the horrible books, no matter how suspicious they are.

"Of course!"

"Sometimes I wonder if the story is real or just fiction... They say that both the Demon Lord and the War God are very handsome and powerful."

"And Master Shen is a beauty matched only by his brother."

"I don't understand why he is running away from his lovers. They are both desperately in love with him."

"Well, according to the books, maybe two lovers are too much for poor Master Shen."

Shen Jiu is tense and wishes to get up to escape from that terrible conversation.

"Despite the rivalry between the two, why doesn't the War God prevent the Demon Lord from conquering us? What are the great cultivation sects doing!?"

"I have heard that the Cang Qiong Sect is busy fighting the terrifying monsters that lay siege to the mountain. They have even had to evacuate the nearest villages."

"Oh what dangerous times we live in!"

Shen Jiu pays and leaves the brothel while sighing. Although he decided to cut ties with his sect, something inside his chest trembles and suffers upon hearing the rumors. Shen Jiu grits his teeth and walks almost running, although, in reality, he tries to flee from his desire to return.

But it was the only way to protect them from Luo Binghe's rage. He has already brought them too much trouble. It's better if he disappears. Perhaps his life was never destined for sect greatness. Shen Jiu is aware of being a terrible person and an even worse shizun. Luo Binghe is a problem that he has raised and allowed to grow without ever trying to stop him. Not even now.

He will already decide what to do when he gets Shen Yuan back. His brother is better Shen Qingqiu than him and can stay at Qing Jing Peak while he looks for a quiet place to rest without being disturbed by anyone else ever again. However, during the nights, Shen Jiu thinks back to Luo Binghe's obsession. He must act before Shen Yuan returns, but he always puts it off for another day.

And so four months of escaping and without results have disappeared.

Shen Jiu is heading through an area near the demonic border. Those lonely and wild roads, where there are not even thieves, are a balm for the wounds of his heart. He allows himself to rest and forget the world behind him.

It is almost sunset when a shout breaks the silence.

Shen Jiu turns with a heavy heart to discover one of the men who are looking for him with wide eyes and bright with disbelief at finally finding him. And he, without allowing him to say anything, turns and runs as fast as he can.

Chapter End Notes

Let's bet! Do you think it will be Liu Qingge or Luo Binghe? Which of the two do you want it to be? 👀

Shen Jiu is found

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

“SHEN QINGQIU!”

It's been a long time since Shen Jiu hears Liu Qingge screaming that name. His frustration is an echo of a past rage and Shen Jiu runs quicker, not looking back and hardly breathing. Instantly, he hears the metallic hiss of a sword being drawn. And although he tries to run faster than the wind, Cheng Luan is a flash that reaches him in a few seconds.

Shen Jiu stumbles when Liu Qingge cuts his way. Without hesitation, he turns his back on him to avoid him. However, before regaining the distance between them, his annoying shidi grabs his wrist.

"Stop running!" He hisses, pulling him back.

But Shen Jiu growls as he shakes his arm to free himself. His abrupt movement causes Liu Qingge to lose his balance and trip off the sword. And although he falls, at no time does he let go of him. Shen Jiu protests when Liu Qingge collapses on top of him and the two end up on the ground. The hit against his head and back is dry but less annoying than when Liu Qingge's body crushes his.

"Stupid shidi!" He splutters as he tries to push him away. "Leave me alone!"

But his expression darkens with a frown. With precise movements, Liu Qingge catches both of his wrists ignoring his snorts and furious hisses. Shen Jiu ends up trapped against the ground, Liu Qingge's weight pinning him down as he holds his arms against his chest.

"I've been looking for you for months." His voice is hoarse and awakens in Shen Jiu a tremor as he remembers the last time they saw each other. "No one knew anything about you. We were afraid something had happened to you... Why do you keep running away?"

His eyes are red and wet. Shen Jiu gulps and avoids him looking away.

"I have to search for A-Yuan," he mutters with the confidence of a lie repeated a thousand times.

"We can look for him together! Why haven't you told us anything for these months? We didn't even know if you were alive!"

Liu Qingge's voice trembles on the verge of fragmenting. Shen Jiu also feels those same cracks ripping through him as his self-control falls apart, breaks, crumbles like a sandcastle.

"What I do is none of your business, shidi," he answers coldly, trying to sit up, although that brings him even closer to Liu Qingge. "A-Yuan is my responsibility. And so is Luo Binghe. It's better if I keep my distance from the sect to avoid problems for you."

"And you couldn't even have explained it to us?" Liu Qingge holds his wrists even tighter. "You left without saying goodbye or any warning. And you disappeared for months while we were all looking for you. I never believed you were a coward, Shen Jiu."

That accusation makes him stiffen. Shen Jiu grits his teeth as he glares at him.

"You can't accuse me of anything, shidi. You abandoned me first!"

"That is not true!"

"Oh, and will you also deny that you don't care about me? I know. I'm not the nice one. I'm nasty, unpleasant, and spiteful." Shen Jiu spits out the words without hiding that acidity that poisons his voice and eyes. "Oh, please, I'm not an idiot. You all hated me before A-Yuan appeared. You too, shidi. I’m the hateful Shen Qingqiu, the scum of Cang Qiong Peak..."

"Shut up." Liu Qingge interrupts him with an expression ranging from dumbfounded to horrified. "What are you talking about?"

"Don't be an idiot now! You didn't come back after finding out that A-Yuan was alive!"

"Because I was hurt!"

Shen Jiu's eyes widen in confusion.

"What?" He splutters out of breath.

"Your damn disciple hurt me the second time I went after you." Liu Qingge closes his eyes and Shen Jiu tries to ignore that stabbing pain that pierces his head. He doesn't remember a second time. Only the failure of the first and the rescue a year later.

It's a lie. But Liu Qingge never lies. And his expression is determined when he looks into his eyes again.

"I'm sorry. I couldn't go back. The sect didn't let me either because... you weren't well, Shen Jiu." Liu Qingge takes a deep breath. "You are as important to us as Shen Yuan. Have you forgotten? Your disciples sent you letters every month because they were worried about you. Mu Qingfang negotiated with that beast to be able to visit you and help you. Shang Qinghua has taken care of your peak in your absence. Even that disgusting demon is conquering the world to find you! "

Gently, Liu Qingge releases his wrists. And after hesitating, he hugs him. It's been so long that Shen Jiu trembles at being engulfed by someone else's affection. It is a pleasant warmth that pierces his bones and soothes his heart.

"I've missed you," Liu Qingge whispers, his voice wet with tears.

Shen Jiu closes his eyes before holding onto him and crying. All the wounds and scars that Mu Qingfang showed him months ago with his words hurt again. It's a ghostly ache in his chest, inside his head, in his fingers digging into his clothes.

"I'm sorry..." He splutters. "I couldn't go back because..."

Because he was afraid of the cold of an empty house, of looking into the eyes of others and seeing Shen Yuan's reflection. To discover that everyone still hated him. That everyone would have preferred him to be the one who was dead. The fear of not knowing how to solve Luo Binghe's problem because one wrong word could arouse hatred in him.

Shen Jiu trembles and Liu Qingge hugs him tighter. For a few minutes, neither of them say anything. They just stand still and silent, comforted by the beating of their hearts.

 

 

They find an abandoned house near a swamp. Their silence soon occupies the dusty interior until there is barely room for them. Shen Jiu covers his face with his bamboo hat, embarrassed by his red eyes and disheveled appearance. Liu Qingge looks at him without saying anything, but there is a concern in his gaze that doesn’t need words to reach him.

"Let's rest here tonight," Shen Jiu orders, desperate to keep control of the situation.

"Tomorrow..."

"Tomorrow we will decide what we will do."

He immediately regrets interrupting him with such a brusque and unpleasant voice. Hiding after an aggressive attitude is a bad habit that he cannot get rid of yet. Shen Jiu bites his lip before sighing and ducking his head in apology.

"Sorry. It's just that... I need time."

"It's okay, I will wait." Liu Qingge examines the room with his arms folded, though he quickly looks back at him. "But whatever you decide, I will go with you. You are no longer alone, Shen Jiu, please don't forget it."

Until Shen Yuan's arrival, he was always alone. Liu Qingge's promise is as warm as terrifying. It makes him happy, but also insecure. Shen Jiu has forgotten what it's like to behave around other people. With Shen Yuan was complicated, but he no longer remembers how it happened. Suddenly, Mu Qingfang's words echo in his head.

Trust.

Shen Jiu takes a deep breath. Trusting Liu Qingge doesn't seem complicated. Maybe because deep down he already wants to do it. He is terrified of trusting the wrong person, but Liu Qingge inspires security.

What did Mu Qingfang say to him? Small steps. Tiny changes. Shen Jiu can start by trusting Shen Yuan and Liu Qingge before trying with the others.

"Rest, shidi. I'll take the first watch."

"I can meditate."

Shen Jiu shakes his head.

"I need time to think."

He needs silence and solitude to face his thoughts and make a decision. Liu Qingge understands as he nods without insisting. That night, Liu Qingge rests in a corner with his eyes closed and legs crossed, while Shen Jiu sits at the entrance to the wooden house. His gaze is lost in the sky, reddish by the presence of the Demon Realm. Its stars are more golden, the clouds are blacker. But the cold that stalks him is born from his bones.

When they broke their embrace, Liu Qingge asked him what he wanted to do.

But there is a gulf between what he should do and what he wants. Shen Jiu digs his nails into his sleeves, restless. He knows that Liu Qingge will accompany him to search for Shen Yuan perhaps until the end of the world. But that won’t solve the problem of Luo Binghe nor the situation of the sect. Shen Jiu has been aware of their covert warfare, but he kept running out of cowardice. It is his responsibility and he should return, but then Luo Binghe will prevent him from continuing to search for Shen Yuan.

And the truth is that... he is afraid to face Luo Binghe. Shen Jiu always tells himself that he must do something with his obsession, with his sword, with his hunger for power, but he never thinks of solutions. He just runs, runs, runs, aware that he has fueled Luo Binghe's darkness by hiding the truth about Shen Yuan from him. This tense and fragile situation is his fault and no one else's.

Shen Jiu has tried to ignore it, but the monster he has created has grown immense.

 

 

When Liu Qingge wakes up, a hazy light comes through the windows and there is weight over him. Confused, he opens his eyes to find Shen Jiu snuggled against him, his face buried in the crook of his neck and almost sitting on his lap. His legs tingle after so many hours in that position, in addition to the extra weight on them. But Liu Qingge ignores his discomfort, only aware of the heat that burns inside his chest until it reaches his face.

Unconsciously, he tries to get up even though that means pushing Shen Jiu to the ground.

"WHAT ARE YOU DOING?" He splutters while the other grumbles rubbing his eyes.

"Sleep, shidi. Or trying to sleep," Shen Jiu growls. "Do you know how many nights I've been without sleep, you inconsiderate brute? Why can't you just let me rest?"

Shen Jiu sits up amid furious yawns. Liu Qingge looks at him dumbfounded by his impudence and still with that pleasant warmth hugging his body.

He decides to wait before asking him about his decision.

A shichen later, back on the abandoned roads, Shen Jiu finally speaks to him again.

"We return to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect, but I don't want to attract anyone's attention." Anyone means Luo Binghe. "We will go slow and avoid cities. Will shidi be discreet for the first time in his life?"

Liu Qingge smiles helplessly. He had missed Shen Jiu's malice. His cheeky attitude is better than sadness. Hopefully, he will soon regain his past strength. Liu Qingge still has nightmares about the frail and tired Shen Jiu that he encountered in the palace.

"I'm not the one they're looking for," he points out. "Will my shixiong not attract any demons?"

Shen Jiu's eyes widen in surprise as his ears turn pink. He mutters an offended groan at that word before regaining his composure.

"I have proven to be discreet. Everyone knew where the War God was, but no one knew where this master was." He takes off his bamboo hat and approaches Liu Qingge with a mischievous glint in his eyes. "You should dress up, shidi."

Shen Jiu delicately places the hat on him. His fingers brush strands of hair away from his face, and Liu Qingge’s heart almost stops as they brush his cheeks.

"Much better," he announces, pulling away with satisfaction. "We must hide your beauty, shidi, or everyone will notice you."

As in the past, Shen Jiu always has the last word.

Liu Qingge is grateful that that stupid bamboo hat hides his embarrassed expression.

 

 

Used to his bad luck, Shen Jiu should have imagined that everything was going to end wrong. But he has been fooled by Liu Qingge's presence during those days of travel. His heart sank whenever he disappeared to hunt and then breathed in relief when Liu Qingge returned with a defeated monster. The nights became more pleasant as he took refuge in him and slept with the same serenity as the day he rescued him. (Although shame prevents Shen Jiu from recognizing Liu Qingge as an effective remedy for his insomnia.)

But those days of peace end as abruptly as the wall of ice that cuts their way. They both turn: Liu Qingge with his hand on Cheng Luan's hilt and him with a racing pulse.

"I finally found you, shizun."

Luo Binghe stands next to Mobei-jun. His smile is more satisfied than happy and Shen Jiu shivers while raising an arm to stop Liu Qingge before he is reckless.

"Luo Binghe," he acknowledges, tilting his head. "It's been a long time."

"Shizun, come back with me."

The Demon Lord extends a hand towards him in an almost pleading gesture. Shen Jiu closes his eyes. He can no longer run away. It is the moment of truth, to face his fears, of everything he abandoned.

"No. This Master has to do something. I..." He takes a deep breath before lifting his head and looking into his eyes. "I'm sorry. I shouldn't have left while you stupidly fought. This Master made a mistake and I was too cowardly to fix it."

"Shizun is not a coward."

"Don't contradict me, Luo Binghe." Shen Jiu sighs. "It is fortunate that we met today. I return to the sect. I’m still Qing Jing Peak Master and have delayed my duties for too long. And then, this Master will leave again to complete his mission."

Luo Binghe squints his eyes suspiciously.

"What mission, shizun?"

His mistrust crushes his lungs, fills his mouth with the taste of dust. Shen Jiu doesn't say anything. He cannot trust Luo Binghe. It’s too scary, risky, and dangerous.

Shen Jiu can perfectly see how something breaks in the Demon Lord's gaze.

“Mobei-Jun.”

Ice chaos shakes the road. Fang-like icebergs grow between them. Shen Jiu hisses furiously as he tries to keep his balance. He doesn't have time to worry about Liu Qingge, as Luo Binghe appears before him in a dark blur. Shen Jiu curses having relegated Liu Qingge for the past few days as he kept Xiu Ya as a precaution in his storage. But since Luo Binghe also does not draw Xin Mo, he uses martial arts to avoid him.

"Luo Binghe, stop!" He screams angrily.

But his wayward disciple ignores him once more. Luo Binghe catches his wrist and drags him towards him. Shen Jiu hits him with an open palm, managing to free himself. That only infuriates him even more. The Demon Lord's expression darkens. A wave of demonic qi hits Shen Jiu against the ice wall. The shock almost takes his breath away. With one arm he holds him against the ice, demonic qi devouring his every time he tries to defend himself. Shen Jiu watches as Luo Binghe puts a hand to his mouth and bites to blood.

Fear is as cold as the ice in which he is trapped.

"Don't you dare, Luo Binghe!"

But the Demon Lord immobilizes him with his weight and forces his jaw to open. Shen Jiu hisses as those fingers are forced in and demon blood slides down his throat. He digs his nails into Luo Binghe's arm and his wrist trying to scratch him, but he doesn't turn away from him or stop.

"I'm sorry, shizun. But you haven't left me any other alternative."

And his body collapses into Luo Binghe's arms. There is a panic scream stuck in his throat as he realizes that he is trapped in his own body. His limbs fall limp, he can't even move his head. Luo Binghe carries him like a doll, holding him carefully so as not to hurt him.

"Mobei-Jun," he calls out to his servant.

And the two disappear into the shadows while Shen Jiu hears Liu Qingge's yelling anguished his name.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Shen Jiu: We were discovered because of you, stupid shidi! You draw too much attention!
Liu Qingge: It's your fault for giving me your hat!
Shen Jiu: I thought it was a good idea to hide your shining beauty!
Liu Qingge: Of course everyone is going to notice your perfect features now!
Bingbing: Seriously? Flirting in front of my *salad?

CURIOSITY #1
Relapse is common in therapy (I hope I spelled it correctly in English!). The most important thing about therapy is that thanks to the tools that Mu Qingfang taught him, Shen Jiu has been able to recover this time quicker and return to the path of healing. This chapter has been very important to his recovery!!

CURIOSITY #2
Bingjiu arc is about... their mistrust problems. Now neither of them trusts the other, making dangerous decisions and new mistakes. *hehehehehehehehehe*

Author, drinking chocolate: How to avoid a ship war? The solution is that Shen Jiu meets both of them. I hope you are all happy now 😁💚💚

*the salad is Mobei-Jun

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu's anger is worse than the Demon Lord's

Chapter Notes

I never imagined that a 100% self-indulgent story would receive more than 3k kudos. Thank you very much for all your support ¡w¡

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Trapped in his prison of flesh and blood, Shen Jiu only recognizes shadows and flashes rather than seeing the entire landscape. The shapes around them are familiar, but the air smells different and the sky is reddish. It is not the palace that he knows, but perhaps another one in the Demon Realm.

Fury runs through Shen Jiu's body when he tries to look at Luo Binghe.

"Release me," he hisses with difficulty. Even his jaw and tongue are numb from those chains tangled in his blood.

To his surprise, Luo Binghe breaks his control, restoring the mobility of his own body. Still, Shen Jiu is furious when he pulls away from him and his feet touch the ground. Knowing that his parasites roam freely inside him makes him feel dirty, that something very important has been stolen from him.

He doesn't hesitate when he slaps Luo Binghe.

"Take them away."

Luo Binghe brings a hand slowly to his face. There is a scratch on his left cheek and his fingers caress the wound in disbelief. However, he sighs before looking at him and ignoring the anger that floods his eyes.

"I'm glad shizun is better."

"I'm not better, I'm furious," he growls. "Luo Binghe, take away your damn parasites."

"No."

His answer doesn't surprise him, but it coldly disappoints him while a false calm settles in his body.

"Neither A-Yuan nor I educate you to behave like a beast, Luo Binghe," he mutters the words one by one to spit them out angrily.

Shen Jiu doesn't mind that his expression darkens. Because Luo Binghe's anger will only be a tenth of his.

"Shizun had disappeared. This disciple was very worried about Shizun," he replies in a cutting voice. "Despite all my efforts, shizun never came back. Now I will always know where shizun is."

"Where I am and what I do is none of your business, Luo Binghe!!"

"I was worried that someone would have hurt you! But no. You were with Liu-shishu," he adds spitefully as if that is the worst of all his crimes.

"This Master can be with whoever he wants and no disciple can prevent him."

They both look at each other in silence, aware that their bond between master-disciple is knotted and twisted.

After a pause, Luo Binghe sighs.

"I will show shizun his new rooms."

"No, Luo Binghe. I'm leaving."

"No. The Demon Realm is dangerous and these days the rebels have become bolder. I will allow shizun to come out when the situation is safest... and I can trust you."

His words infuriate him even more.

"I'm not your pet! You can't decide what to do or where I want to be or who will be with me."

Luo Binghe has the nerve to smile.

"Right. You are not a pet, but my shizun."

In the end, the two walk in tense silence, sharp as a thousand thorns. Disarmed from his power of choice and freedom, Shen Jiu ignores him disdainfully. He barely reacts when Luo Binghe guides him to a small palace surrounded by bamboo. Although that ambitious part of him appreciates luxury and beauty, his anger only sees a beautiful cage, a horrible and cruel prison.

The palace is clean and reminiscent of his bamboo house. Shen Jiu, hiding his thoughts behind a cold grimace, recognizes the belongings that he had forgotten in the other palace. Although he has never been to that place, Luo Binghe has built it in such a way that he unconsciously feels it as a possible home.

Shen Yuan's body rests limp and covered in frost in an icy room.

His heart trembles at the thought of the brother he has lost and that he will soon return. He has missed him more than anyone. Unable to continue staring at his corpse, Shen Jiu turns and continues to examine the palace. Luo Binghe follows him like a puppy waiting for his approval. But the cheerful little dog has bitten him where it hurts the most and Shen Jiu will not forgive him even in exchange for all the riches in the world.

He thinks of Shen Yuan again. And in Liu Qingge’s words. And in all the memories that his illness blurred. A year ago, he lived in a room that was never for Shen Yuan since he had his own. Now, they both have their palace.

Shen Jiu has been so blind that only now he understands the magnitude of Luo Binghe's obsession with the two of them.

Unable to continue ignoring the trouble he has created, Shen Jiu turns to Luo Binghe with his arms crossed.

"This Master is going to enjoy a hot bath. I want to see you at noon."

"This disciple will prepare the food."

"Do what you want. We will eat together and talk." His gaze obliterates the Demon Lord's smile. "Because this Master is very disappointed in you, Luo Binghe."

The palace has its servants, but Shen Jiu dismisses them with a gesture. Because he is not a pretty possession and even if he is locked up, at least he will try to impose his rules. And he still remembers how easy it was to let them treat him like a doll when he didn't have the energy to rebuild his life.

After so many months wandering the world like a faceless shadow, Shen Jiu allows himself to rest in an aromatic bath. Although the hot water relaxes his muscles and eliminates the smell of mud and plants that had clung to his skin, there are thoughts inside his head buzzing like flies.

Worry accompanies him when he dresses in elegant robes, green like bamboo, but all decorated with red or black threads. Luo Binghe’s symbols. Perhaps later he will tear them off or demand that his former disciple give him other clothes that don’t make him feel like property. Among the objects that he finds in the room, the thing that most excites him is the fans. He had missed having one, but it was the first thing he removed from his appearance to avoid being recognized.

Shen Jiu is hiding behind a fan when Luo Binghe returns.

The Demon Lord has prepared an excessive banquet for two people. And even though the appetizing smell and bright colors of the food make him hungry, Shen Jiu stands his ground to not lose his motivation between bites. He pours little food on his plate and then looks at his disciple. Luo Binghe doesn't hide his nervousness, nor the useless and feeble hope that this charade would work.

"Where do I begin?" Shen Jiu takes the chopsticks. "First, Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. This Master is aware of all the rumors about the strange beasts that stalk his sect. Your sect, Luo Binghe." He doesn't ask if it's his fault because they both know it. Annoyed, he looks at his face, searching in his features shame and regret. "Fix-it. Apologize to Yue Qingyuan. And pay compensation for all the damage your childish attitude has caused them."

Shen Jiu watches Luo Binghe swallow hard. But he prevents him from speaking with more cutting words.

"Second, the Demon Realm. This Master acknowledges his ignorance of demon society. But since I stayed in your other palace, you have always been busy fighting them. And now, several months later, you are warning me about rebels and dangers." He pauses and Luo Binghe trembles, preparing for the next blow. "Why are you wasting your time in a stupid war? Enlighten this Master, Luo Binghe."

"If I rule demons, the fights between humans and demons will end. No more skinners, no more sowers."

"It seems that you know even less than this Master about demons. Or the world. Reality is complex, Luo Binghe. Imposing your tyranny will never be the solution." But Shen Yuan told him about the heavenly demons. Shen Jiu sighs. "Is that really your motivation, Luo Binghe? Or is it your desire for fame and recognition? It was you who desired this palace or those stupid demons who started to venerate you as a god for your blood?"

"I..." Luo Binghe takes a deep breath before looking into his eyes with determination. "Humans will always reject me for my demon heritage."

"But you are still at war. Is it because the demons also reject you because of your human blood? Or because you have wanted to impose your existence?"

"The Demon Realm is more dangerous than human’s, shizun. Our society is built on strength and control."

"But you could have built a small house in a quiet place and defended your territory instead of striving to be emperor, Luo Binghe."

"That way I will never change the world, shizun." Luo Binghe looks sincere and tired when he raises his head. "I want a world that accepts me despite my nature."

Shen Jiu sighs even though he can understand that desire to fix an unfair and imperfect world. And deep down, secretly, he admires Luo Binghe's determination. Despite his origins, he only fought to reach the top without changing anything. He didn’t try despite getting the power to do it. Because he lost hope before he even learned to walk.

"You're wrong, Binghe," he mutters. "The most important thing to change the world is not power, but will." Shen Jiu shakes his head, embarrassed at speaking nonsense. "What this Master means is that there is no use in dominating demons as long as there is still a wedge between the two races."

"I know."

"And here comes the third point: the Human Realm." Shen Jiu pauses to eat. "You haven't even finished the war against one race and have already divided your forces to face the other? Did you fall asleep in our classes?" Shen Jiu eats more to calm his moodiness. "Now what? Will you enforce the presence of demons in the cities you have conquered? They see you as a demon. A demon that brings more demons and has annihilated one of the major cultivation sects. Why do you think that the best way to achieve peace between the two races was with war? "

When they hear noises and screams, Shen Jiu is not startled but accepts the chaos with relief. His stupid disciple has created a lot of complex dilemmas without simple solutions.

"Stay here, shizun."

Luo Binghe gets up and goes to the door. Obviously, Shen Jiu follows him, curious and eager for more information on the situation of the Demon Realm. Although Luo Binghe tenses upon noticing his presence, he says nothing and allows him to walk beside him.

However, there are no rebels or monsters in front of the palace gates, but rather a furious cultivator dressed in white. Liu Qingge is facing several soldiers when he recognizes them and points Cheng Luan at Luo Binghe.

"Release him. Now." He hisses, disheveled and with a cut across his cheek.

Shen Jiu strikes Luo Binghe's hand with his fan before he unsheathes Xin Mo.

"Fourth point, your sword. We will talk about it later." Then Shen Jiu smiles before looking at Liu Qingge. "You have been unexpectedly fast, shidi. I thought it would take you another day to arrive. Come."

"Shizun!" Luo Binghe stiffens and his eyes shine perhaps with jealousy.

But Shen Jiu faces him and rests the tip of his fan against his chest.

"Luo Binghe, you have already offended your Master by taking away his freedom to go wherever he wants, as well as binding him with your blood. It’s fine. I will stay. But in exchange, you will not prevent people I appreciate from visiting me, understand? "

As he scolds the demon, Liu Qingge approaches with cautious steps. He has not sheathed his sword. He and Luo Binghe silently challenge each other with looks of intense hatred. Shen Jiu ignores them, turning his back.

"Bring another plate for shidi. Now, this Master is hungry and would appreciate a quiet meal without fighting or arguing, is it clear?"

And this is how Shen Jiu ends up in his little palace with an annoying Demon Lord and an even more angry cultivator, both caught in a tense and fragile truce. As they continue their past fight with hisses and growls, glances of hatred capable of piercing through walls, he savors the meal.

It's been a long time since he was able to enjoy such delicious food.

"Luo Binghe," he says and his former disciple raises his head with the same enthusiasm of a puppy. "Is it true that you hurt your shishu?"

His smile disappears and he pales. Instead of answering, Luo Binghe nods.

"Apologize. Right now."

The tension between them is even worse when Luo Binghe sits up, proud and with no hint of regret in his arrogant expression.

"This disciple apologizes for beating his shishu in a fair fight."

It's a miracle that Liu Qingge doesn’t get up and punch him in the face. Just in case, Shen Qingqiu clears his throat.

"I don't want any more violent acts between the two of you. Nor with Cang Qiong Peak," he adds, staring at Luo Binghe, who lowers his head.

Luo Binghe has perfected the art of acting adorable and innocent, but Shen Jiu is still furious at his trick with blood. If you want this Master to stay with you so badly, I hope you are ready to make some changes in your life. For example, his aspiration for Shen Yuan. Shen Jiu will only tolerate a suitor who meets all of his exacting requirements and Luo Binghe is currently an untamed beast.

"I hope that shizun is enjoying the food that this disciple has prepared."

"I never thought that a Qing Jing Peak disciple would be stupid enough to believe that with food he will be able to forgive that you have kidnapped him."

Apparently, Shen Jiu has an unexpected fifth problem: they, for some inexplicable reason, are interested in him too.

"This Master wants to eat in peace," he growls. "Instead of arguing, can you converse like two civilized people?"

Liu Qingge clenches his fists on the table as Luo Binghe flashes a smug smile.

"Do you like literature, shishu?"

It's an innocent question, but Liu Qingge stiffens like he's been threatened with a sword.

"No."

"Too bad. This disciple was hoping he could have an intelligent conversation with his shishu about books. There is a recent collection that you may have heard of, Resentment of Chunshan?"

Shen Jiu covers himself with a sleeve discreetly to feign utter ignorance about that heinous literature.

"I'm aware," Liu Qingge's reply is curt. "I understand the second book is better and the rest is crap."

"Oh, this disciple prefers the first book."

WHY ARE THEY DISCUSSING THAT HORRENDOUS THING IN FRONT OF HIM? Shen Jiu puts down the chopsticks and stares at them livid before smiling.

"I don’t know those books, but recently I heard that people prefer the fifth volume, could anyone explain me why?"

They both stiffen.

The two answer at the same time: "What fifth volume?"

They both lie.

And the two fall silent, allowing him to finally eat in peace.

 

 

"Shidi, go back to Cang Qiong Sect and explain my situation to them." Shen Jiu tells Liu Qingge while Luo Binghe watches over them. "Also tell them that you can all visit me whenever you want. Right, Luo Binghe?"

"Yes, shizun."

The Demon Lord is neither happy nor satisfied, but Liu Qingge's departure seems to have softened his mood.

"I'll be back soon," Liu Qingge announces. "I will not leave you alone with that beast." The beast in question looks at him with hatred. "And I'll bring you real food."

"Oh!" Shen Jiu covers his lips with his fan. "Will I finally discover your secret disciple?"

"Secret disciple?"

"Yes, the one you made cook for us."

Then, Liu Qingge smiles and gently grasps his wrist with one hand to push the fan away from his face.

"There was never a disciple. It was me, didn't you know?"

Shen Jiu tries to hide the embarrassing blush that covers his cheeks, but Liu Qingge stops him without releasing his wrist.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
The next time Liu Qingge goes to Luo Binghe's palace, Liu Mingyan holds him back.
Liu Mingyan: Ge! I have a gift for you! It's for you to use with Shen-shibo ;)
Liu Qingge, confusedly accepts a bottle of lubricating oil: Aromatic oil? Is it for Shen Jiu's hair?
When Liu Qingge arrives at the palace, he looks for Shen Jiu (and ignores Black Bingbing who is also there).
Liu Qingge: For you.
Shen Jiu, still thinking about the books: SHAMELESS! Ò////////Ó
Bingbing: Shizun~ This disciple offers to help you 👀

CURIOSITY #1
"I don’t know those books, but recently I heard that people prefer the fifth volume, could anyone explain me why?"
*people is my sister.
**the fifth volume of Resentment of Chunshan is about Bingliu C:

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

A tired, mad, jealous, but worried shizun

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

When he decided to fix the mess that surrounded Luo Binghe, Shen Jiu never imagined that this would be a disaster of colossal magnitudes. The situation is even worse than when he was "invited" to Luo Binghe's palace. Caught between so many wars that robbed his time and effort, Luo Binghe's armies advance slowly as they collect losses.

At least Shen Jiu has managed to stop the stupid attacks between his worst disciple and his sect. Of course, the tension still covers both of them and conditions their relationships. And as long as he remains a "guest" in the Demonic Realm, Cang Qiong Sect will continue to watch over Luo Binghe.

It is not his sect what worries Shen Jiu, nor the human cities since Luo Binghe accepted without question to stop his conquest.

The problem is the demons.

Perhaps Shen Jiu’s knowledge about their hierarchies and societies is scarce, but he is aware of their innate violence, their desire to conquer humans, and their contempt for a half-breed. Although Luo Binghe tries to trick him with gifts and meals to keep him calm, Shen Jiu hears the rumors and the servants’ whispers. And that's why he knows there are problems in the south.

Shen Yuan told him that Luo Binghe is invincible and perfect, but there is another demon facing him that he cannot defeat. It is a disturbing possibility. What he feels is not really fear, but a cold and dirty uncertainty like ashes under his skin. Because despite Shen Yuan's knowledge, there is a lot that they still don't know. Dangerous threats that hide in the dark. And other things are changing from their original purpose.

One night, Shen Jiu is reading when he feels intense dark and bloody energy, then the chaos of servants as they carry out their lord's orders. He frowns and stands up to leave his palace and search for the source of the scandal.

Shen Jiu finds Luo Binghe in his private quarters, scruffy and dirty, his back twisted under the weight of wounds oozing demonic qi. Shen Jiu clicks his tongue and that alerts him. Luo Binghe turns tense like a trapped animal and his eyes widen in recognition.

"Did you think I wasn’t going to discover you?" His disappointment almost hid his anger.

Although several days have passed, Shen Jiu still remembers the taste of his blood in his throat and that helplessness of losing control of his own body. But he knows the limitations of his fury. Right now he has very few weapons left to steer Luo Binghe onto the right path. Yelling, insulting, or angering him is counterproductive, but seeing him hurt by one of those stupid wars upsets him.

Shen Jiu approaches and Luo Binghe instinctively back away.

"Humans or demons?" He asks. "I hope you didn't fight your Liu-shishu again."

Shen Jiu worries that his silence hides guilt and shame for breaking his empty promises. But those horrendous injuries could only have been the demons’ fault. Shen Jiu disdains the restless attitude of his disciple and grabs his wrist to examine his meridians. A frown of concern is marked on his forehead as he discovers that his demonic nature is running rampant and almost parasitizing the human.

"What are you doing?" Luo Binghe babbles as the blood runs down his lips.

Disgusted, Shen Jiu takes off a handkerchief and rubs his face vigorously until he protests with grunts.

"What have I done to deserve such an idiotic disciple?" He scolds him, holding his wrist with one hand while still wiping the blood with the other. "Your stupid wars aren't working, do you understand now or only when they kill you?"

Furious, Luo Binghe manages to catch his left wrist and pushes the handkerchief away from his face.

"I will never die," he promises with a fury that glows in his red eyes.

"Don't be naive, Luo Binghe: we will all die one day." Shen Jiu releases him and throws the bloody handkerchief at him. "Your qi is a mess, what have you done since the last time I cleaned your meridians? And who have you faced!? This Master is tired, Luo Binghe. You never tell me anything!
