And your problems concern us both."

Shen Jiu ignores Luo Binghe's darkness, that mess of raging emotions that sharpen his blood-stained features, and seeks out the servants to prepare a bath. His disciple seems to keep standing just because of his pride and stubbornness. Shen Jiu won't leave even though his look is defiant like a wild animal. It’s terrifying, it's uncomfortable, he reminds him of the Luo Binghe for whom Shen Yuan sacrificed.

Between beastly grunts and his angry attitude, Luo Binghe manages to expel all the servants once the bathroom is ready. But Shen Jiu stays even though his actions are especially hostile towards him.

"A few days before you were boasting that you could beat your Liu-shishu with your eyes closed and today you act like a crybaby who doesn't know how to take a loss," Shen Jiu scoffs with acid words, enjoying that little revenge that doesn't make up for blood parasites within his veins. "I was thinking of calling a healer, but you know what? You don't deserve it. Maybe next time you'll be more sensible when you remember the pain."

Luo Binghe trembles with fury and weakness as he glares at him.

"Leave, Shen Qingqiu."

"No." He leans his back against the wall and crosses his arms. "Now stop being stupidly proud."

His resentment softens a bit as he contemplates Luo Binghe's pathetic attempts to rip off his tattered clothes. Shreds of black cloth fall to the ground. His robes are so dirty and torn that he doesn't even recognize them. And after seeing his wounds, deep and blackened at the edges, his heart shrinks a little, making him regret his cruel attitude.

Shen Jiu leaves when Luo Binghe is taking off his pants.

"I will bring you clean robes."

Shen Jiu hesitates upon returning to the bathroom but eventually enters. He is concerned about the scandalous adventures of aberrant books that seem to occupy the mind of his disciple, but that night Luo Binghe is too angry to be kind. There is no adoration in his eyes, but the bewilderment of a spoiled child who has been humiliated.

His disciple watches over him while he leaves the clean clothes near him. Ignoring his discomfort, the tension that is more evident now that he's naked, Shen Jiu looks at his injuries. There are several and that worries him. Whoever has faced Luo Binghe has enough talent to hurt him multiple times.

"Who have you fought against?"

His disciple purses his lips, stubborn.

"Who have you fought against, Luo Binghe?"

"Don't pretend you care, Shen Qingqiu," he growls like a battered dog that will never trust his owner again.

Shen Qingqiu can understand him. Embarrassed, he clenches his fists without acknowledging his mistake.

"I care. Because if they are the same who sent the sowers against my brother, I’ll kill them myself." Shen Jiu shakes his head with his eyes closed. "Your talent is annoying but indisputable, who has hurt you? Was it a demon or several? Have you been ambushed?"

But Luo Binghe clings to his silence, turning his back to slowly lather up the dried blood and dirt. And Shen Jiu notices how his patience is evaporating.

"I don't know why you want me to be here if you never listen to me," he hisses before stomping away.

But once outside, Shen Jiu bites his lip and gets mad at himself for making stupid mistakes. Despite his terrifying presence, Luo Binghe still behaves like a puppy begging for affection. At that moment, surely he expected words of comfort and perhaps affection. But Shen Jiu is not kind and doesn’t know how to reciprocate the feelings of others. He is spiteful and direct, painfully rational.

Perhaps if Luo Binghe hadn't kidnapped him and locked him in with his blood, he would have tried to be less cold and kinder today.

Perhaps if he hadn't been broken as a child, he could now be like Shen Yuan.

Being a better person is hard.

 

 

Next time, perhaps he suggests to Liu Qingge to stay for the night.

Despite the softness of the sheets and the candles that perfume the air, despite the calm and warm night, Shen Jiu has trouble sleeping. Again.

That is why he recognizes when someone enters his palace.

Shen Jiu covers himself with a robe before leaving the room. The intruder stands on the threshold of Shen Yuan's room, not daring to go inside. At night and without his Demon Lord clothes, Luo Binghe looks more human. Shen Jiu gulps as he remembers the naive boy who bet that he would never break his sword.

"Luo Binghe," his voice is clear and firm. He doesn’t need to speak out because he knows that his disciple will listen to him. "This Master..."

But his throat tightens, drowning out his words. Luo Binghe didn’t apologize for what he did. Why should he be nice if Luo Binghe doesn't deserve it?

Luo Binghe has turned to look at him sideways. In the dark, his eyes burn like embers.

"This Master is disappointed with the attitude of his disciple and that is why I acted disproportionately today," he manages to mutter. "I don't care if you understand it or not. It's frustrating to be locked in without being able to do anything or move freely. I'm not A-Yuan, Binghe." He takes a deep breath. "A-Yuan was the nice one. I have problems and even though I'm trying to fix them, I'll never change who I am."

Suddenly the night has become colder and more uncomfortable. Shen Jiu wraps his clothes.

"Before I've been a bit harsh, but even if I want to help you, you always keep me out of your business. You only listen to what you want to hear and maybe this defeat makes you understand that you are human and vulnerable like the others. I care about you, Binghe. But I'm also angry for what you did and you still haven't apologized, so neither will I. "

Shen Jiu leaves and returns to his room. Soon, he hears how Luo Binghe closes the door to the icy room and leaves the palace. After recognizing some of those thoughts embedded in his stomach, at the end of that night, Shen Jiu finally manages to sleep.

 

 

The next morning, servants tell him that Luo Binghe is locked in his office and doesn’t want to see anyone. Shen Jiu frowns. You are no longer a child! How long will your tantrum last? Restless, he heads to Luo Binghe's office, located near his rooms. It is off-limits to most except for his trusted generals. But Shen Jiu doesn't care. Since he is forbidden from leaving the palace, he has assumed that he will be able to enter any place inside.

When he opens the door, he discovers Luo Binghe reading at an incredibly messy table. But it is not the chaos that makes him pale, but the novel in his hands.

Shen Jiu forgets all of his worries as anger and humiliation cover his cheeks with an intense blush. His shameless disciple is perfectly fine! He is locked up so that no one will discover their lord wasting his time with erotic novels!

"Oh, shizun!" He comments cheekily as he lifts his head. "What brings you to this Lord's chambers?"

Shen Jiu disdains disorder and the chaos of scrambled maps and scrolls makes his guts churn. Still, he doesn't hesitate to invoke his qi when he dashes for Luo Binghe and snatches the book from him.

Shen Jiu also hates to mistreat books, but that infamous work deserves no other fate than to explode into shreds of paper.

"What are you doing reading that?" He roars. "If you are well enough to distract yourself with these activities, could you prepare the gifts you owe Cang Qiong Sect! Or fixing your mess in the Human Realm!"

Luo Binghe frowns, annoyed, but he immediately smirks again.

"It's just fiction, why is shizun so upset?"

He is trembling, his fists clenched and caught under Luo Binghe's curious gaze. All the answers that come to him are scary and dangerous. His intention is for Luo Binghe (and Liu Qingge) to forget the contents of those books, not to feed the possibility.

Someday, Shen Jiu will gut the author.

Luo Binghe squints his eyes. He tilts his head, examining Shen Jiu's figure. Today he wears green with frayed sleeves after pulling out all the black threads.

"Shizun?"

"Mn?"

"Shizun~"

If the book wasn’t shredded, he would have used it to hit that stupid empty head. Shen Jiu crosses his arms as he values whether or not to use his fan.

"What do you want?"

"Nothing."

His salvation comes when someone knocks on the door. Luo Binghe's smile twists into an annoying grin.

"I said no one should bother me." He growls at the figure kneeling on the other side.

"Forgive this humble one, Jushang. But the War God is here."

"Oh!" A dark, malevolent spark of interest lights up Luo Binghe's gaze.

Shen Jiu watches him tense as he stands beside him to leave the office.

"I hope you're not planning anything," Shen Jiu warns him, grabbing the fabric of his sleeves. "Your Liu-shishu is your guest."

Luo Binghe nods, but his gesture is false and hypocritical.

Shen Jiu decides to keep an eye on him when they walk to meet Liu Qingge. The animosity between the two is dangerous. No one wanted to tell him what happened that time Luo Binghe "hurt" Liu Qingge. Shen Jiu knows the pride of his shidi, his tenacity, and his strength. Hurting him is complicated, but only a very serious injury would keep him immobile for so long.

However, Luo Binghe acts polite when he sees Liu Qingge, who stiffens when he recognizes him.

"Shishu."

"Shizi," he growls reluctantly.

Luo Binghe leans a little closer, hands behind his back, and a predatory attitude.

"Would shishu want to fight this Lord?"

Shen Jiu rolls his eyes before grabbing his fan and slapping him on the head.

"This is how you solve your problems? Since you were defeated yesterday, today you want to take revenge on another person?"

Luo Binghe reacts to the hit with an annoyed snort. Although what seems to offend him the most is being reminded of his humiliation in front of his enemy.

"Fighting shishu will make me stronger. He is the War God of the renowned Cang Qiong Sect, right? Not the Cowardly God." The demon adds maliciously.

And Liu Qingge stiffens angrily, falling into his trap.

Shen Jiu sighs as his patience begins to waver.

"Not today. You are injured and must rest." He speaks as he places a hand on Liu Qingge's shoulder, who seems eager to face his rival and doesn't care if he's hurt or not. "This Master will examine you later. Now, let's eat."

Shen Jiu has a generous stomach and two eager cooks around him. He doesn’t plan to miss any opportunity.

"What happened?" Liu Qingge asks him when they are heading to his little palace. "Is there anyone capable of defeating that little beast? Should I congratulate them or be concerned?"

Shen Jiu hits him with the fan on his head as well.

"Luo Binghe hasn't told me the details," he huffs. "Let's talk about more important things. Did you bring food, shidi?"

"No." His refusal disappoints him so much that Shen Jiu pouts unconsciously. "I've hunted a beast on the way. I'll cook it."

"You are lucky this Lord is in a good mood today," Luo Binghe grumbles. He walks a few steps behind them and watches over Liu Qingge with the same interest as future prey. With a graceful movement, he stands on Shen Jiu's free side and grabs his arm. "Surprise us, shishu."

Shen Jiu uses his fan to push Luo Binghe away. How strange. He thinks. Today he hasn’t tried to stand between the two of us. And he's being decent to Liu Qingge too... His heart almost stops at the sudden possibility that Luo Binghe is interested in Liu Qingge. What if he was reading the fifth volume of Resentment of Chunshan before? What if he has discovered how beautiful and talented Liu Qingge is?

After all, Shen Jiu is unfriendly and unpleasant, the cruel copy of Shen Yuan.

Logically, two such attractive men will forget him when they discover the virtues of the other.

That premonition haunts him a half shichen later when they are gathered at the low table. Luo Binghe praises Liu Qingge's food and gives him some advice that he accepts suspiciously. Shen Jiu doesn't understand what is happening. What if he was poisoned last night and he, blinded by his bad temper, didn't realize it?

Shen Jiu eats in increasingly thoughtful and leaden silence.

What if it is true that Luo Binghe has taken an interest in Liu Qingge? Why does that bother him so much? From the beginning, he knew that both of them had fallen in love first with Shen Yuan. And he never intended to start a romantic relationship with anyone.

But jealousy stabs his stomach and makes his food sour, even though he will never acknowledge that he wants to be loved.

Love is a ridiculous feeling.

And those who fall in love quickly and forget even faster are the worst criminals.

Shen Jiu angrily chews the meat, ignoring its sweet taste from the fruit sauce. His companions no longer try to talk to each other or eat but instead stare at him.

"Is something wrong, Shen Jiu?" Liu Qingge asks cautiously. "You seem mad."

"Of course I'm not mad!"

"I know Liu-shishu's food is undercooked, but you shouldn't piss off, shizun..."

"I told you I'm not mad! Why isn't anyone listening to me?"

Then, the door opens with a slam that almost smashes it.

They all turn at the same time. Shen Qingqiu drops his chopsticks and his eyes widen at the sight of a second Luo Binghe disheveled and furious, his eyes gleaming with bloodlust.

"Get away from shizun!" The newcomer screams.

Neither Shen Jiu nor Liu Qingge hesitates as they stand up and grasp the hilts of their swords, but Luo Binghe moves swiftly. And the next thing he notices is a claw squeezing his neck and pulling him back.

"Don't," the intruder purrs. Shen Jiu purses his lips, trying to ignore the pressure that takes his breath away. "I didn't hesitate to hurt my shizun and I won't hesitate to hurt this one as well."

In front of them, Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe are tense and with their swords drawn. They both grunt at the same time.

"I will kill you if you hurt him."

"If you touch shizun I will kill you."

Their coordinated responses make the fake Luo Binghe laugh.

"I won't if you behave," he promises them. "Too bad, I really wanted to fight the famous War God. In my world you are dead. What a pity."

Shen Jiu stiffens after hearing him. He shouldn't be surprised since he knows that Shen Yuan altered his fate by saving Liu Qingge. But right now the prospect of a world without him is terrifying.

"Liu-shishu," he continues. "Leave us. I want to talk to my... counterpart? Little me? According to my calculations, my world is a few years ahead of yours. That makes you my Bing-didi and I’m your Bing-ge."

Liu Qingge grits his teeth furiously before dropping his sword.

"If you hurt him, I will chase you to any other world to destroy you," he growls before turning and walking away.

The three of them are left trapped in a tension in which no one dares to move.

"Release shizun," Luo Binghe demands with clenched teeth.

There is fear in his voice, an immense panic that devours his eyes and turns his knuckles white.

"Don't be like that! I just want to talk!" Luo Bing-ge snorts but frees him and Shen Jiu breathes a sigh of relief before walking away.

His Luo Binghe doesn't hesitate to grab his wrist before pushing him behind his back.

"What do you want?"

"Is this how you appreciate that I decided to give you some advice?" Luo Bing-ge sits defiantly in front of the forgotten food. "It's funny. Our worlds are very similar, but there are considerable differences. People who don’t exist in my world, they have different personalities or are dead... I examined the advances of your troops." He clicks his tongue. "Your progress is slow but interesting. Don’t be in a hurry to conquer the world. In the end, you will be the emperor of the three realms and you will run out of fun. This is the most exciting thing that has happened to me in recent years."

Luo Bing-ge sighs dramatically. But the scariest thing is that his Luo Binghe seems to listen to him with interest. Shen Jiu clings to his clothes as if that way he could distract him from those words.

"Such a slow conquest is tedious, but I think it will have good results. Don't even think about using Xin Mo to merge the two realms. It was a disaster." He sighs again while Shen Jiu pales in horror. "I thought it was a great idea, but it only caused me more trouble. And forcing a physical fusion destroyed a lot of places that I will never be able to visit again. Also, be careful with those around Mobei-Jun. His uncle is a traitor and his pet will betray him… soon. For some inexplicable reason, since the death of that spy rat, he has never been the same again." 

Through the cloth, Shen Jiu notices how Luo Binghe tenses when Luo Bing-ge leans forward. He fiddles with chopsticks that no longer seem harmless in his hands.

"Although I am disappointed... We are very similar, but from what I have gathered you are not married yet. Do you also need love advice?"

"No." He growls like a jealous animal.

"Too bad. You need them urgently. And I made some mistakes," he snorts. "Too many women who are always fighting over me in the end is annoying. But you don't have any, do you? Don't make a mistake, Bing-di. Take some concubines or you'll never harness the potential of that sword."

"I have no intention of taking any concubines." Luo Binghe assures and for the first time the expression of his doppelganger is confused. "I will marry my love and I will always be faithful and devoted to them."

Luo Bing-ge blinks, stunned to hear those words from someone identical to him. When he clenches his fist, the chopsticks break in half. And he throws his head back as he laughs with hysterical, unhinged, mocking laughter.

Terrified by that heinous advice, Shen Jiu plucks up the courage to stand in front of Luo Binghe, ignoring the pain in his neck, and challenge that dangerous intruder.

"If you don't have anything better to do, get out."

"So cold, shizun!" He scoffs, resting his face on his hand. Luo Bing-ge ignores him. His cruel and boring eyes light up when he looks at his doble. "I know how to resurrect the corpse you keep."

Luo Binghe gasps, Shen Jiu trembles.

It's a lie, right?

It can’t be true.

"But since you're not interested, maybe I should go..." He stands up theatrically.

"No!"

Luo Bing-ge raises his head. His satisfied smirk is crooked and it makes Shen Jiu tremble.

"But what would you give me in return?” He whispers. “It is not easy to raise the dead."

"Everything!"

"No!" Shen Jiu interferes, glaring at his disciple. "He is playing with you!"

"As suspicious as ever, shizun." Luo Bing-ge looks disappointed when he unsheathes his sword. "I'll let you think about my proposal. I'll be back in a few days." His sword cuts the air, but the portal he creates is different than usual. It is a path between worlds. "But Bing-di, remember, my price will be as high as resurrecting a shizun."

And he leaves.

Perhaps Luo Bing-ge has disappeared, but his memory resonates like an echo between them. Shen Jiu puts a hand around his neck, remembering the precision of that gesture and how he wouldn’t have hesitated to hurt him.

"Don't do it," he mutters.

And Luo Binghe looks at him confused and tired after a year and a half wasting his qi on preserving a corpse. He is pale and with dark circles under his eyes.

"I want shizun back." He splutters. His sadness is immense and hurts like Shen Jiu's.

"Me too. But we can't trust him."

He stiffens upon hearing his words.

"Why not? Why can't you trust me!?"

"Don’t be ridiculous! You are not the same person!"

"Maybe we are! We fought, shizun! It was like facing a mirror!" Tears drown Luo Binghe's eyes. "You abandoned me. You left me alone with no one else to take care of Shen Yuan. Why can't you trust any Luo Binghe?"

Shen Jiu opens his mouth, but all of his words have died.

And not even now he is able to confess the truth about Shen Yuan's death.

Because deep in his heart, he can’t trust Luo Binghe.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS 1
Bingbing: I have no fears.
Bing-ge: In one chapter I almost fixed the communication problems with your shizun and I would have solved your enmity with Liu Qingge by fucking him.
Bingbing: I HAVE ONE FEAR.

BONUS 2
Shen Jiu: At least you've made it in time to try shidi's food! The other Bing-ge loved it.
Bingbing: I change my mind. We can't trust that imposter >:(

CURIOSITY #1
I warned you in the first chapter that this story is 100% self-indulgent. And Bing-ge vs Bing-mei is one of my favorite extras! And with this twist, we are approaching the climax of the trust issues subplot between Bingbing and Shen Jiu~

In the next chapter we will find out better what does Bing-ge want. After all, in this AU he hasn't encountered a sweet and loving shizun, but an angry cat.

BONUS 3
Catjiu: LOVE IS FOR THE WEAK!
Also Catjiu: I DON'T have a crush with Kitty Qingge. It is normal to appreciate that he is the perfect man. -//////-
Also Catjiu: Damn Bingpup. How do you forget about me so quickly and flirt with Liu Qingge in front of me? QAQ

(He still has to fix his little self-esteem problems.)

CURIOSITY #2
I hesitated between Shen Jiu recognizing Bing-ge or not. In the end I have chosen the second option to reflect that, unlike Shen Yuan at the end of SVSSS, he still doesn't understand Bingbing. Unlike Liu-shidi, they still have to talk about their problems!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Who can trust Luo Binghe?

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

When they tell everything to Liu Qingge, who had waited outside tense and restlessly, his expression darkens with concern. However, the most uncomfortable thing about that situation is that he doesn’t judge Luo Binghe or threaten or yell at him, but instead stares into Shen Jiu's eyes. And his silence is even worse than an accusation. Liu Qingge is wordlessly asking him why he isn't telling the truth about Shen Yuan.

But Shen Jiu doesn't dare.

There are secrets that over time grow and become so heavy that it is tiring to carry them, but it is also more difficult to tell to certain people. And Shen Jiu knows that Luo Binghe will hate him for hiding that truth. It's too late and so he clenches his fists and looks away. At least he can try to get his Luo Binghe to change his mind.

"In exchange for A-Yuan, what would you give in return?"

Luo Binghe blinks, confused by the unexpected question, but his answer comes immediately.

"Everything."

"That’s the problem, Luo Binghe." Shen Jiu sighs. "I can't judge you because I would do the same, but we don't know what Bing-ge wants. Right now, he has more information about us than we do about him. He also knows your desperation to resurrect A-Yuan." Shen Jiu puts a hand on his chin as he thinks. "He has said that he merged both realms. That is a horrific atrocity."

"Or maybe he meant well but ended badly," Luo Binghe right away defends him. Or he defends himself.

Shen Jiu trembles as he realizes that perhaps that same idea has already tempted his disciple a long time ago. Later I'll talk to him, we need to solve this problem first.

"It's a disaster that will alter the geography of both realms, creating an entirely new place at the cost of destroying the rest. Perhaps he is interested in something that was lost in his world." Shen Jiu takes a deep breath. "But Luo Bing-ge has also insisted that there are living people in our world who are dead in his. What if he wants someone else in return? Would you still agree, Luo Binghe?"

This time, his response is slow despite the determined glint in his eyes.

"Maybe."

"And do you think it would make A-Yuan happy to find out that you have sacrificed someone innocent for his sake?"

"I don't care if shizun hates me, at least he will be alive."

The two challenge each other with the same stubborn and determined gaze. Liu Qingge clears his throat before intervening.

"Don't think I'll allow another beast like you to kidnap someone," he growls and Luo Binghe responds with a cruel smile.

"How if shishu never managed to defeat me?"

"Enough!" Shen Jiu intervenes before the two draw their swords. "Your shishu is right, Luo Binghe. This Master also opposes a stranger from another world abducting someone."

"I didn't know that Shizun enjoys eating intimately with strangers," his former disciple replies in a sour voice. "What if Bing-ge just wants a treasure? You're the one who doesn't want to trust him and only thinks the worst."

His throat still burns where the intruder had grabbed him.

"He is dangerous. You should know: you are the same person in parallel worlds."

His statement makes Luo Binghe pale and a flash of anger flashes in his eyes and then darkens in disappointment. Shen Jiu turns to Liu Qingge with an uncomfortable feeling inside his chest. Luo Bing-ge's interest in Liu Qingge was unusual. Terrifying. Worrying. If he has to make any conjectures right now, Shen Jiu would bet he wants Liu Qingge in exchange for Shen Yuan.

And Luo Binghe will hand him over to him without hesitation, that's another clear assurance. Shen Jiu must keep him away from the palace while he tries to find some solution.

"Shidi, go back to Cang Qiong Mountain Sect." And he adds before Liu Qingge protests. "You have to warn Zhangmen-shixiong of the existence of another world. This Luo Bing-ge has defined himself as the emperor of the three realms. He is dangerous and powerful. The cultivation world must keep alert."

Liu Qingge reluctantly agrees.

"I will be back."

That promise makes him tiny and fragile. Shen Jiu trembles when Liu Qingge reaches his hand to catch his. Immediately, Luo Binghe looms behind Shen Jiu like a shadow.

"Don’t." Shen Jiu looks away with his heart stuck in his throat. "Do you remember my cat?"

"Yes." Liu Qingge frowns, confused.

"Look for him. I think Shang Qinghua and Mu Qingfang have copies of his favorite places. Go back to where you found me and look for my cat."

Look for Shen Yuan. Because if they find Shen Yuan before Luo Bing-ge returns, then they won't have to negotiate anything. Although their Luo Binghe's reaction will be even more unpredictable, It is preferable.

Liu Qingge frowns but nods slowly while keeping an eye on Luo Binghe.

"If the other hurt him again, I'll kill you," he warns him.

His words put Luo Binghe on the defensive, who bares his teeth like an animal.

"I will never let anyone hurt shizun."

"He's already tried, you blind beast." Liu Qingge raises his arm and his fingers brush Shen Jiu's neck without daring to touch more. "If I can't find your cat, I'll be back."

As always, that's the promise that hurts him the most.

Please, don’t come back.

 

 

Luo Bing-ge's brief appearance has shattered the tense calm in the palace. In the following days, Luo Binghe's mood worsens. He is more susceptible and aggressive. He identifies Shen Jiu's mistrust of his double as a personal attack and his inordinate attitude destroys the little trust Shen Jiu had regained in him. Their meals become more awkward and the fact of being locked in that palace is more unbearable.

Luo Bing-ge returns after nine uncomfortable days.

Shen Jiu is reading in his palace when he notices a terrifying and suffocating demonic energy disturbance. Even the servants who tend to him pale. Shen Jiu drops the book on the table and runs outside. He and his Luo Binghe arrive at the same time.

And the two find the intruder in the throne room.

In those nine days, they haven’t only argued, eroding their complicated relationship, they also have accepted a pact between their different opinions. And that is why Shen Jiu steps forward to cover Luo Binghe and face that man's hungry wolf smile, so similar and so different from his disciple. Shen Jiu's expression is sullen and this time he doesn't intend to be fooled.

"I don't trust you," he warns him.

"Shizun." His disciple sighs, disappointed that he has broken his promises of patience so soon.

"Shizun." The other raises an eyebrow, amused. "I understand that it is your brother who is dead. Will you not trust this Lord even though he may resurrect him?"

"No." Shen Jiu crosses his arms. "Before we agree to any deal, we want to know what you want in return."

Luo Bing-ge still smiles with that arrogant confidence as he reaches into his robes and pulls out a white jade relic covered in dark energy. His gaze flies from Shen Jiu to his counterpart.

"I found this artifact in the ruins of the Eternal Night Mountain, deep within the Demonic Realm. You haven't gone there yet, have you?" Luo Binghe shakes his head as he curiously gazes at the relic. "I highly recommend it. It is one of the most interesting treasures I have found, even more than jewels or wives." Shen Jiu twists his lips in disgust upon hearing such dehumanization of a living being. "Thanks to its power, I can negotiate with the demons without being fooled by any of them. Come closer, Bing-di."

Shen Jiu grabs his sleeve when he walks past him. Be careful , says his worried look. He only lets him go when he nods before stepping in front of the other.

"How it works?"

Luo Bing-ge extends his hand and the relic begins to glow. It floats on the palm of his hand, covering them in a golden brightness.

"As long as we're within his range, neither of us can lie," he explains.

"Omission is another way to intervene." Shen Jiu intervenes. "What do you want in exchange for Shen Yuan?"

Luo Bing-ge still doesn't look at him. To him, only exists his other-self.

"I want you to tell me the indications to achieve something that only you possess: a concrete feeling. In return, I will tell you how to resurrect your other shizun."

"Is not enough." Shen Jiu walks to stand next to his disciple. "We want you to resurrect A-Yuan. Then we will confirm that we were deceived."

"Is your shizun always this suspicious?" Bing-ge mocks, finally paying attention to him. His gaze makes Shen Jiu flinch uneasily. "I don't want to. It is a tedious and complicated method, although with Bing-di power level it won’t be difficult for him. I have no interest in wasting my time: I will tell you how you will resurrect your shizun and before I leave you will give me my answer, deal? "

"Deal."

Luo Binghe responds without waiting for the opinion of Shen Jiu, who snorts, more annoyed than worried. Although his suspicion is not softened even when Luo Bing-ge seems to ignore everything he had assumed about him.

“The Demons' Holy Mausoleum.”

Those four words make Luo Binghe's eyes widen at the same time as his mouth. Shen Jiu looks at him with impatience and a small hope that grows at the possibility of recovering Shen Yuan a few months ahead of schedule.

"The Demons' Holy Mausoleum?" He mutters. "Just that? Is it that simple?"

Luo Binghe still nods in his stupor.

"How could I forget? I can resurrect shizun if I bring his body to the Demons' Holy Mausoleum..." He babbles with a dry voice.

Shen Jiu retrieves his fan from his belt and uses it to hit him on the shoulder.

"Why didn't you think of it earlier!?"

He's losing control of his calm, but for once he doesn't care. There was a safer and more reliable solution than seeds. There was another possibility waiting for them and Shen Yuan might have already returned. And Shen Yuan can come back, maybe today, maybe tomorrow. Shen Jiu covers his face with both hands as he notices tears in his eyes.

Then, the relic trembles before a beam of light push Luo Binghe several meters away.

Of course, Luo Bing-ge lied when he said that the artifact was a lie detector.

Shen Jiu turns to his disciple, too confused to feel anger or disappointment. But he discovers a golden wall that separates the two of them from Luo Binghe, who stands up in a fury. Wasting no time with stupid questions, Shen Jiu unsheathes his sword and lunges at Luo Bing-ge.

The demon smirks before dodging him with insulting ease. They hear an intense cracking noise as Luo Binghe's Xin Mo hits the wall.

"What are you doing!!!?"

"Wasn't it obvious?" The other demon mocks him. "The price of one shizun is another shizun."

An icy panic paralyzes Shen Jiu upon hearing him. But when Xiu Ya falls to the ground with a metallic clink, he understands that it is not just fear that numbs his body or the reason why he falls to the ground. It’s those disgusting parasites that swarm in his blood that both demons can manipulate.

"STAY AWAY FROM HIM!"

Luo Bing-ge hums with a smile as he reaches down to pick up Shen Jiu with the ease of a toy, a gift that belongs to him. In his arms, he is just a doll that ends up resting against his broad chest while Luo Binghe tries in vain to break through the wall.

"Don't worry, Bing-di." Despite his lies and deceptions, he seems sincere when he looks at his counterpart one last time. "I'll take better care of him than the other one. Enjoy your other shizun."

"I'LL KILL YOU!" The wall is covered in cracks bright like lightning. "LEAVE MY SHIZUN!"

But Luo Bing-ge turns his back and Shen Jiu can no longer see his disciple, just hear his anguished screams. His insides protest when noticing how two forces fight inside him. And he clenches his teeth unable to move, but that pull disappears when Luo Bing-ge uses his sword to open a hole to another reality.

“SHIZUN!”

They arrive at an immense palace that ridicules Luo Binghe’s, a pale shadow in comparison. The sky is bright red with flecks of blue, and the stars are mixed in the chaos of various unknown constellations. Demons and humans are waiting for their lord's return with ovations and bows. Some are strangers, others familiar. There is a Mobei-jun just as stoic and quiet as the one he knows. There is a Sha Hualing who laughs when she sees him in the arms of her lord.

Luo Bing-ge drops with mocking care Shen Jiu on the ground, still frozen in a rigid and inert body, before turning towards the portal. And he brings out a second relic: a red dagger that seems forged with blood. Then, he plunges it into the portal and reddish veins sew it until the path between the two worlds disappears.

Shen Jiu gasps when he feels that he regains control of his limbs, that his voice belongs to him and nothing is holding him back. However, it’s useless: although he can walk, he has nowhere to run.

 

 

When Liu Qingge returns, he finds the chaos surrounding a raging demon who has smashed everything to open a portal and failed a thousand times. Luo Binghe has his knuckles broken and bloody from hitting the walls while he was screaming and his eyes are bloodshot. His appearance is more beast than human, but Liu Qingge doesn’t flinch, walking even faster.

"What happened?" He growls. "Where is Shen Jiu?"

"He has taken him..." He babbles, kneeling on the ground, unable to get up. "He has taken Shizun and I can't get him back... What should I do now?"

Liu Qingge pales. Panic first dilates his eyes and cuts off his breath. Then rage takes control.

Luo Binghe only blinks when he punches him in the face.

"You stupid beast! You had to protect him!"

Luo Binghe bites his lip. He knows. He knows it perfectly. And that's why he doesn't respond or defend himself but instead waits for Liu Qingge to hit him again. He deserves all the pain and suffering in the world: he allowed one shizun to die and now the other has been stolen.

But Liu Qingge fidgets hysterically. And although he shoots him angry glances in which the desire to attack him shines, he does nothing.

"Now you know how I felt," he growls. "Now you know how you feel when the person you love is taken far, far away, where you can't see him and you can't do anything to save him."

Finally, Luo Binghe reacts by raising his head.

"Is not the same..."

"IT'S THE SAME, STUPID LUO BINGHE! Do you finally get it? You're not that different from the other one." Liu Qingge covers his face with his hands before screaming until his lungs are empty. Then, he falls defeated to the ground. "I should have guessed... Why did I leave Shen Jiu alone?"

"He wasn‘t alone!" Luo Binghe's tears burn in his eyes. "And that's worse ..."

"He was alone." Liu Qingge looks him into his eyes and despite the distance between them, he seems to be very close. "He was locked away from us because you kidnapped him. Twice. Do you get it now?" He repeats, in frustration and fury.

Luo Binghe finally gets it.

Regret is cruel and painful. And its roots begin to conquer the heart of the Demon Lord. It is different from regret for Shen Yuan's death. It's not about what he couldn't avoid but what he has done.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS: What do the characters think about kidnappings?
Shen Yuan: It's wrong.
Shen Jiu: It's okay except when I'M kidnapped.
Luo Bing-ge and Bingbing: It's our hobby.
Liu Qingge: In my case, IT'S A FUCKING RESCUE MISSION!! *angry noises*

CURIOSITY #1
We have reached the climax of Bingjiu mistrust issues subplot!

The two of them have created this problem by not trusting each other. Everything would have been very different if Shen Jiu had told Luo Binghe the truth about Shen Yuan (then he wouldn't have been tempted by his evil twin) and if he hadn't keep away Liu Qingge (who could have helped them). But things would also have ended differently if Bingbing hadn't forced his blood onto Shen Jiu.

They haven't made a bad decision in this chapter, they have accumulated them during this third part :)

But not everything is bad! Bingbing's Redemption Arc finally beings! (But not Bing-ge's. This Bing-ge has crossed all the red lines in his world... We will know more about him in the next chapter~)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

The scum villain’s fate

Chapter Notes

PIDW's timeline should be enough warning, but panic attack, mentions of torture, body horror.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

For Shen Jiu, it is clearer now why it took Luo Bing-ge nine days to return. That lying wolf devised his trap very carefully, looking for the elements that would isolate them from his Luo Binghe. Shen Jiu's guts twist as he realizes that he has done something on the way between the two dimensions. And for the first time in many years, he feels tiny and trapped again despite the fact that there are no chains and his false disciple has guided him to elegant and luxurious rooms. Very similar to his palace, his bamboo house.

Both Luo Binghe are so alike that they are almost the same person. Locked against his will for the second time in a palace, Shen Jiu examines the room with disinterest. Frustration still burns in his gut at having misread a person he should know. Although he had also been fooled when Luo Bing-ge arrived despite their differences and earlier he had needed Liu Qingge to understand his disciple.

Shen Jiu sits down with a weary sigh. Anger and fear had burned away leaving regret behind.

Everything would have been very different if he had tried to understand Luo Binghe. Shen Jiu failed as a shizun when his rage pushed him into the Endless Abyss and by accepting all of Shen Yuan's words without appreciating that Luo Binghe is a person capable of growth and change.

Now he must deal with another, more unpredictable Luo Bing-ge. But he is doing the same as my disciple , Shen Jiu thinks as he examines the room. Maybe I was wrong and Luo Bing-ge is dangerous to others and not to me. Absentmindedly, he strokes his neck, wondering if the assault was real or a trap to hide his true intentions.

Luo Bing-ge is a cunning wolf, that's the only clear truth.

Although the night grows on the other side of the window, devouring the sky in starless darkness, Shen Jiu collects everything he knows and his options. I can't run away . He frowns as he taps his fingers on the table. Because of the damn demon blood, he can find me anywhere. And he had had enough of being immobilized twice in such an unpleasant way that it locked him inside his body. Furthermore, as long as he still doesn't understand Luo Bing-ge's true intentions and character, he shouldn't risk angering him. I should first investigate the differences between our worlds… and find a way to return.

After all, no one will rescue him. Although Shen Jiu doesn’t understand what kind of artifacts Luo Binghe used, he intuits that he has done it to prevent otherworldly people from entering this one. That leaves him alone. And it is better to accept it soon than to cling to childish and stupid illusions. Furthermore, Shen Jiu is tired of waiting. He is alone, but he is not helpless. He will find a way back and surely Luo Binghe will have brought Shen Yuan back.

Shen Jiu barely knows a few details: the Demon and the Human Realm were merged, Liu Qingge is dead, Luo Binghe is an emperor... Shen Jiu stops his hand. All of that reminds him of Shen Yuan's prophecies.

Luo Binghe mentioned that he hurt the Shen Jiu of this world.

Shen Yuan never made it clear to him what his true destiny was, only that it would be horrible.

Nonsense . There is nothing more horrible than his past, although a world without Liu Qingge and Shen Yuan is so terrifying that Shen Jiu feels cold to his bones despite the warm environment. He is shaking. Shen Jiu hugs himself, accepting that he won't sleep that night either.

 

 

The morning begins with deceptive normality, an echo of his life in the other world. Demonic and human servants bring him food and prepare an aromatic bath for him. They also offer him luxurious hairpins and silk robes. Shen Jiu rejects nothing, although he watches over them armed with a meek silence.

The door opens and a young woman storm in.

"SHIZUN!"

Shen Jiu is startled when she lunges into his arms. This Ning Yingying is similar to his Ning Yingying. She has the same eyes, even though she dresses and combs differently. The girl he has seen grow up has become a lady.

"Shizun!" She whimpers, hugging him even tighter. "A-Luo said that he was going to bring a shizun from another world, but I never imagined... Shizun! You’re here!"

Shen Jiu gulps. He has always been weak with his favorite disciple and although Ning Yingying's tears affect him, he cannot forget that that is not his disciple nor is he her shizun. They are two strangers with the faces of people important to them. Still, his heart softens a little when he strokes her head.

"Stop crying," he scolds her. "You're not a child anymore."

Ning Yingying sobs, but she lets go of him as she wipes her eyes.

"I missed you so much, shizun..."

And he understands that the Shen Jiu of this world is dead. It is a certainty that he accepts with indifference and resignation, despite the suspicion that it was surely Luo Bing-ge who killed him. Because information is power. Shen Jiu gazes at the young lady as he wonders if this Ning Yingying is as talkative as the one in his memories. I'll have to check , he thinks, tilting his head.

"Ning Yingying." He calls her. And his voice escapes the familiarity and affection he feels for his disciple. "This Master is confused by the differences between our worlds. Could you help me?"

"Of course!" Her eyes spark, excited with the same childish illusion as when he taught her a new score. "Today is a beautiful day. Shizun can accompany me for a walk in the flower garden."

He nods, eager to leave those rooms and find out what kind of world awaits outside.

Ning Yingying babbles as she guides him. Her mood is so bright that it warms the cold that he feels under his skin. Still, his words are empty. She repeats the same phrases and reflects on how much she has missed him. Ning Yingying doesn't talk about the sect or Luo Binghe, but about other women that he doesn't know. Shen Jiu accompanies her without interrupting her, analyzing all of her sentences as he examines their surroundings.

Luo Binghe has built a palace that rivals the heavens. It is more immense than some cities, sparking in gold and jade, although the stone of the buildings is black. Within the walls glitz and power shine, yet Shen Jiu trembles as he walks through that bloody sky.

The garden Ning Yingying leads him to is so beautiful that it almost took his breath away. All the plants are exquisite. Some are familiar to him, others he only knows from legends and there are some unknown, perhaps demonic or extinct. Scattered around the garden, reading or chatting with each other, there are countless women. And they all interrupt what they do to glare at him. Some without disguising, others trying. They are piercing and sharp looks, aggressive without the need for words or blows. Shen Jiu ignores them. None deserve his attention, only Ning Yingying and his clumsy attempts to calm the environment and make him feel comfortable.

"Look, shizun! A-Luo planted these flowers last year. When they bloom, they will spread golden pollen throughout the entire garden until they cover the sky. I hope that shizun can see it with me. It will be beautiful!" She smiles wistfully. "You know? That tree is the same one from the legends that shizun told me when I was little. A-Luo looked for it for me."

Shen Jiu is unable to contain a fine smile, touched by the enthusiasm of that young woman who hasn’t forgotten his thirst for knowledge.

"Later I'll take shizun to the lake! There are immortal carps and..."

"What is this scum doing here?" An unpleasant and cutting voice interrupts Ning Yingying.

But the worst is not those rude words, but that she flinches with an awkwardness that erases her smile and makes her pale. Furious, Shen Jiu turns to face the Little Palace Mistress.

"It looks like the world doesn't matter," he comments in his coldest, harshest voice, and his most judgmental look. "You are always doomed to be a spoiled worm with no manners."

The woman looks at him with hatred. Her clothes are even more ostentatious and she wears so many jewels that it is even ridiculous. A small golden whip hangs on her belt, which she extends with a snap.

"Insolent!" She hisses, waving the whip at his face. "You shouldn't be here!"

Shen Jiu parries the blow with the back of his hand. He could have dodged it, but he prefers to show his disdain so that everyone understands how little he respects that woman.

"Unfortunately, we both have the same opinion."

“Shizun, your hand!”

The skin is flushed, but he shakes his hand nonchalantly. No blow from someone so pathetic can affect him, even if his bones are broken or his muscles are torn.

The curiosity of other women is intense and no longer hidden in sidelong glances and discreet whispers. It surrounds them with murmurs that sound like swarms of wasps. The Little Palace Mistress hisses furiously before she sways the whip.

"Who do you think you are, Shen Qingqiu? Someone must teach you respect."

"I was thinking the same thing. About you." Shen Jiu ignores the moment Ning Yingying starts to tug at his sleeve to shut him up. "First, your posture is wrong. You wave the whip without grace or technique. How did you learn? Hitting animals like the beast that you are?"

"Hitting dogs like you."

She steps forward angrily, but a melodious voice like bells stops her before she raises her arm.

"I wouldn't do that. Our lord is quite fond of this version of Shen Qingqiu."

Sha Hualing walks towards them with the delicate steps of a predator. However, Shen Jiu isn't fooled by her playful, red-painted smile. She was laughing when Luo Bing-ge brought him to this world and has only intervened to prevent him from receiving physical harm. Surely on Luo Bing-ge's orders. But that didn't make her an ally, perhaps one of his worst enemies.

The demoness holds the whip with her hands ending in sharp nails.

"I advise you to wait. Jushang will eventually get tired of him." Sha Hualing turns to give Shen Jiu a cruel smile. "Although, honestly, I don't see the difference between the two Shen Qingqiu."

"Not surprising. I don't see any difference between you and the Sha Hualing of my world, either: you are both equally annoying, cocky, and lousy."

Someone laughs in the background. The demoness's smile grows sharper as she turns her back on the Little Palace Mistress to approach him.

"And you are as arrogant as the other one. Do you want some advice?"

"No." Shen Jiu holds her gaze. "But I would appreciate it if someone could explain to me exactly what Luo Bing-ge wants."

"I'd like to know that too," another woman interjects.

Shen Jiu is not surprised to find that Qiu Haitang is also there. Still, he trembles and instinctively clenches his fists. Her hatred is terrible precisely because he doesn’t regret what he did. Shen Jiu maintains an icy expression despite Qiu Haitang, his only childhood refuge, approaching them followed by Liu Mingyan. Even though Liu Qingge's sister doesn't speak, her eyes burn with a terrifying hatred that confuses Shen Jiu.

"I've already told you, Jushang found him in another world and made the mistake of believing that this Shen Qingqiu is different from the other. He called him nice!" Sha Hualing laughs as the other two trembles with rage and the Little Palace Mistress clicks her tongue. "Maybe he wants to play with him now that his other toy is broken." She turns her back on him and walks away in deliberately short, mischievous steps. "I'll give you my advice even if you don't want it or deserve it, Shen Qingqiu: learn your place. Jushang can be kind or..."

She doesn't finish the sentence and that pause invokes all kinds of possibilities. The demoness turns her head to look into his eyes.

"I can tell you. But maybe you don't believe me. Or you won't care."

"What are you talking about?" He groans, crossing his arms to hide his unease reflected in his clenched fists.

"About what happened to the other you."

"He's dead, right? Luo Bing-ge killed him."

Sha Hualing smiles like a cat.

"Maybe not. Maybe yes. Maybe he cut you thousand times so you would slowly bleed out. Or maybe he buried you alive." She savors another pause, searching his expression for any hint of discomfort. "Do you dare to find out, Shen Qingqiu?"

Ning Yingying grabs his arm so tightly that she digs her nails into him, destabilizing him.

"Don't do it, shizun." She whispers to him, her pupils dilated in panic and her face white as snow. "Don't listen to her. We can visit the lake. Going to the garden was a bad idea..."

But Shen Jiu ignores her trembling voice to lift his head arrogantly.

"Show me."

Although most of those women watch it with curiosity, they are irrelevant, more decorative flowers than real persons. However, those four are dangerous predators. Perhaps Luo Bing-ge has kidnapped him on a whim and he won’t harm him, but they will not hesitate to confront him, to humiliate him, to make him pay for the crimes that he shares with his other self. He must show them that he is not afraid and nothing they do will affect him.

"Marvelous."

Sha Hualing's smile is as sharp as a dagger.

Ning Yingying doesn’t dare to accompany them. She stands in the garden with her head down and her fingers twisting the fabric of her dress. The Little Palace Mistress also doesn’t join them, instead, she sits under a gazebo.

"It stinks too much for me," she excuses herself waving a perfect-nailed hand. "See you later, Shen Qingqiu. I hope you will act more respectfully next time."

He responds by rolling his eyes. And he follows Sha Hualing, Qui Haitang, and Liu Mingyan out of the garden, who guide him down a narrow path hidden among the beautiful palaces. Shen Jiu suspects that this is a secret path that they shouldn’t know about.

His curiosity grows when they reach a dungeon. Although his heart constricts as he remembers the occasion when he released Shen Yuan from the Water Prison, he walks nonchalantly. However, with each step, he realizes that the other Shen Qingqiu must be alive. There is no point in keeping a corpse locked up. Sha Hualing scoffs when he frowns, surely misinterpreting him.

But they don’t guide him to common cells or a Water Prison, but they go downstairs carved out of the rock. The atmosphere is so cold that it pierces his bones despite the layers of clothing. Soon, a stink of rot rises like dust. Shen Qingqiu wrinkles his nose and covers his face with a sleeve.

"Before it was worse." Sha Hualing explains with a malicious glint in her eyes. "Unless you appreciated the smell of blood, in that case, it was delicious... Here. We have arrived." His sharp nails brush against a door. "It's too bad you're late. He can't speak anymore."

The door opens. Shen Jiu is suspicious of a trap. It stinks like a corpse, but not even Luo Bing-ge is so insane to preserve the body of his former master in such deplorable conditions. Seeing that he doesn’t enter, Liu Mingyan slaps his back with an open palm, pushing him away. Shen Jiu hisses before looking at her, but not even his anger overshadows that inhuman and inexplicable hatred that distorts her expression to make the young woman a stranger.

And finally, he ignores them to face the horror that Luo Binghe has hidden deep within his palace.

At first, he only sees a thing hanging from several chains. But under the dirt, there is a human body. Incomplete. Without arms. Without legs. Just a pathetic dangling torso with eyes closed. One of his lids is wrinkled as if the eye socket is empty. The thing is rotting. But the thing is alive. Shen Jiu begins to run out of air. Though weakly, that thing's chest heaves. His breathing is raspy. Maybe because his lungs are also shattered and rotten. His breathing is so soft that it’s almost nonexistent. But it exists.

Because that thing is alive, its humanity is stripped of brutal wounds. That thing should be dead, but it languishes silently. The cold devours the thing and only his own blood protects his fragile and skeletal body.

The thing is not even aware that they are there, that Sha Hualing laughs. And her laughter resounds like the echo of bells.

Shen Jiu is paralyzed. Horror keeps him from staring at that nasty monster thing, so horrible that nausea creeps up his throat.

He is that thing.

Shen Jiu trembles with no air in his lungs, dizzy from the sight of the thing and that putrid stink. He stumbles. And his eyes stop on something shining on the ground.

Something metallic.

Shards.

Shiny and metallic shards.

Perhaps from a weapon.

A sword.

Xuan Su.

There's a scream stuck in his throat, mixed with nausea and a sob, but he only lets out an inhuman, bestial gasp. The world around him blurs and his heart races and his lungs expand and yet he feels like he's drowning. That he is that thing and that is why he cannot move or run away.

A few tears cover his eyes as Shen Jiu turns to flee. But there is no one. The door is closed. They have locked him up with that thing and he hears Sha Hualing giggling on the other side of the door and the voices of Qiu Haitang and Liu Mingyan wishing him a slow and painful death. But the thing is not dead and Shen Jiu wishes it is. Death is preferable, death is sweet. He was kind in condemning the Qiu to just disappear.

His fists hurt. He is knocking on the door without realizing it. Because he needs to flee before his brain understands all that MEANS THAT THING AND THE SHARDS OF XUAN SCATTERED ON THE GROUND, AS COLD AS THE CORPSE OF...

The door opens.

"Shizun!"

Ning Yignying cries, but she is not the one who holds him, but the very person who created the thing.

“What’s the meaning of that?” Luo Bing-ge growls and his voice surrounds him. His presence is everywhere, and Shen Jiu cannot get rid of him even if he tries to slap or kick him. His hands hold his shoulders tightly, but he is ignoring him as he scolds the other three. "This Lord thinks it was clear when I said that this Shen Qingqiu is not like ours."

"It was a joke!"

"Ling'er..."

"He was acting so annoying and arrogant! He must understand where he is now."

"That's a lie! Shizun and I were just taking a walk!"

All of their voices mingle in a diffuse echo that Shen Jiu hears without understanding. He has closed his eyes while he tries to control his breathing.

This is the fate that Shen Yuan was trying to change.

Shen Jiu is still tense, panic gnawing at his insides, but he straightens up and slaps Luo Binghe aside.

"Don't touch me." He hisses in disgust. And fear.

Nobody talks anymore. Ning Yingying shifts her weight from one foot to the other, uncomfortable and restless, Sha Hualing's smile is more insecure, and Luo Bing-ge's expression darkens. He moves and one arm wraps around his shoulders to lead him away from the dungeon while he closes the door with his other hand. That dry sound reverberates inside his ribs and Shen Jiu knows that he will keep thinking about the thing no matter how much he tries to run away. The memory of that ghastly sight, that smell, the brilliance of Xuan Su's shards, are locked inside his head.

"Don't worry, shizun." He promises him with a poisonous whisper and a smile that Shen Jiu would want to destroy with his nails. "If you behave well, you will be safe."

The threat paralyzed his bones with a tenacity worse than demon blood. Shen Jiu doesn't dare reject him when Luo Bing-ge pulls him toward him in a hug that is intended to be comforting. But it is cruel and painful.

"Next time you'll be punished, Ling'er. I don't want any of you to bother shizun anymore, is it clear?"

"Yes, husband." Several voices mutter at the same time.

"Good. Now let's get out of here."

Shen Jiu feels like a doll being dragged outside. And although it is a beautiful day, he still has the cold of the prison inside his body. His mouth tastes like bile and he keeps shaking. Ning Yingying, aware of his discomfort, takes his hand. Her skin is warm and she rubs her fingers gently over the injury.

"Let's go to the lake, shizun. You'll love it."

She speaks with the desperation of someone who wants to ignore the thing that Luo Binghe keeps in his palace. And he finally recognizes the differences between this Ning Yingying's smile and her disciple. Only one is really happy.

Shen Jiu doesn't pull her away but instead turns his head to look into Luo Bing-ge’s eyes.

"What do you want of me?" He finally dares to ask.

His voice is hoarse from all the screams that he hasn’t been able to release.

The Demon Lord leans down to stroke his cheek with mocking care.

"Your affection."

 

 

Shen Yuan died thinking that his sacrifice would fix everything. However, when he awakens his world is in chaos.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Readers: We have no fears.
Author: What if it takes to Shen Jiu as much time to come back as Shen Yuan?
Readers: WE HAVE ONE FEAR.

(Just kidding! Unless...)

Shen Yuan is back! Hope you're happy now 💖💖💖💖

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Yuan is back

Chapter Notes

A calmer chapter since we all need a break :')

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It's an ordinary awakening despite the ground in which he nearly drowns when he opens his mouth, gasping. Shen Yuan scrambles to escape this embrace of mud, leaves, and soil. And when he breathes the crisp air of the bamboo forest, his first thought after he dies is: Shen Jiu is going to kill me. He is a mess who hardly looks like a person. Although his body is lithe and strong, his skin is covered in mud scabs and his hair is dirty and tangled, so long that he trips when he tries to get up.

His first steps are staggering. That is a body that has never walked, that has never eaten or spoken. His heartbeat is impatient and fearful, his lungs expand and the air smells with a unique intensity that makes him dizzy. All the stimuli around him are sharper than ever, even though Shen Yuan is someone who has already died twice and this will be his third life.

Terrified of being discovered in such a disgraceful state, he sneaks off to the bamboo house. Despite his plans to travel the world, Shen Yuan had chosen to cultivate his seed at Qing Jing Peak. There are many reasons that he would use to justify his decision, but the truth is that he did it out of laziness: it is close, it is a place rich in qi and he could monitor the state of his body without moving away. And at that moment, naked and stunned by so many sensations, Shen Yuan appreciates it.

Of all the people he is avoiding, Mister Shen Perfect Jiu is the first. Shen Yuan passes through the bamboo forest in silence on a side road. He breathes a sigh of relief as he reaches the bamboo house without being discovered. Oh, the damage has been fixed, he observes. That's a good sign. No wars, no dramas. Qing Jing Peak is as calm as ever and he will soon regain his peaceful life. His brother has escaped PIDW's original fate and Luo Binghe has yet to commit any atrocity. Everyone can be happy now.

The house is trapped by a cold silence. Everything is just as he remembers it, so his transition must have been brief. Hopefully, Shen Jiu won't scold him much and will only punish him by copying some poem. Shen Yuan walks through the rooms carefully so as not to dirty anything up. After getting clean clothes, he prepares a hot bath and indulges in that comforting pleasure.

(Although ripping out all the filth is costly and soon the bath turns into torture.)

Shen Yuan only leaves the house when he is presentable again in his green robes, the fan that Liu Qingge gave him at his waist, and his hair in a hairpin gifted from his brother. At first, he wanted to wait for Shen Jiu to come back, but his nerves are nibbling at his stomach. It is the presentiment that reproach in the form of a storm is approaching. Waiting is stressful and overwhelming. Shen Yuan decides to pluck up his courage and go outside to look for Shen Jiu and find out what happened to Luo Binghe after his self-destruction.

He didn’t imagine that, upon seeing him, his disciples would run towards him like a bunch of ducklings and jump on him. Too much enthusiasm! He has never been dead! Why those tears?

Although their relief affects his heart. Fluffy cloud-like happiness spreads across his chest as he smiles.

"Stop crying, this Master has returned." He tries to reassure them, distributing head pats randomly. "Why those long faces? It was only a temporary absence!"

"We thought shizun was dead," Ming Fan cries.

"With how terrifying Jiu-Ge is? This Master would never have dared! And he wouldn't have left me... C'mon, I'm here. That's what matters, right?" Shen Yuan is looking for someone who is not a mess of tears and snot. The perfect candidate is Gongyi Xiao, who remains a bit distant, his eyes wet and his head bowed in embarrassment. "How long have I been out?"

Luo Binghe caused a lot of damage with his uncontrolled qi, in addition to the fact that his disciples would not be training calmly the day after a quasi-invasion, so Shen Yuan deduces that the soul change hasn’t been immediate. Maybe he's only been away for a few days...

"Responding to Master Shen, you have been absent for a year and a half."

His smile disappears and all his words are drowned out in unintelligible noise. Shen Yuan clears his throat as his thoughts spiral into a confusing maelstrom. That is too long! Normal that his disciples are treating him like a ghost!

"This Master apologizes. I... I didn't think it would take me that long to come back..."

His voice dies at the thought of Shen Jiu. And Liu Qingge, Luo Binghe, and everyone else. Embarrassed and enraged by the stupid magical rules of that world, Shen Yuan clenches his fists and restrains himself from covering his face with one hand.

But... maybe it wasn't bad. Qing Jing Peak is still perfect, the sect is as always. Perhaps that time of absence has allowed Luo Binghe to make amends with his brother and Cang Qiong Peak. After regaining his enthusiasm, he looks back at Gongyi Xiao.

"What happened after I self-destroyed? Did they burn my body?"

It wasn’t an actual death and Shen Yuan didn’t deserve a real funeral, but he would be excited if paper money had been burned for him. However, the young man twists his new green uniform with shaking hands and warns that nothing was as he expected. Perhaps Shen Jiu was so furious that he buried his corpse in the Demon Realm?

"Well..."

"That bastard Luo Binghe took Shizun's corpse!" Ming Fan intervenes, interrupting his awkward murmur. "He kidnapped the other shizun too!"

"HE DID WHAT?"

His pulse quickens and those old fears that he believed he had abandoned in his other body return to the horror that the story has continued. With jerking movements in panic, Shen Yuan pushes away the disciples who are still crying to demand the truth from the rest.

"What happened? Is my brother okay?"

Is he alive? Is he whole? Is he free or rotting in the infamous Water Prison?

Shen Yuan is getting dizzy as the book begins to turn real. The gore descriptions that he was so passionate about now make him nauseous. And his disciples, led by Ning Yingying, Ming Fan, and Gongyi Xiao speak at the same time in cacophonic chaos.

"Liu-shishu went to rescue shizun..."

"But Luo Binghe defeated him!"

"I heard that A-Luo defeated Liu-shishu twice..."

"Liu-shishu was in seclusion for a year. We don't know why..."

"But then he rescued shizun!"

"We were able to visit shizun. He was..."

"Sad."

"Strange."

"Mu-shishu said that he was sick."

"A disease that at first we did not know, but we were investigating!"

"Although shizun never responded to our letters, he always seemed happy to see us."

"After a year, Liu-shishu managed to rescue him."

"We were ready to defend shizun from Luo Binghe!"

"But then shizun disappeared!"

"We tried to search for him, but demons and monsters attacked us and endangered people!"

"After several months, Liu-shishu found shizun."

"But Luo Binghe captured shizun again and took him to the Demon Realm."

"We don't know what happened, only that Liu-shishu came and went to take care of Luo Binghe's shizun."

"But..."

"Something has happened."

"We don't know exactly what."

"Only that shizun is in danger."

"All the Peak Lords and Luo Binghe have gathered at Qiong Ding Peak."

"There is a meeting right now!"

Shen Yuan gets up although their voices echo in his head senselessly, only a thunderous noise that leaves him deaf and dizzy. Despite his confusion, he doesn't hesitate.

"Ming Yinginying, I need you to take me to Qiong Ding Peak."

The absence of a sword is not going to stop him.

And Ning Yingying also doesn’t doubt to unsheathe her spirit sword.

The sect is the same as before his self-destruction, but Shen Yuan finally understands that everything is different. The others have changed and so much has happened that not even Ning Yingying's report, more calm and orderly, clarifies his questions. Shen Yuan doesn’t understand why Shen Jiu has suffered even though he knew that he would return or how Mu Qingfang has identified a depression that shouldn’t exist at that time. He also doesn't want to believe that the War God was defeated or that something terrifying has forced them to ally with a Luo Binghe who almost repeats what he did in the book.

And his brother has disappeared.

Something stronger than Luo Binghe has taken him and that shouldn't be possible.

No one manages to stop him when he lands on Qiong Ding Peak. Shen Yuan walks with steps between furious and terrified until he reaches where the Peak Lords have gathered. The doors open with intensity and he enters still dragging that emotional chaos.

"Shen Jiu?" Someone mutters.

"WHERE THE HELL IS MY BROTHER? WHAT HAVE YOU BEEN DOING WHILE I WAS AWAY !?"

"Shen Yuan!"

He has no time for their questions or confused looks. His brother is missing and he needs answers. Upon stumbling upon Luo Binghe's expression, Shen Yuan begins to tremble.

"What happened? What did you do? Why...?" Furious, he covers his face with a sleeve so that no one will see him cry. That body is so sensitive that his emotions grow out of control. "Why didn't you protect him...?"

"Shizun... This disciple..."

His voice collapses into a strangled groan. Even though his appearance breaks with every step, Luo Binghe approaches him turned into someone different than the demon from last time. It is no longer madness that affects him, but a terrible sadness that leaves Shen Yuan speechless. Suddenly, Luo Binghe drops to the ground and bows to him.

"This disciple is sorry. It's my fault... I couldn't protect shizun!"

The protagonist is crying. His body trembles, shaken by tears and exhaustion that he never imagined in Luo Binghe. Everything is wrong, but that's the worst. It breaks the illusion of being part of a written story to sink into the murky waters of unpredictable real life.

Shen Yuan turns as Liu Qingge approaches them with clenched fists and a livid face. He is also suffering, although his feelings are much less intense but just as real as those of the demon.

"You’re back... Are you real?"

"Yes, Liu-shidi."

Liu Qingge does something as incomprehensible as Luo Binghe's bow: he hugs him. It is too strong and leaves him gasping for air and protesting, but it is also a desperate hug and Shen Yuan notices his dry throat realizing that his decision was perhaps not perfect.

"Please, can someone tell me what happened to my brother?"

The truth that awaits him was neither pleasant nor hopeful. It breaks everything he believed in the world of the book and awakens his worst nightmares about torture and mutilation. They don't know what it means. Only Shang Qinghua knows in detail the world he built and later destroyed.

Shen Yuan becomes dizzy, almost losing consciousness, and two pairs of arms hold him down. For a moment, he is grateful. But he's too tense to be distracted by nonsense.

"What were you fighting for?" Shen Yuan hisses. "Why did you leave my brother alone?"

Even though Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe bow their heads in regret, they are both furious and glare at each other with hatred.

"This disciple recently discovered that shizun wasn't dead. No one told me the truth."

"Because you kidnapped Shen Jiu first! Twice! You isolated him from the sect and poisoned him with your blood."

"Stop!" Shen Yuan interrupts them, too hysterical to think about the consequences of their actions. Besides, it no longer matters: he is not the perfect Shen Qingqiu, but the millennial who argued about horrible books. "I want my brother back."

Luo Binghe clenches his fists and bites his lip until he bleeds.

"This disciple has not been able to open a way to the other world. It is closed..."

"Oh, don’t worry." Shen Yuan looks around for Shang Qinghua, who is trying to hide behind Yue Qingyuan. "I will find a way." He promises in a cold, sharp voice.

At PIDW there was always a solution to impossible problems. And for the first time in his life, Shen Yuan is willing to accept a Deus Ex Machina if it returns him to his brother.

 

 

When he was a child, Shen Jiu made the mistake of waiting for Qi-Ge. He waited and waited, as the days turned into years and the torture ripped apart his body and doomed his future. He waited and waited, while he collected wounds that still accompany him like invisible scars. He waited… until he reached his limit and everything burned. He broke. Even though he was lucky to not die, he broke into a thousand pieces that turned him into an unhappy person, who fought for ambitions that would rot when they were achieved.

When Shen Yuan died, he waited again. And for a year he lost control of his life, he let his disciple become a huge problem, and all his fears caught him.

This time, Shen Jiu won't wait.

He has learned his lesson and will not make the same mistake anymore. He won’t wait for an impossible rescue as long as the world is sealed by Luo Bing-ge's spell (and a part of him knows that they will never look for him since now they already have Shen Yuan). He won't surrender to his worst emotions again until he becomes another Luo Bing-ge’s doll.

It's strange, but after a long time, Shen Jiu feels alive thanks to having a goal in mind. They still don't know what a furious Qing Jing Peak strategist can do.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Shen Yuan after waiting five minutes: Waiting is stressful and horrible.
Shen Jiu: Hold my tea.

CURIOSITY #1
In relation to some comments from the previous chapter: trauma doesn't make you stronger. In Shen Jiu's case, trauma destroyed him. However, he now possesses the tools that he has gained from his past experiences (mainly therapy). And although he is back in a situation similar to the trigger for his trauma, this time it will be different.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

The one who is wrong

Chapter Notes

This chapter is 100% self-indulgent. I hope that Shang Qinghua is not acting very OOC! He also has the right to get angry sometimes.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Shang Qinghua trembles, pale and scared, when Shen Yuan glares at him.

“I need a fucking explanation. Now.”

They are at An Ding Peak. The smell of ink and tea and the quiet of the room create a bubble of deceptive peace. But outside those walls, the world is in chaos and Shen Yuan is still trying to understand everything that has happened in his absence.

"What other Luo Binghe? There is only one inimitable protagonist! This didn’t happen in the original work!"

"Ehhmh..." Shang Qinghua wrings his hands nervously. "Based on their descriptions... I think he's... (don't kill me cucumber bro) my original son."

"That can't be possible! In PIDW there was never a plot like this. Maybe it's an illusion? There were twenty subplots in which Luo Binghe's worst fears come true and he loses some of his wives to an illusion... But it doesn't make sense because Luo Binghe isn't gay. "

"About that..."

"Maybe it's another plot by whoever set us up with the sowers?"

"Cucumber bro, please!" It is the first time that Shang Qinghua has yelled at him and Shen Yuan blinks, confused. "Why did you want to talk to me if you don't listen to me? Jiu bro has been kidnapped by a Luo Binghe that looks like the original one. The description matches: the only person capable of hurting and surpassing Luo Binghe is another Luo Binghe."

But Shen Yuan doesn't want to believe it. Everything that has happened during his absence is a blurred shadow. For him all that time has been only an instant, not almost two years. The only certainty is that his brother is not there and he feels nauseous at the thought that he has ended up in the original book.

"You are all hysterical." He speaks with false calm. "A lot has happened in the last few days and your point of view is not reliable. Perhaps you have been too quick to make conclusions."

"It hasn't been days , Cucumber bro. It's been a year and a half."

Unable to accept it, Shen Yuan waves his hand to dismiss it.

"We have to be reasonable. In PIDW there were no other worlds. Besides, it's just a book! It can’t be real!"

"Now we live here! It's real! And the book has already changed. Look around you! Shen Qingqiu shouldn't have a brother, Liu Qingge should be dead, and Luo Binghe's obsession with his two shizuns is different. Everything is different! It's no longer Proud Immortal Demon Way . After all these changes, why do you have a hard time accepting that something unpredictable has happened? "

"But this breaks the suspension of disbelief! And Luo Bing-ge would be acting OOC if he kidnapped my brother."

"After reading and analyzing my book, have you still not realized my son's obsession with Shen Qingqiu?" Shang Qinghua rubs the bridge of his nose. "I may have been a bad author, but you are an even worse reader."

Offended, Shen Yuan blushes as he opens his mouth.

"What!?"

"No, now you are going to listen to me." He interrupts him with an unexpected boldness. "Maybe Proud Immortal Demon Way wasn't the best book, but it turned out like this because readers wanted porn and a ridiculously large harem. I had plans, plots, and character backdrops. But nobody cared! Writing about the heavenly pillar Luo Binghe paid my bills, that's the reality." Shang Qinghua takes a deep breath before continuing to speak. "Your comments were always funny. Unpleasant, unfair, and very rude too. Whenever I read them, I felt that at least someone was aware that the shitty system we live in had destroyed my story. But it also frustrated me knowing that I could never write about certain things that would have shut your mouth. And now here we are! You have changed the plot, you appreciate the character you hated the most, and yet you still don't understand anything."

“That’s not true!”

"You are one of those who considered that Binghe did nothing wrong! But he did! Revenge is not justice. Shen Qingqiu wasn’t a good person, but nothing he did justify that ending. Still, you wanted more, do you remember? " He accused him in a cold voice. "My book was about circles of abuse. You could write 10,000 words criticizing the internal coherence of the story but you never realized a message as obvious as that."

"Because Shen Qingqiu is different from Jiu-ge..."

"They're not! They are the same person! The problem is that you can forgive even the most horrible crime if it is done by someone you care about. In the past, you wrote a lot of hatred against Shen Qingqiu when discovering the story of Qiu Haitang. But... Did you even react this time? Or were you too happy that your brother recognized you? "

His cheeks burn, covered in an embarrassed and angry blush. Shen Yuan clenches his fists on his knees. It is getting harder to meet Shang Qinghua's gaze.

"Your beloved Luo Binghe was an unreliable narrator," he continues. "You should know by now. It doesn't matter what Shen Qingqiu did to him, he killed a lot more people, he..."

"Yes, I understand that." Shen Yuan hisses. "Jiu-ge is not as bad as the book portrayed him."

"You know now. As a reader, you never commented on the incoherence of Luo Binghe condemning Shen Qingqiu for mistreatment, murder, and lust when he was the worst abuser, murderer, and lustful man."

"We're drifting off-topic! We need to save Jiu-ge. He hasn't done anything wrong, we can't leave him alone!"

Shen Yuan needs to believe in other plots and alternatives because imagining his brother with the original Luo Binghe is too scary and painful.

"So, you're finally assuming that your beloved protagonist is not a good person. Congratulations." Despite the sarcasm, Shang Qinghua breathes a sigh of relief.

"I still consider Luo Binghe's appearance to be absurd," he mutters through clenched teeth. "And it doesn't make sense: he has already had his revenge, why does he want my brother?"

Shang Qinghua rests his elbows on the table as he covers his face with both hands.

"No. You still don't understand anything." He whimpers. "Did you never suspect anything after so many analyzes complaining that Luo Binghe neglected his wives? His love for them was brief, his hatred for Shen Qingqiu eternal. If he is the Luo Binghe at the end of the book, do you think he will miss this opportunity to retrieve a perfectly good Shen Qingqiu? "

"This is your fault for writing the story!"

"Yeah, it's the author's fault for writing Luo Binghe and Shen Jiu for being the villain. But everything Luo Binghe does is perfect!" His sarcastic tone returns. "Being the protagonist doesn't always prove you right. Luo Binghe was an imperfect protagonist and no hero."

"Well, the Shen Qingqiu in the book did do some things wrong... But I tried to prevent my brother from making the same mistakes! Our Binghe is good and the other is not." He reasonably exposes. "So, the problem is not Luo Binghe's nature."

"Why are you so dense when you put your mind to it? Where should I start? Everything you don't see doesn't mean it doesn't exist. A lot of things have happened and you have the problem of jumping to the wrong conclusions because you don't see the complete image."

"Can we stop being distracted and find a way to save my brother?"
