"No, because you need to remove the blindfold and see reality as it is. Shall we start with Proud Immortal Demon Way ? Tell me, did something strange happen when you saved Liu Qingge in the Lingxi Caves?"

Shen Yuan frowns.

"He was suffering from a qi deviation."

"Was that mentioned in the book?"

"...no."

"But it also happened. However, the readers only had the point of view of Luo Binghe, who didn't know many details. So, now, can you guess what actually happened between Shen Qingqiu and Liu Qingge in my book?"

The image of the original character treacherously murdering his shidi fades, replaced by his own memories in which Liu Qingge attacked him.

"Next: the demonic invasion. Readers still didn’t know that Liu Qingge was dead. Shen Qingqiu had survived a Peak Lord in a murderous state when he found the sect was in danger. Thanks to his deal with Sha Hualing, Cang Qiong Sect had no losses. What do you think his logic was during the three fights? "

"He was the first because it was an assured victory. Afterward, Liu Mingyan volunteered and he didn’t object."

"Liu Mingyan was Liu Qingge's sister and the main disciple of Xian Shu Peak. He assumed that she would win. However, Liu Mingyan lost and that cornered him. Do you still think that he chose Luo Binghe because he expected him to be killed instead of choosing who would win and save the sect?"

Shen Yuan notes a bitter taste in his dry throat. Uncomfortable, he ducks his head.

"But he mistreats Luo Binghe daily..."

"Most of the mistreatment was ignoring the harassment of the other disciples because Shen Qingqiu doesn't care about him and that's the truth. He was indifferent and... he also had problems in the past. Circles of abuse. Shen Jiu was repeating what he was taught. Or did you never suspect anything strange about the story of Qiu Haitang? A former slave killing so many people, but leaving others alive. If it had been a cold crime, there would be no survivors. But there were. Specifically, his former fiancée who claimed that he was well treated. That only leaves two possibilities: first, it was not intentional. Second, it was intentional but Qiu Haitang deserved to live and the others did not. Do you have other conclusions besides an analysis of why Shen Qingqiu is a monster that deserved torture? "

"You never wrote any of this," he murmured, unable to meet his eyes anymore.

"Because you didn't want a villain with a background, but gore and porn." He mumbled with an ancient grudge. "Lastly, the Alliance Conference. Why push your disciple into the Abyss when you could have killed him? No one would have suspected anything, a lot of disciples died that day. Luo Binghe survived because Shen Qingqiu never intended to kill him."

"He pushed him to hell!"

"And you would have done it too because the System asked you to!"

"I planned to prepare him and convince him to come down, not cause him trauma!"

"Your plan was to deceive him.” Shang Qinghua huffs. “You can still believe yourself morally superior because in both cases your brother did it. This part has happened twice, why do you think that both times did Shen Qingqiu push Luo Binghe to the Abyss instead of killing the demon?"

"No, no, they are different situations!" Shen Yuan exclaims, gesturing with his hands. "Jiu-ge did it to protect me. If Luo Binghe didn't end up in the Abyss, I would have died."

"In Proud Immortal Demon Way , he did it to protect the sect. If Luo Binghe didn’t end up in the Abyss, the other sects would have accused the Cang Qiong Sect of sabotage."

“Oh.”

"As I already told you: Proud Immortal Demon Wa y was a book about repeating circles of abuse. Shen Qingqiu wasn’t a good person by any means, but neither was he evil and heartless person. He needed therapy. Luo Binghe as well." Shang Qinghua sighs. "I could tell you about all the plots I could never write, but it doesn't matter. Now that you understand the book better, let's get to your second mistake: your Luo Binghe is not a good person. Although, he is not evil either."

Shen Yuan's last memories are blurred like a dream. And he consciously decides to ignore the betrayal when Luo Binghe used his blood, betraying his trust.

"It's Xin Mo's fault."

"If you know, do something! Your brother ordered to reform Zheng Yang, now you convince your disciple to leave Xin Mo."

"He will never give up his golden finger!"

"So, so the blame is not on the sword but on the ambition of the one who wields it?"

Shen Yuan chokes on his own words.

"That may also be Xin Mo's fault..."

"See? You're doing the same thing again: defending Luo Binghe by blaming everyone else. Aren't there many coincidences that Luo Binghe’s only guilt is choosing the worst sword, having the worst shizun, and being written by the worst writer? Give him some credit!"

Embarrassed, Shen Yuan bows his head.

"Sorry for calling you a bad writer." He apologizes. "I didn't know about that when I read the book."

"Well, all the books are written by real people. And even if the story sucks, that doesn't excuse trolls and haters to not have empathy."

"I'll talk to Luo Binghe about the sword. Still, Xin Mo is messing with his head."

"Xin Mo affects his decisions, that's true. We will all be safer if we get rid of the sword. But don't forget: Xin Mo tempts him with his wishes. Shall we now talk about everything your disciple has done while you were dead?" Shang Qinghua gives him a disapproving look, like a teacher angry at a mischievous child. "First, steal your body and kidnap your brother. For a year. And I hope you apologize to Jiu bro because he has been going through depression and a grieving disorder all this time. And that was not just the writer's fault." He accuses him in a sharp voice. "Luo Binghe has seriously injured Liu Qingge and threatened the sect. He used to attack us to force Jiu bro to return to his side. The second time he kidnapped him, he forced him to give his blood. If Jiu bro wouldn't have been isolated in his palace, Luo Bing-ge wouldn't have had it so easy to kidnap him."

"If he's the original lead, nothing would have stopped him..."

"But perhaps it would have been different if Liu Qingge or Yue Qingyuan had been around." Shang Qinghua sighs. "However, the first thing you did when you returned was scolding Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe as if they were both equally responsible."

"I still didn't know anything about this!" Shen Yuan defends himself. "They were both acting like angry cats while my brother was missing!"

"Be more careful next time." Shang Qinghua pauses and all of his aggressiveness and resentment disappear with hesitation. "I have been helping Mu Qingfang so he can understand therapy and mental illness. Shen Jiu needed it and he has improved a lot."

"Why do I have the impression that you are hiding something from me?" Shen Yuan squints his eyes and looks at him suspiciously. "You know your characters very well. Why has Jiu-ge suffered if he knew that my death was not real?"

"I better tell you that when he comes back, okay?" The author clears his throat nervously. "The point is that Luo Binghe also needs therapy. Mu Qingfang has tried to help him, but he has always refused. Tell him. He will listen to you. Tell him to put down that sword and that Mu Qingfang can help him control his emotions. Demons are by nature more aggressive and cruel, but he is half-human. Theoretically, it should be easier for him to learn how to control his inner demons."

Shen Yuan doesn't say anything. He feels as if all the author's words occupy the space of the room and crush him until he is breathless. Since he had awakened, confusion and fear have kept him in a state of disconnection from reality. Or maybe that disconnect exists from the start. After all, he was the idiot who died dedicating his last words and thoughts to a book that he could choose whether to read or not.

At least being a hater served to pay Airplane's bills , he thinks resentfully against himself.

The worst thing is that all that discussion has been of no use because his brother is still lost too far and if it is true that he is in the clutches of Luo Bing-ge, he may never see him again. Or maybe he doesn't get him whole and Shen Yuan trembles. The entire time, his motivation was to avoid that ending. Yet is his brother, someone he sincerely appreciates, who may suffer from it. And that's not fair.

It never was and Shen Yuan finally gets it.

"You are the damn author. You invented this world, how can I get Jiu-ge back?"

Shang Qinghua scratches his forehead.

"Do you think I haven't been pondering about it all this time? From what I can gather, my son very carefully devised the trap. Not only did he look for an artifact capable of restraining Xin Mo while he kidnapped Jiu bro, but he has also found a method to block the path between the two dimensions. Our Luo Binghe has been trying all this time and still hasn't succeeded."

Fear crushes his lungs, his stomach twists, and nausea creeps up his throat.

"There must be some way!"

"Perhaps! But I have no idea! I was writing 10,000 words in one day, believe me, my brain forgot all the fucking worldbuilding."

"But not me." Shen Yuan frowns. "You say that Luo Bing-ge has locked the dimensions? So, he has decided to use something very specific. Perhaps, if I find the artifact, we can reopen the dimensions."

His only hope is a tiny possibility, but Shen Yuan clings to it desperately. Anxious, he bids farewell to the author to run to Qing Jing Peak and search for his books. According to the description given to him, the artifact that Luo Bing-ge used as a barrier is the same one from a subplot in which a demonic chief handed him a trap. It would be logical that Luo Bing-ge chose another well-known relic, Shen Yuan deduces. And we both know the same.

He is walking down the slope of An Ding Peak when he sees Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe, the two of them engulfed in dense silence and caught by the same looks of hatred. Although Shen Yuan smiles unconsciously upon seeing them, his heart freezes as he remembers Shang Qinghua's words.

Luo Binghe is no longer an adorable puppy, but an untamed beast.

"Shidi, Luo Binghe, what are you doing here?" he asks them, approaching them with restless steps. "Do you have any news?"

But Liu Qingge shakes his head and all his hopes die.

"Shizun seemed very confident when you went to talk to Shang-shishu, did you find anything?"

"Perhaps I have a clue. But it is very imprecise and this Master needs to investigate first."

When he takes a step forward, heading for the Rainbow Bridge, the other two follow coordinated.

"Aren't you going to leave me alone?" Luo Binghe hisses when they reach Qing Jing Peak.

Liu Qingge responds with a snort.

"And allow you to kidnap Shen Yuan as well if I left you alone? In your dreams."

Shen Yuan walks a few steps ahead, even so, he hears them perfectly. It would be easy to ignore their discussion and attribute it to rivalry stupidity, but Shang Qinghua has managed to make him no longer consider their anger the same.

"Luo Binghe..." Shen Yuan stops. And at that moment he understands that he is still afraid. For the others, it has been years, for him only a long dream since the last time he saw his disciple. Fear has conditioned all of his decisions about Luo Binghe, such as accepting his blood or self-destruction. And they are not, precisely, small gestures. Shen Yuan gulps before looking at that stranger with the face of his disciple. "We need your help. Without you, I can never get Jiu-ge back."

"This disciple will do whatever it takes!" He exclaims and his voice sounds desperate and broken.

But it is not enough for him to regret it if he later makes the same mistakes.

"But when you return, we need you to get rid of that sword, please."

Luo Binghe frowns and looks doubtful for the first time.

"I need Xin Mo to protect shizun..."

Liu Qingge snorts beside him, folding his arms.

"Since you have that sword you have done nothing to protect him."

Shen Yuan clears his throat to get their attention.

"Xin Mo is dangerous. It hurts you and those around you, you need a better sword. And..." He swallows hard. "When we get Jiu-ge back, you'll have to listen to him. Understood? You can't decide for him. Nor kidnap him again."

"Nor Shen Yuan," Liu Qingge adds, staring at the demon.

Luo Binghe clenches his fists tightly, ducking his head.

"I never intended for shizun to suffer." His gaze seeks Shen Yuan's with tears in his eyes. "Not even that shizun died. I'm sorry, shizun..."

"But sometimes we make selfish decisions that hurt someone else," Shen Yuan mutters, thinking how badly Shang Qinghua must have felt when reading his comments. "Next time, think about the other person's feelings. Even if I hadn't, ahem, disappeared ." He clears his throat nervously. "I wouldn't have been happy if you had abducted me that other time. I want to be here. With my disciples, my books, my cat, and Jiu-ge. And the same goes for my brother. You can't decide for us."

“I understand.” Luo Binghe mutters, still with his head bowed, but dropping his fists weakly. "I'll fix everything."

"There is a third thing this Master must ask of you when we rescue Jiu-ge." Shen Yuan takes a deep sigh. "Go see Mu Qingfang."

Luo Binghe finally reacts, tensing up defensively.

"I'm fine."

"No, you're not. We threw you into the Abyss. That was cruel and horrible. It's normal if you're not okay." His gaze searches for Liu Qingge, who listens silently to them still frowning and arms crossed. "You too, Liu-shidi. You have suffered because of me, this Master apologizes."

They are no longer characters, but people. And people suffer when someone they love dies or are pushed unexplained to hell.

 

 

Meanwhile, in another world, the Demon Emperor storms into Shen Jiu's room with violent rage.

Chapter End Notes

CURIOSITY #1
Although I like Shen Yuan as a character, as a writer I consider him to be a terrible and toxic reader. I started to write fanfics fleeing from people like Shen Yuan, who have the moral superiority to belittle your work and at the same time stay in the most superficial part. When I read SVSSS, at first I didn't like Shang Qinghua. I thought he was a shitty writer, but as the plot progressed I began to understand him a lot better. (In this essay I will explain how capitalism has ruined PIDW and so many authors...)

So, yeah, Shang Qinghua deserves more recognition!

This chapter will be crucial for the development of Bingbing and Shen Yuan. As many of you pointed in the previous chapter, Shen Yuan has disconnected from reality. He always saw everything as if it were a book and disappearing for almost two years has done to him a lot of damage. All the main characters have been through a lot during that time while he's still the same Shen Yuan from 16 chapters ago.

He will change. But he needs time.

BONUS
Veterinarian: Hello, how can I help you?
Luo Bing-ge: I have problems with my new (stolen) cat >:(

----------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Luo Bing-ge gets mad

Chapter Notes

BONUS: Are you lost with so many worlds and so many Shen Qingqiu? System is here to help you!
First world, codename "Found Brother". How many Shen Qingqiu? 2 (one missing). Description:
-Shen Qingqiu (Shen Jiu): First Shen Qingqiu, currently in the second world. ROLE: romantic interest.
-Shen Qingqiu (Shen Yuan): Second Shen Qingqiu, recently revived. His corpse is still in Luo Binghe's palace. ROLE: romantic interest.

Second world, codename "Proud Immortal Demon Way". How many Shen Qingqiu? 2. Description:
-Shen Qingqiu (Original): Authentic Shen Qingqiu, currently dismembered and locked up in a cell. ROLE: horrible villain.
-Shen Qingqiu (Shen Jiu): The Shen Qingqiu that just arrived. ROLE: harem villain.

* The assignment of roles is according to the point of view of the Luo Binghe of each world.

 

MERRY XMAS!!!!!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The morning of the same day that Luo Binghe storms into Shen Jiu's room with violent rage, Shen Jiu decides to visit the garden again. In an unexpected burst of courage, Ning Yingying decides to accompany him. Although she is not his true disciple, Shen Jiu has sympathy for her. And he also feels remorse to see her tremble and wring her hands uneasily. Ning Yingying walks beside him with little mouse steps, despite the fact that, according to the information he has gathered, she is one of Luo Bing-ge's three main wives.

Still, Shen Jiu understands her. The others seem to have been corrupted by the darkness of the Demon Lord. That whole world seems twisted and putrid, shattered in a nauseating way.

This time, Shen Jiu has created an armor of arrogance to return to the garden. Despite the storm of sharp stares, cruel laughter, and tension that poisons the air, Shen Jiu walks as if this place belongs to him. Those ignorant fools think they can affect him, but they don't know that this situation is better than the helplessness of being a slave of the Qiu.

And Shen Jiu hasn't forgotten: now he's a cultivator, a Peak Lord with good reasons to return to his world. He not only possesses the power to defend himself but also the experience of being a prisoner and spiteful intelligence.

Step one: don't resist. His enemies must underestimate him, belief in their victory to soften their vigilance.

Second step: gather more information about the artifacts that Luo Bing-ge used to kidnap him.

Shen Jiu walks with apparent disinterest, telling Ning Yingying about the plants and flowers that decorate the garden. She responds with forced smiles and monosyllables. Despite her discomfort, he doesn't stop. Nor when nervousness grows like branches under his skin. There are sharper gazes than others, crueler voices, and Shen Jiu seeks them out despite the trembling of his heart. He still remembers the claustrophobia and dank darkness of the cell in which the thing is locked like a vomiting nightmare. And the culprits of that confinement are close. Too much.

Right now, they are worse than Luo Bing-ge.

Shen Jiu is aware of Sha Hualing's closeness when he decides to stop in front of a thicket of golden roses.

"Although these only grow in the Demon Realm, their origin is heavenly," he explains to Ning Yingying.

Ignoring the people he despises is one of his best honed talents by time. Despite the demoness' shrill appearance, Shen Jiu pretends that she doesn’t exist in a performance worthy of recognition. That annoys her, of course. Sha Hualing walks towards them accompanied by the jingle of her bells. Although Ning Yingying stiffens, he continues to turn his back on her.

"What a surprise to see you around, Master Shen!" The demoness greets him with a sweet but cold laugh. "I hope you are not trying to escape."

Shen Jiu assumes that such a large harem must be supported by a complicated system of privileges. Fortunately, all of his targets are central figures. He turns to give her one of his most dismissive glances. From what he has deduced, Sha Hualing is not only one of the main wives, but also a close companion of Luo Binghe. Everything he says or does will be reported to the demon. Probably twisted to turn the truth into a lie.

Perfect, he thinks, curling his lips into a grimace.

"Unlike you, I’m not stupid."

The demoness's smile grows to show his fangs. A menacing reddish gleam flashes in her eyes.

"Perhaps Master Shen doesn't understand the situation..."

"I think you are the one who doesn’t understand. Let this Master enlighten you." Shen Jiu sketches one of those grimaces that he hasn’t used for years, formed with half-mockery and half-disdain. "This is not my world. I have nowhere to go, why waste my precious time trying? I’m unarmed and I sense that the world outside the palace is hostile. Do you want to push me into danger, demoness?"

He has spoken loud enough that the whole harem can hear them. Humiliating Sha Hualing may be one of the few hobbies of some of these women. Despite the accusation, the demoness is a worthy opponent and doesn’t allow rage to engulf the control of her emotions.

"So, have you accepted your fate to marry Jushang? How unexpected of the proud Master Shen! Too bad that no one is happy to include you in the family."

As I care.

"Who said anything about getting married?" That gets the demoness to smile victoriously by catching a hint of rebellion. "Your husband is clearly confused. I intend to wait for him to get bored and return me to my world."

"That will not happen, Master Shen. Luo Binghe has a record of more than three hundred successful conquests and no failures."

Of course, that plan is too naive and even Shen Jiu doesn't believe in it. Too bad, he sighs. It would be the perfect answer. Still, he waves his hand to downplay his words. Looking stupid is part of the first step of his plan.

"I know my disciple better than you, but thank you for your consideration."

Sha Hualing takes a deep breath, slightly annoyed by his indifferent attitude to her provocations.

"I'm afraid Master Shen is terribly wrong... about everything."

"And what makes you suppose that someone like you knows more than the Qing Jing Peak Lord?" Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow. "As I understand it, I am the only one who has met two Luo Binghe and two worlds. What about you?"

A slight but furious blush covers the demoness's cheeks.

"I’m trying to give you some friendly advice, Master Shen. You are underestimating my Jushang's tenacity."

"And you my ambition." Shen Jiu takes a deep breath before grinning like a villain. Third step: encourage Luo Binghe's wives to get rid of him. "As I've already said, I know two Luo Binghe, why would I resign myself to staying here? My Luo Binghe," he possessively emphasizes the name to sound more believable. "has promised me fidelity. I have no interest in competing with you when I can have one Luo Binghe entirely to myself. Even more! Depending on what I wish, I can choose between a Demon Lord and a War God, both equally attractive and with immeasurable talent."

Shen Jiu is almost startled after hearing a furious hiss, but it's part of his role to be arrogant and unattainable. Ning Yingying hides behind him and Sha Hualing turns her head to see Liu Mingyan approaching them with furious and restless steps.

Perfect, Shen Jiu lifts his sleeve to cover his smile. It is time to move on third and fourth steps.

“Who!?” He growls. "Who dared to take the title from my brother?"

Shen Jiu lets out an exaggeratedly mocking giggle.

"No one. Did Luo Binghe tell you anything? Liu Qingge is alive in my world."

Despite the veil, Liu Mingyan pales as she realizes what that means. Despite the fact that Sha Hualing is famous for her hot blood while she for her calmness, the woman draws her sword to point it at him.

"Stay away from my brother!"

"How if he insists on meekly crawling into my bed?"

Shen Jiu longs for a fan. It's hard to control his emotions and hide the satisfaction that the third and fourth steps of his plan work perfectly. Poor naive girls, facing the master of collecting enemies. Although the fourth step involves them discovering how different the two worlds are, the third requires them to see him as a love rival and they preferentially conspire to give him back to his world. At worst, they will try to assassinate him, but that's the sixth step.

Liu Mingyan shivers vividly and her rage makes her sword tremble.

"Oh, don't look at me like that. Your brother is a formidable warrior, an unsurpassed beauty and this master is unable to resist his charms."

"You're lying! You hate him!"

"How could I hate the man who saved my life?"

Liu Mingyan blinks, confused. The best lies are those that seem credible. Grudge blinds Liu Mingyan, but her brother's adoration will make her accept without hesitation all the compliments he says about Liu Qingge. Luckily, she will slowly begin to believe that he is in love with Liu Qingge.

Shen Jiu sighs exaggeratedly.

"In this world, there is no Liu Qingge and I must share Luo Binghe with three hundred despicable women, why should I stay? Unless..." He has turned and looks at them sideways. "I wonder how far Luo Binghe will go to get my affection. My tastes are simple: I appreciate loyalty and devotion above any jewel."

The satisfaction of contemplating their nervousness and restlessness almost made up for the unpleasant moment they made him suffer. This is fun, he thinks. It's been a long time since I've bothered someone so much. Shen Jiu hums as he wonders how Luo Bing-ge will act if he posed such a dilemma to him. Too bad that everything he has told is lies and he has no intention of staying in that world and ruling over a harem.

But they don't know. They don’t know that Shen Jiu's true motivation is to return to his brother’s side or that his romantic feelings are much more confused. They don't know anything, they just believe in misconceptions.

A servant appears and the four of them turn in unison.

"Master Shen, Lord Luo sent this humble one to announce that he will eat with you today."

Shen Jiu exaggerates a victorious smile to rub that preference over the other two even though his heart beats uneasily.

Fifth step: Avoid Luo Binghe, but subtly. He must avoid both his anger and interest. He must be so boring as a doll, someone who doesn’t involve any risk; someone that offers him a pinch of what he wants to prevent him from forcing him against his will.

"It will be a pleasure."

 

That day, the Demon Emperor storms into Shen Jiu's room with violent rage.

Shen Jiu groans, annoyed by the sudden scandal, but without opening his eyes. He notices how the healers and servants surrounding his bed are startled and receive his lord with fearful curtsies.

"How is he? Who did it?" His anger reverberates against the walls and makes the furniture shack. "Who dares to poison my future wife?"

It's hard trying to stay hurt while his own anger grows inside the walls of his stomach. Oh, Shen Jiu hates that possessiveness, that feminization that he has never asked for. However, he still has the satisfaction of being more intelligent and that is why he doesn’t react when Luo Bing-ge sits on the edge of the mattress to take one of his hands.

"We think it could have been one of his wives... again," comments one of the healers.

"Rumors say..."

"... that Sha-fei wants to get rid of Master Shen..."

"... or that Master Shen provoked Sha-fei and Liu-dafei..."

"... or that several of them are jealous..."

"Fortunately, it is a mild poison! Master Shen will recover with a little rest!"

Of course, it is a mild poison. Shen Jiu is not that desperate to poison himself with an unknown poison that could cause him irreparable harm. Even so, he groans again, keeping his eyes closed in the determination that Luo Binghe will decide to let him rest and forget about the promised meal.

He is not rejecting him, too bad that he has been poisoned.

Too bad that some idiot planted beautiful but poisonous flowers in a garden.

Too bad that he possesses an encyclopedic knowledge of flora.

Shen Jiu struggles to remain unconscious when Luo Binghe stands up. And that victory is more satisfying than having left his rivals speechless. The demon takes too long to let go of his hand, but in the end, he does so while muttering a frustrated growl.

"Find out the culprit. I don't care who it was, this will not end without punishment."

"Yes, my lord!!!!" Several voices chant.

A treacherous smile almost peeks across his lips as the bedroom door closes.

Sixth step: weaken Luo Bing-ge's trust in his harem.

Chapter End Notes

CURIOSITY #1
According to my search, "-fei" means wife. In case of harems, "-dafei" is for the first wife. Correct me if I'm wrong!

CURIOSITY #2
Do you know what I love? Shen Jiu trapped in horrible circumstances using his wits to survive. Give me more stories like that! PLEASE!! He's cunning, a bastard, and a survivor.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Do it for Shen Yuan

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Shen Yuan becomes aware of the weariness on his eyelids as Luo Binghe kneels beside him to offer him a cup of tea.

"Shizun..." His disciple's voice is a murmur fearful of making a mistake. If Shen Yuan wasn't so focused on reading ancient manuscripts, he would have noticed that Luo Binghe walks silently, his expression clouded, and his shoulders slumped as if were crushed by an invisible weight. "It's late. Shizun should rest."

His exhaustion is as thick as the darkness that covers the sky, but Shen Yuan stretches like a cat before shaking his head.

"This master is fine."

But when he goes to resume reading the manuscript, someone takes it from him. Shen Yuan protests with a groan, but Liu Qingge ignores him. With a determined scowl, he jerked and carelessly scooped up all the reading material Shen Yuan had gathered. Shen Yuan trembles as he gazes at those battered books.

"Rest." Liu Qingge orders him with a growl, unexpectedly soft and with a hint of concern.

"This master is fine!" Shen Yuan protests.

But neither of them wants to believe him. With a resigned sigh, Shen Yuan reluctantly agrees that he won’t be able to continue investigating that night. Unless he gets rid of his guests. So, he stretches his arms while he exaggerates a yawn.

"Okay, it's late. But you should rest too." He adds.

After all, both Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe have been helping him while he consulted different books. Both have flown from one end of the sect to the other to bring him material from the libraries of the other peaks and have assisted him in all his requests. If it weren't for them, Shen Yuan wouldn't have even eaten!

Shen Yuan rests one elbow on the table and his chin on the back of his hand as he watches over his former disciple.

"This master wonders… Luo Binghe." He is startled after hearing his name. "Where are you staying?"

Both men stiffen.

"Nowhere shizun." Luo Binghe's answer is cautious. "This disciple returns to his palace."

"But it's too late!" Shen Yuan misses a glance at the sky outside the window, dark as coal.

"It's fine, shizun. With Xin Mo, I can shorten any distance..."

"No!" He screams helplessly. "We said you would never use Xin Mo again! That sword is dangerous, save it for unavoidable situations and never use it again for trifles, understand?"

Luo Binghe lowers his head.

"Yes, shizun."

Despite all his fears after hearing Shang Qinghua's reprimand, Luo Binghe is acting with the same docility of a dog that has made a mistake. That relieves Shen Yuan. The Luo Binghe in the book would never give up his golden finger, but this Luo Binghe can still become someone else different.

Shen Yuan sighs as he massages the bridge of his nose.

"You must be tired and this master won’t allow you to travel at night. You should stay overnight here..."

"What!?" Liu Qingge sputters, his eyes widened. "Don't even think about it, Shen Yuan!"

"Why not?" He turns to him, gazing at him with innocence. "He is a disciple of Qing Jing Peak after all..."

"He is dangerous."

Luo Binghe growls at him, showing his teeth.

"I would never hurt shizun."

"As if no one could believe you anymore!" Liu Qingge waves his arm, clenching his fist tightly. "Have you already forgotten everything you've done?"

"This disciple already apologized..."

"You can't apologize to Shen Jiu because he's missing. Because of you!" Liu Qingge takes a deep breath as he closes his eyes. "Don't dream of being alone with either of them until you show me that you've really changed."

Shen Yuan sits up slowly so as not to startle either of them and walks towards Liu Qingge with tiny steps. By placing a hand on his forearm, Shen Yuan appreciates Liu Qingge's tension. His frustration is evident in every brief outburst of rage. Shen Yuan wishes he could help him, but as the days go by, he is becoming more aware of that emptiness that separates him from others.

It is not easy to recover from almost two years of nonexistence.

"You also need to rest, Liu-shidi." He whispers to him, sliding his hands over his arm to relax his muscles. However, that strains him even more. Liu Qingge turns his head so sharply that he must have hurt his neck. "Are you okay?"

"Yeah..." He manages to sputter, ears red, before releasing his arm from him.

Ahead of them, Luo Binghe has narrowed his eyes and is suspiciously watching them. Although he now understands their reasons better, Shen Yuan is tired of the war between them. Every gesture, every word, even the most innocent context, sparks between the two.

"Well, this master trusts his disciple. Luo Binghe won't let me down, right?" He says, looking Luo Binghe into the eyes, who immediately nods.

His words hide emotional blackmail, but Shen Yuan won't regret it if his dirty tricks work. However, despite Luo Binghe's promise, Liu Qingge hisses in anger.

"No."

"What do I do then? Let him sleep in a hut!?"

Shen Yuan considers that to be outrageous, however, Liu Qingge shakes his head.

"Too close. He is coming with me to Bai Zhan Peak."

“Oh.”

Shen Yuan puts a hand to his chin as he evaluates the proposal. Luo Binghe, on the other hand, opens his eyes in horror.

"Not a bad idea, Liu-shidi."

"Shizun!" The demon whimpers.

"But you must promise me that you will treat Luo Binghe as a guest. Can I trust you, Liu-shidi?" More emotional blackmail. But since it's working, he decides to take advantage of that opportunity to improve their relationship a bit. "Listen to me you two: this Master is tired of your fights. Arguing won’t help us to rescue Jiu-ge but our union. I hope you can rest tonight, but if this Master hears that you have fought again or that someone has offended his host or the host hasn't taken care of his guest..." He pauses dramatically before giving them an icy look despite his smile. "You will disappoint me a lot, is it clear?"

Although they both bow their heads, the tension between them hasn’t disappeared. But Shen Yuan is content that neither kills the other overnight. And he can investigate without a headache after listening to them argue for hours about who makes his food.

It's no surprise that once he closes the door to his house, he hears them growling outside, but that's no longer his problem. Nope. If they keep arguing, Shen Yuan will punish them, but that will be tomorrow.

Now that he is no longer distracted, Shen Yuan can continue investigating. After retrieving his books, he lights a new candle determined to read through the entire night until he finds a way to retrieve his brother.

 

 

The only reason Liu Qingge allows that ungrateful beast Luo Binghe into his house is because of Shen Yuan. Even though he hates breathing the same air as him, at least he will be calmer if he can keep an eye on him instead of the prospect of the beast sleeping under the same roof as Shen Yuan, who still does not understand the intentions of his disciple.

Despite his sour mood, Luo Binghe lets out a mocking snort once they reach Bai Zhan Peak.

"I don't want to offend Liu-shishu, but I don't think anyone can live here."

Liu Qingge shoots a glare at the demon.

"We don't all need a fancy palace."

"Do you know that furniture exists, Liu-shishu? And that dust is removed, not treasured?"

Liu Qingge hopes that Shen Yuan will forgive him if he mistakenly buries Luo Binghe inside a deep well.

"Be a good guest and shut up." He growls as he walks through the house.

"I don't know if Liu-shishu could be a good host, do you have any food? The kitchen seems... empty."

"You can practice inedia, spoiled demon."

"I was a better host," Luo Binghe mutters under his breath before raising his voice again. “At least you have two beds, right?”

“...”

“Liu-shishu?”

“...”

“Liu-shishu!?”

 

 

To prevent Luo Bing-ge from being suspicious of his plans, Shen Jiu cannot always run away from him or hide behind excuses. And, very reluctantly, there are times when he agrees to his presence. Shen Jiu feels that he is walking through an abyss where he must estimate every gesture, tone of voice, and words. To the harem, he must be a threat. To Luo Bing-ge, someone boring who poses no threat. It's an uncomfortable contradiction that keeps him tense every day. Shen Jiu must calm his hatred, his poisonous rage, the fear that he doesn’t want to acknowledge.

Shen Jiu is discovering that his emotions are very intense and his control over them is dire.

Although it shouldn’t be a surprise to him since his failure to handle Shen Yuan's disappearance or to push Luo Binghe into the Endless Abyss in a panic blinded by betrayal. Still, it's frustrating.

That morning, Shen Jiu walks by the side of his enemy making an effort so that his gaze doesn’t linger on Xin Mo. He won’t make the mistake of underestimating Luo Bing-ge again. And an inadvertent gesture is enough to sink all his efforts. After all, they are both aware that he is not there of his own free will and will take any opportunity to flee.

Shen Jiu couldn't look at Xin Mo while he thought about stealing the dark sword. It is the most tempting, complicated, and stupid plan. Without erasing the wall that separates the two dimensions, Xin Mo will be useless in his hands. Furthermore, Shen Jiu understands the danger of the sword and he will prefer not to touch it.

That’s why he has a second plan.

Due to his statements, whenever he has no choice but to accompany Luo Bing-ge, one of his wives will go with them. Luck smiles on him that day when Liu Mingyan joins them on a walk through the forest near the palace.

The woman watches him with shadowed eyes, and Shen Jiu wonders if the marriage has already argued about Liu Qingge. For the moment, the only change is that her tension is more suspicious than hateful. Although her anger still marks her gaze, turning her into a different person than the Liu Mingyan he knows.

Too bad that the Demon Lord insists on monopolizing his attention and preventing him from talking to her.

Shen Jiu takes advantage of a moment in which they stop to dodge Luo Bing-ge with the excuse of talking to her and pretending to not have noticed that the demon was trying to put his arm around his waist.

"Are you okay? You are very quiet, Liu Mingyan."

She squints her eyes.

"I'm fine."

Her response is abrupt and curt. Perhaps Liu Mingyan has accepted that he didn’t kill her brother in another world, but that will not erase her animosity towards him. Shen Jiu covers his face with his fan as he values his next move.

The second plan is complicated.

"In my world, you talk a lot. When you are quiet, is it because something worries you. Does something worry you, Liu Mingyan?"

"You know exactly what it is." She walks past him, hitting him with her elbow, to stand next to Luo Bing-ge. "Why did you bring him? He is still the hateful Shen Qingqiu."

"He is different," Luo Binghe insists.

Both speak with the fatigue of having repeated that discussion many times in the shadows of their relationship. Shen Jiu looks at them straining to maintain a neutral expression. It doesn't benefit him if either of them discovers the snake lurking behind his eyes.

"He is not! Perhaps my brother had more luck in another world, but he is still a coward, a traitor, and a murderer. He will hurt you again, my husband."

"I don’t think so." Luo Bing-ge responds with the arrogance of someone who thinks he is invincible. But when he turns his head to look at him, again with that unfulfilled hunger of a spoiled demon, Shen Jiu trembles. "He loves my counterpart."

"Sorry?" Shen Jiu nearly chokes on sputtering. "I told you to forget those horrible books..."

"It wasn't the books, shizun. It was what you said, your concern..." Luo Bing-ge walks towards him and Shen Jiu forgets his self-control and backs away until his back hits a tree. The demon is in front of him and it is one of those times when he is immense, a shadow that completely covers him. "You tried to protect him even if you're weaker. You care about him."

"Care is not the same as love." He frowns.

"Oh, shizun. I knew your hatred better than anyone." A claw-like hand caresses his cheek, making him shiver. "You never cared like this for anyone, not even Ying'er, not even the poor sect leader Yue. I know this because I know you better than anyone."

Shen Jiu has held his breath and only takes a deep breath when Luo Binghe pulls away. His cheek tickles in an echo of that brief but terrifying touch.

"For me, they are the same." Liu Mingyan grumbles.

And Shen Jiu decides to desperately seize on that opportunity.

"We’re not. If you have so many doubts, go ahead and ask me anything about your brother. And I'll show you that Liu Qingge and I were close."

This time he doesn't dare to say intimate so as not to risk invoking Luo Bing-ge's jealousy.

Liu Mingyan stares at him and says nothing for a few seconds until she nods.

"Fine. How did you two meet?"

"Cang Qiong Sect’s Annual Twelve Peak Martial Arts Meeting. Your brother won."

"Obviously. And you lost and screamed that one day you would kill him."

"Perhaps." He shrugs without assuming another embarrassing moment in his life where he lost control of his anger. "But then something happened. We were sent on a mission together and Liu Qingge saved my life. I couldn't bear to owe him that debt, so... I invited him to lunch." He improvises. Desperate for his lack of imagination at a stressful moment, Shen Jiu decides to draw inspiration from some scenes from the infamous Resentment of Chunshan books. "I brought him a basket of loquats without knowing that this was his favorite fruit."

To his surprise, Liu Mingyan closes her eyes.

"It was..." She murmurs wistfully.

Oh, what a lucky coincidence!

"We started to get along better as a result of that incident. Your brother is an excellent warrior, but a disaster of a person. Whenever he goes on an expedition he forgets something..."

"It’s true." Liu Mingyan sobs. "I remember the time I had to go after him because he had forgotten the family seal."

Another coincidence? Today is my lucky day.

"So, I was left with no choice but to help him pack his luggage. I think that's how we became friends. Your brother is stupid, simple, and trustworthy. I'm so glad to meet him," he adds and a sincere smile escapes from his heart. Shen Jiu immediately hides it behind the fan. "Once, during one of our trips, we rested at the Liu state. In the end, we stayed two days longer than expected because his entire family challenged me to a duel."

"Oh, the family tradition! They did the same with my husband."

More coincidences!!!!???? He frowns, uneasy that whoever wrote the Resentment of Chunshan books knows Liu Qingge too well. Well, he will worry about the identity of that infamous writer when he returns to his world.

With calculated steps, Shen Jiu approaches Liu Mingyan and puts a hand on her shoulder.

"In my world, I also have a brother. He... died. I know your pain. I know your anger. If I could, I too would do anything to get him back." He softens his voice as he allows sincere tears to flood his eyes. "You are not alone, Liu Mingyan."

And Shen Jiu waits, heart crushed against his ribs, for them to fall into his trap. The only one who knows how to cross both dimensions is Luo Bing-ge. The only one who can manipulate Xin Mo is Luo Bing-ge. Oh, Shen Jiu is not an idiot. He won’t risk angering the volatile Demon Lord by stealing his sword since he won’t know what to do with it later.

His plan is more perverse and complicated, more subtle because it is about apparently doing nothing.

His plan is to tempt Luo Bing-ge to open the way between the two dimensions again.

And Liu Qingge is the perfect bait.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS 1
Shen Yuan: I'm going to (unconsciously) push Liu Qingge into a "just one bed" situation with Luo Binghe :)
Shen Jiu: I'm going to (consciously) push Liu Qingge being kidnapped by Luo Bing-ge >:)
System sighs: You're close to unlocking the polyamorous ending...

BONUS 2
Shen Jiu, the one who has been kidnapped the most times: Liu Qingge is great kidnapping material ÙwÚ

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Everybody wants to go to the other world

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Of course, his plan is not perfect and Shen Jiu is aware of its worst weakness: Luo Bing-ge will keep his decision to open the way to the other world in secret. Probably, the only one who will know is Liu Mingyan and that is why Shen Jiu tries to coincide with her to contemplate any change in her attitude. And, at the same time, he shouldn’t arouse any suspicion because it is precisely Liu Mingyan who is most suspicious of him. While Luo Bing-ge's other wives consider him a threat to their stability in the harem, Liu Mingyan sees him as a cruel and manipulative person. Perhaps his last words about Liu Qingge have softened that impression, but Shen Jiu is not naive enough to believe that she will suddenly consider him a good person.

Furthermore, staying entertained with pointless activities helps him flee from Luo Bing-ge as he continues to build his caged animal facade. Although that has its downsides, like enduring the presence of despicable creatures like Sha Hualing.

That morning the demoness sits in front of him under the gazebo in the garden. Her smile is fake, bright, and sharp, and Shen Jiu watches her suspiciously. Perhaps Sha Hualing prevented him from being physically harmed the first day, but she was the one who mocked him most cruelly. Seeing her, Shen Jiu trembles as he remembers the suffocating confinement in the cell with the thing .

Before returning to his world, he will destroy the thing . That’s a promise.

"Good morning, Master Shen... Or should I call you concubine Shen already? I understand that my husband will soon announce your new title."

With her, Shen Jiu doesn't bother to pretend innocence, instead, he gives her a disgusted look.

"What do you want?" Shen Jiu rests his chin on the back of his hand. "I know you, vermin. You don't need to pretend with me."

“Pretend? Oh, don't get me wrong, Master Shen. I find it extremely amusing that my husband has decided to make you his new bed toy. However..." She leans toward him, her smile showing her fangs. "You are acting very calm, Master Shen. That is unlike you. And I know you very well. You are arrogant and proud, you would never allow a demon to make you his vulgar concubine. That makes me think of two possibilities: you aspire to something more, perhaps to be his empress, something that I will prevent. Or that you are intentionally keeping a low profile to escape your destiny the moment we lower our guard. Something that I will also prevent because, honestly, this fate is funnier than the one that the previous Shen Qingqiu suffered." Sha Hualing closes her eyes flirtatiously as her voice becomes softer and more melodious. "So? Which of the two games are you playing? And don't waste your time trying to fool me. You've even allowed yourself to be poisoned even though you possess the power to protect yourself from stupid tricks."

Well, that's part of his plan. And not all the attacks have been caused by himself, but Shen Jiu has intentionally lowered his guard to instigate the other members of the harem to attack him. Punishing his mistresses, wives, and concubines have also kept Luo Bing-ge distracted. Although if what she says is true, I'm running out of time.

Shen Jiu opens his fan.

"I think you're wrong, but that doesn’t surprise me. Although for the first time in your life, you have hit one prediction: yes, I’ve a plan." He snorts before smirking. "I think I already warned you, demoness, but I have the knowledge of both worlds. And some people don’t change. Do you think I want to stay in a palace where they will try to attempt my life? Obviously not."

"So, you are interested in the first game: winning your place next to Luo Binghe."

"Why do you look surprised? But don’t make a mistake, I don't plan on destroying the entire harem. Ning Yingying was my disciple and I appreciate her. I also don't mind Luo Binghe getting distracted by various women because honestly, I'm not attracted to the idea of satiating his appetite alone. However... this harem needs a purge."

Sha Hualing has crossed her arms and although she is still smiling, her posture is threatening. Perhaps Luo Bing-ge gave her the order to protect him from the other’s intrigues, but the demoness is the most dangerous and ruthless of them. And right now she's evaluating whether he's a menace to get rid of.

Accepting her enmity is as foolish as agreeing to become Luo Bing-ge's concubine, and Shen Jiu will not take that risk.

"Am I pretending weakness? Indeed." He keeps talking. "Because the most annoying person must disappear. So far, I know that she is instigating women with a lower status so that she doesn’t stain her hands. And that is what I want: to provoke her into making a mistake. After all, she already did something similar in my world and I am using that information to my advantage."

"And you're telling me because...?"

"I don't like you and you don't like me either, but we can ally against a common enemy. I'm pretty sure you don't enjoy such a huge harem either. Small numbers are easier to handle."

"Interesting. I hear you." However, her expression hides her thoughts behind an empty smile.

"In my world, when my Luo Binghe showed interest in courting me, the Little Palace Mistress tried to end my life. That mistake ended with her banishment." Shen Jiu smiles behind the fan. "Do you want to help me, demoness? Maybe if you pretend to help her, she will rush in and I can get rid of that nuisance."

And he finally succeeds: Sha Hualing's eyes sparkle with mischief.

"How, Master Shen?"

"In my world, she used a certain poison. Ancient Stone Bat’s." He explains in a whisper. "It is lethal, but fortunately the antidote is in this garden."

As he speaks, Shen Jiu caresses a tiny but beautiful purple flower growing near the gazebo.

 

 

Luo Bing-ge has doubts about the War God.

Meeting him in the other world was as unexpected as discovering a softer and funnier version of his shizun. However, that man is as madly in love with Shen Qingqiu as his other self is. And that is a competition that he doesn’t need. Furthermore, he never faced Liu Qingge and is unaware of the extent of his true power.

According to Liu Mingyan, his brother was one of the most powerful cultivators. Perhaps she is exaggerating. Maybe not. Luo Bing-ge decided to set a trap for Yue Qingyuan precisely because he didn’t underestimate his talent.

However... It's been a long time since he had a worthy match. And he lost the opportunity in the other world to face Liu Qingge.

Luo Bing-ge invokes the dagger with which he sealed the two realities while he wonders what to do. Liu Mingyan won't rest now that she knows his brother lives in another world, but he doesn't need more suitors to distract his shizun.

I can face him . Luo Bing-ge thinks while the adrenaline rush before a battle burns in his veins. If he is too powerful, I must prevent him from entering this world. But if I beat him, I can give him to Yan'er. Also, I will have the guarantee that I can control him if he tries to get close to shizun.

The Demon Lord smirks.

 

The eternal quarrels between Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe distract Shen Yuan, who no longer knows how to punish them. At least they don't try to kill each other anymore, but they keep arguing over any trifle and it's horrible. As if they were little children, Shen Yuan has had to separate them with different tasks while he continues to investigate. And so, Luo Binghe is sitting in a corner examining Xin Mo as Liu Qingge prepares to return to Mu Qingfang the books he lent and Shen Yuan has already read.

The silence is broken when Luo Binghe hisses through his teeth. Immediately, the two of them turn to him.

"Now what?" Liu Qingge growls, frowning.

"I feel something ..." Despite his expression of concentration, Luo Binghe's eyes spark with a hope that makes Shen Yuan's heart stop. "The other world. I can feel it."

 

 

The dagger gleams in his hand as do his eyes, intense scarlet like freshly shed blood. Let's see, shishu, if you deserve the title of War God...

"My Lord," murmurs a trembling voice behind him.

Luo Bing-ge growls as he stops the process. He turns angrily and the servant flinches even more.

"What do you want?" He hisses.

If it’s something stupid, he'll kill him. And the servant understands by reading that murderous desire in his eyes, for his voice becomes even shakier.

"It's Master Shen! Someone has poisoned Master Shen!"

Luo Bing-ge squints as his dark qi grows around him.

Today someone will die.

 

 

Luo Binghe's illusion fades and Shen Yuan knows without words that he has lost that link to the other world. Despite the painful disappointment, he places a hand on his shoulder.

"It's fine, Luo Binghe." He sighs. "We will be luckier next time. When you feel the protection weakening again, we will try to get through it. We need to be vigilant, as it could happen at any moment."

Liu Qingge puts his hand to Cheng Luan's hilt, Luo Binghe clenches his fists. And both agree with the same determination.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
When they all meet again and ask Shen Jiu how he managed to get Luo Bing-ge to deactivate the barrier...
Shen Jiu: Oh, it was simple. Only I had to convince him that Liu Qingge is great kidnapping material.
Liu Qingge: YOU DID WHAT!!!!!!!??????????
Shen Jiu: Who wouldn't want to kidnap Liu Qingge? He is great, attractive, a great cook, and very loyal.
Liu Qingge: Ò ///// Ó
Luo Binghe: Ó _____ Ò
Shang Qinghua: Who tells him? (about his crush)
Shen Yuan: Honestly... you have a point, Jiu-ge.
Liu Qingge: Ò ///// Ó !!!!
Luo Binghe: Ó _____ Ò !!!!
Shen Yuan: But your plan had a big flaw.
Shen Yuan: All the Luo Binghes of all the worlds are straight!
Shang Qinghua: ... who tells him?

I'm really enjoying the subplot in the PIDW world with the intrigues and tensions of the harem, so I have started to write a new fic that I think Found Brother readers may like 👀

CURIOSITY #1
Does anyone remember the Ancient Stone Bat? 👀

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Who poisoned Shen Jiu?

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

For the first time since Shen Yuan woke up underground, he feels determination fluctuating in his veins. It is a warm feeling that restores hope and erases the psychological wear caused by tension, by the fear of having lost his brother perhaps forever and not knowing how to get him back. Now, they have a possible solution which implies that they must be together while they wait for the next time Luo Binghe detects an anomaly in the wall that separates both worlds. Perhaps it is a natural fluctuation, perhaps it is a weak point, or even Shen Jiu's efforts to escape.

They, on the other hand, have another opinion.

"I'll be with... him ." Liu Qingge hisses as he gazes at Luo Binghe with the same contempt the demon gives him. "But you must stay here."

Shen Yuan blinks. It is hard for him to believe that he has heard correctly.

"No way! And abandon my brother? Never!"

"Liu-shishu is right." It is as strange as creepy that they have agreed on something. "It is dangerous, shizun must stay in Qing Jing Peak."

"I'm not defenseless!"

"The other... me could manipulate the other shizun because of our blood..."

"This body doesn't even have your blood, Luo Binghe!"

Honestly, facing the original protagonist terrifies Shen Yuan. He is a shadow that Shen Yuan has feared since he appeared in this world. But circumstances have changed. Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe are his allies and he WANTS to travel to the other world to help Shen Jiu. Of all of them, he is the one who knows the PIDW intrigues best. They need him to survive!

Shen Yuan clears his throat, determined to not give up on the firm resolve of the other two.

"This Master is no ballast. From your description, the Luo Binghe from the other world is acting like... Taxian-jun." He responds with the character’s name from another novel that he never read but had been recommended to him. "Do you know him? He is a famous Emperor Lord. Thanks to the historical documents I’ve studied, this Master is able to predict what kind of world we will encounter. You need me."

Shen Yuan's stubbornness, which made him survive while reading PIDW to the end, is more powerful than the protagonist's halo. And in the end, he wins and the other two reluctantly agree to let him accompany them on the condition that whatever happens, he won’t separate from them.

That means he now has two stressed guests at his house. Not a big deal. Luo Binghe freaks out cleaning the house and Liu Qinggge mistreats the food (inexplicably, despite cutting the meat with the sword and cooking with blows, the result is quite delicious). Shen Yuan is entertained by observing them as he collects all his knowledge from the original book. Every detail, every irrelevant subplot, will be crucial to the rescue mission.

A shichen later, the house is more orderly than ever and the two of them have prepared an ideal feast for twenty people. Shen Yuan isn't complaining. He deals with stress by eating while he talks nonsense so that others don't find out that he is actually thinking about torture and amputations and...

"That's so good!" Meanwhile, he may enjoy eating in the hope that the food will fill that void within his body. "You are both an ideal material for a husband. This master will regret a lot when you marry a woman and leave me alone... Jiu-ge doesn't know how to cook."

His words, innocent and sincere, have the power of an earthquake. Liu Qingge chokes, Luo Binghe's expression becomes indecipherable, a kaleidoscope of happiness and sadness culminating in him muttering: "I remember..."

Since they're almost at a sleepover, this may be the ideal time to ask them about their romantic interests. Luo Binghe is already an adult and the romantic plot will begin soon, right? This is a harem novel, why are the two leads fighting over the villain? Shen Yuan clicks his tongue angrily. His brother wouldn't be in such trouble if demons had other priorities.

Thinking of Shen Jiu, of all that he will be suffering in the other world, his stomach twists. Anxiety devours hunger and a lump in his throat prevents him from swallowing. He can't smile anymore and his need to gossip about their love life disappears.

"Shen Yuan?"

"Shizun?"

"I'm fine! I'm fine!" He sighs, briefly closing his eyes.

He is not well, but it is ridiculous to say it when his brother is worse. So Shen Yan takes all of his feelings and locks them deep in his heart, with the nostalgia for his past life and the terror of dying.

And he forces himself to smile again.

"So... Liu-shidi, Luo Binghe, do you plan to get married in the future?"

Liu Qingge breaks his chopsticks as he clenches his fist, and Luo Binghe's eyes sparkle even though his attitude is tense, suspicious, and uncomfortable. Oh, Shen Yuan hums, amused . That means there is someone!

"You are both undeniably attractive and talented." He starts and instantly nervousness shakes them both. Shen Yuan smirks as he covers his mouth with his sleeve. "Is there a maiden who has caught your attention?"

"No." Liu Qingge growls with a firmness capable of ruining any joke.

Shidi, don't be angry! It's a joke! I'm teasing you because the tension is killing me and I need to distract myself or I will throw up! Shen Yuan looks at Luo Binghe, too transparent, so sincere. While Liu Qingge's stubbornness makes him doubt, with Luo Binghe it is clear: he is in love with someone.

"What about you, Luo Binghe?" He is startled to hear him and Shen Yuan's smile grows. "Oh, you can't fool this master. Tell me, does Luo Binghe have anyone in mind?"

His former disciple raises his head and gazes into his eyes with a determination capable of altering the entire world. Oh god, is Ning Yingying, right? When they solve this plot, the protagonist will declare Ning Yingying and as their shizun I will have to give my opinion. Don't worry, Binghe! This master supports your relationship with Ning Yingying. You don't have to be so tense!

"That's right shizun. This disciple has... two people in mind."

That doesn’t surprise him. Well in the book he had a harem with a disproportionately huge number. Two is an ideal number! However, Liu Qingge grunts and leaves the remains of the chopsticks on the table. Now, the two of them are glaring at each other and... Oh no.

OH NO.

They are Liu Mingyan and Ning Yingying, right? When Shen Yuan saved Liu Qingge, he never imagined that it would affect the main romantic plot of the book.

"That's quite bold, demon."

"Liu-shishu can't judge me, you're as bold as me."

Oh. OH. Shen Yuan is starting to forget the reason behind the anxiety as surprises spread out before him. Of course! Someone as great as Liu Qingge is the second male lead material! PIDW has risen to a love triangle!

"This Master..." He begins, making an effort to hide his inner gremlin behind a neutral expression. "This master is aware that some people can love more than one person. Two is not a bad number, as long as they cherish both equally."

"Of course, shizun!"

"But remember, Luo Binghe, two is an affordable number, but after three the disputes begin. I hope you remember my words when you start your harem."

"SHEN YUAN! Don't encourage the demon to create a harem!"

"That's quite demonic, Liu-shidi. We must respect other cultures."

"Yes, Liu-shishu." Luo Binghe is smirking and that reminds him more of a villain than a protagonist. "You should respect demon culture. Furthermore, the purest cultivators never marry."

"YOU!"

Shen Yuan sighs, finally hiding his expression behind the fan.

"Don't be like that, Luo Binghe." He scolds his former disciple. "There is nothing dishonorable about cultivators having a dao partner. Honestly, with all the ridiculous situations that end in papapa… I mean, sex, it's strange that there isn't a habit of having a partner."

"But Liu-shishu is so powerful that he doesn't need any cultivation partner." Luo Binghe adds maliciously.

Liu Qingge seems about to draw Cheng Luan and challenge him to a duel right here. And for the sake of the integrity of his household, Shen Yuan must avoid it.

But at the same time, this is so funny. And Shen Yuan doesn't remember the last time he felt so calm, not thinking about any of the worries that lie in wait for him. That also makes him feel guilty. He shouldn't be laughing while Shen Jiu suffers.

 

 

If it weren't for his long experience lying to the entire world about Shen Yuan's identity, perhaps Shen Jiu would be laughing right now. His plan has been perfect. He now must endure a stickier Luo Bing-ge than usual, but while he is the poor maiden that Luo Bing-ge must comfort the harem trembles. As cunning as a viper, Sha Hualing has brought before the Demon Emperor a terrible accusation against the Little Palace Mistress.

This is the first time since he was kidnapped that Luo Bing-ge has summoned the entire harem. The courtroom is huge, and yet there are so many women gathered together that the atmosphere is oppressive. The dome of the harem is next to Luo Bing-ge. Liu Mingyan, Ning Yingying, Qiu Haitang, Qin Wanyue and Qin Wanrong surround their husband, while he must suffer the humiliation of sitting on his lap. Shen Jiu hates acting like a doll, but he is theoretically poisoned so he swallows his disgust. The Qiu taught him to lie, to pretend to be complacent, and harmless. Once again, those tools help him survive.

Kneeling in front of Luo Bing-ge are Sha Hualing and the Little Palace Mistress. And behind the latter, a handful of women who have dared to confess some of the attacks Shen Jiu has suffered. Not all, of course. The main schemer is quietly sitting on Luo Bing-ge while the demon embraces him possessively. This is even better than I expected , he thinks. Sha Hualing is a fearsome rival. She must have promised them something very juicy for them to dare to acknowledge her attacks. Even though all these women are shaking, none have done anything serious, only small sabotages such as tearing his clothes or sending anonymous threats.

Only one has made the mistake of trying to poison him.

They have all made the mistake of believing that one of them poisoned him previously.

And Luo Bing-ge's patience has burnt.

"This Lord believes that he was quite clear when he warned that any attempt against shizun would be punished."

"She is lying!!" The Little Palace Mistress hisses with bloodshot eyes, probably in humiliation. "I would never dare to attack your favorite!"

"Oh, but you threatened them to do it." Sha Hualing purrs. "Don't be afraid. Neither of you had a choice, right?"

One by one, the women the demoness has brought confess their antics and all accuse the Little Palace Mistress of manipulating them. Shen Jiu doesn't care if what they say is true or false since there is probably a hint of everything. And the Little Palace Mistress trembles furiously.

Luo Bing-ge's grip on his waist grows stronger with the accusations. His anger is terrifying. Shen Jiu can feel it in his restless breath, in the fire that burns in his eyes. For the first time since he began playing scheming, Shen Jiu trembles as he ponders the possibility of being discovered by the demon.

"Since Master Shen's arrival, Xiao Gongzhu has been pressuring the lesser concubines to attack him." Sha Hualing resumes. Her smile is beautiful and red like the blood that she would like to spill. "But the other day you crossed the line by poisoning Master Shen with the Ancient Stone Bat's poison. But you didn't stop there! You also burned part of the garden, preventing Jushang from getting an antidote in time."

Nor is it their fault that they believe Shen Jiu is dying. When Luo Bing-ge broke into his room to threaten the healers, he spoke to him. Shen Jiu knows how to be persuasive. After contemplating him with his wives, he has discovered what he likes: submission, the fragility of a toy. Oh, Luo Bing-ge accepted that charade as it meant playing with Shen Jiu as if he is a doll that must be carried in his arms.

But Shen Jiu is not dying.

Ancient Stone Bat is an annoying but harmless poison. He already suffered it once and was only affected for two days.

Shen Jiu stretches subtly. As the two rivals in the harem argue to show who is crueler but smart enough to not attack him, Shen Jiu whispers into Luo Bing-ge's ear, intentionally brushing his lobe with his lips.

"Should I say something?"

Luo Bing-ge caresses his cheek. His thumb slides to a stop on his lower lip and Shen Jiu for a few seconds fears that he will try to kiss him.

"Go ahead, shizun."

Shen Jiu breathes a sigh of relief when he gets permission to sit up and leave Luo Bing-ge's presence. The atmosphere is less oppressive, although everyone is looking at him and some have frowned.

"I think you are making a mistake, misses. This master is well."

Sha Hualing laughs with satisfaction.

"As I expected from Jushang, only he would be able to find the remedy despite your ploy..."

"Oh miss, don't take us for idiots." Shen Jiu takes out a fan and opens it dismissively, though not hiding his disdainful smile. "There was never an antidote. The Ancient Stone Bat's poison is irrelevant."

The demoness' smile freezes, but she is cunning and doesn’t betray herself. She keeps smiling when she gazes at the confused Little Palace Mistress.

"See? They caught you burning the flowers like a fool."

"You both got caught, miss." Shen Jiu takes a couple of steps forward. "You were the only one who knew about the false antidote, Sha Hualing. But in your arrogance, you decided to set a trap for Xiao Gongzhu by taking advantage of my incomplete information."

It wouldn't surprise him that all the women who have ratted out the Little Palace Mistress were originally blackmailed by Sha Hualing and that the demoness has always been trying to attack him from the shadows. After all, he planted that trap to confirm her intentions. If Sha Hualing had merely instigated the poisoning, that would mean that she too wished to get rid of Little Palace Mistress. But by attempting to boycott the antidote she reveals that she hoped to eliminate him and blame Little Palace Mistress for his murder.

Nice move, he thinks. You are a predator among flowers.

But in the end, he wins.

Shen Jiu stands in the center, gazing condescendingly at his two defeated rivals. Sha Hualing has been so ambitious that she has also given him the tools to eliminate the Little Palace Mistress. In a commendable performance, Shen Jiu doesn't react when Luo Bing-ge stands up to stand beside him and hugs his waist possessively. Not when he announces that Shen Jiu will enter the harem... as his first husband.

He has won this fight, but not the war. Shen Jiu is aware that he is running out of time or tricks to prolong the inevitable.

Chapter End Notes

This chapter has a subtle foreshadowing: Shen Yuan is right, the romantic plot will start soon 👀 I always knew that the romance would be for the fourth and last part of the fic, when Shen Jiu overcome part of his traumas and Shen Yuan was more aware of the world they live. Meanwhile, I must take advantage of these last chapters to make jokes with Shen Yuan. The misunderstandings will be over soon ¡w¡
