★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Yuan discovers the romantic plot

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

That hug was the most intense and longest affectionate gesture that Shen Jiu had dedicated to him (and to no one, in fact).

Unfortunately, it doesn't take long for Shen Jiu to return to normal. And when they drag him to Qian Cao Peak, he is back to being that sullen and whining cat who disdains his own health. Shen Yuan considers it a miracle that he hasn't scratched anyone, even though intent shines in his merciless eyes.

"Enough!" Shen Jiu hisses after Mu Qingfang gives him a quick check. "This master wishes to return to his house. Alone."

Well, even Shen Yuan is aware that with so many people gathered in the room it can get suffocating so it’s a great plan. Also, he is included in that alone . Privileges of being his brother. Shen Jiu stands up, intending to head for the exit, but he stops to look at Luo Binghe. Even though he is one of the most powerful assembled there, a Demon Lord with two palaces and an army, he pales under Shen Jiu's piercing gaze.

"Remove your blood from me." He orders him in a cold, sharp voice.

Luo Binghe lowers his head. Shen Yuan is unable to tell if his expression is one of regret or disappointment.

"Yes, Shizun." He murmurs in a small voice.

Shen Jiu seems happy once the two of them return to the bamboo house, which will no longer be cold or empty.

"I'm going to take away those clothes." Shen Jiu growls. "And this mess?"

Shen Yuan clears his throat. Perhaps someone did not have time to clean up the chaos of manuscripts and books piled on the table and even the floor. He has a good excuse: there was no time for minutiae when they rushed to the other world. Even so, the appearance of the usual pristine house is embarrassing and Shen Yuan rushes to pick up the junk.

He longs for those days with Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe helping him keep order. The two of them are wonderful househusbands. Shen Yuan thinks about inviting them to dinner. Not because they are terrible at cooking and need their help to survive. Of course not. It's to celebrate Shen Jiu’s rescue.

And for the food.

Once dressed in his Peak Lord clothes, Shen Jiu doesn’t leave his side. Shen Yuan already knows that he is not a person who tends to show physical affection. Shen Jiu simply stands by him, asking questions and making observations about the house, the state of the peak, and the future in general. It’s comforting despite spending nearly two hours picking up. Shen Yuan is starting to consider the possibility of punishing Luo Binghe for all his pranks by making him his assistant.

Shen Yuan doesn’t take long to convince Shen Jiu to have the other two come over for dinner. He would also like to celebrate it with his disciples and the other Peak Lords, but he knows that would overwhelm his brother. So he decides to start with something small.

Despite having rescued Shen Jiu, the animosity between Luo Binghe and Liu Qingge hasn’t disappeared. It is different, yes, a still aggressive tension but softer in a certain way. They no longer seem to want to kill each other and for Shen Yuan that is a breakthrough. Besides, as long as they keep bickering over trifles like who's in charge of the food, he still has Shen Jiu to himself. But later, when the four of them are already seated at the table in front of an oversized banquet, the two fight for Shen Jiu's attention.

Shen Yuan is not stupid. He appreciates that Shen Jiu is smiling behind the fan and that he is enjoying their attention. Stupid tsundere , he sighs, eating non-stop. The food is excellent as always and someone must savor it while the others play.

"This master is curious." Shen Jiu nonchalantly comments, but Shen Yuan recognizes that questioning look. It is the same he uses when he examines his disciples. "When I was in the other world, Luo Binghe, where did you stay? At Qing Jing Peak?"

"No, Shizun." He responds with his perfect white sheep attitude. "This disciple would not dare. I’m at Bai Zhan Peak."

Tsk, what a liar. Shen Yuan thinks, amused. It was Liu-shidi who dragged you away.

"Bai Zhan Peak." Shen Jiu repeats, frowning slightly.

Luo Binghe's eyes light up upon hearing his reaction. Though he doesn't break his facade, the demon flashes a tiny mischievous smirk.

"Yes, shizun. Liu-shishu was kind enough to let me stay at his home."

Liu Qingge, who had been eating in silence until now, tenses up and turns to scrutinize the demon warily.

"You're staying... with Liu Qingge?" That discovery stuns Shen Jiu, who has unconsciously lowered the fan enough, and now they can see his puzzled expression. “In the same house?”

Luo Binghe blinks with feigned innocence.

"Yes, Shizun." 

Shen Jiu turns to Liu Qingge, waiting for him to confirm that fact. But the War God has frowned and remains as alert as a wild animal. Meanwhile, Shen Yuan pops some marinated beef into his mouth. He would be lying if he denied how much he is enjoying that show.

"It's not a big deal." Liu Qingge finally growls. "I wasn't going to leave this beast without surveillance on Qing Jing Peak."

That seems to calm Shen Jiu down.

"Good decision, shidi. Although this master is still curious about Luo Binghe's definition of kind ."

Shen Jiu surely thinks that it was sarcasm and that the demon would take that opportunity to attack Liu Qingge. However, his smile doesn’t disappear.

"Liu-shishu is a great host. This disciple is very grateful for his hospitality. Although…" Luo Binghe pauses and Liu Qingge narrows his eyes even more. "This disciple would appreciate Liu-shishu buying another bed."

Shen Yuan chokes on his food. Binghe! Don't say that with such a serious face! He's still coughing when Shen Jiu turns to pass him his cup.

"So...another bed..."

"Yes, shizun. Liu-shishu only has a small, narrow bed."

Shen Yuan feels that he is going to choke with the food. What is Luo Binghe playing at with such ambiguous words? And more importantly, why isn't Shen Jiu aware that he is provoking him? Although his tension is different from Liu Qingge's. Shen Yuan notices that his brother is breathing rapidly, and a slight blush covers his cheeks.

"Beast." Liu Qingge warns him with a growl.

"What? It's true. Even though young shizun said that Liu-shishu should be good, this disciple wakes up with a sore back every morning."

Now Luo Binghe dares to tear up. Shen Yuan no longer plans to continue eating. This show is better than the series he used to enjoy in his past life.

"Don't listen to him." Liu Qingge growls, turning around in disdain. "He is sleeping on the floor, nothing else."

"Nothing else?" Luo Binghe repeats still in his honeyed voice. “After what had happened between us, this disciple believed that we were already closer… Qingge.”

Although Shen Yuan is holding back his laughter at their reactions, it is not lost on him that Shen Jiu almost drops his fan. Luckily, the other two are too busy bothering each other. Or not to start a fight at that precise moment.

"Do you have a death wish, demon?" Liu Qingge growls, punching the table so hard it cracks. "Stop that. We are not close and never will be. You don't even think of calling me by my name again, nor does shishu. You don't belong to this sect anymore."

"Hmm...Ge'er?"

Liu Qingge stands up and this time he draws his sword.

"Stop!" Shen Jiu intervenes, afraid that they are going to fight. He has closed the fan with a snap and uses it to aim at the demon. "Luo Binghe, stop talking nonsense and offending Liu Qingge."

"Why? He can kiss me but I can't tease him?"

And the bomb falls. The two cultivators pale, and Shen Yuan is sure he saw Luo Binghe smack his lips. Although he continues to bat his eyelashes with the sweet innocence of a maiden, the demon smirks malevolently. Shen Yuan fans himself. His brother is not stupid and with a glance, he finds out that Luo Binghe is telling the truth. And on this occasion, his words cannot be misunderstood.

Shen Jiu stands up, pale and livid, and points to the door.

"Both of you. Get out."

Luo Binghe sighs. And Shen Yuan watches curiously how he doesn't look at Shen Jiu, but leans towards the War God still with that mischievous smirk on his hands.

"Are we going home, Qingge?"

Why...? Shen Yuan's throat is dry. His gaze shifts from the furious Liu Qingge striding away probably to avoid a fight, to Luo Binghe ignoring Shen Jiu, and to his brother's fury. Rage is common in Shen Jiu, almost a second heart. It pulses through his veins, stronger than his spiritual energy. But until then, his anger had always been cold and aggressive, not silent and marked by trembling of limbs. Shen Jiu is blushing as he walks away from the table muttering under his breath.

“Stupid fickle libertine demon…”

"Humm..." Shen Yuan brings the tip of his fan to his lips. He has the absurd feeling that Luo Binghe was trying to make Shen Jiu jealous. That strategy appeared repeatedly in PIDW and usually ended in a threesome between the Demon Lord and two of his wives. The more he thinks about it, the more confident Shen Yuan is in understanding Luo Binghe's strategy.

And with a shiver, he remembers that the other Luo Bing-ge did not torture his brother, but took him to... the palace of future...

Fuck.

 

 

The next morning, Shen Yuan shows up at An Ding Peak like a gale, opening the door of Shang Qinghua's house with his qi without bothering to knock. Luckily he is working at his desk instead of sleeping.

“Cucumber bro?” The other transmigrator sputters, surprised and uneasy.

"Can you tell me what's going on between my brother, Liu-shidi and Luo Binghe?"

That traitorous weasel Shang Qinghua bursts into thunderous laughter.

"Ah! You've finally figured out the romantic plot! It took you a long time, Cucumber bro..."

Shen Yuan drops his fan on the ground.

"Romantic...plot?"

"Yeah. I mean, even though you've changed the story, you can't avoid some things like Luo Binghe falling in love. Well... What is happening now is because you have changed the story. Congratulations, Cucumber bro, you're stuck in a love triangle. And so is your brother."

After a long pause of several minutes in which Shen Yuan is unable to say anything and stares blankly at nothing, he finally manages to speak.

"So... Luo Binghe isn't straight?"

"He never was, bro."

Chapter End Notes

I have the headcanon that Luo Binghe is bisexual and Liu Qingge is gay. Aish, I hope that in the next chapter I can write the meeting between orShen Qingqiu and our Shen Jiu. But first they needed a scene between the four of them finally reunited.

BONUS
Luo Binghe: What will Shizun do? Does this disciple have nowhere to sleep except Liu-shishu's comfortable bed? UwU
Shen Jiu: To the woodshed. Now Ò//A//Ó

Luo Binghe flirting with Liu Qingge is a joke... unless...

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu meets Shen Qingqiu

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

No one noticed Shen Yuan's existential crisis.

 

 

A week after his rescue, Shen Jiu finally returns to Qian Cao Peak.

Before fleeing from the other world, Shen Jiu wanted to alleviate the misery of the thing . To his surprise, they had already rescued him in a sudden burst of optimism. He didn't know how to feel about it, so Shen Jiu took all those feelings and locked them deep inside his chest.

Once at Qian Cao Peak, Shen Jiu takes a deep breath.

During that time, Mu Qingfang has prohibited visits. The state of the thing was terrible, physically and mentally. At the daily meetings of the Peak Lords where they discussed the threat from the other world, he kept them informed about the progress. It took Mu Qingfang days for the thing to wake up from his catatonic state. In addition to the severe mutilations, the thing is malnourished, his wounds are infected, and his body is mangled inside and out from torture. His mental state is just as deplorable, as the thing hardly reacts and spends days trapped in a deep sleep, almost unconscious.

But today the thing is awake and Shen Jiu can no longer postpone the inevitable.

Ning Yingying is also at Qian Cao Peak. When Luo Binghe and Liu Qingge informed him of the rescue of the thing , Shen Jiu looked at his former disciple. And he also offered her the chance to escape from this hostile and twisted world, in which she wasn’t happy and would be in danger once Luo Bing-ge discovered the truth. Even though his invitation was extended to join Qing Jing Peak, Ning Yingying had refused the proposal. Instead, she decided to stay on Qian Cao Peak, accompanying the thing . Shen Jiu allowed it, as Mu Qingfang could also help her just like he healed him.

Ning Yingying smiles at him as Shen Jiu walks in.

"Good morning Shizun!"

Even though the two of them were never really Master and Disciple, she insists on calling him that. And he allows her with a slight smile. Fear still dulls her eyes, but it seems to him that she is more lively. Although Shen Jiu would rather stay with her and talk about how she is doing, he sighs before heading to the room where the thing is. His footsteps lose determination without stopping. The room that Mu Qingfang has prepared is far away from other patients and onlookers. Despite the cleanliness and the medicinal plants that sweeten the environment, Shen Jiu still notices that stink of rot when he enters. It's a phantom smell that seems to come from inside his lungs. The cold of the cell is also trapped under his skin and makes him shiver.

Sitting on a bed, covered by white inner robes that hide his stumps, rests... Shen Qingqiu .The one he could have been, his miserable other self in an alternate dimension.

Shen Jiu closes the door with stiff fingers. Turning around, he intentionally avoids the other's gaze. Shen Qingqiu only has one eye, but it is open and watching him tensely. His distrust is rough and aggressive, Shen Jiu notices it in the air. Even though he can't speak, his silence is loud. Shen Jiu can recognize in it his questions and all those scathing words that are doomed to get stuck in his throat. Almost better this way. Shen Jiu is not ready to argue with someone as stubborn and proud as he is.

"Mu Qingfang has informed me that you are getting better." He says as he sits away from the bed, where he can look at him feeling safe. "Although our shidi suspects that for the first few days you acted as if you believed this to be a dream. Or an illusion. Well, I have news for you: it is real."

The other narrows his eye, still suspicious.

"You are in another world. I know it's hard to believe, but I hope you appreciate my explanation because it's preferable to be kidnapped by an arrogant demon." Shen Jiu snorts. "Is that damned sword’s fault… We still haven't figured out why there are two worlds. The important thing is that there are certain differences that you may have already noticed. You're perceptive enough to have found a dozen differences already, am I wrong?"

And his other self finally reacts by raising an eyebrow, as if insinuating that he has found even more.

"Good. As I have discovered, in this world we are a few years behind in yours. It is not a great world, don’t be fooled by the contrast. It is miserable, unfair, and cruel." Shen Jiu stops, examining the other's expression. "You know what I'm talking about. From what I've gathered, our pasts were identical."

There is something that he hasn’t told anyone: Shen Jiu knows the reason that it has divided both worlds despite coming from the same origin.

Shen Yuan.

"Still, I have to admit that this is a decent world compared to yours. And I want it to stay that way." Shen Jiu sits up. Despite his intentions, he doesn’t approach Shen Qingqiu but walks towards the window. "The future is uncertain. That Luo Bing-ge will not give up, not after how we have challenged him. But you don’t have to worry: we will protect you. With some conditions, obviously."

Shen Jiu finally turns to him. Despite the security with which he has disguised himself, he notices a lump in his chest. With Shen Yuan it was easier, as he soon assumed that he was a different person with the same appearance. But he is Shen Qingqiu. They are the same but different.

And Shen Jiu would never trust himself.

"First, you must help us with your knowledge to prevent the catastrophic events that have destroyed your world." Shen Jiu snorts when the other looks at him wryly. "Don't be childish, you have other ways of communicating. And don't worry. We are looking for a way to put your body back together. It will probably take a couple of years and I don't have that much patience, so use our intelligence to think of alternatives. Second... "

Shen Jiu narrows his eyes. He has not forgotten anything that he heard in the other world.

"Do you remember the mission of the well?"

Shen Qingqiu looks annoyed but ends up reluctantly nodding.

"Do you remember what happened with Shang Qinghua and Liu Qingge?"

After hearing the last name, his expression darkens. Shen Jiu already knows what happened even before he frowns. Even though he also protected Liu Qingge, Luo Bing-ge's wives ensured that he became his killer. Of course, Shen Jiu doesn't trust them either.

"How did Liu Qingge die in your world?"

That question seems to stir up terrible memories. Shen Qingqiu no longer reacts.

"Perhaps it happened during a qi deviation?"

Shen Qingqiu breaks his absent state to look at him with a mixture of surprise and anxiety. Shen Jiu hums thoughtfully. Thanks to Shen Yuan, he has enough pieces to solve that puzzle.

"We are both susceptible to qi deviations. Perhaps you killed him unconsciously, or perhaps the qi deviation itself consumed our shidi. When you get your tongue back, I want you to explain to me exactly what happened." Shen Jiu walks to a stop in front of the bed, looking down at the other. "Liu Qingge is alive here. If you pose a threat to his life, I don't care if we're the same person: I'll kill you, understand?"

Shen Qingqiu meets his gaze defiantly. It's a good sign that he's getting his pride back.

"Those are my main conditions. If you agree, then nod. Otherwise, I will return you to Luo Bing-ge in exchange for leaving our world in peace."

Everyone would probably oppose that decision. But Shen Jiu knows that Shen Qingqiu has his own pessimism and that pathological insecurity that makes him consider himself worthless. Despite his furious look, the other nods. Because the two are also born survivors and will take advantage of any opportunity, however toxic and destructive it may be.

Neither of them hesitated to accept Wu Yanzi.

And Shen Jiu and the world he is offering him are infinitely better than that rogue cultivator.

"Great." Shen Jiu opens his fan, hiding a satisfied smile. "Now that we have agreed, allow me to give you some directives about your new situation. We have a brother."

Shen Qingqiu bit his lip.

"I’m not talking about Qi-ge."

Shen Qingqiu's one eye widens.

"I'm not going to share my brother. Next." Shen Jiu ignores the other's attempts to claim his attention to keep talking about Shen Yuan. "You are here because of the inexplicable optimism of Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe. Liu Qingge is the second best thing that has happened to me in this life. After my brother." Shen Qingqiu lets out a gasp, furious that he is ignoring him. "And Luo Binghe... is a particular case. He's not like yours. I'd rather say he's like us."

Shen Jiu fans himself slowly. It's easy to assume his fondness for Shen Yuan or his growing feelings for Liu Qingge, but Luo Binghe is more complicated. Especially now that he knows what he can do. And explaining it to Shen Qingqiu would be difficult given his experience. Shen Jiu still remembers that warped grudge of jealousy he felt for the stupid Liu Qingge and finds it hard to imagine how much the other has suffered at the hands of Luo Binghe.

Despite this instinct to be defensive against Shen Qingqiu, Shen Jiu sighs and lowers the fan, closing it.

"Don't worry about them. They'll be with me and my brother." The other stares at him again and he again ignores his hints. "My relationship with our sectmates is good. Liu Mingyan is a nice young lady here, Huan Hua Palace will never be a threat to us anymore, and Sha Hualing has no romantic ties to Luo Binghe that would lead her to act like a beast protecting her territory."

Shen Qingqiu raises an eyebrow, intrigued by that nuance. However, Shen Jiu refuses to explain what kind of dark interest Luo Bing-ge had in him.

It's better if he doesn't know.

Shen Jiu doesn't want to give him any more nightmares.

“Your Yingying has accompanied you, although you already know that. Until we heal you, you will not leave Qian Cao Peak. Until we solve the problem with the other world, you will not leave the Cang Qiong Sect. Afterward, you are free to do whatever you wish with your life. Is there any doubt?"

Shen Qingqiu has frowned sullenly. Poor thing , he thinks. It will take you a while to have a fan to hide your emotions. Shen Jiu has not forgotten his distrust and will only change his attitude when the other shows him that he is trustworthy. However, he decides to soften his aggressiveness.

"My brother's name is Shen Yuan."

Shen Qingqiu tilts his head in interest.

"I found him. He is…" Shen Jiu sighs. "He has taught me many things. And he has also helped me improve my relationship with the rest."

The other blinks.

"No. I'm not going to introduce him to you."

He pouts again.

"I'm not overprotective! Do you remember how we took care of Qi-Ge in the streets? Well, Shen Yuan is just as naive and you are a bastard with blood on your hands. Leaving you two alone is out of the question."

Shen Qingqiu gives him a muffled growl that perhaps means "I don't have hands" or perhaps "you too".

Chapter End Notes

Shen Jiu will regret this chapter when Shen Qingqiu gets his tongue back >:3

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shang Qinghua solves the riddle of the soulmates

Chapter Notes

In chapter 22 I gave you a little riddle about soulmates. It's time for the real author to solve it :)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Discovering the love plot has been more shocking for Shen Yuan than all his deaths. The love triangle is no surprise, after all, this started as a harem book. The problem is that the harem is wrongly focused! Luo Binghe is the harem master! And Shen Yuan will always support his disciple, even if he decides to conquer all the attractive men (which are not few) in this world. But… since when is Shen Jiu the one with so many romantic interests? And why are those same romantic interests interested in him too?

Well, Shen Yuan acknowledges that their attention is nice. But he is straight. So, he removes himself from the equation. Now he must fix this absurd mess.

“You’re the fucking writer.” He growls once at An Ding Peak. In front of him, Shang Qinghua is gobbling up melon seeds like popcorn. "How do I fix this mess?"

"It's not a mess if it's fun..." Shang Qinghua clears his throat as Shen Yuan glares at him.

"From 1 to 10, how likely is it that Liu-shidi will stop persecuting my brother and acknowledge Luo Binghe as the only harem master?"

"Although I'm pretty invested in the enemies to lovers trope and hatesex, Liu Qingge's loyalty is like steel. Could my son and the War God tangle some night? Maybe. Will they forget Jiu bro? Never."

Shen Yun whimpers as he rubs the bridge of his nose.

"Why has the plot deviated so much!?"

"You are the reason the plot has deviated."

"... shut up."

Shang Qinghua shrugs, grabbing another handful of melon seeds, while Shen Yuan ponders different possibilities with his arms crossed.

"The best way to resolve the love triangle is for Jiu-ge to choose one of them. Fortunately, the answer is simple."

"Oh, I hear you!"

"Luo Binghe, obviously! He's the protagonist for a good reason! There's no one more attractive than him or more powerful than him. He already has a castle! Oh gosh, can you imagine living in a castle with servants? And the food!" In other circumstances, Shen Yuan would have hidden behind a fan so as not to lose his cool, but the magic of Shang Qinghua is that he can act like the true millennial that he is with him. "The fantasy of having Luo Binghe cooking for you every day!? Gosh, as his brother-in-law, I will also be able to enjoy his food!! See? The answer is simple. If I had to choose.. ."

"Well, technically... You can too..."

"...I would choose Luo Binghe. And since Shen Jiu is smarter than me, he will too." Shen Yuan concludes with satisfaction.

Shen Yuan also considers himself to be smarter than average. Not an achievement to be proud of in a world where the IQ of the characters is lowered by the interest of the author. But, sometimes it is useful to solve these kinds of complications since the others don't.

He is fanning himself proudly when… he realizes something.

"Well, I have to admit that Liu-shidi is also attractive. Now I understand why you killed him in the novel (and I'm still angry): he is probably the only one capable of rivaling Luo Binghe. And Liu-shidi is so attentive! The best uber in this world. Five stars, highly recommended." Shen Yuan bites his lip. "His cooking is delicious too. I wouldn't mind having him as a brother-in-law either, honestly. He is pretty, loyal, a good fighter, and cooks… Fuck. They're tied!" Shen Yuan covers his face with his hands, stifling a scream. "Damn excuse of author! Why are all your male leads so perfect?"

"You know? I'm surprised you still haven't considered the possibility of a Shen brother for each of them..."

"Impossible. I wouldn't mind, you know? They're both very caring and it would be wonderful to have a partner to protect me from this fucking world were even flowers want to kill you. And I can't spend my whole life living with Jiu-ge, especially when he gets married to any of them. Honestly, I always thought that Bai Zhan Peak is the coolest peak and a castle would also be formidable." He sighs. "But I'm straight. It wouldn't be fair to either of them."

Despite exposing his arguments, Shang Qinghua continues to eat his melon seeds with a mocking smile. Why does he want friends if they don't support him? Shen Yuan snorts and reaches out to grab a handful of melon seeds just for the sheer joy of teasing him.

"Now that I remember..." Shen Yuan murmurs with a thoughtful look. "There was a subplot. With Madame Meiyin."

"Have you met the clairvoyant yet? And you didn't tell me, Cucumber bro!?"

"I had completely forgotten about it." He acknowledges, shrugging. "The point is, she made a prediction. A very vague prediction. About a destined one. I didn't give it any importance because I assumed she was talking about some woman... who would end up in Luo Binghe's harem. But now I think it could mean both Luo Binghe and Liu Qingge." Shen Yuan points his fan at Shang Qinghua, startling him. "You are the damn author of this world. Answer me a question about your worldbuilding. She said she was predicting my future, but she was reading Jiu-ge's body. Who was she really referring to? And who is my brother's soulmate?"

It is the best way to solve this dilemma. Shen Yuan will support any outcome. In any case, there is now another Shen Qingqiu, so both Luo Binghe and Liu Qingge can get the perfect and happy ending that they are looking for.

"Well..." Although Shang Qinghua is not known for his determination, at that moment he is more indecisive than usual. "I never valued the possibility that someone real would end up in my world. But let's face it: Madame Meiyin is like a horoscope."

"That's not what you wrote!"

"What I'm trying to say is that she was vague because her ability is limited. Perhaps she was referring to both Liu Qingge and my son. Or perhaps she was talking about two destined ones because she sensed the future of the two of you!"

"Oh!" Shen Yuan doesn’t expect such an answer. And his heart decides to defy common sense by beating faster. "Then, what is the answer?"

"Did I tell you that it's probably the System's job to get the story closer to my original idea? Well... There never was a harem. But the harem..."

"I know, I know... It fed you." He snorts, still disappointed to discover the bitter reality of the life of a content creator. "Then?"

"My intention was for my son to find out the truth about Jiu bro. Circles of abuse, remember? As a good protagonist, Luo Binghe would destroy it... But certain readers" Shang Qinghua gives him a meaningful look, "didn't like that his hated villain was a gray character. And that would mean that Luo Binghe had cruelly and unfairly tortured a person who didn't deserve it! My editors forbade me..."

At times, Shang Qinghua seems like a grandfather recounting his war stories. With a gesture, Shen Yuan motions for him to summarize.

"What I mean, is that Luo Binghe and Shen Jiu have always been destined. They are... the cruelest definition of soulmates. Similar backstory, the possibility of healing or destroying each other. Jiu bro's petty attitude made Luo Binghe return his hatred a hundredfold. And so Shen Qingqiu ended as it began: miserably, tortured, being someone else's possession." Shang Qinghua pauses. "But an act of caring makes Luo Binghe return that same love a hundredfold. And more importantly, blind loyalty, the quality that Jiu-ge appreciates the most."

"You're a bastard."

Shen Yuan fiddles with the melon seeds, not understanding why that answer has left him scrambled inside. This time it is no surprise after discovering that there are details of the book that he never understood. For years, Shen Yuan has lived under a name that is not his own, imitating a person he initially hated. He never wanted to be reincarnated in a book and even less so with his memories. In the end, it is exhausting to be trapped in a body that at first didn't belong to him, nor his way of combing his hair, nor his clothes, nor his hobbies. At least he had the consolation of a room to claim as his own. But the truth is that he has been trapped living in Shen Jiu's shadow for too long. And he misses his past life! Because of his family and friends, because of the internet, the stories he couldn't read, the games... and because it was entirely his.

It's stupid, but he's disheartened to discover that even his fate doesn't belong to him. He has none. Neither a soulmate.

"Don't make that face, Cucumber bro!" Shang Qinghua exclaims upon noticing his gloomy mood from him. "If Jiu bro and my son are destined, that means Liu Qingge is yours."

"How?" He growls without hiding his bitterness. "I'm not supposed to exist!"

"Exactly! At this point in the plot, Liu Qingge doesn’t exist either!"

Shen Yuan's eyes widen. And he stares at the author.

"What are you talking about?"

"Liu Qingge was going to die. Liu Qingge WAS destined to die. But you saved him. In the book, neither of you exists. But you changed that!! Your existence affects Liu Qingge's. That's the definition of a soulmate, Cucumber bro."

After a few long minutes with a blank mind and an open mouth, Shen Yuan finally reacted.

"Oh." He clears his throat, trying to regain his immortal aloof image. "Too bad that I'm straight."

Shang Qinghua facepalms for a reason he doesn't understand.

Chapter End Notes

Maybe it sounds contradictory: I don't like soulmates but I find them very interesting. I hate the idea that we are destined for a concrete and immovable future. That means that we are insignificant (and that we aren't responsible for our decisions either since it is fate's fault). It's sad that fate decides that your life will be wonderful or miserable... or who you will fall in love with.

This is one of my headcanons: Bingjiu and Liushen as soulmates because of the impact they have on each other's lives. I do like the idea that a soulmate is someone very important to you, although not necessarily romantic. And that together you can build different futures.

I'm still working on the polyamorous relationship for the end of the fic. Shen Yuan's arc begins by accepting that the other characters are LGBT and then that he has a small unrecognized crush 😂 Shen Yuan, hurry up or you'll be left alone!!

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Yuan’s gay panics

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

According to Shang Qinghua's definition, a soulmate can also be a friend. And that is the reason why Shen Yuan decides to visit Bai Zhan Peak that morning: he misses his friend. Besides, he's pretty bored too. Shen Jiu is throwing himself into the recovery of the other Shen Qingqiu together with Mu Qingfang. And he has nothing to do. The disciples are no longer children who need his help, he is also not allowed to leave the sect until the problem with the other world is solved. Shen Yuan has been reunited with his cat and has caught up after almost two years of absence. Not even Gongyi Xiao has anything interesting to tell him!

Well, if his brother has decided to leave him in boredom, Shen Yuan will visit his good friend Liu Qingge.

As usual, Liu Qingge is beating his disciples. What is not so common anymore is the fact that today he is teaching them. Liu Qingge's lessons are usually silent, except for screams and groans of pain. However, Shen Yuan appreciates that he is giving them directions. Maybe they are crude and composed of monosyllables, but it is progress. Shen Yuan trembles unconsciously, as he knows that the only reason Liu Qingge is exerting himself is to prepare his disciples for a possible attack.

How cute , he thinks.

Then, Shen Yuan slaps his cheek.

Shen Yuan forgets his stealth as he approaches the training ground. He walks carefully so as not to stain his clothes with the dust floating in the air. His presence does not go unnoticed. Instantly, everyone turns to him, and Liu Qingge stops what he was doing to approach him.

"Is something wrong?"

"No." Shen Yuan's smile makes Liu Qingge soften his scowl. "I just wanted to visit Liu-shidi."

A slight blush stains his cheeks. That's illegally cute! Shen Yuan has to control himself not to slap his cheek again.

“Mn.” 

Liu Qingge turns around, making a vague gesture that perhaps points to his home or perhaps to the training ground. He also seems confused about his intentions, merely making it clear to Shen Yuan that he is invited to the entirety of Bai Zhan Peak. 

Shen Yuan raises his fan to hide a mischievous smile when… Fuck! Why did I take the fan he gave me!? He hadn't even noticed. After all, it’s one of his favorite fans. What if Liu Qingge notices? Will he jump to conclusions? I don't want to give him false hope! Overwhelmed, Shen Yuan hides the fan up his sleeve when Liu Qingge doesn't look.

"Liu-shidi, Liu-shidi..." He stammers, unable to control those nerves that are like an army of ants under his skin. "I was wondering... Do you think Jiu-ge would let me visit the city if you come with me? I know it's dangerous, but Liu-shidi is strong and..."

Fuck. Just the two of them... That sounds like a date! What if he thinks I'm asking him out? Retreat! Retreat!

"No, that’s a terrible idea." Shen Yuan anticipates Liu Qingge's possible response by shaking his head and crossing his arms. "How could this have crossed my mind? It's so foolish..." As he sputters, Liu Qingge looks at him in confusion. "Well, Liu-shidi, since I'm here, how about having tea..."

In his house? ALONE! What are you thinking about? Retreat! Retreat!

"...While we watch your disciples? Yes! That's an excellent idea!"

And Shen Yuan steps forward with impatient steps to create distance between them. Being straight in PIDW shouldn't be that hard! He protests to himself. Next time, he will hit Shang Qinghua a hundred times for making his characters so dangerously attractive. Everything would be easier if the others had flaws. But Liu Qingge, so loyal and dedicated, is just perfect. Then there is Luo Binghe. Objectively, Shen Yuan knows that he has a dark history that might have been even darker under other circumstances.

He is also aware that he started reading Proud Immortal Demon Way because he is into it.

Liu Qingge doesn't object to the idea of Shen Yuan drinking tea while he continues to train his disciples. From time to time, he gives him curious glances that meet Shen Yuan's gaze, making him blush. (That's normal too! What should he do? Look at the scenery? He has come to visit his friend!) Even though Shen Yuan pretends to be lost in his thoughts as he drains an empty cup, Liu Qingge continues to act normal.

Until one of the disciples manages to grab him by the outer robes. It is an unsuccessful attack that ends with the young man on the other side of the peak, but his clothes are loose, revealing his collarbones.

The collarbones are normal. Everyone has collarbones! Shen Yuan's nervousness is related to the puritanism of this era and nothing more.

With an annoyed snort, Liu Qingge takes off his outer robes. He is so sweaty that his clothes cling to his perfectly defined muscles and... ENOUGH!!!!

Shen Yuan drops the cup of tea from his hands. When Liu Qingge looks at him, puzzled, he clears his throat.

"I think I should go back." He sputters, averting his gaze to ignore the spectacle of the War God's beauty. "I have..."

The oven on? The gas open? Why are there no good excuses in this era? Shen Yuan forces himself to walk, knowing that once he reaches Rainbow Bridge he will run. Maybe to Qing Jing Peak, maybe to An Ding Peak, or to a river to jump into. His head is blank with the only thought of escaping. But his legs are like jelly. And his body doesn't respond. Shen Yuan falls to the ground as if he has suffered from heatstroke. Or worse: a stupid and timely wife plot.

Fuck Airplane Towards the Sky!!!!

At least he is nearly unconscious when Liu Qingge catches him in his arms, preventing him from falling. Those muscular arms take him gracefully and he ends up with his face resting against his chest. Now Shen Yuan can't escape his warmth and scent.

"Liu-shidi... your beauty has defeated me..."

His only luck that day is that Shen Yuan finally loses consciousness.

 

 

Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow when he sees Luo Binghe in the gardens of Qian Cao Peak. His former disciple recognizes him too, giving him an open smile (but not as bright and sincere as when he's with Liu Qingge (and Shen Jiu isn't stupid, he knows it's a ruse, but something inside him twists (there has been always jealousy in his heart))). His pride prevents him from losing whatever the demon's game is, so he gives him a blank expression. No smiles, no anger. Luo Binghe doesn't deserve the right to his emotions.

(Except that darkness digging its nails into his bones.)

"What brings you here, Luo Binghe?"

"This disciple has come intending to fulfill his promise." And he adds after Shen Jiu nods curiously. "Shizun asked me to remove my blood."

"And you did it."

"Yes. But there is another shizun."

The two know who is inside the wooden house, although neither mentions his name. The fact that Luo Binghe comments on it without attaching special importance to his other self softens those dark feelings. (Shen Jiu hasn't sunk so low as to be envious of himself yet)

"Good." He acknowledges it with a nod. It is positive that Luo Binghe made that decision without being forced by him.

However, the demon shakes his head sadly.

"I couldn't, shizun. I haven't even managed to get in. The other shizun has panicked after listening to me and Mu-shishu has decided that it's not the best time."

"That's true.” He sighs. “I'll talk to him to get his permission. Maybe it'll be easier if he's asleep."

Shen Jiu knows that his other self also hates having demon blood inside his body.

"This one leaves, shizun." Luo Binghe bows his head towards him.

Shen Jiu frowns with a hunch.

"Are you leaving the sect?"

"Mobei-jun has warned me that there are problems in the Demon Realm."

Shen Jiu snorts.

"I told you many times that you have too many open fronts." He scolds his disciple. "Did you forget about the rebellion in the south when you came here?" And his eyes widen as he guesses what happened. "You didn't forget it: you abandoned it. Luo Binghe! I will never allow any disciple of mine to be so stupid! And you want to rule? Leave that stupid palace and do what you're really good at."

He walks away from the demon to enter the house with impatient steps, not even waiting to hear Luo Binghe's answer. But his fury is not entirely real. After so many years affected by the resentment that he was worthless, that Qi-ge abandoned him, that everyone else preferred Shen Yuan, it is comforting that someone leaves everything for him. So idiot , he thinks, remembering the unexpected appearance of Luo Binghe and Liu Qingge in the other world.

His mood is excellent when he enters Shen Qingqiu's room. The appearance of his other self is still haggard, although there is a determined gleam in his eyes. The thing has decided to live and become a person again.

"Your Yingying sent me your report about the other world." He says instead of greeting him as he sits at the visitor's table. "Nice job despite your limitations. I knew you could." He pauses during which his other self looks at him suspiciously. "Though it's useless. I had already found out all that information."

Shen Qingqiu's face twitches. I also make that ugly face when I get angry? Shen Jiu ponders as he taps his fingers on the table.

"Don't look at me like that. You should have guessed."

This time, it's a bit unfair since Shen Jiu has all the secrets that Shen Yuan once wrote. But thanks to this task he has confirmed that the other world is the one his brother predicted and that Shen Qingqiu has not tried to deceive him.

"Good news for you: I know what you have written is true. But I need more."

His other self wrinkles his nose before shaking his head.

"You don't want to or you don't know anything else? Be careful with your answer: being stubborn is not the same as being expendable."

Now he is looking at him with a hatred so intense that anyone else would be scared. Then, he raises his head proudly.

"Oh? As I imagined, you know more things."

He nods.

"Shall I call Ning Yingying?"

He refuses tilting his head.

"So you've decided to be stubborn."

Shen Qingqiu shrugs vaguely before turning to the window. It is not a gesture of evasion or to avoid him, he is trying to show him what is outside the window with his gaze.

"Am I to assume you want something in return?" Another nod. "Go back to Qing Jing Peak?" Negative. "Something from outside?" An intermediate gesture. "Someone?" Affirmation.

Shen Jiu frowns.

His thoughts are not difficult to guess.

"I will not leave you with my brother until I confirm that you aren’t a threat."

Shen Qingqiu, who has neither arms nor legs, not even a tongue to defend himself with, gives him a skeptical expression.

Which becomes one of uncertainty.

“What’s wrong?” Shen Jiu frowns, confused.

His other self lets out a muffled groan, as inexplicable as the tension wracking his battered body. Shen Jiu sits up. And then he notices something cold on his wrist.

Looking down, Shen Jiu discovers a tiny green snake wrapped around his wrist like a bracelet.

The snake bites him, faster than his reflexes. It is too late when Shen Jiu uses his qi to get rid of the reptile. The poison spreads through his limbs, stunning him and causing him to stumble. He is dizzy and sleepy. Some hands grab him by his shoulders, holding him up so he doesn't collapse. Although Shen Jiu cannot see them, his instinct knows that they are not anyone he knows. Perhaps an enemy with cold skin and scales on his fingers. In front of them, Shen Qingqiu is pale and his eye dilated with fear.

"Hmmm. Another Master Shen?" Says the stranger. "How unexpected."

Chapter End Notes

EXTRA
Readers: Both Shen deserve vacations!
Readers: We want bonding time!
Readers: OrShen Qingqiu and Shen Yuan must meet!
Zhuzhi-lang: Got it UwU

I promise you this is the last kidnapping!!! (It's a family thing, ok?) And this time it won't be anything dramatic, but a fun encounter between the three Shen :D Who will finally discover their in-laws UwU

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Luo Binghe and Liu Qingge need to trust each other

Chapter Notes

I really enjoyed writing this chapter, I hope you like it!!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Chaos had engulfed Qian Cao Peak when they discovered that both Shen Jiu and Shen Qingqiu from the other world had disappeared. The Peak Lords and their head disciples were arguing among themselves, entangled in the same contagious fear, while Luo Binghe stood back in a corner. Thanks to Mobei-jun's ability to travel through the shadows, he had returned to the sect to discover the news that managed to crush his heart under the weight of panic. But instead of intervening, he stood silent with his arms folded, weighing all the possibilities with the clues he possessed.

Soon after, Liu Qingge lands on Qian Cao Peak with brutality capable of tearing apart Mu Qingfang's gardens. But nobody scolds him, because the War God carries in his arms the pale and inert body of Shen Yuan.

Luo Binghe frowns even deeper.

According to Mu Qingfang's diagnosis, Shen Yuan is dead, though he doesn't understand why. Luo Binghe listens, still distant from the others, as he begins to figure out what has happened. The demon clenches his fists, furious but also restless since everything indicates that his other self is more powerful than they had imagined.

After being satisfied with the image he has deduced from the clues, the demon finally moves. He walks without making noise or disturbing others. His gaze meets Liu Qingge’s, who is also tense listening to Mu Qingfang's theories. With a gesture, Luo Binghe motions for him to follow him outside. And this time, the cultivator does not ignore or challenge him.

The two meet in the garden, away from the restlessness of the rest and their prying ears.

“What?” Liu Qingge growls.

"Demon blood." Liu Qingge's eyes widen as he understands what he means. Luo Binghe crosses his arms before continuing to speak. "I can't track Shizun anymore... Shen Jiu." This time, it is better to say their names to avoid misunderstandings, even though the demon feels his tongue burning for being disrespectful. "But I notice my blood on Shen Qingqiu's body. He is in the southern Demon Realm. And perhaps, Shen Jiu is with him."

Liu Qingge nods.

"Do you think it was the other Luo Binghe's thing?"

"Not sure. The south has been defying me for many years. Perhaps they have captured shizun to blackmail me. Besides," Luo Binghe lets out a bitter voice. "I'm pretty sure the other me would have fed Shen Jiu with our blood again and taken the two of them to his palace, not some lost place in the south."

After all, that's what he did. Luo Binghe clenches his fists tightly to hide his contempt for himself.

"But this is not all." The demon continues. "I can feel my blood on Shen Yuan's original body. He has awakened."

"How? He wasn't dead?"

"I had left because I was warned that some rebels were attacking the palace. But I was already late: someone has stolen Shen Yuan's body and now he has been awakened in the Demons' Holy Mausoleum."

"That's why this body is dead." Liu Qingge understands. "His soul has returned to the original body."

"Effectively." Luo Binghe takes a deep breath. “The Demons' Holy Mausoleum is a special place, not just anyone can enter. That means that my enemies in the south are more powerful than I had imagined or it is someone else.”

Liu Qingge frowns, guessing without words who he means. Since the possibility of resurrecting Shen Yuan using the Demons' Holy Mausoleum was his other self's idea. Luo Binghe looks at his former rival. Deciding to summon him was easy, but now the words get stuck in his throat. Luo Binghe is not used to trusting anyone else, even for a while he also harbored dark and toxic doubts about his two shizuns. But this time his limitations stop him. Despite the repulsion of his pride, Luo Binghe is aware that alone he won’t be able to rescue all of them. And in a way, he trusts Liu Qingge and his honesty, that his feelings are strong enough to fight to the death to rescue the two brothers.

Even so, it is difficult for him to arm himself with the necessary courage to open his mouth and propose an alliance.

"I can break into the Demons' Holy Mausoleum." Luo Binghe growls, shattering his pride to pieces with a few words. "And I can tell you where Shen Jiu and Shen Qingqiu are located in the Demon Realm."

The alliance is so unexpected that Liu Qingge looks at him in confusion without saying anything or reacting. Luo Binghe also can't believe that he finally said it. The temptation to use Xin Mo creeps up his right hand in a tingle that will only disappear when he grasps the hilt of the sword to traverse impossible distances in seconds and then annihilate his enemies. He forces himself to take a deep breath to push those thoughts away.

"Can I trust you or not, Liu-shishu?" He hisses.

 

 

When Shen Jiu wakes up, he is a little dizzy and his wrist is sore from where the snake bit him. But soon he clears his head and his thoughts flow freely. Shen Jiu sits up. He is lying on a simple bed inside what looks like a tent. And from the noise outside, the cultivator deduces that he is in a war camp. At least there hasn't been any Luo Binghe this time. That doesn't stop him from still being furious.

Shen Jiu determinedly gets out of bed and leaves the tent. Whoever kidnapped him made the mistake of not chaining him up or nullifying his abilities. He can even access Xiu Ya! It's easy to corner a random demon to demand answers. And so, less than a few minutes after he woke up, Shen Jiu is entering the main tent of the camp to confront the daring demon lord. Even though no one announces his presence, as Shen Jiu is playing on the surprise factor, he is transfixed by two pairs of eyes.

There is a demon and a human. The demon is graceful and his smile widens as he recognizes him. But it's not the demonic mark shining on his forehead that stuns Shen Jiu, but his eyes are identical to Luo Binghe's. And at that moment, it occurs to him that maybe he made a mistake by focusing on his disciple's future instead of his past. It was a lapse not to investigate the unexpected origin of a half-demon and now he has someone in front of him who is undoubtedly his relative.

The other is Shen Qingqiu. Who now has two eyes. One is red and watery, but it is real and now he is scrutinizing him with a gaze similar to that Shen Jiu would find in a mirror. The demon has healed him. His pitiful other self still has neither arms nor legs, but he has recovered his eye and from the blood staining his lips, Shen Jiu deduces that his tongue as well.

"Who are you?" Shen Jiu decides to ignore Shen Qingqiu for the time being to focus on the kidnapper. "And what do you want?"

The demon curves his lips into a feline smile, with a touch of mischief.

"This one's name is Tianlang-jun. It's really nice to finally meet you, Master Shen. I've heard a lot about you."

Both Shen Jiu and Shen Qingqiu frown in an identical gesture, as both of them also know that infamous name.

"Under other circumstances, it might have been a pleasure, but not this time." Shen Jiu growls.

His response probably amused the demon, who laughs before indicating that he should sit with them. Reluctantly, Shen Jiu approaches. Despite the icy fury that pulses through his veins, he is more than curious to understand how an ancient legend has returned.

"You and your brother are quite famous. And interesting." Tianlang-jun comments as he picks up a pot of tea. The movement of his arms is strange as if they were going to fall off at any moment. "May I ask who is the third and how did he end up in this state?"

"A distant relative." Shen Jiu comments, making Shen Qingqiu snorts. At least he still carries a fan. "Can I also ask you a few questions?"

"Of course!"

"Are we in the south of the Demon Realm?"

"Indeed."

Shen Jiu glares at the demon.

"So it's you who has been fighting my disciple all these years."

Tianlang-jun lets out a thunderous laugh.

"As smart as they say! Although it seems that my offspring isn’t very clever, at least he has you, Master Shen."

The revelation does not surprise him, since it fits with Luo Binghe's age and talent, yet it is a discovery that almost stuns Shen Jiu. Meanwhile, Shen Qingqiu seems to be silently digesting that information.

"I have one last question." Shen Jiu stares at Tianlang-jun. "Perhaps a certain incident with some sowers is related to you."

The demon's smile is answer enough and that's what Shen Jiu needs to get up with his sword drawn and point at him. Tianlang-jun doesn't react. He rests his head against his fist as he watches him amused. Shen Qingqiu is also looking at them with curiosity in his eyes.

"You planned to hurt my brother." Shen Jiu hisses.

"Not by a long shot, Master Shen. My nephew's intentions have always been to help you both."

"Nephew?"

"I think it's the one with the snakes." Shen Qingqiu intervenes for the first time.

Although they are the same person, his voice sounds different, hoarse, and rough from disuse.

“Explain.” He orders the demon.

"The two of you took pity on my nephew in his time of need, allowing me to return. My Zhuzhi-lang is a good boy. Despite my intentions to destroy the cultivation world and annihilate all sects, he has interceded to save both of you."

"You plan to do what!?"

"Though my interest in meeting you two is genuine." Tianlang-jun ignores both the sword pointed at him and Shen Jiu. "Especially to you, Master Shen. Your adventures are more interesting since your brother was dead for so long."

"Can you explain to me again what you plan to do with my sect?" Shen Jiu hisses.

"Destroy it. It's nothing personal, I plan to destroy them all." The demon pauses. "Perhaps if it's personal, after all, it was the great sects that sealed me under a mountain. Can you please sit, Master Shen?"

"Don’t." Shen Qingqiu intervenes. Between the lines, Shen Jiu listens: Stay standing, at least you have legs.

"I wasn’t going to do it."

"In that case, can you put the sword away? You can't sign with your hands full."

Shen Qingqiu narrows his eyes. Not only because the demon disdains his ability as only incredibly powerful beings can, but because he talks about destroying his world with indifference while he only thinks of his own interests. Interests that he still doesn’t know.

"Sign what?"

"A masterpiece. But first, can I ask you about the ending?"

That demon is crazy and only says absurd nonsense. Shen Jiu's head is beginning to ache just from trying to understand him.

"This master doesn't know what you're talking about."

"Well, a logical ending would be for both my offspring and the War God to end up with an immortal master, but each book offers a different perspective. And my offspring already made it clear by kidnapping you both..."

Shen Qingqiu chokes.

Shen Jiu is livid and his thoughts have stopped working. 

Meanwhile, Tianlang-jun keeps talking.

"Under other circumstances, I'd think my offspring would be able to crown his two masters as his empresses, but the War God is an excellent love rival. The rescue scene was very passionate indeed."

It's not Shen Jiu who bursts out hearing that, but Shen Qingqiu, who turns to him with a wild look.

"What is he talking about?" He hisses.

"Nothing."

"You despicable liar... Is that why the beast didn't lock you up with me? I couldn't believe it when Ning Yingying said that..."

"Your Luo Bing-ge is a madman who only talks nonsense." He cuts him.

"Do I have another child?" Tianlang-jun blinks, more amused than surprised.

"Don't listen to the demons." Shen Jiu continues. "They are liars."

However, Shen Qingqiu straightens up with his head held high to meet his eyes.

"In that case, you are the worst of demons."

"Do you speak from experience?"

"Obviously."

"Master Shen, can you put down that sword? It took me a long time to heal your distant relative and I need you to sign the books."

Shen Jiu pales, and Shen Qingqiu narrows his eyes suspiciously.

"What books?"

Tianlang-jun preempts any excuse, pulling out five books from his sleeve, which he places on the table.

"The last one surprised me. I never imagined the possibility that the two suitors would become entangled in a passionate hate relationship." He hums happily. "I am very grateful to the author because they have made it worthwhile to return."

Instead, Shen Jiu is grateful that his other self has no arms to pick up those books since the desire burns in his eyes.

"That's fiction." He snorts without hiding his disgust. "None of it is real."

"Someone wrote a book about you with the beast and our brute shidi?" Shen Qingqiu lets out an acid but heartfelt laugh. "From what I see, your life is still pathetic in this world. What a relief. I already believe that what you told me was not true."

Shen Jiu hesitates whether to hit him with the fan or the sword. However, Tianlang-jun clicks his tongue and shakes his head like a calamity before destroying the world.

"Don't try to belittle me, master Shen. I heard that my offspring attacked the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect, causing your brother's death. Then, he took the two of you to his human palace. Too bad he beat me to it by conquering the Huan Hua Palace." Tianlang-jun sighs. "All the War God's attempts to rescue you were also famous. How long were you locked up? A year?"

"I wasn't locked up!" Shen Jiu hisses. "I was a guest while I waited for my brother to return!"

"Yeah, sure. Perhaps a guest in his rooms?"

Shen Qingqiu has paled even more.

"Obviously not!"

"It was very exciting when the War God rescued you."

"How lucky." Shen Qingqiu grunts through clenched teeth.

“And very romantic, I must say. According to rumors, Master Shen was so weak from my offspring's mistreatment that he had to carry you.”

“Nevermind. You’re pathetic.”

"Enough!" Shen Jiu plunges the sword into the table, startling the two of them. “Don't twist the truth!”

"It is a known fact to all that Master Shen was wandering for a year while his two lovers pursued him."

"You're not even remotely close to the truth."

Despite his anger, Tianlang-jun's smile doesn’t fade or diminish. The demon even has the nerve to hold out the books to him.

"Can you sign them?"

The demon then protects them with his dark qi when Shen Jiu tries to destroy them. That makes his arm fall off, but he instantly snaps it back on. Shen Qingqiu looks at him enviously before turning to Shen Jiu.

"Now I understand why they came back for you."

"As I am tired of repeating, the demon only talks nonsense and those books have been written by someone else based on isolated facts."

"You can't fool me." Shen Qingqiu hisses. "Although I'm still surprised that someone is capable of taking an interest in you... WHY LIU QINGGE?"

"Don't jump to conclusions..."

"YOU TOLD ME YOURSELF THAT IT WAS THE SECOND BEST THING THAT EVER HAPPENED TO YOU! I thought you were exaggerating, that maybe you were trying to confuse me or it was all a delusional dream of the beast. But Liu Qingge? That brainless brute?"

"Don’t." Shen Jiu warns him with a hiss.

"Have you forgotten what happened at the well mission?"

"He apologized, okay?"

"Oh? So you're a naive accepting apology? Have you forgiven Qi-ge too?"

"It’s different!"

"Yes? And what about YOUR DISCIPLE LUO BINGHE? How did you end up between those two?"

"I don't know!"

"Oh? So you finally recognize that there is something?"

Shen Jiu is trembling as he turns to Tianlang-jun, who watches his discussion without hiding his amusement.

"Can you remove his tongue again, please?"

"He won't." Shen Qingqiu intervenes. Despite the confidence he appears, there is a fear deep in his eyes. "I can tell interesting things. For example, do you know that if you send certain legs to Cang Qiong Sect Leader he will fall into any trap no matter how stupid it is?"

It is a message for both of them. Shen Jiu still remembers that before they were kidnapped, he had asked him for new information. And his eyes widen in horror as he understands everything that those perverse words contain.

It is also a threat.

Shen Qingqiu has no ties to this world and he won't mind allying himself with the demon if he doesn't offer him something better. I hate myself. He groans before sitting up and looking Tianlang-jun into the eyes.

"Don't listen to my cousin. The accident sometimes makes him delirious."

Shen Qingqiu clicks his tongue in disgust, and Shen Jiu gives him a warning look: you are no longer a distant relative but my cousin. Don’t complain.

Chapter End Notes

Today's author favorite flavor is: love rivals forced to work together 👌🏽

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen brothers and the awkward family meeting

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

A snake demon greets Shen Yuan when he awakens inside a coffin. When the stranger, Zhuzhi-lang, explains how he ended up in the Demons' Holy Mausoleum (smiling too brightly despite kidnapping him), Shen Yuan feels an unexpected relief. Now he has an excuse to not look Liu Qingge in the face ever again. And next time, he will explain to him that all the nonsense he said was because his soul violently left his body.

He is a good brother, okay!? He is not going to unconsciously flirt with his possible future brother-in-law!

Then, the Demons' Holy Mausoleum shakes and one of the walls breaks as Luo Binghe appears with a pack of Moon Python Rhinoceros. It's... quite heroic. Perhaps his heart races as he smiles like a silly maiden. Unfortunately, Zhuzhi-lang turns into a snake and swallows Shen Yuan.

That is not pleasant, but gross and dirty.

The next time, Shen Yuan wakes up to a much warmer and more comforting place that doesn't reek of snake breath.

"A-Yuan!" Someone exclaims. A hand helps him straighten up, and Shen Yuan recognizes first the smell of bamboo and then the worried expression on his brother's face.

"Jiu-ge...?" He sputters. "Have you been kidnapped again?"

“Again?” A third voice intervenes with disgust.

Shen Yuan, already awake, raises his head to find the original Shen Qingqiu looking at the two of them with a hard-to-read scowl. There is curiosity in his eyes, but also disgust and mistrust. He is sitting in front of a low table. His appearance has improved considerably since the last time Shen Yuan saw him. What was once almost a corpse has now regained some of his past glory and his lost eye.

"You can talk." He stammers, surprised.

"Evidently." Shen Qingqiu clicks his tongue. And although he doesn't say so, Shen Yuan suspects that he is assessing his intelligence and not positively. "So, we finally met. I was quite curious about your existence."

"Well, he is Shen Yuan. I hope you are satisfied by now." Shen Jiu growls, clearly dissatisfied, before sitting up. "Now we're leaving. Hurry up."

"What?" Shen Yuan splutters.

He's still a little dazed after so many emotions and he stumbles when his brother yanks him out of bed by his arm.

"What are you doing?" Shen Qingqiu looks just as confused as him. "You told Tianlang-jun that you would stay of your own free will."

"I thought it would be pretty obvious to you that I was lying."

"Wait! TIANLANG-JUN!!!?"

Both ignore Shen Yuan.

"We're not leaving." Shen Qingqiu hisses.

“I only waited because he said that Shen Yuan had been caught as well. Now that he is with me, I have no reason to willingly become his prisoner.”

"He wants to destroy the sect."

"Another good reason to leave and warn Yue Qingyuan."

"Or we can stay. A good strategist must collect as much information as possible to devise the best plan."

"And why do you care? This is not your world."

Shen Qingqiu grits his teeth in anger. Although his expression is terrifying, his face is the same as Shen Jiu's and so Shen Yuan recognizes the fear lurking in the depths of his eyes. And sadness.

"My sect was already destroyed once. I'd rather not live through it again."

That mention makes Shen Jiu tense. He clenches his fists tightly and his expression becomes more determined.

“According to what you have told me, Yue Qingyuan is in danger as long as we are prisoners.”

Oh fuck. Shen Yuan pales. That bastard Shen Qingqiu! Why did you tell him!? Taking advantage of the holes in the System, Shen Yuan had offered a lot of information to Shen Jiu, but he had also left out another. There was no need to traumatize him with the description of Luo Binghe's torture or Ming Fan's agonizing death eaten by ants or Yue Qingyuan… impaled by a thousand arrows after receiving his legs torn off as bait.

But it's as if fate is pushing Shen Jiu to discover all the dark secrets of the original book.

Although Shen Qingqiu trembles imperceptibly, he still holds his head high and challenges Shen Jiu with his gaze.

"I will scream if you try to leave."

"Filthy snake." Shen Jiu hisses, furious.

"But... I can keep quiet if you explain to me why you have a brother."

Suddenly, Shen Qingqiu's security seems more fragile. That's a ridiculous and selfish request compared to the seriousness they were discussing earlier, but it's important to him.

Shen Jiu and Shen Yuan exchange a look.

It's a simple question with a complicated answer.

"I found him." Shen Jiu begins to speak in a hesitant voice. And Shen Yuan doesn't need more to know that he has chosen the half-truths. "I was already a Peak Lord when I met someone identical to me. Our meeting was not pleasant. He tried to steal my position..."

"And you locked me up." Shen Yuan fights back. "Now that I think about it, that was almost a kidnapping."

"Nevermind. Our relationship improved and the two of us worked together as Shen Qingqiu until Luo Binghe came back from the Abyss and everyone found out the secret. The end."

They share the same unease as they wait for Shen Qingqiu's reaction, who looks at them in amazement. Though his mouth is open, he doesn't say anything, and for a few seconds, silence hangs over them until it reaches every corner.

"And... that's all?"

"I can tell you more details once we're away." Shen Jiu reluctantly agrees. "Deal?"

Shen Qingqiu nods.

However, all three are startled by footsteps. And an instant later, the cloth covering the entrance is parted and two demons enter. Shen Yuan already recognizes Zhuzhi-lang, so his gaze falls on the other. It is easy to recognize certain similarities of Luo Binghe in him, although Tianlang-jun is much stockier and his smile is brighter.

"Oh! How curious! Master Shen, your brother is identical to you and your cousin."

Cousin? Shen Yuan thinks in amusement before turning to Shen Jiu. His brother shrugs before heading towards the demon.

"You're interrupting a family meeting. We'd appreciate it if you leave us alone."

Jiu-ge, you can't talk like that to the most powerful Demon Lord before Binghe! 

"You're so funny Master Shen! I must also thank your brother for helping my nephew." Beside Tianlang-jun, Zhuzhi-lang hangs his head in shame. The scales on his cheeks shine with a blush hue. "Besides, if Master Shen insists on not answering my questions, perhaps your brother can help me."

Shen Jiu tenses up suspiciously. Shen Qingqiu looks amused.

And Shen Yuan is confused.

Tianlang-jun walks in, followed by the snake demon, to sit down at the low table without waiting for forgiveness or permission. While Shen Qingqiu has no choice but to stay by the demons' side, his brother stays in front of Shen Yuan protectively.

"Must this master remind you that our private lives are private?" He hisses. "Furthermore, A-Yuan is not interested in men."

Shen Yuan blinks in confusion.

“Forgive my insistence, Master Shen, but this old man is curious who his son-in-law will be. My offspring is a disappointment, but at least he has good taste. Also, the three of you are a great catch. If neither is interested in my son, you still have my nephew."

Now Shen Yuan's cheeks burn with embarrassment. He is not surprised that Zhuzhi-lang seems so mortified and prefers to sit away from his uncle. Meanwhile, Shen Qingqiu and Shen Jiu are glaring at him with a dark and terrifying expression, which must have haunted little Bingbing's nightmares. Too bad that Tianlang-jun doesn't care.

They all notice powerful demonic energy outside at the same time. Despite the raging darkness that pollutes the air, Tianlang-jun's smile grows.

"Well, he is finally here."

"You wanted Binghe." Shen Yuan sputters. "That was a trap."

"More or less. I was sincere when I promised my nephew that I would prevent any Master Shen from harm when the cultivation world fell."

Shen Yuan holds his breath as Luo Binghe walks in. His shadow seems even more immense with fury. This space is too small to contain two heavenly demons, and despite the suffocating anguish, Shen Yuan smiles.

"This is unexpected." Luo Binghe looks at everyone who is gathered until his gaze stops at his father. "Who are you and what are you doing with my shizuns?"

Shen Jiu's hand is cold. Shen Yuan shivers unconsciously as his brother holds his wrist so tightly that it hurts. But Shen Yuan doesn't say anything. He has a feeling that he should keep quiet at the moment.

Tianlang-jun looks with disinterest at his son with a less than friendly expression.

"You are identical to her." In his mouth, that doesn't sound like a compliment. "Before we talk about certain matters, could you solve this old man's doubt? Which Master Shen do you prefer?"

Luo Binghe lets out a laugh too bitter, too broken, to be friendly. And Shen Jiu squeezes his wrist so hard that Shen Yuan turns to him. All his complaints die in his throat when he discovers that his brother is deathly pale and with dilated pupils.

"All of them."

This Luo Binghe only carries one sword.

Xin Mo.

Chapter End Notes

:)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

A family meeting even more awkward

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

The tension is not only uncomfortable but terrifying. His brother is tense while Shen Qingqiu has turned pale. Zhuzhi-lang watches the newcomer warily, and Tianlang-jun's smile is less warm. All the eyes are fixed on a Luo Binghe very similar to the one Shen Yuan knows. There are hardly any differences in his physical appearance. He may be shorter and paler, but he has the same magnetic charm as his disciple. And irredeemable cruelty darkens his features.

Despite the fear, Shen Yuan gulps and pretends not to recognize the impostor. He is an avid reader! He can understand Luo Bing-ge better than his own! Shen Yuan squeezes Shen Jiu's hand to ask for confidence before welcoming the demon with a smile.

Although Shen Jiu holds his hand tightly, he doesn't say anything.

"Hi, Luo Binghe. You have arrived on time." Shen Yuan's pulse quickens as the demon turns to him, gazing at him like a predator would at his prey. "Let this master introduce you: he is Tianlang-jun, your father."

A new curiosity flashes across his face. After all, what protagonist would pass up that opportunity to discover his origins? Luo Bing-ge not at least. Shen Yuan is still trying hard to feign normalcy as he drags Shen Jiu along with the demons. Perhaps the tendency to kidnap is a family trait, but he trusts Zhuzhi-lang's moral code. The demon snake seems the least prone to ripping off limbs.

"We were discussing some interesting matters before you arrived." Shen Yuan keeps talking as he thinks of different ideas to draw the attention of the blackened protagonist away from his family. "Sit, Luo Binghe. I think you and your father have a lot to talk about."

"Don't get me wrong, Second Master Shen." Tianlang-jun intervenes. "This boy of mine and I only had two matters to discuss and he has already answered my first question."

"Relating to our previous conversation." To Shen Yuan's surprise, Shen Jiu dares to speak. His voice is monotonous but serene. Unlike him, Shen Jiu knows how to camouflage his nervousness and pretend to be normal. "The answer is not that simple. Or have you perhaps forgotten the third volume of Resentment of Chunshan?"

Tianlang-jun leans forward.

"Of course not, Master Shen. I even brought a copy with me with the hope that you would sign it. Also this son of mine, of course." The demon looks at Luo Bing-ge without understanding that he is an impostor from another world.

Sen Yuan doesn’t blame him.

Luo Bing-ge approaches. Despite his relaxed posture, his gaze watches over the three of them. Then, Shen Yuan feels a tingling inside his body, as if he is making sure that his blood is still working. This is bad. He thinks. Only Jiu-ge is free from demon blood. And if Luo Bing-ge finds out, he will force him to drink it. In front of him, Shen Qingqiu is livid and terror is reflected in both of his eyes.

"Are you sure? Maybe you should reread chapter 41." Shen Jiu clicks his tongue disdainfully. "Obviously, your interest in explicit scenes has made you a terrible reader. You have to look at the composition of the story and its characters."

Instead of being offended, the demon smiles and rests his face on his hand.

"Interesting, Master Shen... So chapter 41?"

"Exactly. I could point you to other examples, but I find this to be the most interesting in the current situation."

Shen Yuan breathes a sigh of relief as the unpleasant feeling of someone poking around inside him subsides. But the break is brief. Following his directions, Luo Binghe gets closer with the purpose of sitting down with them. But he chooses to stand behind Shen Jiu and wrap an arm around his waist.

"Shizun, this one is disappointed. I'm here, but you prefer talking about books with... him." His displeasure is evident. Luo Bing-ge glares at Tianlang-jun without hiding his mistrust. Behind the former demon lord, Zhuzhi-lang takes a defensive stance. "So cruel, shizun. Although this one is curious. What is my father doing here?"

Shen Yuan restrains himself from smiling victoriously. Luo Bing-ge has taken the bait. Any anomaly between the two timelines should intrigue a bored emperor.

"I'm also curious." Shen Yuan speaks not only to win as well but also to attract Luo Bing-ge's attention and leave his brother alone. Although after confirming that he is the only one he cannot manipulate with his blood, it is quite likely that he will try to physically control him. "I mean, it was our fault but this master doesn't understand why..." Oh no. Saying in front of Luo Bing-ge, who merged the two worlds, Tianlang-jun's plans? Horrible idea. Retreat. "Why did you abandon Luo Binghe?"

Perhaps it is not the best topic of conversation, as both the son and the father become tense. Or the other way around: perhaps it is an ideal topic of conversation. As a former internet troll, Shen Yuan has experience with controversy and how to create incendiary debates.

"Look at him!" Shen Yuan breaks the silence by feigning more ignorance. "He is a good boy. Perhaps too intense and we should work on his homicidal intentions, but he is a great cook, caring, an expert in housework..." None of his compliments seem to flatter Luo Bing-ge, whose smile turns sarcastic. Well, maybe then the emperor will learn what kind of Luo Binghe is appreciated in this world. "We all believed that our Luo Binghe was an orphan."

"That's thanks to his mother. I was recently aware that I had a son."

Although an upset Tianlang-jun is terrifying, Shen Yuan is not scared. The intruder from the other world is even more disturbing.

"I don't know who the woman who gave birth to me is, but my mother is someone else." Luo Binghe growls.

Uh oh. Luo Bing-ge doesn't seem as interested in his family as he had supposed. Tianlang-jun shrugs lightly and turns to look at Shen Jiu.

"I would like to continue talking to Master Shen about chapter 41. A scholar like you surely has an interesting point of view to contribute."

"I think shizun is busy." Luo Bing-ge narrows his eyes. "No one has yet explained to me what my three shizuns are doing here... Or who should I thank that my original dear shizun now has both eyes and a tongue."

His smile is sharp as a knife and even Shen Yuan trembles as he fixes his gaze on Shen Qingqiu, who is as stiff and pale as a statue of salt.

"The perpetrator should thank his father." Shen Jiu snorts. His calm is also breaking, even though he is the only one of the three who still manages to maintain some composure. "Where are your manners, Luo Binghe? You show up uninvited, interrupting our literary debate."

"That's because shizun suddenly disappeared."

And in front of them, Tianlang-jun listens. He no longer smiles.

"It wasn't our decision."

"It's what happens when shizun decides to leave the safety of my palace." His smile twists as he hugs Shen Jiu even tighter. "This lord has learned that he must take better care of his shizuns. The three of them."

Although his brother pales, his eyes flash with anger.

"So..." Shen Yuan clears his throat. "We're not pretending anymore?"

"Chapter 59." Shen Jiu hisses.

Tianlang-jun nods.

"Zhuzhi-lang."

That is his only warning before a gigantic snake destroys the table and comes between them and Luo Binghe, who backs up, dragging Shen Jiu with him. A chill freezes Shen Yuan's limbs, keeping him frozen. And from his expression of anguish, something similar must be happening to Shen Qingqiu.

"Quite interesting..." Tianlang-jun comments. "You're not my son, but you are a heavenly demon. I'm curious how your blood has ended up in two Master Shens."

"I can do a demonstration." He brags.

"In your dreams!" Shen Jiu roars before summoning Xiu Ya.

And he uses the sword to force Luo Bing-ge to release him. However, the demon only takes two steps back before walking around him.

"Shizun, you should be nicer. It would be a shame if you lost your brother again."

Shen Yuan gasps as fire shoots through his insides, twisting his organs, causing him to close his eyes and dig his fingernails into his palms.

"Chapter 57."

Despite having a body with drooping arms, Tianlang-jun is unexpectedly fast. And with a sharp blow to the acupuncture point, Shen Yuan loses consciousness.

Chapter End Notes

First I thought of giving the chapter numbers randomly... Then I chose numbers related to the fanfic chapters :3 (Anyone try to guess the references?) Although why Shen Jiu used those specific numbers will be explained in the next chapter~

----------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

Shen Jiu did read those books

Chapter Notes

As many of you guessed, chapter 41 is when Shen Jiu mistakes Luo Bing-ge for Luo Binghe. In chapter 59 there is a mention of Zhuzhi-lang turning into a snake (this one was difficult, I admit it!) and in chapter 57 the two Shen brothers lost consciousness. Although Resentment of Chunshan has a different plot, absurd and erotic, I thought it would be more fun to pick some numbers with meaning instead of choosing randomly :3

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Nowadays Resentment of Chunshan only has five volumes. Although there is a possibility that its mysterious author will write more, Shen Jiu will take care of that matter once he discovers his identity. Meanwhile, he grudgingly acknowledges that knowing the contents of those infamous novels has its uses.
