In chapter 41, a shapeshifting demon poses as Luo Binghe and almost tricks them.

In chapter 59, they are meeting with a clan of evil demons who want to kill them. At the climax, the demons turn into beasts and treacherously attack them.

In chapter 57, the characters were surrounded by succubi who were trying to lure Liu Qingge with his poison. To save him, Shen Jiu knocks him out.

Although Shen Jiu distrusts Tianlang-jun's intelligence, in the end, it seems that he understood all his messages: this Luo Binghe is an impostor, attacking, putting those who are poisoned to sleep so that the demon cannot manipulate them.

Shen Jiu's hand firmly grips Xiu Ya's hilt after he stepped in front of Shen Yuan. Luo Bing-ge laughs, indifferent to the presence of his father, a demonic snake, and a furious Peak Lord. With a flash of black and silver, the demon draws his sword. His Xin Mo is covered with dense and suffocating darkness, making Shen Jiu tremble. It has always been an abominable sword, but right now it seems more wicked than ever.

"Are you sure, shizun, that you can protect them from me?" He scoffs with a cruel, crooked smile. "With my blood, I can destroy his guts; I can make your brother wake up in pain... or invade his dreams. Be nice and return to my side or I will punish you."

Shen Jiu grits his teeth. Despite the confidence he tries to convey, he's shaking with horrible panic. And for a brief moment, Shen Jiu ponders the possibility of negotiating with that monster in exchange for him never putting Shen Yuan in danger again. It wouldn’t be the first time that he has risked his life to save someone he loves. That was how he ended up trapped in the Qiu mansion.

But your life matters too , says a voice inside his head that sounds like Mu Qingfang's during their sessions or Shen Yuan's when he gets angry. You also have value. You aren’t expendable.

Shen Jiu misses his chance to make a decision when Tianlang-jun moves in with Shen Yuan in his arms. Towards Luo Bing-ge. His eyes widen in fear, though he keeps pointing the sword at his enemy.

"What are you doing?" He hisses.

Tianlang-jun ignores him, standing in front of Luo Bing-ge at a safe distance.

"I will give him to you in exchange for the sword."

His words hit Shen Qinqiu, who pales as the Demon Lord raises an eyebrow in puzzlement.

"Your traitor! Leave my brother alone."

"I'm sorry, Master Shen." Tianlang-jun gives him an apologetic smile. "But as I said, I had two issues with my son. Although this is not the real one, I can tell that this sword is Xin Mo."

Luo Bing-ge's expression is puzzled, though he seems about to burst out laughing. And for once, Shen Jiu is unable to predict him: what will he choose? His obsession with him or the most powerful sword in the world?

"What do you want my shizun and my sword for, old man?" There is a dangerous gleam in his eyes.

Tianlang-jun is unimpressed by his aura.

"My interest in meeting Master Shen is due to my nephew. Regarding the other, I'm going to merge both realms."

And Luo Bing-ge, who already did it in another world, finally bursts out into a raucous, exaggerated, laugh.

"So, this is the situation. The way I see it, shizun, you have two options. Come with me and help me defeat this old man. And the four of us will return to my world." He qualifies the number possessively, confirming Shen Jiu's worst fears. "Or... I will merge both realms myself, is that alright with you, old man?"

Tianlang-jun has narrowed his eyes and also seems to assess all the possible consequences of this situation.

"I let you choose, shizun: come with me willingly or give up when I destroy your world and you can only be with me."

He is mad! Shen Qingqiu grits his teeth despite the horrible panic pulsing inside him. He is mad and that makes him even more dangerous.

"For my part, I have no problem with you merging both realms whenever it happens," Tianlang-jun says in a clear voice, and Zhuzhi-lang protests with a querulous hiss. "However, do you need to claim all three of them?"

"Of course. I already have a harem of two hundred women, why not one of shizuns as well?"

"You're insane." Shen Jiu hisses, unable to hide his contempt anymore, his rage, his horror. "You're talking about your master! The one you viciously mutilated and tortured! And you don't even know Shen Yuan! He hasn't done anything to you except look like me."

Luo Bing-ge doesn’t reply. Because he doesn't care. He is no longer a half-demon desperate for affection, but someone who lets his most selfish darkness devour him. He is an emperor who reshaped the world at his whim. And with his power, he can achieve any wish, even the most exaggerated and ridiculous.

Shen Jiu is struck by an old panic that wells up in his bones, from the scars left by the past. Is this how he ends? He manages to think despite the shock. Was I always meant to be someone else's property? Slowly, he lowers the sword without noticing the gesture. Unconsciously, he knows how to recognize the best option: the one that won’t destroy the entire world or kill the people he cares about.

The ice rescues him from his daze. It springs up from everywhere, sharp stakes of frost and sharp stalactites. They stand between them and Luo Bing-ge, who hisses more surprised than angry. With an unexpected chill and warmth inside his chest, Shen Jiu turns just as his Luo Binghe and Liu Qingge emerge from the shadows accompanied by Mobei-jun.

The relief he feels is so intense that Shen Jiu almost breaks out laughing and crying, though he ultimately freezes as they burst in. Luo Binghe charges at his other self while Liu Qingge attacks Tianlang-jun. The snake hisses between fury and pain as the ice hits him. It is then when Shen Jiu discovers that Zhuzhi-lang has Shen Qingqiu. Dammit!

He doesn't allow his runaway emotions to control him anymore. Shen Jiu wields his sword with confidence and determination as he runs towards Zhuzhi-lang. Taking advantage of the demon being distracted by Mobei-jun, he sneaks away toward Shen Qingqiu. His other self is so light that it is easy to pick him up and flee before Zhuzhi-lang notices.

Shen Jiu is backing away with no clear ideas when a familiar voice calls out his name. And he turns just in time to see Liu Qingge with Shen Yuan in his arms. Tianlang-jun is bleeding, though his expression is one of curiosity. And one of his arms is missing, although it is not clear if Liu Qingge has cut it or it has fallen off again on its own.

"Follow me!"

Shen Jiu nods before following in his shidi's wake as Mobei-jun covers their backs, holding the other two back with his ice. Shen Jiu stops Liu Qingge by yanking his arm.

"Wait! What about Luo Binghe?"

His disciple is still fighting against his other self with excessive and furious violence.

"He will follow us." Liu Qingge frowns with distaste as he speaks. "He can track them."

"But... What if he doesn't win?"

Shen Yuan convinced him of his disciple's invincibility, but he has already seen Luo Binghe be fooled too many times. Furthermore, he is using a normal spirit sword while Luo Bing-ge wields a Xin Mo strengthened after years of killing and orgies. At this moment, while one demon has allowed his rage to control him and the other derisively dodges him, the difference between the two of them is abysmal.

His worried gaze meets Luo Bing-ge's. And he gives him a crooked smile before backing away with calculated steps under Luo Binghe's wary gaze.

"I'll give you five days, shizun. You can find me at Maigu Ridge." With a precise blow, the demon opens a portal in the air. "It's a promise, shizun: your happiness, your pain, your sadness, they all belong to me. And if I can't possess any of the three, I will destroy everything you have."

Though he disappears, his menace remains with them even as they use their swords to fly away from the Demon Realm.

Chapter End Notes

So, Shen Yuan, how do you feel after find out that your beloved protagonist has become the final boss?

BONUS
Shen Jiu: ...we are doomed.
Luo Binghe's protagonist halo: Not today 😤

----------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

✰ Tumblr

The dilemma of five people and three swords

Chapter Notes

After the tension of the previous chapters, it's time for a break! I hope you like this chapter ☺️❤️

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Once Shen Jiu feels that they are safe, despite still being under the red sky of the Demon Realm, he forces them to land on a rocky path, ignoring Liu Qingge's protests and Luo Binghe's misgivings. But there are pending and urgent matters that mustn’t be postponed while the threat of Luo Bing-ge lurks in the shadows.

"Luo Binghe!" He hisses and the determination in his voice makes the demon tense. "Get your blood out of them. Now."

It is one of those orders that the demon obeys with his head bowed and without protest. Shen Jiu knows that Shen Qingqiu has been awake for a long time and that he keeps his eyes closed to avoid the others. Even so, he doesn’t hesitate to bring his broken body closer to Luo Binghe despite noticing his discomfort and the panic that beats restlessly under his skin. However, his other self remains stubbornly silent and allows the shadow of his tormentor to touch him. It’s a minimal contact, and yet Shen Qingqiu remains pale and his brows twisted in phantom pain, echoing perhaps his worst memories.

When Luo Binghe finishes cleaning the two of them of his infected blood, Shen Jiu finally allows himself to breathe a sigh of relief.

"Let's go to the border." He orders the rest before getting back on Xiu Ya.

"My palace is closer." Luo Binghe points. "I'll order food, a bath, and a room to be prepared... for Liu-shishu as well."

Liu Qingge glares at him, but he chooses to hold Shen Yuan's body instead of his weapon. Shen Yuan is no longer limp due to unconsciousness, but sleeps peacefully, his arms around Liu Qingge's neck, his mouth open as he smears drool on his outer robes. Despite his interests, the demon’s argument is consistent, however, Shen Jiu shakes his head.

"We need to return to the sect and warn the cultivation world of the calamity that threatens us. There is no time to waste, let's go."

While Liu Qingge doesn’t hesitate to follow his command, Luo Binghe is delayed a few seconds, surely sad that he missed such an opportunity, but in the end, he also mounts Zheng Yang and flies behind him.

The journey is tense and silent, uncomfortable by the terrifying shadow of Luo Bing-ge and its dire consequences. Eventually, Shen Yuan wakes up and the shock of Liu Qingge holding him in his arms almost makes him fall off the sword. Only the threat of his brother falling into the void makes Shen Jiu stop and insist that Shen Yuan should travel with him, but the others point out that he is already carrying Shen Qingqiu.

"If my second shizun is uncomfortable with Liu-shishu, he can always travel with me." Luo Binghe proposes. Despite his voice being a restrained whisper and his obedient disciple attitude, a smirk struggles to appear on his face.

If it wasn't for the distance, Shen Jiu would have hit him with his fan. Instead, he holds Shen Qingqiu even tighter to hide that raging tremor that beats under his skin and reflects in his voice.

"Luo Binghe!" He hisses. The words crackle in his throat with too much anger, too much rancor out of his control. "Aren't you ashamed? First, you annoy your shishu, and now my brother with your tricks…” 

“Shizun, this disciple hasn't bothered Liu-shishu." He dares to bat his eyelashes in feigned innocence. "Would shizun enlighten this dumb disciple?"

“Silence! Keep flying and don't waste our time."

In the end, Shen Yuan assures them that there is no problem in traveling with Liu Qingge. He loves it! But today his voice sounds false and without the security of the past. Shen Yuan, moreover, insists, blushing and with a babble, on standing up instead of his arms. Shen Jiu concedes.

"What was that?" Shen Qingqiu growls at him as they fly again.

"Aren't you pretending to be asleep anymore? You're welcome, by the way, for removing your demon blood."

His other self snorts contemptuously.

"What was that fit of jealousy?"

"Jealousy? What jealousy? I'm just taking care of my little brother."

"Don't try to fool me, we are the same person." Shen Qingqiu rolls his eyes. "Just be more subtle next time. I don't want to see a version of myself getting humiliated by a demon or the brute from Bai Zhan Peak."

Shen Jiu announces that his arms are tired and pretends to pass Shen Qingqiu's body to Luo Binghe. In the end, he doesn't do it because it's crucial not to stop, but his repellent other self stops bothering him and just glares at him in silence while they fly between dark clouds.

A few minutes later, they pause again because Shen Yuan prefers to ride behind Liu Qingge instead of in front. It's a ridiculous decision in a time of crisis, but Shen Jiu allows it without hiding his soft spot (and Shen Qingqiu snorts, calling him weak under his breath). However, before Shen Yuan was held tightly in Liu Qingge's powerful arms and now he is as far away from him as the sword will allow and clinging to his clothing as little as possible.

When Liu Qingge speeds up, he falls.

Shen Jiu lets out a scream that Shen Qingqiu qualifies as pathetic. Despite the mass hysteria, Luo Binghe is the fastest and catches Shen Yuan in his arms with inimitable precision. His brother, who had turned pale, flushes bright red and begins to mutter nonsense.

"We trade swords!" He exclaims between swipes, forcing Luo Binghe to let go of him even though they are still several meters above the ground. "I will fly on Xiu Ya."

"We’ll be too much." Shen Qingqiu comments in that irritating voice that Shen Jiu is beginning to hate, despite being identical to his angry tone. "It will be safer if you stand still with the brute or the demon. Or switch places with your brother."

"As if I'm going to leave A-Yuan alone with you, you petty snake."

"Jiu-Ge..."

Shen Jiu swallows all his words when Shen Yuan gives him puppy eyes. Although he doesn't understand what is stressing him out so much, Shen Jiu has a weak point capable of making him change his mind and even waste their precious time by forcing others to switch swords. In this way, Shen Yuan climbs Xiu Ya. And he, not intending to fall into the petty trap of his other self, endorses Shen Qingqiu's dead weight on Liu Qingge. Probably Shen Qingqiu will only be quiet with him because the War God's patience is scarcer than the rest and he may let him fall if he provokes him with his comments. By default, Shen Jiu gets on Zheng Yang.

"This master leads," he warns Luo Binghe, ignoring the fact that this is not his sword.

"Yes, shizun!"

From his smile, Shen Jiu should have suspected that the demon would gladly stand behind him and hug his waist. Not forcefully or digging his fingers in. It is a precise hug, which makes it impossible to ignore his presence. It's not suffocating or uncomfortable like Luo Bing-ge's touch or the times he held him without permission. It is a delicate but firm, playful touch. Luo Binghe even dares to rest his chin on his shoulder and when he speaks his voice tickles him.

"Shizun, you and your... family are alright?" Despite his stubborn silence, the demon doesn’t give up. "This disciple was very worried..."

"Hush, Luo Binghe. We can talk once we arrive."

Shen Jiu had vaguely hoped to reach the sect that night, however, the sunset catches them still at the border. And fatigue wraps around them like a second skin. Shen Yuan almost stumbles off the sword again when he falls asleep on his feet and Luo Binghe has long ago put all of his weight on him and his slow breathing warns that he is also asleep.

With resignation, Shen Jiu assumes that they must rest that night in a border inn.

To avoid a show, Luo Binghe hides his demonic traits and Shen Jiu insists on covering Shen Qingqiu with a coat until he becomes a bundle. That doesn't make him happy at all, but he prefers that degradation to the humiliation of many disgusted looks, and he agrees to remain silent.

Although everyone knows that he will try to take revenge later.

Once inside, Luo Binghe asks for two rooms.

"No way!" Liu Qingge hisses. "That’s not enough for all of us."

"Who carries money, Liu-shishu?"

That fact steals all their protest and Liu Qingge shuts up his words as an embarrassed blush covers his cheeks. Since three were kidnapped and the War God, as he now confirms, has never cared about those details. Shen Jiu rubs the bridge of his nose while Shen Yuan sighs, too tired to get angry.

"Fine." Shen Jiu growls. "It doesn't matter, we'll be leaving soon in the morning, understood?"

The innkeeper guides them into the hallway. His steps are as nervous as his voice since he senses that none of them is an ordinary person. Perhaps that is why the innkeeper offers them two spacious rooms that are much higher than their budget. Shen Jiu examines them critically. The two are almost identical. They have a bathtub in a corner behind a screen and only one bed, albeit a large one. The decoration is austere without being seedy.

During the year he'd been wandering the country, he'd stayed in worse places. This inn is not luxurious, but today he is accompanied by a spoiled demon, a brute who is still noble, and, most importantly, his brother. Shen Qingqiu would probably adapt to any place, but not them, and that night they must rest to regain their strength. With a nod, he approves.

"Bring food and hot water," Shen Jiu orders the innkeeper. "My friends know how to cook. If our money is not enough, they can pay with their services."

"Jiu-Ge..." Shen Yuan yawns, unable to shake the sleep clouding his gaze. "You can't treat the protagonist and the second male lead like that."

Nobody understands his words, although Shen Jiu already knows enough of his vocabulary to get an idea of the meaning.

"I can. If they don't like it, let them protest."

No one protests. Liu Qingge's stance is as tense as it gets as he carries Shen Qingqiu, with a different awkwardness than usual. He has pink ears while Luo Binghe gives him a wide smile.

"This disciple will gladly fulfill any shizun's wishes."

"You..." Liu Qingge turned towards him so sharply that the bundle almost hit Luo Binghe's chest. "So cheeky."

“Me? This disciple just wants to make his shizuns happy…” Suddenly, Luo Binghe's eyes widen and he ignores Liu Qingge to turn to Shen Jiu. "This dumb disciple has had a question for a long time, how should I refer to you three? Is the new one also my shizun?"

"Never." Hisses an angry voice from inside the bundle .

"Can this disciple use your names as Liu-shishu does?"

Liu Qingge is glaring at him with an intensity that almost gives off sparks and smoke. After being kidnapped, fighting, dealing with his other self's poisonous personality, the interest of someone who should be dead, and the obsession of a demon from another world, Shen Jiu is in no mood for his disciple's flirtation. 

Although he prefers it when Luo Binghe ignored him to pester Liu Qingge.

"To the kitchen, now."

Shen Jiu drags his brother and the bundle into the first room and closes it with an enlightening slam. Then, he drops Shen Qingqiu on the bed.

"We have to at least find you some legs." Shen Jiu hisses as he stretches out his arms. "It's tiring to carry around with you all the time."

"Being carried is also exhausting." He hisses as he tries to sit up with a pathetic dignity that should have burned by now.

Seeing someone identical to him, someone he could have been, struggling with determination not to be relegated to an object, makes something burn inside Shen Jiu's chest. Its relief and hope since even this broken version of him is fighting to recuperate under insane circumstances.

Perhaps later, when Luo Bing-ge's mess is sorted out and he has his limbs back, then Shen Jiu will encourage him to talk to Mu Qingfang to heal all the scars on his soul as well.

Servants bring hot water, and Shen Jiu encourages Shen Yuan to take a bath first before he goes back to sleep. His brother is so tired that he looks like a ghost, and Shen Jiu is afraid that the food will not arrive on time.

Meanwhile, he waits while planning tomorrow's tour. Getting to Cang Qiong Mountain is a priority, but perhaps they could split up to warn the minor sects as well. If they found a spirit sword in the city, Shen Yuan could return with Shen Qingqiu to the mountain.

He is pondering when the voice of his other self snaps him out of his thoughts.

"I'm surprised."

"About what?" Shen Jiu raises an eyebrow, intrigued.

"The arrangement of the rooms. I'm surprised that after your fit of jealousy you allowed the two of them to sleep together in the same bed." He smirks maliciously.

"I wasn't jealous."

To his relief, Shen Yuan comes out from behind the screen drying his hair with a talisman. The hot bath, instead of waking up his lazy little brother, has only served to make his expression sleepier.

"Are you going to explain to me, A-Yuan, why were you so weird when we were flying?" He asks both to change the subject and out of genuine curiosity.

"They are your suitors, not mine." He rubs his eyes as he sits between the two of them. "As your brother, I'm not going to interfere in your love life no matter how hot they are... But you should choose soon, Jiu-ge. It’s not fair for… them."

This is not working. Now the conversation is even more awkward, and from the mischievous gleam in Shen Qingqiu's eyes, his hateful other self is itching to tease him. Shen Jiu clears his throat.

"Can we talk about important matters like PREVENTING a monster from destroying our world?"

“Humm… No.” Shen Qingqiu tilts his head to look at Shen Yuan. "What do you think about the beast and the brute sleeping together?"

For some reason, that idea makes him blush.

"Ehh... Ah! The other room!" Shen Yuan bursts into hysterical laughter, causing Shen Qingqiu to narrow his eyes curiously.

"Of course, what else could this master be talking about?"

"It's not the first time. I'm sure they have a lot of experience... Just sleeping together!" Shen Yuan hastens to add seeing that Shen Jiu has clenched his fists nervously. Although his cheeks glow bright red as if a certain image had passed over his head. "They have already shared a house, surely it is not a big deal."

"Oh, I see..."

"Stop messing." Shen Jiu hisses at his other self. "I'm not jealous."

"I haven't said anything. Yet."

"And between them there is nothing. Nothing." He insists. "They hate each other."

"Don't trust the hate of the beast. Mine has gone from torturing me to wanting a harem with ridiculous copies of myself."

Suddenly, Shen Jiu's confidence becomes more fragile. After all, there is a fifth book about their entanglements where their hate turns into something more passionate. And the mysterious author is someone who knows Liu Qingge too well and has been able to consider such a likely scenario.

"A-Yuan..." Unconsciously, a faint murmur escapes him as he looks at his brother. "You've seen them while I was away. Do you think there might be something between them?"

Shen Yuan ponders his question. He doesn't seem so sleepy anymore.

"Well... Maybe my point of view isn't the most appropriate since I didn't realize recently that both of them are attracted to men, though... Fuck."

"Your language." Shen Qingqiu scolds him with a disgusted face.

"What's wrong, A-Yuan?"

"They kissed! How did I not suspect anything!?" He covers his face with both hands, stifling a groan. "They kissed! Well... Liu-shidi was the one who kissed Luo Binghe. There were a lot of tongues involved, a lot of indecent touching, and they almost broke a wall. It was quite intense. And hot..." And Shen Yuan adds to himself with a murmur "How come I didn't notice anything?"

Shen Jiu is frozen, perplexed, and confused when he hears voices on the other side of the door.

"Shizun enjoyed seeing Liu-shishu dressed as a sweet wife, perhaps he would also enjoy seeing you in a maiden's clothes."

"I'm going to kill you."

"Careful, Liu-shishu. It would be a shame if you dropped your dishes."

"Later."

That's a playful and mischievous voice that reminds him of when they rescued him. On that occasion, Luo Binghe was excessively close to Liu Qingge. Shen Jiu clenches his fists, unable to escape from a tremor that rises from his heart. It shouldn't matter to him. It is irrelevant. Just a boring demon who's also bored with him as Qi-Ge did... Shen Jiu shakes his head, trying to banish those thoughts.

"This master has rushed." He clears his throat to calm his voice. "Liu Qingge looks uncomfortable with Luo Binghe. They should sleep in separate rooms."

"Well, well..." Shen Qingqiu tilts his head without erasing his mischievous smirk. "What do you suggest then, dear cousin ? There are five of us and there are only two rooms."

"That's true!" Shen Yuan intervenes. "Jiu-Ge, do you have any preferences?"

And he opens his mouth, unable to reply.

He doesn't even understand why he's so jealous or for whom. Because someone is interested in Liu Qingge? (Who doesn't?) Or because Luo Binghe isn't paying the same attention to him anymore?

Shen Jiu is so lost in his thoughts that he doesn't notice the knowing look the other two exchange.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Shen Jiu: I don't understand myself. I can't control how I feel. I'm angry and sad, and I don't understand why.
Shen Qingqiu: You are sick.
Shen Yuan: That's having feelings.
Shen Jiu and Shen Qigqiu: The what?

Our poor Shen Jiu is so bad at understanding his feelings. He already knew the envy and now he is discovering jealousy.

In the next chapter we will understand better the strange behavior of Shen Yuan 🤭 (although I think it's pretty obvious if we remember what had happened between him and Liu Qingge before he was kidnapped~)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

The dilemma of five people and two rooms

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

If his brother were a computer, right now he would be with a blank screen and without reacting. Shen Yuan can't help but mischievously laugh up his sleeve. The words of the original Shen Qingqiu have pushed him into an especially touchy state, and Luo Binghe teasing Liu Qingge has only aggravated it. Now the five of them should be having dinner with some peace after the recent incidents, but Shen Jiu is still acting like a broken computer. Or a fussy cat that must make a choice.

And Shen Yuan is looking forward to Shen Jiu making that decision soon.

Thoughtful, Shen Yuan plays with his chopsticks. Since he came to this world, he always thought about surviving, never about love. Not even when Madame Meiyin predicted his romantic future. First, because that body and therefore that prediction belongs only to Shen Jiu. Second, all women are doomed to end up in Luo Binghe's harem. But in the end, the author himself has pointed out who each soulmate belongs to and Luo Binghe is a capricious bisexual who is no longer interested in women.

Shen Yuan just wanted to escape the plot, but over time he has found a new family. And now he's wondering if maybe it's possible to not just survive, but live without regret. Discovering the world, making his own decisions... falling in love.

What Shen Yuan is NOT thinking about is the fact that before he passed out and changed bodies he said something stupid to Liu Qingge. He is also not thinking that he has suddenly woken up in Liu Qingge's arms, too close to him and after drooling all over his clothes. And, of course, he's already forgotten about his pathetic attempts to keep a respectful distance from his brother's romantic interests.

It is better to laugh at Shen Jiu while he waits for him to decide before Shen Yuan can cultivate his own feelings. Or see how original Shen Qingqiu pretends not to be hungry until Shen Jiu threatens him to eat some. At least his pride doesn't stop him from being fed by someone identical to him.

When Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe go to their room, the atmosphere calms down a bit. Shen Yuan forgets his manners while lying on the bed as he takes a deep breath and closes his eyes. His head hurts after dying to wake up in his old body, being kidnapped by a snake, stumbling upon a plot that wasn’t in the book, escaping Luo Bing-ge's threat, and losing his face for stupid (gay) panics.

"You are not going to do anything?" Shen Qingqiu, that wicked snake, keeps bothering Shen Jiu, who hisses like a cat.

"No. I'm neither jealous nor do I care what happens between them." He growls before adding. "Furthermore, you and Luo Binghe can't be in the same room and I won't let you bother Liu Qingge either. Much less leave you alone with A-Yuan. And if I stayed here to watch over you that would mean leaving A-Yuan alone with Luo Binghe and, since he already tried to kidnap him during a qi deviation, I don't trust his intentions towards my brother."

Shen Qingqiu lets out a mocking laugh.

"In short, you've thought about it but haven't found a convenient solution."

Shen Jiu refuses to answer. Instead, he picks him up and drops him onto the bed like a sack of potatoes. Shen Qingqiu straightens up a bit to glare at him.

"One day I will regain mobility." It sounds like a threat.

"I'll be waiting for it."

"You know you're the same person, right?" Shen Yuan intervenes. "Can't you get along? Teasing between you is almost like attacking yourself."

The two exchange a look before replying at the same time, "No."

"Find. Nevermind. But please, just use words and not weapons, okay?"

No one promises him anything. Which doesn't mean much either, since they're both perfect liars. Still, Shen Yuan would be calmer if his brother at least tried. Fortunately, his intervention serves to stop them from fighting like vermin, and for a few minutes, there is peace in the room. Until a sharp blow startles them.

Shen Jiu draws Xiu Ya, Shen Yuan gets up, and Shen Qingqiu tenses, all three ready to meet any attack. However, the blow has sounded behind the wall. Shen Yuan frowns before turning to his brother.

"Jiu-Ge, that is Liu-shidi and Luo Binghe's room, right?"

Shen Jiu silently nods.

The three wait, but there are no more blows. However, there is one fact that none of the five appreciated when the innkeeper showed them the rooms: they are so close together that you can perfectly hear each other's voices.

"That hurt, Liu-shishu." Luo Binghe purrs in the same teasing tone that he used earlier to annoy him. "Next time you could push me onto the bed instead of the wall."

"Preposterous!" Liu Qingge hisses and Shen Yuan can perfectly imagine his face flushed with a mixture of anger and embarrassment.

And there is a part of him that wants to be there watching Liu Qingge holding the protagonist against the wall with the same intensity with which he kissed him once. Why didn't I suspect anything? He reproaches himself. Why didn't I realize that it's not very straight to get turned on by a kiss between men?

While he is dealing with his inner thoughts, they keep talking.

"Stop playing and take off your clothes." Liu Qingge orders and someone, perhaps Shen Qingqiu, gasps, and someone, obviously Shen Jiu, drops his fan on the ground.

"Why don't you undress me, Liu-shishu?"

That is a line that Shen Yuan has read many times that precedes... Now he is the one who is red and suffocated. Not like Shen Jiu, who is pale and wide-eyed. There is another blow, and Shen Yuan realizes that Liu Qingge has accepted the challenge. But he doesn't hear him undressing Luo Binghe, but the noise of cloth ripping impatiently. And then something that sounds like a muffled moan.

"So big." Liu Qingge clicks his tongue in disgust. "How have you been able to walk all this time?"

Shen Yuan is about to burn. He already knows that Luo Binghe's heavenly pillar has a magnificent size and thickness that only exists in fiction, but Liu Qingge sounds surprised. And very few things can surprise the War God.

"You know, Jiu-Ge? Maybe we should all just surrender to Luo Binghe's harem…" He comments with a nervous giggle as he turns to his brother.

But his brother is missing and there is an open door.

"Oh, this will be fun." Shen Qingqiu chuckles before a slamming door shakes the entire inn.

"What are you two supposed to be doing!?" They hear Shen Jiu's furious voice and how it turns into a surprised exclamation.

"Shizun?"

"Shen Jiu?"

"SINCE WHEN YOU'RE HURT, LUO BINGHE? And, shidi, isn't there a more indecent way to care for my disciple?" His voice is a curious mixture of concern and sarcasm. "Binghe, to bed. Now. Shidi, bring water."

Shen Qingqiu continues to laugh as footsteps rush past in the corridor.

"Do me a favor." Shen Yuan is startled when he speaks to him. "When that brute returns, put up a talisman and seal the room with those three inside."

"That won't make Jiu-Ge happy."

"You also want him to resolve his feelings, am I wrong?" Shen Qingqiu raises an eyebrow, daring him to contradict him. "In case you all forgot, we're up against an insane demon who has already destroyed a world and plans to do the same to this one if we don't surrender to him. I need this pathetic other me to keep his cold mind and that won't happen as long as he's blinded by his emotions."

It's a good argument, more reasonable than Shen Yuan's selfish motives. When Liu Qingge returns, he does as Shen Qingqiu has instructed. After sealing the room, Shen Yuan returns and sits on the edge of the bed. Fuck! In the end, I will sleep with the scum villain. He realizes. Although this Shen Qingqiu doesn’t pose any threat, it is still uncomfortable to be around him.

"Do you know?" Shen Yuan clears his throat to put on his most confident facade. "This wouldn't have happened if you hadn't been pestering him about this."

"I know myself and therefore I know him." Shen Qingqiu's gaze seems more focused on the wall that separates the two rooms than his eyes. "I know what I can do during an irrational impulse of jealousy. Like throwing tea at an unlucky child. I've had a lot of time to meditate on my emotions and how they marked my downfall. Perhaps everything would have been different if I had been colder. They have accused me of being indifferent, but if it were true, not so many people would have died nor would it have affected me so much."

Shen Yuan doesn't know what to say, so he sits on the other end of the bed and looks at the remains of the villain he used to hate so much.

"Do you regret it?"

He tries to shrug before turning his head and looking at him.

"I don't want to talk about the past, but with you. About you. Who are you?"

Shen Yuan trembles even though he doesn't seem to judge him like Shen Jiu did the first time they met. Since he doesn't know what his brother told him and doesn't want to contradict him, Shen Yuan plays dumb.

"What are you talking about?"

"What kind of person are you?" Suddenly, Shen Yuan realizes that he is just being curious. "What do you like? What is your favorite tea?"

"Oh. Well... I love to read. Also, I miss reading other people's adventures instead of living them."

Shen Yuan has been unconscious for too long. He is no longer sleepy despite the darkness that has dyed the sky indigo and black. And he also wants to know the person better, not the character mistreated by the narrative. So the two talk, exchanging questions and answers that smooth out the awkwardness between them.

 

 

Shen Jiu is furious after confirming that he cannot open the door. Although Shen Qingqiu can't even get out of bed by himself or handle a talisman, he knows that it was an idea of his devious other self.

Reluctantly assuming that he is trapped in that room with the other two, Shen Jiu turns his back to the door and walks toward them with purposeful steps. Luo Binghe is sitting on the bed. His smile almost deceived him that he had been injured while fighting Luo Bing-ge. And if it wasn't for Liu Qingge, he wouldn't have noticed.

"The two of you, each one in a corner of the bed." He orders them decisively. "This master will be in the middle. Is it clear?"

Liu Qingge nods, averting his gaze, and Luo Binghe's smile becomes brighter and more enthusiastic.

"Yes, shizun!"

He is a little nervous when they blow out the only candle. Although the bed is wide, not enough for three grown men. Shen Jiu doesn’t dare to move so as not to touch anyone. It's not fear. It is not that atrocious panic that affected him in his time as a disciple. It is the awkwardness of not distinguishing the nature of his feelings even though he has already slept with Liu Qingge once and even kissed him or took care of Luo Binghe's meridians without caring about his closeness. But now suddenly everything has become different and he doesn't want them to misunderstand any spontaneous touch.

Shen Jiu takes a deep breath and tries to sleep staring at the ceiling.

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Shen Yuan: Are they going to...?
Shen Qingqiu: Yes.
Shen Yuan: Too bad we can't see it, but at least we can hear them.
Shen Yuan: It's not our fault that the wall is so thin and they are so loud U///w///U
Shen Jiu: NO! We must intervene!
Shen Yuan: To join them?
Shen Jiu: To separate them!
Shen Yuan: Oh *disappointed noise*

 

As a curiosity, I had different ideas for this chapter and I chose this one for the moment bonding between Shen Qingqiu and Shen Yuan and because it was the option that you commented on the most ^^

BONUS 2
Shen Qingqiu: The only way to resolve this conflict is with a sandwich *he doesn't know what it means*
Liu Qingge: 😳
Luo Binge: 😈

We'll see in the next chapter how they wake up...

--------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

Neither can rest

Chapter Notes

Hi!!!!

I'm sorry it took me so long to write the next chapter. Recently there have been quite a few unpleasant comments about the fic's endgame and... it's exhausting. At the end, I forgot that this is a story I started writing 100% self-indulgently and I was unable to face the chapter. BUT I'M BACK!

I'm going to leave a longer note below, meanwhile, I hope you enjoy this chapter ^^

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Pretending to be asleep is a wise move in his situation. And Shen Jiu's acting is perfect. No one would differentiate him from a person deep in peaceful sleep instead of the sea of nervousness bubbling inside his chest. And perhaps in other circumstances, he would have fallen asleep because it is an excellent night, calm, not too cold but not too warm. It is almost tolerable to feel two bodies against him. Unfortunately, the presence of those two bodies is the reason for his nervousness.

His acting skills are excellent because after a while Shen Jiu notices Luo Binghe turning around. Now the half-demon is looking at him. And he gets a little closer. Shen Jiu clings to his self-control to ignore the tickle of his curls against his face.

"Liu-shishu, are you sleeping?" Luo Binghe whispers.

"Yes."

"Oh great." Despite having his eyes closed, Shen Jiu knows that Luo Binghe is smirking. "What was the show from before, Liu-shishu?"

Liu Qingge doesn’t reply. Unfortunately, his talent for acting is worse than Shen Jiu’s. Starting with the fact that he made the mistake of responding earlier and it's too late to keep quiet.

"Liu-shishu." Luo Binghe insists with an evil purr. "Were you trying to make shizun jealous?"

Shen Jiu nearly chokes. But he manages to keep his stance relaxed while Liu Qingge tenses up, hitting his arm with an elbow.

"Stop talking nonsense." He hisses. "Rather, stop talking. You're going to wake up Shen Jiu."

"You're the only one yelling." Luo Binghe points in a careful whisper. Shen Jiu can feel that Liu Qingge trembles. "So?"

Liu Qingge insists on keeping quiet. With an amused sigh, Luo Binghe sits up a bit to get closer to him and thus crush Shen Jiu with his body. The cultivator holds his breath as he forces himself to stay relaxed instead of tensing under the weight of the demon, who is poking a finger at Liu Qingge.

"Shishu... Shishu~"

"Now what do you want, annoying beast!?"

Fortunately, Shen Jiu is already awake. Otherwise, he would have been furious at Liu Qingge for yelling loud enough to be heard in the other room as well. The War God turns to face Luo Binghe and now Shen Jiu is a bit more trapped between the two of them.

"Why do you react like that, Liu-shishu? This disciple just asked a simple and innocent question."

"You never say anything innocent." Liu Qingge growls, still not lowering his voice.

Luo Binghe laughs softly before changing his stance, completely crushing Shen Qingqiu, to get even closer to Liu Qingge. A muffled noise reveals that the demon has covered his mouth with a hand.

"Tsss... Stop yelling or you'll wake up shizun." He whispers despite the fact that, first, he is lying on top of Shen Jiu, second, in the unlikely event that they hadn't startled him, Liu Qingge's abrupt jerks to break free of his grip would have already woken him up. "This disciple just wants to talk to you... Ouh."

Luo Binghe moans as Liu Qingge bites his hand. Shen Jiu no longer knows if standing between them was a bad or a great idea, only that his intuition is correct and that their tension is not something that his jealousy imagined. If he hadn't intervened, maybe that night those two would have gotten entangled in something different and he and his family would have had to listen to them behind the wall. Although it would have been an amusing sight to see on the other Shen Qingqiu's face, Shen Jiu would have killed them later for doing filthy things in his brother's presence.

And for giving him false hope.

Liu Qingge has managed to free himself from Luo Binghe's hand and has now gotten up as well to push him against the bed so that Shen Jiu is crushed between his chests as they argue in whispers over his head.

"What do you want now? Do you demons never rest?"

"Not when I have two beauties in my bed."

Shen Jiu wishes to disappear. Please don't let A-Yuan listen to this , he thinks as Liu Qingge pulls Luo Binghe's hair, causing him to moan shamelessly again.

"Tell me what you want and let me sleep." Liu Qingge hisses, this time lowering his voice slightly.

"I wanted to thank Liu-shishu."

"And you can't wait until tomorrow!?"

"Well, first I wanted to know if Liu-shishu was provoking shizun."

"I'm not you!"

"Liu-shishu..." Luo Binghe sighs. "Your voice."

Liu Qingge grunts under his breath.

"I'm not you." He repeats, this time in a more measured tone. "I would never pursue another person in such a cowardly strategy. I respect Shen Jiu too much."

"But would you kiss another person?" Luo Binghe teases him, making him fidget uncomfortably. "What did that mean, Liu-shishu? That you don't respect Shen Yuan or that you wanted to kiss me?"

"Didn't you want to thank me!?" Liu Qingge is as terrible at changing the subject as he is at whispering. "You already have. Now sleep."

Luo Binghe's laugh reverberates in his chest. Shen Jiu can feel it behind his back.

"You don't even know what I want to thank you for."

"Probably up to no good."

"Well, this disciple is grateful to Liu-shishu for allowing us the current situation." Shen Jiu can also feel Liu Qingge's tension. After all, he has his head resting on his heart and can hear his restless heartbeat. "But this disciple wanted to thank you for caring about my condition. It made me feel... happy."

"I'm starting to regret it."

Luo Binghe laughs. Leaning towards the War God, Shen Jiu ends up spinning as well until he is completely trapped with his face buried in Liu Qingge's chest and his back against the demon's.

"This disciple liked the kiss, Liu-shishu." He whispers.

It's a few words, capable of further altering Liu Qingge's pulse and making Shen Jiu hold his breath.

"Sleep." The cultivator growls. "It's a miracle you didn't wake up Shen Jiu."

"Don't worry about it, Liu-shishu. This disciple also masters dream manipulation."

"DID YOU FORCE HIM TO SLEEP!?"

"No, but I can tell when Shizun wakes up."

Shen Jiu tenses up. Luo Binghe just told him that he knows he has never been asleep in the first place. There were never any secrets in that conversation, rather his intention was for him to listen to them. Furious and embarrassed, Shen Jiu breaks his mobility to elbow him. Luo Binghe laughs softly before reaching out and hugging him from behind.

"Liu-shishu..." He keeps talking this time with a less mischievous voice. "Shizun likes you. I know that. And... I think I also like Liu-shishu."

"Now what are you talking about?"

"This disciple suspects that shizun feelings toward me aren't entirely negative either."

It sounds like a question, one that Shen Jiu doesn't know how to answer or what to answer, so he remains quiet and still between them.

"That would be great because I love shizun too."

"You contradict yourself, beast."

"I'm not. But I hope shizun is better at math than Liu-shishu."

Shen Jiu absently nods. He has indeed understood Luo Binghe's message, although it does not clear his feelings, but rather stirs them up. At least it calm the voice of his stupid jealousy, They both came back, he forces himself to remember. But Shen Jiu is not used to being loved and he still trembles with fear that it is a false affection or fleeting or doomed to disappear. Instinctively, Shen Jiu hugs Liu Qingge's clothes.

"Huh?" The cultivator stiffens. "I think he's waking up."

"Oh, don't worry, Liu-shishu. Shizun is still dreaming. It must be a nice dream." He adds in a melodious voice.

Shen Qingqiu turns long enough to elbow him again, then lays his head on his chest. Much to his chagrin, Luo Binghe's ample chest is more comfortable than he had imagined. Guessing his intentions, the demon moves to push Liu Qingge against them, giving him an excuse to sleep lying between them. The cultivator makes a move to move away, but Luo Binghe stops him.

"Stay still or you'll wake up Shen Jiu."

Liu Qingge has no choice but to obey.

 

 

The next morning, Shen Yuan waits impatiently for the door to the other room to open. He still doesn't know whether or not to confess to his brother that the walls remained just as thin as before, something that the others forget, and they were able to hear a good part of a certain conversation. Fuck , Shen Yuan can't get over how pornographic Luo Binghe's moans were when Liu Qingge did… Well, he doesn't know what he did, but the demon liked it.

Unexpectedly, Shen Qingqiu seems much livelier that morning and doesn't object with his usual stubborn pride when Shen Yuan offers to fix his hair.

"Do you know?" Shen Yuan comments with feigned nonchalance. "I'm beginning to suspect that you're playing matchmaker to take over Jiu-Ge's house."

"Oh. How is that?"

"You're trying to make him the wife of another Peak Lord or a Demon Lord! You're clearly trying to appropriate his title."

"It's also my title."

He hasn’t denied it.

Shen Yuan snorts, still wary when Shen Qingqiu tenses up.

"What's going on?" Shen Yuan asks as he stands up.

And finally, he discovers a tiny green snake on the floor of the room.

"It’s probably a coincidence." Shen Yuan stammers. "Right?"

Chapter End Notes

Well...

I'm the kind of writer who only has a general idea in her head. I started this fic with the intention of writing YuanLiuJiu, however, the plot metamorphosed into the current story and Luo Binghe joined the equation. I understand that this has disappointed many people who were looking for Liushen and/or Liujiu. Sorry. I'm terrible at planning, especially on such a long story.

Recently, I finally found a possible ideal ending. It will be a surprise, but I think it will be the ending that you will all like the most. (Please! Don't ask me! It's a surprise but I also don't know if I will change it depending on the development of the final arc) I only ask for a little faith. Or, if you still have doubts, you can abandon the fic and give it another chance when the ending is already written >_< I don't care if you abandon the story either because it isn't what you were looking for or because you don't like some ships. It is very valid! But please don't be like Peerless Cucumber. Behind the computer there is a real person and some comments are very demoralizing.

About the controversy of the ship tags... I have already been asked why orLuo Binghe appears instead of Luo Binghe since it can generate confusion due to the evil Luo Binghe. I wrote it months ago thinking that it is the description that best fits Luo Binghe's behavior and I have kept it because I think that people who search for those tags might like this fic but I'm not so sure anymore TTwTT Maybe it would be better to leave only the tag of the Shen Brothers?????

BONUS
Luo Binghe, proud: We talked about our feelings UwU
Shen Yuan: YOU talked about your feelings, the others haven't said anything
Luo Binghe, sighing: I know. But like my second shizun said once: Liu-shishu and first shizun are two fucking tsunderes.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

★ Twitter

The one who supports kidnapping

Chapter Notes

This chapter has cost me more than I expected due to the stress of adult life 😭❤️

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Within the room, there is a tension capable of destroying entire cities. Still, Zhuzhi-lang resists the pressure of five wary gazes that scrutinize all his movements, his expression, and even the snakes peeking out of his sleeves. Shen Yuan, sheltered by the protection of a Demon Lord, a War God, and an Overprotective Big Brother, allows himself the luxury of hiding behind the other three. Although all his memories of Zhuzhi-lang are blurred, since he always ends up either unconscious or inside the mouth of a giant snake, Shen Yuan is aware of the danger and does not relax.

Zhuzhi-lang lifts his head, triggering an avalanche of tense postures and hands on the hilts of swords ready to be drawn. The innocence in his wide eyes does not match the suspicion that beats in Shen Yuan's heart.

"You can relax. This one would never hurt any Master Shen." He asserts with a determination that lights up his features.

Shen Yuan believes in him, however, his brother clicks his tongue disdainfully.

"Perhaps you do not wish to harm us, however, your uncle had no qualms about sacrificing my brother."

"Oh, about that..." His voice trails off, affected by embarrassment. "He never intended to hand over Master Shen, but to get the sword and then get rid of his opponent."

"You just admitted that your uncle is a liar, how do you expect us to believe you?"

"Because I am not lying when I promise that I owe Master Shen a debt and I will do my best to save you. The three of you." He adds vehemently. "And you need us. Both to escape the clutches of the demon who looks like my lord's son but isn't and to survive when the two realms merge."

"We have no intention of letting that happen." Liu Qingge intervenes with an angry growl.

"With all due respect, you are at a disadvantage. None of your weapons can rival Xin Mo and you cannot take on my lord's false son and protect the three Master Shen at the same time. Furthermore, we will not oppose him since we almost share the same goal."

"That is not a wise move." Shen Jiu says. "Our security is incompatible with the triumph of that demon."

Zhuzhi-lang pauses thoughtfully.

"Then, it's even worse for you: you can't fight him and protect all the Shen Masters while we prevent you from succeeding. Both realms must unite, that is Junshang's wish. And only the Shen Masters deserve to survive."

Zhuzhi-lang's words infuriate Luo Binghe and Liu Qingge, who seem ready to draw their swords and challenge him right now. However, Shen Jiu leaning his fan against the demon's chest and Shen Yuan holding his shidi's sleeve prevent bloodshed. Although none of those gestures is enough to calm their rage. However, Zhuzhi-lang is right: they are stuck at a difficult crossroads where all paths seem to lead to disaster.

Shen Jiu sighs before taking a step towards Zhuzhi-lang. Ever since the demon snake appeared, the five of them have kept their distance. And now Shen Jiu breaks that cautious rule, though he doesn't get too close to the demon, just close enough to grab all of his attention and command his presence. Since he has perfected the art of being threatening without the need to shout or use violence. Just one glare is enough for Zhuzhi-lang to pale a bit.

"Let this master guide you in a fairly accurate prediction of what may happen in the next half shichen." His voice is cold and calm, with the power to go through the skin and become a chill. "First of all, this master has no interest in fighting inside this inn and causing unnecessary destruction. So we'll just assume without actually doing what will happen, okay? Right now, you're at a disadvantage."

Zhuzhi-lang frowns, sharing the same confusion as Shen Yuan.

"Perhaps." He concedes. "But I am not your enemy."

"You are as long as you oppose our intentions." Shen Jiu hits his hand with the fan with a thud that startles even Shen Yuan. Each hit accompanies his next words, sharp and furious. "Maybe you don't want us to be hurt and you won't hurt us personally, but do you think that the death of our friends and family will make us happy? Haven't you appreciated that the destruction of our world will only bring us suffering? That way no debt is paid, Zhuzhi-lang, you will only make us regret giving you our help."

The weight of that truth makes Zhuzhi-lang open his eyes, confused and surprised. Before he gets over his daze, Shen Jiu continues speaking.

"As this master was saying, right now you can't defeat us. And, more importantly, you can't escape either. So I'd appreciate it if you didn't try, understood?" He tilts his head and Shen Yuan sees from the side that he is smiling evilly. "Despite your twisted sense of duty, this master appreciates your attempt to come and convince us, so I have no intention of killing or hurting you either. For now. However, I must point out that you have made numerous mistakes: we are not alone. We have the support of the Cang Qiong Mountain Sect and probably the Huan Hua Palace as well. We can gather the cultivation world, and as a general of Tianlang-jun, you must remember the consequences of our power."

Zhuzhi-lang nods. He is rigid and has clenched his fists, affected perhaps by terrible memories.

"You have also not appreciated that we are not defenseless, but that we have certain resources. Like a sword capable of competing against Xin Mo."

"That's not possible..."

"In the same way that there are two Luo Binghe, there are also two Xin Mo. I hope that an identical sword meets your requirements for a weapon worthy of rivaling Xin Mo." However, Shen Jiu does not recognize that none of them want to risk using Xin Mo for the excessive price it demands. "Regarding your role, thanks to your hypothetical defeat we would also avoid the pressure of possible kidnapping and this master assumes that Tianlang-jun will not sacrifice his nephew either. Is it clear now?"

He is smirking when he turns to Luo Binghe.

"Perhaps my dear disciple has brought immortal binding cables? Or do you know another method to neutralize a demon?" His voice sounds sweet and that is precisely why it is so uncomfortable.

Everyone, absolutely everyone, tenses at what his words imply.

"Shen Jiu..." Liu Qingge warns him. "What are you planning now?"

"This master believes that it was obvious: for the sake of our safety and that of the world, we must take a hostage." He turns to Zhuzhi-lang. "Don't move. I have no intention of destroying the inn and no matter how much you resist, you can't beat us right now. It's quicker and less annoying if you accept your defeat."

Shen Yuan sighs. He doesn't know if it reassures him or not that despite so many kidnappings, his brother hasn't changed his attitude.

"We're not taking that snake with us." Liu Qingge hisses.

"We're taking Zhuzhi-lang as a guest . The other cultivators will have no choice but to act if they see that Tianlang-jun's general has returned. Or how do you expect to justify the threat? No one will believe us if we speak of another world and another Luo Binghe, but they will accuse ours."

"With justified reasons." He grumbles, glancing sideways at Luo Binghe.

"Well, I can't deny that, but it is incoherent to say that we are going to defeat Luo Binghe with Luo Binghe's help."

"You're going to use Junshang as a scapegoat?" Zhuzhi-lang hisses angrily as he straightens up.

"It is not a lie: perhaps your uncle doesn't have the sword nor will he be the one who attacks us, but it is also his wish and you have recognized that he plans to support our enemy from the shadows. Now, stop trying to flee. You're a valuable hostage and I wouldn't like to damage this inn."

 

 

"Kidnapping is not always the solution, Jiu-ge." Shen Yuan tells him a quarter of an hour later, after destroying a part of the inn and trapping a raging snake demon with the ease Shen Jiu had predicted. "What do you plan to do with him? The other cultivators will want to kill him!"

And Shen Yuan is not so heartless as to push him to certain death.

Shen Jiu rests the tip of his fan on his lips.

"Zhuzhi-lang is not stupid. Although he has resisted, he has allowed us to catch him because he is interested in staying by our side and spying on our movements. See those little snakes? With their help, he will inform Tianlang-jun of our movements no matter how much we keep him locked up. I'd rather see my enemy and monitor the information they receive than allow them to move in the shadows."

Then, he smiles before patting him on the head and rejoining the rest.

Chapter End Notes

This fic has two types of readers: those who did not believe that there would be no more kidnappings and those who were relieved. I did not lie: there are no more shen-kidnappings >:D

!!!!!
I'd like to start publishing an original transmigration novel online next month ^^ If you're interested, you can stay tuned for news on my Twitter or subscribe to my ao3 account. It will be enemies to lovers between a malevolent shixiong x grumpy shidi. Or what happen when MC transmigrates in a book as a secondary villain and chooses to become the final boss instead of pampering the protagonist ÙwÚ

The body of the Shen Qingqiu who almost stole Shen Qingqiu's body may be Shen Qingqiu's new body

Chapter Notes

I've been so stuck with this chapter for sooooooooo long 😭😭😭😭 Sorry for the delay! There was a crucial detail in these last chapters and I didn't like any of the scenes that I wrote😭😭😭😭

But I finally found the right words to channel the plot!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The presence of his unexpected guest changes all of Shen Jiu's plans. His initial intention was to send Shen Yuan and his other self to the sect to warn Yue Qingyuan of the danger while the three of them alerted the other sects. However, Zhuzhi-lang is dangerous, even tied up, and not worth the risk.

“Xiao Jiu… I’m glad you’re back.”

Yue Qingyuan's smile was part relief and part stress. Their sect leader is unable to hide his astonishment at their sudden arrival after the mysterious kidnapping, dragging a demon he had recognized as an iconic figure from the past to lock him up in the Lingxi Caves.

Shen Jiu almost feels remorse when he looks into his eyes.

"I have to talk to you."

Yue Qingyuan takes a deep breath. The insignificant detail that he has not corrected is a warning that he is not going to say anything good to him.

 

 

Shen Yuan gazes with a lump in his throat at what has been his third body for a short time. Right now the body is lying on a bed and Mu Qingfang explains that he has been preserving it ever since his soul left him.

“At first, it was a precaution since we didn't know what had happened to you. If the two Shen-shixiong hadn't disappeared as well, then I would have feared that it had been a rejection of your soul by the body created by the seeds. I once made the mistake of giving you up for dead, so I chose to protect the body from rotting." Mu Qingfang pauses. "But now..."

His gaze stops at Shen Qingqiu. The original had no choice but to accept Shen Yuan carrying him to Qian Cao Peak after receiving an invitation from Mu Qingfang. And Shen Yuan was desperate to stay distracted while Liu Qingge and Shen Jiu are busy making plans with Yue Qingyuan and Luo Binghe has gone to mobilize the Huan Hua Palace against Tianlang-jun.

"I want that body." Shen Qingqiu acknowledges. There is certain greed in his eyes, like a child who has been offered a luxurious toy.

Mu Qingfang nods.

"I had assumed so. Although Shen-ershixiong has created a precedent, transferring a soul from one body to another is a delicate process and one that is not documented in any medical treatise. I will investigate." He promises Shen Qingqiu, who had already pursed his lips in disgust. “This body is similar to the one we are cultivating, so I should find a connection to get your soul into this body instead of waiting several years for another to be ready, but… It is still a risky process. Shen-ershixiong's soul has too easily left this body to return to the original, are you sure you want to risk it?"

"Mu-shidi, between a dependent eternity with no legs or even arms and the promise of a solution, which would you choose?"

Shen Yuan narrows his eyes suspiciously. He's not entirely sure if this is the first time Shen Qingqiu acknowledges his martial brother relationship with Mu Qingfang, but he suspects it. Now that he has his tongue back, Shen Qingqiu is being strangely polite to everyone, which confirms his suspicion: he plans to unseat Shen Jiu from his position at some point in the future.

Perhaps returning his limbs will have horrible consequences, but even Shen Yuan recognizes that his current state is a terrifying nightmare.

The door opens and a Ning Yingying appears who is not wearing the green uniform of Qing Jing Peak, but in more mature clothes. Shen Yuan looks away, uncomfortable in the presence of another character from the original book. Another of his mistakes was considering that the relationship between Luo Binghe and Ning Yingying was a tender childhood friends to lovers. If that were true, Luo Binghe would not have married a hundred more women or given a higher position in his harem to her instead of those with whom he shared his hatred towards Shen Qingqiu. A significant detail that should have made him suspicious of Luo Binghe's true feelings.

After cupping her hands towards them, Ning Yingying raises her head.

"The arrivals from Tianyi Overlook and Zhao Hua Temple have arrived." She reports. "Yue-shibo has requested that all Peak Lords be present."

"Understood, thanks." Shen Qingqiu is the first to respond.

Although his warm smile may be directed at his favorite disciple and the only one who understands what it means to leave your world, Shen Yuan trembles. Shen Qingqiu, the same annoying character who shunned the sect's social conventions, is now eager to go to that meeting. Too bad that it depends on him to be transported.

At least Mu Qingfang has gotten him a xianxia wheelchair, which is more comfortable and less humiliating than being carried.

The three of them head to Qiong Ding Peak. Along the way, they meet some abbots and nuns of Zhao Hua Temple. Shen Yuan walks over to greet Monk Wu Chen, whom he remembers from Jinlan City.

"I can't believe you two are different people!" He exclaims, mistaking Shen Qingqiu for Shen Jiu, even though technically he's right. "Which one did I meet in Jinlan City?"

"It was me." Shen Yuan smiles. "How are your wounds?"

"Perfectly."

Although sower’s rot caused him to lose his legs, Monk Wu Chen is now on his feet thanks to two prosthetics. Looking at them, Shen Qingqiu's eyes widened with desire. Shen Yuan hums, amused at his reaction. Perhaps Mu Qingfang can prepare some prosthetic limbs for him as well as a temporary measure while they sort out the alternate body.

The other option hasn't been mentioned by anyone, but it's pretty obvious: demon blood.

Shen Yuan shivers as he remembers all that that implies. Saying goodbye with a polite smile to Monk Wu Chen, he hijacks the wheelchair to get away from the crowd.

"You are not going in the direction of Qiong Ding Peak." Although Shen Qingqiu's voice is calm, there is a hint of panic in his words. "Don't you want anyone to hear us? Or don't you want anyone else to see me?"

Shen Qingqiu's contempt for himself is terrifyingly obvious, but it's not what he's worried about right now. Shen Yuan stops in the middle of the Rainbow Bridge and takes a deep breath before speaking.

"I know how you got your eye and tongue back." His silence is illuminating. "I also know how Zhuzhi-lang found us so quickly. When were you going to tell us that he gave you his blood?"

"It wasn't necessary for a modicum of intelligence and I'm relieved that you noticed, Yuan-di."

Annoyed by his jarring calmness, Shen Yuan walks to stand in front of him and crosses his arms.

"You have a disadvantage right now! Only Zhuzhi-lang can remove his blood from your body and I don't think he will. He can control you."

"It was a bet." Shen Qingqiu acknowledges. "I didn't have much of a choice either, that poor snake was horrified at my appearance. But I accepted it because they offered me something priceless and I’m not the object of his obsession, but collateral damage. Furthermore, his desperate attempt to protect the two of you will never outshine Luo Binghe's hatred."

Shen Yuan massages his temple. Although he understands Shen Qingqiu's logic, his decision is still a headache.

"You have put us in danger." He accuses him.

"You can fix it if you give me another body."

Shen Qingqiu is just as arrogant and shameless as his brother, but this time his trick doesn't work. Shen Yuan snorts before grabbing the wheelchair again.

"We're going to the Lingxi Caves. Either you convince Zhuzhi-lang to take his blood from you or I'll leave you in there with him."

Shen Qingqiu grits his teeth like a cat that has been scolded.

Chapter End Notes

Shen Yuan: Shen Qingqiu would probably betray us.
Shen Jiu, nods satisfied: Good boy. I too would betray myself.

――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

★ Twitter

Monsters understand other monsters

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Shen Yuan is late.

Shen Jiu frowns, more worried than upset. Mu Qingfang has been the last of the Peak Lords to arrive. The twelve have gathered before receiving the delegations from the other sects. There are still some differences between them on how to handle the situation. Lying about the identity of the Luo Binghe from the other world may backfire if they find out the truth later, but revealing what happened in the other world might ruin his Luo Binghe's future forever. Although Shen Qingqiu won't justify his attitude in the past few years, he also can't judge him when he has done worse.

Shen Yuan is one of those who opposes putting all the blame on Tianlang-jun. Too bad that Shen Yuan is late. With a nod, Shen Jiu motions for Yue Qingyuan to invite the rest of the cultivators inside. They shouldn't make them wait much longer. So far, Shen Jiu has managed to convince them to give ambiguous answers, mentioning Tianlang-jun without going into specific details. That way, they won't be lying and they can complete the information later. The first to arrive are the monks and nuns from Zhao Hua Temple, then Tianyi Overlook. When they are all gathered, Luo Binghe appears with the Huan Hua Palace. His presence is awkward and that is why he has arrived last.

All cultivators are aware that Luo Binghe has appropriated that sect with despicable methods. Everyone knows that he is in league with the demons and they already consider Huan Hua Palace a demonic sect, although very few know the truth about his heritage. Rumors portray Luo Binghe as an ambitious man who abandoned virtuous cultivation to pursue demonic paths after losing the Alliance Conference.

In retrospect, Shen Jiu hates that his disciple hadn't been more subtle in the past. His arrogance has put him in a difficult situation and he knows that it will be difficult to convince others that they need a demon cultivator to face the demons themselves. Fortunately, Tianlang-jun's name is powerful and evokes terrible memories. Despite the tension among those who have gathered, once Shen Jiu begins to speak, the cultivators forget about Luo Binghe to listen only to his voice.

When Shen Jiu finishes, everyone starts talking at the same time. There are many questions and fears, and although he possesses the answer to most (How has Tianlang-jun been freed? What kind of power does he want to use to merge the two realms?), he remains silent despite some of his martial siblings judging him with their glares. Liu Qingge stands silently with his arms crossed and a frown on his face, keeping an eye on Luo Binghe. While Yue Qingyuan smiles and moderates to prevent the discussion from getting too heated.

"Tianlang-jun..." Monk Wu Chen of the Zhao Hua Temple mutters. And there is something in his voice, in his contemplative gaze, that captures Shen Jiu's interest.

It is a feeling that beats rapidly in his chest. Despite his calm posture, he is nervous when he turns to the monk to goad him into speaking with curious questions.

Little by little, Monk Wu Chen begins to unravel the story of Tianlang-jun and Su Xiyan. Shen Jiu remembers some details, though not all of them. But now everything is more evident when he raises his head and looks at Luo Binghe, a half-demon who should not have been born. And from his expression, Liu Qingge also seems to have noticed.

 

 

"Oh, Master Shen and Master Shen. Why the pleasure?"

Zhuzhi-lang raises his head when they arrive. Despite his sincere smile and sparkling eyes, Shen Yuan is not fooled by the danger posed by the demon general. He also can't forget that he and his uncle are planning a massacre that only they would survive. Shen Yuan pushes the wheelchair in front of the demon. Shen Qingqiu is still upset and doesn't look at either of them, although he can't escape.

"Release my… family member from your blood." Shen Yuan hesitates, as the relationship between the three of them is still unclear and there is nothing official at the moment.

"Release?" Zhuzhi-lang blinks in obvious confusion. "You make it sound like I'm chaining him with my blood when my only intention is to help Master Shen."

"You will help him by removing your blood." He insists.

"I doubt it, Master Shen. This one's help can improve Master Shen's recovery." Despite the respect in his voice, his gaze turns colder, similar to Shen Jiu's when he used to scold him. "Master Shen's injuries are severe and no cultivation remedy will work."

"But with your blood, you can track him down. And manipulate him." Shen Yuan adds bitterly, remembering the helplessness when Luo Binghe controlled his body like a puppet.

That accusation makes Zhuzhi-lang straighten up indignantly.

"I would never do it!" He hisses. "That was never my intention!"

"Maybe it wasn't, but have you considered the possibility of making him dependent on your blood?"

"And what is the problem?" Zhuzhi-lang's confusion seems sincere. "Even my current appearance depends on Junshang. If it wasn't for his powers, I would be the horrendous creature you met in the Bailu Forest right now..."

"But...!"

"Yuan-di, stop." Shen Qingqiu finally speaks with a determination that makes Shen Yuan turn to him. "I don't care if his intentions towards me are harmful as long as they are useful to me."

That's the problem! Shen Yuan wants to burst into tears.

"You don't need to sacrifice yourself, stupid Shen Qingqiu! We don't want anyone else to hurt you, even with the best intentions. You're a member of my family now, is that clear to you? We're going to help you. No one will hand you over to Luo Binghe, nor will we abandon you." 

Something seems to break inside Shen Qingqiu.

"But the only hideous creature here is me..."

"That is not true, Master Shen!" Zhuzhi-lang intervenes, tensing despite his restraints. "Master Shen is as beautiful as the other two. And I promise I'm not lying because I can understand how you feel. My real appearance is a deformed snake. I also don't have arms or legs, I couldn't speak either. I'm useless, contemptible, and grotesque." Zhuzhi-lang looks down as he sighs. "I understand your wish better than anyone. That's why I wanted to help you, Master Shen, even if you weren't one of the two who helped Junshang and me in the past."

Shen Yuan doesn't want to be fooled by any snake, but his heart starts to waver. His sincerity seems authentic and consistent. Zhuzhi-lang has managed to bring tears to Shen Qingqiu's eyes. He takes a deep breath, trying to control his emotions. But he fails. The original villain is crying, and Shen Yuan subconsciously moves to hug him.

"We'll all help you, okay? I know you don't like promises, but we'll all do our best to get you back on your feet. You have more options, don't choose the riskiest one." Shen Yuan straightens without letting him go to meet Zhuzhi-lang's eyes. "And if his offer is sincere, then he shouldn't mind taking his blood from you and offering it back to you under better circumstances. Right?"

The demon snake nods cautiously.

Chapter End Notes

I've been thinking about the parallels between Zhuzhi-lang and the original Shen Qingqiu for a long time...

――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

★ Twitter

They’re getting closer to the truth

Chapter Notes

I was going to write this chapter last Friday, but I caught covid and it has been a horrible weekend. Now that I'm better I've finally managed to concentrate on writing UwU

See the end of the chapter for more notes

"What are you doing here?"

Shen Yuan is startled upon hearing his brother's voice. Shen Jiu stands with his arms crossed at the cave entrance, his perfect features twisted into a scowl. His gaze stops first at the two of them and then at Zhuzhi-lang. Even the demon general is unable to remain unruffled by his scrutiny. Zhuzhi-lang gulps, uncomfortable, but unable to flee, while Shen Qingqiu lowers his head so his other self can’t discover his reddened eyes and the signs of tears on his face.

"A-Yuan, keep our relative away from our guest. You know it's not safe." He pauses before walking forward and standing in front of the demon. "Why does your lord want revenge? The cultivators indeed sealed him under a mountain, but that was because he intended to conquer us."

Although for once Shen Jiu's words are not malicious but curious, Zhuzhi-lang tenses so sharply that his bonds snap without breaking.

"Junshang would never!" He hisses, his voice turning to poison. "That lying rat betrayed Junshang! Conquer, you say Master Shen? You cultivators had a chance only because Junshang went with no company other than this one and armed only with a flute."

Zhuzhi-lang's breath grows ragged. Although Shen Yuan doesn’t know what they are discussing, he has vague knowledge thanks to the book to draw some conclusions, but not enough. He gazes at his brother, intrigued by his calm, almost pensive expression. Until he sighs, shaking his head as he rubs the bridge of his nose.

"Thank you for your honesty, Zhuzh-lang. This master appreciates it... Because if it weren't for the son of those two being in front of this master, I too would have made the mistake of believing in a story with so many loopholes."

"What are you talking about, Jiu-ge?" Shen Yuan frowns, confused.

Hearing him, he turns his head to give him a mischievous smirk.

"You would know if you hadn't missed the meeting."

That's unfair, but also his fault so Shen Yuan lowers his head in shame as he shifts his weight from one foot to the other.

“What are you talking about, Master Shen?” Zhuzhi-lang narrows his eyes suspiciously.

“Your version of events contradicts the information they received. Lucky for you, this master is cynical enough to question human ambitions. You consider Su Xiyan, Luo Binghe's mother, a treacherous rat. But the Old Palace Master told the cultivators that Tianlang-jun was a threat who planned to conquer us and used his charms to entice a virtuous disciple." Shen Jiu fiddles with his fan. "But no one knows what became of Su Xiyan after Tianlang-jun was sealed under a mountain. And this master is one of the few who was aware that their son was among us listening to everything they said. A child that no one theoretically wanted and has survived despite everything."

"Shizun."

Until then Shen Yuan has not realized that Luo Binghe is at the entrance of the caves. Darkness covers his features, preventing him from figuring out his expression. Luo Binghe hides his emotions and his voice is so neutral that it is suspicious. Although Shen Yuan hasn’t been to the meeting, he has heard enough to reach certain conclusions. And he can imagine that hearing about his parents hasn't been pleasant for Luo Binghe even if he is acting normal now.

"Now what, Luo Binghe?" Shen Jiu turns to him, though he is too suspicious not to keep an eye on Zhuzhi-lang.

"When... this one lost control of Xin Mo." His voice sounds embarrassed for a moment before returning to his calm tone. “Even though my thoughts were a mess, the trigger was when the Old Palace Master announced that he would do his best to lock up both shizuns. But when I conquered the Old Palace Master… he was gone. He has been missing for the last few years. I didn't care because both shizuns are more important to me, but now I can't stop thinking about how strange it is. He is the only one who could give us the explanations we want since he was the one who sent Su Xiyan to approach Tianlang-jun.."

"Hmm… Sounds suspicious. What do you think, Zhuzhi-lang?" Shen Qingqiu gazes at the demon with a gleam of interest in his eyes. "You can't deny that there is something wrong with that story. Too bad the Old Palace Master has disappeared. This master has a feeling that he might tell us something quite interesting. Luo Binghe?"

"Yes, Shizun?"

"Send some of your informants to look for clues from the Old Palace Master."

"You offend this disciple." Despite the darkness, Shen Yuan recognized the demon's smile. "I've already done it."

"Good."

"What would shizun want this one to do when he finds the trail of the Old Palace Master?"

"Whatever you wish. This master has no interest in this matter, and neither do the cultivators." Shen Jiu shrugs. "It's about your origin after all, so it's up to you to choose what to do once you find that coward. It's unusual that he's been missing for years. He knows something, that’s for sure, but demanding the truth or remaining in the dark is not my decision, but yours."

With a nod, Shen Jiu motions for them to leave the cave. Shen Yuan sighs before dragging the wheelchair to the exit. Although he would like to ask Shen Qingqiu and Luo Binghe if they are alright, he remains silent in the end. In the sunlight, the two seem calm as ever.

"Well, are you finally going to explain to me what's going on?" He asks his brother.

However, it is the other Shen Qingqiu who responds with an amused snort.

"Isn't it obvious? The two of you have baited Zhuzhi-lang. Good strategy." He acknowledges with approval that borders on pride. "You have pointed out the inconsistencies in the story to arouse his curiosity, pointing to a person that you consider suspicious and who is missing.
