Furthermore, you have clarified that no one else is interested in the truth or will investigate it, but the affected should decide whether they want to find out or not... You didn't force Zhuzhi-lang to investigate what happened to the Old Palace Master, but I wouldn't be surprised if he did it to pay off his debt to Tianlang-jun."

"Indeed." Shen Jiu acknowledges. "It's pretty creepy that you can guess my thoughts so easily."

“So...” Shen Yuan cuts them off before the two of them engage in passive-aggressive conversation. "Are you manipulating Zhuzhi-lang into going to find the Old Palace Master? Why?"

“Because we already have enough facing Luo Bing-ge. This might keep those two out of the conflict, which will be a relief. We couldn't survive so many enemies while a crazy demon tries to merge the two realms. "

"And why haven't you told me anything? I could help you."

"...because you weren't at the meeting."

Shen Yuan clicks his tongue. Even so, as a reader, he has information that could help them better understand the plot.

"And you have no interest in finding out what happened?"

Because now curiosity burns in his bones after hearing their theories, however, both Shen Jiu and Luo Binghe exchange a look before shrugging.

"Not really."

"I do." Shen Yuan hands his brother the wheelchair, so abruptly that Shen Qingqiu hisses in protest, and runs off.

Using his qi, he speeds across the rainbow bridge while searching for Shang Qinghua. Once he finds him, Shen Yuan grabs his sleeve and drags him away from the other cultivators.

"You author!"

"What do you want? What has happened now?"

"I never thought I'd tell you this but I need spoilers."

Over the next eight minutes, Shang Qinghua explains another of PIDW's hidden plots.

"YOU FILTHY SNAKE WHO SOLD OUT FOR MONEY. HOW COULD YOU DO THIS TO US READERS????? I CAN'T BELIEVE YOU MADE US BELIEVE SHEN QINGQIU DESERVED TO BE CASTRATED WHEN THE ONLY BASTARD WAS THE OLD PALACE MASTER. YOU ROBBED US. GIVE ME BACK MY MONEY AND MY SOUL!!!!!!!"

Shen Yuan takes a deep breath to calm down. But with this information, a new plan begins to form in his head. Shen Jiu intends to distract Tianlang-jun and Zhuzhi-lang and get more margin against Luo Bing-ge, however, thanks to this discovery he can try to make them their ally.

"I hope you're not hiding anything else from me." He growls, glaring at Shang Qinghua.

"... honestly, I don't remember."

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Shen Yuan: I can't believe you made me believe Shen Qingqiu deserved to be castrated ò__ó
Shang Qinghua: That's not my fault!????? But yours????????

Shen Yuan has been too long under Shen Jiu's influence

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

"I never imagined that you, precisely you, would dare to kidnap me."

"Now you're being dramatic."

“Oh? Then what is your explanation for sneaking me out against my will from Qian Cao Peak in the middle of the night?”

"..."

"I'm waiting."

"I need your help."

Shen Qingqiu snorts, sarcastic and dismissive, at the possibility of someone needing his help.

"What have you kidnapped me for?"

"It's not a kidnapping!"

Ok, Shen Yuan acknowledges that the situation is a bit fishy and anyone else could draw the wrong conclusions. But that's a decision that Shen Jiu would have approved of, which is quite ironic since he hasn't told anyone, least of all Shen Jiu. But desperate situations call for desperate measures so Shen Yuan continues to drag the wheelchair through the shadows of the sect.

"Don't talk so loud or you'll alert the disciples on guard."

"What's the problem? You don't want them to know you've kidnapped me?"

"You're being especially irritating today."

"Well, I was trying to sleep after a day that hasn't been good." Shen Qingqiu cocks his head. "Oh? Are we visiting Zhuzhi-lang again? Are you that desperate to take his blood from me?"

"You only got the first part right." Shen Yuan stops. They have arrived at an inhospitable and lonely place in the middle of the Rainbow Bridge. “I have discovered the truth of Su Xiyan and Tianlang-jun using unorthodox methods that I cannot explain to anyone. In the end, Jiu-ge was right to blame the Old Palace Master and with my new information, I know that Tianlang- Jun will want revenge once he finds out what really happened."

"Although this master is a genius, I cannot understand why you have disturbed my sleep."

"I have various problems: First, Tianlang-jun must believe me even though I have no proof to show him. Second, we are not interested in him taking revenge on the Old Palace Master, but in helping us protect our world. You are like Jiu-ge."

"More precisely: we are the same person. Keep talking."

"With your negotiating skills, I trust that you will be able to use the information I will give you to convince Tianlang-jun to help us against Luo Bing-ge."

"You want me to blackmail Tianlang-jun."

"That's another way of putting it."

"Fine." Shen Qingqiu smiles like a devious cat. "What's in it for me?"

"..."

"What? I'm not stupid, Yuan-di. You're asking me for my help because my other self will never support such a risky plan involving another powerful demon whose interests are closer to Luo Bing-ge's than yours. However, I’m desperate, I’m flattered that you offer me a challenge instead of letting me rot like a plant, and it will always be a pleasure to oppose my other self. And you are aware of my price."

"You know I can't make you grow arms or legs but if you help me I'll use my knowledge to get your body back."

"Meanwhile, you will be the one to take me everywhere I want."

"Fine."

"You will be my arms and legs, I don't want anyone else to come near me."

"Fine."

"And..."

"Ok, don't be so demanding. You have to show me your skills first."

Shen Yuan guides the wheelchair towards the Lingxi Caves as he thinks of how to explain to Shen Jiu that he is about to release Zhuzhi-lang to make a pact with the devil.

 

 

The next morning, Shen Jiu doesn’t find Shen Yuan in the bamboo house, but a cowardly written note. He is reading it sitting at the low table while he drinks tea when the door is flung open. Liu Qingge bursts in with the same manners as a wild animal.

"Shen Jiu! Shen Qingqiu has..."

"Missing from Qian Cao Peak? I know." He sips tea without paying attention to him.

Shen Jiu doesn't react even when the door is flung open again and Luo Binghe appears.

"Shizun! This disciple has gone to the Lingxi Caves and..."

"Zhuzhi-lang has disappeared? I know." His calm is tense and borders on rage.

The door swings open a third time, with determination instead of violence, and Yue Qingyuan arrives just as anxious and overwhelmed as the rest. Shen Jiu snorts in annoyance before slamming the table as he puts down the letter and turns to face them.

“In case you come to inform me that neither Shen Qingqiu is at Qian Cao Peak nor Zhuzhi-lang at Lingxi Caves, I must warn you that I already know. He left a note."

"SHEN YUAN HAS DONE WHAT!?" Liu Qingge and Luo Binghe yell in unison, sharing the same panic.

However, Yue Qingyuan just turns pale as he looks at Shen Qingqiu.

"No… I… I didn't know about this."

Shen Jiu frowns and a faint concern begins to spread across his chest.

"Then why have you come?"

"There is intense demonic activity on Maigu Ridge. Luo Bing-ge has finally appeared."

After feeling overwhelmed, frustrated, and scared while reading Shen Yuan's letter, he believed that nothing would surprise him today. But the threat of his worst enemy envelops him in dense, suffocating darkness that leaves him breathless. Shen Jiu's hand trembles, though he manages to set the teacup down before he drops it on the floor.

"We should get ready then." Cang Qiong Mountain Sect's strategist says as he sits up.

"What about Shen Yuan?" Luo Binghe stammers with an attitude more befitting the disciple he once was than the Demon Lord he has become.

"I DON'T KNOW!" An overwhelmed older brother screams.

Shen Jiu closes his eyes and takes a deep breath in a desperate attempt to regain control that has been shattered in an instant. Someone approaches him. Shen Jiu hears footsteps and the creak of fabric, perhaps from an arm that wants to get closer to him but doesn't dare.

“I want to trust Shen Yuan…” He confesses, ducking his head towards the note in which he has explained his plan. "But I don’t know what to do."

What is more important? Lead his sect in a showdown against an enemy capable of destroying the world, or search for his brother before he makes a mistake? Shen Jiu is startled when Luo Binghe hugs him from behind. It is an impulsive hug, firm at first, then ashamed to understand what has happened. But it is a warm and comforting gesture, and Shen Jiu allows him to stay instead of pushing him away from him. With much more embarrassment, Liu Qingge finishes reaching out and squeezes his hand.

Maybe he doesn't have the best answer, but at least he's not alone.

Then someone timidly knocks on the door, startling the three of them to Yue Qingyuan's relief.

"Sorry to disturb you." Says an unknown voice. Turning around, they discover a disciple from And Ding Peak. "We didn't find shizun. Could Shen-shibo help us?"

Chapter End Notes

BONUS
Shang Qinghua: Why didn't you say in your letter that I have gone with you!?
Shen Yuan: Why should I? O___O You are a responsible adult as well as a Peak Lord, while they are two criminals in custody
Shen Qingqiu: ...I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that

――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

★ Twitter

Luo Binghe vs. Luo Bing-ge: The villain and the protagonist are the same person

Chapter Summary

A battle doomed from the start.

Chapter Notes

One day you wake up and decide to stop being a coward.
One day you wake up and decide that 70 is a perfect number to finish Found Brother.

Thank you for joining me on this journey.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Maigu Ridge is trembling wrapped in smoke and fire. Perhaps it is because he has escaped from Xin Mo's influence, but Luo Binghe considers the merging of both realms an aberration. His heart trembles with overwhelm and horror, also with the guilt of recognizing himself in that decision. Luo Binghe stands aloof from the rest of the cultivators while gazing at Maigu Ridge's death rattles as his determination becomes firmer. Indecision keeps the virtuous sects across the river, though not for long.

And he takes this opportunity to disappear without saying anything to anyone.

As Luo Binghe advances towards Maigu Ridge, he becomes more aware that the calamity that is shaking the world is not Xin Mo's fault, but a very conscious whim. And the worst thing is that Luo Binghe can understand his counterpart. In other circumstances, he would have done the same. In the past, he also did worse things that he only regretted some of. Accepting his selfishness leaves a bitter taste in his mouth, but it's not enough to stop him.

Once out of the prying ears of the cultivators, Luo Binghe summons Sha Hualing and Mobei-jun and sends the two of them to guard the perimeter along with their demon host. They nod and disappear to carry out his orders. Luo Binghe flashes a lopsided smile before walking into Maigu Ridge.

The heat is intolerable. The seal on his forehead glows a color as violent and red as freshly spilled blood. It reflects his determination. Luo Binghe walks with the certainty of being the most powerful demon in this dimension and the murderous desire to destroy the most powerful demon in the other dimension. After an eternity wandering between corridors carved into the rock, he finds his other self.

Luo Bing-ge looks at him with a mocking face that doesn't hide his disappointment.

"You are not shizun." He points out. "None of the three. Where are they?"

Luo Binghe gives him a crooked, acidic smirk.

"Haven't you noticed? Shizun chose his brother, not you. None of them are here. Now what will you do?" He steps forward and his confidence erodes his counterpart's arrogance. "If you persist in merging the two realms, there will be no shizun left. You will return to your world alone and the weight of that loneliness will be with you for all eternity."

"Shut up." Luo Bing-ge glares at him with a face livid with anger.

"You will always be aware that none of the three shizun chose you. You are not so important to any of them."

"SHUT UP!"

Luo Binghe allows him to land a punch that almost breaks his jaw. He didn't even try to dodge, but nonchalantly accepted the blow.

"We can fight, but I've already won. And do you know why? Because shizun has trusted me to stop you."

"What a joke!" His eyes flash with murderous laughter as he draws Xin Mo and points his blade at him. "With what sword?" Luo Binghe responds by unsheathing his own and his enemy bursts into roaring laughter. "Zheng Yang? No sword can rival Xin Mo, much less one that breaks so easily."

"My sword is better than yours." Luo Binghe shrugs. He feels strangely calm despite the fact that the atmosphere has become even darker and more suffocating. "It doesn't get into my head or whisper harmful ideas to me. Besides, it's the sword that shizun arranged for me. If I wanted, I could get my Xin Mo back. But no matter how much you want it, you will never have a Zheng Yang. "

Luo Bing-ge pales. He has begun to tremble, perhaps from envy, perhaps from rage. Luo Binghe feels a laugh stuck in his throat. His other self is older and more confident than him, more dangerous and powerful. And yet, getting under his skin is very easy. Beneath that facade are many scars and festering wounds that have never healed. That was why he wanted any Shen Qingqiu so much.

"I'm going to return you to your distorted world." Luo Binghe growls like an animal ready to protect his home. "I don't mind breaking all your bones if it takes to get there. You'll crawl back to that hideous palace of yours and I'll go back to mine." This time, Luo Binghe does dodge the attack of his other self. "I'll take a relaxing aromatic bath and maybe get some sleep. Only when I've washed off the dirt and blood, I’ll go back to Qing Jing Peak. Because unlike you, I still have a sect to return to." He adds mischievously, causing Luo Bing-ge to grit his teeth furiously. "I will go into shizun's house and prepare one of my favorite recipes. Do you still remember the dishes that mom prepared for us? The ones we learned with her? The ones we dreamed of making for a special person? I will make them for all my shizuns. And also Liu-shishu, although I'm not so sure if he will dare to taste them."

Luo Binghe pauses to dodge the merciless blows of his enemy's sword, which swings viciously hungry for his blood. As the two swords collide, Zheng Yang groans in a metallic hiss, and Luo Binghe takes a deep breath before spinning the sword, preventing Luo Bing-ge from breaking it.

"It will be a great party. Perhaps one of the shizuns invites the rest of the sect: surely our martial brothers and maybe some martial uncles and aunts. We will all be alive and happy celebrating your defeat. As a family. Because I’m still a part of that family. And when night falls... I don't know what will happen. I suspect that this time shizun will prevent me from going to Liu-shishu's house."

Luo Bing-ge releases a miasma of resentment that accompanies his next more fierce and desperate attacks. Luo Binghe dodges them with difficulty and the first blows manage to tear his clothes and hurt his arms and legs.

"Well, Bing-di." The demon hisses as rage darkens his features. "We've already heard of your dream. Do you know what mine is? I'm going to destroy you. I'm going to break every bone, every tendon, every joint. I'm going to break that annoying sword of yours. I'm going to drag your shattered body and you will see how I murder all those pathetic cultivators. There will be no more Qing Jing Peak, there will be no more Cang Qiong Mountain Sect. And then I will hunt down shizun while destroying this world."

"Still dont you see it?" Luo Binghe laughs maniacally despite Xin Mo sinking into his shoulder. "You're so piteous that you only know how to destroy! That's so easy... and boring... You're a pathetic monster who can't keep anything. You couldn't save our mother or earn shizun's appreciation. Even Ning Yingying, who has always been with us, has run away from you!"

"SHUT UP!!!"

The sword sinks in further, shattering the joint and muscle, but Luo Binghe can't stop laughing.

"When you wake up every day in your shitty palace and see the world you've destroyed, do you regret your mistakes or don't you care anymore?" The sword makes an unpleasant noise as it leaves his body. "It's so ironic! Why don't you laugh? You wanted both the demon realm and the human realm and you don't have either. It's funny, don't you think? To have become the emperor of nothing..."

Luo Binghe clumsily dodges the sword aimed at his heart. Despite his instant regeneration, Xin Mo's wounds are cursed and not even his blood is capable of healing itself. But he doesn’t care. He will have won while he is still laughing and his other self trembles with rage.

"Why don't you recognize it, Bing-ge?" He addresses him mockingly. "You even pretended to be me. I have won since the moment you yearned for my life. That's why fighting with you is a waste of time." He drops the sword. He is too tired to fight anyway and it will be a loss if Luo Bing-ge manages to break Zheng Yang. "And you know I'm right. That's why you hate me."

The truth hurts more than a stab wound. Luo Binghe clings to a bloody smile as he recognizes confusion on his enemy's face that twists into rage that turns to envy that taints into cruelty.

"I'll kill you."

"Sure?" Luo Binghe walks towards him with clumsy but steady steps. "What is it now? Do you want to kill me and occupy my life? At least acknowledge that I have everything you want."

"You got it." Luo Bing-ge hisses as a maniacal gleam lights up his eyes. "And I don't understand how such a pathetic version of me has been so lucky."

"Are you sure who is the pathetic of the two of us?"

Luo Bing-ge grabs his neck with one hand. His response is violent and direct, it leaves him breathless and prevents him from saying anything else. The demon doesn’t hesitate to stab him with the sword. Xin Mo pierces through his chest and the point emerges from his back after ripping organs and tissue. Luo Binghe vomits a waterfall of blood that soaks his other self's sleeve and his face. Although his vision is blurring, he still distinguishes perfectly the crazy eyes of someone who is almost his reflection. A distorted, selfish and cruel reflection, who has long since been lost in an abyss from which he has never been able to escape.

Even when death clings to his body with icy fingers, Luo Binghe knows that as long as his other self drags those memories he can never win.

He's lost in those red eyes, the only thing he can see, and he doesn't notice the blood splattering on him or the demon's expression of confused astonishment. Until his claw releases his neck and Xin Mo leaves his body, replying against the ground. Now the two are identical: another sword pierces Luo Bing-ge from behind.

Neither of them expected Liu Qingge in their particular duel.

The War God hits the demon's back with a kick before drawing his sword. Luo Bing-ge tries to turn and stab him with Xin Mo, but Cheng Luan is faster and slashes his throat. His blood oozes out and stains his fingers as Luo Binghe puts a hand to the wound. His regenerative abilities protect him, but they don't stop Liu Qingge from punching him in the face and then plunging his sword into the same shoulder that he shattered Luo Binghe.

Luo Binghe does not feel any satisfaction at seeing his other self so hurt, rather an immense weariness. He closes his eyes and staggers before losing consciousness.

For a moment, he is not aware of what is happening. There are screams and noises, then silence. Someone grabs him and nice, clear qi runs through his body, repairing Xin Mo's wounds. Luo Binghe groans in pain before opening his eyes. In that blurry world, Liu Qingge's figure shines white and perfect.

"What happened?" He stammers.

"He is gone."

Luo Binghe doesn't dare to ask if his other self is dead or if he has slipped away to his world. Internally, he wants his counterpart to forget and start a new life. No more capricious wishes. No more destruction to erase everything that hurts him. No more unnecessary cruelty.

Liu Qingge holds him so tightly, digging his fingers into his flesh, that it's annoying and his qi heals him just as aggressively. Luo Binghe protests.

"It hurts, Liu-shishu..."

"What were you thinking, idiot!?"

"Perhaps... I made a mistake..."

"If you're so desperate to die, tell me and I'll make your wish come true without compromising the rest of the world."

Luo Binghe flashes a huge bloodstained smile.

"Were you worried about me, Liu-shishu?"

"Shen Jiu told me to watch you when he went after Shen Yuan."

"Oh, that's even better." He takes a deep breath. "Thank you."

And the protagonist of this absurd story, who only wanted the love of the villain, closes his eyes before losing consciousness.

Chapter End Notes

The day I said "Yey! I'm going to write my most self-indulgent ff!" I never imagined that I would end up writing a ff of more than 170k words. This trip has been crazy and it wouldn't have been the same without all your support. Thanks for the encouragement, the jokes, and the constant support. Without your feedback, I wouldn't have found the strength to write so much.

Before anyone wants to kill the author for this abrupt ending... Do you remember what I said a few chapters ago about the endgame of the fic? Well, it's time to reveal what it is. I told you that I wanted to give you a gift for all your support, so... It's time for the big surprise!

The main story ends here, but there is still the epilogue. Or epilogues.

You are going to vote for your favorite endgame. And I will write different epilogues according to the results. To make it clearer, I will give an example: epilogue A is Liushen, B is Bingjiu, C is Liujiu, D is Bingliu. The four epilogues are canon, but independent... You know, different realities! :D Here the timeline splits and anything is possible. In addition to the endgame, the epilogues will explain the pending subplots.

How do you vote?
You have to comment with a top 5. Example:
5. Liujiu, Bingqiu (my favorite option, so I give them 5 points)
4. Bingjiu, Liushen
3. Zhuzhi-langxOrShen Qingqiu
2. Bingliujiu
1. Bingliushen (my least favorite opinion, so I only give them 1 point)

(it's just an example, you can vote for your favorite ships!)

I will add the points to write the most popular epilogues. You don't have to give five ships and you can even give all your favorite ships 5 and 4 points. Of course, I will ignore the ships that haven't been relevant in history... (yup, not romantic shencest or qijiu, sorry ^^'). You can also vote for a non-romance epilogue of Shen brothers being together!

The voting will be until August 15.

I hope you like the idea and you have enjoyed the chapter <3

(I'm going to publish this running and I'm going to work. If you have any doubt, comment it and later I will solve it)

――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

Afterword

Please drop by the Archive and comment to let the creator know if you enjoyed their work!
